product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Walt Frank
content: Installed today.  Low-volume, garbled audio from the speaker in the doorbell.  Apparently a hardware problem. A replacement will be shipped, but Ring first expected me to wait 7 working days or more for the replacement.  I had to insist on express delivery.  Motion detector works erratically.  Also, I am not receiving tone alerts to my phone when the doorbell button is pushed.  Ring tells me that this is due to a software problem that has to be solved at their end.  Resolution date uncertain.  Overall, performance is nothing like what Ring describes in their TV ads.  I had planned to buy more from Ring, if this first product proved worthwhile. But, after having wasted half a day on this one, I will not be buying anymore Ring products until they give me a basis for confidence.
title: Avoid this product, at least for the near future

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chrissy Gem
content: I’ve had my ring doorbell for a couple weeks now and I couldn’t be happier! I moved to a new neighborhood recently and had a lot of creepy solicitors come to my home. I paired this with a no soliciting sign. It was packaged with all the necessary tools and mounting plates needed for attaching outside my home. I plugged in the rechargeable battery and let it fully haste before going further. That took about 10 hours.I did not have an existing doorbell so I was able to mount it and set upnrahee quickly. This does come with everything you need to wire into an existing doorbell if you choose to do so. Once I figured out the best placement for my doorbell using the side angles mount I was able to attach it in minutes. I downloaded the app for the Ring doorbell and completed the set up. Once attached I placed the last security screw and was ready to go! I also purchased a chime for indoor use which is just an extra device that plugs into any outlet and rings nice and loud so you are sure to hear the doorbell. My ring is set so that it senses motion about 15 feet away. Once it senses that Ring alerts my phone and the doorbell and the chime room no to alert me someone is approaching. Video has been very clear and I love being able to talk and see whoever is outside my door without opening the door. Works great with the night vision.As a single woman living alone this is a must in today’s society. I feel much safer knowing I can look outside at a live view anytime I need to. Comes with stickers you can place on a window or door letting people know that there is video surveillance.
title: A must for home security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LJ Bujak
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Beware:  Company & Products are both very Disappointing...  First unit [RING 2]  I received early October '17 was DOA - Replacement unit has had intermittent problems from first week installed.  Camera failed completely in November 2017; unit transmits Video that is recorded as just Black/ with Noise! Still fighting with RING to get a replacement – No Success;  dozens of emails with most going Unanswered.  When I did get a response its NOT from Tech Support or Customer Service or Product Management  ~~  it's from a Social Media Community something person that is totally clueless. The RING Chime also is intermittent.  I don't know how RING stays in business!  -LJ
title: Beware:  Company & Products are both very Disappointing..

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Another Consumer
content: This product is not worth the money one that I regret purchasing.  Do not buy without reading. Pros Easy to setup Great documentation Cons Requires monthly service plan (while it is cheap, it adds up over time) video quality is poor and choppy no feature to send still image of what triggered motion sensor When battery starts to go dead, the unit triggers random motion sensor chimes that are confusing and annoying Once the trial is up, no storage of videos and no local storage options. Once the trial is up, alerts and notifications are delayed to the point that the person/thing that triggers the motion event are gone. Requires very fast broadband connection (min 50 - 100Mbps) Always on/Live View is the only way to view video whenever you want but it drains the battery very fast Will not work with Blue Iris and other software packages for local video storage. Bottom Line --------------- If you are non-technical and willing to pay for a service plan then this could be the product for you.  There are better options out there if you are remotely technical or if you are willing to learn.  If you care about your privacy and storing your data, then this is not the product for you. I had reasonable hopes for this product.  I was hoping for timely alerts, clean video feed, simple setup, and no need for a traditional doorbell setup.  Now this product is reduced to a standard doorbell.  All because Ring wants to force you into a monthly service plan, snoop through your data, and control you as the consumer. This product could be so much better.
title: This product is a huge dissappointment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Doug W
content: I have mixed feelings about this product.  Before I really get started - note that when you look at the reviews they're mixed in with the reviews for the extender - the doorbell reviews are less positive. Anyway, the motion detection is terrible.  It catches cars far off in the distance and misses people walking up onto the porch.  The video quality is good when it works, which is usually.  Sometimes it just records black.  The audio quality is not understandable between the phone and the unit.  The software is kind of iffy - the software for other products like the Arlo is much better, showing useful thumbnails for the video, (and by the way not charging for storage for the first five cameras). I contacted support about the motion detection and the black video and the audio problems.  We've been circling the drain where they keep wanting me to send updated bandwidth figures and rebooting the unit (which improved the video somewhat but not the audio or motion detection) and then after that they want me to call their support number.  So basically they don't have online support, they just have a couple of canned messages that you'll get every couple of days.  Just go right to calling support.
title: Feels very first generation even though it isn't

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kikikins
content: Three stars for the peace of mind the Ring provides, great picture quality, and low monthly monitoring cost. Two stars off for bizarre motion sensitivity that significantly lowers the usefulness of the product. My house faces a quiet street that dead ends several homes down, only neighborhood cars and delivery trucks pass by my house.  The front door sits ~10 feet from the street, with a single car driveway on the left half of the property and a small patio and landscaped area (with a tree) on the other.  The Ring is installed at my front door and gets a perfect fish eye view of the patio/landscaped area, with equal views on either side of my driveway on the left and my neighbor's driveway on the right. I have the Ring set to the lowest motion sensitivity, which, according to their chart, means it should only pick up motion right on my patio or the inside edge of either driveway (see picture - the Ring should only pick up motion in the blue areas). 1. People: this works well, but because the sensitivity is set so low, there's a few second delay. It mostly picks up delivery drivers as they are leaving my front porch, unless they're slow to place the package.  This isn't really a huge problem, but if someone were to steal a package from the porch, the camera would not be quick enough to pick up a face. 2. Traffic: it picks up EVERY. SINGLE. CAR. that drives by, even though it's far outside of the selected sensitivity area. I get dozens of notifications every day as my neighbors innocently drive up and down our quiet street. 3. Driveways: It picks up my neighbor's car when they pull into their driveway, but doesn't pick up my car in my driveway.  Even if I park in the driveway, it doesn't pick up any motion until I get out of the car and approach the patio. I can't figure out why it likes their car better than mine, when the field of vision is exactly the same. Ideally, I'd like the Ring to pick up motion on my patio and the closest part of my driveway only. As it is, it only picks up patio motion within a couple feet of the door and nothing in the driveway, but somehow still picks up EVERY CAR in the street. In reality, this camera serves little purpose other than the live view function. I can't check the dozens of motion notifications I get each day when 99% of them are cars. I use the Ring alarm system as well, and I like that this is all in one app (and one price for monitoring). I wish I had more controls around the sensitivity of the camera, and that it was better at filtering out motion outside of the set zones.
title: Nice peace of mind, but unevenly applied motion sensitivity limits usefulness

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Carol H.
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Update! See attached video catching delivery person delivering my pkg and then stealing it! I received the Ring doorbell and am very happy with it. It was easy to connect to my wifi and very easy to install. The directions are clear and simple, the best I've seen on a product like this. I downloaded the Ring app on my phone and was immediately able to see video of my front door and communicate with those outside. The range is wide and very clear with sound and color. Awesome product, get it!
title: Ring Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark D. Anderson
content: I read reviews, which is why I purchased the product, that were 4 and 5 stars. What I missed was the fact that the reviews were from the product being hard-wired; that is, not using Wi-Fi. I use Wi-Fi: fiber optic cable internet; router w/in line-of-sight and about 20' from an extender; and, router w/in 40' of doorbell itself and 20' from extender. This Wi-Fi use of the product, due to a weak signal despite the close proximity to the router and an extender, causes the video to "ratchet"; that is, you see someone in motion, then nothing for 4 - 5 seconds, then a brief motion detection again. In other words, useless. A lot of money for useless. Can't return because it has been over 30-days. It took me that long to figure out what was going wrong. DO NOT buy if you intend on using Wi-Fi!
title: Wi-Fi connectivity can render the product all-but useless.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CiraldoFamily
content: Imagine leaving your house, getting in your car and then driving away. Then, once you are three blocks away from your house, your phone alerts you that motion was detected at your door. I got that notification this morning. I was the motion, and it took that long to tell me. That's, well...useless. Completely useless. Who needs a doorbell that tells you someone was there a while ago? And if you want to know who that someone was that came to the door ten minutes ago, it won't tell you. Not without a monthly fee, that is. Because, unlike it's competitors, there is no video history AT ALL unless you pay for it. For as much as Ring charges, you should be able to expect it, at a bare minimum, to be reasonably responsive and to allow you to at least see a live feed of the camera and a picture of who was there without having to pay for it. I could not be more disappointed in this device.
title: Unreliable, Unusable without paying for additional features

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NeverFinished
content: Biggest waste of money I've made in a long time. Bought this in mid November, 2017. Battery goes dead in about a month. Takes hours to recharge. Doorbell is 60 ft from the router. Originally got a weak wifi signal. Spent more money on a Ring Chime Pro. It's 40ft from the router and 20 ft from the doorbell. Still have weak signal issues. Also have 2 Ring Chimes. One loses it's connection to system regularly. I'm resetting something every few days. After the first 30 days you have to have the subscription to access your recored activity. The final straw is it takes a minute or more to access the app to answer the doorbell. Whoever rang it is gone by then. Don't buy this product. It's not worth a damn.
title: Very expensive unreliable doorbell.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: suz702
content: I was a little apprehensive about a couple of things. Was this really a worthy investment, when I actually don't get many uninvited visitors at my door, and mostly deliveries? I already have an alarm system, and security door. Yet, I am gone most of the day, so being able to see what's going on at my door makes sense. My other concern is that my porch has an enclosure and the doorbell does not face front, there is a walkway from the street to my front door, which is a little secluded, and I face my neighbors home, in a Townhome community. Ok, let me dispell a couple things that may have prevented me from purchasing this. I read that with the Ring Doorbell 2, you will receive mounting wedges that will widen your viewing angle in instances where your porch is enclosed like mine. When I was installing mine, I tested the angle before the actual install, with the wedge and then flush to the wall. The difference was barely noticeable! This has an Incredible wide angle lens that captured the walkway around the enclosure wall just fine. So I did the flush mount. Also, it is suggested that you mount the doorbell no more than 4ft off the ground, and there is a wedge that you can install to point the camera in more of a downward direction. Again, I did not find that to be necessary. My existing doorbell was probably 5 ft off the ground and it didn't make much difference in the viewing angle, but I suppose if you want to see packages on your porch, you may want to consider this. I did not use it. One bonus for my neighbor, since we share the same walk way, I can see people approaching their door too, so if anything ever happens over there, I can share video that I have. The install was very easy. The app was a no nonsense install but you must operate it on a 2.4G band WIFI. I have a dual band router with 2.4 and 5G You then must go into your router set-up and disable the 5gh. It is simple to do, and does not effect the quality of your WIFI signal to any of your other devices in any way. Okay, now, if you are getting bad or choppie reception from your Ring Doorbell, the company advises that you spend another 50.00 (49.99) to buy a chime extender.....um, how bout NO!  Listen folks, you can buy their version and it will play chime  tones if your Ring Doorbell is not hard wired to your exiting doorbell, but if it is, you don't need it. ANY WIFI EXTENDER WILL WORK. I already had a TP-Link WIFI extender that I bought a couple years ago, and it works just fine, my cost then 19.99, the cost today on Amazon, 19.99. Up to you if you want to save 30.00. Another concern was my metal Security Door, interfering with the WIFI signal. It seemed to. I put the WIFI extender in the closest electrical outlet to my doorbell, and PROBLEM SOLVED! Do you need the Ring Cloud service at 3.00 a month or 30.00 a year? That again is up to you. But you can save and share a video to your email without cloud service. Let me mention the installation one more time. I hardwired mine to the existing doorbell wires <simple> they tell you to turn the power to the doorbell off at the breaker. I didn't, nothing happened. But again, do what they say, not what I say!  I installed on stucco, again, simple, but you are gonna want to use a smaller drill bit. The whole install is easy as pie! Overall, I am really impressed with this product. The 1080 camera is crisp and lifelike! Is it worth 199.00?? The Jury is still out on that! Seriously, you can now purchase 1080 survalence camera's for inside your house that are FINE products, for about 79.00, and that includes a free app that does pretty much the same thing as the Ring app.  So while I think the Ring Doorbell 2 could be priced more around the 99.00 range and that would be more realistic, I can understand why the creator of this product wants to milk the profits, he came up with a damn good idea! Still, after the novelty wears off, the price should come down.
title: Flawless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Wildwood Seapointe Condo
content: I purchased the Ring 2 Doorbell with the intention of monitoring my seasonal home which is 3,000 miles away from my permanent residence.  After installing it and making sure it was working properly at the end of the season, I departed my seasonal home.  About 2 weeks later I received a message on the Ring app indicating that the device was offline.  I suspect there may have been a temporary Wifi outage at the seasonal home but instead of coming back online when the Wifi was restored (like all of my other devices), I am told by the Ring customer service staff that I will need to go back to the seasonal home and reinstall the device on the network. They are telling me that this is some type of security measure to protect me from other people getting on my system.  So instead I am stuck with no protection since my doorbell is now offline and I would need to travel 3,000 to reset it!!!  Why doesn't the system automatically reset like all of my other devices.  This is not addressed in any of the promotional material so I am writing this to raise peoples' awareness that if you are thinking of purchasing this to monitor a seasonal home that is far from your permanent residence, this system has a major flaw.  Hopefully Amazon will figure out a way of addressing this soon.  Otherwise the system is not providing the protection that I expected when I purchased it.
title: Major Shortcoming With Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T. Lyon
content: I chose the Ring 2 over other options because I wanted a video camera for my door that could use the existing wiring, ability to speak to visitors at the door, and the more positive reviews over the competing products. Although it has definitely been helpful, it still has some major issues. The biggest annoyance is that you either get alerts all the time for nothing or miss actual people at the door. Every morning I wake up with about 10 notifications on my phone, but it's always of someone walking away or of a car driving by. I've since installed a $25 Wi-Fi camera inside pointing out the window, and it does a much better job of capturing the motion that triggered the camera. I'm hopeful that this gets improved in software updates, but given the severity of the issue and time on the market, I'm very doubtful. Setup is not as easy as it should have been. It wasn't mentioned in the information that I read online, but using with a digital doorbell system requires you to connect a diode across the wiring connectors. Given this accounts for most systems from the last 20 years, I'm surprised this wasn't built into the device's circuits directly. If you don't wire it correctly your doorbell won't go off, could go off randomly in the middle of the night, or could get fried in the case that you don't use it and should have. As others have mentioned, you have to use the Ring subscription to get any use out of the device. The alerts take a long time to load in the app and whatever triggered it is gone by that time. Things that are great: - The IR camera works very well in the dark - It looks nice and blends in better than I expected - The field of view on the wide angle lens is great Ultimately, I think that I would like to try out the Nest Hello option instead to see if it can improve upon the motion detection and alerts.
title: Great concept but still some shortcomings

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: zxephin
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. UPDATE: I am now on my 3rd replacement RING DOORBELL 2 in the last 60 days. I keep being told im in the 1% minority who has issues... but im having a hard time believing that. Ive had the worst time with this product. So heres an easy breakdown of the pros & cons based on my experience. PROS: Customer Service is attentive to the point of annoyance. Its wireless and that seems to work fine. Its easy to set up. CONS: Poor video quality and reliability. Poor sensitivity to Motion Events. (basically its bad on what its supposed to do) ORIGINAL REVIEW: I had massive issues with the first Ring Doorbell i ordered... So RING SUPPORT sent a replacement doorbell 2 camera and a wedge kit. I can say that i am receiving less false positives thanks to the wedge kit... its still not perfect and misses catching the mail man, OR ANYONE for that matter, 95% of the time... but at least its not picking up vehicle traffic anymore. 75% of the time my camera shows an Orange sky & blue people. its the same video issue i was having with the first one i purchased. And because of this issue, the footage is practically useless if we ever have to identify the correct color of someone, or their clothing... so lets just hope we never have to use the footage to solve an actual crime. Ive included an example taken from our new Ring Doorbell 2... so you know what im talking about. To say im unhappy with the product as it currently stands would be an understatement. Unfortunately, the decision is not up to me to return it at this time. If it was, i would return this in a heartbeat. As a person who works in video production full time... video fidelity is very important to me, and this product has not stood up to its claims. As a homeowner, security is very important to me, and again, this product has not stood up to its claims. However, i can say that the customer service department has done a good job of trying to fix my issues, despite the fact that they have been unable to do so. So i dont blame the support team. I blame the engineers and the marketing dept. They have made and sold me a bunk product.
title: inconsistent, unreliable... unfortunately.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eduardo Pagani
content: Finally, got my ring Video Doorbell 2 over the weekend. PROs - Setting it up was quick and easy. - Great video. - It warns you when someone is at the door or within the set area even before they ring the door bell. - You can see and hear visitors who ring the doorbell quite clearly. CONs - Though you can see/hear people clearly no one can understand you when you talk back.  The sound is all garbled.  The volume is low and it sounds like someone speaking on a cheap walkie-talkie in the next room. - There is a delay to answering the call on the phone.  The phone notifies you immediately upon the ring.  Then you must launch the app and it has to connect, etc.  If your visitor or delivery person is very patient, you will be able to see them.  Actually, you see their ears a lot as they lean closer to the unit to try to hear what the heck you are saying. - The same delay applies to Alexa (Echo devices).  I tell my Fire TV Cube "Show me the front door".  Alexa then mutes my show, launches "home" and then it switches to "ring.com", then it buffers and finally it shows the front door.  Just in time to see the UPS guy jumping back into his truck... - Of course, before I posted this review I looked for answers on ring.com.  There in no troubleshooting guide.  The FAQs and "Help" areas are very generic and repetitive with help on items such as "how to install the app"... Will continue to search for help and I will post updates in case I am able to get the sound problem fixed. For now, see picture of me seeking help from ring and not getting any...
title: Great video, garbled sound.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Karen Zinkosky
content: Typical bait and switch fine print, "free" 30 day subscription worked fine, but now even trying to answer an active ring takes too long an it turns into a "past" event, subscription renewal required. For what this thing costs you should be able to at least answer an active alert within 30 seconds without it drifting off to the cloud and not being able to view it at all ... dont waste your money ... unless you want another monthly bill to pay.
title: Bait and switch fine print.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: C. Cooper
content: Worked...for a while. I love this concept. I bought the latest one in order to get the best tech. Unfortunately it appears this may not be a fully baked product. After working for a couple of weeks, the unit has gone into a repeated flashing blue ring loop that can't be changed. Customer service is still attempting to resolve. If they do, I will change this review. ******** Updated I never heard back from the email support so I called the support line. It was determined that the unit had to be replaced. I was sent a replacement unit and was told the following: 1)replacement unit would come with return shipping labels, 2)once I set up the new unit, the defective unit will automatically be removed from my app 3) the monthly recording membership would be migrated to the new unit All of these things eventually did occur. However, I had to make a separate calls for each of these tasks to occur. It appeared at each of the customer service people I spoke to only performed one of the tasks and promised do the rest, but that never happened. I am sitting now with a working Ring 2 unit and I am satisfied. I would prefer in the future if I have any customer service issues that the help desk perform all the functions that they promised the first time I call.
title: Maybe not ready for release?***updated

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Piano Man
content: It was a fairly easy install and worked fairly good for a month, but now has just become a $200 doorbell button. I refuse to pay them every month for the rest of my life for something that I own, that uses my WIFI and my phone, but they have configured their RING App so that it will only let you keep the recordings if you agree to pay them every month for the rest of your life. I have a Samsung Smart Cam, it will record Hi-res video, it is motion activated and will track the subject, I can talk to whomever is being recorded, they can talk to me and I can access it from anywhere thru my phone, I can do whatever I want with my recordings and all I had to pay is the initial cost of it! No Monthly Payment plan to use the SAMSUNG Smart Cam! Makes sense! But, the people at RING are money grubbing thieves and want to wring money out of you for the rest of your life if you want to use the doorbell that you bought from them. I gave the RING 2 two stars because it does work fairly well, but it's really sad that you have to pay them for the rest of your life if you want to use it.
title: Works as advertised, but they want you to pay them every month for the rest of your life!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alexander Houtman
content: UPDATE 9/23/18: Downgrading the doorbell to one star.  I've reset it, tried moving the router closer, angled the antennae towards the doorbell, and nothing works.  I keep getting notifications, but the app and doorbell refuse to connect.  If there was a real emergency this thing would only serve as to show what happened after the fact to those that found our bodies, rather than help prevent it.  Useless. I've owned and used this doorbell for the last 6+ months.  The ring video doorbell was easy to set up, the app is super intuitive and everything about installation went extremely smoothly.  Unfortunately that was the last time things went smoothly.  The battery life is great, however with only a single battery and long recharge times, there is a ton of downtime where the doorbell is unusable.  Eventually I ordered a second battery which solved this problem, but this was an extra expense and a seemingly annoying oversight. The doorbell itself worked great for the first month, however since then it has been riddled with connection issues.  The doorbell is less than 20 feet from the wireless router and the router is an extremely well reviewed gaming router.  I can get wifi reception at the end of my driveway with my phone (over 80ft away).  So there should be no issues with reception.  Even with this wifi router I can still never connect to the video doorbell 2 on the first try.  When I get motion alerts, I try to answer and nothing comes up.  I have to exit the app and retry 2-5 times before it will connect, no matter the battery level.  Obviously this is a real problem since if there ever was an intruder or a serious issue not being able to connect for 30 seconds - 2 minutes could be a real issue.  I also know it's not the app since I also have another ring product that is hardwired and have zero issues with it. I think the doorbell is a great idea and everything about it shows how good of a product it could be, but if it can't do the fundamental thing it was designed for, then why did I pay $200 + $30 + tax when I could have gotten something similar for 1/10th the price?
title: Great Idea, Mediocre execution UPDATE: Horrible execution

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lawrence Family
content: My very positive experience with the Ring Floodlight Camera made me run out and buy this for the front door. I've been very disappointed. Video quality is OK, not great. Even when people are feet away from the camera you can't make out their faces. It is very slow to respond to motion. Most of the time people have left the frame before video starts recording. The biggest issue is the motion settings. The Ring Pro and Floodlight Camera provide the ability to define a polygon within the video frame where you would like the camera to watch for motion. Additionally the other products provide the ability to set the sensitivity within that polygon. The Ting Doorbell 2 provides a general sensitivity slider and an arc region which almost pointless. The. You get filters for how frequent you want alerts. This system fail miserably. The end result is either getting alerts when a mosquito flies by twenty feet away or only getting alerts when someone is knocking on your door. I'm very disappointed.
title: I've been very disappointed. Video quality is OK

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Avid Reader
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. So far so good!  Installation was fast and easy.  I downloaded the app, set up the Ring 2 in it and tested it.  I adjusted settings such as notifications, motion zones, etc.  I turned off my main electric breaker, unscrewed and took off my old doorbell, and wired this on to the old doorbell wiring, screwed it onto wall where the old doorbell had been with the bottom of it being around 4' up from the ground.  I turned my electric breaker back on, and my Ring 2 works perfectly.  It connects to my network with ease.  The sound is good.  The motion sensor is good.  The camera seems fine.  The video isn't always as clear as I would like it, but it's not bad.  I don't know if the problem is with the wifi speed, the camera or what, but faces can be blurry sometimes.  The front door is within a few feet or my router/modem, and it seems to connect well to it via wifi.  I'm not sure why faces are blurry sometimes.  I signed up for the subscription.  It's only $30 a year which is cheap for security.
title: Easy to set up and use!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dave U
content: Received the Ring Video Doorbell as a gift.  It worked well at first, although the battery required charging far more frequently than advertised.  Recharging the battery requires removing two very small screws from the base of the doorbell, taking extraordinary care not to drop one of them, charging the battery, then reassembling the doorbell, again re-installing the two small screws.  After approx. 16 months, the battery would not hold a charge, and the doorbell stopped working all together.  A call to Ring customer service was answered by a determined technician who ran several tests remotely and finally agreed the battery was defective.  She said Ring would not repair the doorbell, and my only option would be to step up to their Protect Plus plan, which is intended to cover multiple Ring devices.  That plan costs an additional $7 per month or $84 per year.  In return, Ring would provide the latest version of the same model doorbell.  Since I don't have multiple Ring devices, and the same model doorbell was selling for $179, I declined the offer.  Ring also said they would not offer a discounted price, even though the original doorbell worked properly for only four months past the warranty period.  With no better options, I decided to order the Ring Video Doorbell 2 with removable batteries.  The replacement doorbell was installed upon receipt and failed to work properly from day one.  In this case, the IR emitter did not turn on, and all videos taken in less than optimal lighting were virtually useless.  Another call to Ring customer service resulted in more remote tests and final confirmation that the IR emitter was defective.  When asked if Ring would replace the defective doorbell directly to minimize delays, the technician said they would not, and the device would have to be returned to and replaced by Amazon.  As usual, Amazon agreed to replace the defective doorbell, but delivery is not expected until the end of January.  When the doorbells worked properly, they were very helpful.  However, the extremely short battery life in the first model (Ring Video Doorbell), and the out-of-the-box failure of the second model (Ring Video Doorbell 2) has been very frustrating, as well as costly, and certainly indicates poor quality control.  Ring's unwillingness to expedite a replacement and make the customer whole when their products are already defective when delivered should sound a note of caution to prospective customers who are considering Ring's products. Update - 1/4/18 In response to my review, I received an an offer to help resolve my Video Doorbell 2 problems from Ring's Neighbor Satisfaction Specialist, Mary Nell Johnson.  I couldn't reach her during the holidays and decided to try Ring's technical support team again and was connected with Porsha.  She was aware of the problem with my doorbell (firmware was not updating properly) and proceeded to troubleshoot to confirm the exact cause.  After a few minutes, she had me try the doorbell and it worked perfectly! Mary has since reached out to me to confirm the doorbell is now working properly and extended my Protect Plan to compensate for my inconvenience - a fair resolution in my opinion.  I appreciate Ring's dedication to correct my doorbell issues and the professionalism of their reps on the phone.  Because the doorbell now works as advertised and we really love being able to stay in touch with our home while on the road, I now feel the doorbell deserves a rating of 4 stars.  Had it not been for the intervening hassles, I would give it a 5 star rating.
title: Beware of Ring Products and Their Apparent Quality Control Issues - Updated

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Steamguy
content: Six month review: This is a fantastic concept. My wife is disabled, and the idea was that she could see AND TALK TO whomever was at the door. This is a GREAT concept, but... You HAVE to have a blistering fast internet service. Which i don't have, in the rural area where I live. I have DSL. Apparently that's just not good enough. The audio feature is COMPLETELY broken, for slower connections. Minus four stars. You can SEE who's at the door on an Echo Show, but you CAN'T TALK TO THEM! Whiskey Tango Hotel!!! So the "Works With Alexa" claim is mostly false. Minus six stars. I can be at work, and the app sends the doorbell tone to my phone. Neat. Try to see who's there.... "Your phone is having trouble connecting to Ring" . Time wasted trying again and again to see and maybe talk to whomever is there... And they walk off, in the meantime. Minus three stars. I'm leaving this set to one star because most of the time, you can see who's there. And my wife can call their cell and talk to them (if it's a friend). Would I spend this money again with Ring? Not unless Amazon went into the place and started kicking serious... umm... donkey... in the Software Development department. Those guys have been shooting the breeze and sitting on their butts for WAY too long!
title: Doesn't REALLY work with Alexa

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nick A.
content: I have trouble starting up a computer but the Ring Doorbell 2 was so simple even I was able to install.  You can't beat the $30 bucks a YEAR for the cloud.  While do not have to have it, it's crazy not to get it.  You get quality at a great price.  Everything that you need is in the box except for a drill. Simple easy to follow instructions.  Customer service  is quick to answer the phone and supply answers to questions and is NOT out-sourced over seas.  You will be happy with well thought out unit.
title: Even I could install it !!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lou H
content: I purchased after my boss highly recommended, after purchase I decided to read the reviews.  Usually I read reviews first. So I was a little worried . But I’m not worried anymore.  Motion detection is spot on , there are settings to help achieve what your looking for ,  Recordings are spot on , system runs really fast.  Maybe people got some bad units , but this operates exact the way it should. A few things to know.  You can change the motion detection to area desired , height desired , so cars are not setting the unit off.  Mine is hardwired. , but there is a Wifi signal bar , battery life bar ,  everything you need to know. Also a system diagnostic test. It will let you know any signal or battery life issues.  Lastly the biggest gripe I read was the 3 dollar a month ,  or 30 bucks a year charge.  Good grief. Are you kidding me.  That’s dirt cheap. Every camera you buy out there has charges and these are cheaper then most .  Only thing I was not happy about is I purchased mine for 199.99 , the next day they change to 129.99.  That stinks.  But great product.  Installed and set up correctly , works perfectly
title: Reviews are misleading.  Great product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R. Medina
content: I purchased my unit in October of 2017 on the recommendation of a friend. It is hardwired so no battery issues to report. The problem comes with its consistently weak connection to my wireless network. When this unit was installed, my network was powered by an Apple Extreme base station with two bridge repeaters, one of which was in the garage about 15 feet away from the the Ring. But even at that distance, getting a consistent video signal was hit and miss. Sometimes I could get a clear live view, but other times nothing but a black screen. When it did record an event, I was more likely to see the back of the person at the front door walking away than a full frontal view. Mind you, I have a home full of smart door locks, wireless security cameras, Amazon echoes, laptops, iPads, iPhones, an Apple TV, computers, a wireless garage door opener, Lutron Casseta wall switches, Hue light bulbs, Rachio sprinkler boxes, Ecobee thermostat, etc. Everything, and I mean everything, works flawlessly with my network except for the Ring. Yesterday, I replaced my aging Apple network with a Netgear Orbi system with two satellites rated to cover a house twice the size of mine. OK, I said to myself, let's see if this will improve the Ring signal. Short answer, no. It still reports a moderate to weak signal even though one of the Orbi satellites is less than 10 feet away from the doorbell! Enough. I'm done. My advice is to stop giving your money to a company that spends more on slick advertising than putting out a quality product!
title: A total waste of money and time!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: VZI
content: Update 01 January 2019 So after changing my app to include live view I was able to set up much better zones. However, I would consistently get a delay in my notification followed by 16-20 seconds of frozen video before it would resume. This is obviously worthless since whatever triggered the alert is long gone at this point. I called customer service and they thought this was strange as this is not an issue they typically hear about. However, they were able to log into my camera and confirm seeing the same issue as well as seeing that my signal strength up/download speeds are all at least twice the minimum requirements. Regardless, they wanted me to set up a hot spot. After speaking with one of the managers, Chuck Kinion, he explained that while this is not an issue that typically occurs, it has been happening with some of the lots being shipped. Sometimes a firmware update fixes the issue, but he didn’t know when another firmware update would occur. He suggested sending me a new doorbell and explained that if this one didn’t work I should call back and allow them to continue to work the issue rather than return it. When the new unit arrived it was worse than the first one. Video quality was extremely poor, as in couldn’t read a license plate 10 feet in front of the door. The video freezes occurred on and off throughout a video instead of once and then working. I again called and asked to speak directly with Chuck. I was told he was busy, but the rep pressed hard to allow me to have her resolve my issue. She went through all of the typical steps, reset, log on, wants to set up a hot spot even though my signal is strong. She clearly didn’t understand how any of it worked and was just reading down a list of troubleshooting steps. The worst part however is that she gave me the same line about how this isn’t really an issue and it must be me. When I asked her what she was basing this on she told me because she works there and answers these calls all day. I, having since done some research, told her not only did Chuck tell me this was a known issue with some lots, but Amazon review, Reddit, and a number of other sites show that this issue has been occurring for over a year with thousands of units. Worse, everyone is getting the same line; new to them, must be your signal, etc…  Which tells you they don’t know what the problem is, are no closer to identifying the problem, and therefore not anywhere close to developing a solution other than blame the customer. Since she clearly could not help me she told me that she would have Chuck call me back, that was three weeks ago today. This is an expensive doorbell that doesn’t do what it says it will. It would be bad enough to wait and see if firmware updates come and make things better, but to require customers to pay a subscription service while the product doesn’t work is unfathomable. There is a reason they kicked their closest competitor off of Amazon, there is a reason they’re giving these things away for free at times, and there is a reason the customer service slogan is “it’s not us it’s you.” They’re hoping everyone is pot committed to Amazon when the dust settles. My experience with this whole situation has made me think twice about continuing to poor money into Amazon products. I have a few Echo and Fire products and was going to purchase more. I’m now holding off now before I invest more money since I may need to consider switching to google or apple as I would like all of my products to be unified as possible and Amazon is not going in a great direction. Original Review: I have been looking for a security camera and my doorbell recently died so this seemed like a good choice. I received it the other day and the battery took about 10 hours to charge. When I initially put the battery in and tested it inside everything seemed fine. However, once I put it up outside I was only receiving motion notifications about 1 in 10 times. I tested every angle and setting.  My wifi consistently demonstrates more than 2.5 mbps upload and more than 28 mbps download, well above the suggested requirements. I thought I finally had the settings that offered better motion coverage and I received a notification that an Amazon package was 8 stops away, all I had to do was wait and see the camera and alert in action. 15 minutes later not only had the Amazon delivery person dropped the package at the door, they were there long enough to take a picture. I received the alert from Amazon that my package had been delivered, nothing ever came from ring, no alert, no recording occurred, nothing. I also find it strange that I can't get the camera to actually work correctly, but the battery is already down 3% after only 4 hours. Doesn't seem like that will last log. For a product that is expensive and costs another $30 per year, per device, working 10% of the time is unacceptable. Worse is that this seems to be a common problem and not only hasn't been fixed, but they continue to push this product heavily. There are a lot of options out there: cloud vs hard drive, hardwired vs battery, doorbell/light fixture/stand alone cams. The one thing that everyone requires above any of those options is that it actually turns on every time. Not 10% of the time.  I will be returning mine and going with a better option.
title: Does not work, they know it doesn't work, blaming the customer is their strategy to fix the problem.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: EngineersGuideToGod
content: My wife bought this doorbell during a Black Friday special offer.  I replaced our standard doorbell with this one in about an hour.  Now that I've done one, I could definitely do another one in about 15-20 minutes.  It is very easy to install.  I wired it up to our existing doorbell wiring, and that keeps it powered and also rings our house doorbell.  Very glad that worked so well.  Our battery stays charged at 95 to 100% all the time, without us having to do anything. We've had this in operation since around Christmas time with no issues.  It has been a great tool for seeing if we have a package delivery (I see this on my iPad at work), and knowing who has been to our door.  We are paying the annual subscription at this time, although I'm not really happy that we have to do that -- otherwise I would rate it 5 stars for sure.  It would be nice if everybody could have a small amount of storage for free, or if it could use our existing iCloud storage. Installation notes:  Night vision was an issue, since it lights up the side wall of our door frame area.  I installed the wedge and this improved the problem significantly and gave us additional viewing area.  I tried putting some black paper on the edge of the door frame area, but this did not make much of a difference.  Our doorbell area was a little too narrow, so I was only able to screw in the left side of the Ring doorbell.  This has not mattered. The ability to talk back to people, particularly my teenage children when they forget their keys, has provided enough amusement to easily make this purchase worthwhile.  Enjoy! EngineersGuideToGod
title: Love This Doorbell -- Easy to Install and So Much Fun

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rick sluder
content: Giving local police department's access without permission of owner is a major problem. Consumer's should be warned before buying this product. I was looking forward to having this technology until I found out it allows police to spy on people. I'll be returning my Ring Video Doorbell 2 because of police having access. The "justice" system is beyond corrupt this technology should be used for personal security not police surveillance. If I wanted them watching I'd buy products that advertise police having access without my permission or the ability to block them. The neighbors feature is great without police. They ruin this product it is mass surveillance.
title: Privacy Concerns

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chicky
content: so if you don't pay for their plan you can't see your front door anymore, i loved the 1st month you could see everything clear , but now i'm out 200 bucks for a video door bell i can't use anymore, no where in the page you look at all the info does it say your going to be held hostage after the free trial
title: Warning after your free trial ends you can't see your front door anymore

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Amazon Customer
content: Amazon had it for $140 last week with a free echo dot.  At $200+ it would be in a box already on its way back for refund. Bad mounting design with no gasket and no space for other than flush on smooth surface.  Think uneven brick surface with little to any place for wire nuts to go.  Nice they include a tool kit, but the masonry bit was useless on brick and had to buy better even with a hammer drill. Speaker/mic volume terrible.  Can barely hear talking or listening and this is the R2 and not the pro with a smaller speaker. Poor wifi.  Close to good router and constantly complains of poor signal and noise and gen 2 does not have N. Poor/slow motion detection.  Most of the time it does not actually capture the person and its a straight shot to the front door.  Just watched a video of nothing and then a flash of wifes rear going in the front door.  UPS guy was already at front door dropping boxes before he showed on video. I have motion alerts on and most of time I’m lucky if I get them 15-30m later. Like others have said this thing is useless unless you pay for the service.  Without it you probably won’t be able to answer an alert fast enough before it goes away. About the only thing that seems to work ok is live view.
title: Not Terribly Impressed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Firstboomer
content: I like this product, but it has two significant design defects. First, you can change the sensitivity of the motion setting using the App, which is as it should be, meaning you can adjust how wide the range is for picking up motion. The range is from 0 feet (off) to  30 feet or so. The issue is that any change won't be SAVED, meaning take effect, until the doorbell button is pushed. What?! So, if you're out to dinner, and you realize that you forgot to even set the motion detection to "on," or change its range, you can log into the app, change that setting, but it won't take effect until the doorbell is pushed. Just plain stupid. Second, if you have multiple Ring devices, you can't switch from one "live view" to another device "live view" live view immediately, once it's on "live view" for one device, it takes a moment for it to let that one go, and allow logging onto another. Annoying. There is a little bugginess setting them up which requires releasing and reinserting the battery, but that's not a huge deal. If these defects were remedied I'd give them 4 to 5 stars.
title: Great idea and good quality, but has issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. Madmac
content: After getting a new door (and frame) but forgetting to add new wiring for a door bell I decided to give the Ring Video Doorbell 2 (because it has a battery) a try.  I wasn't expecting much, but it sure has surprised me.  Mounting the doorbell on the provided mount into masonry was straightforward, and the setup was incredibly easy.  After a week with our new Ring doorbell we couldn't go back to a normal doorbell again.  Being able to monitor the front door live when ever you want is a cool feature, but being notified when someone is within 5 feet of the door is the real neat feature.  Before anyone rings I am already looking at who is at the door and video is clear day or night.  Definitely a great product.
title: A product I didn't even realize I needed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard Mackenzie
content: I hate it, but that may be my fault.  Turns out I have an intercom system instead of a standard doorbell.  So my existing can't be used to power this unit.  OK.  No problem.  Having to go with battery operation and recharging isn't the end of the world.  BUT why can't they provide a simple contact closure so I can tie that to the push-button of my existing system.  I have "chimes" all over the house, and don't want to purchase all that many of their new remote ringers.  All it would take is for this new unit to activate the old button.  That's not expecting too much.  But apparently it is....
title: Why can't they provide a simple contact closure??????

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CeeCee
content: Night vision on this camera is horrible. Video stops recording after 20 seconds of detecting motion and there is no option to extend this. At night, a strange man drove up to our home which set off the camera, by the time he stopped and got out of the car and headed to our home, 20 seconds had passed so we got no footage of his face or him walking to our door. To make it worse, since this happened at night we can’t make out anything in the video besides the fact that he had a car because the resolution is so poor. I am really upset with my purchase because we also paid for installation and can’t return this piece of sh*t camera.
title: Horrible night vision and short video recording

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Matt Rizos
content: - bought the first one on Amazon.  The next 2 were sent out by ring support (the first one had no motion alert.  guess what?!  neither did the second one) - Motion barely works or not at all. - Wifi connection problems even though the access point is less than 2 feet away (access point, not an extender). - Every other device works on our Ubiquiti Amplifi wifi network perfectly except our Ring 2 - The old Ring 1 works flawlessly, and we still love it.  It's at the backdoor, but now I have to move it to the front door and remove the Ring 2 there for return.  So pissed!!! - Can't wait to waste time on my vacation Friday dealing with this crap. Yo!  Ring!  The Ring 2 has serious design flaws.  Recall them and give us something that actually works!
title: 3 Ring 2's. All of them sucked. Looking for other solutions now.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: mbuckley
content: Installed our Ring 2 doorbell about a week ago. So far I like it, it's nice being able to turn on the live feed whenever I want and actually have the ability to answer the doorbell remotely. But I'm a little disappointed in how many times it has missed picking up movement. We've played around with the motion settings a lot. The first few day it seemed to be working great. My parents were staying with us for a few days and from work I was getting alerts every time they came and went from the house. However, there have been several times when it has failed to pick up activity and I have no idea why. About half the time when we pull into our own driveway, it won't pick it up at all. It didn't pick up three separate package deliveries this past week which included the delivery person walking all the way down the driveway and right to the front door, or our Shipt grocery delivery. It didn't even pick up my boyfriend when he walked right past the door and down the driveway to take the garbage to the curb. What the Ring 2 is excellent at is picking up cars driving past, even though I have brought the motion range down significantly in the hopes of avoiding those alerts. We hardlined the Ring 2 directly to the doorbell, so it's not a battery issue. We used one of the angled bases to make sure it was pointing in the direction we needed it to. Hoping through trial and error we can figure out how to get it working more efficiently.
title: Works some of the time?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JGray49
content: Being a security fanatic that appreciates technology, I truly wanted to like my Ring Video Doorbell 2 purchase from Amazon.  Unfortunately, I am going to return the Ring 2 and search for an alternative product.  I firmly believe that RING (now owned by Amazon), has a significant weak link which involves RING servers that stores your video and audio. Despite all efforts on my part which involved an ideal installation with strong download and upload speeds (55 mbps/11 mbps respectively - Spectrum cable) and a strong RSSI signal (-28) (Linksys EA8500 4 attenae router 8 ft from front Ring 2 Doorbell), and a perfect Ring App health report, I exhibit extreme video and audio lag (12 seconds in my last test) in addition to periods of no connectivity at all. (Blue Spinning Circle on Black Screen).  Note: Tested using Apple Iphone 8+ IOS 11.2.6 and iPad with Ring App. Ring customer support offered little or no help other than to attempt to shift the reason for my issues back on the possibility of MY Wifi connectivity which they ultimately admitted to being more than adequate for optimum performance of the Ring 2 Doorbell. (NOTE: Ring customer service can "see" your Ring connectivity stats when you call them).  While customer setup and connectivity issues with home router setups can vary greatly, there are many reports on the Internet of Ring attempting to place the responsibility and blame of Ring doorbell issues back on the consumer, even going so far as sending them free Ring Pro WiFi extenders to correct connectivity issues which many times it did not. In my honest opinion (IMHO), I believe that RING (now owned by Amazon)  currently has issues with it's recording servers and the growth of the company.  Imagine all the video and audio information from ALL the RING security products (doorbells , floodlight/cams, etc.) across the world going to one or several server storage locations without the adequate upgrades in hardware required to handle all this data.  Your Ring doorbell camera or floodlight camera when viewed with the Ring App does not "see" in real time.  FWIW. I do have a home 6 camera DVR recording system that DOES give real time video even when viewed with my viewer app.  The video signals are transmitted directly to my phone or viewing device without going to a storage server like Ring engineered into their product. Ring/Amazon is attempting to capitalize on selling you storage space for your video and audio.  While that is certainly fine and does provide for secure offsite storage of your video/audio, it is NOT well engineered in it's present form.  As a consumer of a security product, we need instantaneous viewing of what is going on outside of our door so that we may respond appropriately.  This Ring product in its current form is going to give someone a false sense of security and may end up harming someone or result in unrecorded property damage or theft.  Hopefully now that Ring has been purchased by Amazon, Amazon will invest the money to perfect a product that is truly unique and has great potential.  I will be the first to order one WHEN this product actually works as advertised.
title: The Weak Link of the Ring Video Doorbell 2 may be RING and NOT YOU or YOUR ROUTER WiFi

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Amazon_Customer
content: The concept of Ring sounds great, video doorbell that allows you to see, hear, and speak to anyone who comes to the door. The price seems pretty steep, but I jumped on the opportunity to purchase not one but two of these during the Black Friday promotion. After installing the app on my phone, and installing one of them I get a message that says I have started the trial for the "Protect" plan, I am thinking "okay whatever that is" and go about getting ready to install the other one, as I am doing this I think "what is this Protect plan it is mentioning"? Well low and behold, the people over at Ring have a business model that relies upon a monthly subscription, similar to cable TV, Netflix, etc. except they are basically charging you to access your own content (video/audio recordings from your doorbell that you spent upwards of $200 on in the first place). I don't write a lot of reviews on Amazon, but when I come across a product that irks me I feel the need to let people know about it. If you want a fancy (although HUGE) doorbell that may or may not show you who is at your door right now, or want to pay $10 a month for this company to let you see who was there four hours ago then go ahead. As for me I found an alternative that can store data locally via SD card or NVR, with the option to have cloud backup, is a smaller package, has better video, and is at a lower price point.
title: This is a joke/rippoff, after spending so much on a product a monthly fee is a slap in the face

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: 718 Enterprises
content: Initial review of my first 24 hours using the Ring Video Doorbell 2. Since installation I’ve had 4 people ring the bell during different times of the day. Keep in mindy phone was within the same WiFi as the doorbell 2 was connected to, i was home. When someone rang my door, in almost seconds both my wife’s and my iPhones rang with an incoming door bell alert. Clicked open the alert, and within I’d say 10-12 seconds the live stream loaded clearly and 2 way voice communication worked flawlessly. So far I’m happy. Keep in mind my home WiFi is Verizon Fios 100mbps. I have no use for the motion unless I am away on motion, so I will not review that. The doorbell aspects and functionality works and does it’s job. There are some minor delays in loading the live picture. But not too bad. In one instance, the person at my door waited close to 25-30 seconds before I could speak to them or see them from my phone. Which I thought was borderline too much time to keep someone at my door step waiting if I’m home. But, I understand WiFi tech is never perfect, so I’m ok with that. Ring live preview can also be accessed from my Fire tv on my big screen tv in just 10 seconds. Worked flawlessly 3 times on command. I’m pretty happy with that. It’s been 24 hours, and the battery life is now at 99%. I will update in 3 weeks and see where the battery life is at. If I can get 3 month of battery life out of one charge, I’ll will be happy. I am going to get a second battery for a quick swap, I believe that is the best option. Installation was quick and painless into aluminum door molding. No drilling required. There are slot of negative reviews of the bell and app not functioning the way it’s supposee at all, BUT that’s not my experience out of the box. So far it does the job for me. Pricey, but I think eventually I will get the WiFi extender chime to compliment this. If it fails me more than 3 times within this month, I  will be returning this. Too pricey to keep if it doesn’t function at minimal standards.
title: WiFi range and strength makes a difference.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Christy G
content: I purchased this about a month ago and cannot begin to say how happy I have been with it. The camera quality is very clear, the app is very user friendly, and the audio works well. I have the battery powered and it lasts about a month but mine is constantly going off due to motion which probably drains the battery. I know I can update my motion zones to reduce this but for the time being I am enjoying seeing how much traffic comes into my culdesac. There is also the issue of for some reason delivery people do not realize its a doorbell and still knock. The motion sensor picks them up but I may have to make a sign that says "yo, I'm the doorbell."
title: ... a month ago and cannot begin to say how happy I have been with it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sally Jones
content: Constant problems and “quirks” with this product. Their customer service department speaks English, but the only thing they have been trained to do is give countless reasons any problem is not their fault. We heard multiple times it was our WiFi speed when we have a fiber connection. Software and interface is poorly programmed. Constant false alarms no matter what the setting, missed real motion alerts, videos so long and quirky to download it’s easy to miss what actually triggered it. There is a $30 per year fee per CAMERA to have it barely usable. The video capture is 160 degrees, but it warps the image so it’s hard to make out who people are even if you know them. Their promo materials tells a much different story than reality. Everyone I know with one is frustrated. Save yourself hours of headache and avoid.
title: Avoid

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: HFL
content: I love this doorbell.  I added the chime for indoor sound too, making this system even better.  I prefer the battery option since I do not have a wired doorbell to attach the Pro model to.  The fact that it comes with all of the extra pieces to tailor the setup to your particular scenario is great.  Set up was unbelievably easy.  The battery does take a while to charge, I left mine over night.  So far it is working great.
title: Works great, no wires needed.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael
content: At first glance it seems like an expensive but nice feature to add to my home.  I would love this if it just worked as described with out buying add-ons. The problem, starts with the fact that it won't work as advertised without paying for a monthly service.  However, I have not seen a single place where they state this so you are aware of that before buying it.  I would not have bought this if I had know that it required a monthly service to function as they described it.  I see this as just plane fraud!  I understand paying for long term storage, but there are plenty of ways to make videos available without them forcing people to use their monthly service. I was also disappointed to find that it doesn't have any kind of chime for inside my house included.  Once again it is extra, but not stated anywhere.  It will work with an existing hardwired doorbell, which is a nice feature (if you have one).  Since it works with a wired doorbell I can understand the chime being separate, but it should be stated that it's not included.  When paying $200 for a doorbell, I don't expect to have to pay extra for the actual "bell"! The adjustable motion sensor, doesn't seem to really be adjustable.  I have set it to the minimum distance of 5ft, but it still triggers on cars in the street, which is way over 5ft away.  Also, it is so slow to start recording, many times what ever triggered the motion is completely out of frame by the time the recording starts.  I have walked up to my door opened the storm door, opened the main door and went into my house and the only thing recorded was the storm door closing. The video is supposed to be 1024, and technically it may be, but the actually quality of the video is very poor.  I get much better quality from an $8 Chinese made thumb drive camera. When an event does occur, the time you have to answer the notification on your phone is so short that I've only been able to do it once.  The single successful answer was because my phone was in my hand and I knew the bell was about to be rung, because I had my daughter press the button as a test. For $200 I expect a doorbell to be something really special and the way this is described it would be, but it doesn't work close to the way it's described without buying add-ons and then it still doesn't quite get there.  It feels like if I paid for a first class airline ticket, but have to pay per minute to look out the window and I'm still being charged separately for drinks. Update:  I spoke with someone from ring that did suggest changes that improved the problem of too sensitive motion sensor.  However, I was pretty much blown off on the other issues.  They did offer a refund & I told them I'd prefer they make it do what they say it does, but they basically said they think it does what they say it does.  I assured them mine doesn't come close.  In all these months I have only been able to successfully answer a doorbell one time when I didn't have their "optional" service.  It does NOT work at all, except as the most expensive dumb doorbell, without their "optional" service.
title: It would be hard for me to be more dissapointed in this.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: I.B.
content: Forced remote server processing causes slow response times, slow video recording triggers. (I have FIOS, 100 up/down, wifi RSSI -58, device reports 'good' wifi access) Anyone could walk directly up to the doorbell and cover the camera and by the time the device started recording, due to the time required for it to be triggered by amazon servers/processing, camera could be covered and you'd never see who did it. They could fix this by allowing 'local' processing, i.e. allow you to access the camera directly from inside your home network, but that excludes their monthly subscription model. They force you, lock you into, having to send video data to amazon servers to have the image processed to determine if there was ‘motion’ and if it does detect motion, it then triggers recording.  If you don’t believe me, review posted videos… you’ll notice the same thing with most videos, they all seem to start well after the suspicious person is already in view. The ONLY time this doesn’t happen is because something had already triggered the ‘motion’ event, which then triggered the video recording to start. Oh by the way, recording is only available if you pay a monthly subscription. Once the one month free trial finishes, you are left with ‘live’ access only.  So at the end of the day, you might as well buy a raspberry pi with a HD camera attachment and have a camera you fully own and control.  So in the end, you will pay at least $100 dollars (more if you get the newer versions) for what is basically a raspberry pi, camera attachment, battery backup, and iphone/android app.  And the Android app is fairly buggy when it comes to phone orientation. Expect it to crash often and have to close out the program and have to reopen it. The Fix: Allow a “serverless” option so I can access the device without having outside internet. Let me run video processing locally, don’t force me to have my video sent off to some EC2 instance that is also processing every other ring video feed, and might be grossly starved for resources.
title: Greed leaves you with an expensive IP camera you can’t use without Amazon’s servers.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vegas Steve
content: It works great as a doorbell that you can answer from your phone.  The motion detection is dreadful.  I have Arlo Pro's installed as well and I thought their's wasn't very good, but compared to this, they are great.  And if you go with Arlo, you get 7 days recording free, where Ring wants to charge you for any recordings.  Don't confuse this for any sort of security system. However, I'm returning it.  I have a Nexus5x phone that has the most current Android OS.  It DOES NOT allow you to bypass the lock/swipe screen.  By the time I get to the notification, I CANNOT use the video/audio of this doorbell (I'm on battery power only).  Ring has no solution to date.  On previous OS's the Ring app would 'pop up' directly on screen and you could interact with it.  Just FYI.
title: Ok as a fancy doorbell.  Not so hot on other functions.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: L
content: I like the idea of what this device is suppose to do but it is a very high priced door bell and does not function as advertised. Video quality is poor it skips a lot, when it works colors are nice but it cannot focus on features very well if you needed to identify a burglar or a license place in my driveway. Video also starts with image white out during live view. It is useless at night as the light makes the image blotted out. Ability to change functionality of device on phone app is limited and non-existent on computer. Live view is not available on a computer, on the app it works with delays. Motion sensing does not activate someone approaching camera until they stand in front of the device and wait with max sensor. Two way audio is poor, I could hear my neighbor across the street start his car but could not hear the person at my door, that same person could not hear my either as the audio was breaking up. It also takes several seconds for audio to activate for someone ringing doorbell when it should already be functioning from the motion of the person walking up to ring the bell in the first place. It states it works with Alexa but its only works with certain Alexa devices that has additional devices. For example, it you have the Alexa dot it does not work with that alone or on your phone, you need an additional device (fire stick TV) for it to function, very misleading and unclear from marketing.
title: Needs improvement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chris H.
content: I've had this thing for less than a week and I can tell you that you should look for another video doorbell. The battery depletes rapidly. I've had to recharge it once already. It's picky about it's WiFi connection so much so that I went out of my way to bring three mesh WiFi routers to my home only to buy a Ring Chime Pro to help out. The app (for iOS at least) is crap. It crashes on open, it crashes when trying to view a video; heck! it won't connect to the video more than half the time. The motion sensor on it is a joke. So much so that the cheap Dlink camera does a better job at a fourth of the cost. It can't decide if a person right in front of it is a motion event until that person is about out of frame. The doorbell isn't much better. Sure you'll get a notification but by the time it connects (if it connects) that person could be long gone, or worse inside your house. The firmware for the product is pushed out selectively so who knows when it'll update for you. The app will tell you it's up to date even if it's not. Other annoying things is it doesn't work with Google Assistant or HomeKit. Unless they rebrand to Amazon Security they should support other home talking-trashcans. The good, customer service is great although you have to call them. Let's hope their CS team isn't taken over by Amazons. Installation was easy, like less than five minutes easy.
title: Do not buy. (Ring Doorbell 2)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mr C King
content: We bought this as more an add on, as we have cameras. I didn't want a recording but more a way to interact remotely with people at the door - for that it's useless. It worked well the first month, while in the "trial" and connect live instantly to my phone; however as soon as the trial ended and it went to live only mode (the mode i had been using) it now keeps telling me it can't connect and bombards me with requests to pay their $30 subscription. It's bascially now just a large doorbell with no connectivity (note I have disconnected and reconnected and made sure the WiFi is good - it is). My biggest challenge now is returning it BO NOT BUY UNLESS YOU WANT TO PAY THE SUBSCRIPTION - DOES NOT WORK AS AN INTERCOM
title: Looses all connectivity if you don't get the subscrition

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: The human
content: update after months of using this: the live video feed stopped working and Ring customer service wanted me to remove my doorbell and put it next to my router to test the signal, even though my router is 10 feet away and the RSSI signal strength indicator was -46, perfect, in the ring app. The doorbell rung about 50% of the time, while the video feed worked about less than 10% of the time. I even hardwired it because I thought that the battery was not outputting enough strength to the wifi video feed, but I was wrong and only wasted time and money getting it hardwired. The customer service rep wanted me to upgrade to a more expensive doorbell, even though they could not resolve my issue. What a sham. They should modify their app to not only include the RSSI strength, but also be able to perform jitter/ latency testing... etc... so that customers are not put in this situation and both parties can be technically sure of what kind of signal quality there is. original review: I liked that it has an app and i get a notification on my iphone when someone rings the doorbell. I dislike that the battery drains so fast, about a month or less. My house is the corner house on my street, and my ring 2 doorbell picks up all vehicle traffic, even with angled positioning and reduced sensitivity settings. My ring 2 doorbell app said it had half battery life left, and I went on a vacation for one week, but the doorbell barrery drained 2 days after i left. Someone broke into my car while i was gone and the stupid ring 2 doorbell didnt catch any of it because the battery drained prematurely. Garbage battery. I now have to hardwire this, which is not what I wanted to do when I bought this underperforming rindg 2 doorbell, which means spending more money on it. If i buy more batteries, there is another hidden cost. Also, the recording feature requires a paid plan, so more hidden costs.
title: garbage plus Hidden costs
