We returned it because after speaking with product support our door chime was not compatible. After receiving this unit we discovers that it too was not compatible with our door chime. Shame on me for not looking at the compatibility list (review the list before purchasing), but I assumed it was compatible as the Ring support person advised we get this one. There are 2 other issues that really are detrimental to this product. We have an Asus $200 WiFi router that has 8 antennas. We stream everything as we are cord cutters. So our router is amazing. The Ring doorbell sits about 30 feet from our router. Live video is often sporadic and so is recorded video. We average about 300Mbs internet speed so that isn't the issue. And we stream 4K video throughout the house via WiFi without issue. So it's got to be the Ring that is the problem. The other issue plaguing this unit is resolution and image quality at night. If you want any 8mage quality what so ever, make sure you have plenty of light. At night the images are bad, real bad. It foes provide a since of awareness which is great, but don't expect to recognize anything in night shots unless you have a great deal of light.
title: So our router is amazing. The Ring doorbell sits about 30 feet from ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vik Twain
content: This is super easy to set up. If I was rating it on that it would get 5 stars. It works well as a door bell too. However it is useless as a motion detector camera which is primarily why I paid so much for it. I have it wired to power and it is in a fairly enclosed porch but it still fails to capture on motion until someone is 1-2 foot from the doorbell. It should start capturing several seconds earlier when someone steps onto the porch, but it does not. Terrible sensitivity. Someone could easily steal a package without this capturing it. Video is supposedly 1080 but it doesn’t look like; often very blocky. WiFi signal is strong (-60). I think the problem is that my porch is shaded but also gets plenty of light at the entry so it has trouble adjusting the sensor to that. Very poor quality from something so expensive. Update: The number of times that a delivery has been left right under the doorbell without it detecting the delivery man and recording a video is ridiculous. This product is not worth the i initial cost and the annual cost.
title: Motion detection is useless. Video quality is subpar.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Showells
content: Horrible software and WiFi antenna. Nothing but poor connection. Ring customer service is useless. Excuse after excuse. Kept blaming my internet connection. No other device indoor or out door has this problem. Only the ring doorbell. My connection is Fios quantum and theirs best router and it’s only 5’ from the doorbell. I even took the doorbell off the wall brought it in and put it next to the router still receiving poor signal. We went round and round so long I can’t even return it anymore. If you buy it. Good luck and beware.
title: Best internet and WiFi still bad connection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ozzy'sMom
content: I hate the Neighbor app.  I have to leave my phone on at night because my aged mother is ill. So, the first time I was awaken during normal sleeping hours by the app alert was 12:30 am an insane alert about a dog. The second time during this first week owning the Ring was at 5:30am over someone  hearing random gun shots.  Damn, in less than one week I've been waken twice. Then there's the quality of the Ring,  1080p is BS...The images are weak especially at night.  I hate it. It works about the same as a $25 Wyze. I hate the alerts chiming all day over nothing. I hate the blurry images that lag to death. I hate that my plants and large porch over hang block much of the view.  I hate the app. Am I sending it back,  probably not. I'm leaving town so I want to want to keep an eye out for miscreants. Yesterday during Thanksgiving dinner I pulled the battery out. It's still out...I have the deterrent without the aggravation. Problem solved.
title: Much hype Much annoyance. I wish I would have passed it up.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brett
content: Although the video looks great and the audio is clear for real-time events, you must pay a subscription costing $3 a month if you want to be able to view past occurrences even for the same day.  This means that if you don't have a subscription and someone steals a package or breaks in you'll be just as clueless as you would if you didn't even have this device.  Factor in an added fee of at least $66 (assuming you'll own it for at least 2 years).  There are equally great products available without a subscription.  I give it one star because I don't like being ripped off by hidden fees.
title: Warning - Subscription Required!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: OnlineBuyGuy
content: I was excited to get a doorbell that had video, as I was curious to who was coming to my door all day everyday while I was away at work.  Plus, I had a package stolen off my doorstep so I wanted the opportunity to see what happened and hopefully bust the next degenerate that tried to steal from me.  Well, the first 30 days were cool, I could review all video alerts that occurred.  But then they wanted money to keep doing this, which is ridiculous so I said no thanks.  Since then, every time someone comes to my door, by the time I get to the app they are gone and so is any video.  There ought to be a automatic 3 day video retention policy and a way to keep video you want, but alas there is not.  Originally I liked it so much that I was going to get other ring products for around my house, but now after understand the scam and seeing the competition with their free versions of video saving I will just go with them and sell this to some sucker at my next garage sale for whatever I can get for it! Oh, one other thing, it took an hour to install, not 5 minutes.  It took 5 minutes to get the drill set it up!
title: A complete rip off - Ring 2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dent.Arthur.P
content: This works well, as advertised with a few cautions and caveats: 1) You can't adjust the brightness levels. This is especially a problem if you install it on a darker covered porch and it's pointing out toward a bright street or driveway.  It doesn't have enough dynamic range to expose both at the same time and you can't tweak it to expose what you want monitored.  So if it exposes for the bright street, it doesn't see motion on the porch because it's too dark.  If it exposes for the porch, it will not sense motion on your driveway or street because it's too bright. It needs to either dynamically adjust according to the subject of the motion or else let me set the exposure for where I want motion monitored so that it can properly sense the moving objects. 2) Be careful where you install it.  It needs a good bit of clearance below it in order to both slide out the battery and so that you can get the torx driver straight up and down below it to remove and install the cover screw.  Even something like the dead bolt key housing is enough to keep you from servicing the battery if it's too close beneath the doorbell. 3) When mounting the frame of the device to your location, don't screw the mounting screws too tight or they will break that plastic frame right off! Use a hand driver and not a screw gun.
title: Works well, but you can't adjust the brightness level

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Luvume
content: Update 2/16/2019 :  To my surprise I was contacted by customer service, Alexis.  Alexis offered to assist me with resolving the motion issue I was having with the Doorbell 2 by helping me acquire the Ring Doorbell Pro.  The Pro resolved ALL the motion issues I had with the Doorbell 2 (See review below, I initially rated the  doorbell 2 a 1 star). The motion detection adjustment scale on the Pro is so far removed from what is offered within the Doorbell 2 hands down. I am trying to adequately describe my delight and amazement with the technical upgrade in what the Pro offers.  I get 0 motion alerts from cars or any unwanted movement. You can adjust the detection perimeters to be shaped exactly like the area you're trying to detect.  For example, if your sidewalk is long and rectangular, you can adjust your perimeter detection to be long and rectangular. The Pro also has color night vision so fantastical it looks like day vision at night. The clarity of the picture for the Pro is unbelievable.  The upgrades to the Pro are so astounding and vast I can only imagine what the Ring Elite has to offer.  Alexis is one of the most sincere, readily available, immediate response, extremely knowledge of all products, all time customer service Rep I have encountered to date. 100% true professional. Her desire to satisfy the customer was like Chick-fil-A customer service, Top of the Tier. Hope someone reads this and gives her a Promotion.  I end w/recommending EVERYONE to purchase the Ring Pro (5 star rating) or probably the Elite. Amazon sells at a pretty good price, it's worth it. You won't be disappointed. First review 2/1/2019: I absolutely despise this product. No matter how much I adjust the motion sliding scale, I get every vehicle that passes by. The instructions are, in order not to get every car or tree that blows adjust the car icon out of the street range, which I do. I have the person icon as close to the house without turning the motion off and I still get every vehicle all day and night. I even have the sensor set to light. Nothing works. The app alert is so often I find myself snoozing all the time or just turning off the sound which defeats the purpose of having it. I just missed the deadline to return today. I'm sure there's a better product out there just have to find it.
title: Purchase the Ring Pro instead

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: FredL
content: Another reviewer said it pretty well with "if you’re looking for a video doorbell, I assume it will do the trick, though the slow speed and lag time between ring and video connection makes it useless for anything except someone sitting and waiting at the door." I'm not one of these people that has their cell phone glued to their hand so I have to add in the additional time to grab my phone. I'm also pretty bummed out by the necessity of paying for their cloud subscription for storing any videos. You'd think they would give you some minimal amount of space for free and entice you to spring for more but no, it's all or nothing. The sensitivity of mine is set to about 15 feet but picks up motion across the street over 50 feet away. As a final note the user interface leaves a lot to be desired in terms of viewing and deleting stored videos. It's slow and almost requires twisting the phone back and forth between portrait and landscape mode to see what's going on. Buyer's remorse for sure on my part.
title: Not nearly as useful as I had hoped.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Frank D.
content: It just doesn’t pick up motion (people or cars) in time to see them arrive if they are more then 10-15 feet away. This is installed to cover the door that it’s mounted on and down the driveway, if you push the range out to the max you get cars going by, but even then it’s just the back end as they move by my driveway. When set it to max you get let’s of alerts that are just cars going by, very annoying. If I get a person dropping of a package all you see is the back of the person leaving, not what you want if someone is stealing from your doorway. They also are having an issue with the Rapid Ring app on iPhone, it will not connect to show you the live video if your phone is using WiFi. I think for the price this product should work much better, should use some of the new logic that will pick up just people and needs to react much faster to start recording. I gave Ring a poor review and whey wanted to know why, I replied to them, let’s see what happens. I will update this post if they do anything. PS if you just want a doorbell, you get one for much less, that’s all this does well.
title: Doesn’t record what you need for security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Christian Whitfill
content: The idea is great! But it can’t do it’s job 8/10 times. It will pick up every car driving by, but not somebody standing literally right in front of it (my son even touched the camera. Nothing). Ive adjusted the settings probably 15 times. If I bring the bar down any lower to not get the road, it won’t get anything at all. Sucks for the price. All it’s really good for is talking through it or viewing the live camera- which who is going to watch that all day?
title: Overrated

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kristian
content: Let me begin by saying, it takes a lot for me to write a review. It has to be something pretty bad for me to express my concerns about a product. That saying, this is probably one of the worst products I have ever spent my money on.  I purchased the Ring video Doorbell 2 in January along with two extra chimes...Not cheap, but I trusted the product. First of all, setup didn't take long...thats the good thing. Now for the bad....I have a designated T1 line in my home...I push at times over 1k MB speeds for internet, so  my wifi can be felt from past my driveway.  This product has had iffy connection since the beginning. The quality if nothing to write home about...I have way better quality on my Blink X2 Cameras and they don't even have a subscription service. Im paying $3.99 a month for a product that has crappy motion detection...it's either constant or nothing at all...no in between and always late. Crappy Wifi connection...and it's advertised to work with Amazon Show, yet you cannot view anything...I work from home on the 3rd floor...I would like the camera to work with the show which is located on my desk. Yet it never does and to make things worse...I reconnected it to the show and it asked me to reset my password...After resetting with the same password it kept failing. I tried on my iPad, fail...I tried on my computer Failed and then it locked me out for 24 hours..Fine..I called customer support...(outsourced of course) and the girl said, sorry nothing we can do to reset your password and have you attempt again. Now Im out of a product for 24 hours that works when it wants and has horrible customer support. No thanks. Big waste of money. Don't even bother...Go with google Nest Cam or wait for Amazon to make one...this is horrible and by far one of the worst products ever purchased.
title: Worst Product Ever Purchased, Even Worse Customer Service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SkolVikes
content: The Ring Doorbell 2 has some fine qualities but in the end I ended up returning it and purchasing a Nest doorbell instead.  The installation instructions are top notch and attempted to provide hardware for every circumstance that might arise.  Everything was beautifully labeled  and extra parts were provided.  They even provide the correct screw driver you will need.  I installed it in about 15 minutes working at a leisurely pace. This model has a rechargeable battery that can act on its own so you never have to wire it.  It is supposed to last 6 months.  It went down to 90% in a week of fairly heavy use which included me testing and tweaking it.  I would imagine the battery life would be better under normal use. Now the issues:  I had it installed on the same level  of my home as my router which has an excellent range.  The Ring app kept saying I was having signal and/or interference issues.  I have many connected devices in my home including other cameras, Amazon Echo’s, and smart bulbs and have never had a problem.  I purchased the Ring chime extender to try to mitigate the problem but it had no noticeable effect.  I then bought a transformer, drilled a hole through the wall and hard wired it so that it wasn’t dependent on the battery.  This also had no noticeable effect. The performance of the camera itself was frustrating.  It would notify me that someone rang the doorbell but it would often take too long to connect to the camera so that the person had already left so I couldn’t actually answer it very well.  The motion alerts were inconsistent.  It would record cars driving by but miss the mailman putting mail in the mailbox right in front of it.  Which really defeats the purpose of deterring package/mail theft. The other problem was that it would only record when activated by motion so that if it missed something there was no recording available to review.  The Nest I replaced it with records 24/7 so that if it misses something or someone mentions that something happened in the neighborhood I can review the footage at anytime. One thing that drove me nuts is that Amazon advertised it as “Alexa compatible”. I assumed this meant that my several Echo’s scattered through the house would provide some sort of notification when someone rang the bell.  This was particularly important to me since i didn’t have an existing doorbell.  Alas it only works if you have an Echo Spot or Show with video capability.  Note that the Nest does provide audible alerts to the Google Home so Amazon is really behind on this considering they now own Ring like Google owns nest. So regretfully, I sent the Ring back.  I feel that it is a couple years out of date and needs some tweaking to bring it up to modern standards.  If you need it to work exclusively on Battery power it’s worth considering, otherwise I would look elsewhere.
title: Good if battery power is your only option.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AReview4U
content: If you want this to let you know what's going on at night, WHICH MOST OF US DOOOOOO, forget it.  This thing will go off all day long but as soon as night hits, NOTHING!!!  You get absolutely no alerts at night.  What a POS.  If you want it so you can see who's at the door when the ring the doorbell, it's fine.  BUT forget about using it for a surveillance camera as the Motion is wayyyyyyyy off.  It'll go off if a car drives by and when you look at the video, the car is wayyy past and down the street. So, of course, if you pull up in front of your house, park your car and start to walk up the 50' pathway to your front door (which is where it's mounted, of course), it will record NOTHING until you are at the door and actually opening the door up.  That's a pretty darn big delay.  So for Motion, it is absolutely useless.  I haven't decided whether to keep it or not, as I own a Nest surveillance cam out front which works great for the Motion, so I really bought this just for the doorbell feature as my Nest is mounted high up and really only gets the top of the head if someone is at the door.  I'll decide in a week or 2, but as I said, if you really just want it for the video doorbell feature, it'll serve its purpose, but don't expect it to let you know of anyone approaching as the Motion feature is a total fail.
title: Not worth the price!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lechatnoir
content: This is the worst piece of garbage I've ever purchased. 2 weeks in and very sketchy company wants to sell me their wifi booster because as of the software 'upgrade' it no longer connects or will stay connected to router that is 11 feet away.  I spent money having an electrician hardwire this to my house, including cutting my front door trim to accommodate it. Now I have to change connections every 2 days when it decides not to work. When someone rings the bell, on the rare occasion it stays connected or will connect to my phone, it takes so long to see them, they are back in their car and gone. No security in that! Save your money and get regular cameras. This device is a total scam.
title: Video storage is an on-going monthly charge. Anyone could rob you before it connects.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michelle Lynn Johnston
content: I've had my ring doorbell for a few months.  I was so excited.  However, this door bell doesn't pick up people until they are walking away from the door.  The ability to "answer" a ring never seems to work.  I have adjusted and adjusted and adjusted the motion settings, our street/car/porch settings.  I really wanted this product, wanted to like it, and expected it to work.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND the Ring Doorbell because even if someone did break in or walk up the house that didn't belong there, this thing would not pick it up AND you can see it with so many other customers having the same exact issue (when they post in their videos in the product forum and your neighborhood forum) - it doesn't capture the movement/person until its too late.  It is ridiculous!
title: Doesn't Do The Job - DO NOT BUY

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brad
content: I purchased this product due to a coworker showing me a video of a potential intruder into her home...She would have had no idea that person was there if it were not for this product.  Once I received the product, everything was fairly straightforward and the instructions are very easy to follow.  It took about 8 hours for the battery to fully charge.  Once finished, I inserted the battery and began installation of the camera. I installed it on a wood surface and used the 4 supplied screws.  The included level was a very nice touch and helped make the installation process a breeze.  I had the camera installed, up, and running in under 15 minutes.  With the second gen. version, you can adjust the motion zones as well as the sensitivity.  I would suggest playing around with it a bit to find your camera's sweet spot.  I also did some testing by walking past it and it worked every time.  I have only had it for a few days, but so far so good. The only negative I can think about this camera is that you must pay $30 a year for their video recording service.  The camera will still notify you without it, but no events will record for later viewing (such as when you're sleeping) unless you pay for this service.  I really wish there was a free/slim option...But hey, you get what you pay for and I will definitely be paying for this service.
title: everything was fairly straightforward and the instructions are very easy to follow

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GamerGuy274
content: This thing has one of the worst connections for viewing activity live.  When going to connect it can sometimes take 10 seconds, or most of the time it can take 2 minutes!!  The microphone is horrible too! When it actually does connect from a phone ring there is 15% chance I can actually understand what the person is saying. Definitely going to look for an alternative when I have more time to deal with things.  I regret paying for the 1 year cloud service because I seriously doubt I'm going to continue using this for a full year.
title: It's OK when it works

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patilu
content: We are very satisfied with our Ring 2 doorbell. We wanted protection as some of our neighbors have experienced vandalism and also because we have  many packages deliveries to our front porch. We think the ring will act as a deterrent and as evidence in case of crime. A neighbor showed me video from their Ring camera and it sounded like something that would fit our needs. The Amazon's online offer to find someone to install the Ring and schedule the installation was instrumental in our decision to go ahead with our purchase of the Ring. We wanted to wire the Ring into our electrical system but were concerned that it could be difficult to find someone in our rural area who had experience installing and setting up the Ring. Amazon arranged for prompt installation at a reasonable price. The tech who did the installation was clearly experienced with the process and when he left our house the Ring was installed, I had downloaded the app on my phone, he had demonstrated how the ring works and I had given it a test drive. It was money well-spent. We seperately purchased an Echo Spot, which has a small screen. When we are at home we can view the front door area and hear and speak to visitors without having to find the smartphone and access the Ring app. We just say "Alexa, show me the front door" and we are almost instantly looking at the front door area. We speak to the Echo and visitors hear us on the porch and we hear visitors through the Echo. The sound on the porch and in the house is crystal clear. The Ring app announces through our Echoes (and smartphone) that there is motion in front of the house or that someone has rung our bell. The Ring2 doorbell works just like a regular doorbell in that it chimes when someone pushes it. We had the Ring 2 wired in because we didn't want to lose doorbell function if our wireless went down. We also didn't want to deal with recharging the batteries of the doorbell. Things to consider: Camera angle - Our Ring was installed with one wedge behind it which tilts the camera in the doorbell slightly down. However,  it is not tilted down enough for me to view the porch floor where delivery people usually leave packages. I would like to be able to view that area on the Spot instead of having to open the door and look out if I'm home. I also can't see the packages through the app if I'm away from home. There was a second wedge in the ring package that was not installed. I okayed the camera view with tech, so that's on me. I just didn't realize there was a problem until after he was gone. To install additional wedge(s) we will have to have someone detach and rewire our Ring doorbell. I've since learned you can also  purchase Ring wedge packages  on Amazon with 3 wedges so you can experiment with 1,2, or 3 wedges to be sure you are capturing the area you want at the time you install your doorbell. The wedges can also help you eliminate or reduce triggers that cause a motion alert like cars just driving by your home.  There are settings in the app to help pinpoint the area you want to monitor, but being able to physically adjust the camera angle helps, too. Insets and offsets limit camera view -If you have an inset entry to your front door (or other insets or offsets on the side of your house where the Ring is installed) the camera view can be limited by the walls of the inset or offset. It will not be the expansive view of your driveway and front yard  that it would be if your door, doorbell , and home design are all flush. We do have a slightly  inset front door (about 4 feet) and no offsets. The walls of the inset somewhat hinder our camera view. Through the app we can see the half of our driveway closest to the street and about 2/3 of our front yard, as well as the small porch/front door area. We cannot see any area up close up to our house except for the walls of the inset/porch area and a short section of sidewalk directly in front of the door. You may want to consider additional Ring cameras if the camera view from the doorbell is not expansive enough to meet your needs. Using Ring app on the phone: the app is user friendly, but does not have a setting to repeat  notification sound. If you don't hear that that one notification or see the simultaneous popup on your screen indicating that there has been motion or that doorbell has been rung at your house, you won't know about it until the next time you look at your phone. I think home safety is of critical importance like phone calls and messages and should most certainly have the repeated notification capability of those other apps. Video quality: Live and saved daytime video from Ring camera is very clear on my Samsung s9. At night the entryway/door area is also very clear but the dark yard and driveway in the distance look like smoke that's pixelating.  I think this is because we have a dawn to dusk light near the doorbell camera. I've seen my neighbor's night video from a Ring camera that isn't right near a bright light and the quality is excellent. Saving  video of motion and doorbell rings- The saved video is very user-friendly to access and view through the app. You do have to pay $30 a year to save your video after the 30 day free trial that comes with the Ring 2. If you don't pay, you will only be able to view what the camera sees in real time. If you add additional cameras, there is a different payment package if you want to save video from all of your cameras. Too many motion detection notifications - It might become wearying to hear repeated notifications if you have lots of traffic in and out of the door with the Ring doorbell. You can snooze the notifications for fixed periods of time and turn motion notification off through the app and it's easy to do. We are happy with Ring 2 with qualification that we also purchased  the Echo Spot to coordinate with it.It is very consistent in notifying us of motion and doorbell rings. I gave the Ring2 4 stars instead of 5 because there isn't the option in the app to repeat notifications. For me that severely limits the most critical use of the app when I'm away from home, which is to notify me (more than once if necessary) of activity around my home in as timely a manner as possible.
title: Works as promised, but app needs a critical tweek

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ArchDruid
content: I don't write many reviews on products but I feel I really need to let people know what they are getting into with the Ring 2 Doorbell. First off, do what I should have done and read the reviews before purchasing. You'll save yourself a lot of heartache. During the Thanksgiving Holidays my wife's aunt had one of these and it really impressed my wife so she talked me into replacing my Zmodo camera with this. Big mistake. As others have mentioned the motion detection is really bad. I did like another buyer and watched on my phone as I approached the doorbell. I got all the way to it, waved at it for a few and finally it kicked off. Mine's set for maximum range! If you want a camera doorbell that goes off when you open your door to leave the house..this one's for you! My garage is 15' from my ring doorbell and the other night it went off saying motion and by the time I looked out my wife had already pulled around in front of the doorbell, went out of sight, and then backed into the garage and the only thing the ring caught was the end of the car as it entered the garage. Unacceptable! Another issue as others have noted is the ridiculous speed this thing puts motion is has detected as a past event. I can be at work on a good wifi network and I'll get an alert. By the time I grab my phone, click the alert to pull up live cam, it's already too late. This alert window needs to stay active at least 30 seconds before it calls it a past event. My doorbell is within 10 foot of my router and has a very strong connection and the Ring always says it's a great connection so thta's not an issue. I bought a Ring battery spotlight camera for the back porch and it's detection seems to work a lot better.  If I would have known I would have probably just got another one of them (or stuck to the Zmodo). The only Pro for the Ring doorbell 2 though is great packaging, echo DOT alerts, and easy installation.
title: Very Disappointed in the Motion Detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: roll cyclones
content: Constantly doesnt connect and mostly when it does it's a black screen. My internet is 50mbps and the router was 3 feet away from the doorbell so that wasnt the problem. It did work better at night but still the recording was glitchy. The only thing that worked well was the motion sensor and the actual door bell. App seems nice but I would rather prefer a bare bones app that simply displayed the camera when clicked on. We have a $30 baby monitor that works flawlessly and puts this thing to shame. I really wanted this to work but I had to return it. Oh and the $30 yearly recording fee sucks too.
title: Black screen more often than not

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SpitefulMonkey
content: Ok, here we go. I purchased this doorbell originally to use wirelessly (not hardwired). The next day I decided I didn't want to mess with charging it. So I purchased a new transformer knowing the one here would not be enough to keep up. I went with a 24v/40va from here for $15. There are no chimes I've ever seen that can operate above the standard 16v, so I just opted to use a ring wireless chime and bypass the old wired one in the house. It could not handle the new higher voltage from this transformer. Now very important here...YOU MUST USE A RESISTOR if you wire directly with no chime. 50watt 25ohm. There are tons here for 5 to 6 dollars. Replaced the Transformer, threw the resistor inline, bypassed the old chime, and wired the ring. All is working perfectly. Video is great, no wifi issues at all, and the echo show integration is flawless so far. I'm loving the device. One less talked about feature is the "neighbors" social app. Being able to see all your neighbors posting footage from their cams of strange events and describing them. Seeing a distance from your home of where it took place and commenting on the posts is great. Think of it as anonymous facebook for ring cameras. I feel connected to my neighborhood and any events here I should know about. I feel this was an amazing purchase. Dont be scared off by some of these posts. You just need to do a little research on the best approach to hook it up for you. I cant speak on battery life as I decided to hardwire, but on the other aspects, this has been great. With the angled backplate it came with I clearly pickup my porch, front yard, and driveway. I'd repurchase again in a second. As a side note, you can power a second ring from the new transformer if you desire (backdoor). Plenty of power.
title: Fantastic purchase, I'm pleased in every way so far

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Philip Weiss
content: How on earth could there be a doorbell that doesn't ring?  OK, it rings OUTSIDE, but nowhere inside!  A $10 wireless doorbell comes with a ringer that you can put anywhere inside, but this $200 one doesn't.  No, that's extra I guess, but they don't even say that on the product page.  They do say that it works with Alexa, so I figured, ok, my echo dot will tell me when someone rings the doorbell.  Nope.  I guess you can view it on a Show or your TV, but I don't have those.  I just want to know when someone rings my doorbell.  Is that crazy?  Wish I could return it, but it took so long to figure out all the problems with it, it's been over 30 days.  Most of the other stuff doesn't work right either, but not having a ringer is just a big FAIL for a doorbell.
title: A doorbell that doesn't have a bell!  Seriously, I can't make this stuff up.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: superK65
content: My first Ring was wonderful. No matter where in the world I would be I could keep an eye on my door. The ring died after two years.  I was lost so I purchased the Ring two.  I used the existing bell wires to install.  This ring is not worth buying. It doesn’t capture any night activity. It goes off line frequently. It is slow to turn on, so when it does work, the video shows the person leaving the area, no face just the back. When we were out of town it went off line and there is no way to reset it without being at the doorbell. As I said the first ring was wonderful so maybe the quality has deteriorated over two years.  My son also experienced the same problems with their second ring.  They have switched to Nest.  I am so disappointed given the cost of the Ring and it isn’t working right from the start. I hope no one pays so much money for such an unreliable product.
title: Don’t waste your money on the current Ring2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Traveling gal....
content: Allow about an hour and walk through the clearly written instructions step by step and you can set up and install replacing a wired doorbell.  We had a problem with the motion detection not going off at night and called Ring and they were great.  They were able to adjust our settings remotely and now it works fine.  Highly satisfied with product and customer support.  Here are a couple of tips:  it's a little large and obvious...fits but hangs over one side....we used the wedge to avoid street motion...the motion notice to your phone lags the recording start so your'e not going to talk to the UPS delivery person...but you will see them...you will be able to talk to someone that remains standing in the area.....the recording lasts for 40 seconds after motion is detected.  After that you have to go to "live view" which is also recorded and continues as long as your viewing session continues.  After 2 weeks we have very few "false alerts" and it's captured every motion that it should have captured.  The app is easy to use and after a day or so it's very friendly.  Buying more Ring cameras for garage and back porch.  Great product.  Not perfect...but very very good.
title: ...after a bit of "tinkering".... here is a "heads up"....but highly recommend

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Steve Sussman
content: Opinion seems divided on this product, but my assessment is that the Ring Doorbell is entirely unsatisfactory. My experience was as follows: 1. Took two tries to create an account, inexplicably. 2. Motion sensing was erratic and unreliable. I tested this feature several times. Sometimes I received a quick notification; more often the notification arrived some 30 minutes later; sometimes I received no notification at all. 3. Upon pressing the doorbell button, I received notifications properly and quickly about half of the time. 4. I received error messages that the wi-fi has disconnected more than a few times. This, despite the fact my router is 15' from the unit, and that I have strong wi-fi at much greater distances throughout my house. A security product is worthless unless it can work reliably and predictably close to 100% of the time; not the less than half-of-the-time of Ring doorbell. This product is woefully deficient and is definitely not recommended. I returned mine.
title: Unreliable, erratic, and worthless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Edmonds
content: For a product that is owned by Amazon, I am surprised that the ring doorbell functions as inconsistently as it is. When someone approaches the door, Ring is supposed to let you know there is motion detected. Sometimes it does. Sometimes it does not. And when it does, you can answer the alert message by looking at your front door  through your phone.  By the time you answer it on the app, whether immediately or within 1 to 3 seconds the individual that was at the front door has been long gone. The system has so much delay that by the time you answer it right away the person is no longer there. And sometimes the video of that individual that activated the alarm could be seen in the history. And other times it could not. It is too unpredictable of a product, too slow and laggy, and it makes it not worth it to live up to its hype. And this is not because of the weak Wi-Fi situation either. I confirmed this by standing in front of the Ring doorbell and did a speed test from the Ring  application and it shows Uplink 30 MB downlink and 30 MB uplink, which is substantially more than Ring needs to operate.  Finally, who has the time and the memory to replace the battery and charge it every few days? This should come with a AC charger or give us the option to purchase an approved AC charger so that we can run it from inside the house through the wall and to the back of the ring. That option is not available. You'd have to find your own solution for an AC plug in. You are provided a diode to get it to be powered by the existing classic door chime but that also is dependent on how old your existing door chime is.  Just not enough options to solve this doorbell challenge completely.
title: Unpredictable. Does not function consistently.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Courtesy D
content: The doorbell seems like a great concept but it just doesn't fully deliver. I have gigafiber by AT&T with 1GB download speeds. I have a WiFi mesh setup with full coverage of WiFi throughout the house. I was told before considering ring to ensure that my network is up to par so I did my homework before making the purchase. The doorbell worked sometimes but it was choppy and people couldn't hear me at times. I just received my purchase 3 days ago and it appears to possibly have been used since it had a few scratches on it. The camera doesn't seem to power on at all now so I checked the battery and it's literally fully charged. I purchased this in hopes of adding additional security to my home but if it doesn't power on that hope is gone out of the window.
title: Died after 3 days and won't power up

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: rita
content: I hope to extend this review after a few weeks.  This is just my installation and setup experience. 1. First impression is disappointment that the battery must be charged for five hours before the device can be installed. I understand that lithium batteries probably shouldn't be shipped fully charged, but nowhere in the product description does it say how long this will delay the installation. Bad psychology, in my opinion. 2. Excellent toolkit provided, along with extra screws. Everyone should provide a couple of extra screws. Nice touch. 3. A nice flat mounting plate is provided, but not mentioned anywhere in the instructions. You can attach the plate to the house while the battery is charging. The the doorbell can be attached with four machine screws. Much cleaner and easier than trying to attach the device directly to a wall. 4. You really need a power drill, even if mounting to wood. They provide a masonry bit, but for wood, you will need to drill pilot holes, particularly on an old house where the wood has hardened. 5. I do not advise going against instructions to shut the doorbell power off before attaching the bell wires to the device, but I ignored this instruction, and nothing was hurt. It's 12 volts. I have no idea what breaker controls the bell transformer. And I'm careful. 6. The claim you can install it in five minutes or 15 minutes is just silly. Between gathering tools, reading instructions, removing the old bell switch and prepping the wall, you are looking at one or two hours. An experience professional might manage it in half an hour. But it's something to do while the battery is charging. 7. It works.  WiFi setup is simple and painless. It will probably tell you your signal is weak and recommend an extender. 8. I am a bit disappointed in the signal strength test. It really is necessary, but I don't like the way they do it.  Basically, I think if you and use a phone or tablet at the doorway, you should have no trouble with this device. If that's not true, the product needs to be improved. 9. They use a signal strength number that is technical and is intuitively backwards. Higher numbers are worse. When I translate my signal strength to common terms, I get two bars out of five at my doorway. In their terms, -60 out of -99. They could easily just display this on the app, and skip the unnecessary babble. 10. It works fine. 11. Night vision is surprisingly good. 12. I bought the chime. It is cute and has voices like barking dogs available. I will return if anything changes. There are many features to play with. 13. I added an old, unused smartphone as an additional video chime. No extra cost. I have a couple of retired devices. 14. Old devices can be used to view, but they don't work as substitutes for chimes. At least I haven't been able to get them to sound a chime. 15. I'm happy enough that I added a year of storage service. Someday I may add another doorbell for more coverage. 16. I set the motion sensor to make it less sensitive to street traffic. Now the only vehicle that triggers it is the garbage truck. Hasn't missed any actual people near the house.
title: First impression is good, with exceptions

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: teresaww
content: I wish I had done more homework on this. I thought I did...  I've followed ALL instructions that came with this. Searched the internet for anything that I could find.  I even  spent more money on  a wi-fi  extender... The Ring is just two feet away from this, on the other side of the wall, and my connection says that's it's better than most. Our phones are ISP compliant with the Rings restriction.  What's the problem?  I don't get notifications. It picks and chooses when to send them to my phone.  My phone isn't the problem. I've set it so that ANY notification from this app is a priority.  But still, I have to manually go into the app, and look at history, to see that I've gotten a 'missed' bell or motion.  I purchased a Ring alarm system, at the same time, and haven't  even taken it out of the box a month later.  If the doorbell doesn't work as advertised, why should I assume that the alarm system will? I hope others have better luck.
title: VERY DISAPPOINTED

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: casandra
content: I would advise anybody looking at purchasing one of these that it’s great if you purchase the subscription. If you’re planning on trying without the subscription I would save your money.  While not within the subscription period, the videos process for so long that any motion detected is gone before you can see the video and 9x out of 10 the video never finishes processing so you’ll never know what caused the motion. The subscription is inexpensive it’s just something to keep in mind.
title: Do not buy unless you’re buying the subscription.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Faith K.
content: Our Ring doorbell works great! It picks motion up quickly. The night vision is really good too, especially if there is a light on outside. Obviously it is harder to see details in the dark, but during the day the picture is crystal clear. Good sound and wide camera angle too. It was so easy to set up and is easy to use. I love the Rapid Ring app which can quickly take you to live view upon receiving a notification. We use the battery instead of hardwiring since we rent, and it seems to hold a charge well. This is just what we needed. Installation Hint for anyone who has a doorframe that is not flat - use the corner bracket and just face it toward your door because you only need to mount it right in the middle of the bracket and don’t need a flat surface, and the camera is plenty wide enough to get everything you need.
title: Exactly what we needed!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jester
content: First off.  If you have a router that is 2 years old or more and you have spent less than a 100 on it... you WILL have issues.  This has nothing to do with this product and had everything to do with the wireless network in your home. This device requires a more modern network especially if you have more than 5 Wi-Fi enabled devices in your home. Leaving the tech specifics out of it. Motion Detection If you do not use the provided wedges and follow the instruction it will not work well.  Most of the reviews clearly do not follow the directions or online tutorials on this matter.  If it sees the street.... it will pick up the street.  The goal of this camera is to watch the door... not your front yard. Beyond those two items here are the true pro's and con's Pro -Cheap -Easy set up -Chime add on removes the requirement of dealing with wires -the ring network (You get alerts from people in your area who also have ring when suspicious activity happens) -All tools needed (Even the drill bit) included Con's -Not the greatest camera quality -If you are not a "Tech" person you may need a little help with the set up. Its not too bad, but I could see how people can get confused. -Notifications can be annoying.  Until you dial in the motion activity feature it will be annoying.
title: Read this before you judge based on 1 star reviews

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sean M
content: * see update Works as advertised except for motion detection. Mine is positioned about 35 ft from a very quiet rural street. Like the instructions advise I adjusted the motion zones so the roadway is not in them. This did not work!  I now have the motion set to basically 3 ft (lowest it can go) which means motion isn’t detected in much of the area I wanted it to even though I have the angle plate installed. A human now will not set it off until they can look in my window and ups and fedex never activate because they just put the package at the end of the porch. However large cars and trucks will still set it off 50 ft away!  So 75% of the motion activation is false alarms and annoyance and it misses 50% of what would be important to know about. I’m giving it 3 stars because it’s still a useful product as a video doorbell once the button is pressed by a visitor. But they need to be a visitor who wants to announce there arrival. So far battery and other operation seem to be impressive for a device this price. Also to note the app looks nothing like shown here. The motion portion of the app on Amazon shows you can adjust motion with many different fields set on or off. On iPhone at least it’s no where near that. I had 3 zone I could set on or off and only a sliding bar to adjust all motion distance for all zones together not separate which I believe would have eliminated much of my false motion alarms. Although the road is still very far from being in any of these zones and it’s still actives so it appears to be fancier or more of a novelty than an actual accurate adjustment. *Update ring customer service has reached out to me several times via email requesting me to schedule an appointment to speak about resolving my issues. There’s some problems with this. First how do I know that this isn’t a fishing scam requesting my info. Next when looking at this persons alleged calendar the closest time to schedule a phone conference was 2 weeks out so apparently I’m not the only person having issues with these. And finally I have already taken it upon myself to speak to customer service before I made my review so apparently they don’t communicate with in there own company. It would very much seem that these products made by ring are brilliant ideas without being fully refined or developed and sold as finalized products and just using customers as beta testers to see how they perform in the real world. Most businesses that sell and market products that have not been fully completed don’t survive which is troubling because of the amount I have invested initially in cameras and alarms ect. that will become essentially “bricked” if ring folds. It’s a brilliant idea and nice products but they have a long way to go. Also another update after using doorbell 2 for a few months is battery life. I can’t imagine how anyone is getting months on a single charge. Ours is mounted to a side door that gets average traffic from a small family in a rural setting with no other traffic. I don’t regularly check “live” feed and waist the battery yet 3 weeks is all i get. More troubling is that it’s not well disclosed before buying this that the wired versions not only eliminate the low battery life issues but also have far superior motion control that would have solved my above listed problem. Knowing this I would have run my own doorbell power supply and purchased a hardwired version that actually works.
title: Lots of improvements to be made

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Pioneer B
content: I purchased this to replace my old wireless doorbell and allow me to move the other Ring camera to my back door, I can't say that plan worked... Pros: * Usually notifies me when people ring my doorbell (Recommend to use "Rapid Ring" app in place of the default to get your notifications) * Notifies me through my Echo(s) when someone is at the door * Video recording of people who are making deliveries to see if things are delivered or not * Doesn't need to be wired into previous doorbell (can if it is there) - Excellent for those without doorbells hardwired! Cons: * Terrible WiFi coverage, even compared to the Spotlight Camera that is 6 feet further away (this is only 3m away from my AP and barely has signal) - Recommended by Ring staff to purchase another of their WiFi extender solutions to have better coverage * Motion coverage for people on a hill is _terrible_.  Even at minimum settings I get alerts from people driving by significantly further away * Doesn't actually always get the correct motion.  I frequently have no capture from the doorbell of the mail delivery, despite it showing fine on the Spotlight video (facing into the house).  Ring staff still can't explain this * Video is frequently "empty" (either white or black).  Ring staff have indicated this is because my internet isn't sufficient to do the video all the time.  Again it works fine from Spotlight, and apparently a 1Gbps link isn't enough since they seem to be using the 802.1b antenna at best.
title: Not for everone, but great when it works!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stacy Baker
content: The install kit is complete garbage and made of 100% plastic. I installed the camera and we decided to move it down and over after a few days because it was aimed far too high. I took it down and drilled new holes and put the plastic angle mount up for homes with steps back up. The camera will not go back onto the bracket because the top two plastic mounts the screws go in seem stripped. I only tightened them in by hand. I removed them by hand. I was careful and there is zero reason they will not go securely back in. They go in, but if you pull on the camera, it comes easily back off. The bottom two mounts seem to still work, go figure. The mounts should be made of metal. The holes the screws go through should be metal. Everything is plastic. I mean everything. I actually like the camera. I like how it works. I think it’s a great system made totally useless by this piece of garbage mount. So plan carefully your mounting spot kids, it appears if you have to move you’ll have to buy a whole new kit. A 75¢ piece of plastic that runs $20 to replace. So until I can buy a new mount, I what, get a half secure camera? This product costs too much to be mounted with such a terribly cheap system. 🤦🏻‍♀️🙄🤦🏻‍♀️
title: Plastic Mounting Kit Fail

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Aaron Burt
content: I bought this primarily as a security camera to watch my front door. I get a lot of packages and while this wouldn't stop porch pirates, I would hope this could at least capture someone's face to give to the police. My home faces a street, about 40 feet away. I have a 10 ft sidewalk that I hoped the ring would pick up motion for. I tweaked motion settings for weeks trying to get it to start capturing right as they turned that 10 foot sidewalk, but all I could manage was seeing the back of their head. Granted, these delivery people didn't stick around for long, but neither would the suspected porch pirates I wanted to catch. In fact, someone could walk up and hit the doorbell before I would be alerted to motion. I have a Galaxy s7, about a 2 yr old phone. Clicking the motion notification to open the app and connect to live view takes about 7 seconds on a wifi connection. I haven't lost connection to wifi, despite the router being almost as far as possible to my Ring. Install time took a lot longer than 15 minutes. More like an hour, although much of that was my lack of skill, but some of it was drilling into brick. After the 30-day free trial, you lose access to your previous recordings. They aren't stored for a single minute. It's live view or nothing. I ponied up the $3 a month to be able to save and view the recordings, but I don't feel good about it. Overall, this would work great for talking to people waiting at your door, but not for capturing evidence of bad guys. I am likely to uninstall the product in the near future.
title: Probably not the best for security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jeffrey S Spatz
content: If you just want a video doorbell, and not so much motion surveillance, then this is great. If you face a street, the motion point goes off every time a large truck goes by.  I set my detection sensor to be low and only pick up  movement in front of the street per the app's directions.  I also installed the wedge looking down as we have stairs leading to my front door.  I can be doing jumping jacks 10 feet  front and center of the camera and it won't pick me up, but if a UPS truck/Van/Truck drives by 30+ feet in the background, it will pick it up every time.  I did some research on how to fix this, and apparently this is just something I have to deal with as there is a serious engineering flaw in the design sensors.  Something to do with IR sensors instead of video sensors.  I am turning off the motion alarms on my Alexa so it doesn't go off all day, but keeping it on my phone for now. We will see how long that lasts.  I am pretty disappointed as I was counting on this to be my security for the front porch and yard, but if I have it turned up enough to do that, it gets every single car in the background which is 20-30 feet away from my porch.  Too bad.  This would probably be fine if I lived in the burbs off the road about 100 feet.
title: Video Door Bell great, Motion detection not Great.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: BMoon
content: TBH, for a security camera, its way too slow.. meaning even if i have motion detection to the maximum, when people walk fast it's reaction time is too slow and wont capture all u see is an empty hallway  with just a notification that a motion was detected... Thats stupid.. might as welll have the cam running/recording non stop all day if it cant capture quick enough. And the time it takes to load the video when u get the notification, soooo slow regardless of wifi being on ur phone or not. Its horrendous because how am i supposed to yell at a trespassor or w.e if by the time the live vid loads theyre gone?! And not to mention the stupid "community" blog.. ppl are retarded (excuse my french) and nosy and omg whiny af! Why is there a helicopter in the sky in LA? Cuz its the city you piece of dooky! What did ya wanna know? And my god, some ppl leave their packages out til 4 am and complain someone stole their package.. like bits! Then pick your package up promptly or dont have it delivered if u wont be home! STOP BLOWING MY FEED UP WITH YOUR COMMON SENSELESSNESS! YARRR. OK  im calm.. just really thought this product was all that but ... Its not just fyi peeps. UPDATE: this 'doorbell' is a useless piece of JUNK! Not only does this camera not capture certain movements because it's so slow the app that you need to download has retarded people on there posting stuff about helicopters flying over their house ...like really I don't need to know there are helicopters flying over your house they are just doing their job ..flying okay?! on top of which..there are idiotic privileged people talking about how there are transients and they are just teenagers and kids trying to do fundraiser for school or whatnot, I mean how dumb can people be and that kind of post is allowed yet I post something about people like that and it's removed so if I could give this a 0 star I would.. don't waste your time with this piece of junk buy the nest
title: Buy a Nest, dont waste your time on this JUNK

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: j_rosey
content: I have been using skybell for past year or so, but I decided to purchase ring security system and wanted to have all my security products together, so I purchased this doorbell to replace my skybell. I would say the app and features/adjustments you can do in the app are better then skybells, however my rating reflects the sole purpose of this product and that’s the video quality and clarity. After installing the ring during the day, I was contempt with the video quality. However, once the sun went down, the product was utterly useless. So I got my skybell back out and hooked it up to external outlet that way I can compare the two.  The attached images show the differences in video quality at night. Top image is from skybell, bottom is ring. Ring could barley pick up my white shirt and hat. I am truly hoping my ring doorbell is defective because if it’s not, I will be returning my ring security system as soon as it arrives since it can only use other ring products and this doorbell has left me in doubt of their products. I will first be exchanging this product to see if it was defective or not and will leave a follow-up review.
title: Horrible, really hope I received a defect.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kat W.
content: 7/20/19 Update to previous review: After having the doorbell installed for a few days, I wanted to provide an update. The motion detection appears to be better. The current setting still picks up a few cars driving on the street, but I'm getting clearer images of people as they approach my door. As for the speaker, still unsure. 7/16/19 I received my doorbell yesterday and couldn't wait to start using it. I was going to pay someone to install it for me, but figured I could do it myself after watching the installation video. I'm glad I kept my money because the install was pretty easy. I hardwired it and it took me about 10 minutes. The hardest part was drillling through the brick. I'm not sure if there is an issue with the battery because I left it charge for at least 5 hours and it never signaled that it had completely charged. I decided 5 hours was long enough. When I looked at the app, it indicated that the battery was completely charged. Setup was quick and easy. Wi-Fi connection is just ok. But that can be due to the location of my router, which is at the back of my house, in my closet. I can't move it and really don't want to buy the extender. The motion detection is not great. I was expecting another package and I knew it was in route to my house. So I anxiously awaited it. I got the notification that motion was detected. I looked at the live feed and saw the vehicle driving away. When I reviewed the video on the app, I realized that it did not start to record until the delivery person was at my door. I make some adjustments in the settings and tested it several times and not much changed. A few cars driving along the street activated it and depending on how fast they were going, it caught the tail end at most. I'm going to play around with the settings some more before I draw my final conclusion about this. Otherwise, I tested it at night and the night vision is great. The speaker on the doorbell was horrible during our initial testing. It was muffled SB's echoed. Will continue to play around with this as well. The app is ok, nothing fancy. So needless to say, the jury is still out on this doorbell. I really wanted to love it, so hopefully I can work out the kinks. I will update my review after a few days of using it.
title: Still not sure

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: H. Anderson
content: I love the idea behind this product, but the app isn't great. In the last week, it seems to have improved (even though I don't remember getting an update), but I also bought the video storage plan (super cheap... $3/month or $30 for a year) so maybe you get better service that way? LOL.  The camera quality is fantastic and now that I'm actually getting notifications, I don't have as much buyer's remorse as I did before. I still get a black screen 90% of the time when trying to do a Live View, but if there's no one at my house, what's the point of that anyway? So, I like it. A flawless app integration would make it perfect.
title: Pretty good

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ben D.
content: Great product, great software, the Alexa integration makes using it smooth and simple. The completeness of installation tool kit included was unexpectedly top notch bar none. The masonry drill bit was unexpected because of the cost it adds to the overall package. Sadly the included machine screws used to attach the doorbell onto one of the 3 included adaptor plates were just a bit too short. 3 out of 4 caught a few threads(not enough in my opinion) one didn't quite reach. I know it was an issue for me because I installed it onto semi uneven brick, but this brickwork top notch, so it's a typical installation. It's an oversight by the engineering team because very few of these will get installed onto surfaces equivalent to what these peices were apparently tested on lol. They included 2 different lengths of wood/anchor screws, but the machine screws were too short even under ideal conditions so it doesn't seem like it was an attempt to cut cost, so it looks like a miscalculation maybe?
title: Just a bit longer, TWSS

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lance A
content: This has been great.  I have Ring scheduled to ignore when I leave and when I get home.  It's tuned for only the areas where an intruder or visitor would pass.  The field of vision is wide and outstanding.  The video quality via wifi is outstanding. The battery consumption is measured in weeks (I have a charger with a couple extra batteries on standby). I was able to intercept a pushy neighbor making trouble with my wife via the unit's Mic and Speaker remotely while I was at work - on the FIRST day of ownership!  Totally paid for itself in that one instance.  We were also shocked at the qty of events in our neighborhood, another great feature of the product.  Once we saw how many other people in our (very safe) area posted issues such as people attempting to break in to cars and homes in the middle of the night, we immediately bought a stick up cam and mounted it above our car.  The installation and configuration of each was super simple.  The iPhone app is great and very easy to use.  I can't really think of a negative - if you're on the fence about a video doorbell, this is the one to buy!
title: Totally worth every penny!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eric Yunginger
content: We bought this as our home is not wired for doorbells, and past wireless doorbell units (purchased from a big-box home improvement store) had frequent problems with interference from the neighbor's system.  Purchased after getting an Echo Show, and deciding to take the plunge into "smart home" accessories. First things first, as a doorbell, it works fairly well.  Except...it won't ring on Alexa devices.  (Even with the supposed update to the Echo app, we still cannot get notifications through Echo).  It does, however, provide nearly  instant notification to both my phone and my wife's, as well as the Ring Chime Pro unit inside the house (More on that later).  So to that end, as a doorbell, it does its job. Except it's not just a doorbell.  It's supposed to be a motion-activated camera, and compatible with Alexa devices.  Out of the box, it basically did not work for us - our wireless access point is in the basement towards the back of our (small) house.  Mounting the Ring next to the garage walk-out door, it lost all connection and would not work at all - no notifications, no video, nothing.  I suspect the aluminum alloy siding on the house has something to do with that - I can get wifi in my driveway, but apparently not a strong enough signal for the Ring.  So we needed to boost the signal.  Instead of just buying a wifi booster/extender (which should be completely unnecessary in an 875 sq ft house), we purchased the Chime Pro.  This has the benefit of being a dedicated chime device for the Ring, as it still isn't working with Alexa the way it's supposed to, and also boosts the wifi signal for  Ring devices.  But ONLY Ring devices.  Doesn't do jack for our phones, etc.  The Chime Pro is plugged into a wall outlet literally 4' away from where the Ring is mounted outside, and we still get marginal at best signal at the Ring as reported in the app. When the Ring detects motion, it will automatically record 30 seconds.  In theory.  Probably half the time, ours records 30 seconds of blank video.  On-demand live view has to be enabled in the app, and works about the same...half the time.  We haven't really used the two-way communication feature that much, on account that the times we've tried, it took so long (or failed) to connect, rendering it useless. Battery life, I've got no complaints.  They advertise several months, but do warn that life will be shorter if live view is enabled, as that leaves the camera active 24/7.  This was a choice we made, so we could 'check up' via our phones (in theory).  Even still, the battery has lasted over a month.  I can deal with pulling the battery and charging it monthly, even if it does take several hours to recharge. As a wireless doorbell, it does it's job fairly well.  As anything more, it leaves a lot to be desired - and I certainly wouldn't call it a security system (as Ring tends to try and imply).
title: It's.....okay.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michigan Amazon Customer
content: I really hoped this would be the solution we were looking for.  After a night of too many motion alerts, I pulled back the zones to what has been the appropriate distance.  It no longer sets off alerts from cars passing by but the issue of late alerts or no alerts have come to the forefront.  No amount of further adjustments have helped. A couple days back the mailman left a package on the front porch.  No alerts came through until after he was driving away in his vehicle.  If he had been a thief he would have been long gone before the video started recording and an alert sent.  Just now I got an alert and it showed me taking the garbage out...something I had done 15 minutes prior. Internet connection is good to marginal even with the chime pro we purchased along with the doorbell.  Interesting concept but not $200 interesting.  Packing it all up and sending it back and hope to find a workable solution to the issues I had hoped Ring would solve.
title: Just now I got an alert and it showed me taking the garbage out.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ryan Pugh
content: First off the quality of the device and the amazing job they did with packaging and setup is amazing. They provide everything you need right out-of-the-box. Installation is EASY! Amazing job creating an item like this that anyone could install. bravo! Unfortunately,  I can only give it 3 stars due to the quality of service. The unit is so amazing and I love it when it works seamlessly.  However, we only get video 1 out 4 or 1 out of times when there is a ring or motion. Also, sometimes the historical motion videos are just a black background. I have incredible broadband with 100+ Down and 15-20 Up over wireless (using 2Ghz). The doorbell has Good connectivity or better. Our devices (ipads, phones, even a laptop) will show a long spin from the Ring app when trying to connect from responding to doorbell events and on-demand live view. Painfully slow connection time if it works, but usually an error about trouble connecting. Again, even with HUGE bandwidth availability.  It's just quirky. I plan on getting the Chime Pro to see if that will help.
title: Amazing Unit but inconsistent service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JenWurtz
content: I was so excited to install a Ring Video Doorbell, for the convenience of knowing when packages are left and also seeing who is approaching our door before they even ring the bell. So far it is working almost up to those expectations. First, while installation is ideally very simple, I have had a hard time getting the placement just right. This is mostly due to the fact that where my current doorbell is (and i am not looking to wire Ring to my existing bell) is not a flat surface, it is a molding that has curves, making it very difficult to properly mount the Ring unit. What I’m doing right now is holding it only by two screws and leaving the right side of the unit not attached to anything. It seems to be holding fine. I love the video - the clarity is really remarkable and it’s fun to speak to someone as they approach the door, like my husband or kids :) The ability to change the ring sound on the app is great and being able to set times for the motion detector to not be “on” is perfect for when my kids have to leave for an early Saturday morning practice and I don’t need to be woken up and told “there is motion at my front door” because i know it’s them. But some of the negatives I’ve found so far are as follows: even if I make the motion detection zone as small as the app allows, the camera is still picking up too much activity on my actual street and telling me there is motion every time someone walks or drives down the street. But not every single time, just about 80% of those times. So as a result every time it alerts me, I go to the live feed only to see nothing. I’ve also tried setting the motion sensitivity to the lighter mode but it is not really making a difference. Second, while the camera gives a great view of my front path, driveway, street, and the approach to the doorbell, if a delivery man leaves a box right at the front door, it is not seen on the screen. I wish there were a way to point the camera down more. I know there is a wedge attachment that comes with it but for my situation it made no difference and i found it impossible to install on my doorframe. Also the doorbell is VERY loud outside no matter how i control it on the app, it’s like the whole neighborhood will know if someone is at my door. I”m not sure why or how to fix that. However, that being said, all in all, it’s a fun and very useful device. I’ve even installed an additional chime in our basement so that if i don’t have my phone on me while i’m Doing laundry or something down there, I can still hear if someone rings the bell, better than i could with our old traditional doorbell.
title: SO FAR SO VERY GOOD

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: The Botonist
content: Poor audio outside, choppy and very bad. Even with excellent signal strength, it is not worth $50. I have seen very cheap products out perform this one. Then when their 30-day trial which they do not tell you upfront expires. It wreaked havoc on my network completely shutting everything down.I spent hours trying to recuperate from it, and I have no way to recover those life hours now. Bottom line, wait or be unsatisfied. For $200 your not going to be pleased. Great idea, but again, they want to be in the middle and paid annually. This is an intolerable feature that I paid a ton for a device that reaches back into my pocket without installing it. Only to find out your eternally on the hook to pay them to use the thing. I will buy an entirely new video surveillance system 4k, that will not only see everything, but has two way audio also. what's another couple hundred dollars for a product that isn't a reaccuring unusable audio, disappointment.
title: Monthly fees, or it is worthless. Quality of audio 1-10 is a 1.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: StuE
content: I received our Ring 2 doorbell in November so we've had 90 days use at the time of this review. Our house is older and without a pre-wired doorbell, so the Ring 2 is a workable solution for our house. Initial installation took 15 minutes from screwing the external housing to the door jamb to connecting it to our Wi-Fi. However our included battery was at 30% so it took several hours to charge to full before I considered installation complete. We have the Ring 2 integrated with our house's network of Echo devices (four total, one of which is a Show), FireTV sticks on three TVs, two smart phones with Ring apps, and two desktop computers (1 PC, 1 Mac). Using the app to control motion alerts took some doing. At first it seemed leaves blowing across the yard set it off, but over time we have the motion zones better defined and limited to about 5 feet in range. Still, every morning at about 8:15 while sitting in my office at work I get a motion alert on my phone ("Motion detected at the Front Door") when the school bus drives by in the street 30 feet away. Apparently each device type and associated app must have ring / motion alerts turned on or off, one setting doesn't manage this behavior across all devices. As a doorbell it works great. The guest hears a ring through the external unit and inside we here an announcement through all Echo devices. On the Echo Show, the Fire TVs, and the phone apps we can ask Alexa to show us video as well as choose to talk to the guest. On Echo Dots or other non-video Echos you only get an announcement, you have to get up and answer your door... just like any other doorbell. Sometimes when requesting Live View we get only a black screen, often an indication of weak Wi-Fi signal.
