We notice a lag between the doorbell ring and getting the notification on our phone apps - enough lag that the guest is often walking away and halfway down the drive before we are able to access video or audio. Again, this could be due to weak Wi-Fi but this isn't too likely since we have a mesh network with a transceiver less than 10 feet from the exterior doorbell. The Ring app suggests that our Wi-Fi signal is moderate at best. That said, this same mesh network works well in covering our backyard with devices able to watch streaming video 60 feet away from the nearest mesh transceiver. Maybe it's the Ring video codec / compression that needs to be optimized? Don't know, it could even be the round trip from doorbell to Ring video server back to the requesting device. The point is, sometimes the system can be less than responsive. In the end, I find the Ring 2 to be worth the effort. I will be buying a second unit for our backdoor too. I'm banking on improved performance over time as the various apps and device firmware are updated. If that doesn't happen, we still have basic doorbells and motion detection where none existed before.
title: A Good Idea, Well Executed. Minor Connectivity Issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Yuna Park
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I absolutely love this ring. I had a hard time installing it so I called Ring and they hooked me up with HelloTech which is a company that sends out installers. The installation took $50 and 45 min. Now this little doorbell tells me whenever there is motion at the door. I can answer the door from wherever! I love how it came with a bronze faceplate since my door handles are also bronze.
title: Awesome doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: B. Collins
content: I can't tell you how excited I was to get one of these things. It's great with all the services that you get for the first 2 weeks. After that, it sucks. If you don't pay for the extra services you get such a slimmed down feature it's almost not even worth it. And OMG is that an inflated battery life that they state. It's total BS. I am lucky if the batteries last a week. Constant maintenance. You forget. No doorbell. 4 hours later, it's charged. Ooops, forgot to put the battery back in. No doorbell. If you are a VERY organized person and have no job or responsibilities that will sidetrack you from making sure this stupid thing is charged, then this is for you. But, if you have a busy life (like most of us) then this isn't for you. There ARE other options out there. You are probably getting this one because you do NOT have the original wiring at your door for a doorbell. And calling an electrification to add those lines will be a few hundred dollars. I get it. But be for warned, you have to make sure you put your "doorbell battery charge" on your calendar for a weekly repeat, take the 3 mins to take apart the unit, charge the battery, put the battery back in, take another 2 mins to put it all together again until you have to do it all over again next week. Oh AND DON'T LOOSE THAT TOOL! Otherwise, you are screwed. Pun intended. What a waste of money!
title: This thing sucks!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: John Daniel
content: It's a great idea but the limitations make it less than desirable, I would buy one of the competitors (and will probably trash this and eat the $$$ I spent). There are two main issues.  One: its basically trash without a monthly subscription. Two: even with a subscription it only records 30 seconds no matter what. I could see it only recording motion but it doesn't even do that, it only records 30 seconds of motion. I have a long approach, so I basically get 15 seconds of walking towards it and then 15 of them at the door.  What happens after that is anyone's guess. It's useless. I will research much better next time and buy something that records as long as there is motion.
title: Buy something else.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Xstime
content: I purchased on November 22nd 2019 and and it worked fine with the free 30 day subscription. On December 1st, I lost "ALL AUDIO / SOUND" and I could no longer communicate with the doorbell or hear anyting from recordings! Now even trying to answer an active ring takes too long an it turns into a "past" event! When I use the app  to see past recordings, I get the SPINNING  CIRCLE OF "OMG-NOT-AGAIN" and it just buffers, until the app  shuts off, then sends me to a "REPORT THE INCIDENT page! I did notice on the REPORTED INCIDENT PAGE... there were logged incidents , prior to me purchasing it. This leads me to believe that it was a DEFECTIVE  RETURNED ITEM, SOLD TO ME AS NEW! It did have some scratches on it , right out of the box .... that should have been my first clue, but I was so excited about getting it and setting it up! It did work really well the first week!  SOOOOOO FRUSTRATING!!! Soon I will have to pay for this awesome subscription renewal. For what this thing costs, WE SHOULD be able to at least answer an active alert within 30 seconds without it drifting off to the cloud and not being able to view it at all ... dont waste your money ... unless you want another monthly bill to pay.
title: SPINNING CIRCLE OF OMG! NO AUDIO, NO LIVE VIEWING!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kindle Customer
content: For a 1 person household, I would give this 5 stars, as it works flawlessly with a cell phone. For a multi person household, all using cell phones, i would give this 3 stars.  The problem is, so that everybody can be notified when somebody is at the door, that the app has to be installed on everybody's phone, with notifications turned on, all of the time.  This adds other issues, is anybody in the house, has somebody answered the door and this doesn't include the amount of video being sent around the cellular system and being saved to every  family members phone. To get around the these issues i also bought a new Echo show, believing the advertising, that when the door bell rings, echo will notify the occupants inside the house and the show, would display the camera view on the screen.  now I thought, i wont need notifications turned on on my phone and not everybody has to have the app installed on their phone, plus when my parents stay, or the babysitter is here, they are notified when somebody is at the door, even if i am not in. The interconnection with Alexa just doesnt work.  When the bell is pressed, Alexa doesnt give any notifications.  i still have to rely on my Cell Phone.  Alexa does give random alerts, at different times of the day or night, however, this does not correlate to people being at the door, they are just random, uninitiated notifications, which is a pain at 3am. Now i am stuck with 2 expensive electronic devices, which do not work as advertised on the amazon website.  I normally love Amazon, but in this case, Shame on you!!
title: Doesn't work as advertised - Wish I had read the Alexa Skill reviews!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: %HUSKYHIDDN%
content: The Ring 2 doorbell is an outstanding product that I am extremely happy with. It arrived a day after ordering it, although in fact I had only selected two-day Prime shipping. Setup was simple. I did have a very helpful agent walk me through connecting it on the phone, but that was because I had called about something else and she offered to. I think it would have been easy just following the instructions. Mounting is also simple, especially given the choice of angled plates to use (I chose the side-angled plate to give a better view of our front door and front yard) and the extremely comprehensive installation kit, which includes a masonry drill bit, a screwdriver, a level and all screws and accessories. The battery takes about two hours to charge, maybe a little longer, but lasts well over a week, which is excellent. We have had no connection issues, either at home or while out, and it works with our VPN just fine. I love the wind chimes alert I get on my iPhone when there is motion. We live in a quiet neighborhood and got the Ring mostly to answer the door for packages and to check on our dogs on the front patio. Sometimes I talk to my wife using the intercom as she is leaving or arriving. It’s very useful just to keep an eye on things, especially our pets! The Ring is clearly an excellent security device (and I have no objection to subscribing to the annual video backup service for $30), but its uses extend far beyond security to household management. If you have a large house, in particular, and children or pets, a series of Ring doorbells would be useful as a simple-to-set-up network of video cameras and intercoms. The UX on the app is nicely designed and easy to navigate. Live View is a great way to check on your door and surroundings. I’m hoping to view some raccoons on it at some point! Night vision is excellent, too. Highly recommended, no reservations.
title: Great security device and for household management

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jack Hoyt
content: Maybe I just got a dud.  Working with Ring now to try and get a replacement. I've had to call them 4 times to try and get the thing set up. After tweaking my settings, buying a wifi extender and then a whole new router.... it still doesn't work. And b/c this has taken months, Amazon won't let me return and the "warranty" that Ring told me about is only to replace.  And to "replace" you have to fight with the Ring Rep for +37 minutes now.......  Not a great experience with Ring the company. Coupled with all the negative news lately about their cameras getting hacked, you think they would be putting a better foot forward. So... $150 for the Ring and $300+ for a Wifi extender and new router and we still can't get it to work. FYI - The Ring representative just told me the router has to be within 15 feet of the doorbell to work??!!! I doubt many people keep their routers right next to their front doors.
title: Dud!  (Product and Company)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mr. Pixel
content: The Ring Video Doorbell seems like a great product for the first month, but constant notifications keep saying that you have to sign up for the "Ring Protect Plan" soon, or it will stop storing the video history for the device, rendering it nearly useless. So yes, this device is an Amazon plot to get you on another "pay us for life" plan. It could have easily been made to hold on to your recordings for say, a week before deleting them. That would be the decent and right thing to do. But instead, if you don't pay for the "Ring Protect Plan" forever, the device becomes useless for protecting your home, it will immediately delete that footage of the guys who robbed your home. Is that what you thought you were buying? Shame on you Jeff Bezos! This reminds me of those old movies where the mob would send ruffians door to door each week to collect "protection money." Gee, the name is even pretty close. Not cool. I think I will have to return this and look for a better product that doesn't plan to charge me for life. I already pay for Prime, which by the way, "Ring Protect Plan" should be and could be included with Amazon Prime. Greed!
title: Careful, Amazon/Ring want to charge you monthly $$$ fee for life, for Ring Video Doorbell!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: just Joe
content: Pros: 1) It is easy to install. 2) It is easy to set up. Cons: 1) The quality of the video from my Ring looks washed out. It's not a crisp image. I discussed this with technical support. The technician tried to improve the image and was somewhat successful but I still think it still looks washed.  Perhaps there is a reasonable explanation for the issue. I had a different model Ring at a previous home and it's video was much better. I might simply have a defective unit. 2) Video alerts initiated by motion cannot be viewed because I did not sign up for the cloud service. This is very disappointing. I might point out to Amazon, this cloud service requirement is not stated on the initial product description page.
title: Disappointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Butterfly Lady
content: When we remodeled out kitchen a year ago, we ditched the ugly 1920s chime, effectively eliminating a doorbell. T  We bought the Ring 2 during 1919's prime days, but with one thing and another didn't get around to installing it until this past week. Although the directions for installation and activation that came with the doorbell werere sketchy at best, we only needed one call to figure out how to add my husband's phone as a shared user. Then came the issue of how to have it "ring" so we could hear it inside!  I went through the installation process several times, thinking I was doing something wrong. Then I called Customer Service (800-656-1918). The representative told me I would need to buy and install a Ring Chime ($30) for that to happen. Nowhere in any of the menus I searched or the small installation booklet did it state that this doorbell (battery powered) needed a separate accessory. So I ordered it and it arrived yesterday. Then the really annoying installation problem arose. I have to say both of the Customer Service reps (Keith and Megan) were very frieindly and helpful, and Keith was incredibly patient with me, After running a series of diagnostic tests, we ended up activating the Chime using my husband's phone. My Samsung Galaxy Note 5 was not communicating with the Chime at the crucial point in the installation. Unfortunately, the Chime ended up registered as belonging to him while the doorbell belongs to me. So the Chime and the Ring 2 wouldn't talk to each other. Today I used my husband's phone to sign him out of our Ring account, sign me in, and set up the Chime. Finally they talk to each other! Finding the page to select our doorbell tone was another case of trial and error, but I did eventuallly find it. Now that everything is installed and activated, I'm very happy with the end result, but the time spent and hassle required to get here has left me wondering if I would have bought this had I known all the headaches it would induce. PROS: o  Provides a good fisheye view of the front porch and most of the yard and the ability to speak to whoever is a t the door. o  Distance from front door and angle of view can be adjusted to suit your own property. o  Works with Alexa devices. Ours is connected to three Dots and a Show. o  Settings can be changed so house can be monitored while we're away from home and even speak to whoever is at the front door. o  Customer Service representatives were friendly, patient, and helpful. CONS: o Battery-operated version requires a separate accessory for a bell to ring inside the house. Neither the description on Amazon nor the written installation instructions mention this. o  Written installation and use instructions are sketchy at best. o In app instructions are not intuitive and require much trial and error, or a call to Customer Service o Required several hours on each of four days to finally get it installed and functioning as we wanted (and as the promotional materials show)!
title: Easy Installation? Not so much! Battery-operated? Buy a Chime too!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Deb S
content: Bought this because after seeing the reviews.  It works great and we can see when packages are delivered or when someone comes to our door.  I even got notifications when I was over 1200 miles away on business.  I was able to talk to the person at my door, and I didn't have internet access where I was.  This was a nice feature of the Ring Doorbell.  The video quality is amazing.  The night vision is great.  I went ahead and paid the $30/year for the subscription even though you don't have to.  Installation of the Ring doorbell 2 was easy and took about 20 minutes from out of the box to getting it adjusted.  I recommend this product.
title: Great security doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. King
content: We wanted to replace our non-working doorbell at the front door of our home. A friend at work lives in a home of similar architecture and shared our disappointment at how hard it was to fix the doorbells provided in our mid-century houses. She and her husband had installed an older version of ring. They loved it. She recommended getting the Pro 2 model which we did. We were a little baffled at the installation process but got through it with the help of some YouTube videos. Once we saw how, installation was pretty easy. A benefit we had not expected, but that we love, is that we see when someone comes on our property. I knew the exact moment our yard waste got picked up even though I was at work. I feel less worried now about ordering online for delivery to my home since now I will see all activity in my front porch. I am less concerned about someone stealing packages off of our porch. If they do I at least have high quality video to add to a police report. I hope my neighbors decide to get the ring.
title: Love it! Don’t want to be without it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard
content: I thought this would be better.  1. Changing the settings is confusing...Every time a truck drives by, the motion sensor goes off.  Even after narrowing the sensor range to 4 ft it still chirps.  It must be the vibration that makes it activate.  I disabled the motion sensor alerts.  2.  Goes through batteries fast.  If you can, have it hardwired if you have an existing wired doorbell.  I had to buy a back-up battery.  More money, of course.  I like the concept of a Smart Doorbell and all, and Ring is probably the most marketed one.  I wish I had done more research before I bought.  I'll probably trash this and go with another brand.  Disappointed, but oh well...
title: Not as Impressed as I'd Hoped

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Douglas
content: Yes, the documentation says you don't need a subscription but without it the device is a real expensive doorbell with crappy motion detection. The subscription gives all the useful recordings, without it, you notifications but see nothing. You can go "live" at anytime but by the time you do, the person that triggered the alert is already gone or almost out of view. For example, the mailman that comes everyday obvious triggers the motion detection and when I click live view and wait for it to connect, it rarely gets the mailman in the picture at all. (Some times it gets just a glimpse of him walking out of view.) And even if you did, you get no recording of it, even of the live feeds you just watched. So good luck using this as a security device unless you have a photographic memory. At least when I had the free recording trial it recorded things and that was nice but that should be included in the price like other doorbell cams. At least a 24 hr or even 12hr time frame with the ability to download videos as needed. During the trial, and after multiple adjustments, I was able to get the motion detection to go off somewhat regularly. The issue is it took way too long to start recording. I have a 4 stairs leading up to door so I use the included wedge on my device. I get people walking on sidewalk triggering and even some cars that drive a little closer than others. So I know it works. But... the mailman, recordings are always of him putting mail in my mail box which is literally 3 inches below the ring doorbell. So the recording doesn't start recording until they are already at my door. If someone wanted to steal packages they would just have to run to door and I wouldn't even get them on camera. I have a 200meg connection. so network speed is not the issue.
title: Subscrition required to be useful.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe S.
content: I've had the Ring Video Doorbell 2 for a couple of years now. We got it right after purchasing our house. Instead of seeing any improvement from initial lackluster performance, it's instead gotten markably *worse* over time. Motion Sensing: I can't count on one hand how often the sensor pulls someone as they're heading to the house. Instead, it's usually after something's been dropped off / as they're leaving. I can open the door, go to my car, close it, and only then will a notification pop off. What's worse, it takes *forever* for it to open up on your phone. And if you don't have Live View enabled (and even then) it'll slowly pop off, give an error, or a glitchy-looking view. WiFi: Maybe this impacts the above, but even when it says there's a good signal.. the connecting can be visibly slow. This is with 300 MBS WiFi. Their response was, despite having good Internet Connection outside my home in my front yard, "Buy a Chime." Well, I bought one. A year or so in, that Chime's made almost no difference. Customer Service: I'll say that for the most part, the CSR team was decent - even if frustrating. I appreciate their efforts. But I don't appreciate their ability to correct issues. On a similar note, I think it's odd how the Ring FB page sort of hides negative comments or issues (maybe that's stopped?). Video Quality: Not great. And we're not looking for great, but it seems like even on others' (who may not be the highlighted ones promo'd by Ring) you see all these screen pops and issues. We'll be replacing Ring this holiday season. Thought I'd give it to my folks, but especially with the delays - it may not be the safest bet. Especially when I'm seeing now how well others are competing. The Cloud subscription model doesn't add much value outside of video storage.
title: Disappointing - not a great value.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Helen Jo
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. The good stuff first - it was easy to install - the app is well designed - for 2 weeks it worked So now the not so good. After about 2 weeks I checked the device and found it was offline. So I took it off the front of the house and did the reasonable. - re-charged the battery ( it was a wired device so the battery should not have been the issue) - re-tested a few times - got all the items and the box and made sure I can send it back. I did read up on issues. But like many folks I simple do not want to spend a second of my life on a customer service line trying to work out why the unit does not power up any more, then come to the conclusion that it is not working and that I need a new one. I'm just sending it back. I will get another one, and if it works I will adjust my 1 star rating to 3 stars. But no one reads the 3 star ratings. The one star ratings really give a best indication of failure. ... This is an update to my original. I asked amazon to replace this item, and I got a new one the next day. I fitted it the following weekend it all worked. The 30 days free video storage started from the new activation date. I deleted the old device from my ring app. So although it did stop working. So far the replacement is holding up and the speed of replacement has been really good. Well many months later I am uprating my review to 5 from 4 as although I had some faulty devices the exchanges worked and have continued to work for many months. after a while you will get used to having these devices.
title: Device stopped powering up after 2 weeks, but was swiftly replaced.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Amazon Junkie
content: I bought the Ring Video Doorbell 2 because I travel a lot and liked the idea of being able to see who was at my door -- and communicate with them -- even when I was halfway around the world. Alas, this was too good to be true! I am disappointed by the very long lag time from when the bell is rung until I am notified on my Smartphone. 99% of the time, I am not even able to answer in time and the person simply leaves before I even know who was at my front gate (if it wasn't for the video recording, I wouldn't have been able to see who was there!). I even ordered a Chime Pro Extender, but it did not improve the connection whatsoever. Second, the audio on the doorbell is very low and there is no way to adjust this. Friends have told me that it is very hard to hear me when I answer, even if I am in close proximity to my router (when answering from a remote location, it is even worse!). As for the motion detection, it is way too sensitive and there is no way to effectively block out unwanted triggers such as cars passing by or even a cat running across the road. I live on a cul-de-sac so cars routinely turn around or back out and this triggers the motion sensors even on the least sensitive setting. I have even installed special brackets to angle the doorbell device away from the roadway as much as possible, but that did not help at all. In the end, I decided to turn off the motion detection entirely. Last, as others have commented, the free recording and uploading to the Cloud is only offered for a very limited time, after which you have to pay a monthly fee. Given the poor performance of the device, it is almost a necessity. I feel like I am being forced to pay for a service just to know who was at my door....something I should have been able to do in the first place -- for free -- if the doorbell worked as advertised! I have tried troubleshooting the issue with Ring Tech Support, but there is no real solution to these problems. I am not even sure if there is a way to update the device software should a fix be developed in the future.
title: Long lag time and poor sound make for a DISAPPOINTING experience

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Tan
content: I would say this device takes much longer than I expected to install. I might want some youtube video which could shorten the process. First is the connection. They need you to press a button inside of that unit. But this is not mentioned in the manual. Although they put a tag in the unit, but no one knows that’s required for set up. So after you installed the cover and figured out the unit cannot be connected, you need to reopen it and do the connection. Then there is issue to enable the microphone on your cell phone. There’s zero instruction on this and I just search online to resolve. Then when I try to connect to Alexa Echo show, it need me to sign in to Ring account. I don’t think I set up any account during the installation process. Just simply provide the phone number and name, no password set up. But now it ask me to log in with password, how can I know that? Try to set up new password but it doesn’t work too. Because it ask you to enter current password. There is no something like “forgot password “ for you to click. Anyway, taking a lot time to fix all these pain in the ass. Apparently they can do it better but they just too lady to do it
title: Not that easy to set up

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Paolo DLR
content: I went with the Ring Video Doorbell 2 because it went on sale and I got 20% off that price. If I could do it over, I'd probably spend a bit more and go with the Nest Hello. My reason is because the Nest records 24/7 whereas the Ring 2 records based on motion detection. The issue is that the Ring 2 sometimes starts its recording a bit late and ends too early. Otherwise, it's a good enough product. It's nice to be able to live view what's going on at my front door whenever I want. UPDATE (Aug 22, 2018): After owning this for barely 2 months, I'll say it's not worth it. I received an email from Ring yesterday that I should charge my battery soon. The thing is, it's hardwired so why is the battery draining? I removed the battery, checked the connections. Even the app confirms it's hardwired. I even tried reversing the wires. Oh well, I guess I'll just have to charge the battery every month or so (and wow does it take hours to charge).
title: Not Worth It

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard Roberts
content: I was impressed with my Daughter's RING, so, I got one too. Really believing in this new tech product, I told everyone who would listen. People showed a slight interest and could see how it would be a good thing, but, it didn't generate enough excitement to entice anyone to purchase one. Within a week after installation, I was alerted to  movement at my front door. I watched the stream that was recorded while I slept.  What an uneasy feeling watch some creepy stranger rattle your door knob, stick something between the door, and take pics of the door with their camera.  I posted it on a neighborhood watch website. Evidentially it took  that motivation to fuel the fire, EVERYBODY was asking me; where they can get theirs, how much money they cost, was installation easy, what model number etc..... When it hits close to home, then it sparks an interest amongst tribe.....several people took a new interest and ordered their RING 2.
title: People showed a slight interest and could see how it would be a good thing, but

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kyle H.
content: The monthly service fee to record even 24 hours of data regulates your ring to just a doorbell. You would be better off purchasing an internet camera and leaving your old doorbell in place.
title: Works, but without monthly fee not very useful.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Goodman
content: Finally got my Ring 2 Doorbell installed. Thoughts: 1. Installation sucks. I hardwired it to our existing doorbell so that it would gain power from the house instead of having to pull the battery out every few days to charge. The battery is held in by a horrible little screw that I would have had to have taken out and put back in every single time I needed to remove the battery to charge it. So obviously hardwiring was the best option. Unfortunately that's easier said than done. The wires that came with it were nowhere near long enough so I had to crimp and connect new wires to be able to install it. Because our door is a few steps up I also had to use these different brackets to angle the camera the correct way so that it would work in the first place. I'm happy to say that it is installed and is apparently gaining charge from the house. 2. The software is amazing. You can tell a lot of money went into development of it. It's very crisp and incredibly easy to use. 3. Motion detection is very fast and very accurate. So far it has not picked up vehicles driving by because I was able to set the exact area that motion will be alerted. 4. When the doorbell is pushed there's only about a two to three second delay before I get the notification on my phone. When I click said notification it instantly goes to a live view of the video of the person at the front door. At that point I can speak to them and they can speak to me and I have HD video showing they were there. 5. In order to upload video to a cloud you have to pay a monthly subscription. It is incredibly cheap and at whopping $3 a month. If we were to add extra cameras and motion detectors outside that cost goes up to only $10 a month and allows a huge backlog of video in case anything happens. 6. The coolest thing I've noticed is the neighborhood feature. When clicking on that I saw numerous people in the area who have these doorbells that were able to upload pictures and videos of suspicious activity outside their homes. I have yet to figure out how I can do that if it happens on my end but I'm looking forward to being able to keep up with what's going on around here and contribute if any suspicious activity happens at our house. All in all based on my first impressions I think it's absolutely worth the money especially since we got it $70 off for Black Friday. Time will tell!
title: First impressions

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Penny
content: My neighbor has a Ring Doorbell and has been singing its praises for months. With the excellent value Amazon was offering for Black Friday, I decided it was time. The video activates when a vehicle passes in front of my house on my side of the street, and sometimes on the other side as well. Pedestrians and cyclers do not seem to activate it unless they approach pretty close. I haven't played with settings yet, but having video of anyone who accesses my mailbox or driveway would be a goal. I am in the 30-day free trial of the cloud service, and think I will likely continue with the paid service since my neighborhood has experienced a lot of car break-ins and mailbox theft recently. $30/year doesn't seem that expensive if it helps capture a thief. Now for the negative: I expected installation to be quick and easy based on reviews, but mine took hours. The instructions want to look easy, so they give steps for the simplest installation then refer you to troubleshooting when installation fails. I went through a long cycle of trying to connect the Ring Doorbell to my network/phone with failure after failure. I knew I had a good signal, so when the troubleshooting wanted me to download an app to check my bandwidth, I got out of there. Accessing the Internet on my phone for detailed troubleshooting is not my idea of a picnic. What the Ring was doing was creating its own Ring network on my phone then repeating over and over that it had no internet. I couldn't figure what it wanted since the phone was connected to Wi-Fi if I went back to it, until I had to switch to this other Ring network. Finally it occurred to me that my VPN might be interfering, and sure enough, turning it off made the connection easy. TIP 1) If you have a VPN, turn it off to set up doorbell. The second problem was getting the Ring Doorbell to connect and ring my existing wired doorbell. I connected the wires and did the installation as described, then took the battery out to store since I was using the wired connection. Seemed logical: choose battery or wired. No. You have to leave the battery in. I figured that out after several installs and removes when I kept thinking I must have gotten the wires wrong. This was confirmed in one of the reviews that I read later. So TIP 2) You need the battery, even if you wire the doorbell. The hours it took to connect and install are the reason I gave 4 stars. If Ring wants to send simplified instructions, fine. But they should consider also sending a tip sheet including some of the things to try when things don’t go smoothly. Of course, I could have called their number for help…
title: WIth crime on the increase, seemd a good investment, but installation was a bear: See 2 tips.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LC
content: I admit, I dreaded receiving this in the mail because I anticipated an afternoon-long project to get this setup. Not so! From start to finish (not counting time to charge the batteries) it took about 20 minutes to get this mounted and synced with the app! I was very pleased with ease of setup. I was also concerned about the sensitivity, worrying that I would be notified any time my flag in the yard flapped or a bunny scampered by. That also hasn't been the case: every notification has been for just cause. More importantly, I believe I have gotten EVERY notification: packages or visitors haven't shown up without receiving the alert. The camera quality is very crisp, and the battery life has surprised me! We have had this installed since 12/4, and as of today (12/27) we still have 59% battery life with Live Feed turned on. To enhance our package, we did buy an extra set of rechargeable batteries and 2 chime extenders. I recommend doing the same, or at the very least getting the battery pack so that you are not without your ring while charging. Overall, I'm very satisfied and have recommended this to several friends! When we are able, we plan to continue adding devices to build a full home security system using Ring products.
title: Easy installation, Excellent Quality

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gail C
content: I have owned my doorbell for 1 month & liked it. This morning I tried looking at the motion detected videos from last night & received message I could not unless I subscribed to Ring plan. Apparently the only thing the doorbell is good for without a paid plan is for a live video....which doesn't help if you have something happen when your not looking at live video. $200 for this? It's not how the doorbell is advertised. I wouldn't recommend & there are other products available to do same thing without paying for a plan. Also interesting when purchasing this item you receive 30 day free access to your videos before you have to pay & Amazon gives 30 window to return. Then they charge $20+ restocking fee if approved to return
title: Subscription plan $ required?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T. Bell
content: Update: Battery life is TERRIBLE!  Lasted < 1 month before needing to be charged. I’ve decreased the sensitivity several times (still pick up cars going by) and still only getting about one month before having to recharge. One HUGE issue that I’ve noticed is you can not customize your notifications of motion/doorbell with your Echo devices in that you either get notifications to all of your devices or none of them. My son moved into a dorm this year and took his Echo dot with him but left it tied to my Amazon account. I had to turn off all the notifications because he kept getting them at his dorm so now I don’t even get notified if someone e is at my door! I know this is a pretty unique situation but could also apply to you for instance if you have an Echo in a baby’s room. You are not going to want it announced on that Echo whenever there is motion at your door or for a doorbell. They need to make it to where you can choose which devices announce these things. Because of this (which I think is a pretty major issue for our family) and the sucky battery life, I am downgrading my rating of this from 3 to 2 stars. Had LOTS of trouble getting it to work properly. Wouldn’t send me ANY notifications of motion detection for over a week! Went back and forth getting tech support via email (also a big pain!). Finally started sending notifications but then was missing motion detection most of the time! Not sure what finally got it to work, but it’s working now. I get WAY too many notifications of cars driving by though and I’ve lowered the sensitivity multiple times. I feel like if I lower it much more, it’s not going to pick people up until they are on my doorstep. I’m relatively happy with it now, but overall I’m somewhat disappointed. I would recommend it, I mean now that it finally is working, I like being able to see who comes to my door, when packages are delivered, etc. But only 3 stars due to the major hassle it was took to get it to this point.
title: Disappointed ☹️

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kickinit
content: I bought this Ring Video Doorbell on Prime Day. I mainly bought it for the obvious reasons of watching my house when I wasn't home and to track my front door after packages are delivered. So far I am happy with it. The battery life is good and lasts plenty long from what I can tell. The video quality is also good and connectivity to wifi has been great. Two problems I've noticed. The "security screw" is nearly impossible to install in some situations. I have a mid-century house with a brick ledge wall that runs along the front. The top of the ledge is about an inch or less from the "ideal install height" of the Ring doorbell. Because of this it can be very difficult to remove and reinstall the screw. I also wish the motion detection range was more configurable on this model. The motion range is basically an adjustable half circle that increases equally as you "slide" the adjustment zone. You can turn off the zones but there are only 3 zones to choose from. With the configuration of my house, if I drag the circle back to avoid the street, my driveway is no longer monitored by the side zone. If I have my whole driveway monitored then I either have to turn off the entire front zone or live with multiple false motion alarms from cars.
title: Great except a few minor inconveniences

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hopeinformer
content: I've only had this installed since August. Pros: The battery life is really good. The motion detection is pretty good. I like that they allow you to setup motion sections but would be nice if you could draw the region. The video quality is decent, not great but not terrible. Cons: the app is horribly slow. They just updated it and now it's even slower. Once I receive a notification of motion and click to open the video it takes anywhere from 2 to 10 minutes. It's the same if I click to view a post from a neighborhood alert. I just added the Stickup Camera from Ring and it's the same... slow. Another downside is that you have to pay for cloud storage. Many others have mentioned this as well. I paid for a year and it said I can have 2 devices. After adding the stick cam and trying to add it to the "protection plan" I'm faced with disappointment again because I can't add it to the plan. I called customer support and asked them how to add the new camera to the plan and they say I'll have to buy another plan. That's just a rip off. I should be able to use my own cloud storage. I think Ring has too much control. Next year I'll be looking for an alternative to the Ring product line. I'm not paying them anymore money.
title: The Ring is ok but the app stinks. Forced to pay for cloud storage to save video clips

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: See Jee
content: Decent camera, but only if you're desperate to avoid wiring. I have three Nest Outdoor Cams around a property, and decided to monitor a fourth door with the Ring Doorbell Cam. Here's my review after a couple of weeks: PROS: + Absolutely no wires or power cables; easy to install + Battery life is acceptable; I'm averaging ~3% loss per day + Looks good, records 30 second clips of movement CONS + Routinely MISSES recordings (events are shown as black video and no audio) + Buzzing noise from unit overpowers recorded audio, masking a lot of the conversations + App is a mess Overall, not satisfied as I wanted to be. The biggest issue for me is that recordings are sometimes logged as purely black video and no audio. For example, something involving police activity occurred on our property, but 2 of the 4 videos from that event were BLANK! The one time Ring was supposed to perform, it let me down. So, as I said earlier, I'd avoid this unless you absolutely MUST go wireless. I recommend going through as much pain and trouble to get something hardwired like a Nest cam instead. After all, we all get cameras to monitor and improve our safety, but what's the use if the recordings occasionally fail?
title: Don't buy this if you're looking for guaranteed video surveillance.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sanjay Aggarwal
content: Overall ecxellent product. Installation went smoothly-I placed on a brick surface. I'm using the battery and bought an additional battery to swap in when the first needs recharching. Setup had a couple hiccups, requiring the help of the customer support: they were very helpful. The other issue in my house was wifi: the Ring requires a very robust wifi signal and they sell a wifi booster to help with this. My original wifi configuration was not good enough but since I have a mesh wifi system, I just moved one of the nodes much closer to the front door (where the Ring is) and it worked very well. Overall I'm very happy with the Ring: video and sound quality are good. I'm very willing to pay $30/year for the level of additional security it provides. I did get the RVD2 at the time of the amazingly good Black Friday sale, so saved alot there! I agree with others that setting motion zones is key if you live on a busy street, or you will get too many notifications.
title: Excellent video doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Reader
content: The images are overexposed for the first 10 to 15 seconds.  Motion detection is spotty. Sometimes it goes off over and over from any little movement, and other times it picks up motion 10 seconds or so later.  Just enough time for your intruder to stroll past it. If you try to pick up a motion or ring, there's always a delay, so it can't really be used to answer the doorbell unless someone will stand around and wait a long time. I've worked with tech support (3 different folks: chat, phone, email) and the issue was not resolved. Finally, they told me my download speed did not meet the minimum requirements for the device which is apparently 2.0 Mbps. They will tell you it's displayed on the box. It is NOT displayed on the box. However, the internet speed of 2.4 Mhz is, and since I have a 2.4 speed, I thought the device would work fine. I would not recommend this product.
title: I good idea, but not a good product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: EGeekDr
content: Was excited to order. Bought mainly because I don't have the required low voltage AC supply at the doorstep. Disabling motion alerts or reducing the range helps battery survive nearly a month. Cloud storage is expensive though cheaper than Nest cam. Alerts are mostly delayed and often cannot see anyone in the recorded video clip which defeats the purpose of installing this. Customer care is very good but they keep telling it is the bandwidth issue and the internet speed etc. Maybe next is 100MBPS and with ORBI Mesh router! All other demanding WiFi devices work perfectly. Ring need upgrade their servers and the response to the alerts.
title: Good but has issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Helena
content: The first day we had this installed we discovered a delivery guy that helped himself to our hose to cool off from the heat wave and the woman who delivered a card to the wrong neighbor.  After watching these videos we wonder what else has happened in front of our home in the past twenty years.  We even saw a car drive by slow once it was driving by our home in the middle of the night.  That felt suspicious. I also love that I could see reports shared of things that have happened in the neighborhood from other people who also have the Ring Doorbell. Further, we installed the security system.  We now have much more protection at a savings of $33 per month over ADT.  We just need to recoup the $450 initial cost of the equipment.  That’s about 14 months.  We’re very happy with the system. We’ve had several nights where we were beat and ready to go to sleep and were not sure If anyone had turned on the alarm and we have to drag our tired body down the stairs.  Now we can turn it on right from bed. The other night I busted my husband because he forgot to close the door on the upper deck.  The app wouldn’t allow me to turn on the alarm and told me the door was open.  That was a funny moment in addition to the delivery guy who found relief with our hose.
title: Wonder what else has happened in front of our home in the past 20 years

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe
content: I really wanted to love the Ring Doorbell, but it has one major flaw.  Apparently most new phones, either android or apple, do not work well with the Ring Doorbell when it comes to communicating with anyone who comes up to your door.  For some reason, the speaker on the doorbell is so quiet that the person on the outside can't hear you.  It's not a hardware problem, but rather some kind of software problem in the Ring Doorbell System.  If you read through the Tech Help Forums, it is a known issue, and you will be told by the Ring Forum Moderators that you can correct this by disabling certain features, but often times that doesn't fix the problem, and I shouldn't have to reduce the capabilities of my device just to use something that is one of the biggest selling points. I really love how the rest of the device works, but if I can't communicate with the person who pushed my doorbell, or just ran up to try and steal my latest amazon delivery, then I might as well return it and go back to my old security camera system.
title: Voice Communication with visitors doesn't work.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. Hutton
content: I'm still (luckily) in the trial phase of the Ring Doorbell before purchasing a cloud plan.  This thing is terrible!  I installed it right next to my front door, set up everything properly.  Suckola.  I get motion detection all the time (even when I lowered the settings), but the worst part is when I go to open it to see what the motion is, about 98% of the time, it just spins "thinking" and attempting to connect and show me.  When I wake up in the morning and notice that I had a few motion detections during the night, I open the Event History to view and I get nothing but pitch black - one to two second video.  I don't know if their video recording sucks or if their night vision sucks.  When I go to just look at Live View, the same thing - 98% of the time, it just spins thinking about whether or not it wants to do its job.  It's definitely not my wifi because I still have signal from my router down the street. So the reality for me, is I have a stupid ridiculously expensive doorbell.  That's it.  No video or live view awesomeness.  Just lame piece of junkness.  At least I found this out before installing the second one I bought, and before signing up for the cloud service.  Wish I could send this one back!
title: Do Not Recommend-WASTE OF MONEY

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Daniel
content: Another reviewer mentioned these issues, but I was impulsive and bought it anyways. They are all true. - I spend a good deal of time adjusting the sensibility settings and using the brackets (both V and H) to reduce false positives, but they are still too many.  My door is about 25-30' from the road and if a truck passes, even small cars, "motion detected".  You stop giving importance for the sensor. - I try to answer motion but it takes so long to load (I have an S8, with good wifi) and I got a connection problem way too often. If wasn't another false positive (as usually is), I would have missed the person lurking. - The recording starts too late. when you go see the recorded video (because you were not able to answer the false positive motion), the video starts way too long after the movement started. - regarding payments: I have a Piper camera that records up to 1,000 24s videos for free, overwriting after that. It works great. It always worked. Why Ring enforce additional payment is mind-blowing considering what is available on the market. - I have installed with battery, that was really good because it was easy to install, but on the current pace (75% after 25 days) there is no way it will last the suggested 6 months on the website. UPDATE: had to completely disable the motion sensor, the false positives were driving me crazy. Not paying the monthly fee. It's too many clicks to get to the screen when somebody actually pushes the button. Avoid this product and wait for competitors to come up with something better. UPDATE 2: Now this piece of crap will not enter live view.
title: Trash. too long to answer, too many false positives, subscription (for this service, really?)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alex
content: Have had this for a year and a half. It works for live view for when I want to view the camera remotely, but it NEVER works when someone rings the bell. It goes into a loop of loading video and the person is gone before it ever loads. Then it glitches and doesn't save the video so I can't go back and see who it was. Bottom line: Ring is a crummy company selling shoddy products. I can whip up a more reliable product using a Webcam, a button, and a raspberry pi for half the cost (i have done so indoors for security purposes). If you care about privacy, you'll stay away from Ring. They don't even bother with encryption on their devices and all of your comings and goings are stored on their cloud servers and there's no ability to simply save to a network storage device instead of the cloud. Very dissatisfied with both this device and the flood light cam. I'm keeping them on my house because I'm moving and I'm assuming the next person will like them... Until they have to use them.
title: Never worked, not even once!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: El Gordo Tejano
content: I received the camera, and proceeded to install it. The instructions are great for install, but take your time and read through them as you will need to refer back to them a few times to make sure you got everything correctly. The setup of the camera was actually super easy. It took longer to create an account than to setup the camera. There is a delay between the time someone rings the door bell and it notifying you on your phone. So it is slow on that perspective by about 2 to 4 seconds. Processing of videos is also slow. That can take 5 to 20 seconds. It has to do with it uploading the video to the cloud. Would be great if it had a memory card slot and it would record to that then upload the video for quicker access times of videos. I do recommend it as it is great, and the subscription is cheap and worth it. The video quality is unmatched!
title: Great Camera

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Banjo Benny
content: There are at least two fundamental problems with the motion detection: 1. If I set up the camera in the yard and walk directly toward it, it will not detect me. Whereas if I set it up to the side of my path and walk past it, it has no problem. 2. when it does detect motion, it tends to capture the end of the motion event and not the start of it. Good cameras will give you a couple of seconds prior to the motion and the entire motion event. To try to quantify #2, I slowly backed my car out of the driveway and parked on the street and waited for the motion event. One of my two rings is mounted on a front gate with a direct view of the driveway. The start of the motion video shows my bright red car in the MIDDLE of my driveway, and then it takes me about 5 seconds to back out the rest of it, trying to maintain constant speed. So it is dropping about the first 5 seconds of me backing out of the garage - in a red car against a green hedge in the background. You wouldn't think such a thing would be so challenging to detect... So...I talked to a Ring guy and he basically said I bought the wrong Ring, I needed to buy one with "advanced motion detection" which is generally speaking the ones that are meant to be wired. Now, as we were speaking, he noticed that mine is wired (to the doorbell power), so wouldn't it have been nice if he could have just reconfigured my Ring to do more buffering and use more power. No such luck.  Maybe the version I bought doesn't have enough RAM to buffer the extra 5 seconds of video. Or maybe their business model is simply to sell you absolute crap and then when you are disappointed, try to upsell you into something more expensive, and your existing Ring will make a nice looking paperweight. In fairness, the Ring is primarily designed to monitor your front door, so you can see someone walk up to it (maybe), ring the doorbell, and wait around for an answer. If the person does not walk directly to your door, the Ring can probably accomplish that feat. I have an amazon cloud cam also, which mostly monitors the back door and the coming and going of my dogs via a dog door, and that works about as you would expect: for example, I just watched one motion event video where one of my dogs is staring out the window, and then another dog comes barging through the doggy door and runs up to the first dog. I seem to have a couple of seconds of no motion, then the motion happens, then the clip ends when the motion ends. That is the way I think most cameras should work, especially ones as expensive as a Ring. So to make up for the "missing motion" that the Ring doesn't give me, I will probably mount another camera that captures the same area, albeit from a different angle. To sum, I think if you want a Ring that strictly monitors your front door, it will probably work fine for you. If you want to use it more as a cloud camera, because you like the app and the power interface is simple, then just be aware the motion detection will drop the first part of the motion, unless you get the unit that explicitly says "advanced motion detection."
title: the motion detection is horrible

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Martin Bayne
content: works great... until your free subscription runs out. Thought I could view the video for a day or so but instead get a message stating your ring protect plan has expired. Need to pay a fee if you want to see any video from the motion detector or when someone rings the bell. Missed my return window by a day. Replacing with an Arlo camera that holds recording free work a week with NO FEE.
title: requires a paid subscription to see video

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: sdnelson11
content: Ring’s products, including this one, really hit their mark. They work out of the box, easy to install, everything’s right there in the kit. The only drawback is if you run this on it’s rechargeable battery, it’s prone to discharging within a couple of months, but that’s to be expected (I’d hardwire it, if I could do so conveniently but don’t have wiring to doorbell at my door). The features are great and Ring’s app does everything you’d want it too. Another downside of Ring vs. Arlo is having to pay Ring’s monthly subscription package if you want the stored videos, but overall the Ring stuff works far better than Arlo (I have some of both product lineups and use them both regularly and prefer Ring). The ability to set different door chimes, volumes, motion alerts, etc - the flexibility of features is awesome. Motion detection by camera monitoring in the Ring products is tough to get right. It simply casts too wide of a net even if you tune down the motion zone or focus it on a small area, you constantly get alerts. I have not figured out how to refine that (or perhaps it’s just a product limitation - in any case the motion detection works REALLY well, actually almost too well — too sensitive). Awesome product, overall.
title: Works really well, convenience, works with the Ring

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jill
content: I love this doorbell. I like knowing who is outside before I open the door. The security of knowing who is at your door is great. The picture during the day is perfect. The night vision is great, but the problem I am having is that it fogs / mists up when it gets cold. I would have given this video doorbell and 5 star if it wasn't for that. Someone set off the motion sensor at 5:30 am and all I could see was an outline and I could not tell what kind of vehicle it was. Update: Almost 6 months later; I changed my 3 star to 1 star because now I can't hear through the app unless I put the bottom of my phone up to my ear and the wifi connection all of a sudden stopped working. It's really weak. If I run the "improve your wifi" it says it's fine, but when I open the camera it says poor signal and shows red signal while trying to load. Sometimes it won't load at all. I moved my internet box right near the ring and I'm still having the same issue. Right now it just says loading live view and won't even load. I tried everything to fix it and nothing worked. I even got a wifi extender. That did nothing. It worked for two minutes and it's back to having a poor connection. It's a shame because I bought this doorbell to notify me if my mom would go out the door and half the time it's delayed. A lot of good that would do me.
title: Being able to see who is outside both night and day.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kim&Chris
content: You are going to really fiddle around with the sensitivity on this...it has three zones which is nice and you can increase and decrease the distance. It picks up everything from a swaying bush to a car going by. You are given 30 days of free video storage that saves uo to two weeks then you have to pony up another 30 bucks a year to continue the storage. One cool feature on the app is that you are linked in to a community group that allows folks to share video and comments. You will see a lot of drunk people showing up at the wrong house and the usual animal sightings. During christmas time people were showing some suspect people looking at porches for package crooks. Battery life is so so in new england...purchased this in November 2019 and we had to take out and charge the battery on January 16, 2020. I suspect the battery may last longer in more comfortable regions that do not have snow.
title: Not bad

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rich
content: This is, hands down, the worst WiFi quality I've ever experienced. This device is approximately 25 feet from our router, with only the wall on which the Ring Video Doorbell 2 is mounted between it and the router. Otherwise, direct line of sight, both at the same height from the floor in the living room. Yet the WiFi signal has never been better than OK. I can successfully connect to the video feed about 1 out of 5 times. I've gone through all the troubleshooting steps Every WiFi device tested has full strength one inch from the Ring, and the bandwidth shows over 100 mbps up and down, one inch from the Ring (per instructions) We have a few IoT devices (thermostat, smoke detector, Alexa hardware, and a door lock) all of which perform flawlessly. The only potential interference remotely close is a refrigerator in another room (the kitchen), but none of the half-dozen devices tested (computer, tablet, phone, other IoT devices) are affected at all. Extra star for packaging, design, and app, but can't award 3 stars because the package as a whole is not Okay. Unfortunately, it took me a couple of months to install, so I discovered the poor WiFi performance too late for me to return to Amazon. I will be trying to pursue a warranty replacement or refund. UPDATE: 11/30/17 Impressed that Ring customer service reached out to help. I just replied, so I'll update this review if I hear anything back.
title: WiFi strength so bad, device is virtually unusable.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: John Morin
content: The batter stopped working as soon as we entered the fall season in southeastern Pennsylvania.  The battery life on the doorbell declined significantly. As of right now, it's January and the battery for the doorbell does not last more than a week. It's awful. I spoke to customer service and they said they would send me a new one, but THEY NEVER DID! A few days after my conversation with customer service I received a message from Amazon asking me to send back my current doorbell so I can receive a new one. Typically, I wouldn't mind doing this type of transaction, but if I do, I will have a hole looking into my house until I receive a new doorbell. Now I am stuck between living with a hole in my house until a new doorbell arrives or keeping the poor battery. The door bell is very poor quality...costs way too much to have a battery that works for a week between charges. Oh yeah and by the way...IT TAKES OVER 8 HOURS TO FULLY CHARGE!
title: Very poor battery life.  Not worth the money.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: M. Perry
content: Charged it, went through set up in the evening after it was delivered, worked fine.  Next morning it was still ok.  Installed it on my door frame, still working fine.  2 hours later....dead, doorbell stopped responding.  Removed, reinserted battery...dead, no lights, nothing.  Recharged battery, put it back in...dead.  Pressed setup button....no response.  Held setup button 15 seconds per troubleshooting instructions...dead.  My Ring Pro failed in a similar manner after about 15 months which is what prompted me to give them a second chance and buy this one.  I'm done with Ring and will be spreading the word.
title: 2nd Ring failure for me.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vicky
content: Delayed action. Delivery at my door today didn't pick up anyone walking up to my door and did not even get her face. It picked up as she turned to leave. Never saw her face. I got the alert and when I tried to open it from the alert, it froze. I went directly to my app and the motion did not show up for 6 minutes and then it took another 3 minutes before I could view it. For some reason it taped for 5:45 which included the delivery person walking to her car, sitting there for a few minutes, leaving, and then several minutes of just my own car sitting in the driveway. I even ordered the Chime Pro after the first day for an additional $50 and it doesn't help at all. I have never been able to speak to anyone through it. $250, don't waste your money. Get something reliable.
title: Don't Waste Your Money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Laurie Pitman
content: This was my only choice in the smart doorbell space, which I researched thoroughly -- there's no power at the gate where I installed this, so I needed the battery option. Don't be fooled by the marketing schma -- the battery charge lasts at the most 2 months. Just buy that 2nd battery when you buy the doorbell, because you'll need it. The video quality is sometimes sketchy, and sometimes video doesn't work at all, but it's on the edge of WiFi range, and the access point is behind a wood gate and a glass garage door, plus it's mounted on a steel post. The doorbell always rings on my phone, even if the video is wobbly, and the audio works pretty well, a lot better than the August doorbell I have at my front door (less than 6 feet from an access point), which never works and rings my phone sometimes 60 seconds after the bell at the door). I wish there was a way to tell it to ignore my neighbor's driveway, which runs right by my gate, because I get hits from their cars constantly. The smallest wedge-of-interest you can set also by default includes things 6'-12' past the area just in front of the doorbell, and that pulls in all the car traffic from my neighbors. But I have learned to ignore that. I'm hoping for better integration with Google Home. Amazon's announcement that they had bought Ring came 2 days after I installed. I confess I might have had second thoughts about the purchase if I had known that was coming. Unfortunately Google's Nest doorbell has to be hard-wired, which wasn't an option for this location. In general, I'd rate the Ring as "pretty good" and definitely an improvement over the August doorbell cam.
title: Buy the 2nd battery when you purchase

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RG0647
content: If you have an issue with the Ring 2 Audio at the device, call Ring Customer Support and let them know what audio problem you are having.  There is a bug in their software they are aware of that they can easily fix with an update.  The packaging is probably the best I have ever seen for an electronics device.  Every thing is labels so you know what to do with it.  The most difficult thing for me was drilling into brick.  I could only drill about half of the length of the insert.  It took about 30 minutes to drill 1/2 inch into the brick, for one hole.  I trimmed the insert to fit the hole length of each hole and that worked like a champ.  A word of warning, the brick attenuates a lot of the WiFi signal.  The Ring App has WiFi Speed tests, you might want to run that twice close to your router and also where the Ring 2 will be located to make sure there is enough signal strength.  You can get a Ring Chime Pro that is a door bell chime and also WiFi range extender if the signal strength is really bad.  The device is easy to set up.  The picture is in color and is very clean.  There are a lot of options you can play with.  If you stay in "Live View" it will eat up your battery faster.  The options you set up seem to be local to the device you set it up on.  So if you are using multiple mobile devices double check you settings to make sure you have what you want on each device.  There is a slight lag to call your video back from the cloud,  it will have any video and audio that transpired.  It is a really great little device, I have only had it a day and I am still learning.  If I come across any new tips I will update this review.  The Ring Door Bell Chime is a good addition, multiple selective rings and you can set the volume, it is WiFi and plugs into an electrical outlet.
title: Ring 2 Doorbell may have a software glitch that customer service will gladly update for you

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: six20
content: This thing is totally worthless, fist off the sound is so bad it always sounds like there is a 100 mph wind even when there is no wind. It was so bad you couldn't even understand anything being said through it. The video was ok but the delay in opening the app to see what was going on outside means by the time the app opens whatever was going on outside was long over. I thought it might be my phone because it was a couple years old so I went and bought a brand new phone, it made no difference. Even when using the alexa echo show it took way too long to be of any value. The motion detection is completely worthless. It constantly is notifying you that it detected movement. No matter how you adjust it it would continually pick up every car driving by, eventually you just have to turn it completely off. This thing was a complete and total dissapointment. Sending it back.
title: Don't waste your money.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ace Ducey
content: This product unfortunately fell short of my expectations. I have configured the proximity settings to only alert on motion detected close to the door. Despite this, the product constantly alerts on cars across the street. However, there have been several instances where people have come to my door, such as to place a flyer, and the doorbell missed this entirely. The reason I went with this product is because it is battery rechargeable, and I do not have any electrical wiring or voltage at my doorbell. The battery needs to be charged about every two weeks. Furthermore, every time the ring doorbell does pick something up, it picks up the tail end of the interaction. I've missed critical footage because of this. The cloud storage also costs an additional fee. The product is better than nothing though. In the future I may pay an electrician to wire my front door area, and replace the Ring Video Doorbell 2 with a different product. Side note, it's also shady that Amazon, which owns Ring, did not allow reviews to be written about this product for several weeks. I felt like they were stifling the truth about this product.
title: High false positives on cars across the street, yet misses people standing at my door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ENTITLED2OPINION
content: I installed this doorbell at my home in Georgia as I had installed an earlier model at my home in Florida where results have been fine.  This newer model in Georgia functions with one major exception.  The night vision is very poor quality. When an alert is detected after dark even at close range (less than five feet) you can see some movement but that’s about it.  When I then go on Live View there is nothing you can see at all beyond about five feet.  Night vision is one of the main features that I needed.  This Model 2 is a total disappointment in that area.
title: Poor Night Vision

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: G Scanlan Jr.
content: I read lot about the ring doorbell and finding it on sale for Prime days decided to jump on the opportunity. If you have a Nest device then setting up the Ring will be a breeze. The instructions, though not many steps, are well detailed. I replaced an existing doorbell with electric chimes so I was able to connect the Ring to the existing wires. The Ring includes wire extensions which were very welcome to allow room to connect the doorbell once the adapter was in place. Software set up of the device was easy. Download the software, create and account and then follow the steps to set up the device you are setting up, in this case a Ring Doorbell. The video is of good quality. I have a flag off my porch and the advanced setting allow you to change which sectors the camera monitors as well as how far out. The setup wizard worked fine but with the flag always waving the advance setting really helped minimize the notifications. If I could change one thing it would be receiving the notice that someone is approaching the door sooner. Some times when I get the notice the person is already at the door and not just walking up to it. This is a small issue as the Ring records the video which appears to start earlier than when you are notified. Network lag the cause, perhaps. I haven’t had any issues with missing packages so I bought this more as a toy. As a toy it excels compared to my expectations.
title: Works better than expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: The Shootist
content: I installed my ring 2 door bell this weekend. Followed the instructions and was up and running in 30 minutes including hard wiring my device. Had to call customer service only once before installation and they were great. So far my doorbell has worked as advertised the tricky part is getting the motion settings correct. My ring2 is 20 ft from the street and it picked up a number of cars passing kthe house early this morning. Cold morning so heat signature from vehicles may have tripped the sensor. Had to customize the motion sensor. I have a strong signal Rssi of -36 so getting good signal .l am please so far.
title: Great product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: dave2282r
content: Video does not respond quickly like advertised, you cannot answer the doorbell remotely as advertised.  The video constantly starts and stops does not run fluid.  I tested wifi connection and signal strength and all were within Ring's recommended parameters.  Tried adding a chime pro to boost signal but it did not help.
title: Does not work as advertised

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Irving O.
content: ---------------------- See update below ---------------------- This doorbell (Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video) was working just fine and then it suddenly stopped working. I noticed no events were being registered even though the device status was showing up as online and with more than 80% of battery. I did unplug and put the battery again but nothing happened. I removed the battery once again and charged it for about 1 minute, and the Ring started working again, I did call support over the phone but they only told me that it might be a battery issue and that I have to try with a new battery... Now this issue just happened again after no more than 5 hours, still the battery is showing up as 82%. The fact that support is neglecting a replacement (I suggested it) even though the product was purchased not even a week ago, is a big problem to me because you don't buy this kind of security devices to become a headache for you. You buy them to provide a sense of security and peace to your home and family. At this moment I do not see any added value to my household, but only an impact to me and my economy because I have to buy a battery hoping that it would be the answer, but if you can't trust the application device health status then what hope do you have? Not happy at all with this purchase. I will be reporting this issue once again to support and update you in case their response change Updated 10/10/2019 After posting this review and reaching out to the help contact, Ring team was effective to pinpoint the issue and long story short they sent a replacement which is working as expected, they asked me to send the faulty equipment directly to Santa Monica for further testing but all in all the device is now working as I want. My recommendation to anyone facing issues is to do not hesitate in contacting their support and be ready to explain thoroughly in order to get the best response from them.
title: [Updated - Working as expected] It stopped working.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Daniel Servansky
content: As a video doorbell it works well and was easy to install. The battery lasts about a month and takes a few hours to charge up. My biggest complaint is that the motion detection settings on this doorbell are highly lacking. Even with the detection turned down as far as it can go any car that passes by or person walking their dog will trigger it. The Pro has a lot more customization of the motion detection settings...
