Had Ring better described or showed the differences in the motion detection settings/setup I would have opted for the more expensive model. UPDATE 06/13/2019: Ring support reached out to me to help address the issue I was having with motion detection. Unfortunately, I had already tried their recommendations of adding the wedges without any improvement. Ring support offered me a few different options, one of which was to upgrade to the Pro device, which has much better motion detection parameters. The Ring Pro was on sale at the time of our discussion and Ring was willing to match the sale price on a new unit, so my Ring 2 was swapped out for a Ring Pro at no cost. I have not had a chance to set up the Ring Pro yet, but I appreciate Ring's dedication to customer service and support.
title: Great, if you're not near a road. UPDATE 06/13/2019: Excellent Ring Support

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark L
content: The basic setup was easy and useful, but the more advanced setup options make the product more effective and less spam alerts to your phone. The additional costs of $3.00 per month per Ring device for Basic Monitoring or $10.00 for the house is inexpensive but I think it should be included in Prime Membership for free, especially considering the membership continues to increase as Amazon maintains record profits. Update 2/24/19: I was not able to get my in home digital chime to work, with the diode installed both ways, and last night my home doorbell started going off on it's own constantly, I had to turn off the circuit breaker and dealt with it this morning, still no luck on getting the interior door chime to not ring with the Ring 2 installed. Any help would be appreciated.
title: Frustrating product cheesy subscription fees

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DBurk
content: Several problems with the Ring doorbell. 1.  Response of the camera is extremely slow.  When someone is immediately at your door, the app on your phone will take forever to open and by then, the visitor at your door is gone. 2.  There are no free plans to view your videos. The lack of a response time nullifies its use, then you can't go back and see who was there.  Camera is almost useless.... Funny how Amazon isn't even reaching out to give the canned response "this is not what you should expect"....I'll be trying to recoup my investment soon or throw it in the garbage.
title: Response so slow, visitor has left before you can answer with the app....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: motees
content: Well, after trying and failing to install my Skybell, which I bought and used successfully in Holland, I thought I’d give Ring 2 a try. Glad I did. Fairly easy to install, replacing my existing 18V doorbell button. Installed the resistor to get my digital doorbell to ring properly; OK. Both my regular doorbell and the Ring 2 doorbell ring fine when the button is pushed. Installed the angle wedge with the thickest part at the bottom so my low wall positioned Ring 2 tilts up a bit; nice. Tip: watch the Installation Videos, located in the app wheel menu, before installing for clarifications. With the set screw on the bottom, it would not be easy to pull device off wall; but it would be easy to smash the device off the wall with a hammer. I subscribed to the $30/year subscription so my videos (rings, motion and Live Views) would all be saved at the Ring cloud service (good for security) and my Ring 2 would be replaced if it is stolen; a very reasonable fee. I really like the Live View feature, allowing me to see my front door area from anywhere in the world that I have internet access. Being able to listen and talk is a really great feature—-in fact, one big reason I bought it. Sound quality is adequate. I had hoped I could turn off the Live View and just easily activate it whenever I needed it, especially remotely by cell access, but this is not possible: when you try to turn Live View on, a message appears saying that “Live View will be enabled after your next motion event.” So I just always leave it on now, Motion detection with iPhone message alerts is great, with nearby wifi, or remote cell. The image quality is very good in the daylight; fair at night. I thought it would be better though. The image is a bit dark at night even with 3 porch lights on. There should be a way to adjust the brightness. I had a concern in the first few days with the battery level dropping about 1% per day, and never increasing—-even though it is hard-wired. Maybe I should have followed the recommendation to fully charge the battery first. So I did that, and the battery level still kept droppng for about 4 days and then it finally started to increase (for the first time) and has stayed at 99-100% ever since. Seems OK now. I bought and installed 2 wireless Chimes (tech support corrected advised me that I did not need the extender feature of the Chime Pro); one for downstairs and one for the basement. Fairly easy to link both to the Ring 2. The Chimes can also be programed with different alert sounds, both ring and motion. So, I have 6 different ring sounds for Ring 2 and the 2 Chimes (ring and motion for each). Volume can also be adjusted for all 3 separately; very handy. And there are snooze options for doorbell and chimes, though unlikely I will use those much. Not surprising, I am quite glad I bought this Doorbell 2. I can now answer my doorbell remotely if I want to, communicate, and monitor my front porch live and with alerts. Suits me. Overall, better than I thought it would be, and no significant problems. So, 5 stars.
title: So far, so good

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Silvana
content: la camara no se ve muy bien. Se ve un contorno negro y la imagen no es muy nitida. Parece de baja resolucion.  Pareciera q no funciona bien o no es un buen producto. Tocan el timbre y tarda en avisarte al celular. Tengo muy buena velocidad de internet. Me ofrecen mandarme otro pero me estan dando muchas vueltas pidiendo acceser remotamente a la camara de mi ring y ahora me piden que les de una tarjeta de credito sin ninguna razon logica...
title: HD???

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chuck
content: With my original doorbell wiring having failed and it not being practical to replace, without extreme measures, I decided to go with a battery powered doorbell. At first I looked at simple doorbells only but decided to step up to Ring Doorbell 2, with it being battery powered. It was easy to get it set up and install and I even bought a second battery, to make sure I always had power. I liked it at first. The daytime shots were great and even the night time shots were pretty good. I integrated it with my Amazon Echos, so whenever someone pressed the button, all my Echos would notify me of someone being at the door and I could view it with my Echo Show 8. I really thought this was great. Where it began to drop the ball was on notifications. It would notify me quickly of movement, which was good. However, the first problem was the lack of being able to really customize the notification zone, other than a sphere pattern from the front of the camera. It would pick up cars driving by but when I reduced it, to avoid the road, the sphere coverage would also reduce the effect in areas I wanted coverage. so while I now wouldn't get notified of cars driving by, I also wasn't getting notified of cars coming up my own driveway. it was one or the other. The other issue was that when it did notify me of movement, because of the wake up time, that it uses to save battery, when I would look at the video clip, I would maybe catch the last few seconds of whatever triggered it. If something moved quickly enough through the zone, the camera wouldn't even pick it up. The next issue was battery life, it says the battery with last MONTHS, but if you actually use any of the setting that can help with the detection, it would chew through battery. I think I would end up getting a few weeks at most per charge. Just about every setting I picked, it would warn me about battery life. Not so good. So, after considerations, I decided to go with the Ring Pro instead and use the Ring Plug in adapter and ran that under my front shingles and into the garage and plugged it in there. Being powered all the time, the Ring Pro is much better are motion detection. It has customizable detection zones, so I can set the zone to avoid the road out front while still paying attention to my own driveway. It also records internally on a loop, so when an even does happen, the recording it save, starts several seconds before the event happened, so you get a complete recording of the event, not just the tail end. Pros Easy to set up Very good daytime picture Good nighttime picture Can run on batteries only Cons Detection zones are an expanding/contracting sphere only, so you are limited in what can be covered/ignored Because of wake up, it is slow to record motion, so recordings only catch tail end of event or miss them completely Battery life was nowhere near what they say it is. They say close to 6 months, but that it ridiculously inaccurate. It's more like a month, if you use any of the available options All in all, if you have no other option at all, other than battery, this will do OK. But if you have the ability to hard wire via house wiring or a plug in adapter, go with the Ring Pro instead, it is much more advanced and will do a better job. If you are not locked into the Amazon ecosystem like I am(Echos around the house), i would also check out the Nest Hello from Google. It has continuous recording and face detection, things the Ring Pro doesn't have but would benefit greatly from.
title: The "wakeup" time makes this not so great...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jay
content: Update: updating the review after the trial 30 days period is over. Note that Amazon return policy is 30 days. Ring also made their free trial 30 days. This way customers will not experience how the product work before the Amazon return policy expire. What happened now that the 30 days free trial is over is that the app is requiring me to subscribe. The subscription is $3 per device per month. This subscription is only to keep the videos on the cloud storage. Saying it again, to have cloud storage, you need subscription. Google provides 15 GB of free storage. Aren't  Ring (and Amazon) supposed to provide at least 1GB of free storage with a device that they sell? I find this as a minimum requirement for people to be satisfied from this product. For me, I have the choice either: 1- Pay Ring $3 per device a month indefinitely. 2- Use it as a regular bell or maybe throw it away. What I have done is that I installed an outdoor Samsung camera. The camera has SD card. It also supports sending prompt alerts (with images) to my own Google Account. So, technically, I am getting a much higher quality camera with local storage and free Cloud Storage for 15G. And the camera is about $80 less than the Ring bell. I would not recommend the bell unless it is only for the fancy look. During the first 30 days trial: In its best, I would say it is Beta product. I bought two of this bell for two properties. I connected them to the existing wires. What I don’t understand is that why does the battery drain even though the camera is wired. Overall, waiting for their app to get better. I was considering the full security system and cameras for my property. But now that I tested this, I would have to search for another provider for home security and cams.
title: Updated review after 30 days

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: FUSIONCHA0S
content: Back in 2016, I was getting into the Video Doorbells for extra security for packages.  After much review of Ring, Skybell, Nest, and August doorbells, I decided to purchase the Skybell.  I instantly enjoyed being able to get notifications when there was motion and when the button would be pressed.  The advantage with Skybell was that it came with free subscription.  Well... after 2 years of using the Skybell, i ran into many issues where the motion would not notify me or even pickup, wireless trying to connect to my network at home, and many other headaches which you would think be fixed after many patches.  I have my own server room and network system which I ran network throughout my house and even have a business hotspot near the Skybell, still had many issues with the Skybell doorbell. Moving forward...... I reviewed my options again as I was fed up with Skybell and still only had the same options today as they were 2 years ago.  After much consideration i decided to choose the Ring Doorbell 2.  They do offer a free subscription now, which is great, but you cannot review any motion or button press history events.  Of course this is just due to needing to purchase the basic plan for the cloud storage.  Even for $30 annually, the basic plan is still cost effective.  After using the doorbell in the trial version of the plus plan, I am planning on paying the $30 just because its cheap cost and I would rather have the events to review rather than just seeing the live view. Setup was easy (easier than Skybell).  The app loads quick and can edit motion detection's, alerts, and much more.  I connected the doorbell via hardwired to an analog doorbell.  The box comes with many customization options, tools, and took only 10 minutes to install. Testing the Ring doorbell worked perfectly and better than Skybell.  I installed my Ring doorbell with the provided wedges that came in the box.  I have a 20 foot driveway and the detection works so great that cars driving by alert me.  You can decrease the range of the motion in the app.  When there is motion, I can open the app from my lock-screen and only takes about 2 to 3 seconds before i can see the event.  The load times are very quick and faster than Skybell. Overall, I am day 15 in my trial and I am glad I decided on Ring.  The product is great, and far better than competitors.  Cost is ideal for those that do not want to pay hundreds each year on cloud storage like nest.  I would highly recommend Ring to others.
title: Best Video Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TyLittleTechGuyDad
content: This is an excellent product when it works properly. The video will break up and freeze when the wifi gets sketchy. The real issue I have is that the audio kicks in several seconds after the video has started. So if there's a plot about to happen on your home when the video starts, you'll see them talking, but won't hear anything until the sound catches up and you hear, "...and then we kill him." WHAT?! Seems like something that can be fixed with an update. And hopefully will. There are plenty of options to monitor your home (depending on what products you have from Ring) so you can get a lot of information even while away from home, including a live feed!
title: Video is clear....when the WIFI is good.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kimberly T. Millionaire
content: 1.  Battery life - 6 weeks after install the battery was dead.  6 WEEKS!!!  An additional battery sold WITH this package would have helped. I'm charging the battery today so.... yeah. Gotta keep the front door open because I don't have a door bell today and I'm expected a few people to come by. 2.  Too sensitive. - My phone was chirping, beeping and chiming ALL freaking day notifying me of every mosquito within two miles of my door (gross exaggeration of course but that is what it felt like). So much so, that when someone was REALLY at my door, I didn't even look at the notification, assuming it was just another car driving by. 3. Recharging the battery takes a million zillon hours (seriously - 24). That's just too freaking long. 4.  Does not connect well with my WIFI.  My router is probably 20 feet away from my front door, and often I get a message from Ring that the connection to WIFI is poor. (I have Verizon). Overall - I could have lived without this product and saved my money.
title: I Don't Like It.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Will S.
content: It was a fairly straight forward set up/install and no need to contact Tech Support, and they proudly proclaim how they are available for assistance which is a good thing.  It does all it is advertised to do, but remember that there will be a subscription fee of either $3 or $10 per month.  ($3 is for the basic, $10 for more features and if you want to add more Ring brand items.)  I opted for the $3 basic plan and I am fine with it so far, be sure to read what is covered in the two plans.  Depending on your Internet & wi-fi speed there will be a slight delay from the device to your smartphone, and you should definitely download the App to your phone.  For the most part the delay is minimal, not quite "real time" but pretty close.  The motion detect works very well and starts the video recording, I like the speaker/microphone built in so I can hear as well as speak to whomever is at the door.  (All recorded of course.)  After looking at several reviews of brands, including a very positive review for this one on CNET I opted for the Ring 2 and have not been disappointed.
title: Works very well, I would recommend this item

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SRNA
content: Update: I bought this thing in 2018 and it had NEVER WORKED AS A DOORBELL.  It never connects in time to actually answer the door. It is basically a 2 way surveillance camera. I upgraded both my internet service/speed, bought a chime extender, bought a solar battery charger for the device and it STILL does not connect fast enough to actually  function as a remote doorbell, which is the whole point I soend thia much money on a doorbell. Troubleshooting does nothing. And it basically is false advertising. not as simple as answering your phone when the doorbell rings. it often stalls trying to connect and lets the person at the door know that no one is home because you CANT answer in time. Ive NEVER had it work for answering the door with my phone.  it is good for surveillance and seeing who ramg your doorbell  with good zoomable picture and clear night vision. i upped my internet speeds to accomodate it, but its not working the way its advertised. also you NEED the doorbell  chime module if you expect to hear the door withiut your phone near you.
title: IT HAS NEVER WORKED AS ADVERTISED! (UPDATE)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tomalaya
content: This is a great device. I didn’t know what I was getting into buying it - it was an Xmas present for my wife. I thought I would be intimidated to install it, but it literally comes with everything you need except for a drill. I need to install in brick - it come with the masonry bit even!  All hardware was there, special brackets to fix the angle and position for our weird inlet porch, everything! The mounting options are incredible. Beyond that, it *just* works. We charged it, plugged it in, and it went.  We get fast notifications when there is motion, we see our packages get delivered. The remote doorbell from anywhere is an awesome thing, and the ring community alerts through the app are one of the best uses of social networking I’ve come across yet. We’ve run it now for several months without issue. I’ll need to invest and get more ring cameras and watch my house from all sides. These are really well done electronics.
title: Love the ring, easy to get running

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: C. Reed
content: This is an updated rating from my previous "1". The Ring Support team has been outstanding in helping me fix issues. I am still underwhelmed with the responsiveness of the system and the fact that some of the fixes require you to drill holes and put shims in place. Disappointed that their app doesn't show the area where the motion detectors are looking. Also disappointed in how expensive it is to store/view  video files. Ring costs as much per month as  Netflix or Hulu  and my videos are not nearly  as entertaining as Ozark or Handmaid's Tale. I have now paired this with a stickup cam and  a spotlight cam.  The three of these work well together to cover the outside of our house. The app has recently improved with some new features. So overall I am fairly happy with this setup.
title: Updated review thanks to help from Ring Support

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Charles B.
content: If you are like me, you probably often skip the one star reviews on the assumption that a lot of them, knowingly or not, were written about defective products. My unit worked fine for over a year (with occasional connection problems, but nothing to get worked up about). Sometime around the time the Neighbors app came out, though, things started to change. Let's back up a moment. Amazon has owned Ring for a while now. For a while, they mainly didn't get involved. Eventually though they jumped in, with the biggest marker being the release of the Neighbors app, an app that allows you to see and share neighborhood alerts. It's free, and doesn't require a ring doorbell or account, and worth taking a look at. But what came with was much worse. Consistent delays (often more than a minute) consistent trouble connecting to the live feed, and even occasional delays on the doorbell phone notification. You would think Amazon could handle it, but... it seems like it can't. If you read some other reviews, my experience isn't singular or even particularly rare. This doorbell has a lot of features, and when they work it's a great product, though at a fairly high price. When core features don't respond until more than a minute too late if at all, though, this product fails to be useful for its core function, or anything really.
title: Good when it works, but all too often useless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Physics Teacher
content: UPDATE: 1) The Ring 2 listing claims HDR capability. This is not true. After struggling for 2 months attempting to get the HDR option to function Ring 2 support finally told us the the RING 2 does NOT support HDR. 2) Unit returned: After being elevated to a supervisor (Michael) we informed him that the RING 2 listing on Amazon is misleading. The listing claims that the RING 2 supports HDR when in fact it does not. After some back-and-forth Micheal, he sent us an RMA# and a prepaid UPS label. Once we get the refund we shall update to that fact. We were so excited the day the RING 2 Doorbell arrived. Our neighbor has a RING doorbell and that had a substantial influence upon our decision.  If we had to do this from scratch we would get the eufy Doorbell. No hidden iCloud fees. [Once our 1 year subscription expires we will cancel and order the eufy Doorbell] Installation was a snap. Since we were replacing an existing doorbell the power supply was there. There have been many questions as to sufficient voltage to power the RING 2: Do not worry about that. The power sourced from the preexisting doorbell wiring only charges the batteries. Any trickle voltage will suffice. 1) The wire extensions supplied in the kit are very helpful when replacing an existing doorbell . 2) The wedge system is definitely helpful especially when the front door is four steps above walkway. 3) The easily adjusted Zone System is (should be) especially useful if your front door faces the street. However, we have been tweaking the RING 2 for over 2.5 months. We have yet to find the sweet spot. The Zone System seems to have negligible effect upon false alerts. Yes, it is an easy Zone System to adjust but unfortunately we have found virtually no difference in those adjustments. SLOW response time: By the time we get an alert the person(s) are already headed down the steps. We have a lightening fast WiFi system coupled to an extremely fast modem. The signal to the RING is Excellent. However, the response time is far too slow. Customer support is excellent. UPDATE: New software update just downloaded which only makes matters far worse. New update offers “People Only” recognition. An USPS postman was just here. The Ring 2 using the People Only recognition option did not “see” him even though he was standing directly in front of the camera. We immediately disabled the People Only option.
title: Disappointing! UPDATE: No HDR! Get the Eufy Doorbell instead!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jp. Spy
content: When I opened the package,  before installation, I already knew this must be an excellent product designed, manufactured and packed by a high quality company (with thoughtful funders and engineers etc.).  It takes care of the customers thoroughly: old and new customers, attaching to existing doorbell or not.  The best thing is to include the small screwdriver (set) for installation and it is also of  high quality.  Has spare screws in case you dropped the first ones.  After installation, it ran beautifully and smoothly.  My home got extra protection instantly and my home insurance got a minor deduction (credit back) in the premium too.  Friends admired what I have but were hesitating to buy the same once they learned about the monthly subscriptions.  I think everyone will choose Ring Video Doorbell if there is no cost on the basic cloud space subscription because there are some other products already offering this free cloud drive space forever.
title: Excellent product with a well-thought comprehensive package

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Geek cook
content: There are so many reviews out there comparing door bells and most reviews miss the point that most doorbells can't do a very simple thing: Press the button - a video of the door starts instantly showing who is in the front door. You have to ask Alexa to start the video. Although, again, this is common for the majority of smart doorbells, but I would expect both Ring and Blink (Amazon companies) would have this capability. Nest and Google Home have figured this out. So far, the only one I have seem proof it does, why can't Amazon?
title: No instant video on echo show, buffering issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Flavia
content: Not reliable. Many packages dropped whithout any image. I caught several timeS that it did not recorded something that happened rigth in front of the camera while I was watching. Had my settings changed with their support 3 times and tested and keeps missing incidents. It happened again today.  They blame on the settings again. App does not hold the settings you choose over the time eventualy changes back to minimum. But even the minimum should record something when is right in front of the camera. We can not trust. Records every single car that drives by but when I needed most, not a single image.  After a year and multiples attempts to fix I will have to buy another brand to replace. Waist of money and time.
title: Not reliable, I watched incidents that were not recorded.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tiger Rider
content: I purchased this along with the Chime product since I don't have existing wiring. Download the App before installing because there are good instructional videos available to provide guidance on install and setup. That said, the install and setup process is very simple and took around 5 minutes. The one problem that I did run into was related to my wi-fi network. I am have an Apple AirPort Extreme with a couple of AirPort Expresses. I set up the Ring next to the base station but installed it next to one of the extenders. I had to take the battery out of the Ring before it could 'find' the Express extender. Other than that it was completely seamless. I have been using the Ring for a couple of days. The street is about 80 feet away and the door is below street level. The motion detection was pretty good, cars driving down the street did not set it off. However I discovered that garbage trucks were setting it off so have adjusted the sensitivity.
title: Good Solution for Monitoring Door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: "Jake"
content: Install was quick and easy. Installing the app on my phone was the same. Being a 100% disable Veteran, I can't always jump up to answer the door, but with the Ring I don't have to worry about jumping up any more. I'm still working out some bugs like setting the motion sensors just right, but that's expected. For me, a great investment! Ira "Jake" Jakob USAF (Ret) 100% Disabled, Not Ready To Quit!
title: Quik, simple, and easy to install and same for the app on phone.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Aaron
content: Install was pretty easy. App set up was pretty easy. I have set up other security systems with aps before. Gave it a 2 star because you have to pay a monthly fee per each ring devise just to SEE and record ANY VIDEO. I did not read that at all anywhere, not that it is not stated, but i think that would be something very highly stated that you have to subscribe and pay monthly for EACH RING ITEM that you need for or to use as a security system. My other systems you do not need to pay for any thing. You can archive videos and save many videos weekly for free.
title: Ring doorbell v2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J-Reezy
content: Ring doorbell is a great addition to a connected home. Positives: - Super easy to install to an existing doorbell.  I also recommend this as it eliminates the need for a battery.  I am no handyman and the install only took 10 mins - Crystal clear camera day and night with a massively wide angle - App is easy to use and the UI is intuitive - Notification of motion detection is great - Intercom works well.  Easy to tell a friend or a relative too "Come on in!" Areas for improvement - Connection seems to be off at times.  Not related to my network as it is the only device that seems to suffer this issue - As it relates to above, if you want to immediately answer a ring when you are away, the app seems to have trouble connecting quickly unless you are on the local network.  As a result, you may not be able to "answer" a ring before the person leaves. - Not yet integrated into the apple home kit Overall, this is a welcomed addition to my connected home.  The challenges seem to be more with the fact that wireless communication and IoT is still developing.  I imagine things will only improve over time
title: Convenient and fun way to upgrade your old doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lizz + Michael
content: Listen to Beyonce. Buy this doorbell. We hemmed and hawed about buying a video doorbell. Do we really NEED one? We weren't sure. But now that we have it...we can't imagine not having it now. We chose to get this one instead of the wired one, because we didn't have a wired doorbell already at our house. It is a little sensitive, and picks up a lot of motion. However, that setting can be altered, but we like keeping an eye on things. We like it! It wasn't difficult to set up. Plus, we got the whole Ring security system, and we pay for the service, so it works well with the whole integrated system. The BATTERY LIFE could be better. And we could change settings to make it better, but it's not that bad. Here are some PRO-TIPS (after 1.5 years of using this) 1) Customize it as much as possible. Don't be afraid to mess with settings and notifications, and use some tape or command strips to test out the angle before you put it in the wall. 2) When the battery is low, it needs to charge overnight. So if you don't want interrupted use, then invest in a 2nd battery. 3) It does NOT come with a chime. Which doesn't usually bug us because it's just my wife & I, and it's connected to our phones, and makes them ring. But if your phones aren't accessible, or are shut off or in airplane mode, you won't hear anyone ringing the bell. (Or in our case...when my mom house sits for us, she has no clue when someone rings the doorbell) To fix that, you DO have the option to add guest access to the ring app, which we did this year. Or you can just buy a chime. We're glad we bought it!
title: If you like it then you should have put a Ring on it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: 516-Andrew
content: Was just about to review this, and the app locked up my phone? Reboot. Works fine. Without a subscription, it's basically a web-cam plus a smart door-bell trigger.  (It's a door-bell button that announces on every Alexa device in the house, when it is pressed.) Are you ready to pay $30 a year? If not, it's just a camera. Unless you subscribe, this does not record anything for you. Without recordings, if you do get a movement notification, by the time you turn on the app and request to view the camera, too much time has passed. (Hopefully, your 'visitor' is waiting at the door. Thieves do not.) I haven't heard a movement alert recently, but I have received some previously... Let's see if some system adjustments today will fix that. I'll assume 'device status' at 100% means it's not due to battery issues, but I'll check that anyway, also. Bell rings? After you hear the bell you can say "Show me (or hide) the front door" and see the cam on an Alexa Show (or turn it off) if you are sitting next to one, or you can open the ring app and open the camera to view it. (You could view any ~other~ camera the same way, as well.) You can talk to/hear visitors through the device, as well. Have not tried it with people. Just listening, I have only heard the wind. Ring saves a snap-shot only of what you view when you open up the camera from the app. I assume at the moment the camera was opened? Or I thought it did. I see none from today, while checking things and writing this. The one from the other day is no longer visible, either. So, without subscribing, it does not record ANYTHING, and you then obviously cannot review, save or share that which is not recorded. It has not helped me see when the mailman came, even during the first free month. I can take and text someone a video from my phone. This system should do the same. At least record (or give an option to record) video directly onto my phone/device directly, when I have the app running and i view a camera. There is too much greed attached to this system... Unless you understand it's also $30/year while you own it, or you know and accept the limitations it has, this may not be for you.
title: You basically have to subscribe... I have not, yet.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stephen Russell
content: The first problem you are going to run into is battery charging takes 5 hours.  No mention of using your fast charger.  The initial software setup was fairly easy and quick.  The next problem you will have is the most difficult; mounting.  Until you actually put it on the wall you have no idea what the camera covers.  It's all trial and error.  The biggest caution I can give you is DO NOT OVERTIGHTEN ANY OF THE SCREWS!  All the plastic pieces are very soft, if you use a bracket, the tiny screws will strip and loosen if you give them an extra half-turn.  The screw heads for the angle brackets bearly cover the opening and there are only two very thin screws that secure the entire bracket(s) to the wall.  I couldn't believe how flimsy the mounting is of such an expensive device. After mounting two angle brackets I still could not see the entire face of someone standing at the door.  Ring claims that's not really a problem.  REALLY! The next complex software issue is linking to Alexa.  I went to the Ring app on my phone and the first thing it asked for is a password.  Now you would think it was the Alexa password because it does not tell you what the hell password it wants.  Turns out, even though you are already in the Ring app, it wants you to re-enter your RING password, then your Alexa password. After I got past that issue, it said it was linked to Alexa.  NO!  I went to my Echo and asked who was at the front door.  Alexa says I don't know what the front door is, and it's not in the device list.  Turns out there is a not so clear task to add RING as a SKILL on Alexa. Took about three hours to install and link after the 5-hour battery charge.  After all that it works pretty well, but remember it's also $30/year for online access.
title: Not as easy as they advertise.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike Willis
content: Like the AT&T commercial says, it is "just OK."  Get the Ring Doorbell Pro.  It is much more useful.  This model has PIR motion detection.  The Pro model has video motion detection which has two important features this one does not: 1.  The motion detection is more customizable.  With the Pro model you draw on the screen the area you want to cover. 2.  Most importantly, with the Pro model the recorded clips start about five seconds before the motion is detected.  The camera has a buffer that is constantly keeping a few seconds in memory.  Then when it detects motion, it adds the previously recorded few seconds of video to the clip.  If you have never had a video camera this may not seem like a big thing.  It is.  This is absolutely important.  Makes your clips much more useful. The Pro model also has dual band WiFi which may or may not be useful to you.
title: This one works but get the Pro model instead.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jesuis
content: I had to update my whole router system in order to access the doorbell.  Then the first battery (totally charged) only lasted 30 days, and I am on a private drive away from the street.  Installer didn't leave the screwdriver for security screw, so I had to order one.  Now I'm trying to sign up for the Protection Plan and I can't reach Ring by phone or computer.  Also, I understood that Amazon Echo Show was compatible with this product, and I can't get it to work.  Spent hours on this and called Amazon support.  This has been a painful transition and it's almost too late to go back!  I hope I can resolve these problems soon or I'm going back to a door knocker!!! Updated 4/25/19 The first installation was done by a "professional" sent by Amazon.  Ring.com Support responded to me and eventually sent me a replacement unit.  I easily replaced it myself, and after some tweaking with Alexa, now it's all working properly and is compatible with Alexa Echo Show.  It will take me a while to get used to it.  Ring Support was very good and responsive... I recommend calling them before driving yourself crazy with Amazon Support.
title: Update

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hayleigh
content: I had high hopes for this doorbell. Ive heard great things but it just doesn't work well for us. Installation was easy enough. But it frequently misses movements I've messed with the settings several times. I can get all the way into my house with no notification. I've had packages delivered and no notification. The tip on the iceberg was when the doorbell failed to connect to WiFi for 24hrs. With no notification. I would've liked to know there was an issue with the connection. I no longer feel like it's providing a layer of protection since it doesn't say anything when there is an issue. I also will add I don't have an issue with WiFi anywhere else in my home and have tested the wifi using the ring app and it had good numbers. So I really don't understand the issue.
title: Really disappointed in lack of notifications

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jhon
content: I have had a lot of issues with this doorbell. Try to contact tech support......It s a joke. I usually have great experiences with Amazon products. The software needs to be improved. Most of the time I want to see a live view of my front door, I get a black screen.  Also, I wanted to be able to shut off the Alexa notifications when I am home. I was able to shut off the notifications on that show up on my cell phone but not Alexa. So I contacted Tech support and after 15 minutes in a chat, the guy told me to read the instructions on my Alexa app and i should be able to figure it out on my own. He did not know how the Alexa portion worked. (But I am supposed to) Very poor tech support. I would think I would be able to go to the ring app and with a simple swipe, suspend the alarms until I choose to turn the back on. (Like I want to take a nap or sleep in) I can suspend the motion portion for up to two hours, but not the ring portion, but again, I think that is only for the cell phone and not for Alexa. There should be a simple command to Alexa to suspend alerts until I tell it to start them again. Maybe you can do this, but tech support was unaware of it, so I just don't know.  I wish I had purchased a different brand and it is now too late to return it. Maybe they can update the software to fix the black screen and to be able to turn off the Alexa notifications with one swipe or command.
title: Lots of issues and tech support is hard to reach.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: P. V. Cleave
content: My wife wanted a video doorbell so when she was in different parts of the house she could see who was at the door. I had previously installed my regular doorbell and had the required power, so I was happy I would not need use battery. I did the measuring of current and no matter what I set it to, it would not work. The unit works with battery, but I do not want battery. I cannot send it back because I have had it too long. I waited to install because I doing some work in that area, and did not want to risk damaging it. I Decided to set it using the battery option. However, the quality of the material is so poor. I was using the angle bracket. I was amazed that the screws that came with it barely hold it on there, in one area of the plastic the screw can fall right threw. I thought there must be washers or something to keep it secure, nothing. I did get it attached. However, I can't get the unit attached. The srews keep popping out. I cannot get one to go in. The quility of material used is very poor. I wanted to contact Ring, but the one manual I have had no phone number. I am not a fan of their products or service. Ring is not a company I plan on doing business with. I do not understand why they make it so hard to contact them for service. I have been setting up other video devices around my house. I have found one product that is very cheap that works nicely. It is not a doorbell, so I know all is not lost.
title: Wired Doesn't work at all and poor quality material used.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jon Shirley
content: GOOD LUCK getting this to work in time to use the audio function.  I've had this almost 9 months and have not once been able to get the function to work in even a remotely timely manner. And don't forget that you have to pay a monthly subscription fee for this thing to actually work as advertised (it still won't). Video rarely saves correctly, notifications are almost always too late to be relevant (most never make it my way). If I could do it again I would have absolutely gone with a different solution.
title: Not once has it worked as advertised

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kaktovik
content: Why do they make these so wide?  The only option that is narrow as my door jam is the 2nd gen pro for $199 as opposed to this for $139 at the time of my purchase.  All the newest gen 3 doorbells are even wider and so are a non starter. Biggest problem:  Almost always when I go to check or it detects something it can not connect to my WiFi until much later.  Boy, I hope I never have an emergency which is the only reason I bought it.  My router is about 7 years old or so, but it was the top of the line at the time with its accompanying expander and is capable of hundreds of Mb/s WiFi.  I take my cell phone to the doorbell, outside my house and can watch a full stream movie.  When I run the test requested by Ring I measure 10+ Mb/s up and down when they only need 1.5.  There own test says I have a strong signal.  As I read how to resolve this about the only thing left is to replace my routers with a new set that is designed to better handle many simultaneous connections.  I am assuming and hoping this is the problem and so I just today ordered the newest top of the line Netgear Mesh WiFi router (MK2).  When it becomes available I will add another expander as well.  This is designed to handle modern homes with up to 25 simultaneous smart phones, tablets, smart TVs, etc. I will provide an update if this did or did not resolve this problem. Other than that I have a 1/2 acre lot and am well off of the street but it will pick up every big truck going by.  Luckily I am in a somewhat rural neighborhood with little traffic on my street with no through traffic so I can deal with that.  There is the ability to adjust this sensitivity down but I have not chosen to do so.
title: Not working properly (yet I hope)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jgg
content: Even though amazon sold this packaged with a dot, it does not really work with one. I enabled the ring software and linked it as a skill to my alexa network. I was able ot enable the doorbell ring and motion detection on the page for the doorbell. It did not work. I talked to the ring people, and the first guy first said echo/ring communication was 'problematic', said the echo was not on their list of devices that work with the ring2. I then talked to a second tier ring rep who was clearly not at all familiar with the issue, but said she had seen the doorbell chime work on the dot, but that you cannot yet use the dot as an intercom station for the doorbell (that it is 'planned for the future, but not yet working). Now couple that with the fact that unless you pay ring a monthly fee to see the video from the bell, its a pretty useless product - with Amazon owning ring and pushing this product (and bundling the two) you'd think they could easily give you a free account to save the last month of video on one of their servers. So in short, Amazon seems to have oversold the ring2/ Alexa connection, without getting the Ring (owned by amazon) staff familiar with what it can and can not do. So, DO NOT BUY THE RING 2 unless you only want to get doorbell announcements on your cell phone. I guess its OK for that. but the connectivity with other devices (Even laptops) is "problematic" at best, and not working at worst.
title: does NOT work with Echo dot (yet) no matter what they claim

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: sdjlc
content: Ok, I've been unhappy with this since I installed over a year ago.  BUT I've learned some things which will HELP YOU 1) Those commercials where the homeowner yells at someone before they even get to the front door are BS.  This thing isn't fast enough for that.  For instance, by the time you get an alarm, and a picture, you'll just see the mailman go around the corner. - Don't expect that early warning kind of functionality. 2) The pictures from the camera on your phone are poor.  No matter what Wifi access point I install, no matter how close it's not really useful on the phone . BUT - long in to your RING account online you can use filters and see much better pictures. 3) You're probably going to have to add a wifi extender.  I don't like these much because they rob bandwidth to talk to each other but, you won't get good pictures without it. 4). There IS a way to get good customer service.  My call was going south fast talking to someone who's first language wasn't English and, apparently, only had basic checklists.  Each time I said something she'd try a different checklist.  However, I asked (nice) if "there is someone there for whom English is a first language) and was transferred to someone who not only understood me better but actually had product knowledge.  I I still don't have all the problems worked out but my most recent tech support call gives me hope..
title: READ THIS REVIEW - not quite as bad as I thought

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Miodrag M. Popovic
content: So we set it up because we order all our Christmas stuff on-line and package theft is real and annoying. Got the echo to go with it, and have the phone app. 1. DIdn't realize you need a subscription after you buy the unit. That was annoying 2. That commercial where you can talk to someone who is at your door? Nah. Half the time the thing tells me there's someone at my door AFTER they've walked away. There's no way you could yell "Hey! Put that package down!" in realtime, EVEN IF you're ACTUALLY at home.  We have good wifi but the lag time can be up to a minute if I'm down the street at the school 3. The thing doesn't alert you it's battery is going, so it's really easy to forget you need to charge the battery and you just notice you haven't gotten notified that you've gone out your front door in a while. If you're overworked and distracted like me, that could take 3 days, maybe more. Not kidding. 4. The instructions to take the front cover off to GET to the battery? BAD design. You'll definitely break a couple fingernails and, if the battery's not DEAD, there'll be nice recordings of you inventing new swearwords as you're trying to pry that @$#@#$ cover off to get to the battery. THAT SAID, we had a weirdo wandering around 'selling' solar but people noticed she was trying to open doors, didn't have business cards and was generally acting a little odd, so when she did show up to my house I recognized her, let her know that her face and odd behavior was noted all over Ring ...and she left the area after that, so ... that was good. Does it keep theft down? I didn't have any packages stolen this year. Is that because of ring ? Maybe. Maybe we were just lucky. Maybe a little of both.
title: Eh. It's okay. It's just ok

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hydrad
content: Apparently you can buy a device for about 20 dollars that will take the Ring system down.  It’s a small transmitter that interrupts your WiFi signal.  All the Ring devices communicate through your WiFi.  Since the Ring company forces us to store all our videos in the cloud, by interrupting the WiFi signal, the video can’t be sent up to the cloud, so it eventually gets recorded as a blank video once WiFi is restored. Porch thieves just carry the transmitter with them as they walk down the block stealing packages.  All ring devices (or any WiFi connected devices) within a 200 foot radius of them are automatically disabled.  The Ring devices will still detect motion, but since WiFi is disabled, they can’t save the video to the cloud. This came to my attention recently when I had a package stolen from my porch.  The ring video doorbell 2 just showed a 30 second blank video with no sound.  A video 10 minutes prior to the blank video show the package being delivered.  Another video about 15 minutes after the blank video show the package gone.  The ring device was not covered, or It would still have the background noise which is quite noticeable in all other videos.  The blank video is totally silent.  I have reported this to customer support and they reviewed the videos from my doorbell and concur with my assessment.  They said they would pass the problem over to their programming section. This now makes the ring devices totally worthless for any kind of security purposes.  Any 10 year old kid can disable the system just by buying one of these small transmitters.
title: Ring Can Be Easily Disabled By Porch Thieves

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MCStro
content: This is a great product, but I'm not even sure it will work for my situation. Two situations that are problematic for this: One- if you have an intercom doorbell system.  Two if you have a front door opening right onto a sidewalk. I wish they would mention more upfront information on installation and best placement scenarios.  People who want the wired-to-existing doorbell scenario need to know that anyone with intercom systems will have install issues. Also, people with front doors that open right onto a sidewalk may have tricky (at best) install & operation issues with many" false positive" triggering because the smallest perimeter is 5 feet- which takes up almost a whole sidewalk width.  I thought the product package said it would have 3 wedges inside, that can lower the "eye"  by 5-10- or a total 15 degrees when all 3 are combined.  My package had only one 5 degree (lowering eye) wedge and 1 corner (angle sideways) wedge.  I probably need all 15 degrees (combining all 3 wedges) to avoid false positives on motion that can seriously wear down battery and unnecessarily alert you. Since I ordered it from Amazon site, I guess I now have to go to the actual Ring site to order more wedges.  What a pain, and further delay on install- and it may not even work for my situation.
title: Great product, but missing pieces & shd have better install info upfront b4 buying

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Justin
content: I've wanted a Ring for quite a while, and this last Cyber Monday sale essentially screamed out "if you don't order it today, you're dumb." First, let me take you through why it took me so long to get one. It wasn't because of the price, it's because my existing doorbell is a hard 90 degrees to my front door. I didn't know angled wedges were a thing, and I wanted to keep the bell hardwired, so I was afraid of the angle, not being able to see everything I wanted to. Because ideally to keep it hardwired, I'd want someone to re-wire the doorbell to next to my front door so I had a straight-on view. Considering how this wouldn't be a traditional wire relocation like moving a network cable, but rather using brick, I was a bit scared of even asking for a quote to do this. But then I saw that the Ring came with 2 angle brackets, so I took the plunge. As you'll see from my photo, using the corner angle bracket completely eliminated my concerns while keeping it in the existing hardwired location. There are a couple of things I don't like about this, however. First, it's 2.4 GHz WiFi only. That's quite a bit 'in the past' in my opinion. If your doorbell is a significant distance from your WiFi router, you may have connectivity issues. I don't have this issue, but the video quality definitely is sub-par compared to what is advertised. Next, you have 30 days of a free trial to be able to see your previous video alerts before you have to...yes...buy a subscription. I already have a subscription for Nest for a camera on my house, now I have to subscribe to another ecosystem to access old videos? Not cool... That being said, if Ring's security cameras have 5 GHz capability, I'd consider killing my Nest subscription and replacing it with Ring's. Have you ever installed one of Nest's outdoor cams (not the IQ)? It's absolutely absurd with multiple built-in potential points of failure. There's a reason why I only installed 1 of the 2 Nest cams I got as a gift. If Ring beats them in this regard, I'll happily replace it and go 100% with them.
title: Impressive, but could definitely be improved upon

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nick
content: Had this for a while, it stopped working when I changed my modem. Called customer service, could not get through to anyone because they asked for a code, I signed in got a code, that did not work. Finally got a customer service, who tried to get me to sign in my app after she apparently reset it.  But by now I was kicked out of the app and could not sign in despite multiple tries with sane password and resetting it at least 4 times. Finally the new password worked, but when I went to retrieve the code on my email, I was kicked out of my app again, again it would not accept my password. I had to turn sign in my email account via laptop, finally entered my app. The customer service rep now wanted my to unscrew the bottom of the ring device to reset. But I had no screwdriver that small. The original packing 2 years  I did not have any more. So now they are sending me another screwdriver, and I can expect to waste another 1 hour on the phone. The rep told me I was not the only person who was having this problem, there were many others. Best to totally avoid the product, the security and set up is such a hassle and a total pain. I spent at least 40 minutes on the phone and web trying to get this synced to my new modem, still could not get my new modem linked and expect to spend another half an hour once I get the screwdriver. The device is so so, often the notification are delayed. Avoid.
title: Best Buy another product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: P-man
content: The picture quality is good and I can watch the front door and street. Good motion detection. Easy install and setup. I got the power supply and the external bell. Works fine. Some downsides to this 1) The subscription for recording. No news. I decided to buy the camera, knowing this. Just means that I cannot record, as I'm stingy. 2) The connection... I have mesh network and about 50 years from the access point to the bell (a door between). Still, often I cannot connect. So when I get "motion detected at your front door", I need to go to the door, to check. Often the app just won't open the camera. Restarting the (windows) app sometimes works. 3) No constant viewing. When connected (and since I don't dare relying on the "live view" to succeed), it only shows 10 minutes. Then I'm blind. So if I'm waiting for package delivery and need to make sure that they don't just drop a not, without ringing the bell (happens), I will need a different camera solution. So perhaps not really worth the money... Though I don't regret. I just hope that Ring will start delivering on customer wishes.
title: Working occasionally

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CARROLL ASTEMBORSKI
content: Set up was a snap!  Existing doorbell made that aspect of installation easy too. Have had two incidents take place right outside my home and since I was in the back of the house I was totally unaware.  The most recent involved fire trucks and the barn across the road from me burning to the ground.  I do have quite good hearing but was unaware until my husband asked a neighbor about the barn and he told him about the fire and said people were out watching and would you believe passers by were actually parked in my driveway.  I am able to see the whole area now at a glance.  All in all very happy.
title: Money well spent!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike Loch
content: Odd how the company can put out one product that works great then put out a piece of crap like this.  I have been on board with Ring since the beginning.  When we moved to this new home 3 years ago I purchased the Ring Pro (as an upgrade to the original Ring we left at the old house).  Due to constant disconnections, I spent several hours on the phone with Ring support (which used to be good) and we figured out that our frequent power fluctuations were like the cause.  So on their suggestion I purchased the Ring 2 as it is battery powered and since I have it live wired, the battery is always charged.  It worked well for about a year, then on the last firmware update it became totally unreliable.  Back to hours on the phone with Ring support.  This time they were not so good.  He had me reconnecting to the WiFi over and over expecting a different result.  Only when I disconnected it from the doorbell wires and took out the battery and reinstalled it as totally new did it work again.  Now 2 weeks later it is back to not catching motion or even someone ringing the bell.  It has full power and a strong WiFi signal but will not connect to live view or even catch motion. How can my two stick up cams work almost perfectly yet this piece of crap does not? About ready to jump ship and go to Arlo or Nest. Instead of texting his mistress or playing around with his Blue Origin rockets, maybe Jeff should spend some time and money on the companies he has bought up.
title: Buy something else...this the worst tech since Windows Vista

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Keely
content: Update: i originally gave The Ring 2 a 1 star review. After posting my review i was contacted my am Amazon Ring Technician to help me fix the problem. After hours of helping us with our product and router, exchanging our product, and ultimately fixing our issue, I’m happy to give Ring a 5 star review. The product works great now, despite not being initially compatible with our modem, and has given us instant, clear video review of our front porch. The customizable doorbell sounds on the Chime Pro is just a bonus! I was so excited to buy the Ring 2 after seeing the reviews.. but it's not worth the time or hassle! User friendly is the opposite of how I would describe this product. The product worked great right off the bat, but like a lot of people have said, once the 30 day trial expires (and you don't purchase the plan) it doesn't record anything again. It was always too slow to load on my phone and eventually just said "poor connection" every.single.time. Then the first time I had to charge the battery I took it out, charged it, put it back in.. and now it won't connect to the wifi. After hours of troubleshooting and every suggestion on the Ring website it still won't connect (hard reset, resetting the modem/router, checking wifi speed (10x what it needs to be), and connecting other devices to the wifi to make sure it works) so needless to say we're not satisfied customers. Too bad we can't return it through Ring directly because we ordered it on Amazon..
title: Updated from a 1 star review thanks to customer service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brian Taylor
content: Purchased this product as a Christmas gift. The ring has been nothing but a problem since it was installed.  The battery dies very quickly even though the device does not get a lot of activity.  Every third time the ring is checked in live mode the video is black and every 3rd -4th alert, the video is black.  The device has been updated and currently says it is up to date, yet the video is still black. I have the original ring and deal with the same black screen every 10th time so I thought the upgraded device would be better. For the money I could have purchased 2 of the original Ring.  Oh, and tech support doesn't know what the issue is, but blamed it on the Wi-Fi, easy excuse to use.  My exchange window expired so I am stuck with a $200.00 tempermental "security" camera that works when it wants.  I won't be purchasing another Ring device, especially now, their are many other camera options on the market.
title: I would have purchased a different camera.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: william
content: I have a love/hate relationship with this. The installation was surprisingly easy and that is a big plus for me. I am not a techie who loves new toys. I like the video log of former motion events as the video is very clear in both daytime and night when I review my “motion log”. (There is an outside light at night.) I turned off motion alerts. My neighbor works different hours and the alerts kept waking me up.  But the reason I purchased ithis was to see who was at the door before opening it.  And talking to that person before I open the door. Sadly, the app takes way too long to open for that to happen. Seriously too long. They are gone before the app works. I added the Chime Pro. It has done nothing to boost my signal or speed of access. So it is useless to decide about opening my door. I have decided to keep it for awhile but I’m not a “dedicated happy user”.  If the video log is what you need, this does a great job. But those ads of real time scaring off crooks?  Not gonna happen.
title: Good clear video record of former images but cannot do real time imaging

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ryan Brown
content: Ring sells itself as being a way for you to answer the door using your phone rather than in person. But it's not actually any good at that.  If I'm at home and on the same wifi, it generally takes about 15 seconds to come up. If I'm out and on mobile data, it can easily be double that. If I'm on someone else's wifi it's completely hit or miss; frequently Ring's servers just don't load. That's likely due to firewall rules, but it still makes the service useless. Which leads to the real issue: you get 0 history if you don't pay the $3 per month per device subscription fee. There's no "view the last 3 videos" or "store videos for a few days without a subscription." It's all or nothing. What's even more infuriating is that you can't direct the recording to a local storage option. That makes sense from a business perspective (they need their $3) but absolutely no sense from a technical perspective. Similarly, you can't patch in a local home automation system like Home Assistant without paying the $3 a month fee. This might work fine for someone who wants a single device and doesn't mind paying someone else to do the maintenance. But if you want to actually own your own system, I'd avoid it.
title: Not actually useful as a real time video link.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ramon Borquez
content: This is a great doorbell camera and intercom system. I have had no issues with WiFi connection or using the app. The set up was completely easy and the all directions came in the box and on the app. The motion detection is great IF you manage to put it in the right spot. The only issue I have is that I live in an apartment and have a stairwell going down. I accidentally placed it a smidge too high so the motion detection does not catch movement if someone ducks really low or if someone is short like my wife. Granted, it will still record them standing up or when they get close enough to the camera. The main reason I got this is because there has been a huge increase in package thefts in my area. I have had multiple packages stolen and the same goes for my neighbor across the hall. Since putting this camera up, we have had no issues. The only problem I have is delivery men or women tend to like putting my packages at the very edge of the steps or a few steps down...why you might ask? I don't know. BUT I am still hopeful that my ring may one day manage to capture some footage just in case I do have another package stolen. I recommend getting some really strong duct tape or 3m strips to first test out the view your camera will be getting upon your placement. I do not have a doorbell so I had to drill holes into the wall. Dry wall is a breeze..but stone? Not so easy and management wouldn't like seeing multiple holes in the walls so I am stuck with my placement. Definitely find a way to test everything out yourself before drilling any holes. The screws that came with it are strong but the ring can be torn off. Warranty covers it though and whoever does manage to steal it would be unwise. It has GPS and a serial number so yeah..not really an issue I would worry about. The intercom system is great too. Sound comes through very clear and the view is real time. The night vision and view it gets even with sunlight directly facing it is great. You do have to sign up for a subscription service if you want to have footage saved otherwise you just a motion sensor camera that will notify you of movement. I think it is 30 dollars a year. Very cheap and well worth it in my opinion. To each their own though. The battery life depends on your settings and usage. Mine is set on very sensitive for motion detection and I get a lot of activity but the battery still lasts me 3 weeks or so. I highly suggest you buy an extra battery and store the special screwdriver tip in a place you won't lose it. Overall, this camera has done its job and has helped me feel more relaxed with getting packages dropped off. This does serve more than just protecting mail. You are welcomed to a community watch group in your area of other fellow ring owners where you can post suspicious activity that was caught on camera. At first I did not care, but I check what is going on in my area almost every day. If I had to ask for something to make it better, it would be for more bumpers so you can change the angle of the Ring's view. It came with one that helped changing the angle of my Ring but it isn't enough for my stairwell. If I had just one more or possibly one that had a higher angle it would be perfect.
title: It's almost perfect!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vince Neil
content: Very good build quality. You can tell the company is very serious about quality based on everything you find in the box and it's presentation. Very good app. Excellent video quality. The length of time between getting the notification of a doorbell press and you being able to converse with the person is a little bit too long - the biggest annoyance of the doorbell. The doorbell tells me that it's wifi connection is weak even though the system works fine. The motion detection is absolutely useless. Even with the detection zone set to minimum and set to "light", we get a notification when a car goes by. Oddly, it doesn't always report a person approaching the door. We had to turn off motion detection. The technology to do this is simply not in this doorbell. Overall, a very good doorbell. I would probably buy it again. I bought mine at a warehouse-type store for a much better price and it included a ring chime (doorbell) to plug in wherever you want to hear the ring as well as a free year of saving videos. Now that the year is up, I can't save any videos including the video that was just recorded a minute ago when someone rang my doorbell. So, being at work, I can't see who's at the door when they ring the doorbell unless I answer the ring in realtime with my phone - which I never do because I'm at work. To view any video, you have to subscribe to their service, with "basic" running at $3 a month. Without that, it's more of a glorified doorbell. Just keep in mind that you need to be a monthly subscriber to really utilize this doorbell.
title: Great doorbell with a couple of issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jake
content: Parden the view.  I know I'm not the richest person nd don't have the nicest looking house or yard on the block , but I don't care I just wanted you guys to see how good the picture is on this video doorbell.  I love to write honest reviews and I 100% reccomend buying this. Mine has no lag,  and was very easy to set up and get going.  Oh BTW I set it up myself and trust me I'm no professional.
title: I guess just read the review

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MICHAEL W.
content: I wasn't sure I wanted a video doorbell, so I decided to limit my investment and buy a Ring Doorbell during the holiday discounts, and I couldn't be happier.  Due to the shape and height of my front porch, I needed to use both 'wedges' to aim the Ring camera down and right, and yet the installation was still very simple.  I also needed to adjust the detection area (using the app) to prevent cars on the road and people on the sidewalk from causing alerts to be sent.  All of this was easily accomplished, and now I have complete peace of mind when I am away from home and/or have something delivered and sitting on the porch.  I did not previously have a powered doorbell at my front door, and so I had some concerns about battery life and how often I was going to need to recharge the Ring battery.  But I am happy to report that after operating continuously for over 6 weeks (with motion detection on and getting one or two alerts per day), the Ring battery level is still at 81%.  One day I might decide to run power to the Ring device, but in the meantime, the battery life is exceeding my expectations by far, and it is not turning out to be any sort of inconvenience whatsoever. PS - I bought a refurbished model for my backdoor to save some money, and it is working equally as well as the new unit on my front door (including picture quality, motion detection, and battery life).  So if you want to save a little money, I also highly recommend the refurbished model.
title: Easy Installation and Total Peace of Mind

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: IT Admin
content: Doesn't work in a useful way with Alexa Show 5 package. Doesn't ring on the device. Doesn't display notifications on the device. Can't be setup without a cell phone or tablet. Pages you are directed to for setup display the wrong instructions for the Alexa model I had. This is after the device updates for 20 minutes. My $25 wireless doorbell works every time when you push the button. The ring is intermittent on all devices. It's not because of Wi-Fi as you can open the live view and it pops up right away. Away from the device live view takes a longer time to load but it loads. The motion sensing alerts you quickly on the phone and computer. Not sure you are able to view anything but live view on the Alexa device because I see nothing that indicates you can. So to view the Ring on the Alexa 5 I have to use my psychic abilities or randomly assume someone is at the door and say Alexa show Ring. There is no way to know anyone is there without a cell phone or computer as far as I can tell. The microphone and speaker are not that great. Video severely degrades in the dark. Even with a porch light above the camera. My cheap security cameras would display clear color video under the same lighting conditions. Especially when your 3 feet away. Facial features were not clear when the sun went down. Reminded me of some of the very early cell phone cameras. I will mess around with this a bit more but most likely its going back. Expected a bit more based on the reviews. and quite frankly I was a bit embarrassed giving this to my mom as a gift.
title: Requires a cell phone or tablet. Does not give Alerts or Rings on Alexa

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Donald Fuller
content: Seriously, I love this doorbell.  I work from home in my basement and could never hear the doorbell.  We had an existing chime with one ringer and a wireless battery operated button on the front porch.  No idea why it never got wired, but the estimate to run the wiring is nearly $300 so I looked at battery operated bells.  I have Amazon Echo's throughout the house, and decided to give this a shot.  It takes 4-6 hours to fully charge the battery so I recommend getting an extra battery (WORTH IT!).  It took me a few hours to figure it out, remove the old one, install the new one and configure the Alexa skill so it's a mini-project.  Now when someone so much as steps on our porch, 8 Alexas all around the house say "Motion detected at the front door".  And it rings everywhere, so we always hear it.  I have successfully answered the door a few times while away, and I subscribed to the affordable video storage service.  With all that said - I can't quite give it 5 stars because I'm still struggling with network connectivity issues.  The problem is most likely my home network which may not be fair, but sometimes when I try to stream the camera it won't connect.  Despite that, I would absolutely buy this product again.  If you don't have an Echo, you probably would want the smart chime that they offer.
title: I love this doorbell (who says that?)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Elizabeth K.
content: I had a Pro that I hardwired to my existing doorbell for about 2 years now. We had trouble after trouble with it, but once Ring replaced it (it was a dud) we haven't had any issues. So, we decided to invest in another one on our side door. We didn't have the capacity to install another doorbell transformer. We already have a Ring Chime, so we decided to go with a battery powered Ring doorbell and just link it to the Chime. It's been installed for about two weeks now. The battery is only 1/4 empty and it works so much better compared to my Pro minus the ability to customize motion detection. We're right next to a busy street, so I assume that's why our battery doesn't last as long as others, but I'm satisfied that a full charge will last about a month. I purchased another replacement battery so that I can charge that one before the other dies and swap them out. I'd recommend this over a Pro any day as long as you don't need to customize motion zones.
title: I actually like this one better compared to my Pro

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Augie
content: I'm really disappointed in this doorbell.  It is often random as far as how it picks up motion outside of about 5 feet of the doorbell.  Sometimes it will detect a person outside that range but more often not.  I've adjusted the range in the app several times with no luck.  The only thing increasing the range seems to do is detect more cars even if I set the range well short of the street.
