As far as detecting human motion, at best about 5 feet directly in front of the camera, and none detected from the side angles even though the app shows those areas being monitored.  Even though the detection zone and camera in the app clearly shows my driveway it doesn't even detect my car when I enter the driveway.  But it picks up cars directly in front of the camera on the street unless I turn detection down way past what the app shows.  So it seems the detection really only works in a forward field and not so much left and right despite what the camera and app shows. Even worse when I go live view or watch recordings when it is night there is this loud screeching feedback type sound. It is the only thing you can hear.  It doesn't do that during daylight.  So I think there is something wrong with the night vision mode. I give it 2 stars because it was easy to set up and I can at least use it, sort of.  Not what I expected at all though. I only bought this because I use Ring Alarm and wanted something to easily integrate with that.  Maybe I got a bad unit, I don't know.
title: Very disappointed.  Night mode has weird screeching sound, motion detaction is sporadic

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Marti R
content: OK, so the installation took way longer than 5 minutes because I have stucco, and after drilling all the holes, I realized I should have probably gone with the wedge kit, which meant different holes.....so I just live with it aimed as is.  The video is good quality, but doesn't actually load up quickly enough that I can see who is at the door unless they are standing there for awhile.  Also, notifications frequently do not actually work, which isn't helpful.  Even more annoying is that I've discovered that when looking at the history, the most recent videos are not consistently available without quitting the app and opening it again to get a refresh.  My wifi is fast and reliable, and the doorbell is actually not far from the router. I guess I expected more.
title: It works, but....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robert J
content: It's on me for not researching this more carefully before buying it, but I will say that the advertising, marketing, and on-the-box product descriptions (and the Amazon description*) do not clearly communicate what the consumer must do to make this product functional--and frankly, useful.  I have a very fast, mesh-supported Wifi setup (300 mbps) and the doorbell is less than15 feet from a satellite repeater in this system.  When someone rings the doorbell, it takes approximately 30 seconds for the Ring to signal me on my phone that someone is there--and by the time I get the signal, they are usually gone.  This is important, because I didn't realize that if I don't pay $3/mon indefinitely (until the price goes up someday) to subscribe (there is a 30-day "free trial"), I will not even have the ability to get information or video on who was there--which essentially means this product becomes a very expensive, $200 doorbell if I don't become a permanent subscriber.  The reality is that this doorbell will work (sort of--the 30-second delay for video notice is inevitable, apparently) for 30 days--and then you have to pay more to keep it working. *The Amazon description says (at the bottom) that a subscription is needed "to access stored videos."  I did not understand, as I now realize, that this actually means that a subscription is needed to access ANY of the videos.
title: definitely not what I expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Traci P.
content: I was hesitant to order it because I read all of the negative reviews about having to buy a chime for it (to get the wifi to the door) and the video quality being poor. Also, I read about some people experiencing poor battery life. Charging the battery too about 7 hours from a wall plug. I was able to program it and set it up before charging it. There is so much you can do with it. You can set it so you can just watch a live feed whenever you want. I was playing with that feature a lot before turning it off. As much as we messed with it yesterday the battery went down to 93%, but it has stayed at 93% for the last 12 hours so I'm sure it was because we were testing it out, watching the live feed, etc. I did just order a spare battery for it so I will be able to just swap it out immediately instead of waiting for it to charge. I happened to wake up at 5 am because my dog needed to go out and decided to check the live feed. I kept hearing a light knocking through the audio. It creeped me out. My husband said it was probably the storm door tapping against the frame due to the wind. My 20 year old has a curfew and now I know exactly what time he gets home (after I'm asleep). Needless to say, he doesn't like the Ring Doorbell 2. The picture quality serves it purpose so no complaints there. Another cool feature is that a lot of other people have the system so you can see a map and different things that happen within a 5 mile radius of your home. I can see where packages have been stolen from neighbors porches and a lot of other things (only if they choose to share it). I am so glad I bought it, for sure!
title: I really like it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kindle Customer Ted Hallman
content: I bought this item along with a free accompanying Echo Dot. The Ring arrived, but without the Echo. When I inquired, the Amazon employee informed me that I had neglected to check the box stating I wanted the Echo. I am sure there was a box, but I didn't see it - and I saw no instructions stating that another measure was required to receive the Echo. I was unpleasantly surprised at Amazon's intransigence in this matter and am disinclined to renew my Prime membership as a result.
title: Frustration with Amazon

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Houston
content: I should have done a better job of researching this device before I purchased it. There was nothing stated in the description or write-up regarding the need to have a faster internet speed and that is important for my application. I live in a rural area where there are few options for internet access providers. We decided that we would go with Centurylink here which was a lower cost and most common in our neighborhood. Little did I know that the very slow speeds of centurylink makes a difference with the Ring device in its' functionality. I tried Wifi extenders and then even bought a separate router to get better coverage which was beneficial to everything else but discovered that, no matter how strong the signal was/is it doesn't make a difference if the internet speeds are not fast. So now if I want this Ring device to work even a little bit, I need to buy faster internet access which will effectively cost me  $300 a year more over what I am currently paying just to have a Ring doorbell plus the cost of the service to get the video to work at another $30 per year. It was stupid of me to buy this even if I was able to do all the wiring and installation myself which would have cost me even more additionally had I not had that capability. Bottom line is that this device does not work on centurylink's slow internet speed in my rural area. Don't buy it until you have done better research on what it needs to actually work right.
title: Should not have purchased this item

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alyssa
content: This thing picks up every single car that drives by. So we decided to turn down the sensitivity. The day after we turned down the sensitivity there were a group of people going through unlocked cars in our neighborhood driveways. It didn’t record multiple people in our driveway searching through one of our cars. We forgot to lock one of our cars that night. Luckily for us there was nothing worth stealing in there. Our neighbor across the street has cameras that did pick it up so we were able to see that there were at least 4 people walking all around our driveway and in front of our house and neighbor’s houses. So we turned the sensitivity back up. Well it still picks up EVERY car that drives by but doesn’t pick up people walking in front of our house. So if a neighbor has guests and they park in front of our house it will show the car leaving but not someone getting into the car. It has missed several deliveries too. It will show the delivery vehicle leaving but not the driver coming up to the door (Unless they ring the bell). Then tonight it didn’t pick up my family arriving home, parking in the driveway, getting items out of the car, then unlocking the front door until 2 of our 4 family members had already made it into the house. There was also no sound for at least the first 15 seconds of the recording. So, basically it doesn’t actually pick up the things we would actually like it to pick up but it picks up at least 30 cars driving by everyday. I’m really not impressed with it. I’ve talked to other people who have a Ring doorbell who have had similar issues with theirs. I’m thinking about getting a different device that continually records. I got this one mostly to know when I got deliveries as I do a lot of online shopping and to know when the kids came home from school.
title: So many notifications I end up ignoring them all day

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S Quentin Quale
content: I will likely keep this product as it will still provide a good deterrent while still capturing video on some level even though immediate motion detection is really key in a trustworthy surveillance camera. And usually I wait before I comment on products through Amazon so I can have a well tested purchase. But I have to say no matter what other bells and whistles come with this doorbell camera, it will never offset the complete failure of the camera to delay 3-5 seconds before it actually records the motion in front of the door. Someone could literally run by your home and toss a brick through the window and walk off without getting it on camera. Still I suppose if someone is breaking in, it will take enough time to likely get them on cam facing towards it. And it will still be a deterrence for mischief altogether. The delay will never make me rate it higher than 3 stars. If there are motion cameras that can trigger at less than half a second, I have to believe the technology is there to implement that into this doorbell camera. Perhaps a built in backup snapshot that is more instantaneous that might actually go off before full internet signal is achieved. So I took a part of this post down explaining how the battery was draining even when hardwired and the battery fully charged. Even when i had all the settings to use the least amount of battery. I am not sure why it started to work right but it did, and even after putting all the battery draining options back up it is still holding at 100%.
title: The 5 second delay failure.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Blanca
content: i must say i am a repeat buyer of the Ring. I just sold my last home which i personally installed the ring doorbell. i wired it myself, but i cant take the credit i had this wonderful young man from ring walk me tru the installation. i turned off the power and with the included hardware i took off my old doorbell ringer and wired it directly it was so easy with him walking me tru it. in  my new home i ordered the ring video doorbell 2 and it was easier than the first time around, trust me im a single mom with 2 kids who interrupt anything i do. It took overall 10 minutes to install. very easy with the included instructions that little ol me had no problem understanding and the only mistake was that i forgot to turn of the power and  did not get electrocuted. I  blame the kids saying mom,  mom, mom, mom,mom  when are you done.
title: Love the Ring bought it again.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Roger
content: Had some issues installing on uneven surface and had to put on back burner for a bit with disabled family member and children in the household.  I just got a notice that my free video storage trial will soon expire. They are already wanting more money and haven’t even used it. I’m thinking this purchase was a mistake. Update:  Finally got around to installing. I was impressed with everything that’s included. Because of where my existing doorbell is located it wasn’t a good fit for the ring. Don’t see the need to connect to existing doorbell anyway.  Increased rating for ease of installation. Still deducted 1 star for not providing the most basic free limited storage. The live view is useless for me because the best internet available for me is 1.5 mb download. If it had live view over WiFi it would be great but if they provided that they couldn’t goad you into paying for their cloud storage.
title: Charging for storage. Blink is better and free storage.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael D
content: Not sure what the deal is with the one I got but I spent 3 hours chatting with technical support trying to get it setup. Looks like it may have bad LED's around the button, so I cant tell what its doing.  The one I received had scratches on the shiny plastic above the camera.  I don't really mind, but seems odd for a new device. My biggest complaint and reason for 2 *'s is that you have to pay for cloud storage to use any of the Video Recording or Sharing features.  I understand that these companies want to make more money off of subscriptions, but I am really starting to become irritated by all of the devices requiring it when it could very easily record to a NAS device or other cloud storage provider.  (The way it has been done for decades now)
title: Cloud only storage and quality control issues.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: George B.
content: We decided to purchase the Ring door bell as there's more package and personal property threats lately. I wasn't sure how it was gonna be or if I'd even like it. After the first 3 months you can either purchase the 1 years plan for video storage or go free but if you choose to go free you wont be able to pull the footage of something does happen. You'd simply be able to watch the culprits steal your car or package.  I didn't see the sense in that so went with the yearly plan. It's been over 6+ month's and after showing my brother-in-law he even got one for their home. I like it and would probably stick with Amazon video security devices. The Wifi needs to be good or you have to buy the repeater. I didn't need one but that's what I've heard.
title: Wasn't sure but love it now

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kdogg
content: Before I bought it, many people told me how great the Ring doorbell is.  Many more have told me the same thing since I bought it. The problem is that none of these people actually have one. It seems to be one of those products whose greatness people agree on before ever actually living with one. So, did it meet my expectations? No, it's just an improvement on the old doorbell. Very easy install, clever implementation that makes it harder to steal than you'd imagine. The ringer works, you can hear it on your phone whether you're running the app or not. The default alert tone is the first three notes from the great song ‘It Takes Two To Tango.” A few weeks into my life with Ring I googled for advice on how to change the alert tone, so that that song doesn't run through my head for an hour after I get a visitor.  The Ring video tutorial on changing the ring tone presumed that I knew how to reach a certain page, so they skipped over that part. But since I hadn't spent long hours surfing through the app it took far too much time to find the page they pointed me to.  I found a ringtone that does not annoy me and now I like the ringer. (I used to write interfaces. The interface for the Ring app is a work in progress.) I have not yet figured out how to have a video of my new visitor pop up on my phone instantly when I get a notification. So far I DO hear my doorbell if I'm near my phone, but if I want video I have to go to my home screen, access the Ring icon and wait for the video to pop up, and by that time I've reached my door to get a live view of what's what. If a delivery person has rung your Ring, they will often be gone by the time you access the video. Nobody there? That's actually a pretty good indication that you have a package waiting when you open the door. No package? Perhaps a sales person has given up on finding you home. You'll get loads of neighborhood security alerts on your phone via the 'Ring community'. However, I'm not all that gripped by coyote sightings five miles from my house, nor by alerts about suspicious lurkers in neighborhoods I pay good money to not have to live in. I'm sure I'll figure out how to turn neighborhood alerts off after a while, hopefully before the Ring community turns me into a full-blown paranoid. Creepy guy looking at cars on your street?  Leave me out of it. I don't mind learning curves in modern devices. If you do, why on earth would you buy a high tech doorbell? One thing I'd LOVE to turn off are all the sales pitches for the feature that records and saves your videos. ($3 per month! Great if you need it, which I do not.) I have gotten far too many sales emails from Ring, and popup ads on the app, and I've barely owned the device for a month. I have opted to not buy this feature, though it's likely that some people will find this to be the whole reason for buying a Ring.  I just wish to heck that the company would stop trying to push it on me.
title: Pretty good.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PMC
content: I love the product. It does exactly what I need. It monitors my front door, notifies me, allows me to see and talk to whoever is there and keeps a video record of what happens. It is also perfect for me since I do not use the front door much because I almost always drive off and I get to my garage from the inner door. The Ring will let me know when someone leaves something by the door unannounced. If I should be traveling, I can ask a neighbor to remove it so the house does not look unoccupied or if I catch them, I can ask them to leave it in the lenai. I am very impressed with the package because the box brings mounting hardware for just about any application. No trip to the hardware store for more supplies with the Ring. Well done! The software download, account and device setup really take 5 to 10 minutes. Hardware installation took me a while because I have a side mounted doorbell ringer and considered placing the Ring front-facing and using it on battery only. But I tested the side mount, which required both of the included adapter mounts to adjust to the angled siding of my house and the corner mount to get a better camera angle. This replaced my existing door bell ringer and it works fine with the existing doorbell for when I am home. I am considering returning the second battery. If the wired installation provides good power and extended battery life or backup use of the battery only, a second battery is not really necessary.
title: Great product comes with all the installation hardware

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: BSlaw
content: 5 months after purchase and install, we smelled something hot in the house like melting plastic, and turns out the ring door bell shorted the actual doorbell unit that makes noise in our foyer.  Luckily someone was home to pull it off the wall and disconnect the ring doorbell.  Maybe it's defective? The first 5 months of use were ok other than that but risking a fire hazard doesn't make me feel very safe. Update: I contacted Ring and they were very quick to respond and resolve the issue; and easy to work with.
title: Ring fried my doorbell, but they responded quickly

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kat D.
content: called due to battery not charging although we spent the money to hard wire it..... and got an email from them. box says it works to -5F. this is what the email states..... Important temperatures The following are key temperatures to watch out for in regards to your batteries. 36°F (3°C): The battery may not hold a charge as effectively, resulting in you having to charge the unit more frequently. 32°F (0°C): The battery may not charge at all.  Even hardwired configurations may not charge the battery. -5°F (-20.5°C): The battery may stop working completely until temperatures warm up. What to do when it gets cold Bring your device inside: When it gets cold and your device's battery runs out, bring your entire device inside and charge the battery with a USB cord. This will allow your device to warm up while the battery charges. Make sure your battery is charged to 100%: When charging your battery, be sure that it reaches 100% before your remount the device. While the battery still won't be as effective as when the temperatures are warmer, making sure that the battery is at 100% will allow your device to work as long as possible. Monitor your charge and the temperature: As long as the temperature hovers around the points listed above, you may have issues with battery charge. Therefore it's important to constantly monitor your battery life when it gets cold to make sure your device is always working.
title: pos....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: greyfox47
content: Liked the video quality. But don’t expect to have a real time conversation with someone at your door. Even with a strong WiFi connection, there is a significant lag from notification to actually having a video to see. Maybe that’s typical of these types of systems? Technical support was friendly and helpful. I seriously considered returning. Ended up adding the Chime Pro extender to increase the WiFi strength. That may have slowed it down? Unless your primary purpose in purchasing is for surveillance,  I wouldn’t recommend. August 25 The Ring Doorbell 2 has been an unreliable struggle since day one. At the t8me of the previous review, I thought I had all my issues resolved..... ha! Wrong! Most recent was a vacation. It recorded my family outside leaving and that’s it. For the rest of the time I got the infamous “your doorbell is not connected to the internet” message. I even bought the extension to improve signal strength but that has proven to be just as unreliable. The lag continues to be unacceptable and worthless. Kudos to those who are satisfied, but I’m not among them.  Tech support has been helpful but getting me back on line isn’t worth the time when the reliability is so consistently bad. If you buy, good luck. I still have a month left on my warranty, and it’s time to go after Ring ....
title: Nothing happens in real time - Revised to One Star

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stuart E. Johnson
content: Installing and setting up the camera device was easy and quite convenient. However, when trying to sign up for one of the Ring Service plans, it became evident that something was wrong. Amazon has my street address; they deliver a constant stream of products to my door (with only an occasional error). The Ring App has, however, created a new address for me, across the street. I refuse to sign up for a plan based upon the wrong address. I contacted Amazon CS who responded as well and as nicely as they could, but they have no ability to provide much help. So, onto Ring CS. What a mistake that was. Their responses (likely produced by AI, with very little effort expended on the I) was downright insulting. They set me up with a text link to Carla, and it is anybodies guess as to who or what she is, but that conversation rapidly went further downhill and I terminated the comm link without resolving anything. I am amazed and rather (actually very) disappointed in the lack of involvement in the support coming from Amazon. Not sure if I will rip the camera off the wall and send it back to Amazon or if I should keep it as a memento (rather like a stuffed animal). Anyway, I suggest you spend a few pennies on improving the Ring CS and provide your hard working Amazon CS operatives with a way of gracefully handing off a Ring problem to an appropriate source.
title: Too little I in the AI support.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: David
content: I bought this after seeing a friend's video on their phone. I must admit, the video quality on this is incredible. Better video quality than I expected for sure. Night time video is amazing. The clarity even without light is far more than I expected. No issue at all in seeing faces, no blurry vision whatsoever. However, the sensitivity settings, at least on this one, make the alert's on my phone go off every time a vehicle goes by my house. I live on the main street in our town and have traffic going by constantly. The settings on mine are set for the street to be 30 feet away from the house, actually the street is more than that, but I only have three choices and that is the furthest it will go. The motion settings, according to the device, should only be detecting motion to about 15 feet from the Ring 2. I have the wedge to where the device points more upward. If I were to turn the wedge over the device would not capture faces in the video. Contacted Ring about this and really did not get a good answer as to why it was so sensitive or how to change it. With that being said, I give it a 3.5 because the alerts are good, but now it's a little "The Ring that cried wolf" syndrome. Is there really someone there and do I need to check the video. I know that this is probably a small annoyance that I am leaving a not so great review for, however I don't need to know every time a vehicle drives past my house. If I could get that setting changed, it would be 4.5 star review!
title: Ring 2 great video quality, but

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: nate g.
content: LATEST UPDATE - SAVE YOUR MONEY!! IT'S WORTHLESS! UPDATE.. THIS IS CRAP! ABSOLUTE CRAP! IT DOESN'T WORK HALF THE TIME AND WON'T PICK MOVEMENT FROM MY DRIVEWAY. SHOULD HAVE WENT WITH A DIFFERENT PRODUCT! The app only allows a modification of which areas to "watch" as a whole. I have a street in front of my house and have to bring the detection in closer to my home. Because of that, there is a huge portion off to the right that is not being covered. The camera is pretty good. However, someone will ring the bell and/or be at my door for almost 10 seconds before I get notified. When I open the app to check there is such a lag that by the time I am able to see who it is, the person is already walking away and/or gone! I even bought a wifi booster to enhance performance and it is still SLOW!! Maybe I have a defective one? I am not sure. But fully satisfied I am not.
title: DON'T BUY.... ITS USELESS CRAP!! .....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GCDave
content: I bought it because my home office and workshop are 60' from the front door, and I couldn't hear the doorbell chimes when I was in either of those places. I bought the Ring because of it's remote notification features and thought the video function would be an added bonus. So far, that part hasn't worked out great. It does a good job of catching the back of the UPS guy's head as he walks away, and while the motion notification may be fairly immediate, the video is delayed 10-20 seconds . It does do a good job of picking up moths that like the lights, deer strolling across the sidewalk, shadows of tree limbs moving in the afternoon breeze....The Ring device health meter says I have a weak Wifi signal, so I ordered a Chime Pro, as the info on it alludes to the fact that it's a signal booster. That would be a yes and "no". The yes is it sounds off when the Ring sends a signal (quicker than my phone notification), but it doesn't boost the wifi signal to the Ring device. I located the Chime Pro halfway between the router and Ring unit. The Chime Pro gets' a great signal - the Ring still shows the same weak signal rating. I called Ring Tech to see how to determine if the CP was actually rebroadcasting the signal. Apparently that question was not on the tech's "cheat sheet", as he had no clue as to wat I was asking. Going to have to put in a wifi extender, I guess. Will further evaluate this device's usefulness after that...
title: Not really thrilled with this device.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: kelliekaz
content: I love this camera! Extremely easy to install and set up. Comes with everything you need! Tools, wedges to attach for the best angle and a walk through setup for the best view/record. The fee is so inexpensive ($30 a yr) and well worth it. The only negative I've noticed is while recording there might be a bit of a lad/stall in video but not audio. This could be due to my internet provider ATT and my rural location. I can check the battery life on the app and will get a notification when it needs charging. Charging is so easy! I just use the little screwdriver that was included, remove 1 discreet screw remove the cover and click out the battery.  Sorry to say I haven't paid attention to how long it takes to recharge but will next time. The picture on my iPhone is clear both day and night. I love that at anytime I can tap on the icon and check my home.
title: Works Great!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Felix
content: It works fine as a doorbell, never missed someone ringing the bell. I have the recording plan with Amazon, sometimes it records, sometimes it doesn't .... the signal is good, I have no idea why it sometimes decides to do it, and sometimes it doesn't. Also sometimes it starts recording when someone is already leaving my door, so the beginning is missing in the recording. I expected more. I do get the alerts on my phone when it feels like sending them.
title: Sometimes it records, sometimes it doesn't

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lewSki
content: I started off with the Arlo doorbell as I have a 7 camera Arlo infrastructure that works great, the doorbell on the other hand needs some development. So I tried the Ring #1 doorbell and it worked OK, but had many shortcomings in my setup. I upgraded to the Ring2 and this one is soooo much better. I have had it in for a few weeks now with no issues what so ever; video and audio quality are great, very little if no lag in alerting my phone to activity, and the included wedges made the install angle perfect for my house. I know folks complain about the cloud storage fee but $36 a year is not allot to ask, I pay Arlo $100. All in all this works for me.
title: Much better than first model.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Diana Cross
content: It is not compatible with an analog doorbell. That means if you don't have your cell phone with you, you will not know someone is at the door. It also requires DC power and the power supply it came with doesn't meet building codes. I purchased this as a Christmas gift and now I see the window to return it closed Dec 24. Naturally, it was opened on the 25th. I guess I'll have to sell it on eBay at a loss.
title: It won't work and I can't return it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ryan Booth
content: DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK.  Shame on Amazon (owner of ring) for making and selling such an absolute trash product. It's cheap, flimsy and a poor experience at all levels. Surely we can do better than this at this point? The recording takes forever to trigger. It's great getting a notification to then see...no one at the door. I can't get live view to ever work. The quality of the audio and video is awful. This is in a well lit, indoor hallway. Conditions ideal so if it looks this bad there, I can't imagine something exterior. The sound the unit makes is ghastly. Like they found the worst speakers from the 80s and threw them in. Not worth the ridiculous $199 I paid in Sep. 2019 for this. Shame on me for being that dumb.
title: DO NOT BUY THIS PIECE OF JUNK.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sid Z
content: I've had the opportunity of having both the first gen of ring and currently the second gen Ring 2. There's a big difference in the two straight out of the box. - You get a wedge and better mount plate for your ring so that you can set it up to the preffered angle - the new batteries hold charge much better and last longer and they're replaceable - you now have motion detection zones which honestly are not really good - video quality is much better and so is night vision - finally the biggest change is build quality. My last ring was a nice premium metal finish. This one though is very much plastic all around and feels cheaply made. Set up for the bell is super easy, I did buy a chime to use it as a real bell at my house but that's optional at $30. The motion detection works flawlessly and the 30 second clips it saves are good enough for me. I do not subscribe to the ring protect service. Now for people complaining about accessing their video clips when it detects motion. It's not instant and there's a reason for that. It alerts you to motion almost immediately but the clip it records is 30 seconds long and takes time to upload to the cloud from where you retrive it for viewing. Hence why you need to use live view most of the time. This is normal but I believe easily fixable if ring defaulted the motion detection to live view. Secondly this ring requires a good internet connection. I feel their diagnostics tool believes a 5 Mbps connection is sufficient but it's a one time test. If you're investing in any wifi enabled security you need to have a good internet connection and a router. I have a mesh router that's able to handle my 5 cameras and other smart home devices well. You need to have the right amount of network bandwidth to handle all of these connections or else you're going to have alot lag and that's not something ring can fix.
title: The almost perfect doorbell with security in mind

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sunshine4Life
content: Installation: I had planned to install the unit without the angled bracket but realized that would require me to drill 3 holes (reusing 1 from original doorbell) vs 1 hole using the bracket (reusing 1).  Hardest part was figuring out which circuit the doorbell was on (it's low voltage but better safe than sorry).  Lessons learned:  You need a drill gun, use a butter knife if you're struggling to remove the cover plate, charge the battery before installing, use one or both of the angled brackets to save on holes. Functionality: I've read a lot of complaints about motion sensitivity, connectivity issues, etc. and was expecting the worst.  After 24 hours I have to say I'm pretty satisfied.  My doorbell is pointed towards the road (~60' away) and with motion detection maxed, notifies me when traffic passes; this is fine as I live on a dead-end road with only 12 homes.  As for connectivity, I tested how quickly I was notified on movement.  I got 1-2 steps into the field of vision before a phone notification.  On average getting from the notification to live feed is about 5-10 seconds.  More than acceptable in my opinion. I had no intention to pay for their service but I'm already considering the 30/year basic subscription as reviewing stored footage is pretty nice.
title: Initial Review after 24 hours

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: scharr22
content: I love this device, and when it works, it's amazing. The technology itself is incredible, and does exactly what it says well. The issues is with the signal. I can put a wireless mesh on the other side of the window to where the Ring is at, and it sometimes takes a long time to pull up the live view on my phone. I can also move the mesh device further away and sometimes get better results. It's really a mystery to where the Ring want it's wifi signal located. I've been playing around with this for almost 2 years. It almost seems like the best results are when the signal is further away from the device. On a positive note, It's been working well for the past 3-4 months, so maybe an update fixed this issue. Overall, I am very happy with the device. !!!!!DO NOTE!!!! We will need a subscription to use this device other then live view after your year with this device is up. It's not expensive, but it is additional cost, so do take that into consideration. I was not thrilled with this when I found out I could only have live view and noting else until I forked over more money.
title: Love it, but signal strength is shaky, and a monthly subscription

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hector
content: Los videos se pausan ai beses y ai beses que no se conecta rapido a mi cell pense que era el internet y tambien a un internet mas rapido y bueno pero sigue asiendo lo mismo funsiona bien pero me justaria que se conectara rapido a mi cell .
title: Se pausan Los videos.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. Younger
content: Works well for me. You really need to understand that you are setting this wifi device on the OUTSIDE of your house where there is a high chance of wifi interfence. The material of outside your house may cause wifi interfence so Google it for yourself. I don't care if you have 500 Mbps plus internet but it means squat if the spot where the ring doorbell will be has WiFi issues. Before you buy this or other ring products (I also have the ring spotlight) use your phone to check the wifi by closing the door then looking at how many bars you have. Even if it drops one bar..your ring product may not work as well. Use a good wifi extender near your chosen spot to see if it works better. One reviewer even said it.."I get poor signal from my router or the ring gets poor signal from the router"  so fix it by changing router or use a wifi extender! That being said....it works well for me but it's not perfect and I'm still not done adjusting it to avoid getting it set off by cars passing by or even squirrels running around. Nope..not kidding about this.
title: Ring is a great product but you have to work with it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: 1CrazyLife4Me
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. We got two, one for the back door away from busy road and one for the front door. The Back door 5 stars works very well with very few false motion reports due to car motion. The front door is different on a busy road about 15-30 ft away. We get so many false alarms saying motion at front door grrrr!! We have tried everything even the lowest motion setting and still false alerts so guess we will just live with it. Thank God they offer to shut off zones in app or we would have an alert every minute lol. Still happy though. Pretty clear night pic even in the pitch black with night vision! Update a year later: we are still pretty happy with our ring doorbells BUT the battery life is horrible and a lot of times people will ring our doorbell and stand outside for a long time, some will even leave before our video doorbell alerts us there is anyone there. We still use them and do subscribed to their service as it is nice to have when it works properly. Please update the software to alert to phones or the Echo in a more timely fashion. Keeping it 4 stars for this reason and the battery life. The batteries also takes a very long time to charge like 6-10 hours straight which sucks. Video of the daytime quality where it missed a ring doorbell and I had no idea anyone was here.
title: Awesome Product except failed doorbell rings

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Fonda250
content: I reluctantly bought this item at the urging of my wife. We had tried a surveillance camera for a few weeks that we bought at another venue and found that it failed to notify us when there was activity at our front door, returned it and got our money back. We live in what I would consider a safe neighborhood and wanted it more for notifications of visitors and or packages being delivered regardless of being home or not as we had one delivery left out overnight and had no knowledge of it until the next day. I have vinyl siding so I added a block to provide a flat surface to mount the doorbell on. My doorbell is wired doorbell so the installation was simple. The only issue I had was the few minutes I spent trying to ascertain weather or not the wired doorbell would need the battery pack installed. I may have missed that when reading the instructions but if not the manufacturer could have made the fact that no matter which configuration you have the battery is required a bit clearer. Setting up the App on my phone was as simple as any others and connecting to the doorbell via the App was also easy. Once I adjusted the range properly it has functioned without fault and I highly recommend this item to anyone that wants or needs to be able to see or get notifications when someone is within range of the sensor.
title: Easy to install and works well

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ion
content: Bought a Ring Video Door Bell 2 and chime a little over 30 days ago and have been working on trying to get it to be useful nearly every day. The primary problem with it is the "motion" detection performance renders it useless. For one thing it doesn't really detect motion, it detects changes in infra red (IR) returns. For another thing the sensitivity slider for detections is useless. On a smart phone you can't adjust it in incremental steps, in fact until I installed Ring software on a Win 10 PC (Ring's App is incompatible with a Win 7 PC) I didn't know it had 10 steps to adjust the sensitivity. The smart phone usually just jumped from min to max. However; after spending about a week attempting to get the motion detection usable I decided the sensitivity slider is useless Because: At a setting of 9 or 10 it will detect "motion" (changes in IR) out to about 100', which picks up every car going by resulting in a false motion trigger about every 15 minutes. During a 10 hour period 40 videos are produced. Looking through the videos in an attempt to find someone actually approaching the front door would take a couple of hours - making these settings useless. At a setting of 8 no "motion" is detected until a body is directly in front of the camera at a distance of 3' - making it useless since the video isn't usable for 2-3 seconds after the camera is triggered in which time a person could move to the side of the camera out of view or in the case of a delivery person they've dropped the package and all you see is their back as they depart. All settings less than 8 just reduce the 3' detection distance. My installation has a light colored stucco garage wall well to the the left of the camera. During the day the north facing camers picks up heat (IR) changes from the sun off the wall and causes probably 1/2 of the false triggers - this after enabling only the center sensing sector - indicating the enabling or disabling of the sectors is also useless (inoperative). Unfortunately I spent to much time trying to get this useless device to work so I'm outside the Amazon 30 day return window. ...the chime works, but unfortunately only with a ring door bell.
title: ... been working on trying to get it to be useful nearly every day

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robert Hall
content: I wish I had read more of the reviews before I bought this. The one thing that you want a video doorbell for is so you can have some sort of security. You can see when packages are dropped off or if someone is trying to steal your packages. Well when you first buy the doorbell it works awesome you get to see everything that goes on because they give you a free trial. After the free trial (unless you buy their subscription) the doorbell is useless. I feel like the company is ripping off people who don't realize the full extent of their purchase. The doorbell is $199 up front but then you have to pay $3 a month in order to see any of the video. The only thing it is good for is live view. By the time you get an alert and try to view the video (burglar, vandals) it tells you that you have to pay to see the video. Like I said it's useless unless you want to pay there fee. This system uses my Wi-Fi that I pay for, my cellphone that I pay for and a number of Amazon Echos that I have also paid for. Why should I have to pay them to view video on devices that I own or pay for. There are many other video doorbells on the market that let you record for free. While I have never used any of them and can't say how good they are if they offer free video storage that's a pretty good start for me.
title: YOU HAVE TO PAY TO SEE VIDEO!!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tony L.
content: I totally agree with another reviewer that said this is a bait and switch product. I wish I'd returned this within the 30 day period so I could have bought a more useful product. The basic problem is paying Ring for a subscription just to be able to review video generated by an alert that happened a minute ago. Why the heck should this require a subscription? Cache the recorded video in the camera and show it to me when it detects motion!  There are doorbells out there that will give you this basic feature without requiring a subscription. This is just a very expensive dumb doorbell. Now I have to set up an additional Wyze camera just to monitor motion at my front door. Wyze cameras are cheap and no subscription costs for basic monitoring. Bottom line - DON'T BUY
title: Buy Another Product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Deborah T.
content: My front door windows are frosted so I needed a way to see who was at my door. I had no existing doorbell and chose this model because the battery lasts for approximately 3 months (you'll receive a notice via email when it's running low or you can check battery health on the app) and is easily rechargeable. If you have an existing doorbell, buy the unit that uses its low voltage power. This unit was simple to install and came with two wedges for offset installation. Note that this device comes with a free 30 day cloud backup. After that, if you want your "motion events" saved, you'll need to extend the service for about $30 per year. Without the cloud backup, Ring is just a fancy doorbell with a camera.
title: Ring for use w/o an existing doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lesa
content: A ring doorbell does not have the Wi-Fi capability of a cell phone. I have a small house. I can sit on the porch and have excellent Wi-Fi signal on my iPhone and my iPad. Yet the ring doorbell does not have this level of capability and receives a poor Wi-Fi signal from my router. After reading many reviews, I reluctantly had to buy the ring chime Wi-Fi extender in order to improve the signal reception and improve the operation of the video capability on the ring doorbell. Buyer beware. It is a useful tool for answering doorbell’s, but unless you have a good Wi-Fi signal your video motion function will be impaired with problems related to: trouble connecting to live you, not picking up motion on the video quickly enough, blackouts on the video when motion is detected, etc. With the addition of the ring chime Wi-Fi extender, we seem to now haveThe level of operation that we wanted but it cost us an extra $50 to buy the device to get the doorbell to function properly. The ring doorbell needs a great deal more development related to its capability in receiving Wi-Fi signal. It lacks the reception capability of even the most basic cell phone.
title: Poor WiFi signal - buyer beware

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Wiles
content: This device works well when you hardwire it to your actual doorbell. Now my brother-in-law wired it up for me because I'm clueless. I bought this for my parent's house. They really do like it! It does, however, freeze up every now and then. The picture is great and it was a little tough playing with the motion sensitivity. Bugs set it off at night. The app is great and free, but to keep all of the privileges there is a small fee after using for a couple of months. You can still use the app, but it doesn't keep a recording of motions detected. It kinda defeats the purpose of detecting any unwanted visitors. I think it's like $30/year or something. It's a great security device and you know when things are being delivered. You also know how much your dogs bark when someone rings the doorbell.
title: Great security addition for my parents-Warning, app isn't totally free

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: mustardchips
content: Decided to get on the bandwagon. It has some features I like and some I think it should. First - the install: I have a relatively narrow molding to install device and was caught off guard on how physically big it was. I’ve been to homes that have Ring, but holding it surprised me. The screw holes on the Ring are on the outside edges meaning I would need to mount the left side into brick and the right side at a sketchy angle into the moulding. Luckily, the included angle plate mount in the center, so I decided to have my Ring have a slight downward angle and install was a breeze. I have a mechanical chime, so only had to connect two wires and use 6 screws. Second - Functionality: Picture and sound quality are better than expedited. I’m fortunate to have my router in the guest bedroom adjacent to front door so signal is strong. This ring requires a battery, which worries me, but luckily the mechanical chime power powers the unit and is there for considered “hardwired” (really didn’t want to have to mess with charging batteries). My favorite thing was later in the day after install, I solicitor came to door and alerted me while working in office. I pulled up Ring app and saw guy at door while he and I both waited for my wife to answer. Heard and saw entire conversation perfectly (wife did great job of getting him gone!) What I really DON’T LIKE is that “live view” times out after 10 minutes. I believe this is due to recording being uploaded to cloud and Ring not wanting to be left on continuously. Would be great if “live view” could be continuous and there was an option to initiate recording. Example: on Halloween to be able to have a tablet running with real time view of door with out it timing out. Overall, this is nice addition to home.
title: Nice unit, though no continuous Live View

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JMMorton
content: I picked up the ring doorbell 2 on sale. I figured it may help keep an eye out around the house and couldnt hurt. I think it generally does what's advertised. The video and sound quality are pretty good. Night vision isn't amazing, but considering the size and power consumption it's better than expected. The app is where I think most of the problems are. Once the doorbell detects motion, every phone and smart device hooked up to it start to go off. If you've got multiple Alexas set up, it gets very PeeWees Playhouse very quickly. To view the video of whatever set it off, you'll need to wait until that segment uploads. If you open the notification, it'll bring up the live feed after loading for a while. I can't really imagine a busy household with people coming and going all the time. You'd really have to set up timeframes for when motion alerts go off and when they don't. I think that by turning them off, you're ultimately turning off a big reason for these type of devices. The app also has a sharing feature for other ring users around you. So randomly you'll get notifications about things going on around you. Some of these are good clips of suspicious type behavior. The other 75% is often hilariously paranoid or otherwise useless information. Today at 4pm someone decided to alert the neighborhood that a man was trying to disarm her alarm with her cellphone and had his pen ready to attack her. It was clearly just a salesman texting while he waited for her to open the door. Hopefully your neighbors are as entertaining. The installation wasn't bad and the instructions were clear. It even included a drill bit for stucco. I like the product overall. I wish the actually load times to bring up the live feed were much shorter and that motion detection clips could be viewed prior to them saving to the cloud.
title: Not bad

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Klown
content: I had to do a review of my initial reaction opening the box. WOW. I’ve owned RINGS since they started. The first product would fail after long term exposure to elements as the mounting plate was not water proof. I’d send in for replacement and customer service without fail would over night a new one. I purchased this one for my back yard garage to monitor my tool shed. I have the Eero net WiFi. This is my first “new” mode RING. Wow. Packaging was almost Apple quality, the further I dug into the box the more impressed I became. Sealed RING case! Two wedges for RING motion alleviation. An old RING mount to assist with new RING. It actually made me feel good! Amazon really did a good job keeping a life long customer without over complicating things. CON: My concern is....the NEED for the battery. The point of running 24v to the unit is to ensure longevity. I do not need the inconvenience of a damaged battery only to have to replace it in 5 years. That being said. I’m curious how long this beautiful specimen lasts in a yard full of trees and sunlight.
title: Multiple RING owner since 2012

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Texas Irish
content: Amazon needs to get serious about Ring getting their act together. I've had multiple Ring products about 2 years now, and had high hopes for their success and for my experience with Ring security products.  I'm letting you know that I'm increasingly dissatisfied with my Ring product experience.  The first year or so was very good, the last 6+ months have been absolutely terrible. I'm a retired IT consultant with extensive experience with all sizes of companies in many different industries. I'm very dissappointed that a company such as Amazon, which is a leader in it's field due to easy to use, functional software running on a robust architecture, coupled with continuously refined processes, has allowed Ring to meander in a completely different direction. Ring continues to prioritize both hardware and software new product development at the expense of current product functionality, reliability and ease of use. This has resulted in hardware that doesn't work as well now as it previously did (or as well as its competitors), software bloated by advertisements and overly complex bells and whistles, and an infrastructure that can't support the primary purpose of its products. The end result is Ring not delivering the product experience that most customers want out of a security product, which is the fast, reliable, accurate notification of and video of the security incidents which their cameras capture. That's the bottom line. Ring's product philosophy seems to mirror Microsoft's from years ago....develop complex products with lots of bells and whistles that will do everything anyone could ever want, but not the reliable, easy to use products that have the core features that 90% of customers are looking for. Ring doesn't seem to understand that software update reliability and useability depends on thorough regression testing (making sure that today's update doesn't break something that worked yesterday) and comprehensive IT and user QC (quality control) via IT and user beta testing (putting new updates in the hands of selected IT and actual users, prior to general rollout, so beta-testers can give feedback about ease of use, functionality vs requirements, unexpected consequences, etc.), to further refine and improve the proposed updates. I'm explaining within parentheses the terms preceding the parentheses, because I don't think Ring in their haste to deliver more and more products and changes quickly, thoroughly understands or comprehensively utilizes these quality processes. So in closing I'll just say that while Amazon's tagline is 'Earth's most customer-centric company', Ring's might be paraphrased as 'Earth's most un-customer friendly security product company'. Amazon....take control or 'Ring security products' will become a term used only in the past tense.
title: Amazon - you own Ring so take control and fix them

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NC. movie man
content: I got mine in yesterday my son installed it in about a half hour. He replaced the front doorbell button, what took the time was the button was installed by a short electrician and needed to raise up about a foot, he pulled on the wire and found over a foot of extra wire had been pushed back in the wall. It was easy to mate with my phone I am disappointed that it won't work with my Kindle HDX 8.9 customer service said the app is not ready yet for it. Today is 9-9-18 I will update as time goes by. Okay, it's 9-21-18 have had some issues, it didn't let me know anyone was on the front porch till he or she rang the bell. We had had to reset the wifi and it didn't hook back auto. will keep you posted. 10/02/18 had to get the cloud service before my time was up but the nice lady gave me 30 more days before I have to pay anything a paid the whole year 6 bucks cheaper. 10/09/18 I'm back had my second ring come in yesterday, My son did all the prep work over the weekend I call customer service and was told a 16-volt tran will work just fine so I had him run the wire and set the tran under the house. If it don't work will get back.
title: Five star so far.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Darlene Jones
content: This is our first item to purchase to move forward on making our a smart home. We have been wanting this ring doorbell for quite some  time and prime days made it possible to purchase. The picture is very clear and the night vision is quite nice too. We have found that there is a slight delay in notifying us on our phone of any motion but otherwise it works just like the instructions says. It was easy to install and set up on both our phones. I love that you can set the range for motion, since we live on a busy street. I found that when the hubby is mowing the yard, I can snooze the motion for the time he's mowing. Therefore I'm not constantly reminded of motion in the area. We wanted the extra security that the ring gives and so far we are pleased.
title: Nice feature for our home

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tripp
content: Pretty underwhelmed by this product. My Ring doorbell is no more than 10 ft. from my router, with very fast speeds (200 down, 20 up) yet when I get a notification, it still takes about 6 or 7 seconds for the camera to activate. By this time, whatever motion was occurring has already gone or I catch the tail end of it. Part of this is also due to the bad motion detection. It does not begin recording until someone has walked all the way up all 15 of my steps and knocked the door/rang my doorbell. My front yard is wide open with a about 100 ft to the road where delivery vehicles park. My Ring doorbell does not catch anyone walking up to the door directly in front of the camera even though the motion detection is almost maxed out. If I have the motion maxed out, it picks up vehicles driving by, but still not people walking up, and kills the battery in no time. The recording time never seems long enough to sufficiently capture whatever motion has occurred. I'm very disappointed in this product and plan to get rid of it and just go with a video surveillance system.
title: Waste of money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Madman With A Camera
content: Pros - Does not need to be hardwired - Works with Alexa - Fairly easy to install and setup - Pretty good image quality Cons - Biggest peeve is that the motion detection is flakey. I have it set to detect only motion from the right as that's where people would approach, and only if they are fairly close to the door.  I still get false positives when large vehicles go past the house (my front door is about 20-25 feet from street. - When I go to live view when someone is at the door it takes a bit for the camera to sometimes connect.  That is extremely annoying as people will keep ringing because I can't see them an talk so I need to go to the door anyway.  This might be because I don't have it hardwired, but defeats the purpose as I live on a second floor and that was the whole purpose of getting the Ring. - Wifi distance is not very good.  While I connects to mine it's just on the edge of it's limit which may be part of the issue above. - You need to pay if you want to view your past alerts and access it remotely.  Not a huge sum but something you need to be aware of that I was not. All in all, I'm fairly satisfied and might get one for my back door as well though I may have to get a wifi extender.
title: Does what it does...motion detection is flakey

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jay Koontz
content: Absolutely fantastic.  It's simple and clean. I bought this primarily because in my two bedroom apartment (yes apartment), I'm using one of the bedrooms as a den and that's where my soundbar and system is and when I'm watch TV, it fills the entire room and I was not able to hear people tapping on the door.  With the Ring Doorbell, I have attached it using command velcro strips (because apartment rules and damage blah blah), with the srips i was able to place it over the existing peephole and it's front and center when people approach my door. There are many features tagged with the Doorbell. I have motion alerts setup so anytime there's movement outside my door, I get notified via a app notification. That does get a bit annoying since I have neighbors, but, I just ignore the notifications and then the device will silently record for about 30 seconds and then I'm able to playback what it captured should i need to (free 30-day trial with RING then to do the aforementioned you need to subscribe to a protect plan with Ring, like 30 bucks a year for one device). So how does it work? For me, when there's movement outside my door, i get notified and if someone pushes the button on the doorbell, it rings of course from the doorbell and also on any device that you have the RING app installed on (for me, my Mac, iPad and Iphone) (there's an attachment you can get called CHIME/CHIME PRO, that will allow you to actually hear the ring inside the house but I have not purchased yet) SO, one the doorbell is rang, if your phone (iOS at least) is unlocked, the screen will automatically open to a live view of whatever is outside the door. You can answer the ring and speak directly to that person OR you can unmute the microphone to listen if you were wanting to do a little eavesdrop.  (NOTE: If you have home automation, you can connect smart locks to the app and then trigger for the door to unlock as well if it's a friend/family member/whomever) Now, the cost is a bit high, but, as my first video doorbell, i believe it gets the job done, the picture when you're viewing a live view or speaking with someone is 1080P HD CRYSTAL CLEAR, as is the audio!  There's a night vision mode so that if your doorbell is mounted in a spot not lighted at night, you can still see the person whose at your door! Now the downside is that the doorbell is battery operated with a rechargable battery, it will come partially charged but you will NEED TO CHARGE IT FULLY BEFORE USING FOR THE FIRST TIME. It took about 7hrs to charge initially and i just went to bed and installed the battery the following day.  I've read that there is an A/C adapter sold online so you could theoretically "hardwire" it in if your someone like me living in an apartment and that would make the battery inside become a backup battery.  You CAN use this with your existing doorbell configuration.  It came with all the tools and things needed to install. The best part is that should your RING device get stolen, as long as you notified the police and have a police report and submit a claim to RING, they'll replace the device free of charge. All in: It's a wonderful device, I installed it and it works as it supposed to.  It does freak some people out because they're not expecting someone to respond from the doorbell and most don't even know there's A/V capabilities if it's like a delivery person, but, I've told them about the doorbell and they thought it was the coolest thing ever.  It was easy install for me, the app is free and within the app you can also become part of a community watch where you can share videos and other RING users can do the same and then you can of course, be on the lookout when suspicious stuff goes down. Definitely worth the money and I refuse to return it.  I've had it for roughly a month now and I have no issues.
title: Best video doorbell if you need something simple and easy

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kam1am
content: There is a bit of a delay at times but from what I've been able to tell, it has always been when someone we know well just walks right in and doesn't actually ring the doorbell unless the door is locked. When the doorbell is rung, I instantly see who it is, so that really shouldn't be an issue. It is pretty sensitive to motion, such as when someone is mowing the front yard. Those first couple of passes by the front door set it off. There is a large shrub that needs to be trimmed again close to the front door. When it got very windy a couple weeks ago, I believe it was the motion of the shrub setting it off. We tried a different brand and had nothing but troubles with it, (even when they replaced it with a new one). All in all, we are very happy with it!
title: It does what I need it to do!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lightingal
content: Okay, I've been wanting one of these for a while and finally found one I could afford. It's great during the day for photo quality. I don't know why it goes into night mode, because there's always lighting on in the hallway. My wifi in the apartment is maybe 20' away, but it doesn't always lock onto the signal. There's also many times it's missed people and I don't know why - it's on the most sensitive settings. Also, the battery is losing charge really fast! I had one on the charger and it was fully charged - I put it in the Ring device, and checked it - and it's at 86% instead of 100%. Anyway, if someone sees this, would you please contact me so we can figure this out? Thanks!
title: fast shipping

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LaZaa
content: With all the hype around Ring (except for the lame security concerns that are more of a user fault) I'm struggling to understand how is this meant to be one of the best of its kind. * Echo Show integration (0/5) I purchased an echo show because I wanted to see who is at the door and expected it to show that automatically when someone is ringing. Instead, this stupid doorbell is sending the recording to the cloud and echo show just tells me someone is ringing. What's the point? I need to tell Alexa to show me the front door but by then, I could just walk to the door and see myself. Why showing that automatically is not even an option (even thru routines)? How is this adding any convenience? * Motion Detection (1/5) Despite all the wizards and fine adjustments available in the app, the motion detection is horrible. My door is facing an intersection and the closest street is 40 feet away. I played around a lot with all the calibration options but it is still turning on for every single car but since it is not buffered and has a decent delay, i usually just see the car zapping out of the screen in the first second and then watch the nothing. The same goes with delivery people coming up to my door. By the time the camera is on, the person is already heading out from my door and i can see only his/her back. I bet the same will happen if someone takes those same packages. * Night vision (2/5) I have a lit front porch (that is really common in my area). Oddly, with my holiday decoration on, Ring goes into night vision mode, but as soon as the decoration is off, Ring is back to normal mode. Really frustrating. Isn't it supposed to turn on night vision when there is less light? I cannot wrap my head around this. So even though I like the details/clarity of the night vision mode, I could not find any adjustment option to make it work for my porch. Without night vision, it is needless to say that the recording from the night is useless. Considering all the security concerns floating around recently, I assume Amazon/Ring is focusing on fire fighting and I do not expect they would fix my problems any time soon. With its current maturity, this is just a dumb outdoor wifi camera powered from your doorbell wire. Nothing more. I just need to find some time to install back my old doorbell and send this crap back to Amazon/Ring.
title: Extremely disappointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Harry
content: Don't waste your time and money. Don't expect to talk to anyone after they ring the Ring 2. They will not be there by the time your Ring 2 gets up and running on your smartphone.  Also I can not tell you how many times my smartphone alerts me someone is at the front door when it was me and I am already in the house. Just a little slow. Don't expect to see the persons face that steals your package off the front porch either. The Ring 2 is so slow that all you see (if anything) is their back leaving with your package. And it is so choppy there are big gaps in the video. One second they are 15 feet away then they are either 30 feet away or gone. And the audion i8s a joke also. You can hear something but it is so broken up you can not understand them. I don't know if they can understand you or not.  Maybe I got a lemon. I hope they are not all this bad.
title: Junk don't buy!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eddie
content: Review updated 11//2019 I have rice rating by one star.  After the last software update the camera works much better and I have high hopes that it’s going to get even better. Review updated 9/11/2019 I have been contacted a few times by "Ring" support people regarding issues with this device.  I'll try to update with some videos and pictures. I think my biggest frustration with the device is its lack of continuity.  A few times it will connect, and you can have a live view, and an hour later you can't get a connection no matter how many times you try. My setup:  I moved my Arris router downstairs so that I could have wireless roughly 30 fee from the Ring device.  Although I have never any issues with other devices by having my router upstairs, the Ring refused to connect.  The app showed on the device health that there was plenty of signal level, but live view would not work. Operating systems:  I have tried the app with my Windows 10 computer, a macbook pro 15, a pixel 3, and an iphone 8. The system that connected more than the others was the Macbook.  Probably 3 out of 10 times.  The pixel was next with 2 out of 10.  The iphone was dead last.  It connected maybe once out of a hundred. The Ring device has updated once.  I did not notice any performance updates. I have about two weeks left to decide to keep it.  I purchased my through the Warehouse and got a discount.  For $70, I still don't think it is a good deal, and you certainly don't want to pin the safety of your house on it. I'll keep fiddling with it and upgrade as I go.  If I can get my hands on a google mesh system, and put one of the orbs a few feet from the device, I'll try it, but I am hesitant to shell out another $200 to make this device work.  I might has well put a logicam on my mac and just leave it running and check in via facetime. You would have better luck protecting your home with a screen porch then this device.
title: Updating review after using for two weeks. - I still would not recommend buying one.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GG
content: UPDATE OCTOBER 2019, I decided to sell the ring and purchased the eufy Security Wi-Fi Video Doorbell, 2K Resolution for $109.99 (got a $50 discount code).  The people who designed and programmed RING 2 should be fired for making a useless product.  It tells me someone is at the door and I try to see who it is by using my phone and I get an hour glass for several minutes, by the time the Ring app recovers, the person at the door is gone.  WHAT A $199 JUNK... I can not believe Amazon allows this product to be sold. UPDATE JUNE 2019, In addition to requiring a monthly subscription, I have come to the conclusion that this product is VERY useless.  This product starts recording when it detects a motion, therefore it is sleep to save battery until a motion is detected. This means that there is NO RECORDING of what happened just before it detected a motion. Go walk in front of the camera and walk away fast. The camera will tell you that someone is at the door, then you look who it was and you will see no one.  What I want to know is why am I forced to give it even one star... Let's say you are in the bathroom and someone rings your doorbell.  You come out within a minute and the person is gone and you are now wondering who was at your door.  This product doesn't even save the most recent recording and it wants you to signup for a subscription in order to see the most recent recording.  I don't need to save my recordings for weeks at a time.  I just want to know who just rang my doorbell.  It is extremely easy to add this capability to this product, however why would they do it when they can get you to subscribe and make more money.
title: UPDATES, product requires a subscription & it is useless without one, got eufy for $109.99

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nathaniel H.
content: So they are trying to make improvements. But not succeeding at it. Pro's Long battery life even in winter (That surprised me) Easy to take out the battery to charge it I like the access to the door bell on all of our Alexa enabled devices I also like the live view Option to use as a speaker Con's Goes off constantly (Even though I have fixed the radius in which it see's) Video is short and cuts off to quick The beginning of the video is often distorted and that's when the action happens The refresh rate to see whos at the door takes a long time and you constantly have to refresh until it comes up then the person is gone. Video and voice is shaky at best.
title: Eh, it's okay

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Toolman Tim
content: This was pretty easy to install using the battery and I had it up and going in under a hour. I decided after a few days to hardwire it to my old doorbell wires when I learned that it replaces the old door bell, so when it is pushed it will ring my existing doorbell and I will never have to take the battery out to recharge it. Plus, it was then less clutter as I didn't like the doorbell and this being next to each other by my front door. The old doorbell was also at a better height than having this just above it. The motion sensor only seems to pick up motion that goes horizontal, and does not pick up a person when they are walking directly towards it, until they are maybe 10-15 feet away. But, will pick up the garbage truck on the street 30-40 feet away, even though I have the motion zones set to not detect motion on the street. For some reason only large trucks like the garbage truck set the motion sensor off, cars and trucks do not. I have the motion zones set so that they do not cover the street, so nothing on the street should set it off. The wifi signal on this has to be very close to your router or you will have to setup a repeater very near it, which is what I had to do, I plugged in a wi-fi repeater inside about 5 feet away, and even still it doesn't get a 100% signal strength, but it is over 50% to give it a good signal. The lower the strength the better, I thought at first the larger number is better, but it measures the loss, so a lower loss percent is better. I gained a 30-40% improvement in using a repeater inside the house, as the router is on the other side, so the repeater for the wifi works good. There is a bit of a delay when you go to view or click to load the recorded videos from the motion sensor or the doorbell being rang. It seems to depend a lot on the device you are using the app on, as older phones have a longer load time.  That wasn't a huge negative, but it is slower than I expected it to be. The primary thing that needs to be fixed on this is the motion sensor, as people walking directly to it, are not captured. Even when driving a car in on the drive, of which I have set to be in the motion zone, it will not set it off.
