It may be because it is not directly in front of it, but the zone is set to cover it, so I don't understand why it does not pick up the motion. It works every time though when someone comes on to the porch and records them, so for that aspect it works perfect, every time. I just wish that it would start the recording before they get on to the porch, and I don't know why it always picks up large trucks on the street that are not in the motion zone.
title: Near Perfect - For The Average Home's First Video & Doorbell (and what's lacking)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Peay
content: Every time the Ring had a motion detection, my home WiFi was as if all the bandwidth was being dedicated to Ring.  When I started working from home, my conference calls would drop when the door had motion. The packaging and install experience was excellent.  It even came with a little screwdriver.  I had it up and going pretty quickly.  It took a little time to configure to my WiFi, but pretty easy to follow.  The mobile App (iOS) worked most of the time.  However, often, I would be alerted as people were walking away.  The other half the time, the motion notice would alert me, but it could not connect to the camera.  Maybe my work WiFi was blocking a certain frequency? I have SO many $5.99 to $10.99 Subscriptions that adds up to $100s a month. I had purchased an extra Chime, but the dogs bark and the baby cries every time it goes off, so it's sitting on a shelf.  It worked great. I ended up disconnecting all the alerts, because it was constantly disruptive to the other devices on the WiFi.  The App allows me to limit motion detection, etc, but even with that, it was not worth dropping a call or disrupting the other WiFi needs.
title: Good product, but no longer use

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mac
content: What a waste of money. For the amount of money this costs you would think it would be a solid product. Not so. This just quits working randomly. The app shows the battery to be charged but the doorbell will not detect motion or even signal the phone when someone rings. A call to tech support and their solution was to uninstall and reinstall the app. That was a 45 minute call. Then a few days later it stops working again. I hit the reset button to see if I could get it to work. Setup failed. Very frustrating to buy an expensive product and it is just garbage.
title: Garbage

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Denise E.
content: I had been contemplating ordering a ring for several months.  I'd read through the reviews, both good and bad, and did research on video doorbells.  Once this one was discounted as a newer product came out, I decided to go ahead and order. I received it timely and, at first, was a bit overwhelmed when opening the box and seeing all the hardware.  I am about the least handy, put together type person you can imagine.  I watched the videos and read the instructions.  I had it on and working, without the wedge, in about 15 minutes.  After looking at the picture I was getting, I decided I did need the wedge (I'd talked myself into thinking I didn't need it) I took the ring down and reinstalled with the wedge.  The picture is perfect both day and night. I am still in my non-subscription free month but I knew the subscription was needed for best use.  Given the level of security I now feel, it will be well worth the cost of the ring and the subscription. I can't speak to durability as I've only had it for a few weeks.  However, it did just fine through severe thunderstorms and strong wind gusts.  Will revise if this changes.
title: Glad I Ordered

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cat D
content: This is the most incredible waste of money I have ever fallen for. I have NEVER been able to see who was at the door or what motion is detected. It has a strong connection to my WiFi and is located only about 10 feet from the router. See picture to see what I see when motion is detected or my doorbell rings. “Processing”. Later, I can look back and see what or who it was. Since birds flying by or trucks going past on the street setting it off, I generally ignore it. If someone is at the door, it’s way faster to go see who it is, even if I’m upstairs or in the basement. Don’t fall for this junk. Don’t waste your money. Buy a better system from another company. Also, I thought it recorded all the time. It doesn’t, only when motion is detected, meaning all the criminals have to do is stay out of its limited range. The police came to my door asking to look at the video because a crime had occurred practically in front of my house. No video of that, of course. We originally thought this would be the start of a video security system for the whole house. No way! As soon as we can spare the money, we’ll buy a good system.
title: NEVER shows who is at the door. Worthless!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Susan
content: I received this item and did the install as instructed.  We even hooked up a 24 v transformer and added a Cutequeen  50w 25ohm resistor to the transformer (which was a piece of cake to hook up).  It ran as 'hardwire' beautifully.  The problem was with the motion sensor - we could never get the motion sensor to work farther than 8 feet no matter where we placed it on the wall (outside).  We used EVERY setting offered, we moved the unit up and down the wall, with and without the included wedges - no luck.  (We currently use a Moultrie Cam which will capture a gecko climbing up the gutter spout and that works way better than this Ring 2 worked.  We assumed that is was defected so it was returned today and replacement ordered.  We see videos on what this unit can do so we will install a 2nd one and write another review. I am updating this review because I ended up returning the second one.  Apparently these are not defective but they are made not to start motion less than 8 feet.  I want the motion to start at the end of our drive which is approx. 20 feet.  I really didn't need the 'doorbell' feature but the motion feature was a must for us.  From what I could tell some of the posted videos of the doorbell were in fact motion cameras.  I returned this item and got the BLINK camera instead and so far the motion range is excellent for what we want it for.
title: Returned Item but re-ordered - updated

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cyclone3211
content: After watching the videos, it was easy to install.  I'm 80, so it wasn't perfectly parallel, but close enough.  Like to kow who is approching and maybe at my door, as does my wife, and this does that.  Great item along with this is the Amazon dot which also tells you when someone is there.  Video is okay but would like the response time to be shorter to get the messages and video since my WiFIi is quite fast.  Maybe an update will fix that.  Other than that, I would recommend it.
title: Who is at the front door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chung T. Nieh
content: Hard to set up correctly even with customer help over the phone. This Ring does take good picture but I can't view it on my cell phone(then what for) and agent blamed my home wifi system. The picture should send back to my cell phone via wifi or date either way, there is setting problem but the agent only think about wifi and blame my home wifi which works perfect for my computer. Agent does not understand tech very clearly. No one design a alarm system depend on home wifi only. Maybe I was wrong that the Ring is only works with wifi and it only works with your home wifi. The alarm banner appeared very short time(may be 1 second) I think you have to ignore it practically whether you like it or not,. To catch  banner you have to stare your cell phone all time. Ring only cares about money that  Ring's ad appeared long time. title: hard to set up, very short time of banner(to tell you there is someone),

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: QuizBot
content: This was easy to install and set up.  We didn't hardwire it because our current doorbell is in too narrow of a space, but that seemed simple enough if we would have done it. The battery is still around 35% after one month of use, which is better than I expected. Sometimes the video is choppy. I'm not sure if this is my sucky Wi-Fi or if it's the camera/program. It will detect motion, but then start recording a second or two too late sometimes so you can't go back to see what set it off. That's not really useful if someone was taking something off your porch.  Maybe I need to adjust my settings, but it alerts to motion, then records for however many seconds, sometimes completely missing us entering the house. For example, a car pulled up, but the driver didn't get out right away, the camera registers the motion and alerts, but several seconds go by, the camera is finished with the 30 seconds,  person exits the car and comes in the house, but that's completely missed. Or sometimes it'll stall during recording so you see someone step off the porch, it glitches so you see them stand still for 5 seconds, then vanish. Anyway, we still enjoy the camera and the live view is very clear. Sound is ok when talking through the doorbell. We've purchased the recording extension for the year.
title: Some glitches, but overall ok

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jenna
content: I just moved to a new house.  I've been excited to get out of an apartment and really get into some of the cool home automation type products, including Ring.  I bought this on prime day.  I was a bit disappointed bc of the setup of my entryway, sort of like a hallway almost with the doorbell on the wall (so doorbell isn't facing the street).  I didn't really like the idea of using a bunch of wedges and having this sticking out (thinking someone will walk into it or it would be more easily damaged).  So I opted to use the battery and put this up by the door (where imo the doorbell should be anyhow).  I guess mainly because of the hallway type entry, I don't get a great view.  Where the entryway ends, the brightness of the sun is so much you really can't see anything at all (can't make out driveway or yard, it's just bright light).  OK, not really ring's fault that's just how cameras and light work.  What I am super disappointed with however is the motion detection.  I have messed around with the settings on motion detection SO much trying to get it to work.  Occassionally it will randomly pick up what I assume is just a car going by, although you can't see anything in the video (def no one on the porch).  But when I tested it, no matter what I did - walk fast, slow, jump, wave my hand in front of the camera - it just will not pick up the motion of a person.  That was a huge reason I bought this!  Hoping to get notified if someone was at my front door (package dropoff, random stranger, etc).  It works ok when the doorbell is pressed and I was able to connect it to my Echo Dot to announce someone is at the door.  Overall, I'm disappointed.  I'll keep it because I do think it is a deterrent (maybe not, but I would hope).  Pretty much every house in my neighborhood has one, in addition to monitored security.  So it's a great concept, but unfortunately it's just not working as well as I had hoped for.  Maybe the motion detection works better when it's hardwired.  Given the location of my existing doorbell though, it seemed like I wouldn't get a very good view of anything except a brick wall.  And due to the light and poor motion detection, I'm not able to see anywhere near what I had hoped.
title: not as cool as I expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michelle Horton
content: Complete waste of a $300+ investment. The ring doorbell constantly says the battery is dead even though I’ve charged both batteries I have fully. The indoor chime worked for a few months and then wasn’t picking up my Wi-Fi, even though all my other devices in the house don’t have an issue. I realize I’m going to have to call their customer service to try to get it fixed or replaced, but for the amount of money I put into the system I shouldn’t have to do that. Completely disappointed and wish I would’ve kept my old doorbell. complete waste of a 300+ dollar investment. The ring doorbell constantly says the battery is out even though I’ve charged both batteries have fully. The indoor chime worked for a few months and then wasn’t picking up my Wi-Fi, even though all my other devices in the house don’t have an issue. Completely disappointed and wish I would’ve kept my old doorbell.
title: Waste of time and money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chase.
content: I've had my Ring installed for two weeks. Most of this review is purely information and not wholly criticism. The video quality is lacking.  My device is located 10-15ft away from my router, which is supplying 100+mbps down and 20+mbps up, even so the recording and streaming is a bit choppy. I would not call it high definition. It picks up motion accurately for the setting I have it on, which is standard. After two weeks of use the battery has consumed ~10%, that's with live streaming turned off and around 6 events a day. I would recommend if you plan to mount this to masonry then purchase a nice masonry bit and don't use the one supplied in the packaging. It's useless. Save yourself the agony of spending hours drilling a couple holes. A good DeWalt bit will do the job in 1/10th of the time compared to using the bit provided. It's very convenient that this device pairs with my Echo set up. I can view who's at my door through my Spot or Show. I can also answer my door through my Dots.
title: Gets the job done

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: James Jenkins
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. First the not so good, The battery needed to be recharged after 3 or 4 weeks.  They claim a 6 month battery life, but we made several selections that "would reduce battery life", we are not disappointed.  Realistically it hard to imagine that you could get longer between recharging then that with what we are getting. The attached video is while I was at work and my wife called to say there was a truck running out front.  I have the it set so a truck on the road does not activate it, but I was able to use the "live view" to see what was going on. We have opted for capturing the most video and it will start recording from the steam of the dryer vent on a cold day, I agree with other reviews that realistically you need to plan on spending the 3 dollars a month for the video saving.  Even with my phone not locked, the mail man is usually at the neighbors before I can get to live view, but it does do a good job of recording him every day. In nearly 2 months we have not had someone in the camera range that was not recorded. We got the first one as test, then we liked it so much we got more, we have put them on our rental properties.  The tenants are also enjoying it.  If/when they move out, we will be able to reset and use to monitor the houses when we put out the "For Rent" sign.
title: Better then expected, liked so much we put on the rental properties as well

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: FCW
content: My son kept bugging me to buy a Ring doorbell.  I told him that I didn't see a need for a video doorbell.  I finally gave in and got one when we installed our new vestibule.  This was necessary since our original doorbell would be inside the screened enclosure.  I must say that I have changed my mind completely on this product.  I really like notifications when people are at my door.  I've even conversed with people who rung my doorbell while I was away from home.  There is a $30 per year optional charge if you want the captured videos archived.  Well worth the cost, but you don't need this service to see the videos in real time.  Since I could not connect to the old doorbell, I am running the unit from the battery.  After a month and a half of use, the battery is down to 37%.  I'll need to charge the battery in a couple of weeks.  This doesn't seem to be a big deal.  Since the unit is so far away from my WiFi router, I purchased a Ring Chime Pro which provides an internal bell and WiFi extender.  I fully recommend this product.
title: It's a Great Product that I Never Knew I Needed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CN in the Sun
content: So far not impressed. I have other wifi cameras that have their own SD cards that do better. In fact, it recorded a truck entering my driveway, but the video did not start until it was pulling away. My other camera (Japanese brand) recorded the truck pulling in and pulling back out, and recorded it to a card and my phone. Also, I hooked it up for the doorbell and it apparently made the old doorbell transformer angry which started buzzing and wouldn’t stop even when I took the Ring out of the circuit. I had to disconnect the doorbell and will probably have to replace the transformer. Not sure why that happened but I wish I had installed it without my doorbell in the circuit now. And the app continually gets stuck in processes as there is no back button, so you have to close the app and reopen it if you don’t want to “add a chime” once you hit that button, or to get into settings if you entered the side bar menu (I can’t seem to exit the side bar menu).  I waited a long time to buy a Ring from all the advertising and now I wish I had not. And adding to this review: you have to pay a monthly fee to keep the videos in their cloud, apparently no other way to look at the videos. Waste of money, go buy a camera with two way communication and an Sd card to avoid the fees every month.
title: Not impressive at all- would never buy it again

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Daniel Tartaglia
content: For a $200 item you think it might at least record the when a person rings or approaches the door. If you don't by the extortion subscription ($120 annually) you don't get any history of the device. Even my logitec and Nestcams give 24 hour records for free. The webcams send me alerts, allow me to listen and speak, and keep a record of the activity for one day or longer for FREE. I had no idea this product started with the $200 price tag and then requires a subscription to work. Unless you pay the subscription, the device only inform you if someone rang the door bell....unless you pay you cant access the device...WRONG AND DECEIVING. These RING characters are hoodwinking buyers to make millions. I didn't buy this device to get on a payment plan every month. Had I known this I would have reconsidered the purchase. MY ADVICE: If you want to see who approaches your front door get a webcam.... LOGI or other. You get free alerts to your cell when movement is detected, you can listen and speak, and they record and keep 24 hours or more of motion for FREE. Unless you pay the subscription, the device only inform you if someone rang the door bell....unless you pay Ring monthly you cant access the device...WRONG AND DECEIVING.
title: Disappointed with Commitment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kristin k.
content: So I e had this since the first week in dec 2018, and I never got around to writing a review but I’m so frustrated with this product , I’m besides myself. The night vision setup is poorly designed. It stopped working about 3-4 months ago. Let me give you some history. Well it worked for a few Months and now I’ve got no night vision whatsoever.ive gone through the troubleshooting rigmarole, I passed my return period So Amazon won’t take it back and I can’t reach anyone at Ring.witj their modified working hours. Right now, I’d advise anyone who ask me about this product to look at something else.. I will see if ring will help me remedy this situation but o kinda already have an idea of what they say. Will update soon. Kristin
title: Not happy

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Just a customer
content: Ring Doorbell2: battery life - unacceptable - less than 30 days without much of activity customer service on chat - if you ask a question they do not like you get disconnected; they supposed to keep the line open for 10 minutes by their own rule - I got disconnected within 1 minute. Tried 3 times - and 3 times the same result. Their FAQs are not written by professional tech writers. They do not tell you that their device can put your house o fire and they do not explain either. And what is the "internal chime" - is it inside the doorbell2. In fact the doorbell does not have ANY "internal" chime. It may have an external chime if you buy it - but they are not sellling. They only sell remote wifi chime - which will not save your house from the fire created by lack of "internal" chime. I guess they ment a wired chime inside your house. Really disappointed by those "geniuses".
title: Beware - Customer service unacceptable

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Josh
content: I've never been able to trust this thing to actually work. It will tell me every time when the mailman drops off a letter, as long as I'm within two miles of the device. Otherwise, it's either out of battery, has no connection, or just can't tell me what's going on because the app is a PoS. It's as if the thing knows when it's an inconvenient time to just crap out. All the other reviews seem to be about how you have to pay money to get this thing to agree to do its job. Let me tell you about what happens when you actually pay that money. (1) The first time I was away from home, my internet mysteriously stopped working, and so it told me that it had switched to its emergency-only cellular backup service. When in this mode, it gives no indication whatsoever that it's still functioning. The Ring app promises that all is fine, though. I don't trust it as far as I can throw it, because... (2) The second time I was out, the doorbell reported that it was low on power and the batteries should be replaced. It kept reporting that it was around 5% power until I got home. The problem? It had already died. It was completely out of power, not functioning at all, and lying to me about it through the app. As if I wouldn't notice. (3) The fourth time I was away is right now. I'm in SWITZERLAND. The app won't open, probably because I'm in Switzerland. Good work, Ring team. If only you had ever thought that maybe your users would want you to keep working while they're away from home, and that sometimes, that will mean OUT OF THE COUNTRY. I had also bought a unit for my parents without the Ring station, for use in monitoring my elderly grandfather if he tried to leave his apartment on his own. It would faithfully notify them of their every visit. But when he finally wandered outside and fell, no one noticed until the next morning. I don't trust this thing as far as I can throw it. Look into a less commercialized, more honest and transparent system, like all the other reviews are telling you. Edit: Another interesting missing feature: letting you know when the battery is low. What a concept, right? Main base station will lose communication with the doorbell, and silently assume that there's a wifi problem while reporting that the unit is alive and well at 2% battery. For weeks, or however long it takes you to notice that the thing's just dead and replace the battery on your own. This is one of the most laughably useless products I've ever owned. Buy something else. Other products won't even charge you to download the information they record for you.
title: Functionally useless; cannot be relied on.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: p-bass5
content: This device does what it claims and is easy to install. I hooked it up to my existing door bell wires with no issues and no modifications needed. Be sure to check your mounting location before unpacking it all to see if the device will fit, because it is much bigger than a traditional doorbell button. In my case (see photo) it actually is a little too wide for the door casing and sticks out a bit, but I’m ok with it. And you don’t have to wire it to your doorbell, it can function as a stand alone device since it connects to your WiFi. So you could mount it anywhere you want. The advantage of connecting it to your existing wiring is that it also charges the battery. If not wired you will need to periodically charge it, although it appears to be a long lasting lithium pack that is easy to remove and charge by USB when needed. I’m satisfied with the product but I am not satisfied with the fact that you must pay a small monthly fee to retain video history storage after the first 30 free days. Without the video storage it serves no purpose in my opinion, so be prepared to start paying $10 a month if you want to see the video event history. So... It’s not just about the purchase price, there is also that service fee! Small monthly fees like this are a popular strategy with many companies and, again this is my personal opinion only, a part of “the fleecing of America”. Before you know it, you have all these small monthly fees with different companies that add up to hundreds of dollars a month.
title: Good product, but a monthly fee is involved

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Sheppard
content: First of all I have a full set of ring cameras and can say the quality of the video is decent and the motion detection is accurate on the ring floodlight camera and somewhat on this camera. It doesn't record constantly so it misses some things that may be important. Example, it shows it can catch motion to protect a car parked in front of your house but it misses a lot of the people walking around the car at night time. Also after 30 days now you have to pay $100 a year which was not made clear before I started purchasing these cameras and spent days installing. Pro - The neighbors app, easy to use and share ring app, image quality is decent. CONS - Like I stated before it doesn't record continuously meaning it only records when it thinks there is motion. Bait and switch subscription service. Motion detection, It ALWAYS catches the mail main but only sometimes catch people walking around parked cars infant of the home maybe 20ft away.  Also its hardwired but I still have to disassemble it to charge the battery occasionally because it drains?????
title: Its not a great solution. Just decent.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ashley H.
content: I just purchased the Ring Video Doorbell 2 and installation service through Amazon during the 2019 Prime Days! The technician just left and the service was fantastic! Not only did I get a phone call the day before the appointment to confirm it, but the actual technician called me when he was 30 minutes away to tell me he was coming. My window for the appointment was 2-5 pm; he showed up just after 2:00 and took only 45 minutes to complete the job, leaving the rest of my day to be productive!! I am over the moon with this new upgrade to my home. The Ring Video Doorbell 2 has an accompanying app that is very user friendly and adds a level of instant security to my home without a monthly fee! Yes, you can purchase monthly monitoring services for your Ring devices, but I find the included features to be enough for me for now. No matter where I am, as long as the wi-fi is on at home (the one my Ring Video Doorbell 2 is connected to), I will get a notification on my cell phone if there is movement at my front door or if someone rings the bell. This notification specifies if someone is ringing or if there is motion and you have the option to "answer" either and speak through the doorbell to the person(s) standing there - what a great deterrent for break-ins/theft!! The picture/image in the notification is incredibly clear and easy to see details of the person(s) standing there. I was worried about how the Ring Video Doorbell 2 would fit in the space where my existing/non-smart doorbell was, but the technician suggested using the wedge backplate (included with the Ring Video Doorbell 2) to put the bell on more of an angle to fit better. I'm glad to say that the new bell fits and, with the turn from the wedge backplate, the video actually picks up our entire front porch now, which is great for that security I was talking about. In fact, I love it so much that I'm thinking of getting another for our back door! Once the technician had wired up the Ring Video Doorbell 2, he tested it and it worked beautifully, ringing our normal bell chime in the home to alert us, and showing up on my cell phone to alert me there as well! If you are like I was, with a plain ol' doorbell, consider upgrading this small part of your home to a smarter option; I don't think you'll regret it!!
title: The technician was fantastic!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Melrstx
content: Love Ring in general, but the 2 is way better than the original! This has better camera quality, and the removable battery is so much easier to handle.  We bought a second battery so we can just switch them out quickly. Our old Ring had to be ripped off the door frame because the screws were stripped from taking it on and off to charge and there was no other way to get it off. Plus, while we were charging it for several hours before, we had no camera and no doorbell. No bueno! This is SO much better!
title: Removable battery is a huge plus!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Adrianne
content: I bought the Ring Doorbell 2 in mid-February, so I've been using it for three and a half months. I also bought an extra battery so there would not be any downtime while waiting for the battery to be charged. I had high hopes for the Doorbell 2 because of many glowing reviews. The install was very easy. I used one of the wedge things that was included so it angles down since the doorbell is up two steps. Install directions were clear. However using it is a disappointment as mine fails to deliver as shown on advertising videos  First of all, let me say that there is a Ring Community with answers to usage questions, etc on the Ring website. I have used that resource for the problems we have had, and my searches have returned pages and pages of answers, most of which do not apply to my questions. I have rephrased my questions a number of times and have had the same results. So put on a pot of coffee and be prepared to search long and hard through the responses if you should look for answers on the website. So now to the usage problems: 1. If you've watched videos of this product, you may have seen the conversations between the homeowner from inside the house as he or she speaks with the person at the doorbell. The owner gets an alert that someone either rang the doorbell or set off the motion. The advertising videos and audios are flawless. Unfortunately in real life at my home, though the video is pretty good, the audio is horrendous. It is about 99% static with the other 1% being PARTS of words sprinkled throughout the static. It is impossible to understand anything spoken from inside or outside. In searching how to troubleshoot this issue, among answers to many unrelated questions, I read that this problem is actually a bug and Ring has been working to solve it, but has not succeeded yet. 2. Motion seems to have a mind of it's own. I have adjusted the motion settings a number of times. At first, it alerted me to every car, truck, bicycle, bird, or mosquito that went by, so I must have had it on super-sonic-sensitive. As the troubleshooting indicated I moved the slider various times to adjust the motion sensitivity. I have it adjusted to a tolerable setting now, with fewer alerts, but sometimes it doesn't even pick up the UPS delivery person walking right up to it and leaving a package. 3. Connectivity: Since I had the problems listed above,  I read about how to improve the network signal. I placed a Wi-Fi range extender in a socket on the inside wall closest to the doorbell. According to the Ring documentation, the lower the network signal displayed in the doorbell's health report in the app, the better the network signal is for the device. The report showed that the received signal strength indication (RSSI) decreased to -45.0, which they state is better than most. Unfortunately that did not help any of the above problems. Considering I bought this doorbell so I would be aware of motion near my door and also to speak to an unknown  visitor near the door, I say the Ring Doorbell 2 is a FAIL At this point, I am hoping that updates come along that will improve the performance of my Ring Doorbell 2. Until then, I'll keep it as it is and admire how nice it looks.
title: Disappointed in This Product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mickey  Cooksey
content: The Ring 2 is fantastic, does every thing it says. But Amazon says works with Echo Show and Fire TV it does not Alexa is having problem on lots of commands. In Show you use Skills you download the Ring app. If you read the reviews the app does not work and has not for awhile people wonder why Amazon does not fix it. When you ask Alexa to show me my front door she responds then says the devise does not work to check battery and WiFi. The Ring works fantastic Alexa does not. Same with Echo command Alexa play my Music respond Hmmm something went wrong. I was told it could take to end of year or next year for it to be repaired. Amazon you need to remove from this listing that it works with Alexa
title: Ring 2 does not work with Alexa

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cassie
content: I cannot say a single thing bad about this item I run a small business out of my home & I am often on trips I love the speaker in it so I can talk to people & scare people off I love the neighborhood alerts even though my neighbors are f*** idiots but that’s besides the point The motion sensors are a little strong it’ll sometimes pick up leaves but I wouldn’t want it to miss someone & it alerts me the moment it spots the motion so by the time I unlock my phone & get into the app the person is at the door & I can see exactly who they are & what they’re up to The camera is great & night vision is amazing I’ve also been able to solve issues with amazon ups & fedex package delivery with it so THANK YOU RING you’ve saved me time & money If your on the fence stop thinking & get it already
title: Love it love it love it love it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SunshineAlways
content: I bought my ring doorbell and the  security system. I love the intercom capabilities. But my biggest complaint is the lag time to connect for me to answer the doorbell. It takes like 20 -30 seconds for connectivity to the doorbell. By that time, a package could be stolen, or the delivery person is back in their car. My internet connectivy is great and my cell phone reception/speed is decent. I feel the night vision is subpar for 2019. Ive seen plenty of videos on the ring app of perpetrators and it may be hard to identify them even without a mask. Skintones are har to distinguish with the night vision. So you will want to have flood lights. The ring app/neighborhood community is very informative. They used to have a referal program, where they give you $10 for each referral. However, i got the referral credit and still was not able to use it to purchase ring products....
title: It lags in connectivity about 20 seconds

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Oriskany
content: I originally purchased this doorbell and had some issues.  After several detailed communications through emails and phone calls with my Ring representative, every issue was completely resolved. I had the outstanding support of Kikki, an Executive Community Support Representative. On my first day of communicating with her she made a commitment that she would work me to make sure that I was totally satisfied with my purchase. I can say I am 100% pleased with the Ring products I have, their functionality, and the dedicated support that I received. My doorbell location was a bit unique as I had more of a "tunnel view" since I have walls located on both sides of our entrance.  My expectations were higher than what the equipment could provide for my situation. It turned out not to be the fault of the equipment, but the location of my doorbell. Bottom line was I could not make any adjustments to the settings to make this work. It always worked perfectly if someone approached our door, but I expected it to pick up the motion of someone walking on the sidewalk too. I learned that since I had a limited "tunnel view" people walking by might trip it, but often would be out of the view by the time it started recording. Increasing the sensitivity helped, but it caused another issue because now it picked up all the cars passing by in the street too. I ended up getting a stick up camera in addition to the doorbell. I needed both devices to cover the areas I wanted. Both devices I now have are wired. In my situation the wired devices worked better for me. I can't say enough for my representative Kikki, and with Ring and their commitment to ensure you are pleased with your purchase. It took a while but I am 100% pleased. Great product and their "above and beyond" support that I received!
title: UPDATED Review 10/5/19

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shyma
content: The motion doesn’t activate until a couple minutes after the motion activity has already passed, and the recording didn’t even catch the guy who took a package off my porch until he was already back on the sidewalk walking away. The doorbell worked decently well until the free subscription (that’s in the fine print and you don’t realize is a paid service until it’s over and you call for support on why your doorbell stopped working) ended. Bottom line, NOT WORTH THE MONEY or hassle. Honestly, not even worth the hassle even if it were free.
title: Just awful

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Diane L. Welty
content: I tried the Ring 2 doorbell.  Was planning on getting several cameras, if it worked. I am returning the doorbell. I have a brick wall on either side of my front door. Knew this would make for some tunnel vision. As I stand where I installed, I can easily see half my front yard and most of the driveway approach to the house. Somehow, the camera basically shows brick walls and only the sidewalk directly infant of it. I have two light fixtures on the side walls (4 lightbulbs). I read that they had fixed the problem of it not recognizing night time, under those circumstances. It did not seem that way. The motion detection did not pick me up until I was but a few feet from the porch (where the walls begin). It barely caught me entering the house on the next try.  This is NOT useful to me. Thankfully the easy return to Amazon, is available. The rechargeable battery takes 5 house to charge, but is very easy to remove from the doorbell.  I had high hopes for this device. I chose the Ring 2 over the original Ring... thinking I was getting a better product. It is hard to image how this could be worse.  Under the right circumstances, it may be OK.  But for may usage, it is worthless. I really wanted it to work.
title: NOT recommending....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: grouticus
content: We have had our home security system in our house with dozens of sensors, three cameras, a garage door opener and more.  I recently decided to add the Ring 2 Video Doorbell after hearing all our friends with them saying they love theirs.  After using it for a few months, I'm disappointed in myself that I hadn't added this device sooner as it is now our favorite part of our home security system.  It took about 10-15 minutes total to install on the wall and set up through the app, much quicker than I expected.  Once it was set up, I immediately started getting notifications of any movement approaching our front door which is located in a courtyard.  This is great because I can see when packages are being delivered, when friends and family are arriving/departing, or whether it's just another solicitor and I can ignore the door or answer the Ring through my phone to ask them why they are at my house.  It typically does take a few seconds to load the audio/video if someone rings the doorbell however that hasn't had any adverse effect.  The picture and sound are great and I really like the fisheye look because it captures more of the area being monitored.  I even talked our new neighbor into buying one herself and told her I would install it if she did buy one because of how simple and quick it was to put in and provide more security.
title: Best part of my home security system

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Holley
content: Bought this for Hubby because he really wanted one. It works better on a higher end smart phone versus a cheaper one. When motion detection goes off and you click on answer it takes a while to open up because it has to upload to a server before you can view it in the app. By the time the person gets to the door they could have left and drove off before you could open the app. Room for improvement there.We have a high-speed Internet connection but I think we’re going to need to get a Wi-Fi extender in hopes this will improve its performance and picture. Currently picture very Skippy, so is the sound and does not show much and when it’s dark. If it does OK when the flood light is on. Also keep an eye on your router activity. our Average streaming doubled from what we normally use on the average. It was also creating interference in the network. Some improvements needed there as well. If your cable or Internet provider has a cap on your data streaming this could be a problem. The app is interesting I do like the neighborhood information that people share. It does help bring the neighborhood watch closer and Communication. When we get a Wi-Fi extender I will update the review and let you know if it actually helped or not.
title: It’s OK. But could be better

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael C.
content: The problem is that it often doesn't work.  There are a couple of issues: 1.  Even when the range is set to the lowest setting, there are still a lot of false alarms.  The garbage truck out in the street sets it off.  A passing car will set it off.  Absolutely nothing will also set it off. 2.  The paid subscription is deceptive.  It wasn't clear that without the paid subscription, you really aren't able to use it to see who was at your door.  I understand not keeping video for a long time period, but only for a couple of seconds?  And then it's gone, unless you pay a monthly ransom fee? There are better options-you should consider them. Update:  After dealing with the Ring doorbell for a couple months, I've removed it and put it into the trash.  On occasion it connects quickly, but for the most part it can take a minute or so to actually connect to get a live view.  I tried contacting Ring, but their customer service is even more useless than their product.
title: When it works, it's great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jl9988
content: We had our bikes stolen from our fenced in patio, so I bought this. I am in love. Because we are fenced in, the ft to activation doesn't really matter, and it only goes off when someone really is there. The app on the phone is so easy to use. Just note- it is $3 a month to use the cloud storage. Anyways, we used the handy guide to install and had no problems. We did lose one of the security bottom screws that make it so no one can steal it like 2 seconds into the process, but luckily they send an additional one. The directions are easy to follow, and they give you everything you would ever need and more! Screws, drill bit, the works. The video it takes it really good quality, but it is fisheye, so know that. The sound is great too. My dog has learned the app noise and barks because he knows someone is at the door. The battery lasted about a month and a half before I needed to charge it, and that is with pretty normal use (2 times going off in AM, 2 PM, maybe 4 additional throughout the day for packages and dog walks). We turned off the function to see the camera at any time, which saves the battery.
title: LOVE this. Best purchase ever.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dan Durig
content: With demo mode this is a 5 star product. Once you are forced to pay the monthly charge it is much less functional and does not really meet what I see as advertised features. I have two of these. I received one as a gift and gave one as a gift. For the first month everything is great until they want to collect $3-10 a month. then the only thing that is still functional is the ability to answer the door.  All the remaining functionality is gone unless you pay $3-10 a month. I want motion notifications when not home and be able to pull up live video from my home without having to pay for it. I installed a DVR and can do this just fine with that so no need to pay for it here. Installation is easy assuming that your doorbell works. If it does not then you are likely going to need to either fix it or pull the battery to charge it every month or two. I broke two of the screws to mount it using an hand screwdriver so the mounting hardware is a bit lacking, but it did work fine for a different installation. I know that Amazon recently purchased them. My HOPE is amazon will include the video storage and advanced features as part of Prime in the future rather than charge and MRC on top of the service. In many installations you likely may need to get some sort of wedge to aim the camera correctly. Newer versions of ring come with this but are also 2x more expensive so this works fine. The ring neighborhood also is a nice feature allowing to see what neighbors are uploading and dealing with. I removed stars for each piece of functionality that I lost when I would not pay the MRC. There is no reason I should have to pay to stream video live from my doorbell. I understand video storage costs and could see that as a justified expense to charge consumers for. If they have setup streaming to require their servers then they made some architectural mistakes when building the platform and need to be careful how this is marketed.
title: Great demo mode limited functionality without monthly fee

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PhotgraphicLee
content: The doorbell seems good so far. I only had it for about a week. I like how easy it was to connect to the rest of my Ring system. The ease of use is great and I think as the system is updated it will get better. I can also use the video doorbell with Alexa. All I have to say is Alexa show me the front door and the camera will show up on my Tv with the Firestick connected. I read that if you have an Echo show or Echo Spot you can see it on those devices as well. I'm not to sure about the battery life since I only had the device for a week. I will report back with that info. I did read on a few reviews that the doorbell has a delay. I am here to say that there is a delay. It's only a few seconds but it's noticeable. Overall I like it so far. I'm just waiting to see how it will hold up in the weather.
title: A little lag in the connection.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nicholas M.
content: Don't waste your money or time.  And no, it doesn't actually work with alexa.  Just a cheap piece of S# running on old 2.4ghz wireless technology without the ability to stream even the poorest video quality it begrudgingly attempts to display. Ring also doesn't mention that they don't actually ring any echo device.  One would assume that once the skill was enabled and the doorbell rang, an echo would chime and the echo show would display the video from the doorbell.  Nope.  No chime.  No notification.  No alert whatsoever.  And if you just so happen to want to see the video from the doorbell on your echo, you have to ask echo to show the video, and then the video attempts to load and by then people have left and all you are shows is either a black "attempting to connect" display or a video that looks like it was from a camera that was dropped under water. I can't believe what a waste of a product this is.
title: It's a dud product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jason
content: Pros: Very clear 1080p images day or night. Easy to mount and set up. Speaker, so you can talk to people who ring the doorbell. Cons: Does not pick up people walking up to the door but picks up cars no problems. Videos stored on your phone but after "free" 2 week period you can't view non-live videos anymore on your phone. 2.5Ghz only wifi Will not work with wifi extenders Summary: I have always wanted to buy one of these for years. Finally bought one on super sale. It was a breeze to set up after charging the battery for 12 hours (only got to 80%). Installation took about 10 minutes. The system works ok. It was great for the first two weeks having the videos for playback to see who was at my door that the camera never picked up even when they were standing by it delivering a package but it is more than happy to pick up the 8 busses that drive by in the street every day m-f plus the 4 trash trucks and daily UPS/Fed ex trucks. Notifications take forever to get to your phone if on mobile so if there is a UPS delivery where they run up to the door and ring the bell then run away because UPS never waits, you won't get it in time and then you can't view who rang the bell because they want you to pay $15/mo to view your videos on your phone (not the cloud). Totally worthless in my opinion after the free introductory period. Pretty much a lawsuit waiting to happen. The camera only works on 2.5Ghz wifi networks which is odd for being a 1080p camera that pretty much requires 5ghz for direct streaming quality, no wonder it's so choppy all the time. The camera absolutely does not work with wifi extenders even on 2.5ghz networks. It fails to connect but works ok direct to the router on a 2.5ghz network. Tried at multiple locations for these issues and they are consistent on multiple devices, I have installed some for friends, it is a device limitation. Don't even bother if you use a 4g hotspot for a remote location, might as well throw it in the trash. You would be better off with a $40 trail camera from Cabellas or a $100 HD camera that stores video on a SD card and connects to your local network for mobile use. At least then you can view prior videos for free 24/7 for as long as you like. I really hope this doorbell does not fail this winter. It says nowhere the operating temps for the device until you open the box and it says -5f in the instructions. It's usually -20 to -30 for weeks in the winter here so it will be put to the test. I hope the battery does not explode, that will be fun in mid January trying to clean that up. Would not have bought if I knew that up front.
title: High quality camera that needs updates

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sherry Yates
content: The motion detector in this doorbell only detects motion 1-2 feet in front of it. I have called tech support several times and followed all of their suggestions to include purchasing a $70.00 wifi extender and it still does not pick up motion unless it is one or two feet in front of it.  The last person I spoke to suggested if the wi-fi extender didn't work, the product may be defective, so I am trying to get someone to exchange it but so far they just want to tell me to try the same stuff that they already had me do. I don't think a customer should have to spend another 3 hours on the phone doing stuff that clearly hasn't worked. Completely frustrated!!! Update: I am editing my review. I was contacted by a community support representative who worked with me to try to determine the problem, without me going through everything that was tried before. It appears that my front door set up was just not compatible with the battery ring device. She exchanged it for a spotlight camera, which is working great, no issues! Thank you Kikki!
title: PROBLEM RESOLVED-Do not buy this piece of junk!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Marcia Blount
content: I am a Geek.  I have Alexas and Smart Home Devices all over my home.  For the past year, I have had a different brand video doorbell (AlfaWise).  It came with online software that had no directions, and it lost connectivity to our smartphones shortly after we installed it.  The fix was to detach the doorbell and set up a hard-wired connection to the network, connect the smartphones, and then install it back on the house.  So mostly it was an expensive doorbell chime. Anyway, this Ring Doorbell 2 is LIGHT YEARS ahead of the other brand!  I installed it with a battery and have had it for about a week.  I have fine-tuned the motion sensor to our liking, and we are notified by Alexa whenever motion or a ring is detected.  We can see the front door at anytime on my Echo Show, and we can review the videos right from our smartphones, tablets, etc.  I understand there is a subscription price of $30 per year to store our videos.  I find that perfectly reasonable.  I have also purchased another battery to keep charged for when the other one gets low.  I am extremely pleased and would recommend this to anyone!
title: This Geek Loves It!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Marrracco Jones
content: Before I bought this doorbell, I had all kinds of problems with people trespassing on my property. Now, I have zero issues. Don’t get me wrong, I have four other cameras around the exterior of my home, and the combination of them all is a deterrent to those who aren’t respectful of their neighbors. The Ring wireless doorbell was extremely easy to install due to the provided materials, and the written as well as included video instructions. It’s as easy as charging the battery, determining where you’re going to place the doorbell, installing any adapters, installing the Ring app, connecting the doorbell to your wi-fi, and placing the doorbell in the pre-determined location. I’ve noticed that some postal service workers and delivery people won’t ring the doorbell, because they think that activates the recording. Little do they know that the motion sensors start the recording regardless if they ring the doorbell or not. It was well worth the price and now I can relax knowing that a little money spent has driven away an ignorant element in my neighborhood.
title: Easy install and worth the money...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lalabiizkiit
content: I was considering buying this product when some of my packages would go disappearing without any evidence of explanation as to what happened to them. I ended up purchasing this product and the Ring Indoor Camera after one of my neighbors notified me that someone was attempting to break into my vehicle at around 4am. Thanks to this product and it's amazing motion detection I was able to figure out that some other neighbors were taking my packages and I placed the Ring Indoor Camera at one of our bedroom windows facing the parking lot so now I can monitor my vehicle. The Ring Indoor Camera is so good that it caught someone backing into one of our neighbors car and doing a Hit and Run.
title: I love this Camera

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Medieval lady
content: If you plan to wire this to your existing bell, you will need to install a transformer and resistor that don't come with it. It may not be clear up front. If you're not an electrician, you may not feel comfortable hunting in a basement, crawlspace or attic for your old transformer (this new must replace what you already have). In this case, I recommend getting a spare battery pack to charge while the other is in use. It can be hard to get the cover off to access the battery pack: look for a YouTube video online to help with this, need a thin putty knife (or similar) to pry it off. Documentation could also be better. Once installed, it's impressive. Wide field of vision and easily adjustable sensitivity for road traffic and distance. Saves a 30 sec or so video snippet. YouTube can also help linking to Echo devices. Must download yourself to keep or buy a maintenance plan, also not included. Ring App is needed and is sizeable. Battery use is higher if camera is always on.
title: Before You Buy, read this

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike Chasman
content: The concept for this product is great… All the bells and whistle’s might look great on paper, but if you can’t actually connect to the device to trigger a “live view” it becomes useless. That’s like buying a phone that has all these bells and whistle‘s… you can check your email, surf the web, etc... but you cannot make any calls. As far as usability, the company has no business creating any new products, nor adding any new features, until the purpose of this device is fulfilled as advertised.
title: Consistently disappointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rhonda Rogers
content: I was so looking forward to receiving my Ring device. But I absolutely HATE it. I have spent hours, and hours, and hours, on the phone and with email, trying to correct line of sight, and sensitivity. I have had it installed and re-installed by a more skilled installer. There is NO WAY to move the camera in the device that I haven't tried. I did not know, prior to getting my Ring, that I lived in the middle of an interstate. I get every UPS/FedEx truck, car notices all day long. Sometimes 50-100 times a day. It's at the very LOWEST sensitivity, the LOWEST field of range. But my house sits up one step, and faces a street. I don't think of my street as busy at all!! But like I said, Ring picks up EVERYTHING. I'm looking now for a camera doorbell device that gives you better (or at least some) control over. If you have a side entrance, or do not live facing a street, this might work for you. But it definitely does not work for someone like me. Unless you want to see every Amazon truck in your neighborhood, 100 times a day.
title: I HATE this thing--NOT for everyone--Huge disappointment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike
content: I have to say I am not that impressed with this product so far. I setup the motion activation/recording for anything within 10 ft. This thing does not record until the person is already on the porch and even then it is only recording for 1 second sometimes even when someone is still moving around on the porch. This seems like a major problem with the product that needs to be fixed. I will not buy any other ring products until they can fix the current issues. Update: I worked with Ring customer support, they were awesome. They shipped me a replacement device. I installed the replacement device and it had the exact same problem as the original doorbell of only recording 1 second of video. Update 2: Product is now working after spending more time on the phone with advanced support. Turns out my firewall was blocking the ring from uploading its videos. So none of this was the fault of the device itself. Update 3: After over a year of use I cannot recommend this product at all. It is severely lacking and does not so the job it was built for well at all. I have people dropping packages at my porch that never get recorded at all. If it does start recording it is normally as the person is walking away. I have this thing set to start recording if there is motion anywhere in my front yard, yet is fails miserably. I will be moving my entire security infrastructure to a new/better product that will do the job it is designed to do. The Arlo cameras work WAY better than the Ring. I would recommend not buying Ring and go with Arlo
title: Fixed initial problem, but cannot recommend

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eyal S2K
content: I have 2 Ring doorbells. The original and I Ring 2. I bought a Ring doorbell and after about a year it failed. Support sent out a replacement (and made me ship back the failed unit) and a few months later the battery now won't hold a charge for more than a week (on the lowest motion settings). I now have to uninstall it with the special tool, charge it up for 2-3 hours, then go out and reinstall it weekly. Even when the battery is in its best condition you get maybe 4-5 weeks out of it on limited motion settings. The Ring 2 lasts about 3-6 weeks depending on how much motion. The worst is I've had more than one package disappear from my front door and I always ended up with a nice video of the persons back as they walk away because the Ring doesn't start up quick enough to capture a face. That video is also terrible quality. I had the ring on my doorbell and moved it to my front gate ( and added a ring 2 to my other gate) as soon as the Nest Doorbell came out as I have Nest Outdoor cameras on the house and know how much better Nest is. The performance of the Nest is in a different hemisphere. If you have a wired doorbell move on from considering Ring and get the Nest. Picture quality in a different league, Person alerts not just motion alerts, no overwhelming amount of useless motion alerts that take 10 seconds to get launched in the app to see when a leaf blew in the wind, and best of all, the whole event is captured and a 24/7 history is saved, not just the back of someone walking away with your cat food from amazon. The ring app update is better, but still amateur hour compared to Nest. Nest, or someone, please make a decent battery powered version so I can throw these Ring doorbells in the recycling.
title: Pretty Terrible. Performance, reliability, battery, all of it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jon curtis
content: Been working for 3 weeks and no problems. It is very sensitive as far as motion detection. It is worth the $30 annually for the monitoring. Let's hope they maintain that pricing, otherwise it is possible to send it to the cloud through free services and bypass Ring.  The ring doorbell 2 comes with an angled mounting plate. But it would be better if it was the adjustable one as sold by "QIBOX or HOMONO". Certainly more adaptable to customer needs, and would only be "pennies" for Ring. It would be more appropriate if there was tiered pricing on multiple units. Meaning it goes from $30 single to $100 multiple. Many of us would like 2 units, not 3-10. How about $40-45 for 2. With all said, I am very satisfied with the product. I was contacted by Ring to give my review on Amazon, so I have. I hope Ring listens.
title: What can you say when a product does as advertised !!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Fl
content: I finally caved and got one for Christmas. Installed it at the beginning of Jan 2020 and as of June 1st we have had to recharge the battery 2x already (not counting the initial charge before installing it). We have played around with the settings so it's not capturing flying insects or cars that are just coming up and down the corner. We still get that motion detected by we cannot seem to get motion on the driveway or people coming up to the door until they actually ring the doorbell. What's the point?  I do like the live view option as it captures things very clearly. I do not have other Ring devices in the house and it's very cheap to have the monthly service for recording for just the 1 device (it's worth it). If I could have a better battery and an easier/better way to tweak the motion detection, I would be completely happy.
title: great for close ups but not for motion detection and battery life

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hannah
content: Absolutely love this door bell. I thought it was an extra and shouldn’t get it. However, we just went through the Woolsey fires and I was able to communicate with other people from my neighborhood through the Ring app, see videos they posted, and get neighborhood alerts about power/water/evacuation orders, etc. I was also able to see ‘possible’ looters driving around in a pickup truck with a trailer attached... someone in the neighborhood caught them on video checking doors to see if any houses were unlocked! They were able to report them to the police and the looters were caught! Fantastic! It did upset me to see how close the fire got... but I was able to see out my front door, which provided me some comfort. Prior to the fires I went on vacation to Mexico and I surprised my mom when she was checking in on my house... we had a nice chat. My dad also stopped by and had a hard time unlocking my door... when I saw him struggling I was able to talk to him and then unlock the door for him (different product for the door lock but I would not have known if it wasn’t for the Ring doorbell :-) ). I installed it myself and it is connnected to a power supply, so no need to change batteries!
title: Powerful tool and powerful app

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jo-anne Sutton
content: I purchased this in November 2019. This product was great at first. The wi-fi signal was not strong at the door it was assigned so I purchased a wi-fi extender. Initially it detected any type of motion, even wind, which was annoying. We thought it might have been the motion of the wind chimes, so we took them down. It didn't make any difference. It still detected wind. We changed the settings to detect only people. That it did for a few weeks. Now I get a notification that someone is at the door, but not in real time. Someone may have come to the door, and half an hour later I might get notification. Lately, on one instance, I received a notification that someone was at the door, and when I checked the video, and it was black. The video was recording, but the entire clip was black. Before and after that segment you could see the outside, but when someone was there - nothing. I'm done with this device. It's useless, and not helpful. I'll look into other brands that may work as intended.
title: Started out great, then problems started

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Yolanda Cohen
content: Overall, I really like the concept and the features of the Ring 2. I just wish the motion detection could be adjusted more accurately. The concept of alarming for motion detection and the doorbell is a great one. Often, I like to know if someone is approaching my door before I hear the doorbell. But even with the supplied slanted down attachment, I'm still getting false alarms from passing large trucks on my busy street, even when I've adjusted the "alarmed" area to about 5 feet (the road is 30 feet away). I've tried reducing the motion zone to near zero, but then don't pick up people walking on my porch until they're at the door. And I've reduced the frequency of motion to "light" from "normal," but have experienced the same issue. So I've comprised, accepting some false positives for motion in return for picking up people at least a few feet from my door. The other negative is that if I'm outside of my home, I don't hear the motion or doorbell alarm for a minute or two, which means I've missed someone at my house. Even in my home, I can't always get a live view on my phone before that person has left. On the positive side, even with these issues, I am overall happier that I can hear the doorbell in my home and on my phone when I'm out, so even if I can't answer the door I can at least see who was there. This is great for when a delivery person drops off a package on my porch; I can then call a neighbor to move it out of sight if I am out of town, etc. So ... it's not perfect, but I am more pleased than not regarding my awareness of visitors and am living with the occassional false positive.
title: Some great features but motion detection may be an issue on a busy street

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. DFW
content: I've been using for over a month and I really like the motion detection. It would be better if you could do more fine tuning of the detection but that part of the app is a little clunky. I get an alert on my phone when the motion detector is triggered and that's very nice especially when you're expecting a package because most of the time the delivery folks do not knock or ring the bell. The video doorbell works well and I get a different kind of alert on my phone when someone pushes the doorbell button. I've not tried the talk feature yet but the sound on the video comes out fairly clear and is nice to have. Install was very simple and I'm using mine with battery and not direct wired. Looks like I'm going to get 9 to 10 weeks on a charge but I'm not that far out yet so it could be little less or more (I have motion detection on the sensitive side and the feature to take pictures through out the day turned on).  I bought a backup battery so when the current one needs to be recharged I won't have any gaps in coverage.
title: So far I like it and nice to have the video

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Engelhardt
content: Don't waste your money or time --- this product is flawed in design and software/firmware. Purchased Ring Doorbell 2 in June 2017.  It worked without any issues until late-2018.  The core problem was constant disconnection from 2.4Ghz WiFi -- regardless of 20 hours of troubleshoot with Ring support staff and me.  Bottom line -  Ring's firmware updates are likely causing the problem --  since unit failed to work with 3 different WiFi routers tried. Even when the Ring Doorbell 2 attached to my 2.4Ghz network... it was unable to show Live Video or any form of video.  Only the doorbell (audio) worked. Ring support said I needed to open dozens of firewall ports (TCP/UDP) -- which is unacceptable and opens my home network to other issues (since these ports are well known publicly!). Bottom Line -  I am disposing of the Ring Doorbell 2 and will never use Ring products again -- they don't know what they are doing with product design that WORKS in a production, home security environment.
title: Not ready for Production use in Wi-Fi Environment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: W. Tersch
content: If you live in a place where cars drive by, the Ring Video Doorbell 2 will be constantly triggered by them, even at its lowest motion sensitivity setting. I've worked closely with Ring customer support, and tried every setting over the past six months. TIP: Unlike the wired Ring Doorbell PRO, this one has no ability to define areas where motion will be ignored. So you get dozens of battery-draining false alarms per day. It also either (a) fails to record people actually coming up right to the door; or (b) has a long delay before recording kicks in, resulting in a worthless video of the back of the person's head. This defeats the purpose of a security camera. Finally, note that if your house is brick, wi-fi signals have trouble going through the wall, which can make recordings choppy. I cannot, and do not, recommend the Ring Video Doorbell 2. The wired version is a better bet, for people with doorbell wiring, because it allows you to define areas where motion will be ignored, versus recorded. PROs: inconspicuous design, and serves its doorbell function OK. Just fails as a security camera.
title: Awful motion sensing - avoid

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: B. D. McGee
content: Just installed this morning so this is more a first look review. It took a few hours to charge the battery for the first time, so let it charge overnight. Comes with everything I needed to install and more. Pretty deluxe, but expensive. I went with a battery powered Ring Doorbell because my house didn't have a traditional doorbell to replace. Instead it has an old whole home alarm and intercom system. It didn't take long to install the app on my phone and connect the Ring to my network. I tested it indoors before installing to ensure the best wireless connection. Once tested, it took about 10 minutes to install the wedge mounting plate, screw the Ring to the plate, install the battery and security screw and ring the bell! Works great, so I'm going to add some Ring cameras outside. A Ring Stick Up, and maybe a Ring Floodlight. I also ordered an Alexa Show to use as a camera monitor. Will report on this later.
title: So far its working great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: imcelv
content: I had to get the ring Wi-Fi extender for the signal to be decent. The video quality is okay I honestly do not believe that it is full 1080p the video quality seems to be grainy regardless of how strong the signal is, and I have 200 megabit internet. But even with that, the peace of mind that it provides far outweigh any of the little negatives about the device. The motion detection seems to be a bit slow as well it doesn't start recording most of the time until after somebody has turned their back and started walking away from my doorstep, but there are some times where it does start recording as they walk up so it's kind of hit-or-miss.
title: Peace of mind

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rocky Moutain Gal
content: This doorbell works well wirelessly. I am notified if someone is at my door and can see videos of the doorway. It works well both day and night. There is a short time lag before notification on my cell phone so it is not instantaneous. A few times, I have missed the person at the doorway due to this lag but they do show up on video. (Mostly delivery people who ring the bell and leave quickly) I have it attached to a ring chime and my echo dots so I get a ringing sound in the house when someone is at the door. You cannot talk with the visitor over the echo dots - just on your cell phone. I wish that feature was available Ring! It was very easy to install. Just drill 2 holes for the mounting screws using a household level, install the charged battery, and mount it. I’ve had it up for 3 months and no recharge required yet. I live in a cold climate (can get down to -20 and more) and it is working fine. I just bought a 2nd Ring Doorbell two - I like it that much!
title: Works well - will buy another one!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JRMac61
content: I bought an earlier Ring doorbell that had the 720p resolution.  I was not impressed.  The quality of the live view was really bad.  The iPhone app was very buggy.  Well, I installed this version for a widow neighbor and they have really stepped up the quality.  The 1020p resolution is a big jump, the color great.  What I really like is they have been fixing the app.  Works really well now.  I ended up upgrading my 6 month old door bell to this and so far I love it.  Ring also sells a indoor camera that you can add to your setup and that has been fantastic!  The software shows both devices and I can just tap the one I want to access.  Ring has gotten their act together.
title: Ring Products have gotten better!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Todd Gutschow
content: Every home should have a Ring or Ring-like doorbell camera!!!  So much convenience and security.  The camer works quite well.  We’re happy with it’s overall function.  We use the replaceable battery (bought another one on Amazon) so that there are no interruptions in service.  There are some cons, though.  Sometimes, doorbell or ring stick up cams don’t catch something...usually when a car goes by.  I’ve got it set up correctly.  I’ll catch about 95% of the cars going through our culdesac...but still miss about 5%.  Also, I have one stick up cam that misses about 1/2 or more of the cars on our garage side.  Can’t figure out why???  Finally, the cams work very well...but sometimes they just miss something.  I don’t know why...but sometimes, I can walk right in front of a stick up cam and it doesn’t go off.
title: Overall great performance.  A must have for any home!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: 70's Collector
content: Once I got the Ring to finally link up with the app and my home Wi-Fi network, it works good. Took some restarts of the iPhone, my network, and the Ring itself and it was finally happy. The app repeatedly kept reporting that it couldn't find the network....so one star off for that. I think a lot of people would have got frustrated with this part of the installation. Once it was up and running, it was a breeze to customize to the area of my front porch area. Impressive was how accurate the "auto-range" set-up is for the motion sensing. I then linked the camera to my Alexa Show inside the house as well. Easy enough. One thing I think that could be improved is the actual securing to the wall. I needed to use the wedge to point the camera down.
