Between the tiny screws mounting it to the wedge and only two small screws securing it (the plastic wedge) to the stucco, it wouldn't take much to knock it off the wall and walk away with it!!! Yes, I was aware of have to subscribe to keep video....I'll give that a try and make a decision. Now I'm looking to add some other cams on the outside of the house.....stay tuned!
title: Glad I'm Fairly Tech Savvy

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Terry Ball
content: Physically installing this was tedious as I had to use wedges. But, I took my time and was patient. Hooking it up to WIFI has been a nightmare. I live in a 3 bedroom rambler. I have WIFI routers hooked up to Comcast cable at each end of the house. I get 3 out of 3 bars throughout the house on my cell phone. When I step outside the front door, which is no more than 40 feet from a router I get two out of three bars which apparently isn't enough.  I even moved my bedroom router up to the window placing it within 40 feet of the doorbell. No improvement.  I get 2 bars out of 4 on the Ring app and the doorbell can't operate with that weak a signal. I did notice that when setting up the WIFI you first connect to the Bell Network WIFI, then the setup software allows you to  pick your own WIFI network. This might part of the problem. So I call customer service. They confirm that my WIFI is too weak. They suggest moving my router closer which is impractical without running cable all over the house. Then immediately suggest that I buy a Ring Doorbell Pro as it has more powerful WIFI. Fat chance. So, I ordered a WIFI extender that I can plug into the wall directly behind the doorbell. If that doesn't work, It gets shipped back to Amazon.I'm very disappointed that this thing can't pick up a WIFI signal 40 feet away from the router. After all, my Amazon echo dot works just fine standing next to the doorbell. Update: Okay, I rebooted my modem and the doorbell linked through WIFI. I get notifications, and it records video. But when I ask "Alexa, show me the front door" it repeats, "The front door isn't responding. Please check you network connection and your power." I'll figure this out yet. Why is it so difficult. Update: Third day into the install. I got the WIFI extender installed on the wall in the house directly behind the doorbell. And I got it to install. This time it worked but i couldn't get video on my Alexa Show. 45 minutes on the phone with customer service and after factory resetting the doorbell, uninstalling and re-installing the Ring skill for Alexa, re-installing the doorbell and turning on the live video, we finally got the damn thing to work. Whew. Now, if it only keeps working. I just got a motion alert from my Alexa that my wife went out to her car. I had to ask Alexa to show me the front door. DOn't know why the video doesn't come on automatically. Nothing came up on my phone other than a message. I was under the impression that when a motion alert or dorr bell ring was detected, the video appeared automatically. I'll have to call back about that. But, now that it's finally working, don't tell me about the ease of installation.
title: What?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: islandveedub
content: The Ring Doorbell 2 worked for a few months, then stopped recording unexpectedly.  The doorbell worked and sent the signal to the family phones, but that was it.  Tried reconnecting to the WiFi, but now the doorbell alert doesn’t get sent to our phones and it doesn’t record or recognize any motion.  The only thing we can do now is a live view.  This system is a total piece of crap and we had signed up for one years worth of monitoring service when it was working well, so that’s an additional waste.  Save your money and purchase a system that actually works. Update 7/17/19 - Ring contacted me once they saw my negative review.  They were actually really accommodating and helpful, working with me for over an hour until the camera detected motion and recorded properly.  However, I just noticed that it stopped recording again and I haven’t had anything since July 11, 2019.  The battery is still good and I can still do a live feed.  It just doesn’t detect motion and record automatically again.  Thank you Ring staff for your support and professionalism.  However, I am reconfirming that this product is worthless.  I need to find something reliable.
title: Worthless waste of money.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JimN
content: After posting this review: "Very disappointed. After a brief period of time where it worked fine it started to ring every time it detected motion. I contacted support which was not the best. They updated my firmware and in a couple of weeks it started malfunctioning once again. I need to replace it and can’t see myself ever buying a Ring product again." I was contacted by Ring Support who has been working hard to get my doorbell to work properly, The very fact that they contacted me about a malfunctioning product that I had ordered over a year earlier has completely changed my experience. Still waiting to see if the doorbell works the way it's supposed to, but Customer Service/Support is 5 stars!!!
title: Was very disappointed...now optimistic

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Paul S
content: When you buy the Ring Doorbells or Cameras, you are also dealing with the glitchy app.  That is the major drawback for these devices.  I have the Doorbell 2 and 2 cameras.  I had a cheaper brand before and wanted to get something from a major company that I knew I could trust- especially for something like security cameras.  The Doorbell itself is fine. - Video clarity is good.  Not great, but good - Well built - Like that it includes both silver and rubbed bronze covers - Motion detection is good, not great.  Maybe I need to adjust the settings more but I've fiddled with them quite a bit already Again, the major drawback it the app.  Seriously?  The layout is intuitive and easy to use but it is absolutely TERRIBLE at connecting with the Doorbell.  I have super fast fiber optic internet and even with that, it probably takes 30 seconds-1 minute to load live mode on the app.  ????!!! The Doorbell 2 is a good product.  4 out of 5 for it.  1 out of 5 for the app.  Unfortunately, when you buy this, you will have to put up with the frustration of the JUNK app.  Perhaps I will update this review if they ever upgrade the outrageously bad app.  For now, I'm dealing with it....
title: Camera is OK but the app is TERRIBLE!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NAOT
content: First of all, 5 minute install time. I don't think so. I am not the handiest person in the world, I think I can hold my own, but five minutes. The first one took about an hour, and then another 2 hours trying to figure out why I was not getting a motion notification. I finally gave up and called Ring. A real person answered the phone, before someone answered the on line chat (I was trying both to see if/when I would get help) The person on the phone was extremely helpful and we had the motion notification up and running in no time. I installed a second Ring and had it up and running very quickly.  The app is installed on all the phones and iPads and appears to be working correctly.  Ring supplies all the tools needed, which was a nice bonus, as I did not have a masonry drill bit.  At this time, I would recommend.
title: Just installed, so far, okay

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cornelius Qualley
content: So, I've owned two Ring first generation doorbells and I have the security system as well. I upgraded to the Ring Doorbell 2 when I moved to my new house and really can't say much good about it. I've given it about 5 months with constant adjustment of the settings, ensuring the camera is clean, keeping the battery charged, etc. It's honestly more of an annoyance than a benefit. Here are my pros and cons: Pros: • The Ring Protect plan is a good deal if you use the security system - $10/mo. for unlimited cameras and security monitoring really can't be beat. It's probably the one reason I've kept it this long. • The push notifications are pretty responsive, you get an alert within 5-10 seconds of someone arriving, usually before they get to the door (depending on location of course). • The app interface is pretty good...I don't know, I'm really reaching for a third "pro" Con (#1 Worst Issue): • Unable to connect or slow connecting. This is literally the worst thing about this device. I'd say more often than not, I get a notification, click to open the app, and it just spins...and spins...and spins "trying to connect". Sometimes it'll connect, sometimes it won't, you just never know. On one occasion, my wife was meeting someone from Craigslist at our house and said they were acting a little weird, so I tried to watch in on the Ring. The first time I opened it up it connected right away in live view, within 1-2 seconds. I tried to switch back to the app after texting her and literally tried to connect to the Ring for 10 STRAIGHT MINUTES and could never connect. Honestly, what's the point of a motion notification if when you click on it it just sits and tries to connect for the next minute. I literally have to wait and watch the recorded event half the time. Cons (Doorbell): • The new removable battery is probably worse than the original design. The cover is so fragile that I broke it the first time removing it to get to the battery. Sure, you could keep two batteries I guess, but who wants to spend an extra $30 just so they can have a spare battery for their doorbell. • The video quality isn't good. By today's standards, the video quality is just bad, especially for a second generation product. I honestly can't see any difference in the quality over the first gen doorbell. • The night vision is bad. I purchased the Ring 2 because they claimed an improved night vision, I'd honestly say it's worse. I have sub $100 security cameras that are FAR superior in night vision and quality. • It's really expensive. I mean, come on, we're talking $200 for a doorbell. The cost of HD video cameras nowadays is next to nothing, the only advantage of the Ring is that it has a button on it and nicer looking software. Cons (iOS App): • Motion detection has a SUPER annoying flaw. Every week or so, my wife and I get CONSTANT notifications (every 5 minutes or so) of motion, forcing us to just turn off the notifications. It eventually starts to work correctly again, but it happens regularly. I've tried adjusting the settings dozens of times (e.g. frequency, distance, zones, etc.), nothing helps. It's honestly so annoying I'd rather not have it. I'll watch the recordings and not a single thing is moving, yet I'll have dozens of recordings (see photo). • Recording is delayed. As has been discussed many times on here, there's a lag before recording start. • The app has an annoying thing where opening the app triggers a motion alert on everyone's device. Open the app = everyone gets a notification. Also super annoying. All in all, would I buy another Ring? No, I would not.
title: Tried to like it, but it's surprisingly bad

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ralgiers
content: Purchased the Ring Video Doorbell 2 after much research and reading reviews. It worked great for the first few weeks, then lost Internet connection. Had to reset following Ring App instructions. Took many tries, but eventually reconnected. Worked for about another week then unable to connect. Called Ring, went through all of the troubleshooting again, testing our router (which works fine with every other device in the house), resetting the device, etc. No Luck. We acutally have a WiFi extender right above the front door. Also have the Ring alarm system which has no problem connecting to our network. This doorbell is a dud. Need to return but Amazon is saying we are outside the return window...
title: Only Worked for 1 Month- Would Not Connect to WiFi After That

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hayden
content: I have owned the Ring system for a month, and I have spent more time trying to fix them than the amount of time they have worked properly. Its like the people who developed this product were intentionally trying to frustrate their consumers when they designed these damn things. More on why I feel this way below: 1. Connectivity issues, making your purchase useless. If you have a modern wifi gateway with two channels, forget it. Your “first in class” Ring system will disconnect from your long range channel every other day and cease to feed your phone live video or record anything. I’ve modified my gateway settings to dedicate the Ring devices to the long range channel...still disconnects every 2-3 days and I have to reset every one of them. 2. INANE device settings. The Ring app provides device features that allow you to “snooze” the device or disallow light triggers if you are, lets say, trying to enjoy a quiet dinner on your back porch. I’ve tried every configuration to stop the outdoor camera from interrupting dinner with its intense bright light, but no matter what settings I adjust, it STILL illuminates every time a damn shadow passes in front of it. I now take the battery out of the damn thing when we eat on the back porch. Super convenient. Thanks, Ring. 3. Cost-to-value ratio. These are supposed to be premium products. Ring is supposedly the industry leader (not sure why), and they claim to offer a user-friendly product and service, but if you buy this package you are paying for a garbage product from a garbage company. The devices themselves are flimsy plastic pieces of crap and they rarely work. Then they want you to pay an additional subscription fee in order to save your videos? My Ring devices don’t even record anything 80% of the time because they’re disconnected. What videos would I be paying to save? Save yourself a lot of money and frustration. Invest in a wired home security system. I 100% regret purchasing this company’s overvalued junk.
title: DO. NOT. BUY. THIS. PRODUCT.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard M.
content: This is possibly the most frustrating piece of equipment that I've purchased in many years.  I bought and set up this doorbell about 7 months ago.  It would constantly announce false motion notifications even after I adjusted the sensitivity way down.  Now it will still false notify of motion at times and at other times it will not notify of someone at my door.  I've been on the phone with customer service many times without success.  They told me it's because my wifi signal isn't strong enough.  I have Fios Gigabit internet service.  The signal at my door (outside) lists at 150 mbps on my Samsung S9 using Speedtest.  I will be looking to replace this with something that works.  I strongly suggest that you do not purchase any  doorbell made by "Ring".
title: Extremely Frustrating Doorbell  DO NOT BUY!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sarah
content: I used to have the Nest doorbell/camera but recently moved to a home that didn’t have an existing doorbell, so I went with this one for the battery. I’ve lived in this house for about a month and the battery has died twice. I own two so I can switch them out, but it’s just another thing I didn’t want to have to worry about. Something else I dislike is that it just shows you “motion.” The Nest would differentiate between a person or other motion and it would say “motion at the front door” or “person at the front door” or even “sound at the front door.” You could customize further to have it only notify you when it saw a person, which is all I cared about anyway. The Ring does not differentiate and dies quickly because it notifies of every passing car. The Nest is far superior. The only pro of the Ring is the fact that people in your area can post about potential issues, theft, etc. Overall, the ring is decent, but I don’t think it’s the better option.
title: Nest was better

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ALT
content: I purchased the ring doorbell in June and had it installed around August.  As of November 21st, it is malfunctioning. Sometimes it picks up front door activity and sometimes it doesn't.  I'm unhappy with this product.
title: I'M DISAPPOINTED

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: privatperson
content: We had upgraded to this one.  It has saved us so many times. Had a porch Pirate stealing our packages and was able to use the video to show the police what she looked like. They actually stopped her and questioned her and photographed her wearing my SHIRT!  Amazon replaced the stolen shirt and the detective came over to compare photos of her wearing my shirt and the new shirt replace to see if it was the same. He just started laughing it was so obvious.  Note to Porch Pirates, don't wear turquoise pants and bright white sunglasses and have your hair in a messy bun wearing flip flops while stealing packages.  Another night we had some drunk kid trying to open our door. I never woke up to check but it was scary to see the next morning. You can always check who is out there before you open your door. plus the info goes to the cloud incase they try to dismantle it. Worth it every penny.
title: wll worth it for the price!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Janice Morse
content: At first I thought this was great because the video quality is good and it has night vision. But it is SO DELAYED in notifying you that someone is at the door that I would be murdered by the time the notification comes through.  Like ... it goes off AFTER the person is on the house already!  Earlier today my son walked in from work and I had a whole conversation with him and THEN the stupid motivation went off.  If that was "the killer" I'd be dead and buried in the yard by the time the notification comes through.  And the motion detector is also very delayed.  Someone can come up the front walk, up the front steps, and it doesnt start recording until they are walking in the door.  What good is that???  Super annoyed for the amount of money I spent on this.  So basically, it's good as a doorbell but not for security.
title: Not good for security purposes ... just for doorbell.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: IronSpider6
content: Unsure as to why I never purchased one of these my other houses but glad we did here! Didn’t realize that something so small would make me feel much more comfortable and safe. Easy setup and instructions through the app. Worst part was installing into the cement (it’s crooked but who cares). Super simple to use through the app and setup the zones you want it to pickup movement (see pic of UPS truck, My setting only picks up bigger vehicles that drive by as my settings are right at the curb). Also notifies me when someone is near the front door before they even ring (if they do). One door to door knocked on the door and it picked him up while we were taking a drive. Just told him we weren’t interested and it eliminated the need for a face to face. Night vision isn’t all that great (see pic) but I plan on getting a couple other cameras to augment this system and be able to see the blind spots. We have seen a small spike in vehicle break ins around the area since the start of the pandemic so that’s what makes me want to get ahead of this. Lastly, the app gives notifications from other Ring users as to what’s happening around us (breaking, suspicious vehicles, etc) so we can be more vigilant. It also allows me to rewind when my boys are fighting in the front yard to see who started the fight and who needs to be yelled at!
title: Great product that gives me peace of mind and feel in control of my home security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Steven R
content: worked ok when we put it in but each update made it worse.  Now I can't even get on my account because they added a two step verification that sends my access code somewhere that isn't to me.  Can't fix because I can't get on. Update for 5/28/20 Just spent 34 minutes on the phone with customer support about not being able to get on the system and they can't change it.  Now waited 40 minutes for call back from supervisor who tells me they can't change it.  This system just get worse and worse every minute.  I would return it if it wasn't already too late.  Ready to just throw it in the garbage and take the hit for the cost.  Much more frustrating than the cost justifies.  PLEASE BUY SOMETHING ELSE, THIS SYSTEM IS JUNK!!!! System is also so slow 🐌 that "live" is just a bad joke.  This was when I could actually get on my account. Don't waste your money on this junk, go with google
title: Total GARBAGE, updates just make it worse

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patrick Von Maryland
content: Before you purchase this ,I recommend taking a Wi-fi connected device outside to check on your signal strength.It is best if you are at full strength,my Ring connected very well but I had full strength.The battery in the unit holds up great.I lose about 1% strength a day so I can go almost 3 months before having to recharge.I had no problems hooking up to my Alexa devices and get motion/bell notifications fairly quickly.The picture is great and the app works very well.The $30 subscriber charge for a year is well worth it.My prior security system was more expensive but had no charge internet support with motion notifications,that is until they updated their systems and stopped supporting the web.So now I have an expensive video recording system that I can’t check on.But Ring is inexpensive to start and the subscription model insurances against just abandoning the product after a few years.Highly recommend this doorbell.
title: So far a very impressive unit

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gregory M. Bruening
content: Loved the idea of a video doorbell but my outer walls are preventing a full-strength WiFi signal from getting out. I can connect and use my phone on the porch well enough but the Ring is constantly losing/dropping connection which leads to immensely delayed notifications followed by (if I answer the Ring) a .5-1 frame per second view of the person leaving. I'd hope the internal antennae would be a bit strong knowing that these are installed outside where I'm sure a majority of people have weaker WiFi signals but that's not the case. Additionally getting settings to go through has been an immensely frustrating experience. I've yet to successfully change the motion settings despite following every suggestion on their forums. I eventually turned them off as I got tired of cars driving by triggering motion but not USPS carriers on my actual porch. The neighborhood feature is really nice in smaller neighborhoods and with sharing to Nextdoor it can help inform everyone if someones lurking around for packages.
title: Fun experiment, probably wouldn't buy again but good app experience and solid feeling hardware

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Picturelarry
content: **D NOT BUY** Fell off Mount after 4 months..... the screws that were supplied were too short.... I’ve worked with ring tech support ( 800.656.1918 ) at help@ring.com And for 5 months have not been able to help me..... they just can not seem to understand me .... I’ve spent hours and sent pictures...!!!!! Also the WiFi internet connection are horrible.... I’ve got 2 ring ll doorbells and two spot light cams.... all WiFi connectivity is very weak!!! I bought a ring chime pro extender to solve this problem and it was worthless !!!!! All my ring cameras are within 20 of my Comcast Xfinity router which has been check yet the connection  is so weak that if some one should ring my doorbell they are long gone before I can get my system to respond... Save yourself the hassle and choose another systems..... if this does not convince you I’ll sell you my entire $1,200 ring system for $200!!!! Next stop s the GARBAGE !!!!!
title: DONT BUY!!!! Poor customer service, bad product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: KB
content: I’d like to give Ring’s customer service a 5. Their product is more of a 3.5 or so. Definitely has potential, but also seems to have some shortcomings. I’m still happy I purchased it however. Set up is relatively simple. Install went a lot faster and easier than I imagined. This is where one of my issues began. WiFi signal...or lack thereof. It’s pretty bad. Yes I have an older home with brick and stucco and solid walls. But the doorbell is less than 12ft from my router! We have cable WiFi dual band 500mbps the whole works. The Ring has a moderate to decent signal, it was really bad before I relocated the router from 20ft to 12ft. This is a shortcoming of their product. You’ll see numerous reviews online of signal issues. Thankfully mine was resolved relatively easily without needing to buy their WiFi extender etc. The camera is good, but not great. Would really like to see them step it up a notch. Guess we gotta wait for the next version. Night video is ok, it’s what I expected. Motion capture can be a little slow in its capture. Sometimes you won’t even see what caused it to pickup if it went by quickly. Customer service was top notch. I had an issue with a defect on the angle mount plate. They were really nice about the whole thing. I sent a photo and they sent me out a whole new install kit. We’re apologetic and just overall very pleasant. I installed two angle mounts and the tilt mount on mine. Had to make my own screw holes on one of the angle plates. Since it wasn’t meant for so many to stack. But I didn’t want to relocate and re-wire my doorbell and I definitely didn’t want it to run off of battery. Overall I am happy with the purchase. But I’m betting the next gen doorbell will be even better. And most  likely closer to my expectations.
title: Good customer support. Decent product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joey Magnuson
content: We LOVE our Ring doorbell. Installation was pretty easy and the night vision works very well. With “live mode” turned off, the battery easily lasts 2-3 months for us since we don’t live in a super busy area. I will say the recording some times has a delayed start and I’m not sure if that’s from the mediocre WiFi connection or a problem with the motion detection itself. We don’t have a huge house but the modem is in the back while the doorbell is out front, so for now we deal with that inadequate connection - not feeling like shelling out another $50 for a “WiFi extender” or what have you.
title: Very good, despite some connectivity issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jssnyder
content: We have tinkered with this thing for a year and a half and we're so done. It regularly picks up cars driving by despite the adjustable range being shortened all of the way up our yard to the door, it often doesn't record when someone comes up to the door, and it has loading errors so often when trying to use it that if you needed to quickly record something it will give you an error message long after the time has passed. One plus is that the battery life has been pretty decent for us, but it is an all night or all day event to recharge it. Someone just rang the doorbell but it was not recorded, not even the doorbell button press is showing on the website or the phone app. We pay $3 a month to get access to these doorbell recordings, but the device can't even be counted on to save them. The app can be a huge pain and it saves every video you view to your phone, so it can eat up space quickly. I don't recommend this doorbell and I am going to replace it.
title: Randomly chooses when and what to record

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Moti Vator
content: Bought the first unit for package delivery security. We live in a very safe secure, some would consider upper class neighborhood. Imagine my surprise when my first unit was only installed 2 mos. before helping to catch a thief that was breaking into cars in our neighborhood. Police were very impressed I could email them the video as we filled out the report on the spot! Just added more cameras, and yes I pay for the cloud service, it’s worth it and easily justifiable at the cost of a couple lattes a month for the piece of mind we get!  The beauty is we were notified of activity with the motion sensor which got my dogs and I up at 2AM, dogs barking scared off thief from our house, I played video and called 911. My neighbor unfortunately had some expensive items stolen and the video in combination with the thief’s attempt to sell at a pawn shop got he and his accomplices busted!
title: Wow, bought for package security, but just helped police catch a thief!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: treasure hunter
content: It worked fine for a week or two. Then it started missing motion detections, Would freeze in the middle of a recording event and the middle of the event was totally lost. Had several false alarms, and some missed rings. Checked my router, internet speed, checked the installation of the ring devise and more. Did not help a bit. Adjusted the detection zones in the app (when I could even GET it to connect to my phone). Total waste of money--check out the competitors--get one that works! I now have 2 of these pieces of junk and a spare battery and money sunk into their web storage offering.  All useless!
title: Almost useless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MH
content: I’ve had this doorbell for over a year now and it gives me a great sense of security knowing I can see who’s at my door even when I’m not home. This doorbell is very easy to install and even comes with an included multifunctional screwdriver. It took me about 5 minutes to install and add the camera to the ring app. Remember to scan the QR code on the back of the doorbell before installing it since it is necessary to activate the doorbell. One downside of this doorbell is that is a bit of a fishbowl view meaning that the footage it takes is round on the edges and distorted slightly. It also takes a while for it to go live depending on your internet connection. I would recommend hardwiring this doorbell if you are installing it in place of an existing doorbell since it will ensure that the doorbell doesn’t run out of battery. The included battery has decent battery life but it certainly could be better. The 1080P resolution is good and makes it very easy to spot disturbances. Unlike most users, motion is detected very quickly for me and it only takes a few seconds to get to live feed. One gripe I have with this doorbell is that no chime is included. I do need to mention that since most people problem will own an echo device to connect to ring, this might not be a problem since you can setup the echo as a chime. This would’ve been five stars if it loaded faster, didn’t have such a distorted view, and came with an included chime since this product is worthless without one. I didn’t have any problems with the chime myself since I received a free echo dot with my purchase but since this was a limited time offer it isn’t always included. I do think this product is worth it but if you have existing doorbell wiring, I would recommend purchasing the ring doorbell pro instead. If you have poor connectivity, I would recommend going with a WiFi access point over their ring chime pro since that device only supports Ring products and transmits 2.4G signal. I am very impressed with the battery life of this video doorbell. 10% of battery has lasted me more than a week and a full charge lasts 2.5-3 months for me even with frequent detected motion.
title: Good security, wish they included a chime

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Janice Tancredi
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Please excuse the mess on the lanai, we are remodeling. So, I was sceptical about purchasing this after reading some of the reviews but then figured we could always return it so I took the plunge, I’m glad I did. * The set up was super easy, super easy! * You don’t have to have the monthly service, saving the recordings, but I recommend it. *The monthly service fee is as low as $3 a month, I chose to get the $100 for the full year, covering all ring devices, we are so impressed we are also going to purchase the floodlight camera for the back yard. Our WiFi is close to the front door so we always have a strong connection. *I like you can set videos as a favorites, you can download the video as I did and you can snapshot any part of the video or live view. My husband is a police officer and will often check out the ring while at work. ** one of the things I was concerned about was the devise being set off all the time by my animals but nope, it’s smart enough to know the difference between a dog/cat and a body. It’s great! The microphone is good too... sometimes when I arrive home from work, my husband will talk with me through ring... it’s cool. We are very happy with it. We definitely recommend this.
title: So many great benefits

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Daniel Gulino
content: Extremely happy with this.  Encountered only one snag with the installation, which was not this product's fault, and it was quickly resolved by Ring's technical support.  That technical support service is the best I've ever encountered. Easy to reach on a Saturday afternoon, and they quickly pinpointed the problem (the video would not appear on the smartphone we installed the app on) as a setting on our wireless router that needed to be changed.  Once that was done, everything worked great.  We can see and talk to whoever is at the door from anywhere so long as our phone is connected to the internet.  We can turn on the camera any time and see what's going on by the front door. The motion sensor nicely notices any movement by the front door and turns on the camera and records it.  We live well away from the street, so no stray motion by passing cars or pedestrians inadvertently turns it on.  Highly recommended!
title: Easy installation and works great!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: william juaire
content: Update: I have installed my second replacement Ring2 because the first two failed. This one is not working properly so i will probably be replacing this one. Ring product quality control is very, very poor. I would never again purchase a Ring product. I installed a Ring2 on an existing electro-mechanical doorbell system with a 16 vac transformer. It worked great for over 5 weeks, charge level staying between 98% and 100%.  Now the charge goes down 5% per day requiring me to remove the battery pack to charge it. There have been no changes in the ring environment to account for the charge problem. The battery is not being charged internally. Voltage at the transformer is 17.1 volts. Voltage at the Ring2 rear terminals is 17.1 vac. Lack of a voltage drop at the ring terminals means that there is no charge current flowing into the Ring2. The Ring2 is not charging even though there is 17.1 vac at the terminals. I think there must be an internal failure of the charging circuit. I called the Ring help line (800-656-1918 ). They replaced the Ring2. This did not correct the problem.  I even replaced my 16 volt transformer with a 24 volt transformer.  I tested voltage and current at the Ring2 terminals. Voltage is at 24 vac, Current flow at the Ring2 terminals is 9 mA. There are many similar problems posted here on the Ring Forum, A similar post here on the Forum stated that his charging problem occurred after a firmware upgrade. His issue was not temperature related as he lived in Southern Florida. As mine worked great for the first 5 weeks, And now I have the same problem, even with the new Ring2, and nothing in the environment is any different than the first 5 week, I am wondering if this is a firmware problem. Ring is replacing my Ring2 a second time If this is a quality issue, I would suggest other providers as the Ring products may have quality control or firmware issues. My question to Ring technicians:  Do you have a firmware issue causing this problem? That is the reason for the very low overall rating
title: FAILED AFTER 5 WEEKS

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Z. Sandon
content: Bad hardware. Bad software. Worse instructions. Worst customer support. Understand Amazon bought this dog. Idea is wonderful, its application is amazingly inept. Whoever Amazon left in charge of this enterprise is running it into the ground. Setup is a nightmare. Items which would seem to be elementary are simply never indicated anywhere. "Manual" is an incredible joke. You will stumble about until you call their customer service and follow their instructions (equally given without any understanding of ANYTHING from somewhere in East Kazakhstan) to allow unit to join your LAN. You think you're not illiterate in these matters? Don't you worry! Ring will bring you back to illiteracy. Once unit begins to operate you find out that the initial charge, despre having received an USB cable, should only be done via a 110v charger. (Has Ring included such a charger in a $200 unit?? Glad you asked. NO!) 5v USB power? No good. 24v transformer power? No good. Another hour with Ring customer support, your comedy entertainment for the day. Will it ever work? Hope so, one day. That day is not here yet. This unit is the grandfather of the unit that will one day deliver as promised. If the people now in charge of Ring won't be replaced, that day may never come. Once you may get over hardware issues, the software is pitiful. This is where you may begin to appreciate the Apple way of doing things. This AIN'T IT! Fact is, it's a textbook case of how NOT to do things. ANY things. If I sound irritated it's because I've put so much effort and energy into this dog that I hate returning it to buy a better one. That day may soon come. VERY soon.
title: Wish there was a ZERO star option. Or a NEGATIVE one.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: K
content: Phantom notifications would go on 24/7.  Turned out to be bushes on one side and their reflection in the windows on the other side of the door.  I was able to stop them by using customized zones where you can shape the zone to avoid offenders, but it takes a few seconds longer to get the notification.  To do that tap on the 3 dots just above the Front Door view (NOT at the top of page), then settings > motion settings > custom zones and advanced motion detection.  The delay is noticeable. I'm told voices from the mic sound like Charlie Brown's teacher, but they could just make out what was being said. Ring 2 captures the video at the instant of detection, however connecting live is slow and unreliable so I wait and see it in history.  Between that and the delay from custom motion zones I wouldn't see anything at all if I didn't subscribe.  I'll get a wifi extender, but based on other reviews this may not help.
title: Phantom motion triggers solved

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Angela Yuriko Smith
content: I was annoyed from the beginning because when I bought the Ring there was no mention it only records video with a subscription service. While not much, I felt like it was misleading to tell me after I purchased that I needed to now pay every month. This is not why I regret this purchase. It's an unreliable piece of junk. We have packages stolen in our neighborhood, and it seems like every time I need to go check footage, it wasn't working. I drops from the wifi all the time, even though the router is about 15 feet away in a straight line. It doesn't tell me it's offline and I can't get it to send me notifications. It sends my husband notifications but ended mine on its own. I read about all the hacker issues and all I can think is I wish my Ring worked well enough to be hacked. The last straw was getting hit by the package thief only to find the Ring was once again offline. We paid $200+ and $3 a month for nothing. I regret few purchases but I regret this one.
title: Very tired of fighting with this.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AJ
content: I recently purchased one of these doorbells to keep an eye out on my front door while I am away for the day at work. At first I had my motion sensativity way too high with live view enabled and since my front door faces a main street I would get notifications non-stop all day. Since I had the sensativity up too high the battery went from full to 50% in a matter of days. I readjusted the sensativity using the optimized questions within the app and the battery life is way better. Overall I love my ring 2 and love the ease of use of the app and the quality of the picture quality. Also I like that I was able to link the ring to my amazon alexas and since I have multiple alexas around the house it verbally tells me when motion is detected at the font door, i think this is helpful if I am home and dont have my phone right in front of me to check the notification. Also if you have an amazon fire stick or fire tv os u can enable alexa to turn on the live view of the camera on your tv. I did look into adding more ring products like the spotlight cameras but I thought the price tag per camera was too high
title: Super Convenient With Great Picture Quality

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Christina M
content: I like the Ring doorbell. A lot. I don't love it. The battery sucks unless you don't use it at all, the field of vision is just a tad too narrow due to the restricted activity zones.  The recording zone is a semicircle.  My house faces the street.  It won't allow me to record the side of the yard without also recoding every single car that goes by.  I have it set to a low sensitivity to get about 3 weeks out of the battery (instead of a few days due to high traffic), and because of that it doesn't pick up people walking up to my front door, but still records too many cars.  I would like to buy a second one, and I don't mind paying $30/year, but I don't want to pay that for multiple devices.  I will definitely be looking into different brands for additional coverage in the Ring's unfortunate blind spots.  If you don't have the street or can hardwire it immediately  (I have to hire someone to run some line), it can be a 5.  For a busy inner city location only on battery, it is going to be 3 or 4 depending on your distance from the street.  Also, the doorbell is slow to load on my phone, and the sound cuts out, but that could be due to a variety of other factors (wifi strength, phone battery, etc). There was a shooting outside my house about a week ago.  The thing was charging so didn't catch anything.  If you need it for bad areas, definitely consider the crappy battery.
title: Perfect for some, meh for others

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gregg
content: The camera is solid. Motion sensitivity is definitely good; you'll likely get annoyed if you set your sensitivity too high good... works REALLY well with Echo show. Actually, the Show works better than the app. The app....needs help. There's a significant delay between motion and app broadcasting,  especially if opening via the notification. Of course, you have to wait for the event to pass completely before rewatching and see what the cam even caught. There is another caveat as well; should you want to KEEP any recordings, you have to pay for the Ring service. I think basic plan is fairly inexpensive, but it feels like your videos are being extorted to you. At least provide a self-storing option in the form of some kind of SD card or data wiring into an in home storage unit. This hardware as a service model is not uncommon, but it is unwelcome, especially on an app that operates more slowly than anything else on my current gen devices. There should also be a flat riser option along with the angular choices provided.
title: Cam is solid. App is not.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: susan sakio
content: I've had this doorbell for about a month now and it has all of a sudden just stopped working saying something about a validation certificate failure?  UPDATE:  THE DAMN THING IS SO HOT IT IS ACTUALLY MELTING.  I contacted Ring support and they are suppose to have someone contacting me shortly.  Even though they know I'm afraid of the doorbell bursting into flames, I have been told not to touch it until someone gets here.  I'm glad I paid the extra and had this professionally installed so no blame here.  I wish this would allow me to post a photo, it's ridiculous!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Amanda stewart
content: So I’ve had the doorbell 3 months first once it was off the 7 day plan the WiFi wouldn’t connect. The router is 10 feet away. I purchased the WiFi extender and have it plugged in in the same wall 16” away. That’s seem to fixed issue with the Wi-Fi. Now I am having an issue that it tells me that the battery is not charged and it is off-line. I fully charged two separate batteries in both instances it came back saying that it was low and off-line.I spoke with Tech Support and they are issuing me a replacement. I have to say I’m not that happy considering I spent $169 for a product that seems to be having major issues in less than six months  I spoke with tech-support and they are issuing me a replacement. I have to say I’m not that happy considering I spent $169 for a product that seems to be having major issues in less than six months. product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: EJ Honda
content: I've had this working for a few days and already I'm really disappointed with the amount of false motion alarms I'm receiving.  We live on a cul-de-sac, and our front porch is approximately 50 ft from the street leading into our circle.  I am constantly getting alerts for cars entering and leaving via that street, despite repeated attempts to adjust the sensitivity of the motion detection to reduce the distant of motion detection.  I've found one setting that solved the car issue - setting it to the minimum.  Problem with that is it then detects NOTHING - I walked right up on my porch and stood inches from the Ring, and it didn't alert or detect.  Fantastic.  Using the automated settings haven't worked, either. The other issues I've noticed is that we have a covered porch, and on a sunny day if someone steps onto the porch, they are just a dark outline due to the brightness of the background.  I've tried some other video settings, but all that did was make EVERYTHING too dark and without much detail. My friends told me about their Nest cam and how great it is (it even has facial recognition so it won't alert on people you identify as regular visitors), and now I'm wishing I had gone with that instead.  I'm bummed I got taken in by all the marketing that Ring puts out.
title: Disappointing motion detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SPAMEGGSNRICE
content: I’ve had issues with every ring product I’ve ever bought. Ring had to replace my first ring camera/light after quite a bit of back and forth. My new camera/light does work but the night vision is non existent and the picture is considerably blurrier than the original camera I had (they probably sent a refurb). So then, with the doorbell - the picture was okay for what it is, no issues, until we switched internet providers. Now, despite following instructions, trouble shooting, re setting, etc the ring door bell refuses to connect to our internet basically rendering it useless. It’s always something with the Ring products, which is really disappointing because I do like the layout of their app and some of the features they have on the app like the neighbor stuff, ability to save and send videos, etc. Everyone I know with the NEST systems/cameras doesn’t have these issues and the picture is so much clearer. My next house will be a NEST house but for now these Ring products will have to suffice.
title: Should have gone with NEST and here’s why:

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Faye Mobilia
content: I've had the Ring Doorbell installed for a week now and I can say that it performs as well as the adds say it does.  The images are clear.  The night images are also good.  The doorbell assembly is easy to assemble and set up. The only negative I have is that the sound is not as good as I would like.  I don't know if it's the fault of the product or of my wifi.  I purchased a wifi boaster to install near the doorbell hoping that this will resolve the problem. The product is made well and seems to be very durable. It includes excellent assembly and set-up instructions.  I'm please to have this as another security system option for my home. UPDATE; It's now winter ( I live in northern Minnesota) and the Ring Doorbell is useless.  As soon as the temperatures dropped below zero the doorbell quits working.  I would take the battery out and warm it up but that would only be good for a couple of hours before it would go out again/.  If you live in an area where sub-below temperatures are common, be aware that your doorbell camera will stop working.  Something Ring should disclose right on the box.  I would change my rating from five stars to two stars because of this.
title: Quality Product -But cold weather is a factor

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: A. Rizo
content: So good we've purchased a second one. We love our ring camera and it's already paid for itself by keeping someone from taking a $300 bumper cover package off our porch. The delay to go to the live view on my phone's app is virtually non-existent, which is a MAJOR problem with my ARLO cameras (so much so that I am getting rid of them). product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Crazy shopper
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Update: These are awful. Watch the attached video. product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Hawk
content: Never thought I would love a doorbell this much! Was not expecting to pay $3/mo to save videos (basically a requirement if you ever need to show who was at the house, etc)  Would consider adding another doorbell to the back door and a security camera / flood light but not willing to pay $100/yr for the service... product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. King
content: I owned the first generation Ring doorbell for years and decided it was time to upgrade. Because of how our doorbell is wired, I decided to purchase a Ring 2 because it claims to have up to a 6 month battery life and I can't wire it into my doorbell based on where the wiring is located. The installation was easy. We installed it onto the old bracket that was already there for the original Ring. We charged the battery, and set up everything correctly. It was working fine, but the battery died after about three weeks. This kept happening, so after a few months I contacted customer support and told them that our battery life was nowhere near the six month range. Customer support was very helpful and said that our wifi signal was not very strong so they would send us a free chime pro to help boost the signal. This should have boosted the signal so the battery ran longer. We installed the chime pro and made sure our doorbell was using it, then waited. The battery life actually went down. It started needing to be charged every two weeks. As my life was very busy at the time, a few months passed before it was so annoying I contacted customer support again, and they said the doorbell was not actually connected to the chime pro. I figured this was user error, but we had a huge blackout a few weeks earlier, so I figured this was user error on my part and customer support showed me again how to hook the doorbell up to the chime pro. They also sent me an email from someone above the first tier of customer support who I should contact in case there was an issue again. Well... cleaning out my email at the end of the year I deleted that email by accident. The battery life continued to degrade. So I tried contacting customer support again, who quite flatly replied the doorbell was out of warranty and the best they could do was offer me a discount on a new doorbell. I said that I had been sent an email from someone who wanted me to contact them about the battery life, and he said he had no record of that and all he would do is give me a discount on a new doorbell. I was very discouraged. So rather than throw away everything I bought a new battery and am waiting to see if it will do any better. I'm not sure if they strung me along long enough for the doorbell to be out of warranty, but based on the email from the higher level of support I would say this is a common issue. However, after reading lots of Amazon reviews, it sounds like three weeks is about what most people get out of the supposed "six month battery life". Also - the motion detection only picks up people as they are leaving even on the highest settings, so the most I ever see is someone's back. If you choose to purchase one of these make sure you buy two batteries at least, the six month thing is a fabrication.
title: Terrible Battery Life

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: IAN B GIJSBERS
content: Used the Alexa Dot to chime for the front door. Obviously you need to be semi tech-savvy to set them up together. Need to have both ring app, and the Alexa app. For some reason the integration doesn't work from the PC alexa set up in your browser, you must use the Alexa app, once ring skill is enabled, you can go into the Devices under "smarthome" and there is a little switch you need to turn on for the Ring Chime for the doorbell. The ring itself was very easy to install, takes maybe 10 min to install.
title: Works Great with Alexa integration

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ChetD
content: This is a mixed review in that the doorbell itself would rate a strong 4 stars but the integration with Amazon Show is really disappointing and gets a 1 star.  The problem with Amazon Show is that once someone walks up my walkway the Ring Doorbell camera sets of an alert. I walk over to my Show and say ‘Alexa show me the front door’ I then see a spinning symbol indicating that the link is being established. Meanwhile, when the person at the door actually pushes the button to ring the bell. no screen view of who is at the door has appeared. I have to let them wait a good 2 minutes before I see a live view of who is at the door. Meanwhile, the person can see my car in the driveway and hear my dogs barking incessantly. However still no video. I end up answering the door anyway rather than keep them waiting not knowing if its the mailman or some door to door solicitor. Ideally,  Ring (who is owned by Amazon now) should have the "Alexa Skil for Ring"l initiate the video live view link as soon as the camera sees a person in the field of view. I should know who is walking up my walkway even before they get around to ringing my door bell.
title: Annoying delays with video display connection on Amazon Show.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Weston
content: Just as described and pictured. Easy install. Customer support was fantastic. Heads up, if you have a wired doorbell, the battery needed for the doorbell needs to be charged first and then installed. Yes you need a battery even with wired setup, however that's the end of it. the motion and sounds of doorbell run off of battery only, NOT your phones power, BUT the battery trickle charges off of your wires n the interim between actual uses. I've had it up for a month now and the (easy to use) app always shows full power. It records great, app is great, and setup was easy and simple. ONE CON... the speaker (for communication to guests at the bell) is severely disappointing. It is low quality and regardless of volume spoken through the phone, sounds crackling and distorted. You cannot clearly hear from the doorbell side.
title: Pretty satisfied. Though for the price, I expected more from the sound quality.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tim
content: Had this camera for almost a year now and I would not buy it again. The motion isn't too bad, though sometimes misses people coming up to the door when they don't ring, such as a courier delivering a package and just dropping it off.  It almost never gets people walking on the sidewalk in front of the house, which is about 15 feet away. I played around with the motion settings all I can, including the new motion wizard, but can't improve the results. It doesn't always pick up people on the doorstep and 15 or so feet away, but seem to get just about every car 30 or so feet away. In addition, it commonly just stops being available at random. I will see that it hasn't detected any motion for several hours, even though it normally picks up just about every car that passes. Before (from when I checked and is reported in the device help, which hasn't been updated for several hours) and after it stops responding, the battery is always around 98-100% (it's hardwired) and the WiFi signal is around -45 - -50. Sometimes going to the device and pressing the ring will back it come back and sometimes you just have to wait and it will come back after a few hours more, usually sometime overnight. Happens during the summer, fall, winter, and spring. Hot or cold or just right. In addition to it not responding, it will sometimes just pull up a black screen when you go to live view. This includes when I have heard the doorbell go off in the house, but didn't receive a "ring" notification on any of my devices. I pull up the live view and just get a black screen with no audio. I have also noted that there hadn't been any recent motion events, so I suspect that it is not responding again. Both issues happen with the Android, iOS and Windows store app (3 different devices). Finally, the cloud service. It actually is fairly decent and the app for Android and iOS are pretty good. I do wish you could set for the events for record longer, specifically ring events. If the device is hardwired, this shouldn't be a problem. I do like the neighborhood feature to be able to see other issues around. I don't like the new feed for motion and ring events, but that is more of a personal preference. The device health does provide good information about the device, including battery, WiFi strength firmware status, and MAC address, though not IP address. I would like to be able to connect directly to the device instead of only through Ring's cloud based service. All in all, I would look around for something a bit cheaper as I feel with the issues and features, this is overpriced.
title: Not that great for the price

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: KASE
content: The star rating is only because it won’t let me review without it.  There was nothing wrong with it, it was an issue on my end. I looked forward to having the doorbell installed but then was extremely disappointed, I have to send it back. My internet signal in my home is too weak for images to download. We tested it but images would never load to see who was at the door. I live in somewhat of a rural town so before you decide on purchasing the ring doorbell, make sure your internet signal strength is strong enough to support it so you too are not disappointed when it won’t work.
title: Internet signal strength

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gerco
content: I installed the Ring 2 doorbell with a solar charger (from the Ring.com site) and it keeps the battery charged to about 95-96% so I have not have to recharge it yet after several months. The Ring app is responsive and even works reliably when out of the country (I could answer my door from Russia). One significant downside: There is no local access to the video stream, ring events or anything else. If your internet connection fails, Ring goes out of business or some other company buys them it becomes a brick and there is no way to DIY anything. You can only use the Ring cloud to record video and that requires a subscription. No local storage, not even as a backup for when internet is unavailable.
title: Better than the previous version

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jonswife007
content: I own the ring doorbell 1 and it is perfect except for the picture quality. But I’m Keeping it since the doorbell 2 is pure TRASH! My doorbell 1 Is sturdy and solid. Nothing is cheaply made about it (doesn’t feel like it fall apart in my hands). Amazon takes over ring and now makes a cheap, cheap ring doorbell 2 and still charges 200$ lol! Everything about the quality of the ring 2 is bad. The picture quality isn’t even that great compared to my ring 1 doorbell. The motion sensor does not work. Reinstalled my old ring and it picked up every time we opened our front door. So, for all the other reviews who state it’s a WiFi and router problem with the ring doorbell 2 lack of motion sensing is BS!! The doorbell itself is trash!  Amazon is lacking big time with the ring doorbell 2 and needs to get it together! Save your money!! And buy a more quality product!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bernard Douthit
content: These Ring Doorbells are fine. The first one we purchased for $120+ went offline after 1-2 days and no matter what I did to try and fix it this kept happening. It was just flat out defective as I am pretty tech savvy. It also seems that Ring (now owned by Amazon) has fixed this problem as we don't have it with our new one. I think people need to start answering their doors again instead of hiding behind these, plus I don't like the fact that Amazon is collecting information on our home using these.
title: Good - but we had to buy 2 of these to get one that worked

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dennis J. Marino
content: Only able to view one of my double front doors so if a package is left at the right hand door I can view it but if it is placed by the left hand door it in not in the field of view ( the adapters that are included in the kit did not help). The most disappointing thing is that I was told by the Ring company that after the 30 day trial is up that If I don't view a video as soon as I receive the notification that the video will disappear and would not be able to be viewed unless I pay a subscription fee of $100.00 per year for both of my devices.  However the items are well made just don't work well and do not serve the purpose.
title: Video is not saved and poor field of view.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cater Tater
content: After having multiple packages delivered to another house, and said packages disappearing... I was done going rounds with delivery/postal services and their less than stellar customer service.  The Ring Video Doorbell was my magic bullet. Take a stand versus package theft and irresponsibility and buy one of these!
title: Best Item for Twarting Poor Delivery and Package Pirates

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tiffany

The graphics are great and you can talk to people through it. I'm in love and will be getting the security lightlights with camera for the side of the house.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Melodi Mits
content: Our kids purchased the Ring and Echo 5 from an Amazon bundle, as we are slowly turning our home into a "smart home". It seemed easy to install, because there was little swearing from hubby, and it synced with the Echo 5 after a few attempts. We love the app too, which tells us motion has been detected while we are away.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Levesque
content: We have been trying out different cameras for monitoring or home while we are away.  It is a big plus to see what is happening when you get a text from the home alarm system.  I have been watching the comments and reviews of the Ring unit for awhile and when the price dropped I bought in around Christmas.  I made sure a had the Ring in an area with a strong wifi signal, I added an extender between the router and the door location.  Setup was easy.  The app works without crashing.  I blocked out an area in the view that has a bird feeder to avoid false alarms.  There is a bit ot latency in activation and recording, but if the person is coming to the door it works well.  I have to say that the app needs a bit more work to allow looking at older videos.  Hopefully Ring will work on the app and that upgrades at no cost.
title: Good additon to monitoring the home

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JLovesBooks
content: UPDATE 6/8/19: Customer service is terrible and now notifications are 2 minutes delayed. In the last few days the notifications have gone from being just a few seconds delayed to coming a full 2 MINUTES after motion is detected. I'm now getting notifications that I'm walking down the steps when I'm already a mile down the road in the car. I'm not sure what changed, but the home screen looks different now in the app as of a few days ago and I'm guessing an update has caused this issue. Customer service is also terrible. For a while there they were really nice and when I was just a week away from returning the item (within 30 days), they offered me 6 months of service for free while we wait on the Android fix (since there is no two-way communication on Android phones). Well, I replied back, said I accepted and then didn't hear anything. So when all my videos disappeared and my trial expired, I emailed Nicole (the local rep) back and asked what the hold up was with honoring the offer when I gave them a full week to update the account (I ended up paying for service out of pocket). I received a reply from someone who was handling things while Nicole was out of office and this person also offered the same thing and said I had to reply back to accept or they'd help process a return as a last resort. Well, it's now been weeks since that initial email came and even though I've replied at least 4 times (even offering to send a message to them via a Raven since email obviously isn't working), I've yet to hear anything back from either Nicole or her stand-in while she was out. So I'm guessing they really make all these empty promises to get you to not return the device during the return period and then when you think they'll honor their offer, they go radio silent and all of a sudden apparently forget how to check email. We're now looking at our other options for devices and should have just gone with another company to begin with. The idea of a video doorbell is nice, but I'm finding the Ring video doorbell execution is terrible. ORIGINAL REVIEW: There is currently only one-way communication right out of the box if you're using Android (works fine on iOS, but for my Samsung Galaxy S9+, they can't hear me, but I can hear them). I was told 3 weeks ago that they were aware and can usually fix these things quickly (Maury has determined that is a lie). Today I was told there's still no fix. Ours also doesn't pick up motion until someone is standing at the doorbell. We now have 3 mounting plates to fix the motion detection issues at their insistence and it's still not working any better. I mean it's either get every car passing on the road 30 ft away or get someone when they're already ringing the bell. There is no in between. It's missed picking up 3 deliveries to our porch so far. Even if the person tossed the packages, they should still be in the zones. There's just a 3-5 second delay in the notifications, which is nice, but it does take the history a good minute to update, which sucks if you missed the notification. I'm super frustrated. Support tries to help, but it just seems the problems are both with the Android app and the hardware itself. I now have 10 more days to decide if I want to return...
title: Android only has one way communication, only picks up motion when right in front of doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RBrylawski
content: I finally got the Ring for my home.  This is the Ring Video Doorbell 2.  It offers 1080P HD Video with Live View, Motion Activated Alerts, Two Way Talk and it also integrates easily with Alexa.  It comes packaged very nicely and includes every single thing you could need to install it, including a level, two plates to choose from for angle, and two face plates to better compliment your house color. I chose to install this in place of my home doorbell, and if connected to the same wiring (two simple wires, unless your doorbell is digital, which mine wasn't) the battery will constantly be charged.  Otherwise, you can install it anywhere, but if you install it unwired, you will need to remove the rechargeable battery periodically to charge it.  Ring recommends charging the battery before you do anything with the doorbell.  It can take anywhere from 5 - 10 hours.  Mine took a full 6 hours to become fully charged.  And it charges via a simple Micro-USB, plugged into a charging brick like a cell phone brick. Installation was very easy.  I have a stucco block home, living in Florida, and the thoughtful folks at Ring even included a masonry bit in the box.  I do recommend doing the setup before you permanently install the Ring.  Just download the Ring App to your smartphone, use the QR code on the back of the Ring to scan your specific device and follow the steps to connect to your network and get everything set up to your needs.  It takes literally a couple minutes to set up and configure the Ring. Included with your purchase is a free 30 day trial of Ring Protect Plus.  After that ends, you can choose no plan (and get no recorded videos if you're violated - so, not good TBH) or a simpler plan for $3/month (actually, they offer a full year of this plan for $30) or the full Protect Plus for $10/month.  For $30/year, buying the Video Recording and sharing to me seemed a no brainer.  I've read many review here where people seem a bit angry they don't get video recording for free.  I didn't expect this and have no problem paying a bit more for the comfort in knowing should someone try to intrude, they will be recorded and the recording will be accessible via the app to provide to the authorities.  Honestly, I spend more at Starbucks every month.  I bet many of you do as well. Overall, I'm really impressed with the Ring Doorbell 2.  I was at the grocery store this afternoon when my ring app alerted me to someone unfamiliar to me at my front door.  It was fantastic being able to ask who they were and why they were there.  Anyone who values safety, should seriously consider getting something like the Ring.  I chose the RIng because I'm invested in the Amazon Alexa eco-system.  Google recently added Ring support to Google Home, so even if you're in the Google eco-system, you can go with the Ring as well.
title: If You Value Your Homes Security - Put A Ring On It!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SD
content: I had this product for a month and the battery said it needs recharged. Everything I read said the battery life would be up to six months. I have now had the battery on the charger overnight and it’s still not fully charging. Customer service is sending me a new battery but it will take 7 to 10 business days to get it to me. I was also not informed that you could not see your motion sensors after a day if you do not subscribe to their subscription package. It would be nice if what I paid for is what I was getting but apparently that’s not the case here. I’m not sure if I will be sending this back and going another route or if I will just stick it out and see if I can make this work. I am not happy with this product at this point.
title: Battery died after a month and will not charge

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mr. Hammer
content: I have been extremely happy with the Ring Video Doorbell 2.  Motion detection works great, and the quality of daylight images are pretty good.  You can see faces really well when people are ringing your doorbell. The camera has a wide-angle, fish-eye lense.  So it can capture wide area.  Wide angle isn’t really needed with the design of my house, but it might be a bigger deal for you. The battery has been lasting about 4 weeks for me, but I bet it will last a shorter period if you have a lot of stuff going on in front of your house.  I'd still recommend picking up a 2nd battery, so you always can be charging one, while you're using the other.
title: Works great.  Nice Upgrade.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stephen Cruise
content: The motion sensor is useless - mine is 10 feet from my router so that's not the problem.  The motion sensor doesn't detect almost anything...maybe 1 out of a 1000 events.  I just hope that a robber knows to ring the doorbell before stealing my packages, otherwise there's no way they will be caught. I spent hours setting up (had to screw it into brick/concrete since I have a brick house) then endless hours testing and configuring it - not worth my time.
title: Terrible - don't waste your money or your time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R Warrier
content: I recently installed a Ring door bell. This helps me keep an eye on the entry way. It gets triggered when a packet is (Amazon shipment!!) left outside the door etc. For a product this good it seems flimsy and fragile. May be it is because of the thin plastic cover over the batter.  I wish it were more sturdy even though no harm has happened so far. I am someone used to the quality of Apple products and Nest thermostat etc. Sorry for this small gripe! Update Jan 25 2019 I have had this product for several weeks by now. The product appears to fit m requirement. In fact I am considering installing another ring (2 or higher) in another of my residences. I become a snow bird and go to Florida when the weather turns cold.  I have not yet subscribed to the monthly service. I am not even sure I am missing something so far except for the fact that I don't seem to get the ring tone on my phone. I do seem to get notification on my Apple Watch. Does the ring tone on the phone cease after the promotional period? I suspect it does. I purchased a power adapter which keeps the battery charged.  Since I installed this in a high rise building this was quite a challenge. I am glad it became a successful project. To any one contemplating purchasing Ring door bell 2  I strongly recommend the power adapter. The one I purchased was specially marketed for Ring. I suspect any 12 to 24 volt charger will do, but the one I bought came with a 25' power cord. I used a higher gauge bell wire from Lowes since I was a little worried about the thin gauge of the wire that came with the power adapter. I installed a Ring Chime also since there was no doorbell in this condo. Overall I am a satisfied customer.
title: For a product this good it appears flimsy

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Southern Made Designs
content: Ring doorbell 2 is using subpar technology on its camera vision. It is only good for short range detection right in front of it. It should also be able to draw the detection zone like the pro, that would solve the range issue at daytime. The night vision is beyond horrible. ONLY good at less than 10 ft  to see a face. To me that is almost useless as a night vision. I would not recommend ring doorbell 2 due to horrible night vision and horrible zone distance feature. Game cameras are wayyy better at night and day vision. Ring should use game cameras vision technology for day and night vision. I called and they told me to see better, get more lights further out. Uhh no. Don’t need to in pitch black with a game camera. Battery life is a complete lie!!! Mine only lasted 1 month and 10 days before it said to charge at 6%. 6 months to a year is BS! Also it told me to charge after the fact it wouldn’t let me see live view anymore to see anyone is currently at door. Should not tell you at 6%. Should tell you at 10% or greater. They should send 2 batteries if they are going to lie about battery life. I would be satisfied having a backup on hand. With all that said, It is called a ring camera and it does a good job seeing people at my front door. That is main purpose, however it would be nice to see people trying to walk on the side of my house at night. Impossible with this camera technology. Ring, Please upgrade camera technology night vision distance quality and update to everyone stuck with it currently and change detection to draw zone feature like pro. Thanks!
title: Horrible night vision/battery life but works good enough to not return...yet.
