product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lamarsh
content: This doorbell was easy to install.  Ring made that very intuitive and simple.  I have also enjoyed the app for the most part.  It's intuitive and user friendly, and the ways it interfaces with the doorbell hardware is solid and offers tons of different configurations and settings that allow you to really customize the doorbell to fit your needs. But it's wireless connection is horrible.  Ring cleverly notes that the doorbell may not work as designed unless it has a strong wireless signal.  My wireless signal is very strong, my wireless router is about 12 feet from the doorbell and only separated by one wall (the actual door it services).  Nonetheless, I get very poor reception and video on my Ring.  My Arlo Pro 2s are about 5x farther away in my BACKYARD, and have 3 walls between them and my wireless router, but they still work way better than my Ring doorbell.  When we wish to view who is at our door, it is so slow to connect we can rarely get it on in time.  The videos it does record almost never are without freezing frames and HUGE holes in the clips. I've had it up for about 2 weeks now, and the battery is already down to 70%.  At that rate, I'll be having to recharge this thing about every other month.  And I have it set on very strict motion settings, and only record about 3-6 videos per day. The fact that you have to buy a stupid doorbell ringer to plug in is just stupid.  I have a Ring alarm, which has a very loud speaker on the base station.  It's mind numbing to wonder why Ring won't let me tie the darn doorbell into the Ring base station. I have a week or so to decide, but I am leaning towards sending this back!  Really want it to work though!
title: Very imperfect, slow

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Denver
content: I purchased this Ring Doorbell 2 because I read reviews that said it would work without the subscription.  It DOES NOT.  Don't listen to other reviews that say it does.  You have to subscribe for it to work.  It does an okay job with the subscription, however, when I had to change the batteries, it stopped working as efficiently and catches very little unless someone is right at my door.  The wifi signal is week despite nothing being in the way and a Chime to extend my modem even though the modem is not very far away.  It was also not easy to install.  When someone comes to my door, they are usually gone by the time my phone lets me know, so I have not been able to talk to them through the speaker or answer my door that way at all.  If I had known this, would have just stuck with my security camera and not purchased a Ring Doorbell.
title: Ring Doorbell 2 with Chime

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Average Guy
content: This is not a good product if you have a moderately deep porch with a bright background. Back-lighting issues are so bad you cannot make out the faces of people you know let alone those you don't. I bought the whole Ring system including home alarm system and this is the weak link. Our walkway is about 50-feet long. The camera doesn't start recording until the person (usually a delivery person) is on the porch and nothing more than a silhouette. And yet, at other times it triggers when a car drives by. Go figure. If you have a shallow porch and no overhang, it would probably work just fine. THE RING FOLKS KNOW THIS IS AN ISSUE AND HAS BEEN FOR SEVERAL YEARS. There are reviews all over the net with replies from Ring employees with responses like "We'll have a fix shortly." and "We're working on it." and "Send us a video so we know what you're talking about." Even cheap video camera's and phones have auto backlight compensation. Sorry for the negative review but if we don't warn prospective buyers, they'll never fix it.
title: Doesn't Work Well if You Have a Covered Porch

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sir VJAM
content: This ring doorbell 2 is a huge disappointment.  I gave it 3 stars cause it is great idea. Was also easy to install but the lag makes it useless.  Now if someone rings the doorbell and stands there then it’s ok. But if its amazon or UPS delivering where they ring and run then it’s if no use.  The video recording is delayed about 5 seconds so by the time they drop the package on your doorstep and your notified they are gone so you don’t see them.  The night vision works fine and the video quality is perfect.  I have a great Wifi connection so no issues there. Wish there was no lag but no matter what speed your internet is or WiFi signal it’s just the nature of the beast. The lag kills it
title: Disappointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JimBobRob
content: I did my research, and with numerous Amazon ecosystem products in the house, picked the Ring over the Nest products.  Our house is 24 years old, so not sure what I would face in hardwiring, but it was easy.  The install amounted to drilling four holes with anchors in the ubiquitous Phoenix-area stucco surface, and connecting the two wires used for the existing standard doorbell.  20 minutes later - voila! Great images of the front, and working well in the phone app.  I had to tweak the movement alert settings to tone down some front yard plant movement, but it's working great now.  Trying to decide if the video recording $3 monthly payment is necessary, with the provided 30 day trial period, but will likely drop the $30 annual payment for at least the first year.  You can do this yourself!
title: An easy DIY for me

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cindy A.
content: I am a single woman living alone in a house without a security system.  I haven't wanted to spend the money to install a fancy system or pay monthly monitoring fees.  Even spending the $200 for this Ring bell hurt some, but I am so glad I did. I feel so much more safe in my home with this! I also felt it was worth spending a little more on the Ring that you can hardwire where your existing doorbell is vs. using using the battery (do that if you can). It doesn't mater where I am, I get a "ring" on my phone (can choose from many sounds) and a banner notification that tells me when someone is near or on my front porch or rings the doorbell. I can open the app and immediately see who is there, even talk to them.  There are numerous ways to set up the Ring, including the distance you want the movement monitoring to work. You can easily turn the notifications on and off if you are expecting a lot of activity out front. You can easily share photos and video captured from your Ring if there is suspicious activity you want to alert others too, even share with the police if ever needed. Now that I have this and know what a great security tool it is, I am going to purchase the small Ring motion camera for my back porch.
title: LOVE IT. Doorbell and security system in one.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AmazonCustomer
content: Installation was so easy, I even hard wired it. As a result, my regular doorbell chime works and the battery is being charged. It even came with an extra bronze faceplate that matches the door handle.  Now about the bads: Ring app has a way to adjust the areas of motion sensing but I can not completely hand-select the areas, it is just the blue curved area that moves up and down.  In addition to this, the light poles from far away cause glares (or halos), i think it is because of the protective layer over the lense.  Other than that, I think it is doing the work. press the button, the bell chimes, phone rings, etc. And, when I open the ring up, curiously trying to see who is at the door or the reason of the motion sensor, the app loads and loads and loads. Then the live video shows up: the delivery man is getting back on his truck and etc.  which I miss the main thing, because, the delayed app load.  Then I try to see the recorder video, and it is unavailable, it says 'processing'. It takes another couple of hours.  Great product, great ideas, improved safety etc. but ring needs a better server, for faster app execusion and user interaction with the app, may be these could be fixed with an easy firmware update.  Anyways, I am happy for now, and hopeful from this device, because it is backet by Amazon.
title: easy installation, a little slow.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R24
content: It is definitely not plug and play. Took 3 calls to their excellent support staff to get it up and running. If your door bell is not close to your router you will have to purchase and extender and get that all signed up/in. There is a delay from the time the bell/motion is detected until you are alerted on your phone. The good thing is you get a 30 day free subscription to their cloud storage to get thing ironed out. After that you pay $30 per year. You can not record to your computer or other devise. You can see it real time but once you close it it's gone.
title: Like it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: floyd morris
content: Really great product.  Easy to set up.  Easy to use.  I like the fact that it can run on battery and does not have to be hard wired.  The camera gives a great view of the front door.  I was able to check the front door area and talk with people at the front door while I was 40 miles away.  At night the camera gives a sharp clear view.  It is an infrared View which means it is black and white, but a sharp streaming view none the less.  The day video is a sharp clear andd in color. The only disappointmemt I have is that it does not pair with Alexa and my TV.  Maybe that upgrade is coming?  Apart from that I  very satisfied.
title: Really great product. Easy to set up

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: William
content: I am overall very disappointed with my Ring 2.  I have 3 big issues with it. 1.  The wifi receiver is extremely weak.  The Ring 2 is 12 feet from my router and the connection is weak.  However, my cell phone shows full bars in the same location and speed tests to 80-100mbs. 2.  The motion detection is extremely spotty and intermittent.  Because I live in the city, I have it set a at the lowest sensitivity (5 ft).  However, it will pickup cars driving by at 15-20 feet away, while not engaging and showing me walk past it and into my door.  If someone can walk up to this, stand in front of it for 20 seconds opening the door, and walk in the house - and it records nothing - what good is it! UPDATE:  I CAN COME AND GO FROM MY HOUSE, WALKING RIGHT PAST THE RING DOORBELL AND AT LEAST 50% OF THE TIME IT RECORDS NOTHING!  CHANGED TO 1 STAR. 3.  When a delivery person comes and stands in front of my door, the device will often record for only 30 seconds.  So even though there is still someone standing in front of it, swaying back and forth, it stops recording.  Not a big deal when its only a delivery person, but what if this was someone waiting to see if anyone answers before breaking in?  It would have stopped recording before catching them in the act! I like the concept behind this device, but it is very poorly executed.  If someone comes out with better hardware/software, I will likely drop this and buy a different version.
title: Disappointing Hardware.  Weak WiFi. VERY Poor Motion Detection.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: P B
content: Pros: • Good motion detection • Easy to install and set up • Easy to change battery • Neighborhood security alerts Cons: • Does NOT have an “instantaneous” connection (as listed on the box) when the doorbell rings, nor when I use “live” view, nor when I bring up my dashboard to try to view a motion I was just notified of (it takes at least 60 seconds to populate). Note: I have a current iPhone and I have very high-speed Internet, and the modem is only 15 feet from my door/Ring doorbell. • Too much downtime to charge the battery (I purchased a 2nd battery to cover the time). • Timeline review does not allow scrolling in landscape view Update: 2:30am and someone just stole something from my front porch. Live video would not load for me to speak through the device. I tried posting video for my community, but it does not allow me to type any content.
title: Helpful, but certainly not instantaneous.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: John Spinosa
content: I BOUGHT 2 ECHO5's and the Ring doorbell. It takes 11 seconds for the ECHO to show who's at the door! After you say "Alexa "answer the door" WHICH MAKES IT USELESS. Very disappointed at both  Amazon and Ring for their POOR customer service, because they have no  FIX! It would be good if Ring showed automatically. I will be returning all 3 items!!
title: DOES NOT WORK AS ADVERTISED, ACTUALLY FALSE ADVERTISING!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Raul E. Zayas
content: For this review I have to make two distinctions. One is the Ring video Doorbell 2 and the other, the battery operated, Wi-Fi camera. If the doorbell is hardwired, you should not have any problems with signal strength even if there are many Wi-Fi signals in your area. My doorbell 2 is hardwired and is working perfectly well. Now the camera is a whole different story. When I purchased my camera directly from Ring, nobody told me about potential interference problems if there were many Wi-Fi signals in my area. The camera needs a certain amount of download and upload speeds to be able to operate correctly. You also need to have a minimum RSSI number for your camera to work correctly. If you live in an area that is "infested" with other Wi-Fi users so I had a lot of problems getting my camera to work correctly because it was competing with the signal of other users in the area to work correctly. My dowload/upload speeds were very low so the camera did not work at all. The excuse Ring Support technicians always gave was the interference from other users. I purchased a Wi-Fi extender. Do not even bother to buy the Chime Pro from Ring. It is good for nothing! I ended up buying a Linksys Wi-Fi extender but that barely helped. I called Ring Support again. Now the problem was not the signal strength but the distance of the camera from the router! I got sick and tired of Ring Support and called an IT friend of mine and we installed a Mesh Point. Now I have more than enough signal strength and my cameras are operating OK. All of this after HUNDREDS of dollars spent buying additional equipment. I could go on and on but we'll leave it there. Before you buy the Wi-Fi camera, please run speed tests in your area. I would suggest getting a professional to do all the work. In total, I spent OVER $700.00 in labor, two technicians and extra equipment to get the darn (that is not the word I wanted to use), camera to work but I got that camera to work!
title: Watch out with the battery operated Wi-Fi!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. WOODS
content: This product only "works" of you pay for the Subscription service. During the free trial period, I could see live and recorded alerts. And regarding that, the sensor is set off by anything...most times Nothing is there! I narrowed it down to just my porch and still got alerts constanly. Which I then had to visually check using my mobile data up! Only to discover there was nothing there. I'm talking every few minutes it would record and have to be checked! I could use live feed fairly quickly to see alerts as they happened if I wasn't busy.  Once the free period was over, you can no longer see any alert footage after the fact. It still  is listed, but not veiwable. When i try to view the live feed as I get the alerts now,  i get a black screen and a swirling circle...eventually it will either come on or I'll try to get it through a separate function. By then of course anyone who might have been there is long gone! So unless you want to pay monthly fees , don't bother.  I would return it but i paid to have it installed and would have to pay to take it down.
title: Only works properly with paid monthly service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jim Birch
content: This device was relatively easy to install although I ditched the small wire nuts for a crimped-on splice. The motion detector is overly sensitive in that I was initially getting lots of false positives. Following the instructions to desensitize the motion detector toward street traffic was helpful, but I still get several false positives a day. Some may be related to a small shrub near the porch that can move with the wind, but not all of them. If you have shrubs, tree branches, or vehicle traffic outside your door, be prepared. I was not aware when I purchased this that in order to record video you must have at least a minimum contract with Ring to store video on the cloud. Video is NOT stored locally on the device or on your phone, nor can it be stored to a cloud account you may already have. You get 30 days free storage, but after that no video is stored unless you pay the monthly fee. Although the fee is modest, there was nothing that made me aware of this prior to purchase.
title: Easy to install, overly sensitive motion detector, cloud storage fees if you want video.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Channing Hayden III
content: I've had the original Ring doorbell at the front door for close to a year and have been happy with it. I purchased this for the back of the house, but was having trouble with a weak WiFi signal. I purchased the Chime Pro hoping that would help, but it did not. Ended up buying a Netgear range extender to get it to stay connected. The video quality is better that the first one. Motion detection works well. There is much more activity on this new doorbell, and I find the battery doesn't last as long. I do like the fact that the battery is removable and I don't have to bring the whole doorbell in to charge it.
title: Decent video, took some additional equipment to get it connected to the network.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NLVsd
content: So far, I am not pleased.  I feel Ring has been “the name” in video doorbell.  They were one of the first companies and it feels like anyone I know who has a video doorbell, has a Ring. Here is why I am not as pleased.  First, the night vision is beyond horrible and it’s nearly useless.  The video quality at night is so horrible, I cannot make out any features.  Everything is a blur even with my front porch light on and landscaping lights.  Second, the motion sensor zone is limited to your front yard and any wall, column, tree, or bush.  Since I have 2 columns on each side of my door, the motion sensor does not pick up until someone appears right in front of the camera (or center-most motion sensor).  Therefore, I normally only see people as they are leaving and not coming.  Based on some of the neighborhood watch videos, I think package thieves know the limitations of the motion sensors and are getting away without their face being shown.  I am disappointed.  While I am going to keep this unit as a deterrent, I feel may install another outdoor camera with better night vision capability.
title: Expected more from Ring and very unimpressed...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Book Worm
content: Pros: Nice packaging design. I think the Neighborhood Watch feature could be helpful. Nightvision and wifi seem ok, but useless if the unit doesn't work. Cons: The motion detector does not work. At all. This is possibly a faulty unit but the actual doorbell video is so slow, as other reviewers have said, you'll be lucky if you get a photo of the UPS driver's back as they are walking away. Also, if you plan to use it on battery power, you'll need to remove a tiny, easily lost, screw on the bottom of the faceplate every time you remove the battery to charge it.
title: disappointing - I will be returning it asap

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dr. Harris
content: Like most of Floridians with a home built after hurricane Andrew, Building code requires that if there's a doorbell..that it be in a standard electrical switch box.  The RING 2 installation kit includes faceplates that fit a standard electrical switch box IF you need to adjust your RING 2 up or down and if you need to adjust your RING 2 left or right!  For standard flat mounts, you are on your own without a plate that fits as the flat mount has no way to attach it to a standard electrical switch box.  Fortunately, a friend who is a woodworker fixed me a mounting plate that got the job done!  Another issue is that if you have an existing wired bell system, the wiring instructions are bizarrely confusing and misleading!  It's almost as if they want everyone to by a voltage regulator they do not need!  I was very near to returning the Ring 2 to Amazon because of the absence of the Flat mount that would fit a Switch box and becasue of the very misleading electrical connection information.  I am far more tech oriented than the average consumer so I can only assume that the instructions are the way they are to sell you things you do not need!  If you are going to use your Ring 2 only on battery, this is a SNAP!  otherwise, you might want to read up on what your current doorbell uses for low voltage power in advance of purchasing so that when you get your device you are not made to wonder if you need to make additional purchases to have the type and amount of power you need!
title: Great Technology, Terrible Instructions!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JR
content: Doing my research, looking at a couple of other options and speaking with others who own Ring products, I purchased this for my parents house as they have no wires, we had to go for a battery option.  I appreciate the Ring ecosystem's other potential options. Sure the motion detection & video quality by comparison to some may not be there but it's still quite good and certainly better than nothing.  They always know when there's motion at the door, when the doorbell rings and can even speak to whomever is at the door without leaving their current position.  I can also keep an eye on them from afar.  Fantastic piece of mind. It took me a bit to get the motion detection settings dialed in but they're good now.  Also, make sure you add another battery at some point to reduce the down time.  Battery life isn't terrible but it seems to wear a bit faster than they advertise, although that is partially dependent on traffic and your settings. Overall, I'm very pleased.
title: Very pleased

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ryan
content: My front door is 40 feet from the street, and I have the motion detection set to the lowest range, but this device reports a motion event whenever a car drives by.  Worse, it often doesn't record a person walking up to the door to deliver the mail or a package until they have finished their drop off and have turned around to walk away.  Ring has updated their software a few times since I bought my unit last year, and for a few months last winter, the motion detection worked perfectly.  However, starting this spring, it went back to being terrible.  It is an unfortunate result of buying hardware that depends on cloud software, because even if something works when you buy it, it can easily stop working months later when you are out of the return window due to a cloud-side software change.  I have still kept the device, because any camera is a crime deterrent, and because I like the live view.  Sometimes you hear a loud noise outside at night, and it lets you check what is going on without calling attention to yourself by opening your door or curtains.  It is also nice for checking on your house while you are out of town on vacation, such as in the winter to make sure the snow shoveling company came so your house doesn't look unoccupied.
title: Terrible motion detection; software keeps changing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Angel-Q
content: I was so impressed with the install instructions and ease of installation of this unit.  The hardest part of the installation was drilling the holes in the brick and that's it!  I had my husband drill the holes (not crazy about drilling into brick) and I did the rest.  I've had to adjust the sensitivity settings because my front door is probably about 20-30 feet from the road, but once I did that it works like a charm (it was previously picking up larger trucks when they passed).  I do find a little bit of a lag when I respond to a motion notification, but otherwise it works great.  I viewed competitor's products before purchasing and bought the Ring doorbell based on price consideration. I would recommend to anyone who wants an added layer of security and being able to see who is at the door before you open the door. I have not subscribed to the video plan, but will likely do so. This plan keeps videos for 60 days and costs $3/month or $30 annually.
title: Easy Install and Setup

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: dpr
content: I wish this worked as its shown on TV but the reality is that it's slow to respond.  When it detect motion it begins recording and send an alert.  Even thought I have the detection range out about 30 feet, it doesn't detect motion of a person until they're about 10 feet from Ring. It will detect cars driving by in the street 30 feet away, though.  Then there's a delay in sending the alert to your phone.  By the time I receive the alert, open the app and the video opens (there's a long delay of a spinning arrow) the person's long gone.  Also, I have this hard wired but the battery drains over 1% a day, which means I would need to recharge it about avery 3 months.  That's a not close to the 6-12 month claim that they make on their web site.  Charging takes overnight so you need to plan if your leaving town and have a low battery.  ***Updated: Now that I've had this installed for about 3 weeks the battery charge is at 100% and holding.  Not sure why it was depleting the first week it was installed, but it's charging now.
title: Not as advertised on TV - Updated

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lauren T
content: This is a great video doorbell system.  Don't listen to the people complaining about subscription costs, those people are just morons.  You can use this doorbell with out a subscription.  The subscription is only needed if you want to record your videos, so if something is stolen off of your porch you have a video of it to show the cops and your neighbors.  To just use this as a normal video doorbell with live feed capabilities only you do not need a subscription... but if something comes up missing... well you are just out of luck.  I personally, will pay $30 for the yearly subscription fee for this, as I think it is a wonderful deal. The video feed is very clear, even at night when there isn't the best of light.  Audio could be better, but it isn't horrible.
title: Great Doorbell with OR without the extra recording subscription

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dena C.
content: I upgraded from another brand of smart doorbell because I had heard of so many people using it, because I expected more features for the price, and because we could watch on my echo. First of all, it is a massive doorbell. It came with angles mounting brackets which I tried, but will probably remove because I don't think they help minimize false detection. I liked the features to set zones and I think it may work sightly better than my old one. The picture and sound quality are good. I have yet to be near the echo when the doorbell rings so I don't know how useful that ended up being. While I like all the things it is, I am disappointed that the only way to save video is by paying a monthly fee for use. Otherwise you only get live views. Other brands I have had allowed me to save video on my phone at no charge. I might buy it but I would find it reasonable to pay for actual monitoring, not to save video on my own device. Overall I like the doorbell but may not have upgraded if I had understood the pricing plan. It did not occur to me to research that part. No money lost, but no saved images either.
title: Almost a great upgrade

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Julie M
content: What ever.  That is how I feel.  Not impressed.  Bought this a couple of years ago. Wanted to work out any kinks.  Would not again buy. We get the notice anywhere from 20 minutes to two hours later when someone has been to the door.  Upgrading the wifi didn't help.  When we upgraded our phones,  they would only allow one of the new phones in.
title: Look for a better option

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: BD bobier
content: Ring makes installation easy by providing a well packaged product with clear and concise instructions for placement, instal and linkage to the internet & your personal devices. The camera is fantastic, day or night, and provides a clear view of anyone near your door. The microphone picks up sound extremely well, allowing for clear conversions between you and anyone at the door. Motion alerts work well and are easily adjusted to fine tune the unit to your particular needs. Two issues why I gave the product 4 instead of 5 stars. #1 - There is a significant time lag between the time the doorbell button is pushed & notification on your phone. Often, by the time you actually get the video up & are ready to talk, the person has already left or you catch their backside as they are walking away. #2 - long term durability. This purchase was made to replace a 2 year old model #1 that just stopped working. I am hopeful this unit, which appears to be better made, will last longer. I did a lot of research into this and similar products. While not perfect, the Ring Video Doorbell 2 appears to be the best of the bunch. It provides a sense of security that I have come to appreciate.
title: Ring makes installation easy by providing a well packaged product with clear and ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Roy Samuel
content: I've read a lot of horror stories here on Amazon for this device, so I had my reservations on buying it.  But the it was too good a deal to pass up on Prime Day! I have absolutely no complaints about this device.  Easy enough to install, but the provided drill bit is woefully inept at penetrating brick.  Nearly destroyed one drill and needed my neighbor to help me with both of us pushing on his drill! I'm sure it's easier on non-brick surfaces, but this thing was a bear to install by drilling holes into the brick where the doorbell was. Aside from that, setup in the app was a breeze and - drum roll please - WiFi works as advertised.  Signal is strong and I've had no issues whatsoever in getting real-time alerts.  Both the motion sensor and doorbell alerts pop up on my phone immediately - missing events is a non-issue for me.  Now, I'm going to chalk this up to having a mesh network in my house, giving the device a great WiFi connection via 2 APs that are within 20 feet of it. All in all, no complaints and now I have the security of knowing I can monitor the front of my house with confidence!
title: It Just Works...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alan
content: Wasn't as good as I thought it would be. It took to long to show a live feed whenever I received a notification about motion so I would miss it. Then to go back and review the saved footage took an extra minute or two for me to even be able to access that clip. Next thing which was a deal breaker for me was the motion detection. In order to not get notified about every car that passed, I had to have the zone so low that it only started recording when someone was actually on my porch often missing the whole thing so I can't see their face. If someone would have ran up and stole a package, it wouldn't have caught their face just then running away. Ended up returning it and spending a little more on the nest hello. That one is better in every aspect. There 24/7 recording is great so I never miss anything and it just stamps the motion events and viewing the live feed when there's something at the door is much faster.
title: Could be a lot better

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Carla W.
content: I’ve tried every setting variation on this gadget and yet still it has the most ridiculous recordings.  I set my range, set it to recognize people (so no unwanted extra footage of cats and squirrels).  So I get cars DRIVING by my house, BUT it does NOT even record me pulling up to my curb (technically closer to the house than the car driving by), records NONE of my movement toward the house until I’m physically stepping into my door.  So visitors can park and walk all the way to my door, nothing records until they are AT my door after they knock and are standing for a bit.  But had they simply driven by, I’d have all that footage.  I turned off all those SMART features and still gets cars going by, but nothing of a person coming all the way up to my house from a car that moved in front of my house to park.  WHY???  I’m shopping other options.  I had a gentleman walk all the way up today to try my doorknob, the recording I got was him for a split second then turning to walk away.  The footage was not good enough to even see his face.  Worthless really unless they use the doorbell and stand there and wait...otherwise I’m only recording drive bys.
title: Not worth it, asking for a refund or maybe an upgrade to a better product (if it exists).

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lucian
content: This video doorbell is definitely worth $99. I know, this price is off limits most of the times so paying more does not make sense in my opinion...Main reason: motion detection. Why can it detect cars moving more than 60’ away but not detect a person until it is 5 feet from the door? 2 weeks I played with the motion sensor settings to give up after realizing that I cannot set it up to my liking. My Ring is hardwired and it seems that I will never have a battery issue since the battery stayed charged fully since first use. No issues with the WiFi connection as I have seen in other reviews and the distance to the router is about 20 to 30 ft. Pretty fast when it comes to seeing who’s at the door in Live mode. I like that it saves all the events and you can always go back and see what happened. The yearly subscription is not too bad either for $30. I am hoping that some additional firmware updates will help with the motion sensor settings.
title: Motion detection can be improved

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Travis K
content: Major Dissapointment! I purchased this to see people entering my property and for the security of my packages. I have three steps leading up to my door and about a 15 foot walkway to the street. I positioned the camera 3.5 feet from the floor of the top step by my door. I have played with every sensitivity level including the highest one. I followed the setup for steps and changed distance from the roadway multiple times to try and "adjust". However this camera has a terrible range for downward motion. Packages delivered aren't even picked up by this camera unless the guy walks up to the second of third top step and proceeds to drop which none ever do. Essentially this camera is useless for my needs. Per my testing I can wall up my entire path, across my lawn or even to my side driveway and mailbox without ever being detected, what a freaking joke. I have a completely level backyard and it seems to work okay there but if you have the slightest gradient change this thing is horrific. It is being returned and I am going with something better.
title: Motion Detection Horrible

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cliff Korth
content: I am writing this review 7 months after purchasing the product.  Installed easy. Great video. But completely worthless as to the purpose they claim it to be.  If the door bell rings and I get notification on my phone, I have NEVER been able to make the connection from my phone to "Answer" the door.  Always get a failure to connect.  BTW the camera is about 6 ft  away from the wireless access point. Bought the chime pro to see if it would help which did nothing more than produce an audible chime in the house.  This does help to know if someone is ringing the doorbell because I would never know from the phone alerts.  Motion alerts are pretty much ineffective other than getting a recording of the event but not a lot of help in real time.  Flashy advertising and nice packaging doesn't do much for a product that fails to live up to the hype.
title: Very dissapointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michelle
content: When this works - it is the BEST gadget of the year.  I love being able to see who is or has been at my front door.  The camera picks up a whole lot more than just the front porch.  You may need to do some adjusting because when we first set it up, it would activate when a car drove by.  The down-side is the connection is slow.  If someone rings the doorbell - it can take a while for it to ring your phone.  The battery life is not great either. And it is very slow to recharge.  A back-up battery has been unavailable for order for weeks now.  I'm on the waiting list.
title: I Love this product, but it does need some improvement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Average Shopper
content: Overall I'm fairly pleased with this doorbell. After a short hiccough of me forgetting to disable two-factor authentication and then facing an excessive wait time from customer service, the company's customer service came through and completely changed my opinion. That is, they took the time to email me upon reading my previous poor review to further assist me with my complaint. As often it feels like the individual customer isn't important to these giant companies, I found that touching. Also, a word of advice. If you find yourself unable to access the two-factor authorization text, ask customer service to remove the device from that account and add it to a new one. That was way quicker.
title: I can now recommend this product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joshua
content: Poor range, slow alerts, monthly fees. WiFi extender probably needed. My router is 15 feet from the doorbell and it gets poor signal. Larger than you think. Think thick deck of cards plus the black part. Video quality is poor and doesn’t look HD. You can hear people really well but they can hardly hear you. The speaker isn’t particularly loud and distorts if you raise your voice so they can hear you. The motion zone on this is terrible and convoluted to set up. Either you get alerted by squirrels all day or you don’t get alerted until a person is walking away. I tried several settings without avail. Perfect for squirrel watching!
title: Large size, poor range, poor speaker.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MEK
content: It should be made VERY clear that once the 30 free days is up your ring doorbell is not the same device it was previously. Let me explain. My 30 days just ran out. My Ring doorbell alerted me that there was motion at the front door. After about a minute, when I got done feeding my dogs, I picked up my phone, unlocked it, opened Ring and clicked on the Front Door motion. To my surprise there was no video, there was however the following message: "Your Ring Protect Plan has Expired. Since your trial has ended, all your past video recordings have been deleted, and you can no longer review, save or share your video's with anyone. If you'd like to save and share videos captured by your Ring device in the future, sign up for a Ring Protection Plan today." Do I need to be the one to point out the shortcomings here? 1. This is a nearly $200 device that can't "save" to a location on our own network 2. If you don't have a plan, you can't view anything if you don't check your phone extremely fast. This really does render the device to be no more than an over priced camera. 3. Forget it.. there really are too many points I could list. Look, I understand if you want to charge folks a monthly fee for certain services such as the Ring Neighborhood, but there should be an option to save to a local network. I do feel it's ok to offer, and charge people to save to Rings cloud. A week ago I was thinking "I should get more of the Ring devices and set them up around the house, then pay for the Protection Plus plan". Now that I'm FORCED to either pay a subscription or have a simple camera +app, I'm not sure I want to keep the Ring Doorbell. This is a bait and switch operation. Ring does see that right? I have several camera's inside my house that are able to save to my local drive or an SD card. How has Ring not made that a thing yet? So do I pay a company for shady business practices, or get rid of the product and get one that performs the same function with no monthly charge?
title: Nothing More Than A Camera + App After 30 Days

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Bastug
content: I originally got the Ring Pro as a gift, but found out after installation my existing doorbell transformer wasn't putting out enough voltage.  No big deal to replace it, if I knew where it was. Looked everywhere.  Builders put them wherever they feel like, and I couldn't find mine.  Did some research and saw that the Ring 2 only needs 8v minimum, not 16v like the Pro because it has a built in battery that apparently trickle charges.  Installation was a breeze.  No wiring changes needed at the doorbell chime like the Pro, just hook it up to existing doorbell wiring by my front door.  They give everything needed, including small wire extensions with wire lugs to connect to doorbell wires, as well as a screwdriver.  I also like the angled bracket that was included. I did have an issue at first with my Netgear Orbi mesh wifi network.  When first installed it connected to my wifi, but didn't stay so when I checked the live view there was no connection.  A simple reboot of my Orbi router and I saw that the Ring was now listed as something on my network and it has worked since.  I might get another for my side door just because it was so easy to install plus I like the ability to do a live look remotely.
title: Easy install, so far works well.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Whitekn3
content: I am updating this after a year of use.  I consider it pretty much worthless for security.  The motion detector is the worst I have ever encountered. I have tried different settings over the past year and none have even been close to satisfactory.  I do not know how much real motion is missed, but comparing to two other security cameras on the site, it seems like a lot.  I would say over 90% of the events are false alarms. i.e. a bug flying 30 feet away that can't be seen. I have the Ring Video Doorbell 2 for about 2 months, and like other reviewers I have found that it is "ok", but you can't rely on it to catch all the activity at the door where you mount it. Unlike the other security cameras I have, there is no way to make this capture anything before the trigger.  Thus, action that trigger ring may be gone before it starts recording, like a fast walking delivery man.  I realize the trade off would be shorter battery life for some, but I am powering mine via the old doorbell transformer.)  Plus, some events never trigger at all, for no obvious reason.  Based on the number of events that do get captured while I am home, which is most of the time, and the number of events that I know it misses, I would say it misses 20% of the events. I have had two "false" someone is at your door when no one was around in the two months.  Both of those were in the first week. The first one was really disturbing as we didn't realize what was going on.  After looking around outside, then googling it, I am convinced both were the ghost rings others have reported. Overall, I will keep this unit.  It does record activity to a degree, but I will not get more as I had planned to do if it worked out.
title: Misses events but better than nothing.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ron Smith
content: Does not work for me.  “Live View” NEVER works and video quality is not up to par. (Not 1080p) Not worth the price to me.  Looking at other brands, will donate the “Ring!” When I have decided upon its replacement. FYI: I have 300mbps internet service operating on a WIFI Mesh system with a node 10’ from the Ring device!  Tested 124mbs download and 22mbs upload outside measured and recorded “at the device“ as the worst of multiple speed measurements Purchased 11/18.  Many false alarms and always “times-out” when attempting the “Live View” option. I must have a DUD!
title: Wait Until They Perfect It

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Maryland Techy
content: I had friends using this doorbell who were absolutely thrilled with it. Setup - The setup for this device could not be easier or better detailed in the instructions.  Everything is clearly labeled, even on the device itself there are small stickers showing you where things are located.  Getting it set up on your WiFi and getting the battery charged and installed can be done by anyone regardless of how technically proficient they are! Installation - I was worried I would have to attach this to wires...if you look at other smart doorbells (and I have), how you install it depends on how your current doorbell is installed.  And a LOT of them recommend you hire an electrician to do it correctly and safely.  Who wants to hire someone for a doorbell? The Ring avoids all of that.  It's like hanging a picture!  Just screw in the mount, attach the doorbell, screw that in and you're done!  It's literally, 1-2-3! Usage - The same app that helps you install, configure, and get your Ring installed is also what you'll use to monitor it.  And here's where you find out the resolution and framerate of the camera is INCREDIBLE!!!  You'll be able to see the images pretty quickly, they are saved to the cloud (which has a small fee attached), and you can even see where other Ring installations are throughout your area (for blocks and blocks around you!) and what incidents they've encountered.  I don't know if that last part is more helpful than scary, but there it is. Summary - I am SO glad I bought my Ring!  I'm moving soon and this is coming with me!  Which is something you can't do with the other doorbells which require huge installations and rewiring.  I'm slowly making my home a Smart Home and this is a great new addition I'm very happy with!
title: Easy Setup, Excellent Device!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nxactly
content: I really like the concept of the Ring doorbell. It does record 30 seconds every time it detects motion. I get notifications when motion is detected. I am able to snooze these notification when they get too bothersome. My main disappointment is that I can't view anything live and I can't communicate through the device as advertised. It is supposed to be able to do that, but it doesn't work. I think it is the wi-fi signal, but when I conduct the Ring test, it says the signal is strong. Unfortunately, if someone is creeping at my door, I won't know until after the fact- maybe a few minutes as you wait for the video to download into the app for viewing. And forget about talking through the app. While I can hear pretty much everything, if I can even get a live feed to pull up, they can't understand anything I say because it's all garbled. Since the device is telling me my wi-fi signal is good then maybe it's the device itself. At least I got it for a good deal on Prime day.
title: Great Concept - Doesn't Deliver Everything Advertised

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eric
content: I often come home from work with a package on my doorstep and no indication from the doorbell that the delivery driver had been there. The doorbell has an excellent view of the walkway leading up to my doorstep. It doesn't receive WIFI signal very well (RSSI-52) even though it's only 30 feet from my router and I have their range extender half way between the router and the doorbell. I've gone through their troubleshooting steps, and even replaced the router without any improvement. All the other wifi devices in my house have excellent connections to the router. When the chimes worked (they failed after a year and cannot be reset) there was around a ten to fifteen second delay between motion detection or someone pushing the doorbell and the chime sound. I've had problems with their contact sensors too. I've had a couple of contact sensors that couldn't handle being in the sun... the plastic housing would warp enough to trip the tamper sensor, setting off my alarm in the middle of the day. The Ring system is buggy garbage, and I regret spending as much as I have on it.
title: Misses events, poor wifi performance

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: the Gringo
content: I bought a Ring because everyone seemed to be happy with them. I decided not to go with one of the higher rated off brands and now regretting that decision the more I read. This thing is almost useless at answering the door. It takes WAY too long to "Activate Device". Sometimes, by the time it activated, the person was walking away.  This was apparently a bug recently, but they claimed it was fixed and I have noticed no improvement. My connection is good and I have fiber internet, so all i have left is the service is less than par. Frustrated about paying for such lousy service. ***Update: The delay issue is listed as "Fixed", but things are not any better. Almost seems worse. The video sits in "Processing" mode for a frustratingly long time. This is unacceptable. I am looking for a different system. Ring is way over-hyped.
title: does not live up to the hype

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joolie
content: "Live View" is a joke.  Rarely, If Ever Works - And when when it rarely does, it takes FOREVER to pull up. Most of the time it doesn't even pull up at all though. "Your phone is having trouble connecting to Ring." Annoying.  I was mesmerized by the commercials, captivated with visions of my gruff, electronically-brazened voice calling out over the speaker “Hey! Whutter you doin’ on my porch! Put that package down, the police are on their way!” But it doesn’t work in the real world. Everytime i contacted support, it was "my fault", "my internet connection", "you need to update your firmware", "you need wifi extender" blah blah blah.  I even purchased not 1, not 2, but 3 EERO WIFI extenders, and still nada.  "Live view" only seems to work when there is NO ONE THERE!. And that myth about me actually speaking to the person on the porch? Well, the ghost of that ship has done sailed, honey, far out into the sunset and ne’er to return. Only the Jehovah’s Witnesses and the Home Improvement Salesmen are willing to stay on my porch after they have rung the doorbell, waiting while it takes 10-15 seconds for the alert to hit my phone, and then the 2-5 minutes it takes for the video to become available for me to view. So no, my expectations were not met. Motion Detection is Delayed - Yes, UPS delivery guys are fast, but Ring takes SO LONG to even notice they're there, that they're already back in their truck and driving off by the time it starts recording. All in all, NOT impressed, would NOT recommend.
title: Live View is a joke

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael Rudolph
content: The RIng doorbell2 is an inferior product at best. Motion detected video is limited to a 30 second clip of any event even with a subscription. There is a "reset time" before another video starts to record. Ring claims this "reset time" is a few seconds, but with my experience it was longer than 4/5 minutes (tested and verified by ring customer service), if a new video ever even started at all.  No additional videos ever happened for me all of the time. There is also a "white Flashing" of the video when it starts if your doorbell camera is in a shaded area. This will last about 5 seconds. Ring management acknowledges that this is happening, but says that this is normal for their camera and cant be fixed. see pictures. How does this keep my family safe? You miss the first section of video with the white flashing, then the camera doesn't capture any complete event even if motion/activity continues in front of the camera. How is this acceptable? Thieves have figured this out and can turn their backs on the camera for 30 seconds then your screwed and you won't get any video of anything.
title: Terrible product/ Gimmick at best

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Leo R
content: So i got these on sale. Installation was straight forward enough. I did do a bunch of extra work to get it to fit and sit extacly the way i wanted it to. Picture quality is good. Night vision is ok. Alerts and sensitivity are adjustable and pretty consistent. The problem is that it is hit or miss when it needs to connect to your phone so you can see whats going on. Seems to be slow to connect sometimes. Sometimes it doesnt record the video or comes up unavailable.  Seems to do it when i need to see whats going on the most. To be fair, I'll say it works about 80 to 90 percent of the time. When it doesn't it is frustrating considering i am paying to have it recorded and save footage and to be able to see whats happening live. It seems to fail when i need it most. Like when I'm not home and waiting for a delivery, or when someone rings the doorbell, which is the worst time for that to happen.
title: Works most of the time.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike O
content: The product may eventually work fine, I may never know.  This product has 2 MAJOR deficiencies.  I have a 6 year old house with a digital doorbell installed by the  builder (flush mount).  I bought the Ring2.  Did the install and when I flipped the breaker back on my home doorbell just kept ringing.  I called support and after sitting on hold for 15 minutes got a snide guy named Craig B.  Rather than make this too long, I'll summarize.  Why doesn't ring make their product, or a version of their product compatible with DC doorbells and as a bonus, he also told me that even though I'm hard wiring my ring, I'll still have to occasionally remove and charge the battery.  Nowhere does it say that in the literature.  If you hard wire something, that should be it.  Extremely disappointed in ring products and in the attitude of the support person.  Craig sent me a list of "compatible" door bells.  Would have been nice if they shared/explained more about this up front.  Frustrated customer.  Since I've already bought and begun installing, now I have to decide if I'm going to return the ring system or replace my doorbell.  Ring should subsidize me replacing the door bell.
title: Heads up before buying, check compatibility and support sux

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: VR
content: The quality of the picture is good, installation is easy for us. Not only we can telecom ppl at the door but we can review videos that we missed (we are still on the new user trial period so it's free)., we really enjoy having a peace of mind. I must say that had I known that the video is something we have to pay an annual fee to obtain, I'd look at a different product. Because this is not a cheap device and I expect the history storage comes with the package, to learn it's additional cost is not a happy news. I almost never catch the ring live, I have it for a week now. I also like the fact the I can see what the neighborhood reports activities in the area so I can watch out for it. I recommend this device to anyone who wants a good quality camera doorbell and don't mind to pay the annual subscription fee.
title: Great product but wish we had known about the annual fee for subscription for viewhing video

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Goldilox
content: Best thing ever!  I can see who's at my door even if I'm at work.  The subscription is so you can go back to previous video or pictures of a thief and such.  You'll still be able to see who's at your door in real time without subscription.  If you're worried about someone stealing it off your house...don't worry, you'll already have them on camera, up close and personal.  You can even share alerts with neighboring ring users, like if there is a possible prowler,  suspicious vehicle etc.  You can go live anytime you want and speak to whomever is at your door whether you're home or not.  Just recently I checked to see how bad it was storming at my house.  I also have the echo show, and all I have to say is "Alexa, show me the carport" and it shows my carport area on the screen.  I should be the spokesperson for this product!  I love it!  I was on here looking for second camera when I decided to write this review.
title: I should have gotten this first, before the whole wired camera system we have was installed.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Homan
content: The Ring is extremely easy to install and it works even better than I expected.  I like to be able to see what is happening at the front door from my phone anywhere in the world at any time.  I also like to be able see videos of whatever has happened on the porch that day or night. I am the computer tech in the family and I try hard not to call support, but I called Ring support because some things that need to be done in Setup are not clear in the instructions.  The hold time was not more than a minute or two, which is very good.  I spoke to Scott, who is one of the most competent and friendly customer support people I've ever talked to.  We had a few things to solve and he led me through them one by one and then gave me the credit, which I found amusing.  This product and company have it together!  I am considering getting one of their security cameras for my back door too.
title: Better Than I Expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scott Mahan
content: I wanted to like this thing, and when it works it has d great promise. However don't bother with it unless you have unlimited time to mess with hoping to make it work. I'm on my second one, and support has been decent, but it just isn't reliable in motion detection. I have set the motion settings every which way, and so it didn't pick up someone walking up to my door until they are right at the door, yet as I type this, it's going off every few minutes because there is a squirrel playing in the front yard, 15 to 20 feet away, and I have the range set to about 5 feet currently so I don't get every car passing by. (and people still don't set it off until they are on top of it) I feel like A Beta tester for this thing and I'm over it.  I have great wifi signal to it, so that's not an issue. It seems when something does set it off, it takes a few seconds for it to 'wake up' and start recording, though I can stand any distance away for several seconds at varying distances and wave my arms and move around and nothing... Until I'm a foot away (regardless of range setting).
title: Still not ready for prime time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Klassy
content: The "free trial" expired and now this piece of trash is useless. Of course they give you a 30 day trial and then a return period that ends at the same time so now I can't return it. I WANT MY MONEY BACK. This thing sucks anyways even when it was on the trial.
title: I WANT TO RETURN IT

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brian Tarbox
content: The Ring is the app that makes the Echo Show worth while.  The installation was easy (open the box and start charging the battery because that will take 5+ hours).  Added the Device and Skill to Alexa and I was getting notifications on the phone.  To access the Ring from the Show you have to configure alerts, then you can say "Alexa show me the FrontDoor" (or whatever you called the device).  If you do that you can hear the person at the door but they can't hear you unless you enable the microphone.  The audio quality isn't the greatest but its sufficient.
title: Easy to install, works great with phone and Echo Show

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ravin' Maven
content: I got this doorbell because it had a battery and was much less expensive than running power.  The video capture was also attractive for security purposes but I am not yet willing to pay $3 or $10 per month to have the videos saved. There are a zillion videos.  Two every time I go down the driveway, four every time I use my car and return.  I suppose I don't  need to keep deleting them but it is still annoying.  I did manage to integrate the Ring with Alexa  to ask Alexa to turn off the motion capture however the skill can not do this.  Looking at the reviews of the Google skill it is just as bad. This doorbell sends the ring (and video) to the internet which then sends it back to your phone and, in my case, the Ring doorbell chime.  There is a delay of seconds to a minute while this occurs.  They are on the same LAN so they could work immediately - but that would deprive Ring of the money from their storage service. Pros: OK as a doorbell without wiring Good motion detect, sensitivity capabilities, zone capabilities High definition video capture during day Cons: Poor integration with Alexa and Google Variable delays in actually getting the ring on your phone or wireless chime Night capture (IR) not so good - even though I have a porch light that is on Fisheye lens is so-so for security
title: Sort of good

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: irene
content: I've been hearing about this product for years and i thought by now it would've been out long enough that it was really good. Nope- i will get notifications all day about cars passing or light/sun reflecting off of something but i wont get notifications when a delivery person walks right up to my door , no matter how many times i adjust motion detection. The other day when i was getting home i saw the delivery guy walk up and pushed the doorbell on this thing and maybe he didn't push hard enough but i didn't get motion sensor notification either. soooo...? Keep searching, this cam ain't it.
title: Wouldnt reccomend

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ferrante Jones
content: I must say that the good deal on this product appealed to me so much that I barley read the reviews before purchasing the item. I must say that I do like the clear camera, the distance that it covers and that it interacts with my amazon echo. However, I’m not impressed with the constant lag when trying to retrieve the live footage. My internet speed is great so I know that’s not the issue so I’m sure the issue is with the doorbell. I received a notification on my phone that I had packages delivered but there’s no video footage or motion notification whatsoever for the time that the package was dropped off. That concerns me but we’ll see how it goes. I definitely won’t hesitate to return it if it doesn’t give me the sense of security or help that I thought it would.
title: Not impressed - definitely might return

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Belinda
content: I'm so glad I got a ring doorbell and had my electrician install it.  I can now see who comes to my door when I'm at work every day.  I originally  purchased the ring floodlight and had it installed on my garage and a few weeks later I saw a man come up my driveway, knock on my back door and go around looking in my floor to ceiling windows on the back of the house.  He saw the ring floodlight and I told him thru the speaker to leave my yard and I sounded the alarm.  I purchased the doorbell the next day so I could see the front of my house also.  I've since purchased another floodlight for my back yard.  I love the ring products and I feel so much safer now.  I have an ADT alarm but I never would have known there was a man looking in my windows without ring.
title: I feel much safer

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Leonid Mann
content: The Video quality is real HD. However, the record processing is way too long. After receiving motion alert, you have to wait couple minutes before you will be able to see what it is about, since the video processing takes number of minutes. Only after awhile, you can view what or who has triggered this alert. The same happens after somebody rang the bell. It is impossible to answer the bell instantly, but only after the device activated during a minute or two. This is great disappointment. If I could, I would return this device and tried the other type...
title: Video Quality is Great...if you can live with the delays...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RK
content: Bought two units at full price. Found a charging cable and battery but no charging adapters in the box. Realized they don't include it with the box. Called cust support. They told me to use my phone's charging adapter.  I told em I can't because it's type C whereas the ring 2 uses microUSB. I was then told to use laptop's USB port to charge. So it seems I now have to buy a laptop to charge my ring video door bell 2. Bad experience as I did not expect to buy an expensive product without all necessary supplies. Probably my fault since I failed to read all fine print instructions.
title: Customer Awareness

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe H
content: What a piece of crap.  After having this thing just over a year it will not stop sensing motion.  Even after covering the camera with duct tape. It keeps alerting motion when there is absolutely nothing there. Do not purchase this thing if you want sanity! It will drive you nuts with false alarms.  Even before this latest issue it would detect vehicles on the street but not people on the porch! Adjusted the motion sensitivity numerous times. It's just not worth the money or aggravation.
title: NOT GOOD QUALITY JUNK

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Christy
content: With two stars I can start with the short likes list first. It looks nice on the house and may deter package thieves. That is all. Now for the not so great. The app is too slow to pull up the live feed, so there is no point as I can walk to the door and open it before the feed would show. I can’t keep live view on because it drains the the battery faster than it charges with wires from a powered doorbell. Without service, no videos are saved for any period of time. So if someone robs your house you better hope you paid for service. I understand they don’t want to host your videos on the cloud for free, but I have 8 Yi Home cameras around my house, they load faster, require no service plan, and with 32GB memory cards installed give me several days of recorded motion event history, for free. Fortunately I bought this on a cyber Monday deal or I would be a bit more put out that my $20 cameras run circles around this doorbell. Oh and if you happen to have kids who watched Chuggington on repeat, this doorbell plays the Chuggington theme song every time it is pressed, it can’t be changed, but fortunately you can mute it.
title: Without service, it is just a doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Purchase Person
content: Review of Ring Doorbell 2/Echo Show 8 Amazon combo: The doorbell motion detection signal and audio/video is routed to your device via the internet, making motion detection delayed, sometimes so much so that a quick source of motion never triggers it.  The motion range settings are confusing and unreliable.  Recently, after viewing camera images via my Echo Show 8, the sound becomes highly degraded from all others sound sources (e.g. audio streaming) until I unplug the Echo Show for a short time, then reconnecting the power.  One more newly discovered annoying feature on the Echo Show:  I used to be able to resume stopped audio streaming by asking the device to “resume”.  Now, after having watched my first video on the Show days ago, it responds “OK, tell me what you want to watch” whenever I ask to resume an audio stream.
title: Delayed, poor motion detection, doesn’t work well with Echo Show 8

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jet Seller
content: I spent about 3 hrs. trying to get my Ring Doorbell 2 to connect with my wifi. Two of the hours were on the phone with Ring Tech Support. Hard to understand the person, sounded like a Phillipino. She was not good at her job. She keep telling me my router is bad. I kept telling her I can see on my router panel that it recognized the Ring connection, but the Ring unit would not link. Again, she insisted my router was bad....really???? Finally, I demanded a replacement unit. I hope the replacement can connect. I'm not impressed with Ring so far. What a hassel!!! 3rd. Ring doorbell being returned because it won't connect to either of my WiFi or MiFi networks. Received my second doorbell from Rind that does not work. My wife cannot believe he amount of time that I have spent with Ring Tech Support. After my 3rd or 4th person today in the Phillipines, they finally transferred me to someone in Texas. He had the smarts to ask me if I had another devise, such as a laptop to connect thru a cell network. I do, my Ipad and thru my MiFi. Finally, after all the other Ring Techies insisted that I had a bad Wi-fi, I finally convinced a Techie at Ring, that indeed, they are sending me bad units & it is not my Wi-fi networks. There is definitely a bunch of bad units that Ring is shipping out. It gets more painful everyday. I think Ring needs to send me a 3rd unit for free, for all the hassel I've gone thru. They owe me one that they have tested and it works. Don't buy this product until I get to post some successful use of this very pitiful product. 3rd unit same problem. Ring Doorbells are JUNK!!! Obviously Ring does not bother to test these units.
title: Second Ring Dorrbell 2 that does not work. Now 3rd one being returned for refund.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Real feedback
content: We installed this because we live in a city where package theft is a big problem. We can monitor even when we aren’t home or if a delivery person doesn’t ring the bell to know when something is left on our stoop. Also, it’s good to see who is at the door if you’re home alone. I like the safety aspect it provides and the recording. I bought an extra battery because we live in a northern climate so the battery needs to be recharged more often. But you can monitor how much juice the battery has so you know when to swap them out.
title: Great for package delivery or seeing who’s at the door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: chemflyer
content: I really wish I could be more positive about this device, but I have frankly been quite disappointed, and would not recommend it to others. It was fairly easy to install, but was more difficult to set up than it should be. I had a hard time establishing the WiFi connection, and then it complained that it was not a good enough signal. Even though I get a fine WiFi signal at the front door with my phone or iPad, it was not good enough for the Ring. So I had to install another WiFi access point in the room near the front door to get it to work well. The next major issue I have is the delay between motion detection and beginning of video recording. I went through the wizard for setting up motion detection, and  that seemed to work well. But when motion is detected, there is a 2 or 3 second delay before video recording begins. If there was a package on my porch, it would really be possible for someone to run up, grab it, and leave and all I would get on the recording is their back as they are walking away. The first second or so of video is also often of very poor quality. It often begins with a bright screen flare as if the aperture of the camera is wide open, and it takes about a second to adjust to the right light level. Another annoyance is the delay for the app to connect to the device. If someone rings my doorbell when I am away and I want to speak with them through the app, there is often a delay of as long as 10-15 seconds while the app is "establishing a connection" to the doorbell. By this time, the person has often given up and walked away. Finally there is the issue of video and audio quality. Even with the closer WiFi access point, there are often gaps and cutouts in the audio, and occasional gaps in the video where the app just says "video not available". It is not easy to have a conversation with someone at the door through the app because of the poor audio quality. This Ring doorbell is a great concept and it has nice features, but the implementation still leaves a lot to be desired.
title: Disappointed in the performance - video delay, weak Wifi, poor quality video and audio

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Valerio love
content: Love this has mad a huge difference in my anxiety and love to know what the dogs are yapping about so no more getting up and down and my cat doesn’t set it off every time he comes to the porch cause my husband installed it with the right settings. We were very impressed with the packaging it comes in with step by step instructions and labels for everything so you know what everything is for comes with level drill bits and other things you wouldn’t thing of needing. Also the Ring company didn’t skimp and just give u generic instructions. Love that Amazon offered flex payments too this is the first time I ever had it offered and love it no credit needed just use your card and make 5 payments made it affordable!  Don’t recommend the white one cause the bronze is less noticeable!  I chose the one that had them both. Thanks Amazon
title: Ring is impressive and worth every penny!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MR58
content: I bought this for our son and daughter in law for Christmas and they love it!  They installed it very easily and the same night, there was someone out in the street yelling and 2 others chasing him.  He was acting irrationally and the Ring captured a very detailed and clear video of the entire scene.  The police came and eventually caught him running through backyards and were able to identify him correctly due to the clear video our son had.  Great product, price and we highly recommend it!
title: Very Detailed Video Footage!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jerry924
content: This device is ok, there are some problems with it though that I wish they could figure out: Pros: * can go back and watch past videos * two way talking Cons: * Loading the app to see the live video from the time motion is detected takes too long. Sometimes, people have already left the porch * False positives in the fall/winter. Seems like spring/summer, everything is great, then as it gets colder outside I get a ton of false positives. Getting false positive readings at 11pm at night when I don't expect anyone to be coming onto my porch can be unnerving. * Device is only 15 feet from my router and signal is poor. My cell phone has full signal next to it. I think the radio in the ring is not as good as it could be.
title: Its OK

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joseph
content: Just finished installing was a simple process unfortunately theres a slight gap between the angle plate they provide and the top right corner of the actual device nothing anyone would notice but the installer. The motion detection could be better I wish it wasnt done by degrees but rather degree and radius per sector. Battery life is decent so far will right back when first charge is drained.
title: Great doorbell camera system

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ArkiliasX
content: I love this device. I shopped for cameras for months before deciding on this one. It's easy to install. Has great detection abilities and great night vision. My only complaint is that sometimes at work I can't get the live view to work. A lot of people complain about the subscription fee. It's $3.00 a month.
