Most of you pay  more than that for a coffee or pack of cigarettes every single day. The fee is for storing motion events. Storing data costs money. There are alternatives that are free but I would not trust them to have my data saved when I really needed it. I like to know that if I get an alert but don't have the chance to view it right away I can do so later. Totally worth $3.00. Or maybe they are right and I should buy scratch off tickets and energy drinks instead.
title: $3.00 subscription fee is worth it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: A. Nicholson
content: I'm editing my original review which is right below this.  One of the questions I researched was how long the battery would last and the answer was 6 months!!! When I first got it, the battery would last about 6 weeks, then about 4 so I order another battery.  Now, 1 year later the charges on them are lasting less than 1 week.  I have no features turned on except the camera when the doorbell rings and it is still draining the batteries in a week's time. I'm really disappointed and not sure how I'm going to solve this.  Hardwiring is not an option for me. This was my original review. This is working out so well! It was very easy to install and comes with absolutely everything you could possibly need, even a drill bit, not necessary in most installations, but it's there!.  Very clear picture and so handy for me as I am upstairs a lot of the day and can now let someone know I'm on my way, or, if it's someone I don't care to see, either ignore them or tell them to "go away" without rushing through the house and down the stairs to the front door when I don't want to answer it.  The motion detector is great and let's me know when the postman has crossed my doorway to deliver my mail, but is not so sensitive that it's set off by a passerby or a dog.  A wonderful innovation and I'm thrilled I chose to get one.
title: Changed my original rating to poor because of batteries

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Andrea
content: Love everything about it, but it can’t pick up a strong wifi signal most of the time.  Looking back in the “history” of videos is descent (glitches once in a while), but trying to look at the live picture (like when someone is at the door or you want to see it quickly) never works for at least 2-5 minutes until it “connects”. Like it for what it is in general, but they could define make some improvements! The doorbell itself rarely works...usually only goes off when we lose power, which is so weird so we bought the one you plug in to hook to our account in the app and it works nice. I do like that you can move it around to any plug. So if I’m in the basement or somewhere far away from the unit it’s great to be able to easily move.  I do like the convenience of all of their items they sell they all connect to 1 account on your app and it’s easy to check them all or make setting changes.
title: Descent, but definitely could improve in a couple of areas.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Matthew Halter
content: I purchased this product on Black Friday for the Black Friday discounted price, unfortunately the product would not work  for my home and I have to return it.  I contacted customer service because I need to return it and I wanted to upgrade to the Ring Video Pro, with HD Video as that product will be a better match for my home, but I would only purchase it if the Black Friday price of $178.00 could be honored, as I would have purchased that device originally had I realized the Ring Video Doorbell 2 would not work in my home.  Sadly, I was told the price could not be honored; therefore, I will not be buying a Ring...I will not be signing up for a Ring monthly subscription...or buying additional Ring devices, which means the company losses money in the long run.  So I'm very perplexed as to why Amazon would not process this request.  Maybe I am missing something.  I may have to look into buying a Nest from Google.  Not my preferred option, but since Amazon can't figure it out, maybe that's a sign.  Sure hope they reconsider or offer a better explanation than we can't do that.  I've been a loyal Amazon Prime member for many years now.  Disappointed.
title: Customer Service Blunder IMO

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Charles R. Young
content: Easy instalation, though I didn't put it in the same place as the old doorbell because I wanted to angle it more toward the sidewalk. To avoid charging the battery, I used an external power supply since I had a power outlet nearby. As others have mentioned here, when delivery people come set down a box on the porch and leave quickly I will usually miss seeing them by the time I get a visual. When away from home it takes a minute or two to get the phone and activate the camera, so they are usually gone by then. It does record the event though (if you pay the monthly fee). The only thing about that is that it takes a few minutes for the recording to be available, so I can't quickly determine who was there. Alexa integration: I have the Alexa Show 8 which works well to see the camera video. When motion is detected, it emitts a chime sound and states motion is detected or someone is at the door if they push the ring doorbell. The main issue is that I have to command "Alexa, show me the front door." It then takes about 3 seconds for the video to come on the screen. One would think that once the camera announced movement it would automatically show the camera view; but it doesn't. Looking on Google for a solution, I found many people had complained of this for a couple of years.
title: Good picture, a bit of a delay to see video.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Keith Waggoner
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I don’t know why I am reading so many bad reviews on this doorbell. It does what it says . I have a vacation home in the Bahamas and mine works great. Even when I am in the states . I have attached a video of my best friend going in the apartment yesterday and sound and video quality is great. That house is on a very busy road and near an airport. But rarely do I get any alert that is just traffic and I have it set for motions right at the end of my driveway. I use it because it is a vacation home and I am not always there . This way I can monitor it 24/7 . I live in a four Plex there my only complaint would be it works to good and I get a lot of updates I don’t need. I set this up myself . I am a woman even though this is my husbands amazon . I set this up myself in less than half an hour . Most of that was screwing the screws into concrete walls . I didn’t have a drill. I choose not to wire it to the existing doorbell . Since if anyone rings the other bell I can still see them on camera.  I get no lagging delay and have actually talked to my friend as she was unlocking the door . And I am all the way here in the states . And the internet in Nassau Bahamas is not the best quality but my doorbell has never had an issue . Since I didn’t hardwire it I just use the battery I can tell you even on a very busy road the battery life is fantastic. Only have had to charge twice since November. And as I said I live in a 4 Plex there so I am always getting the neighbors on it . I think for the price to know my vacation home is safe it is great. I wouldn’t use another product. Clear view clear audio . And I can speak to anyone at my door from the states and just say we can’t answer you right now we are busy. With that being said I don’t understand what people are expecting this product to do, and yes you have to sign up for a monthly or yearly subscription but I pay only 10 dollars a month and it is worth it . Very satisfied!!! Planning on buying one for my backcourts as well
title: Love it for vacation home in the Bahamas

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jennifer Swiger
content: I love our new Ring doorbell! Very clear video, and you can set parameters of where you want the alerts to go off at. It's actually saved my dog from going missing twice now! She's a little escape artist and has managed to break free from our back porch twice since we got the Ring, and has appeared on the alert so I was able to call the family member who was still home and tell them to bring the dog in. My teenage son however hates it. He's been busted leaving late for school, bringing people to the house without saying anything first and doing a stupid little dance in the front yard while he thought no one was looking! That one was my favorite- as I turned on the communicator to talk and startled him! HA!
title: I love it, teenager-not so much!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chris Graff
content: I really like this doorbell and all the features that come with the subscription. Do not listen to the other complaining about getting pestered by notifications. You need to pay attention to the setup and use the supplied wedges to adjust the motion zones. I first set this up at a much higher angle upwards to see more faces. That resulted in me getting a notification for cars driving by even at the lowest setting of motion. I added the wedge downward and that fixed my issues to where i could actually increase the motion a bit more. It is now perfect and catches just the right amount of movement. The battery lasts a very long time and I bought an extra to swap and charge while the other is in use. I really enjoy the neighbor hood events it allows me to see what is going on in the area i live in. I also have this linked to my alexas and iphone/apple watch. Wifi has not been an issue for me but I have a high end router with terrific signal. Dont read the bad info due to improper setup of this device. The instructions even guide you through this to reduce notifications, I will be buying more Ring items when we buy our next house.
title: Great item!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GT
content: Very disappointing performance. Motion detection was slow to catch sometimes. If you're trying to see your front door remotely but have only 3 bars (out of 5) or less on your phone.. Forget it. The worst part was that there were regular occurrences of the video freezing during recording for up to 8-9 seconds. Doesn't seem like a big deal? That's enough time for someone to come into and out of recognizable distance (with your package that just got delivered). Audio was also poor; sounded like everything was coming through a helicopter blade. Let's also not forget that you have to pay for the service. Returned and bought the night owl. It has better motion detection, video, audio, local recording with inserted sd card, and no monthly fees.
title: R...ng V.......eo .......orb...ll

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: C8992
content: The camera does not work well. It takes too long to be able to review footage after I have an alert or someone rings the door bell. It’s very spotty and not reliable. I much prefer my old Nest Camera and the ease of use. There are many times the camera will not record a delivery or a person at my door and other times it will record a car driving by when I have the settings set to ignore cars on the street. Overall I am not happy with the way the camera works. Needs to be improved.
title: Does not work as well as it should. There are better options out there.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J.T.  Harrod
content: I purchased three of the ring doorbell, and I really feel it was worth every penny I paid. This product is great! The picture is extremely clear both day and night vision. The sound is very clear as well, so I'm able to understand what people are saying when they're within range. I was able to adjust the distance the camera picked up motion before it activated. This is nice because some of the areas I have the doorbell are a lot more active than the other two.  I'm looking forward to getting a camera to go with the doorbells. If you find the batteries draining too fast, you might want to adjust the range under the "motion zone" setting. I purchased the extra battery packs with charger. I'm happy I did because it took about 12 hours to charge the batteries before I could use it. The extra batteries are nice because I have charged them and was able to simply pop them in right away once I saw the one on the back door draining because it's more active. The extra batteries really was worth it because of this. I'm able to always see whose around my back area.
title: Ring is a BOSS!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ingrid Clark
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I got this doorbell as a bundle with the Echo dot for Black Friday.  Mainly got it because of some recent warnings of packages being stolen and cars being broken into in the neighborhood. Connecting it to the wifi from my phone was a little complicated.  The calibration was also a bit of a pain, but once I figured out the right sensitivity and amount of notifications I wanted, I now know when someone steps on my property. The battery lasts even through the constant live camera viewing I was doing on my phone.  Since having it for about 2 weeks the battery percentage has only gone down by 5%. As you can see from the video and picture, the image quality is superb and gives a wide view of my front yard.  Even the night vision mode is clear. Pairing with the Echo was simple. A yearly subscription to the cloud for videos will run you about $30 for 1 device, which I believe is worth it.
title: Better than expected.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Peter Latvis
content: Changing this review from 1 star to 4 stars.  While the original install process was a nightmare and I still don't understand what enabled another person to use my email address to create an account, Ring's customer service has been very persistent in communicating with me until my issue was resolved.  Ultimately I signed  up under a different email address and it worked.  Then customer service worked with me to reactivate my original email address.  While I wish that had been an option from the start, I certainly think there customer service is top notch. ---------- Just got a Ring Video Doorbell 2 for my birthday.  Excitedly I opened the box, and went right to the installation instructions.  The first step was to download the app. I used my iphone 6 to go to the app store, and downloaded "Ring - Always Home".  So far so good.  Right? Nope. I opened the app and it prompted me to choose sign in or create an account.  Having never had a Ring before I opted to create an account.  I entered my email 2x and chose a password, only to be told that the email I was using was already used.  Funny - that has been my personal email for 15 years and I've never had an account with Ring. So I went back an opted for the sign in option, choosing "forgot password".  Sure enough a forgot password email was delivered to my personal email account, and I was able to change the password. My next surprise came when I attempted to log in. Apparently the account already had a name and it wasn't even mine. This tells me that Ring does not verify the email address of its user by sending confirmation with a click through verification.  This is pretty unsafe and not a good security practice, especially for a company that provides home security. While this would be bad enough, its just the start of the problem. After finally logging in - there was no opportunity to add my new doorbell.  I checked all the menus, went through all the settings - no opportunity to add my device. So off we go - time to call their support. I called and spent 56 minutes with their support team (like I have an hour to burn on the first step of device setup).  I learned the following: Uninstalling the App Reinstalling the App Uninstalling the App Reinstalling the App Uninstalling the App, and Reinstalling the App Surprisingly did't fix the problem. I confirmed 3 times that I had downloaded the right app. Emailed 6 screenshots. Confirmed that I'm using a supported phone. Was sent to "tier 2" customer service - no luck Was sent to advanced customer service - no luck. Finally found out that despite downloading the correct app, that it was directing me to Ring's Neighborhood App. I was told there was no immediate fix and that they had no idea how to get me set up since setup is app dependent. Next I was told that they would escalate the issue - finally maybe a solution is near. Nope. Instead the customer service rep mentioned casually that it would be at least 48 hours before the advanced solution team would respond.  That sure made me feel important. So I'm sitting here, looking at the Ring Doorbell still sitting in the box, because I wasn't able to get any further than the first installation instruction.  I'll be waiting a minimum of 2 days for the next possible step. At this pace I'll be another year older before I'm able to install this. Can't recommend this product, it offers really bad security practices, and terrible installation experience.
title: REVISED - Installation NOT EASY - But GREAT Customer Service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Walter L.
content: I like to start of with my dislikes. Battery life. I didnt have a pre existing doorbell so I had to just use the battery. I got about 3 weeks out of it before I had to recharge it. Keep in mind i had it set to motion and had lots of motion. The camera quality is way better than my Samsung 1080P cameras I have worked into my house. The lens is somewhat like a fisheye Lens. It covers my entire front yard and more! The motion is adjustable. Motion detection is great. The app is great. I have recently purchased a new home and haven't installed it here yet. Luckily I have doorbells here that I can wire into. All in all this is a great camera system and notifications are quick.
title: Awesome camera quality.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CC
content: This video door bell has been a great addition to our home security system. Video quality is very good.  Sometimes there is a delay accessing the doorbell live view however, I think that is more of a wifi issue.  Only complaints about the product are 1) Battery Life and 2) Paying the monthly fee for playback. Since we have the system setup to record based on motion the battery needs to be recharged monthly.  Regarding the fee, I don't think customers should have to pay a monthly fee to keep recordings.
title: Works great good product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. anderson
content: I have had this for a month, and it never has worked right.  I have tried several solutions, including spending an extra $50 for the Chime pro, switched my internet over for higher speed, changed router and modem.  I have talked to Ring, and they sent me a link to router port settings.  That didn't help, so Ring told me that the problem is with my internet provider and their signal (Xfinity 250 mbps plus).  I have had Xfinity check my internet, they can't find a problem and says it problem is with Ring.  Neither Ring nor Xfinity have been of any help.  I am going to contact Xfinity and Ring again to see if we can get this solved.  I also made the mistake of spending the $30 for the video recording plan.  So far, no videos to save because the damn thing doesn't work!!!  Update 1/13/19.  After spending more time with the Ring people, they decided the device may be at fault.  They sent me a new unit.  This one worked for 3 days before it started having problems.  I get a 2 second recording at best.  Push the doorbell, long delay before chime goes off, video camera does not come on.  WHAT A PIECE OF JUNK
title: So far, complete waste of money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: The Reviewer
content: The first gen had virtually no issues. This one loves to drain the battery, only sees pitch black at night with spots of light that look like stars and planets in the distant. Can not charge battery fast enough through doorbell power so; troubleshooting info is a big FAIL. Detects every little motion from cars a block down the street with bushes and other cars almost hiding the street. The device can't seem to figure out when to connect to the wifi. sometimes signal strength Excellent sometimes poor. So with all the detection my phone blows up wasting my phone battery. The devs should have thought about motion and doorbells designing this 2nd gen; if I have a revolving door, this device should account for battery use.
title: My experience has been poor - Ring Doorbell Gen 2 failed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robin
content: The Ring is great. After a lot of research I decided on the ring. We did have a problem connecting to our phones, but i think that was on our part, not the Ring. You can adjust the distance and sensitivity for motion detection and types of motion. It never alerts on the neighbor's cat, squirrels or any other varmint that cuts across the yard. We have the battery powered one. If you get that, I strongly suggest to get an additional battery & charger. It does take a while for the battery to charge. The battery in the ring will last a few months before needing charging. The Ring offers a neighborhood alert.  Neighbors post about incidents happening which is good to know. We had a problem with cars being checked and items stolen out of them.
title: We love it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Thomas E Swyney
content: The Ring 2 doorbell was very easy to install.  The booklet was easy to understand and helpful.  The Ring videos in the Ring App were also of great help.  My installation was complicated by not having a working doorbell circuit connecting the front door and bell with the transformer.  I was lucky to have a friend to help me diagnose the problem and splice a piece if wire in the attic to create a working environment.  Then all I had to do was instal a new bell and then the Ring door bell button.  There was a point of confusion  for me created in one of the videos.  A call to the help line put that to rest and I mounted the button.  In my case, my door doesn't face down the walkway, so I used one of the included angle Pieces and it  covers the walkway.  Everything needed to install is in the box and the App as long as you have a working circuit.
title: The Ring 2 works as advertised and is easy to install.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Slush
content: We LOVE our Ring doorbell camera! We don’t have a doorbell in our rental home so this has been the next best thing. We’ve paired it with our Alexa devices and now we hear a doorbell sound anytime someone pushes the doorbell. I use the two-way talk feature every morning to tell my husband I love him one more time as he heads off to work. We also were able to warn others via Ring’s free “Neighbors” app about a door-to-food sales scam after a few of their reps came to our door. I also love being able to answer the door without opening the door, which is another great safety feature. We purchased a Ring Spotlight Camera for our backyard which has an alarm as well as a spotlight and we use the Ring app for both cameras. The only thing I would improve is the battery life. It definitely does not last six months as Ring suggests. More like 4 weeks.
title: Love our Ring Doorbell Cam

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MorganR
content: The concept is wonderful - have a camera (as well as a doorbell) that can notify you on your phone of any motion (as in people approaching your front door), no matter where you are in the world. In practice, it has some limitations: 1) the motion detection easily picks up background motions (cars moving), but adjusting the sensitivity down often blocks detection of people coming to the door -- it took lots of tweaking 2) the lens is very wide angle -- gets a lot in, but that means the detail of an intruder's face (or a package delivery or friend) is limited 3) Requires a subscription service to save the video - so this isn't a purchase, but rather a purchase plus a monthly fee All in all, a good thing, but it could be refined to be better.
title: A video camera accessible over the internet - with motion notifications

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Steve
content: I’m surprised at how poor the Ring user experience is. The product I received works as described. The product is packaged well. However, the recorded video is short in duration with no option to upgrade. Your recordings will often be cut short. The subscribing process was a hassle. The company makes it difficult for you to give them money. Even after subscribing, I’m getting messages telling me my trial is about to end with no indication that my subscription is recognized. Customer service is not great. The chatbots are annoying. Getting a real person to help is not easy. For a company that’s part of Amazon, I’m surprised at how poor the customer experience is. Also, if you give a Ring doorbell as a gift, they don’t have an option to gift a subscription with it. The gift recipient will need to pay to take advantage of basic features. (Update) In recent months, when motion is detected it can take several minutes to activate the device and pull up a live view. Other Ring owners report the same. Disappointed.
title: Surprisingly poor customer experience; Motion detector works well

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T. Moore
content: Ok...so comparing this to the Ring 1, this video quality is GREAT! My dislike: I've noticed the battery life for the Ring 1 is much better. Also, with the motion setting...you have 3 options to choose of how often you want the camera to capture motion. Less often conserves battery life (of course) so I chose that option. The camera recorded everything (birds, leaves blowing in the wind etc) but PEOPLE walking up to my door...wtf?!? Lol...I don't fault the device for that because its a universal setting for all the products...but that minimal option doesn't do any good if it doesn't record what matters...lol. So, with that being said it would be nice if the Ring Co programs it to detect larger objects. But overall, great device.
title: Something to make Ring products better!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Grateful Zugore
content: One thing is that I bought the ringer for it and it was not necessary because I have Alexa and she will tell me when the door bell rings, she will do so on all the speakers I have.  As with the stickup cameras the APP is not so great, by the time I open it and get the image to load no one is there.  I have great wifi and the health states it is all good from that perspective.  Also the Windows browser page is a pain, it continually requires me to get a pin sent to my phone. When I want to open it to see who is at the door i don't want to have to take time to get and enter that Pin.  The Windows app will not stay logged in and also requires a lot to open the app and as above no one is there once I finally get to see the images.  So the Android app takes too long, the browser asks for a pin, and the windows app will not stay logged in.  the device works well the apps not so much.
title: It works as expected but the apps are not so great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Debi
content: Before you buy this make sure you understand how the motion sensor works.  It DOES not work as advertised.  It does pick-up motion and you can "slightly" adjust the range, however you can not adjust it by zones as described in the advertising. I spent two hours on the Ring chat line trying to get it to adjust with no solution.  At the end of the conversation they said the developers made "adjustments" and that's how it works now.......very deceptive! Basically the only adjustment you can make it a wide area motion range that covers the entire wide angle range.  So if you want one side to have a more depth motion sensing than the other "zones" you can not do that.  So then what happens is that the unit will consistently be triggered which is VERY annoying. If I had to do this again I think I would purchase another companies unit.  If fact I might return this as I'm so aggravated at Ring.......VERY POOR design now.
title: Motion Sensor does not work as advertised!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: P. Mendelberg
content: Finally broke down and bought one at Black Friday killer price. Happy I did. Only hitch in set up is need to charge battery first. I wanted to install it when I got it but ended up having to wait until next day as it took 10 hours  to charge fully and they tell you not to sync it with the app until you install the battery. Another plus for me was that I installed it where my doorbell was. I was a little nervous not really knowing whether power would be compatible, But I guessed that most mechanical door bells with two wires work the same and Ring had screws for two wires. So what the heck. Tested it briefly and regular internal door bell worked fine. So next day, synced it with Ring app on my android phone, Worked easily per directions. Installed it on door with wedge add on. It worked great. Good picture.  Have to fuss a little with motion sensor to get it where it  did't go off with cars going by. But now I am satisfied. As long as the keep the fee for keeping the video online for $3 a month I can live with this. The plus having it hardwired to the doorbell is that it keeps it charged up and no having to recharge the battery every few months.
title: Ring Doorbell 2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: gender8ombs
content: Best money I've spend in my entire life, hands down. The motion trigger has been catching my neighbor's gossip about me as she walks past my door in our apartment complex and I may have legal grounds, harassment as she's been making false reports to management, also verified via Ring.  I am so much more informed now.
title: I've never had so much benefit from one device and service.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nicole
content: I had high hopes for this device. I was waiting for a battery operated Ring since I don't have any hard-wiring at my front door (my current doorbell is battery operated). While the device is very attractive (I use the bronze cover to match my exterior), the device itself seems to only detect and record motion that happens directly in front of it, regardless of the fact that I have ALL motion sensor areas selected. I have packages delivered regularly and not once has the Ring 2 sensor picked up the deliveries and the entire path of a delivery person, the porch gate and the area the package is dropped are all within the the range and as close as 6 feet. That means someone STEALING a package would not be picked up by the motion sensor either. Defeats the purpose of me having installed this device. Will likely be returning it.
title: Very Poor Detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Faith
content: This is a bad product. Why should one use this camera if it will not give you info ASAP? I noticed that when someone or something is in front of my door, the camera shows it when it is already in front or very near my door on many occasion. Sometimes it shows the stranger when the stranger is already leaving or far from my camera view. This is not a good product. A good quality camera should record events as it’s occurring ASAP when you get alerted and you check without delays. Sometimes when someone rings the ring door bell, it takes a while for it to load or show you who is there. Sometimes when you speak, they seem to have a hard time hearing you properly and for me to hear them is even worse. The voice is not audible enough to communicate or converse with someone (for example, UPS delivery) sometimes. For this is not an internet issue since I did troubleshoot to make sure...
title: Poor product! Product should be upgraded!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alcyon911
content: ●Delay in notification by several seconds with strong wifi. For example, my daughter walked up, took several seconds to unlock both locks, walked in and was standing in front of me when I was notified of "motion at the front door". ●App is bugged and several times a day will not connect despite giving a "Clean bill of health" on diagnostic. Would not have purchased after trying it for a month. *Update After my initial review the executive of community support from RING reached out to me and guided me in some tweaks to improve my service. After several weeks things have been absolutely constant and I'm very happy with my purchase and this product. 😁
title: Now works great! See update.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cyndi
content: Just wanted a little peace of mind when at home or away and the ring doorbell definitely fit the bill!! Replaced it where I had an existing doorbell and hardwired it so battery should not be an issue. Used the angled mount as it gave the best view of my porch and front yard. Installation was pretty easy and it looks nice. Has worked ever since it was installed with only one miss on a package that was delivered. Have no idea why it didn’t record it. I will probably continue with the $3 monthly storage once the free period is over.  It was a today’s deal which included a free Echo dot. Happy with this purchase!!
title: Nice little security for a good price

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joshua Leon Miller
content: When I purchased this, I had a lot of friends that liked the device and I can see why.  This thing is a life saver.  You will be surprised when you see who actually comes up to your door.  Plus I've gotten a few good videos of intoxicated individuals for good entertainment.  I currently use the battery set up and have been going on almost a week and the battery has barely gone down any.  The video quality is amazing and this gives me the piece of mind knowing the moment someone approaches my house.  The only thing I wish is that it included some storage of videos for free rather than only a month of trial before having to pay for the service to store alert history/videos.
title: A must need now days

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cautious Buyer
content: First thing, the door for the battery is ridiculously hard to open. I don’t even use the little screw. When I need to charge the battery, I have to get a knife or something to pry the battery door open. They could improve the battery door. As for functionality, the Ring 2 takes far too long to show the live picture. I set the motion detection to include my front yard, so that I could have time to see who is coming. The app said motion detected in my front yard. I tried to go to live view. The working icon or buffering icon or whatever kept spinning. It announced again motion detected in my front yard. The picture finally came up, and I saw the mailman going out of the gate. So it actually announced that the mailman was in my front yard both coming and going, but I saw nothing but the back of him leaving the gate. This is far too long for this “security” product to be taking. If it hadn’t been the mailman but a thief stealing my mail or packages, this would be a huge problem. And yes I did subscribe to the service, so in such a case I might have a video of the likely masked person who was able to get away with my stuff. I’m sure that will be very helpful to the police. But sometimes I’m waiting for UPS or FedEx and need to actually give them a package. This Ring 2 just allows me to see them driving away. While the icon is spinning, I can’t even access the microphone to tell whomever it may be to wait. And yes the battery is good, signal strength is good, and the firmware is up to date. No excuse for this thing to be this slow. Ok 2 stars because it does work as a doorbell, a very high priced one.
title: Could Be So Much Better

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sophie 723
content: Updated review:  I had a customer service rep call me and he walked me through the steps of connecting my ring 2 and he was able to figure out why my ring 2 was not syncing with my echo show it was sooo easy one minor mix up caused the ring from not connecting to my echo show, I’ve read other reviews about not syncing up and my advise is if you’ve tried everything I would highly suggest contacting amazon customer service they are super friendly and helpful (the call was less then 15 minutes) and I’m sooo glad I did....now my ring works and I love asking alexia show me front door after I get notified of motion outside....
title: Just love this product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ooh La La Photography
content: There are 2 things I don't like about this Ring Doorbell 2 is that the volume on the intercom is very low and the visitor has to come close to the doorbell unit to hear you. I have a relative who has the original Ring version and their sound is pretty good. Also if your door is out in the open with no roof or a wall on the side blocking the sun then the video will be too dark and Ring cannot adjust them cause all units are set at their default settings and cannot be adjust... well that sucks and fault advertise. Ring said that it might be my wifi quality but I checked it according to Ring's instruction and I have the highest internet package from Xfinity.
title: Not so good quality video and sound

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hamilton
content: My ring doorbell 2 has been hard wired for 6 months (before that it was on battery power for six months...but it’s a pain to have to remember to charge it). Last month it suddenly said it was operating on battery power. I checked all the lines and everything is fine. I spoke to a customer service agent who told me “it seems that function has ceased to work”, and that I “should expect an expiration date with all electronics”.  Right, but a $200 doorbell should work for more than 13 months, right? They cannot repair it, and will not give me any deal on a replacement. He basically told me I should be grateful for the time I spent with my ring doorbell. I just cancelled the ridiculous “ring record” pay-by-month feature, and I am getting rid of my spotlight camera....just disappointed in this company since the beginning actually. There’s gotta be a better device out there. UPDATE: Ring customer service actually read my review and has shipped me a brand new "Ring Pro", which I appreciate. I installed it, and as of now it is working great.
title: Hard wired stopped working

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: e-reader lover
content: The Ring Doorbell is  a great prodect  but  I give it only 4 stars bor the following reasons. They do not tell you you have to buy a cloude storage  plan to save  captured videos  without the plan you only can see  things live in real time  not even 2 min later. There are no instructions on how to turn down the sensitivity of the motion detector.  You have to go online to track that down. When you share the videos with another device the share user has no ablility to edit or delete old videos. The ring is easy to set up  but requires a good WiFi connection  wehad to estend our wifi inorder to get our ring to work. over all a good prodect and  is nice to see who is coming  and going in our driveway and back door.
title: There are things they dont tell you

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eli's_Dad
content: I enjoy this 'tech' product.  I have used it now for about 3 months and I like the alerts letting me know someone is near my door.  Also being able to talk to them without having to open the door is great.  My only recommendation to Ring would be to try and make it a bit easier to install.  It took me a total of about 2 hours, 1 hr for the upgraded transformer for the doorbell and another 1hr to get the Ring doorbell itself mounted.  Not sure there is anything they can do, maybe more clear instructions.  For both items I had to youtube videos of others mounting the Ring to get an understanding of which wires go to what.  It's not just white + and black -.  Its 2 reds and a black and then I got the Ring instructions saying something to the effect of 'don't connect positive', what does that mean and then 'don't connect the diode if low voltage', what does all that mean?  There was no explanation.  I mount my own ceiling fans, change recessed lighting, rewired my outside lights and that was easy  compared to wiring this doorbell.  But maybe it's just because I have an older home and my wires were color coded differently, either way the doorbell is awesome and well worth the price.
title: Excellent, much needed product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: newbyrob
content: Amazing, I should have bought one years ago.  I've been using Blink Cameras for a while and finally with this whole pandemic and craziness occuring Ive had enough of changing batteries, short video snippets and lag in video sent.  I bought this doorbell because someone in my house is immunocompromised, and someone was standing on our porch hacking up lung coughing right into their fist and ringing/knocking on our door.  Regardless of whether they had postnasal drip induced bronchitis, the flu, a common cold, or this new disease I can't take chances.  I bought this doorbell that night, it was delivered by the weekend and I'm not the most handy person in the world but I was able to hardwire it and set it all up.  I will admit getting the zones right has been tricky since we overlook a busy street, but I'm working out the sweet spot.
title: An upgrade I should have made years ago

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lee Lazarow
content: After approx 1 year (a few weeks past my warranty expiration), the battery was not properly charging.  I called Ring support and we initially thought this was an issue with the amount of notifications I was getting (not sure of how this got fixed, but I think there was a software issue since I was told to keep resetting my unit).  I worked with Ring for approx 6 months to try and resolve the battery issue, but found out today that there is nothing that can be done.  Since this is now very far out of warranty, Ring offered a discount to purchase a new item.  UPDATE: Ring offered to send me a backup battery to ensure that my doorbell always has power.  While I still have some concerns about the doorbell, their customer service is excellent!
title: Battery no longer charges but customer service was excellent

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: mgramz
content: Was super excited to get this and install, only to discover that there is apparently a known issue online with Ring 2 microphones not working with many newer Samsung smartphones.  Video works great, signal is perfect and I can even chat with people from other devices like my echo show 5.  However, I don't have an echo show 5 in my pocket, I pull out my smartphone and go to chat with who is at the door, and all they hear is some mickey mouse static.  I can either buy a new thousand dollar smart phone or a different brand video doorbell if I wish to chat with the person at the door.  Called Ring, and they were of no help and pretty clueless, even though many people online seem to be very aware of this exact issue.  Reviews tend to be the best way to get known issues fixed, here's hoping; because I just got my phone a little before the Ring video doorbell 2
title: Voice feature doesn't work with Samsung phones S10e

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Casey Sullivan
content: Had for 44 days before returning through amazon. Ring consistently disconnected from WiFi and then wouldn’t connect for a few days after resetting the router. Called the Ring helpline who tried to blame my WiFi so I called my internet provider who ran several tests and said WiFi was running fine. I then called the rain hotline back and they decided that it was not the Wi-Fi device it’s self so they sent me a new refurbished one. That arrived and did the same thing. When I called to complain about this they said that the device just some time does not work with certain Internet providers. I have Comcast Xfinity which is one of the largest Internet providers in the country so I think it should be a disclaimer before buying ring if it doesn’t work with normal providers. The customer service was absolutely useless and would not help at all since I did not buy it through them. Amazon was great in excepting to turn in giving me a partial refund for things over the 30 day return window. I would never buy this product or recommend this product to anyone.
title: Poor WiFi connection, crappy customer service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Yamileth munoz
content: I can't believe all the positive reviews. This thing does work worth a darn. Pros - the doorbell still rings when someone pushes the button, it could be a mild deterrent to thieves that don't know how bad it is. Cons - expensive, video is choppy even with a solid wifi and internet connection, the resolution is terrible beyond about 5 feet, Android app crashes constantly, couldn't get Windows app to even install, there are no options to have any video or pictures other than live without a current subscription, live connection attempts take 30 secs to several minutes to connect when it works at all, the motion detection picks up every little thing at long distances no matter what setting is used, video recording takes too long to start (it usually starts in time to see a delivery driver halfway back to the truck)
title: Junk

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jaryn
content: I have a bone to pick with this product... it often doesnt detect motion, yet detects motion out of the zone we have selected it to detect (i.e. the road). It takes a little too long to load the app to see who's at the door once I get a notification. And often it have black zones where it says the footage is unavailable? It also will have jump cuts, where it doesnt record certain things like someone pulling into my driveway, it just jumps from no one being there to the car being there with no notification. I just dont understand. I feel we are throwing money away every month to use this thing because it doesnt work properly. I guess you get what you pay for, next time I will buy something pricier that hopefully works better.
title: Spend your money elsewhere

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rick
content: First impression nice packaging. Good quality and design. The instructions were clear and easy to understand. Installation was a breeze. Now on to software issues. I am a tech savvy guy and I could not get the doorbell to connect to my network. I called technical support and they determined there was a software update they needed to push to the unit.  Once they sent the update over the internet it connected just fine. I was really frustrated at first but glad they could resolve the issue quickly over the phone. I have had no issues since (4 months). The only other thing I wish is the doorbell was an actual doorbell. You have to purchase an optional chime module. It does “ring” through your phone though. Video quality is excellent and audio pretty decent. Overall happy with the purchase and would recommend to others.
title: Worth the money. Get the Ring 2 with “live view”

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jennifer
content: I have had nothing but problems with this piece of crap!! I have called ring NUMEROUS TIMES over these months with no resolution to my problem. It won't record audio or video except in spurts. I get a blacked out screen when trying to see a live view. The screen freezes and blurs. This product that ring manufactures is absolute GARBAGE!!! They have sent me 1 replacement and it didn't work at all!! Customer service told me sorry no refund out of refund window. DON'T BY THIS PRODUCT. YOU WON'T GET ANY HELP FROM RING AT ALL!!
title: THIS PRODUCT STINKS!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: B
content: I figured that the 2 would have been better than first gen when it came to signal, as my friend had been more than frustrated. Replaying old motion triggers are decent. Live is still problematic. I've adjusted multiple router settings and positioning as much as I can on a 3 node Google WiFi setup. Went from 60 rssi to about high 30s to low 40s. Problem is that activating the live cam is hit or miss. Some days it's great Others...fails to activate consistently. Might work after 2 or 3 retires after timeouts. Testing the connection between my phone and the doorbell is good. Internet speed is about 200 mbps as tested. Turing off VPN makes a marginal difference. By the time I can answer the doorbell the person, unless a solicitor, is gone. Consistency would turn this into a 5 star review.
title: Great when it works..flip a coin

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe G in Tennessee
content: I really liked the Ring Doorbell but unfortunately, it won't work for me.  While my WIFI download speed is pretty good at around 30 Mbps, my upload speed is only around 2 Mbps (I live in a pretty rural area and it's the best I can get with DSL).  While Ring states that a 2 Mbps upload speed is the minimum speed necessary to have the doorbell function properly, the sound was always breaking up (no one could understand anything being said inside or outside) and the video would occasionally freeze or pixelate.  I was told by a Ring technician (BTW, very good customer service!) that the doorbell audio and video could not work properly with my low upload speed.  I wish they would have made that known. On the other hand, the Ring App worked very well and is pretty user-friendly.  Set up was pretty simple. Motion/doorbell alerts immediately showed up on our phones (and the Ring Chime Pro).  Other than the intermittent video issues, the video was very sharp (day or night).  I could have actually dealt with the video issues, but the terrible audio was the deal breaker.  If you can't talk to someone at your door with it, it's pretty useless.  If it worked with my WIFI, I would have given this 5 stars.  It seems to be a pretty good little product. My wife and I are very disappointed as the Ring security system would have been perfect for us.  (I also purchased 3 outdoor security cam lights to complete the system).  Unfortunately, everything has to be returned. Bummer.
title: Won't work for me.  Internet upload speed too slow...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Abid Khan
content: As a non-electrician, the installation was so simple. I have it hooked up using the power of my old doorbell. I have all the motion settings on max - this things battery does not deplete. I wish the motion settings were a bit better, sometimes it detects the person a little late. I would also like clips longer than 30 seconds. App is okay, if not a bit buggy. The community is also kind of obnoxious, but that's just my opinion. Night vision is good, much better than my DIY camera I had, but sometimes it kicks in a bit early when its still bright outside. I've had 0 issues on my wifi network, which is connected to my 2.4GHz connection. I love the integration on with my Alexa and Hue devices! I have an Alexa in my bathroom, so it tells me if someone is at my door, where I would normally never hear it. My Hue lights all turn blue for a minute if motion is detected between midnight at 8AM, or if someone rings the doorbell, which is just awesome!
title: Glad I went with the Ring Doorbell 2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RealReviewCalifornia
content: Had some problems with the SkyHell so I switched to this Ring Doorbell 2. The Ring seems to be better in every way measurable. The product packaging, what is included, build quality and software are all superior. The only selling point that SkyBell has over Ring is the free cloud storage. The set up was easy and there are several accessories and tools included. The battery powered bell can be used wired to the existing doorbell in your house or not so it can be mounted pretty much anywhere. The picture quality is great and the unit had low latency when sending audio/video. On all products that use WiFi I recommend brushing up on how your router works and routing in general. Most routers use a dual band and for now manufacturers are still sticking with the 2Ghz band. Make sure your phone or device you use to set up the Ring is only on the 2Ghz band and can not switch to 5Ghz.
title: RealReview Recommeded!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Buzzn
content: Pros: You can have a two way conversation. The Motion Detector records 30 seconds compared to some systems (Arlo security Cam system 9 seconds) Crystal clear audio. Cons: Night vision is not very good, at least to my standards. My Biggest Disappointment is after the “Free Trail” this is pretty much WORTHLESS if you do not accept their monthly services to recorded video. I opted not to because I figured I would save money and just screen record what I wanted, but after the trial I couldn’t get Anything! It will still notify you of motion detection and the doorbells but that is it. Impressions: I should have bought a wireless security system. No monthly fees. It might cost more but ultimately you’d be saving because monthly fees eventually add up. I can’t return it before I found out how useless it is the day the return was over. At least I didn’t pay full price for it, as I purchased it on Prime Day Deals.
title: Would of Got a Security System Instead...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jtfairhope
content: The best thing I can say about it the salt  and planning that went into the packaging and  installation kit. Wow they really did think of everything .  Second best thing I can say about it is that it does ring my existing doorbell chime and the battery stays 100% charged by hooking it to my existing doorbell wiring. I had such high hopes for this camera doorbell but it leaves a lot to be desired. Notifications are slow and audio communication is poor. I'm not sure if I'm going to sign up for the cloud recording service due to these issues.
title: I had such high hopes

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kathy Harris
content: I purchased this doorbell and a Chime about a year ago for a second, seasonal home in another state. As a doorbell it works great. However, twice this year it has become somehow “disconnected” from the WiFi in the house (which I can confirm is working). Last time it was unavailable remotely for a couple of weeks (video or live), then “magically” reconnected on its own. It has now been disconnected again for at least two weeks and all the while WiFi keeps working. Company says there is nothing they can do if I am not next to the device. Helpful. Kind of defeats the “remote” access benefit.
title: Frustrating!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: B. H.
content: Unable to view live video. It just clocks and ultimately will not display live video. So if you’re expecting to remotely greet people at your door, don’t count on it working. When someone rings the doorbell, a notification will alert via app that someone is at the door. But again, you won’t be able to see it live. Interestingly enough, when trying to view the video after the fact, it is missing. It is as if nobody ever rang the bell. If you’re expecting to catch package thieves or see if anyone came over, you’ll be out of luck. WiFi signal is bad despite using a hub extender right on the other side of the door. We also have a garage camera by ring, but the video is inconsistent and often cuts off. Despite the doorbell being hardwired, the battery still drains and requires charging. I’m not sure what the point is. This system is completely unreliable. I wish I had not invested so much in these cameras. I’m not looking for a better alternative that actually works. Please ask if you have any questions. I’ll be happy to answer them.
title: All marketing, bad product. Please read before buying

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DTMFM
content: What a disappointment! This doorbell just does not work well at all. I don't understand how they are the leading doorbell company with such a terrible product. It takes too long to get notified when someone rings the bell. The picture is always bad and often completely u viewable. The app takes too long to open to actually see someone at your doo. And they charge you monthly for the privilege of the use of this awful product. I did trouble shooting with customer service and it was useless. They kept blaming my wifi. Not true. All my other cameras work fine. I tried 2 rings, both garbage, got a eufy doorbell, works perfectly, no monthly fees, same wifi network. Buy a eufy instead!!
title: Works terribly, buy a Eufy instead

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard Crum
content: After reading the reviews and the fact they were running a super awesome deal before Christmas when bundled with a Dot, I decided to pull the trigger.  Video quality is better than I was expecting.  Install really couldn't have been easier.  It took about a week to really zero in on the motion settings.  Toward the end of the trial and error week, I did end up installing the wedge to aim it down slightly as ours is a older home with a covered front porch so our front door is about 4 feet above ground level.  We have several stray cats in the area and I'm so glad only the larger ones set it off.  My wife and I are those types of people that if we don't know you we aren't opening the door.  Love being able to pull it up on the TV or even on the Echo Show instead of trying to peak through the blinds.  With the current weather in NE Ohio bringing out so many people going door to door offering their show shoveling services, it's nice to be able to tell them "no thanks" without having to get off the couch.
title: Works better than expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nihala M.
content: I don’t recommend. The app doesn’t open immediately following a ring. Motion detection alerts are at least 8-10 seconds behind-that’s a lifetime in terms of someone walking onto your property. People make it to my door before I even I know they’re on my property. I’ve called three times and they told me to download “rapid ring” because apparently they can’t fix the freezing issue with the original app. It’s just a mess all around. Wish I had gone with another company.
title: Not worth it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kevin M
content: This works very well most of the time. Caught my kid and neighbors kids sneaking out one night. I can see when the kids come home and if they come home with people they shouldn't. The down side is, its missed some important stuff. Don't know how. My wife walked out the front door with both dogs and loaded them and backed out and drove away and it didn't record anything. I had a american flag with a blue stripe hanging 5 from the ring and some one came and cut it in half and the ring didn't didn't record anything again. So pissed at that one. But over all I still like it. I don't have regular door bell so this woks great instead of a pounding on the door. I can answer the door from anywhere.
title: Works well

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Josh Hemenway
content: This is a great invention, and I hope we never have to use it to catch someone in the act. But, knowing we can protect ourselves is a good feeling. The unit was easy to install at the front door and connect to our Amazon Echo. My wife and I have been randomly checking the "view" throughout the day. I like the ability to see in full color during the day and have nigh vision during the dark hours. The two-way communication via the smartphone app is a handy tool. You can deflect an unwanted guest, or remind a forgetful family member of something before the leave. Our street can be quite busy before and after school hours, and the zone/motion sensor adjustment allows for finer tuning. Without the ability to change the range and zones of detection, cars and pedestrians alike would be triggering a recording. As we travel, seeing when people come and go will provide a peace of mind. Plus allowing guest permission via the app, will give our house/dog sitter an extra tool to work with.
title: Extra Eyes for our Front Door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe Douthitt
content: I did not have the required hard-wired connectivity, so my only alternative was the battery powered Ring 2.  Perhaps the people that like the Ring have hard-wired devices.  I have spent hours on the phone with Ring support, my broadband provider support and my wifi router support.  Each blame one of the other two--I am reasonably technical, but not able to troubleshoot this on my own.  I have done everything everyone has advised.  Ring supplied me a range extender since their final determination was my wifi signal is not strong enough (because I have a brick house?) to read the device at my front door.  My wifi-router itself is within 20-25 ft. of the Ring device.  The range extender has not solved the problem, which is that I can get the device set up and working correctly and it will do so for 2-3 weeks, then I will realize it has again stopped functioning.  I have to completely reinstall it--this has been going on for 6 months now, I give up.  it is not dependable enough to depend upon--on a couple of occasions when I needed to see what had happened at my front door, I logged onto the device only to find I had no video recording.  Very disappointing.  I have read comments in forums advising to request level 2 support if you contact Ring, I would agree with that as level 1 is frustrating, especially the fourth and fifth time you speak with them.  But I would like to save you hours of frustration by suggesting you simply avoid the Ring 2 altogether (especially the battery power device). UPDATE - After posting my unhappy review, I received an email from a Ring customer rep named "Dasia."  Dasia was persistent and patient as we tried several times to troubleshoot my problem.  Bottom line--she was able to determine that even though I had installed the range extender, my doorbell was still making the bad connection directly to my router--probably my fault!  Once connected to the extender it has been working satisfactorily, so I am changing my status to "happy" and wanted to set the record straight and express appreciation for Dasia's persistence and patience!
title: Connectivity issues resolved thanks to Dasia

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Denis Kiriaev
content: First of all, it is a video doorbell. So someone rings the door, and you hope to see the video on your phone? It takes me less time to come downstairs and see through the window than it takes for the app to connect and show me the video (and in most cases it just shows error message instead). So as a VIDEO doorbell it is garbage. Motion detection is a total joke. It takes it several seconds to start recording when it detects motion (or to detect motion, whatever). Videos with delivery guys usually start when the guy is already leaving. On other hand, no matter how close I configure motion detection zones to be, it still records every car passing by near my home (well, the tail of the car if it doesn't drive too fast - remember the delayed recording). So 90% of my motion notifications are false alarms. And it records only 30 seconds, even if motion is still there. So as a motion detection camera it is useless, too. The only useful feature is having notification on the phone/smart watch when someone rings the bell - I'm giving it a star for this.
title: Motion detection is a joke, and super slow app

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JULES PARDO
content: I am writing from personal experience with product. I installed doorbell, rear exterior camera with spotlight, indoor chime, bridge unit and other exterior spotlights in order to protect my exterior. The problem is that unless you PAY A MONTHLY FEE IN PERPETUITY, you cannot see the recorded videos of people coming to your house. They don't tell you that up front. So if you don't pay the extorted monthly charge, the system is useless as far as I'm concerned. Yes, you can remotely view a live cams of house on your phone at any time but who has time to constantly monitor their premises like a security firm. And, if some trips your doorbell or other security cams, you will get an alert on you phone, BUT by the time you go to the live cam view to see who's there and interact with them like they show on TV, they are long gone.  I have actually been in my house, gotten an alert on my phone and gone to the front door and found that a package was delivered but the guy was long gone. Wheres the advantage of that, Useless. If you don't mind paying a monthly charge for the recorded videos then go for it. I guess its nice to see when someone does something nice for you like they show in their TV ads, but is that why you are buying this for? This is a terrible product for home security unless you just feel like seeing some after the fact videos, and paying a monthly bill for that privilege. One more thing, after I called, told them about my concerns and requested a full refund, within a half hour they remotely rang my doorbell about 10 times in a row and then about an hour after that, they rang it another 5-6 times. Crazy i know but absolutely true.
title: STAY AWAY!!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nora Lynn Gussman
content: Be aware that when you buy the doorbell by itself for 200 dollars, you can't hear the ring without being right by your phone.  So, you need to buy Chime Pro as well.  Although all of the other devices can pick up my wifi just fine, neither of the Ring doorbells can and have a very poor signal, even after I poured more money into this nonsense by buying the Ring chimes that have wifi boosters.  ugh - very unhappy.  Once someone rings the door bell, the chime may or may not actually ring to let me know someone is at the door.  If it does ring, it is only after a long delay.  ):
title: Doesn't work as advertised

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Iamgadgetman
content: Ok, I am raising my rating from 1 to 3.  It turns out I had a defective unit.  Super defective.  My replacement, which they sent to me free, works as intended.  Customer service was great and very responsive.  Use the app for the customer support.  You can text directly to your service person.  So, the product is okay. ----------------------------------------------OLD-------------------REVIEW------------------------------------- Don't do it.  I had the original ring so I was super excited for the ring 2. I figured it had to be better right? Removable battery, 1080p'ish camera, better night vision...oh the list goes on and on, BUT!  When you do receive a ring and you answer it, and you start speaking, you hear djdjdnfbdusuwvbfbfnfjeuehshsbsndkfifjddjdjdbdbdjdid. I can hear the person, and I THINK they can hear me, but I couldn't tell you because all I hear is fjdidjdjdjdidjdbsbvvaaazzzmmmewwyydhscshsn. I'm JUST outside of my 30 day return policy, so I am hosed.  But if I can save one of you from spending over $200 on this piece of $4!t, then it's worth it.  Go buy the new Nest doorbell, don't bother with this garbage.
title: Defective Unit Made me do it. (UPDATED)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ColaCrock
content: I bought this a few months back when I bought my house. I wanted a camera, but I also wanted to be able to communicate with those that "Ring" the doorbell. Really, the camera works great, picture is clear. However, there are some issues with the motion sensitivity and it has no problem capturing the breeze flowing through the trees, but the mail lady often goes unnoticed even though my mail box is within 3 feet of my camera and in view. Also, the app is where the biggest problems are. I haven't received a notification on my phone in over 2 weeks, including motion alerts and RINGS!!!  If this isn't sorted out soon, I will be seeking a refund. I would not recommend this product right now unless they can fix the bugs.
title: Does not do what it's supposed to do.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ted
content: This wireless product, for the price, works as expected.  Don’t expect lightning speed or clearity if internet speed is marginal or if the router is obstructed or a good distance from the doorbell. A better choice might be a usb cabled system. I misunderstood the “vertical view” being stated as “90 degrees” as I was hoping to be able to see a package on the door step below the doorbell.  Not the case however, “90 degrees” means 45 degrees up and 45 degrees down.  Adding the down-wedge base that came in the package didn’t improve that condition much. Overall a good doorbell but not a substitute for a dedicated security system. Customer technical support by phone is very good. UPDATE after three months use: Have down-graded this product to two stars.  Frequently get “weak router connection” notice even though router is 12 feet in direct line from Ring doorbell. Video is often jumpy and incomplete. Audio is unintelligible. When away from home, and signal is sent over internet, there is considerable delay and party has already left when alert is received giving no opportunity to talk with visitors. I now regret having purchased this product.
title: Disappointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Aliem L. Jumpp
content: I've been watching the Ring product line for some time now. As with all things tech, I was hesitant to purchase the first generation. I am glad that I waited. I've only had it for a few days, and so far it has been a pleasant experience. It was easy to install into the brick exterior of my home. I'm hopeful that teh battery lasts several months, but I will likely purchase a spare in the future. My only issue so far, is that while adjusting the motion detection area, I could not see that field overlay on live video. I had to set it, and then after it was initially triggered I could adjust it over still image. I would have preferred to set it live as the whole night I had to continually adjust it. Just before bed (with kiddo asleep) it went off because a large truck went by the house and the lights fooled the Ring into believing someone was walking up the pathway to my door. The video quality needs improvement as well. Otherwise a good product. I am in the 30 day trial, but the price seems reasonable so I will most likely sign up for teh online storage.
title: A good start

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: A Jax
content: It's okay but the night vision is not very good however the worst thing is that you have to have a paid subscription to save your pics & videos. That's a deal-breaker. I wish I would have done more diligent research reading the reviews because I would not have bought it.
title: Warning, you'll pay for life.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jimmy
content: I was expecting a little more with the famous RING doorbell.  I have a small porch (only a couple stairs) and from what I can see using Facebook Ring Groups I need to get 2 possibly 3 of those angle wedges to get a good install?!  That's insane.  I used the wedge that came with it and apparently that isn't enough.  The night vision camera is good if you are within a couple feet of the doorbell.  A lot of the time the app has trouble connecting to the live view (my connection is great).  I think that is more the app than the doorbell itself though.  I know the motion sensitivity is supposed to be easy to set (which it is) but I would like it if they had a more advanced setting available.  All in all, its not bad.  I did have higher expectations for this leader of the video doorbells.
title: Overall not bad

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: william johnson
content: One of the features with the Ring Doorbell 2, and with other ring cameras, is you can set a schedule for when you don't want alerts. I have a dog that spends a lot of time in my yard, she is always moving from sun to shade and back. I have a Ring Floodlight mounted above my garage door. So my dog moves from the driveway (Sun) to my front porch (Shade). Every time she moves either one or the other gives a motion alert. I tried to solve this problem by setting up motion schedules for both of these devices. The don't work! I called up Ring support and went thru all of that only to find out I gad set up the schedules correctly. Ring support noticed that there was a problem on their end and needed to refer this problem to the software engineers. Well it has been months and the Motion schedule feature still does not work!
title: Motion Scheduling does not work

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: George McFall
content: Absolutely love this Doorbell. Installation is a breeze, and everything is very intuitive.  The motion detector is configured perfectly for my house. I live in a court - sort of... but the cars driving by dont activate the motion detector like I was afraid of. It only goes off if a car pulls in my drive way, or someone walks onto my porch. Tied in with an echo show (I have the 5, but wish I would've got atleast the 8") and this is such an awesome feature to be able to ask alexa to "show me my front door" and it pops right up! Couldnt be happier.
title: Love the ring 2 doorbell, zero complaints so far.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Trever Furnish
content: Works well enough for the price tag, just has a much higher false alarm rate than the pro version due to the difference in technology.  Ring could really decrease customer frustration by being more active in helping customers understand why the false alarms are happening — they could even probably filter them out with software. The false alarms happen when a sudden bright light reflects onto the sensor — and that in turn happens quite frequently when a car with a slightly curved side window passes by slowly on the street on a sunny day, because the sun reflects off that side windo onto every house on the street. This is enough to set off the infrared detection system. It took a long time for me to understand what was happening — I should have immediately understood just by noticing that all of the false alarm video clips start with a completely whited out screen. That’s because even the visible light ccd sensor in the camera is flooded briefly by the sunlight as soon as it turns on. Software could filter this out for customers easily — the pattern would be very recognizable by AI or even a traditional bit of computer code. I only realized this is what was happening when I. Priced that my Wyze cameras also would go off inside the garage — they were detecting the “motion” of a bright reflection shining off the side window of a passing car into a relatively dark garage through a window facing the street — and a second later the ring doorbell goes off. Note that before we had this version of the doorbell we had the more expensive pro version installed in exactly the same spot for several years with no such false alarms. Adjusting the sensitivity settings in the run app does nothing to prevent these.
title: Way more false alarms than with the pro version.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: The Condor
content: It is easy to install the ring, whether it is to replace an old doorbell or as a new doorbell.  I replaced two old doorbells, and now have motion detection and the abilty to talk to people at my front door even if I am out on a boat. Motion detection:  I sometimes get notified there is motion when no one is there, but not often connecting to wi-fi:  easy sharing with others:  easy The Ring comes with easy to follow instructions and videos to follow if you need them.  All screws, screwdriver and level are included in the kit.  There are also adapters to use if your doorbell is far to one side or if there are steps leading to your door.
