I used both the side and down adapters and got a good view from a door with 3 steps leading to it.
title: Easy to set up and to share with others in the house.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Johnathan
content: This is our first time using a ring product and let me tell you it was extremely easy to set up and install it comes with everything you need to to mount it to the outside of your home it also comes with very handy wages that help you angle the Ring doorbell downward and to the side you can also use both of the wages to at the sametime if you need too the installation was very easy and  straightforward it comes with everything you need in the box to install the doorbell the installation instructions are very detailed and helpful also the ring app was also very helpful in setting up the ring and has a lot of settings to choose from the Ring app is nicely designed with easy access to everything you need with just a few clicks away this doorbell is very handy for anyone looking to be informed to who is at there door and also to see and talk to them from anywheres if you are not home it’s also a very good security device that notifies you of motion at all hours of the day and night with very good night vision I highly recommend the Ring doorbell to anyone who is wanting to upgrade their home doorbell to improve there daily life and make there home more secure you can even use this doorbell if you don’t previously have a doorbell installed it is battery powered which makes it possible to use for s first time doorbell install the battery on this unit last a very long time and is rechargeable I will be recommending this product to my friends and family for years to come we love our new Ring doorbell and I’m sure you will too!
title: Ring Video Doorbell 2 is a great home improvement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: James
content: I've always been worried about people stealing packages but not anymore. Good quality video and good enough audio. Easily adjustable motion detection. Good infrared for night vision. Our doorbell isn't in a good spot to wire it to doorbell power. We ended up using some adhesive strips to stick it to the door rather than drilling. Holds well and has good battery life. Keep in mind that you need to pay a subscription plan for the full benefits ($30/year for 1 device or entire household for $100/year). You'll get 1 month for free though. It still works without the subscription but it looks like it only alerts you if someone presses the button on the device (doesn't look like it alerts you for motion but I've always had the protection plan). You can still do live view whenever you want but it won't save any footage for you to review later. With the plan, you can view all clips within past 60 days from people pushing the button, motion alerts, or even the times you opened up live view.
title: Don't Worry About Stolen Packages Anymore

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mary Chasengnou
content: Had this ring doorbell 2 for a little over a month now. I must say it does the job for me. Though it does delay sometimes but not enough for me to complain about it. They do give you a 30 day free trial and after that you would have to pay either a monthly fee or an annual fee. Which im fine with. If its 1 ring camera which in my case its either $3 a month or $30 one time payment. Its not expensive at all. You can adjust the motion detection to as you like. Battery is great so far. Haven't had to change it out like some of these comments were saying. Works great and Im loving my ring 2 so far. Hoping to get more rings for different parts of my house soon.
title: Good investment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Teresa K
content: So far it has been fine. But it detects a little too much car traffic that doesn't seem to be fixable without reducing the "person" detection area also. Also people, especially couriers, don't utilize it's function as a doorbell because "I believe" they know it is a camera and they will just leave packages anywhere they want near my front door and don't ring the bell as instructed to do so that I will know immediately there has been a delivery. The notification on my phone through the app gets missed most of the time and so I will be having a Chime delivered to hopefully remedy that problem. I do recommend purchasing a Chime at the same time as the Ring is purchased. It will save you a lot of headache in the long run. They don't cost that much and will probably give you more of what you are expecting from purchasing the Ring as a doorbell for notication purposes.
title: I Recommend Purchase the Ring and a Chime Together

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Greg Wendland
content: This was my first smart device for my home, so I've been paying close attention to it. When I first installed it, the doorbell seemed to function well and alerts were easily heard. The volume of the doorbell's speaker is not very loud, however. I cared less about the volume, though and more about being able to see who has been to my door, especially when Im away. One thing I noticed is that this device intermittently captures proper video.  What I mean by this is, for example, today the USPS mail truck drove up in front of my house (full view of the doorbell/camera). The mailman got out, approached the house, dropped two packages on my porch, and then turned around and walked back to his truck and got inside. What did the camera/recording catch? None except the mailman walking back to his truck. I see no point in having a doorbell with a camera that catches people leaving instead of approaching. However, and this is the frustrating part, throughout my day, the camera will catch and record a person walking by on the street or a car passing by. (i.e. Videos that don't matter to me). The video quality is clear and audible alerts are clear. I intended to purchase the additional chime that goes with this product, but first I have to decide whether I want to continue using this device or find another one that functions better in the area of recording motion approaching the house/property.
title: Intermittently Acceptable Recordings

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mya A.
content: LOVE IT! I purchased this because I kept having random people knocking on my door after moving to a new house. Due to the way the house was built (and the lack of a peep hole) I had no way of seeing who was at my door. I live in a sketchy neighborhood so opening the door would not be smart. I bought the ring and I am so glad I did. It was really easy to install and set up. I am using the 30 free trial you get for the access to the videos online but I am going to pay for the yearly subscription.  I also bought a backup battery and I have had the ring for a little over a month and had to switch out the battery once so far. It seems as though it lasts about 3 to 4 weeks based on how active your house is. I have been at work and been alerted that someone was at my door, even with poor wifi reception at my job I was still able to see who it was and speak to them. I would and have recommended this to my friends and fam. The battery is easy to remove and replace. If you cant hardwire into an active doorbell I would recommend getting a backup battery to install while recharging. It takes about 6-8 hours to fully charge.
title: Easy to install and use!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Judy C. Register
content: I like this system...even though friends warned of a hacking issue.. I find the motion detection range is too sensitive for our situation...narrowed the perimeters as much as possible, still too many notifications.  Battery life is fairly short. Need to order  back up battery pack. I added the Chime..it's  working fine. The battery has been an issue for my daughter living in AK..it has frozen. No problem in our area. The daytime  pic.  Is crystal clear..night not as good... We had to add the eero Mesh system to get wifi signal the distance, but it is working fine. I think for more traditional house/street perimeters would work great..our street door is a sidewalk from the street...modem  is a large yard, half a concrete house away.. So under those circumstances..I think it is working Great!
title: Quite Useful!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Janet
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. UPDATE 10/2019 I hate our Ring! Our house faces the street and even though I have the sensitivity down as far as it will go and have the mounting wedge installed we are bombarded daily with videos are cars driving by or just the sun shining. The Ring, however, does not pick up people who actually come to the front door to deliver something. It is very delayed in notifying us when there is motion at the door, by the time we are alerted there is nothing at the door anymore, and the app is slow to pull up video even when we have a quality WiFi extension right by the door on the inside of our house. When I called customer service the person was condescending and rude. The neighborhood app is great if you want to see what your lazy, paranoid and racist neighbors think are ‘scary’ and ‘alarming’ or are just too lazy to figure out their question on their own. We have loved our Ring. I love being able to see who is at our door, especially when we're not home or out of town. I also like that the people in our community who have ring can communicate with each other about what is going on.
title: Overly sensitive to cars/sun/wind, misses people, very slow

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dale Wisely
content: It's a great idea. Set-up is clear and easy. But, my experience is consistent with a bunch of comments on Reddit. Poor wifi connectivity. I have 2 RIng doorbells, the regular model and the Ring Doorbell 2. Both suffer from weak wifi signals, even though there's just flat nothing wrong with the signal where these two units are located. I've tested the signal and both locations and there's no reason for it be weak. Whether it's a problem with the doorbells being weak in receiving or sending to the router--I'm not sure. A second problem is that that by the time you get an alert of motion at the door, the delay in the video starting means that whatever it is that triggered it is gone. Now I'm trying to decide to risk throwing good money after bad by upgrading to Google WIFI or a similar wifi distribution system in my home. Frustrating, because I have plenty of other devices connected to my current router and nothing else is posing a problem.
title: Great concept but lots of problems.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Fuzzball
content: I really hate to give it three stars. I'll update it if things get better. First, let me say that the Ring Doorbell 2 is currently being sold as Costco for a cheaper price. This may work a lot better if your router is close to wherever the doorbell is located. I have a long rectangular house, and the router is on the other side. The video and picture quality are pretty good, but it gets pixelated at times. The sound quality is also pretty good when it works. Also I have never been able to have "Live View" work. It's a little slow to connect when I'm trying to answer the doorbell. For whatever reason the quality isn't always consistent. The motion sensors work and I get a nice little chime whenever someone is near the door. I'm getting my internet upgrade so we'll see if things improve.
title: Ring Doorbell 2 is just ok

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Reena Patrick
content: This Ring Doorbell easily replaced our standard existing doorbell. You have the option to install wirelessly or wired, but my husband hardwired it to our existing doorbell wires and it works perfectly. We live in a cul-de-sac and the camera view shows the whole cul-de-sac. The motion sensor has about a two second delay, but not much to worry about since able to scroll back to review anything you may have missed seeing. I was torn between this one and the Nest, but I am so glad I chose the Ring. It cost less and has excellent quality. Great purchase!
title: Excellent Camera View

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robbie
content: It came well packaged with everything labeled and easy step by step instructions. Set up was quick and easy. Camera works great and good picture quality, sound is good too, my son could hear me talking to him from 15 feet away. The sensitivity took a little bit of adjusting so it wouldn't activate every time a car passed, it picks up way past the range it says it does so had to scale it back some. I bought an extra battery because I don't have a doorbell already so could not hardwire it. It has been 12 days now and I am still over halfway on the battery. I will probably pay the 30 bucks a year for the subscription because I like being able to see what has happened throughout the day. All in all I like it and have recommended it to all my friends.
title: Better than expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DJndrn
content: Disappointed with this product. After multiple times adjusting and readjusting the Motion Zone settings, I still get alerts from cars on the street passing by. This is not only annoying but runs my phone down unnecessarily. Working in conjunction with WiFi can be useless due to the fact that if I get an alert, message indicates video processing available shortly (or similar verbiage). That is unacceptable for security purposes. I will try boosting my WiFi. That may solve that issue. I was under the impression that there are no additional costs associated with this product. WRONG. In order to get full benefits (video recording, share videos, professional monitoring, and discounts) along with peace of mind, you HAVE TO purchase the Ring Protect Plan which can be pretty expensive. Guess I should have done better research before investing in this.
title: READ THE FINE PRINT

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jim M.
content: I read the many mixed reviews and was concerned, but I took the plunge. My Ring has exceeded my expectations and I intend to add more Ring cameras. Picture is crystal clear and connects quickly. My mother lives with us and is unable to move quickly, she is able to answer the door from her bedroom. This has been so helpful. Also discovered the Amazon delivery driver using my driveway as a turnaround everyday! I highly recommend. Recently had a neighbor credit their Ring with saving their life. Their condo caught fire in the middle of the night. The smoke detectors did not wake them. However, when the neighbor rang the Ring doorbell and it was announced through their Alexa, they awoke and were able to escape safely.
title: Great Product- Highly Recommend

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: James Gunzel
content: I am disappointed whit this unit and company policy to make the unit 'whole'. There is NO or very little/unclear mention of requiring a monthly/yearly subscription to store and view video. They do not even give you a courtesy minute, hour, day, or week. I would not be reviewing this as 2 stars if it gave the customer a small cloud storage limit or onboard sd card option. Heck, even if it saved to a home network drive that would allow users some options. I understand long term storage and viewing remotely could be a paid service; but not to make the unit continue to operate as advertised. Basically, the company took a good product and want continual residuals by offering/mandating a service that should be inherent in its design/make up especially for the initial price. It is advertised as being a security video doorbell. But to get that level of 'security' you HAVE to subscribe/pay to view/save videos. Even if you instantly check the alert for motion you will already be viewing future events and not the event that triggered the doorbell. Dont know if anyone read the terms and conditions; but there was some verbiage that stated you cannot have a class action suit against the company and all claims have to be settled without judge/jury, which means you deal direct with them and without the law involved to resolve any issues. That to me sounds a little scary and 1 sided. Sorry RING, borderline returning this item for BAIT & SWITCH style business practices that limit the physical unit and expected performance without giving them more $.
title: BAIT & SWITCH - REQUIRES MONTHLY SUBSCRIPTION TO VIEW/SAVE VIDEOS

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Thomas Wilt
content: Let me start by saying that I don't always believe the more expensive the item the better it is. How wrong I was about the Ring 2 Video Doorbell. I first ordered another vendors Video Doorbell and was extremely disappointed. Hard to install and configure the app on my phone. In addition, the camera quality was poor and when pressed, the doorbell did not always work. Thought maybe the technology had not evolved yet so I returned the product. Spoke to a coworker and they had good luck with RING so I gave it a try. First off every part imaginable came with the product in a well laid out package which made installation a breeze. It took less than 5 minutes to configure the Doorbell to my Wi-Fi and 2 iPhones. Video quality is amazing and the doorbell works each time it is pushed. The RING Doorbell is deffeminately worth the extra money. Don't bother with the $89 me too products.
title: Sometimes Paying a little more is worth it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lee~Lee
content: My house is about 20 feet from the street and has 8 steps to reach the front door. At first I adjusted the motion range to cover up to the curb but it was picking up every car the drove by. I tried to decrease the alert frequency but that didn't help.  Next I changed the angle and location several times with negative results. Finally I Re-adjusted the motion range back even further so the sensor would only pick up bottom of the steps and the sidewalk but when I did that the Ring 2 was unable to detect anything at all. My family was going in and out of the house, even standing in front of it and it could no longer detect us. My opinion is that the Ring 2 would work great if I had a home with a longer pathway to the street. The range seemed to work good if it was set at 20 feet out but in my case that was the street. I don't know if the angle of the 8 steps is effecting it or not but the Ring 2 definitely needs some space to detect something moving. In my case when I adjusted the range so it had space it ended up picking up every car driving by.  Returned.
title: Does Not work well if your house is close to the street

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jennifer Ontiveros
content: Really enjoy this product, it’s one of those things I never knew I needed until I had it, and now I don’t know how I lived without it! I run my business from home, and have people in and out all day, as well as packages delivered several times a week. This allows me to monitor who arrives that needs to be here, and who doesn’t, to see when my deliveries happen in real time, and to feel more safe as a woman who is often alone during the day with people that come by my house. While I know a doorbell isn’t going to protect me per se, it’s comforting to know that more people recognize the Ring Doorbell and are aware they are on camera, so they act accordingly! Love the “Neighbors” feature as well...
title: The best thing I never knew I needed...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stephen H.
content: This is a good product (Doorbell 2) and functions well most of the time. Images are nice and clear. Unfortunately even with a WIFI extender less than 3 feet away, the signal strength is weak. I've tried several things, but no luck. It works, but the visitor is usually gone by the time the connection is made and the camera is up. Fortunately it recorded them so I can at least see who was at the door. ALSO very important note, the reason I bought the Doorbell 2 was for the battery function, which you can recharge. Since there is no electrical to wire into at my location, I have to rely on the battery for use. I was told it would hold a charge for 6 months, this is not true! I am going on my third month and I'll be charging the battery a third time this weekend. This involves me having to remove the battery, charging and reinstalling. Yes it is easy but if I have to do this every 30 to 35 days it is a pain. The Ring Doorbell 2 is well made and looks nice, but I'm not sure I would buy it again since I have these issues.
title: Great Camera Bad Battery Life

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NKOTB_amante
content: We absolutely love our Ring doorbell! The only issue we have with it is the fact that the battery runs out pretty quickly if you keep the motion sensor at a wide range and you live on a busy street or a place where a lot of cars go by. Our house is close to the end unit perpendicular to a very busy road, so using it not only as a safety doorbell but also as a video surveillance has proven to be a little bit annoying because we constantly have to change out the battery every three to four days. My husband does not mind doing it, but if it had just been me I would be really sick of it! It works perfectly well, however, and I would highly recommend it for anyone and everyone for all the features it has!
title: We love our Ring Doorbell!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Moshe
content: Yes i get the gist of who it is if they are close I mean CLOSE. My front door has a 5' walkway then sidewalk then 3feet of grass then busy road. The Motion detection picks up everything and is limited to a cone so if I set it to get people more than 2 feet either side of my walkway then it picks up every car that goes buy. If i set it closer then Packages are lost to the pirates and cops in my town don't care. Unless they are looking at the RING the face is NOT something you can pick out of a lineup. The video at times lags and is jumpy. Sunny days blind the face out. If you want a false sense of security buy a Ring. You want more add a second camera. but the picture quality so far sucks.
title: The Video is like 480p so yeah bad.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tara Minson
content: so disappointed with this product after a year. I loved it in the beginning and loved to be able to monitor my house. I have noticed every once in a while that it was missing some motions. My Wi-Fi signal is strong and I’m able to see everything clearly when it does pick up motion. However last night my husbands car was broken into at 4 AM so of course I went to the app and there was absolutely no record of anyone near his car. It didn’t record any motion and clearly not the break in either. Based on where the car was and how they accessed the car it was in clear view .  Same exact spot as always. No WIFI issues no battery issues.  It is just not consistent as to WHAT motion it picks up and what it doesn’t! Not happy after i now own THREE Ring devices!  Thinking of switching to NEST
title: Not Consistent - Missed my car break in!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Phil
content: Ring Video Doorbell 2 was one of the easiest installs I've seen.  Box includes all the tools and screws needed and then some.  This model is battery powered and does not require any existing wiring.  This was a perfect choice for me since my house did not have a doorbell previously. Setup is a breeze and easy to follow along with through the android app.  All of their products have a scan-able QR code to make it even easier.  Pairs well with alexa and even shows an alert on my tv when there is someone at the front door.  Can even show a live feed on my tv through my amazon fire tv cube. If you have been waiting to pull the trigger on a video doorbell, this is a great choice.
title: Super simple and reliable

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike Hunt
content: UODATE 040220: OMG CAN THEIR APP GET ANY WORSE? IT NOW FORCES YOU TO GO THROUGH EVERY NEW FEATURE AND ENABLE AND DISABLE EACH ONE TO GET RID OF THE NAGGING RED ICON BADGE ALERTS, AND EVEN THEN THEY DON'T ALL GO AWAY! VERY ANNOYING! ADDITIONALLY ALL FIVE OF THESE NEW FEATURES HAVE DISABLED SWITCHES IN FIVE SEPARATE PLACES, SOME OF WHICH MAKE NO SENSE WHATSOEVER! HOW ABOUT PUTTING ALL THE CONTROLS IN ONE PLACE, IS THAT TOO MUCH TO ASK? I JUST SPENT OVER A HALF AN HOUR TRYING TO MAKE THIS ALL GO AWAY, AFTER HAVING TO REINSTALL THIS MORNING WHEN THE APP TOLD ME I HAD NO ACCOUNT NO INTERNET AND NO DEVICES! AT LEAST MY CRAPPY LITTLE BLINK CAMERA STILL WORKED! UPDATE$: I just discovered that the theft replacement guarantee is only in effect if you subscribe to their cloud service, now I'm about to go down to one star! IT'S THE GIFT THAT NEVER QUITS...TAKING! Installation is not as straightforward as it would have you believe & the instructions are a little lacking. Also it's not so secure, mounted on the wall with a plastic base, that could be easily pried off . And be careful and not tighten the screws too much, because you'll strip out the plastic!  And that drill bit they send you is a joke, that would have a hard time with a stick of butter, let alone a brick wall! And the tiny hard to reach security star screw on the bottom of the battery, HA, that slows me down more than it would a thief, who would just pry off the entire plastic base from the wall! Now that it's set up it tells me I have a poor Wi-Fi connection and I need to buy an extender chime. Seriously!! Why is it then that I can walk out the door where the Ring is installed and walk another 50+ feet to my mailbox with my phone in my hand, and my Wi-Fi is still strong enough to watch a movie on Netflix?? I give it 2 Stars, only because I'm impressed by the concept! The reality, not so much! UPDATE2: I have discovered that the motion detection is either feast or famine and they really need more zones to set than they have. Also the Zone chooser should be an overlay over an actual live image, but it's not, so it's just guess work! Also if you use both the angle & the wedge mounting plates to get things just right, even though they say they belong together, they don't and they could have given that part of the concept quite a bit more thought! Most anyone who's ever held a tool in their hand could have figured this out toot-sweet! I could have drilled through one to the other or epoxy them together, and it would have been far superior to what they allow you, but then I couldn't send it back within 30 days like I am anticipating at this point! Bottom line... Don't waste your time or money as I have. I will likely keep this because I already wasted a lot of time on it and I don't know what I will replace it with except a hardwired system which I don't feel like tackling at this point, but I really recommend wholeheartedly that you do not waste your time and money on this! There's got to be something better out there, because this is a laughable piece of junk that might be worth almost $50? The monthly per camera charge is the most ridiculous part, there are a lot cheaper and probably just as crappy systems, but they generally don't charge you a monthly cloud charge, unless you want to store your videos long-term! Why would you, when you can just download them? do I really need all that many videos of bugs crawling on my doorbell or cats and squirrels scampering across the porch?
title: Even less impressed the more I learn!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike Nasser
content: This is great device and includes everything you need to install including the screwdriver!  The hardest part of the installation was removing the old rusty screws of the old bell. Which required drilling them out. The rest was easy. I used the extension wires they included to connect to the old bell wiring. I also used the angled bracket as my door bell is located on the side wall. I was surprised that I could see 180 degrees with the camera, which means I was able to see the walkway. The Ring will notify you every time there is motion near the door and If someone rings the bell. You can even hear and talk to the person at the door. One minor drawback: it takes a few (long) seconds for it to show the video or to play a recorded event. The recording is free for the first 30 days and requires a fee of very reasonable $3 per month after that.
title: Great device and easy installation

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Herbert
content: It literally does nothing I need it to well. It alerts me all day when a car drives by but won’t detect someone walking right up to it a good 30-40% of the time (I have adjusted the sensitivity). If someone actually rings the doorbell I only get notified maybe 5 out of 10 times. I have it networked with 3 devices and somehow none of them get notified when the bell has rung. If a large truck drives by I will definitely get a video after waiting like 10 minutes for it to process. I should have returned it. Update. Less than 3 months on the house and it already completely died. Disconnected from the WiFi and would not reconnect. Spent an hour on the phone with them just to find out the junk was broken and they recommended a new one. No thanks this was a huge waste of money.
title: Buy the nest hello

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MilwaukeeMom
content: I almost returned this because we didn't have the space to install it in place of our old doorbell, and I wanted to use the charge of the existing doorbell. We decided to try it battery-operated to the right of the door, where it fit better, and I'm so glad we stuck with it. It was SO easy to install, much easier than I expected, and I love being able to monitor our door even when I'm not home. It helped us realize that our pet sitter forget to come by one day, and it enables us scoop up packages before the porch pirates. It's even notified us of nearby criminal activity. The only downside is that it alerts us every time a car drives by, even though I've adjusted the motion detector settings, but perhaps I need to adjust them a bit more. All in all, a great investment -- I wish I'd gotten it earlier.
title: Love it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DC Steinman
content: I have had problems with my Ring system since day one.  I have made contact with your help desk, received temporary fixes, but no pendant fix.  I don't think your product can perform as advised.  Reviews on the internet seem to agree with this assumption. I'm alerted to motion between thirty seconds to several minutes after the fact.  Not hardly acceptable...
title: This is not a reliable security system.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JRL
content: Cannot say enough about this doorbell/camera. It has worked perfectly since we got it. I got an extra battery and recommend that so that you can keep one charged all the time.  The picture is very clear and you can adjust the range so as to not get unwanted notifications. Very simple set up. Comforting to know you have an extra line of security and also that you can know when packages arrive and you are not home.  I love that we did not have to wire this and the battery lasts a long time after charging. For a reasonable $30 per year, you have all of your videos stored. The only thing I had trouble with at first was getting the cover off to change the battery. It is easier now that I have changed it a couple of timees.
title: How did we live without this

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Judy
content: I originally thought my new Ring Video Doorbell was a wonderful purchase but I have changed my mind now that the "Protection Plan"  free trial has expired.  I was not aware that I had a "Protection Plan" but apparently it is included and if you want to continue after the free trial period, there is a MONTHLY charge.  If you don't take the plan, your videos are not saved, and you cannot share them if you need to report something.  I would not have purchased the Ring Video Doorbell if I had known that this was the case.  Also, when the "Protection Plan" was expiring, a notice would appear every time there was movement at my door, preventing me from viewing the camera.  I am VERY unhappy with this purchase and would definitely NOT recommend this product.
title: Ring Doorbell Monthly Charge

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J287B153
content: I like the concept. It looks good and was easy to install. That being said, the WiFi is terrible. It’s mounted on the other side of a wood framed wall with bunk siding from my wireless router. Less than 4 feet away (not an exaggeration). It’s plagued with constant buffering and connectivity issues. I purchased a Ring Chime with the WiFi extender... absolutely no improvement and that’s mounted 5 feet from my router and three feet and one exterior wall away from the doorbell. I have wireless devices in my basement on the far opposite end of the house that connect perfectly. This has got to be a design/technology issue. The WiFi is all that holds it back.
title: WIFI A BIG ISSUE.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DogLover
content: It’s hard to know where to start. The video reception was available less than 20% of the time. I bought another router to boost the internet reception. Unfortunately it was a waste of my time and money. After 30 days they said I needed a protection plan but when I went onto the ring website they said I didn’t need one bc there were no devices at my location. Hmmm so I thought perhaps I needed to reinstall the ring device but guess what, the page with the reinstall directions wasn’t available on their website.  As I write this, I have been on hold for nearly an hour waiting for a customer service representative.  My advice to anyone considering purchasing a ring device is to seriously consider other options. The customer service reps are nice enough but the platform they have is obscenely inadequate. Somebody needs to send the COO of Ring a copy of Raving Fans.
title: Ring

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lorenzo
content: Right outside of warranty the device mysteriously loses wifi connection (after a year of no issues). After troubleshooting and contacting ring support it’s determined the device will not enter setup mode (suspicious) and their solution is to buy a new one at 35% off (exclusions apply).  I’m not even that mad about the money wasted... but the time invested to setup... drilling holes into my home to support a device/company like this... feels bad.
title: Feels bad man

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Andrew
content: I am waiting for an extender. my Wifi router (Google Fiber) is centered in our living room space. about 30 feet away from where the ring door bell is set up. Signal strength on the app is High, Power High and yet it still disconnects. I have not reached out with RING customer service just yet until i gathered all necessary issues and pool it into one call. what I like about is the blanket security where other RING users report around your area what happened and what to watch out for suspicious activities and other stuff which happened lately in our area (package thieves & Car door being randomly checked if its unlock and empties whatever is inside)  This and among the security lights that are open at night when it sense movement helps deter the person from walking into your property.
title: its Off and On wifi connection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: C.C. Lewis
content: 1.The doorbell is constantly late recording motion, and the response time of the app is extremely slow. I've been notified of motion at my door after I have left my home and driven 3 blocks away before Ring notifies me of the event. So as far as I can tell it is great at videoing people as they leave your property. I was under the impression that the idea was to video the bad guys as they approach not after the crime has happened. 2. The doorbell sends an event(motion at your front door) you open the app and it takes me to a time prior to even purchasing the Ring 2 doorbell, by the time you get to the correct date the event is long over. 3. Let's talk night vision now if you don't have lighting outside I guess that gray dimly lit video is better than nothing, however when you have plenty of outdoor lighting and still get gray dimly lit video, because you can't turn off the night vision on the Ring 2 video doorbell, I'd say there is a problem! I am seriously thinking about returning this and getting another brand of video doorbell. Also let me point out that Amazon, who owns the Ring video doorbell system also falls short by not having tech support available on the website to voice these issues and get some resolution of some sort. So there is my two cents worth for what it's worth, I don't expect to be contacted by Ring or Amazon to resolve these issues. I would be shocked if they did.
title: Disappointed to say the least!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe Beach
content: I ordered this from AMAZON installed it and started having nuisance motion alarms. RING support told me to try a bunch of stuff and none of it worked. I covered up the camera and it was still giving me motion alarms. When they finally figured out it was a bad unit they asked for my receipt. When I sent it to them they said the seller was an UNAUTHORIZED RESELLER and the unit had NO WARRANTY. If I had known that I would have immediately returned the unit but now that they jerked me around so long it's past the AMAZON return date. I am stuck with a RING2 Doorbell alarm with no warranty. TOTAL BS. Amazon should publicize that you are now buying a product with NO WARRANTY
title: NO WARRANTY if purchased from AMAZON "unauthorized reseller"

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MarkR
content: No matter what anyone says, it is not really usable without the service. Without service, if you're on the local network, you will get notifications. But you know have maybe a second to connect before it falls into the archived category. So even if it is still active, you can't watch it.
title: Not usable without service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sean4reviews
content: I'm probably the last person to get this so what else can I say. It has been a HUGE help for us. We use it 5 times a day with deliveries and kids coming and going. Just got 4 Ring spot lights to add to this because it just works well. Slight lag when we try to pull up the video from the camera but I read its because the battery saver mode. Had not real choice but to go battery only because we were replacing an old NuTone intercom doorbell with a unique power system. We bought the ringer and extender and it all works well.
title: Pretty Great - small lag in pick up with battery only

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Pravin Pathak
content: After struggling to find  right product which can detect reliably when some one is at the door, I am happy to find Ring. First tried some lower cost products. But most have this fault alarm issue. With Ring, I rarely get false alarm. So I have notification on my Phone on and can respond to them now. As Alexa was free with this, it helped. Alexa makes job easier. I can quickly see and respond to someone at the door from home.  Best part, old doorbell still rings.  I read old ding-dong a/c bell connection will charge Ring battery as well though at very low rate. So that is added advantage. Overall nice, sturdy and reliable product. Best part it, very low rate of false alarms. So can be counted on.
title: Finally a working product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JustAnotherCustomer
content: Installed following the setup instructions and video however, I have yet to get the motion working correctly, Installed, reinstalled, completed the setup wizard several times but no go. Went online to ring website and started chat. Evidently its a robot or they're short handed. Spent about 15 mins on chat telling me to use the set up wizard again. Once I replied I had, I did not receive any more replies until chat was ended for inactivity. The only inactivity was waiting for them to tell me something else to try. We have a simply safe alarm but went with a ring doorbell because of it's popularity. Motion only works if I wave my hand 2 inches in-front of it.
title: Motion only works if I wave my hand 2 inches in-front of it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael Gallagher
content: Setting the Ring doorbell up was very easy and took me about ten minutes – which included the time walking back and forth to the breaker box to flip the power off then back on once I had wired up the doorbell.  The how-to videos were thorough and setting up the app took no time at all.  I never realized how many people show up in the yard or at the front door and it is very convenient to monitor it with your phone and talk to whoever is at the door. I got this for just $99 during a Black Friday /Alexa promotion vs. its regular price of $199 – with the security /comfort and convenience factor, I wonder why I waited so long to get one as its worth $199 to me.  If you’re looking for security and piece of mind, combined with something so easy to install anyone can do it, I would recommend you get this now.
title: Easy Setup

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: carol monteith
content: this really gave me peace of mind. I was a little weary of its effectiveness at first but quickly realized how sensitive the motion detection is and felt at ease. I do wish that the night vision was a little better. My car was hit in front of my house and while it caught it on camera because it was dark out all i could do was see the general shape of the car and headlights so it failed me in that sense. otherwise it has helped me track down packages and show proof that they did not show up or some one tried to be slick and take it.  i live in a town with a significant amount of car vandalism and theft and it has definitely helped me combat that issue.
title: sense of security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PGB
content: Despite using both shims and setting the motion detection to minimum the unit still picks up cars & trucks 50+ feet away. **After noting the problem on a survey they offered to connect me with a specialist. Nothing from that after a week.** I specifically wanted to use motion detection for package delivery but with so many false positives I have to turn it off. That renders this just a very expensive doorbell. Another disappointment was the video quality. It's good up close but 30 feet away it's poor. Initial setup and installation was easy. Compatable with the existing wiring and the battery stays fully charged on that. Edit: Dropping to a 1 star for continual slow loading of app viewing. I added a screenshot. Hear a loud noise? Get an alert? Get used to seeing this. Edit2: 3/22/20 - Ring shares your activity information with facebook.
title: Motion Detection - too many false positives

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GT21
content: Was thinking about getting a Ring the last two years and finally pulled the trigger this Black Friday, with the Alexa deal for $100 it was to good to pass up.  I had been a little worried that it wouldn't fit next to my door on the trim but with the wedge plates it came with it fit perfect and also hooked up to old door bell wiring perfect.  I also bought a chime but am going to return it as Ring 2 works with old door bell chime. I have only one complaint and that is the inconsistency of when the camera starts to record when someone is walking up.  Seems like 50% of the time it records them at the perfect spot about 8 to 10 feet from the door.  The other 50% of the time it starts recording right when they get to the door.  So if it is a delivery driver half the time you know what they are bringing and the other half of the time they just have finished putting the box on the porch out of view from the camera.
title: So far so good, with one little complaint!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Caroline
content: I would not reccommend this product to anyone, and would get a different companies product that doesn't practice horrible business tactics. Get Any at a fraction of the cost with more features, one that has built in memory that records for your own personal storage instead of having to pay for the life of the product to have features that are purposefully being withheld to create a superfulous service, better a service that shouldn't exist but yet forces every ring product owner to pay or lose one of the whole reasons to have a video doorbell. "Sorry officer the burglar must of known Im too cheap or poor to pay for the cloud recording so I don't have a recording of the break in" Pretty much makes this a horrible gift to give as you'd have to pay for the service to make the gift have any purpose. You can end up buying a $200 product without knowing you have to pay in order to use one of its main security functions as a camera, record video.
title: Horrible business practices, purposefully withholding features forcing to pay forever to use camera

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bill
content: I just purchased a Ring Doorbell 2.  I was first amazed at the contents of the box.  It had everything one might need for various installations, along with simple, easy to read instructions.  The instructions included reference to videos on both installation and operation.  I also had occasion to speak to their Customer Service and the agent spoke English very well, was knowledgeable, and amazingly polite and helpful.  Both the day and night videos are good quality.  The second evening, after dark, I was easily able to identify a teenage prankster, who rang my Ring and ran!  I feel safer now.  I recommend Ring!
title: Product Quality and Ease of Installation

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Li18
content: The installation instructions are quite simple and installing takes about 15 minutes. I did not have an existing door bell, so now wiring to worry about (I'm using the battery that came with the bell). The hardest part was making sure what brackets that came with the door bell should or should not be used to get an optimum view of the visitors to the door. Right now I have motion sensing on. It's neat, but not that necessary for my situation, I don't think. Issues? Well, when someone rings the bell, I get notified on my phone, but before I can get the app open to see who it is, they have left. Now usually these instances are delivery men and they are not going to wait around. But I can replay the video so I can see who they are and what they did. I'd say that among the IoT things that I have, it's good, but there are a number of small improvements that I'd like to see, such as less of a fish bowl image of people at the door, better color resolution, and a more responsive interface on the app.
title: It's good, but...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AwkwardTri
content: It's ok, when placed on a flat surface it catches way too much of the sky. You can add a wedge to point out down but then you have a giant doorbell sucking out with a big wedge awkwardly pointed down.  The fisheye camera would be better if it were tilted down.  The wedge should only be used to make the doorbell appear 90 degree vertical instead of showing you more area below your doorstep.  Also the trigger zones aren't exact so I have to dial them way back to not frequently pop-up a notice. You'll end up turning it off because it's just not ready for that yet.  It's best used to check on packages that arrived, chat with people at your doorbell, or watching who took your package that arrived 2 examples ago.
title: Lots of potential, dream big!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: mahagonythor
content: I was looking forward to getting a Ring Doorbell 2 as all of the reviews I read were very favorable. I wasn't disappointed. The setup was fairly straightforward. The outside installation wasn't hard. Ring provides a variety of tools (a small level, a standard and Phillips screwdriver, etc.) to aid in the installation. The integration with Alexa was very easy. I can now say "Alexa, show me the front door" at any time and a live view pops up on my Echo Show. In addition, Alexia announces that "someone is at the front" if it senses movement near the door. The sensitivity of the motion detector can be modified through the Ring app. What surprised and pleased me is that you can connect with all Rings in your local neighborhood and get alerts from neighbors. I've already seen videos of package thieves in action from other Ring owners near me. I also received a Ring alert of an elderly man who was missing from home. It's a nice security net for the neighborhood. I'll be getting a second camera for the backyard.
title: Better than I expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sisco Muniz
content: This Video Doorbell is rather expensive but, I got it on sale for 50% off. It is amazing. I'm very satisfied with its performance and video quality.  Battery last a long time and it's rechargeable. All mounting options and tools are included and easy to set up. The App is user friendly and I love its integration with Alexa. Another great feature is community Alerts that notifies you of crimes  and activity in your area.  You can shut off Alerts in settings. You also join community alerts and share your Videos with other Ring users and alert authorities of theft or possible break ins. I am very satisfied with my purchase and highly recommend this product.
title: Ring Video Doorbell 2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nazar Potereyko
content: I expected a lot more of this product to be honest, in the hind side I probably would not buy it again. Pros: - great packaging - decent app - easy installation and setup - cheap - decent hardware design Cons: - nearly useless for purposes of answering the door while you are not at home. I get notification that someone ringed, I imediatelly click on answer the ring, and all I get is a spinning wheel which culminates into "unable to connect to your device" message minute later. - motion sensor is too sensitive, I live in the city and I get 20-30 notifications each day when someone walks by, sidewalk is good 10-15 feet away. I tried to lower sensitivity to the min, but to no avail. Works well at night when nobody walks on sidewalks though. - since real-time aspect of the device does not work, this unit is useless without "optional $3/mo" subscription which allows you to review who was at your front door in the past. That at least seems to work.
title: Good idea poor implementation

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T N
content: I loved this when I got it. It never missed a motion and recorded the minute someone was on my sidewalk. In the last 2 months since they updated the app it no longer detects all motion. It misses the mail constantly. I have disabled all the new enabled features I did not want and changed the sensitivity and it still misses motion. Mail shows up in my mailbox and yet no video. Since last year EVERY time mail came or anyone walked towards my house it was recorded. I don’t know what they did in that update but it defeats the entire purpose of me buying this doorbell if I can’t record activity and I don’t think I’ll be purchasing anymore ring products. I’m very upset that they took a perfectly working motion detecting doorbell and completely ruined it with an update.
title: The update ruined this doorbell completely

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: W. L. Morgan
content: Had the Ring Doorbell for not quite a year. The damn thing loses connection to the wifi and you don't realize it has dropped out until you begin to wonder "Why haven't I gotten an alert in a while," then see the last one was a month ago. Nothing has changed as far as Wifi, password, etc., but it wants to go through set-up all over again which means unscrewing the stupid little screw (which you can't see and which is not retained by a simple clip) and rebooting the doorbell. Then step-step-step with no notification that it has stopped working. This happens about once a month now, after working well for the first six months. Disgusted.
title: Ring sucks

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: koi4fun
content: You must subscribe to service to get any usefulness out of this doorbell which is disappointing since spending so much money for a glorified doorbell. it detects plants blowing in the breeze so my doorbell is typically providing false alarms from my perennials.  Battery only last 2 months and not 5 like they say. very disappointing.
title: Ring doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Terri Bailey
content: I have great download and upload speed going to my ring doorbell 2 but the two way communication is worthless!! Can't understand what each person is saying, very garbled and choppy. Does not always work when they ring the doorbell either and mine is hardwired. Can't get any response from Ring customer service either!! Try chatting with them and they say will be right with me and never respond again!! Sooooo disappointed, I spent 400.00 on a new wifi router and modem too because I thought the problem was slow wifi. NOT! Now I am out a LOT of money for a piece of plastic! My husband is very upset too because this was to make me safer while he was at work(night shift). Beware people! It's too late for me. I feel like such a fool now believing in all the hype about this thing! UPDATE: I went to Best Buy and bought a Google Home wi-fi system and get blazing fast downloading and uploading. 100 or more download speed and 10 upload speed. It has helped with the audio for my Ring doorbell 2 but it is still cutting in and out and there is an echo when you talk. It is good enough now and I will keep it. I just hope they fix this audio problem somehow or drop the price drastically.
title: worthless/UPDATE, not worthless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: zeebe
content: I am extremely disappointed with this doorbell.  This thing will go off with ever car that drives by but somehow only manages to catch motion of people actually coming to the house or on my porch half the time.  I have had two packages mysteriously show up on my porch with no sign/video of anyone dropping them off.  Not that getting my packages is a bad thing but this is a security doorbell/camera and that means anyone could just walk up and do whatever ever and may or may not be seen.  Not great for security.  On top of that I keep getting giant chunks of footage unavailable.  I cant access the the app/live feed/past footage away from home 80% of the time and only 50% when I am home. And when I do actually get it to load what/whom ever set it off or what ever I heard outside(since it does not always catch the motion on my actual property) is gone because it takes forever to load. Nothing like watching a neverending spinning circle when your worried about someone on your property.  Very stressful, frustrating, and insanely irritating.Talking to people thru this thing is a joke.  Cuts in out out no matter what device you use and it doesn't make any difference how close or far away from it you are. They can't understand you and you can't understand them.  Worse than a cell phone with one bar of service.  Waste of money. This things not worth $10.  Look into other options this one is terrible.
title: Expected so much better

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Edwin Leister
content: Beware of ring fraud! Do not purchase any of Rings products. Ring stuck it up my six for $400.00! DO NOT BUY RING PRODUCTS!!!!! You can stick my refund wherever. $400.00 is not important to me, but beware that I have written reviews on my PBA, FOP and Vets combats and otherwise. I am in touch with every law enforcement  in every state. I have also sent these posts and emails to include Amazon which my family so far has stent thousands of dollar at Walmart which would have been spent at Amazon, You will soon hear from the FCC when my attorney's will contact them. I have poster this on my PBA, FOP and Veterans web sites
title: Do not buy any products from Ring!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark Ulloa
content: I like the capability to see what is going on at my front door and to be able to interact with the people ringing at my door.  The installation was easy, the configuration so so.  I increased the reach of my WiFi because it was too slow to connect from my cell or from Alexa.  It did not help.  I ended up using the saved footage to see what happened.  Y the time I get to connect to it either the people at the door are gone or the burglars are in.  The motion detection is adjustable, but even at it lowest setting it detects moving cars at the street, which is a good 50 ft away from my front door.  It tends to get annoying and it looses its purpose.
title: Cool but needs to be improved

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PrimeTime
content: I have had my eye on one of these for a while to add to my setup and finally pulled the trigger when it was on sale.  The unit is nice, built well and very easy to install.  My biggest problem with the unit is how slow it is to respond, it takes usually upwards of 10 seconds to actually display video if ever at all so forget about trying to answer a motion alarm.  By the time it displays what ever tripped the alert is gone.  Playback of saved video is choppy and I get a loading wheel constantly but play back of the video on the website using a computer works great.  I love the idea of the motion alert but it seems to cry wolf quite a bit with nothing showing on the video.  It does have the ability to change the area that it will actually detect motion on but is limited to the areas that can be marked especially when compared against my other cameras.  Bottom line is if I had paid full price for this I would have already returned it and still might.
title: I wanted it to be better...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Maxim Mikheev
content: Completely unreliable. The longest working time was around 2 hours. After 1-2 hours it stops sending any notifications about movement or even  Rings. I need to put the device in setting mode and reconnect. But it works again only couple of hours. Looks like Ring's doesn't have any smart people in QA/QC group. Simple test: After connecting your camera to the internet, remove the battery. The device will be shown as online for hours without battery. Same if you turn off your router. Same if you reboot your router. I think the security camera which shown as online but obviously not working is useless. It can be used only as doorbell when you are at home and can reconnect camera manually several times a day
title: Completely unreliable

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: U2
content: So much has already been written about the Ring doorbells. They are not perfect but nothing is. Really, you are much better off having a Ring than not having one. Crime is never going to decrease... Just buy one, you'll like it a lot. In general it's wonderful technology but my only complaint is battery life when not hardwired. I only receive 5-6 motion alerts a day. No doorbell pushes and no video/audio conversations. Yet the battery is draining at approx. 7% per day. Therefore I can expect about 14 days before the battery is fully drained. This is hardly the 6-12 months Ring advertises. I won't return the Ring but I did buy a second battery pack. I strongly suggest do all you can to hardwire the device. Even if you don't have an existing doorbell, buy a 8-24vac transformer and a 25ohm resistor, and run the wires if possible. In my case, hardwired was not an option. Oh, and I wish they'd support an internal SD card for local recording. WiFi is mostly reliable but not at all guaranteed to be available 100% of the time. Heaven help the people of Earth if (when) the Internet goes down or is destroyed...
title: Very nice but needs to be hardwired

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Andrew Anderson
content: We are never going to have a house without a Ring Video Doorbell again.  Honestly, people don't even ring it or realize it is there, which I like.  Folks are always ringing the real doorbell and don't realize they are being recorded. I did give it a 4/5 for motion detection, b/c every once in a while, a fedex or mailman is able to get a package onto the front porch without being picked up by the camera.  But otherwise, it is fantastic and make my wife and family feel safer to know what is going on when we are out of the house or just not willing to come to the door.
title: Get a RING now!  Totally worth it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brown Trout
content: Useless, buggy piece of junk. Of the 3 security devices connected to my home WiFi, this is the only brand item of 3 that fails to connect to live view on a regular basis. For $25 and a micro SD card you can buy a very popular alternative that retains video for zero additional cost.
title: Save your money. Piece of junk.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RYAN J.
content: I've been using my Ring Doorbell 2 for several months.  Overall, I really do like it, but there are some things that really could be improved. PROS: The install was a breeze. The fit and finish is also pretty good (not great...just pretty good). It's nice to be able to see who is at your door before you open it -- even if you're not home. CONS: The video quality is ok, but is still nothing like any of the demos I've seen.  I have a router 10' away from the doorbell with 1 wall separating it. The speaker quality is atrocious.  I don't know how anyone uses this thing to communicate with anyone at their front door.  I've used the "talk" feature a few times and both me and the person at my door struggled to understand each other. The video takes way too long to load.  My UPS or USPS carrier waits for up to about 30 seconds before leaving.  From the time I get a notification to the time I actually answer, I could just walk to the door and open it and greet the person. CONCLUSION: I really do like this product and can see the potential it holds.  I'm hopeful that some software updates enable this product to continue improving. I'm
title: Decent Video Doorbell with Some Annoyances

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: A. Gift For You
content: Ring app collects your information and submits it to Facebook and other data collection agencies regardless of having an account with Ring or Facebook. Police agencies can access your feed and recordings via dedicated API designed by Ring.Camera hardware and components are cheaply built and out of date compared to other solutions. Motion alerts transmit unencrypted auth token that keeps getting blocked by suricata.
title: Unwanted data collection and a backdoor for government agencies.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dudley Thomas
content: I only been using it for 1 week.  My sister recommended it to me and my wife so I purchased one for our home.  It took a little while to figure out the installation process but with the help of You-Tube videos and the videos that came with the device I finally got it up and running.  I am still in the learning phase and trying to adjust the settings to our liking.  The unit works great and the 1080 picture is excellent.  Works good at night with only my front yard light on.  I connected it to my doorbell and now when the Ring button is pressed my existing doorbell ring along with my devices I have connected to it. When I was away from home I got an motion alarm and live video on my Apple iPhone when the mailman was dropping off a package at the front door.  So far I like the Ring Doorbell 2.
title: My sister recommended it to me and my wife so I purchased ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gregory S. MacBeth
content: This is an absolutely amazing product.  If you have packages coming to your home often or just want to increase the security of your home, then this is a force multiplier for you.  First, you have the video and camera that you can configure the degree of motion activation.  B, you have the ability to talk to visitors over your cell phone no matter where you are.  It is easy to install and the networking connectivity is extremely simple.  Hell, you don't even have to wire on your front door as it comes with a rechargeable battery that is very effective and long lasting.  In fact, I am not just amazed by the longevity of the battery, but curious technically how they managed such a small battery to be this effective for such a long period of time. My wife loves this because it is so easy to use.  Plus I have to admit, you can have a lot of fun with visitors and door to door salesman using this tiny device.  So there you have it, it provides entertainment too.
title: Simple & Easy Configuration That Is a Force Multiplier in Ensuring Your Home is Secure.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jennifer
content: I like the doorbell camera it works well but sometimes the motion detection is a little off no matter how we set it. Sometimes it doesn’t  catch motion at all. Like my brother came home and it never went off. Idk if it’s the WiFi or the doorbell as to why. I also don’t like the fact u need to buy the ring chime to actually here the doorbell if someone rang the bell. I think it should come standard with this because after all it is a doorbell and not just a camera.
title: Ring doorbell 2, good camera, bad doorbell without add on of another device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Fred Zahnow
content: All good except worthless capturing an approaching person.  I have pretty much given up improving the gap between motion detection and notification. I actually believe the Doorbell 2 motion detection is poor and does not trigger video until the distance between the movement and the unit is too late to capture an approach. The doorbell is 6 feet from the ringer, and the ringer is 15 feet from the wireless server that easily connects with all other wireless devices in the house. Thanks for your persistence and attention, but I think the product is performing at its maximum potential. Disappointed. to unit.  The lag time between motion detector picking up motion and alert on smartphone is way too long and getting the video of the person leaving is useless.  At least you can see if it is raining when you are away.  Woo hoo!
title: Is it raining?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: MJ
content: I initially left a 3-star review due to issues with a lag in the recording, but I was contacted by the Ring team and couldn't be happier with the customer support I received. After two calls and several emails, Kikki was able to walk me through identifying issues with my internet and sent a wedge kit and chime pro to ensure I had the proper angle to detect movement earlier and didn't have any wifi interference. The camera is fast enough and the picture is good enough that it catches my escape artist of a dog bolting in front of it in dim light at night.
title: Update

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: patrick doerrie
content: Super easy to install and we have since installed for our parents’ house.  Both our phones and iPads connect to this seamlessly.  The neighborhood watch link is also pretty handy.  NOTE: there will be a monthly or annual fee if you want to recall any previous video, even if it was from 10 minutes before.  The only “free” service you get is the notifications of movement and the live view.  We subscribed for the the service anyway since we are not always available for the live view to see who’s at the door.  Also, when you have a lot of visitors in a short period of time you get “snooze” the activations so your devices aren’t blowing you up with notifications.
title: Mostly free and mostly good

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dylan
content: I got this and installed it. Very easy installation. Setup was pretty easy as well. I had no signal problems, but my router is fairly close to my doorbell. The first time I setup the doorbell, I told the app that I had a street in front of my house, which I do, and set the range. I wanted to be able to pick up someone turning into my driveway, but not cars on the road. After some testing, the motion detection seemed to pick up most cars on the road. I dialed the range back a bit and it fixed the problem with cars on the street, but it made it so that you literally had to step up onto the porch to trigger it. After a few days of playing around with it, I told the app that I didn't have a street in front of my house and set my range again. This seemed to be the best configuration for me, as it detected only about 25% of passing cars, but even on the max range distance, more than half the time, it would only detect a person when they stepped on the porch, which is only 3 feet from the door. Ended up returning it. I can deal with it not picking up until a person gets to a certain point of my property, but I can't deal with it sometimes picking up a person from the road or waiting to pick them up on the porch, or maybe picking them up from the driveway. If it was consistent, I could atleast know what to expect.
title: It's ok, but the motion detection needs to improve.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Unforgettable_Fan
content: Horizontal and vertical wedges are included in the box. I did not know this so I ordered separate wedges which i didn't need. The motion detection didn't work right after I installed, but it started working 15 minutes later and no issues after first 36 hours - I am not sure why although I was adjusting settings. Physical installation took about 30 minutes although I was confused by the quick-start guide discussing putting a resistor between the contacts, which was not required for my installation. I just hooked up the existing doorbell wires to the two contacts on the back of Doorbell 2.
title: Angle Wedges Included in Box

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Juliette Oconnor
content: I am a 72 yr old female and was able to install the Ring2 doorbell on my front porch brick wall. It was refreshing to actually have a company give you everything you need to install and operate this without having to go buy special tools or supplies. The box even contained a drill bit to drill into the brick, extra screws and optional mounts to make sure you had the best view. The videos that walk you through installation are very good. I also love the Neighborhood feature that gives you posts by other Ring owners in your area. Overall it’s a perfect product for me - now I just have to train my husband on how it works on his iPhone APP!!
title: Easy to install even for an old lady!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jim P.
content: Would never have purchased the Ring doorbell if I knew it required a subscription to their storage service to be useful. You still get notifications of motion detection and rings, but unless you keep your phone unlocked and connected to the doorbell constantly (which implies,  never switching focus from that app) you cannot possibly unlock it make the connection in time to prevent mischief. And without video,  you'd have to be able to I'd a thief from memory. The doorbell should be able to either store a couple days worth of video in the phone, or on an SD or MicroSD. Certainly won't purchase another Ring device nor will I recommend one.
title: Worthless without add'l sec purchase.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tofu
content: I’ve had A Ring doorbell for about 4 months. It’s great at detecting motion, and every car that drives by 20 feet from the street, no matter how we configure the settings. I bought it so I could tell the pesty solicitors to go away...but, the technology communication is so slow, it’s not efficient, even if the person stands at the door for 2 minutes, and rings the bell twice. The one effective way it has helped was to get great footage to the police of a scam artist that robs houses by casing houses and poses as a covid official with a fake badge and props, then rushes into the house with a group of men parked down the street.
title: Not sure if I recommend this, but it’s good for security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LLM62
content: The ring 2 doorbell was professionally installed by Amazon. The installer told me to change the battery (I bought a spare battery), once it was charged. Unfortunately, the security screw on the doorbell is stripped and stuck.  This means I can't remove the cover to change the battery or remove the doorbell to return it, without breaking it.  Called Ring and was told to put glue or a rubber band at end of screw driver... neither worked. It is still stuck! Battery will shut down soon and cannot replace!
title: RING 2 security screw is stuck and stripped

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: K. Rayford
content: 3.5 stars wasn't available. I ordered the Ring 2 after an attempted break in in the hopes of preventing a second attempt. The ad and information boasted about new and improved night vision,  but the night vision won't work if it doesn't detect that it's dark out.  Turns out that the street light across the street which does NOTHING to illuminate my porch or the path leading up to my home is somehow sufficiently bright enough to bamboozle my Ring 2 into thinking it's day time. As a result, I can't see anything in the recordings or live feed at night or the early mornings which defeats the purpose of owning the damn thing. It wouldn't even be any good to show the police if someone tried to break in a second time.  They'd literally be able to see nothing but darkness.. Not happy. Returning it immediately.
title: Defective night vision

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: terry bennett
content: This Ring doorbell has a lot of potential...but it is failing to achieve it.  The primary issue is the latency between the doorbell and the app.  It takes far too long for the app to notify me. UPDATE - 09/24/19 - After I wrote the review above, I was contacted by Kikki who is an Amazon Executive Community Support Representative specializing in Ring devices.  She encouraged me to schedule a time with her to try to resolve my issues.  When we spoke, Kikki was very professional and personable.  She made some updates & then worked with me to test the system to determine the latency.  She noticed that the viewer was aimed so that it picked up cars driving past the house.  Since I had already installed the wedge device, she had another wedge device shipped to me.  Her actions greatly improved the situation.  She then followed up to ensure my satisfaction. Overall, this was one of the best customer service experiences I have had!  Great way to rescue a dissatisfied customer.
title: Disappointing....  UPDATED 09/24/19 from 2 stars to 5 stars

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Radio Guy
content: I've had the Ring Video Doorbell for a couple of months now. Here's what you need to know. First as a security device it just OK. There is no local video storage so if the internet is down for any reason you have no video. Connection time across the internet varies and while usually notifications from the Ring are within seconds times do vary.
