This is probably not the fault of the Ring but the communication medium which is the internet. Also if you receive alerts on your cell phone you can have additional delays and signal issues with the cell signal. Unless you are in an area with good cell signal you may get slow notification, grainy video, etc. I will say that even when the video was not very good I have been able to speak to someone at the door. The Ring is due to it's location subject to physical damage and relatively easy to defeat. Also you must purchase a video storage subscription after the trial period or you have no video storage so there a ongoing costs with the Ring. Video quality from the Ring is OK but due to the wide angle of the lens the image has some distortion. This is not a defect but simply due to a very wide angle lens and gives a bit of a "fish eye" look to the video. Night video works but is grainy and quality varies. It's also important to realize that the video from the camera will vary due to lighting conditions around the camera, just like any camera if there are poor lighting conditions video may have problems. So take into consideration the lighting conditions when choosing a location for the Ring. The Ring uses WiFi to connect to your internet. The performance of the Ring for WiFi in my opinion is just OK. Other devices we have seem to have better WiFi than the Ring when the signal strength is the same. Bottom line you need to have very good WiFi coverage in the location of the Ring or you will have connection problems at times. I think Ring should try to improve the WiFi performance of this device. The Motion detection of the Ring works pretty well. I did find that we had a flag that cast a shadow of the sidewalk in front of our porch and the waving of the flag and change in the shadow would cause false alarms. Moving the flag solved the problem. We have a road around 60 feet or so from the Ring and passing vehicles do not cause false alarms. Animals that pass in front of the Ring will of course set it off too. We know when the neighbors cat is around. The plastic case of the Ring is pretty good quality. I don't know how long it will last outdoors but personally I am expecting a few years or so until the case shows signs of wear. One thing I do like about the Ring is that it is powered by the wired doorbell connection and keeps is battery charged without any problem.Packaging for the Ring is very good. They have tried to cover just about all installation issues and this has been well done. Overall the Ring does work as advertised but communications conditions (internet, WiFi, and cell) need to be good. I think the Ring can be a good part of a home security system but to secure my home I added other items so supplement the Ring.
title: Unless you are in an area with good cell signal you may get slow notification

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Zac Comfort
content: First, I must say that the included drill bit meant for drilling through brick was absolutely useless. I managed to get maybe a quarter of an inch through in 15 minutes of drilling using all of my strength, after which the bit refused to go any further. After securing the doorbell using an alternative method, it has worked perfectly. The picture quality is very good, and the app works well and is easy to use. The only thing I wish would be improved is the motion detection adjustments. Due to the location of my front door and doorbell, the setting that would work best for me seems to be between two of the available settings, so I am stuck either getting an alert every time a car drives up the street or not getting any alerts, even when a car pulls in my driveway. I assume this wont be changed since the Ring Pro allows for custom adjustments, but that alone isn't worth the extra money they charge for it. But it would still be nice if they updated the software with one or two more sensitivity settings in between the ones currently there.
title: Works well. Very difficult to install on brick.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Greg Chapeau
content: So disappointed! At first it seemed to work fine but out of nowhere it stopped announcing over the echo dots I have. Tried everything I could find to reconnect them but no luck. I can still view the camera from my echo show which is weird to me, why won’t it announce. If you are looking for support, good luck! You would hope a company that makes so much off of us would want to ensure we are happy. They couldn’t care less. It also seems to be missing activity as well, no longer picks up our mail delivery, amazon deliveries or really any other deliveries. I am actively looking for a good replacement and will add the video of me spiking this thing on the ground once I find one. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!!
title: Junk!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gary L. Rezeau
content: After watching your excellent advertising on TV, I did some further research and decided that the ring doorbell was perfect for me.  And IT IS!  My home is a ranch floor plan and I have an office that is far away from my front door.  Although the doorbell works fine I often don't hear it.  The ring doorbell solves that problem and also gives me peace of mind about my front door security.  The instructions are very easy to follow and since you provide all the tools, etc. to get it installed my experience was outstanding.  I just added a ring Chime Pro to my setup today, and that worked great too.  I am very impressed with the design and the quality of your products.
title: I love this wonderful product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jesse Milne
content: The motion detection, as many reviewers have stated, is a joke.  I have mine on very sensitive settings and even with that, it only notifies and starts recording after the delivery person, mail person, etc.... has their back to it.  I have a 40 ft. walkway up to my house and I've tested it many times, played with settings, have it mounted at an angle because I'm on a hill, etc... It just doesn't work.  If anyone came to porch to steal a package, I would most likely just get a nice video of their backs walking off with it. Night vision works well, as does the WiFi connection.  I assume that most people with connectivity issues just don't have a strong enough signal, but my router is just inside the wall that the doorbell is on.  Also like the feature of being able to change the song that plays when the doorbell is pushed (you have to buy a separate speaker for that.) But 90% of the reason I purchased this was for home security and the ability to record people walking TO my door with the motion sensor. I'd look for something else.
title: Just a doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gail
content: Received my Ring video doorbell 2 around the first of November '18.  My handyman installed it; no problem.  Works great, just what I wanted. Then I found out I need to buy a protection plan if I want a video saved in case there is an incident.  Somehow I missed  that detail.  The $30 annual plan will work for me. BUT, the app and  web site have made it almost impossible to purchase it.  In fact, so far, it is impossible.  I haven't been able to accomplish that yet. The app is set up on my phone and it notifies me of motion and rings my doorbell when activated.  I can see my porch and the street in real time.  But I can't purchase the plan that enables me to save the videos. The links on the app just take me in a circle.  I finally tried live chat, waited 15 minutes for a representative. Then the chat hung up on me without resolving the problem.  The rep provided a web site but when I clicked on it, it closed and went back to the chat.  After about 4 rounds of that, chat closed. While I'm at it, I'll mention that the Alexa thingy they sent with the doorbell is a piece of crap.  It keeps saying to go to the web to set it up but after repeated attempts I'm convinced there is NO setup link where it takes me.  It is just a useless paperweight on my desk, soon to be trashed. What is wrong with Amazon that they sell equipment the customer can't set up?  Ridiculous.
title: Lousy customer support

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Yana
content: Great video doorbell. Good quality video. We installed it and activated it without any problems. Wi-fi signal is strong. Videos are clear. We have to use the battery as we didn't want to deal with finding wires to hardwire it. My only gripe is that it gets triggered by pretty much everything. It's a little annoying to get notifications every 10 minutes. That also causes battery drainage. We've had it for 11 days and the battery is already at 39%. Hence, my 3 stars for motion detection. I recommend getting a backup battery. Overall great gadget. I don't have to open the door to see who is there.
title: Great video doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Beate O.
content: I was so excited about getting the Ring 2 Doorbell. True enough it was easy to install and almost everything works fine. It detects motion and it rings as promised. But the speaker does not work. Not like shown on TV, when somebody rings the door bell or sets off the motion detector, you should be able to have a clear 2-way conversation with them. I can hear the person at the door, but they can not hear me, the speaker does not work. At first I thought this was just a defective product, but then I googled it online and there seem to be a multitude of people who haven the same problem, with no solution found.  People say they have called the manufacturer, but they couldn't help either. I am keeping the product because I can still see who is at my door, but I am dissatisfied with it due to the above. Edited 3/7/2019 After endless fiddling with the doorbell and our phones, we are finally able have reasonably  clear conversations with whomever rings the bell or sets off the motion detector. I am revising my rating to 4 stars.
title: Revised 3/7/2019

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Milo Fassbinder
content: The Ring Doorbell 2 is the worst fairly expensive product I've purchased in recent years. I find it nearly worthless, and feel so cheated. When it works, the video is great. But most of the time the app either doesn't work at all--won't load--or doesn't work well, meaning it stops and hangs. I get these alerts, then when I go to see what's happening "live" I can't access.  Even when I can play a video clip, it often stalls until I put the mouse cursor over it. And often it will stall, then immediately jump forward like 10 seconds. I've tried removing and uninstalling, and that doesn't help.  I have the same issues with it on all my devices: my MotoE phone, Kindle Fire HD 10, and high-performance Windows 10 desktop .  When I try to log in without the app, such as on a desktop, I have to wait for a "verification code" every time, which takes 5 to 10 minutes to get to me. BTW, I have high-speed cable internet access. I sit here 3-feet from my router with my devices and the desktop is plugged right in. By contrast, I have a $30 Wyze camera that works brilliantly.  I have that inside the home, looking out a window. This makes sense. Anybody could come along and just unscrew the Ring Doorbell and take it. Although Ring says it'll give you another one if that happens, read the process you've got to go through to get your replacement.
title: App Does Not Work 80% of the Time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jane C.
content: If you have to go battery and WiFi, it's far from as simple as they make it seem. There's a lot of the interface that is pretty unintuitive. The worst is that if you reset your WiFi router's password or install a new router, you must get the ring devices and push a button on them to reconnect them with the new password. The help articles for this are also not all that helpful. For my doorbell, this means unscrewing the key on the cover. For my Camera, this means climbing up and down a 7 ft. ladder every time I need to update a password. Granted, that shouldn't have to happen too often, but I upgraded my router, which necessitated a change. So far today, that has been twice, and I have to do it again tomorrow. These devices have also meant I have to make router location changes in my house causing me to have to call Verizon in as well. Even with FiOS of supposedly up to 100 Mbs,
title: Not nearly as intuitive as expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Samantha R.
content: This device is in my top 10 worst purchases. What a piece of junk. Only useful as a doorbell. Useless as a camera. This company is all marketing and hot air. Motion control settings have no bearing on reality. It records movements by bugs in the middle of the night, but misses package deliveries (if I'm lucky I see the truck leave). Wifi reception is terrible in spots where other devices work just fine. No I'm not buying a chime pro to fix that. Finally, signing up for the afforable basic plan is nearly impossible on a cell phone. I would send this crap back if I could. Waited too long.
title: Records the wrong stuff. Always late. Useless, except as a doorbell... Avoid.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Pam R
content: This is really neat. Sometimes it’s laggy though. Also, we have a video of the guy who robbed us walking away with our stuff when we were robbed, but it did no good. It took the cops six days to get back with us after the initial call and they didn’t know him so the video did no good. I suppose it’s a fun thing to play with and maybe it deters some criminals, but it’s not going to prevent you from being victimized and it may not catch your bad guys. It’s nice not to have to open the door to strangers but let them know you’re home. It’s hard to hear when your dogs are barking, though. It’s nice to be able to see if your packages have arrived yet, I guess.
title: Ok

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: M.V.
content: The hd quality is better than expected and much less pixelated than the 1st generation. I returned the first generation after it started showing a weird blue dot in the images. So, I decided to give this one ago instead and realized soon enough the upgrade in quality of the video is much clearer. The install is easy, it comes with several back plates to adjust angles if needed. The battery life is really good. I only need to charge it once a month and it's sensitivity is set high. I have deliveries and pick ups at the house daily, usually from ups and fedex, we run a business, so I was expecting to have to recharge the battery more frequently. Overall, I think the features are great on the app. I would recommend trying this ring doorbell for a few extra bucks over the first generation.
title: Video quality is better than expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jagroo
content: It has been fun to see who comes to my door during the day, and the behavior of the delivery people.  My doorbell was on a perpendicular wall to my door - which is goofy, but I was able to install using the wedge to get a better picture.  Motion trips when people clear the side of my garage - and that's good. The one thing I don't like is when it tells you that you have a live motion alert, you can't stop it to rewind and see what's going on until it's stopped. It will just give you live feed. The other problem with the perpendicular wall is that if I installed this directly on my vinyl siding, there would have been a gap behind it as it straddled two planks. I resided an area of my house with a vinyl board to mount everything to.  That was a pain in the butt, but it sure helped. 4 stars because it feels glitchy occasionally - but otherwise, I don't know what more to expect. My neighbor is ordering one, and I'll help him install. It's pretty easy to install to existing doorbell wires.
title: This has been fun - and revealing!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: susan
content: I like that I can tell who is at my house and when packages are left. My cousin’s house was robbed by three workers from a cleaning service she hired,  and she was able to show the Ring video of them taking items to their car to the police . You could clearly see the two women taking jewelry out of their bras, and the man taking a watch out of his pants pocket and putting them in their car, all while my cousin was in the house! She was able to press charges, the thieves faced prosecution, and her stolen items were recovered. When I saw her video, I knew I wanted one of these babies for myself!
title: To Catch a Thief...use Ring!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mirkmanea, LLC
content: Conveniently expiring their 30-day free viewable history at the same time their return policy expires, Ring gives you just enough time to think it’s worth while before sticking you with four dollars a month for a $.25/month service. Nothing like being scared witless by the diversity of your neighborhood’s xenophobic “suspicious characters” (who turn out to be guests of the neighbor 9 times out of 10. Never mind the app taking so long to load on a 20mbs internet connection and a iPhone XS that anything that was happening is already long past having happened by the time you can get the live feed up. Oh, and the battery feature is a terrible idea. Should’ve gone wired! I’m going to be frank. If I didn’t know I could get 10x the value from a Kuna, I’d probably rate this product more favorably.
title: Not worth it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: BronxD
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I love the security of having a video doorbell. I love how easy the app is to use to watch videos and get alerts. The video quality is decent, not so great at night. Easy to add additional cameras and have all the video feeds pop up on the same app. I like the easy to charge battery that pops right out. I also like how the Ring app can integrate with my Apple HomeKit and  Philips smart lights via IFTT app. I included a night vision sample video featuring one of the neighborhood critters.
title: Awesome device!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: peter j brennan
content: I bought this then left it in the box for three months because I thought it would be hard to install and was procrastinating.  My mistake. Installation was a breeze. I really like the thoughtful way they included everything you need including a masonry drill bit for drilling the anchor holes if you have an existing doorbell in a masonry wall as I did  They also included extension wires which I also ended up needing because my existing doorbell wires were very short. All in all a really easy install and set up. I also liked the choice of covers. I really didn't want the silver cover and was pleasantly surprised to have the more neutral brown color option. Now my wife has peace of mind and can check who's at the door whenever the bell rings. I highly recommend this
title: Easy install.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Glenn Shankle
content: I have read many reviews on the Ring 2. The sign in shows a 66 percent five star rating. I installed my Ring 2 earlier this week. I was having some minor problems, I’ll spare you the details. Bottom line I called my internet provider who told me I had too many devices draw off my original my original internet package that was consuming the distribution of my WiFi. They beam me out more internet speed. Now all my WiFi devices are working like new and fast and that includes the Ring 2. So I suggest you test your internet speed before condemning the product.
title: Upgrade Your Internet Speed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RB Tucson, AZ
content: I really surprised at the usefulness of this device.  I was replacing old wireless doorbells, that only worked 50% of the time.  This actually notifies you on your cell phone, if someone is at your door.  And you can turn off the motion detection notifications, which can become extremely annoying.  I've had them installed for only one day and also get notifications from other neighbors (videos included) of theft in my area.  I'm really happy on my decision to purchase these for my front and back door.
title: Excellent Product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ZeroR2
content: Ring implemented a feature called "Motion Stop" that stops recording after the Ring device no longer detects motion. The device stops after 30 seconds for battery-operated devices even if physically installed as hardwired. This sound good, but it doesn't work. This is a common complaint.  You can have a person walking up to the house and looking around in the first 30 seconds, the video stops recording and then the person can steal boxes. There would be no footage of the person stealing the boxes. No matter how much motion is detected, the camera stops recording. My guess is that they don't want to store too much data on their cloud (paid subscription) and hence limit to 30 seconds. How can this be useful? You would think that there would be a feature for the user to change the length of recording in the settings. There is also a large delay until the unit starts recording. I have a good router (Nighthawk) and extender (TP Link). When I test the signal strength with my phone next to the Ring, it is very good. I believe that Ring doesn't have a good WIFI hardware to send the signal. I would wait for further improvements until I would recommend this device. I will update my review when this happens.
title: 30 Second Recording Only

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael Brewer
content: Ring is just an overpriced fancy doorbell that alerts your phone. The video feature is so slow to open and inconsistent that 9/10 it's not of any use. The motion sensor will either 1. not pick someone up or 2. Pick someone up far after their back is turned and 5-10 feet away with your Amazon package which is now stolen... I'm a pretty tech savvy guy so I know the product is installed right, has excellent net connect, and software is all up to date. I though maybe the flaws will get better in time and gave it a chance. I left it installed for months but now am just getting around to writing this review and now I'm brought right back to my point that this is just an overpriced doorbell that you have the option to pay a monthly service fee for. Try a different product because this one is garbage.
title: Buy something else...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Joe D.
content: The doorbell 2 seems to work fine.  My complaint is with it's night mode.  There is a hum the is only present when the camera switching from day mode to night mode.  The sound seems to get louder if something gets closer tot the camera and the infra red light has more to pick up or reflect. This issue has been reported by a number users on the Ring forums.  I have tried all the things the Ring support team have suggested in the thread but the sound persist.  People have had their units replaced but the sound is in the replaced units as well.  You can hear the hum with your ear if you listen while the camera is in night mode and you put the doorbell next to ear.  Others in the forum say they hear it even when it is disconnected from the power transformer of the house and it is just running on its battery. It may be a bad batch or a design flaw that is not in a older version of the ring doorbell.  I am waiting to see if Ring fixes the issue and I am hoping to get mine replaced.  It seems senseless to replace it now with so many people reporting the same problem in the replacements.
title: I like it but noise flaw in night vision.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Daniel J LeCour
content: This is a horrible product. I get non stop false positives on someone being at my door and the tinker bell indication has made me hate Peter Pan. Seriously, this thing is just annoying. I have reset the configurations and I still get false positives. Additionally, the video delivery on someone actually being at my door is late and I usually have to run out to the door as people are walking away. There may be some controlled areas where this would work fine but, I don't live on a busy street and I have 500 Mg internet so, not sure where those would be than inside an office with a controlled environment and a T1 line. Don't believe th hype here.
title: Tinkerbell has taken up residence in my home

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: nanie
content: The camera does what I want it to do except show me the live picture. Come to think of it, THAT is what I want it to do. The app is horrible. It is so slow that people leave my doorstep before I get a "live view" and it freezes every other time I try to activate it. Or when I tilt to enlarge the pic.  I can go back and review the video (after rebooting the phone) but everything but live view is an extra $ubscription $ervice. It all worked fine during the 30 day trial period, which also happens to be the return deadline. Product feedback falls on deaf ears. On the positive side, I can paint it to match my house.
title: Not a wise purchase

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ThatBrowningGuy
content: This ring offers a much better image quality than the first generation but the image quality is still lower than other ring products like the floodlight cam (which is an awesome product). Setup was easy, everything you need is in the box. We were replacing a first generation ring and it came with a converter plate to avoid drilling new holes and some angle adjustment plates to get the best vantage point. Took me about 7 minutes to install. Charging the battery using USB took a lot longer than I expected, I hope to not have to do that often. So far the motion seems much better than the first product where we would get tons of false events from cars driving by, especially when it was hot. We’ll see how much better the adjustable zones can do in the summer. The echo show integration is nice and you can also link multiple devices to all record at the same time. I really want a feature to disable the connection to the internal doorbell and just have it ring on my phone sometimes. When the baby is napping and people hit the bell it freaks my dog out.
title: A big improvement over the first Ring

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AngelaT
content: Mine was refurbished: Charging is funky compared to the 1st gen. The 1st gen you could charge it and see if it was charged on the app. But with the 2nd gen you have to take it off the charge and put it in the doorbell then go to the app and see how charged it is. The index on the back that shows how you know it charged with one green strip. Not sure if it works. Overall the ability to see at night and during the days is 10x better. The 1st gen would go in and out as well as be choppy recording. This one is has better videos and sound recordings. It is 1080 unlike 1st gen 720. It is a good buy. Only bad thing is you gotta pay 3$ per camera.
title: Worth the price refurbished. Better than 1st gen

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: paintballr1176
content: I bought this product after reading mixed reviews. I was hoping to be one of the success stories. I gave the product a fair chance (about 3 months) and tried several suggestions for improvement I found online. The long short of it is the motion sensor is flawed. Even at the closest setting of less than 5 feet cars over 30 feet away set off the sensor. The sensor is hit or miss when up close as well. It picks and chooses when to recognize a person standing directly in front of it. I have the doorbell hardwired so it has adequate power and a strong WiFi connection. The doorbell is also mounted at the proper height as recommended in the installation manual. The second issue I have is a useless speaker. I can hear people talking to me through the app but I cannot respond. No matter what I try all they hear is a muffled cracking noise. I will also note that I own the ring spotlight cam for my back yard. This too has major issues that aren’t easily resolved. My connection to the device is very spotty. Again I have a strong WiFi signal throughout my house (confirmed by a technician from my provider) but even at a mere 40 feet away from my router I have a poor connection. My phone and other devices have no issue connecting to my WiFi from my back yard so I know it’s not an issue with my exterior walls or insulation. I’m aware that ring offers a product (Chime) that helps boost the signal but after receiving two flawed products I absolutely refuse to give Ring anymore of my money! Buyer beware, I suggest you look elsewhere for your home security needs!
title: Useless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: A. Anderson
content: She has been wanting one of these for a while.  Simple enough to set-up and install.  The camera works well. If you set it up wireless you get a notice on your phone but nothing rings in the house.  If you want an internal bell you need a ring chime. I added a Chime Pro which includes the bell and a network extender to ensure that I had a strong signal for the doorbell as my router is in the basement and my house is brick.  I don't know if I needed it, but I wanted an inside bell and the difference to have the network extender was not that much so I added it.  We are already talking about adding Ring security lights. Everything seems to be working well and was easy to install.
title: Christmas gift for my Wife

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: 900Psychic
content: Although the product works, the software installation and operational control function at pre-Beta level.  The install on an Android 7.0 phone was "toxic" requiring a power-off to regain control of the phone.  Turning the motion-sensing on was easy -- once it was on there appeared to be no way to turn it off.  Every switch was placed in the off position to no avail -- motion notifications just kept coming.  Switching to Windows resulted in a message that the entire Windows installation experience was being redesigned, so check back later.  Finally, everything worked okay on an Android 6 tablet.  The number of 4 and 5 star reviews on Amazon are baffling.  Even if the installation were easy, the product is useless as a doorbell.  The delay is so long that anyone at the door will be gone before the notification pops up on your mobile device.  You need to buy the additional WiFi chime or wire the Ring up to your old doorbell.  Look on sitejabber -- 38 of 40 reviews are 1-star even though 90% are 4 or 5 on Amazon.  Strange!
title: Brutal software experience, mediocre performance

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SeeTheMage
content: One of the first things the installer told me was that the "RING" system would not chime in my house, so I would effectively lose my doorbell. I would have just purchased an outside motion detector/camera if I had known this. That amounts to deceptive advertising, in my opinion. Now, I am out almost $300.00 and I have to "buy" ring chimes to link wirelessly to add indoor chimes back to my house. I do not walk around the house carrying my cell phone. If you buy this product, please be aware that you will have to spend more to get a doorbell sound back into your house. Lesson learned for my next house.
title: I did not do enough research

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: amazon user
content: The only issues I had were, it always has connection issues and won't load, but my nest cameras have no problem with the connectivity. It is handy that it doesn't need an electrical source however, with moderate useage (25 evenrs a day) the battery needed charging every 14 days. Also the motion sensor was interesting. Cars in the background set it off, but a few times, people that knocked on the door did not (and yes, the mount location was correct and the zones were all operational).
title: Slow to connect but works

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: tucsondonpepe
content: The first reason I purchased the Ring doorbell is because it is battery operated. I did not have to worry about connecting to the original electrical doorbell system. The second reason I purchased the Ring doorbell is because I was able to connect it to two Ring Chime, Wi-Fi-Enabled Speakers. Now I can hear the door bell from any room in my home. Plan to add another Ring Chime for my garage. There is a motion setting that plays a sound different than the doorbell sound. I selected the Wolf sound, very distinctive. Also able to adjust the area the doorbell sees so cars driving down the street do not set off the motion setting Wolf sound. The app is very easy to setup.
title: Great doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ALEXANDER WAYNE
content: If you want to be 100% dependent on a paid service with cloud-based uploading. This product is for you. However, if you live in 2019 and realize that security cameras have utilize a small SD card in them for about 10 years or more, this product does not have that. I also rate it two stars because,  more than half of the videos that alert you to motion at your door don’t show enough before footage, like where the person came from or if they were standing on the side of your house, office and then walk by the front door. You only see the video a few seconds after they are contacted by the camera. A few seconds is all a person needs to run by and do something shady. This is a serious flaw.  More than half my video show a person walking by and then disappearing out of the picture. If the camera were to record the before footage, you could at least have more information and determine whether it was relevant or not. Again, like other security cameras. It works great if you just want to use this device to see who is at your door for Amazon deliveries or the pizza guy/girl. I love the service but not the ability to integrate into my own security camera system I currently have, a.k.a. a computer, a server or another system of my desire. Like all other security cameras you can connect to it usually buy an IP address or old-school BNC cable. This camera re-moves the option for you to manage it. If you don’t mind paying for a service every month, then this is right for you. However I do mind when there is a nagging red banner at the bottom of my app every single time I use it just because I decided not to enroll in their paid service.
title: Must pay for full functionality

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S Lechner
content: This doorbell is working ok for me, but it has been a disappointment.  I had many problems, which are continuing, with connection to the doorbell.  I have a router and have no problems connecting to multiple devices including laptops, phones, kindles, tablets, echo dots and fire stick.  Many of these are connected at the same time with no problems.  Some of my visitors have access with their phones to my router and connect seamlessly.  The same is not true of the Ring Doorbell.  At first the signal was so weak the doorbell would not work.  I talked with support and they suggested the Ring Chime to boost the signal.  This did not seem to make a difference and eventually support agreed with me.  I returned the Chime with no problems.  I then purchased a Router Extender.  This improved the connection, but I still cannot get a strong connection.  I know of times when someone was near the door and the Doorbell did not respond.  Sometimes I get notification, but the person has left already. (This is using the motion sensor)  The doorbell does notify me, but I have not been able to talk with them yet.  What I have is sufficient, but in hindsight, I wish I had done more research on similar products.
title: Problem with internet connection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: gretti
content: Major delay from when the doorbell chimes or detects motion to when you receive the notice. By the time you get the notice the person is gone or frustrated that you did not answer the bell.  The android app is difficult at best to navigate.  There is no one button to press to answer a ring.  You have to open the app. Then find the live view in the menu and hope it connects.  Most of the time it does not.  It works better if your home and on the same network as the Ring.  But I can just answer the door if Im home. The real reason I bought this is to use when Im away.  Too bad I got a great deal when Amazon had their prime day and even with that discount Im still returning this product....
title: Unit not stable

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jack Estes
content: It's a lot of money for this thing, but I can't overstate how well thought out the system is. It came with everything needed to install, with options for trim colors, and the instructions were just exquisite. Like installing a Nest Thermostat if you've ever done that. So well executed. The companion app is very easy to use and is unobtrusive, unlike my surveillance camera app that generates false positive motion alerts ALL THE TIME. The quality of the two-way audio is pretty good. I've talked to the UPS guy, my son, and a random solicitor through it, all while not even being in the same state, and it was very clear. The app does respond weirdly on my Note 8 when trying to modify account parameters, but the video part is great. In short, if you need a video doorbell, and budget isn't an issue, I don't think you can go wrong.
title: Easy to install, lots of features, but expensive.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scott S.
content: Got this doorbell on sale after looking at it for a while. Not a bad setup, but there are some short comings. First the motion sensitivity is hit and miss. I get notified of motion a second or two before someone rings the doorbell. Other times I'll get notified of motion from a street 100 feet away. I've messed with the settings an incredible amount of times and have it calibrated as best as possible, but still get issues with under or over registration. Battery life is very good, charged twice in the last 6 months. Overall happy with my purchase.
title: Works decently enough to replace your existing doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michelle Pelegrino
content: I was very excited to get my Ring system! I gave it to my fiance for Christmas and finally got the time to set it up. I plugged in the battery to charge. A few hours later, my fiance informed me he smelled burning in the kitchen. I immediately unplugged everything and started a search through the appliances. Turns out it was this Ring battery that went on fire!!! I am in shock! I really have never had a complaint about an Amazon/Alexa related purchase, but this completely freaked me out! Unfortunately because I bought this and held onto it to give as a gift, my return window is closed. I'm really upset about the money loss, but more upset about the fact that my house could have burned down!!
title: Fire Hazard

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: IflyA10s
content: The product was very easy to install using the online app. The instructions are clear and installation went very smoothly. The function of the unit is as expected or exceeds my expectations. The online app is very flexible and Is very user friendly. The storage charges for videos are reasonable and $30 a year and you only need to use it one time to make it worth your while. When you install the unit the battery requires around 5 to 10 hours to fully charge so Build that in to your installation plan.  Be sure to check out the new features on the online app as there are some pretty cool items you can turn on for instant pictures when you open the app. The instant notification of motion is a very useful part of the product. I have a nine camera close circuit system and was still the victim of porch Pirates because my current system did not give me instant notification of movement on my porch. I feel if I would’ve had my ring doorbell I could have prevented the theft.
title: Great addition to any security system

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jorge E. Reyes
content: I have it for a year. I'm looking for a replacement. I already cancel my subscription. I have my wireless router in the office no more than 30 feet from the camera. It will connect to see the live stream once every 5 times I try. I got instruction on how to improve that. I assigned a unique ip to the camera change settings nothing work. Must of the time when the camera detected movement and started recording the person was leaving the proarch or was already in the house so you can not see faces. Also you don't have a subscription you don't have a recording. The only way this device is more or less effective is with a subscription. Very disappointed in this product.
title: Useless. By the time start recording you don't see faces, need subscription to be effective

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Snelgrove
content: This is the first Ring product i have purchased and I was blown away with the product packaging, instructions and tools provided for installation. The only company that I have seen with similarly packaged products is Apple. Just as important, installation to replace an existing, ancient doorbell was easy, both in the hardware installation and setting up the app on my smartphone. Ring provided all necessary tools and other materials that might be needed or installation (for example, an insert to tilt the camera down so that it can capture video for steps leading to the front door). I was so impressed I purchased one of their other products, an exterior light/video camera/motion sensor for our backyard.  A very classy product.
title: Easy to install and use

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Daryl
content: Expensive rubbish. Avoid. Camera works well and provides excellent video quality, but, despite having fibre which Google WiFi is currently reporting as 102Mbps down and 20Mbps up, the concept of remotely intercepting and interacting with someone at your front door is absolute la-la land fantasy. I have a dedicated Google WiFi module within five (5) feet of my Ring2 and the Ring2 is showing as the only device on this module. Despite getting a doorbell ring promptly (although, on second thoughts, who knows how promptly if they're not at home and actually see the doorbell ringer arrive) it takes about 2 to 3 minutes to get the video ... by which time the guest/intruder (etc) has returned to their home country. Complete waste of time and money ... you can't record to your own device (computer storage) and their storage plan is irritatingly expensive when you have your own facilities. The motion detection sounds like a good idea but it's way too sensitive (even at minimum settings) if, like me, you have a front door close (about 12 feet) to a footpath and roadway. And the "battery powered" concept, although "works well" and with generous capacity, becomes an irritation after the first few removals to recharge. Easy to swap to a an online power supply but the product isn't worth the effort. Bin fodder ... which it is going to be once I find something that has had considerably more effort put into providing a useable product.
title: No, no, NO!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: The Rarely Reviewer
content: Initially we were thrilled with the doorbell but eventually realized a few months later that it was becoming worse and worse at notifying us.  Initially, it alerted as soon as someone or something entered the driveway but at the end only when the person or vehicle was actually at the door.  We tried resetting everything, adjusting settings, repositioning, but nothing worked, and by the time we finally called tech support we were about a week outside the warranty window.  They had us do everything we'd already done, to no avail, and we were finally told "it's old, probably the lens has slipped inside."
title: Began failing after a few months

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Melissa M. Presser
content: UPDATE: Decided to pay the $92.50 installation fee even though I had already done half the work. Found out 2 hours ahead of scheduled installation that no one was scheduled to come, so that would have been a wasted 3 hours waiting for no one. Ring also started my “free trial” even though I let them know it wasn’t yet installed. What a joke. Decided to scrap the whole thing and send doorbell back. Ring was unresponsive to requests before I even got started. With that lack of customer care, I have a feeling I would have been unhappy. This is a lot of money to pay for this much frustration. Lowering my rating to 1 star. I I am excited to use my new Ring, but there were parts missing (wall anchors; template for drilling holes) and this item is billed as an "easy installation"...except that it's not!  The drill bit included for installation may be suited to wood, but it does not work for brick. Even with the masonry bit I went and bought, I made very little progress toward drilling holes deep enough to anchor the Ring, and I install things electrical and plumbing-wise around my house all the time. And yes, they'll send a professional installer out if I'd like for another $92. It may be a good product, but getting to the point where I'll be able to use it seems problematic. Product itself would get 5 stars; the ease of getting to actually use the product gets 1 star.
title: Missing parts; NOT an "easy installation"; poor customer care

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Msac
content: ***Edit / Update*** - Finally got it to work, by disabling Lookout security on my phone then enabling it again. Took 3 days since installation to get it going. Customer service still stinks but once they escalated it got much better. Subtracting 1 star for overall headache dealing with the below, and subtracting 1 star as I still don;t get all my alerts, just about every 3 out of 4. I would buy an improved version in the future, but holding off for now. 3/5 This was a bad purchase that I am now stuck with because I drilled holes into my concrete to hard wire it. The doorbell does not send notifications rendering this useless to view anyone live or while I am not home. I was on the phone with tech for 2 hours yesterday uninstalling, reinstalling, changing this, turning on that, blah blah and still do not get any notifications. They then email me asking me to reinstall the whole thing, which I do. Then they blame my wifi system, which is hilarious, because.. It Is an Amazon EERO mesh system! Once I told him that he was like oh no, its not your wifi system.. I respond back it does not work, and I have not heard from them again since. This is basically 100 dollar dumb doorbell. So after researching another hour or so on my own, it appears that everyone is having this issue on Android and yet they have done nothing to fix this issue. Look at the app ratings, it is in the 2 star range. Brutal. Do not buy, do not waste your money. I would totally return this if I didn't drill the template (which by the way is cheap plastic) already in concrete.
title: Problem solved but initial headache was dissapointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark Sarria
content: The doorbell video image is great. Very wide-angle POV. The audio is clear. The motion detection needs a lot of work. Shadows, trees, and cars cause the motion to trigger. I've lowered the sensitivity to its lowest setting and still reports a lot of false-positives. The motion detection in the ring is very basic. My suggestion to RING is to add a trip-wire analytic in conjunction with directional-flow to reduce false alarms. Trip-wire enables you to draw a virtual line in the image when someone crosses that line it triggers the alert. Direction-Flow enables the user to set parameters on the direction that must be crossed to trigger the alert. Just a thought.
title: Great Video, bad motion

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: X. Unix
content: I have my ring hooked up to the transformer for my door chime, and it dies about every month. I checked my voltage at the ring itself and had 24v, and even replaced the transformer "just in case" and it did not help. I looked it up online and it seems I am not alone with this problem, and the only fix seems to be for Ring to send an updated version. Instead of wasting my time with their tech support I just bought a different brand. Heres hoping their power solution is superior to this piece of garbage.
title: Battery is garbage!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S.B.
content: We've had our Ring doorbell camera for over a year now, but didn't install it until a few months ago. Unfortunately, it is basically useless if you do not subscribe to their monitoring. While we had the free trial, it worked perfectly fine--when we got notifications that there was motion at the door, we could activate it and see it immediately. There was a history that could be viewed as well. Now that the trial is over and I'm "self-monitoring," the majority of the time it just never activates to let me see the live view when there's an alert of motion at the door. I was under the impression that we would be able to self-monitor and save any videos that we did a live view of. If/when I'm actually able to get the live view to work, I'm unable to save the video. I'm going to trash this system and regroup on something else. If I'm going to have to pay for monitoring, it won't be for this piece of junk.
title: Worthless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Roy
content: Works great on both my daughter's houses. Can see Pittsburgh, PA and Cincinnati, OH at the same time. However, I am having trouble finding an extender to run my doorbell 300 feet from my wifi in my house out to the gates on the property. I have installed an extender and Ring extender. No luck yet. But----Very cool product. I now have 3 for 3 different houses and would buy again.
title: Set up takes several tries. But: product works well.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vela
content: For the first couple months of having this product, it was amazing. It worked as it was intended. After those first couple months, it started to not pick up on motion, only have black recordings and wouldn't connect to a live stream on our phones. We bought an extender, thinking our internet was the problem, but that did not help either. Our next step was to call Ring support, who determined the device was defective. They said they would email us and send us a replacement, since it was still under warranty, but we never got either of them. Now our Ring only records and connects to live video occasionally. I don't understand the point of this device if it does not work as intended. I would give this product 0 as stars if possible.
title: Does not work as intended. Don't waste your time.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Martinson
content: Overall, I am happy with the Ring for my specific use.  I use it in conjunction with my Arlo system.  I really just wanted the Ring for a more visual theft deterrent as well as added visual angle with more natural way to communicate.  Arlo is more hidden and is harder to have conversations over.  I had issues with WiFi strength which required me to invest additional dollars into my WiFi setup.  Funny thing is that Arlo worked just fine and was even further away from my router than Ring.  Weird, but fixed.  The motion detection is not the best either.  However for me, Arlo picks up motion and is my primary.  So for my use case (to be a visual deterrent and to occasionally use as an intercom), it is fine.  If I didn't have my Arlo system, I would not be satisfied and would have returned the Ring.
title: Weak WiFi connection and spotty motion detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: C. Patrick
content: I work at home and wanted a doorbell camera so I could see who was at the door so I could ignore Jehovah's Witnesses, Boy Scouts selling popcorn, etc.  The camera installed easily and I bought an angle kit as well as my door is on about a 40 degree angle to the sidewalk/street.  The video on the camera is good and the night vision is also very good.  However, the lag on the motion detection notification is 10 or 15 seconds from the router (which is 3 feet from the Ring) to my phone.  This is too long a delay.  And why can I not get the notifications to pop up on my computer where I am working all day instead of having to keep my cell phone on my desk.  Another irritation is I cannot get the motion detection to stop detecting cars driving by on the street in front of my house - the detection line is dragged almost to the foot of the steps, but I still get cars tripping the motion detector.  My last complaint, is the cost to save the video to the cloud.  I opted not to do this after using it for the free month.  I only had one instance where I wanted to see who had been there and it just isn't worth the $36+ a year for me.
title: Good, but not great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kym
content: Got this refurbished. Glad i didnt pay more. But Ring 2 doorbell serves its purpose. It is great to have live video recording and thats why we got it. Works well during the day most times. Night time was missing a LOT of stuff. A bit bulky. Easy to install though  but no instructions on angle brackets. Plus angle brackets are way too expensive if u need more. Cheap $30/yr to record as opposed to a home security system, so cant complain too much. I may look into spotlight ring in addition because the left and right edges weren't catch anything even when my hubby walked across the lawn. And i wanted it especially for the cars but sometimes it wouldn't trigger. So we got the wifi extender cause it kept reloading and missing stuff and it didnt do much, but it is better. we will keep trying , but went thru all of the extensions in settings and all the faq's & suggestions; (hense the wifi extender)... so hoping that will help. Ring 2 so far is good for rings or close ups, but needs work, and could be a lot better especially for the hefty pricetag.
title: Ring 2 worth the recordjng & good for its purpose but could be better.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ArnBol
content: I have had this up for around 1 week. It was relatively easy to install but heed other warnings if you will mount on brick as the included drill bit is not good enough to drill the 4 holes. Also, the security screw that is the final step to secure the faceplate was not in the bag of included hardware but was in a very small bag attached to the top of a card insert which was pushed into the doorbell!!  I almost threw it away before noticing it.After 1 week the battery is at 87% so by my math it should last 54 days. Not bad, but also not as long as advertised. The video picture is clear but the motion alerts do not activate until the person is almost right at the door and the motion zones are too broad so that there is always a trade-off where false alerts for vehicles also come through. It would have been nice if there was some sort of faint illumination on the unit because in a dark doorwell like mine, you really cannot see the Ring unit. However, I guess this would further reduce battery life. I paired it with the Ring chime which works well to give us audible alerts inside. Overall, I am happy and I would recommend this to others. I would give it 3.5 stars not 4 though, because of the issues I noted
title: Overall a good buy

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Toz
content: I was very impressed with how amazingly well Ring placed product parts in the box. It is VERY WELL and thoughtfully done. The packaged instructions were better than average and their online video instructions were quite easy to follow.  I really like the look of the primary unit - the doorbell/camera. The quality of the product also seemed well manufactured.  I mounted the camera to two of the ‘angled’ boxes that help improve camera direction. I am a little concerned that stacking the boxes and then the camera is a little awkward looking and doesn’t seem as stable as it would be mounted to fewer boxes. There are some things I do not quite like. The Ring is mounted where my old doorbell was and hardwired, which saves having to charge the battery periodically, which seems like a minor hassle. The Ring is also mounted very close to a WiFi controlled switch for my outdoor lights, and Ring is causing the switch to malfunction. Ring is pretty clear with their online instructions to keep Ring away from smart devices. But in would be very impractical to move either the switch or Ring. But I guess I’ll have to , which will be another minor to moderate hassle. The ‘fisheye’ view is pretty OK, but I’m not thrilled with the night vision. The camera seems a little too sensitive.  Today was pretty windy with snow blowing around and outside holiday directions swaying around.  The unit detected motion about every hour two.  I don’t want to put Ring on snooze overnight, but may need to. I’m  That kind of defeats it’s most important function. My only ‘directions’ related complaint is that the instructions for hard wiring using the old doorbell’s low voltage supply is a bit confusing, and it’s very important to get it right because if you install the ‘diode’ when you’re not supposed to, the unit will supposedly be damaged. Ring should really amplify the warning and clarify how to wire correctly. Today is the first day of operation, so I’m not exactly sure how Ring will perform long term, but I’m pretty confident given the overall product quality and instructions. Oh - and their noted willingness to replace the unit for free if it is stolen tells me they REALLY will stand behind their product (hopefully I won’t need that service!). I’ll update my review in a month or so.
title: Pretty impressive overall, but a few issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bravo36niner
content: Love it, honestly works flawlessly easy set up and easy installation.now I do not have a wired door bell so it runs on battery. I'm not sure where they get the estimated run times of the battery but we get 2 to 3 weeks at our front door and a 4 to 5 weeks at our back door. Now we have a lot of traffic at our front door I mean 3 older kids in and out their friends and boyfriend's. So I'm not disappointed we are usually home on Sundays so I just pull battery and charger while we are home all day and charge it. And it is so easy to do just unscrew pull battery and plug it in.
title: Love it, best electronic investment ever.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R. Titter
content: I've only had the doorbell a couple of weeks & it does exactly what I bought it for. I can see anyone approaching my front door & talk with anyone that rings the doorbell from my Iphone. The directions are easy to understand & it's easy to setup & install. You will possibly have to make adjustments from the app so the motion sensor works better depending on the location of the doorbell & how far it is from the street. You can have multiple people get the alerts on their phones when there is motion or someone rings the doorbell. My wife & I both get the alerts. I see a lot of complaints about lag time & that would depend on how good your WiFi is, how far the Ring Doorbell is located from your WiFi, & what type of signal your phone is getting at the time that the alert comes through. The video is very clear even at night. Overall I am very happy with the Ring Video Doorbell 2.
title: Love the Ring Video Doorbell 2. It works Great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Greg T
content: I upgraded from the first Ring, hoping that this one would be better with the motion detection, but it's not any better.  It seems to pick up cars driving by the house better than people coming up to the door from the sidewalk.  More often than not, I see the person's back on the camera AFTER they rang the doorbell.  So I'll see a delivery person drop the box and ring the doorbell, but I won't see them walking up to the door, which kind of defeats the purpose of even having the Ring.  The picture is better than the original ring because it's 1080p, but that's the only thing better about the Ring 2 over the original.  Ring really needs to get their stuff together when it comes to the motion detection.  The Live View is also not that great, as sometimes it takes 30 seconds for it to load up.  My router and wi fi connections are about 15 feet from the ring, so the excuse of a bad internet connection does NOT apply.  Overall I'm disappointed with this and every Ring I've owned.  The best thing it serves as is a deterrent.  People see a camera looking at them and if they're up to no good, they turn and walk away.  That's what this thing is good for.
title: A problem that Ring really needs to solve

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kris E.
content: Pros: you can save videos of whose been at your door, you can look at live view to see if anyone is there (see cons), it’s a doorbell! Cons: the lag time is awful. My UPS guy is back in his truck by the time I get the motion sensor chime.  So if a guest rings the doorbell he/she must stand around waiting until the device loads the camera. If you’re in a place with fabulous WI-FI you can check to see whose at the door, if not it won’t load the camera. Every time my home WI-FI goes down I have to reset it. Really not worth the cost. I was hoping this would be a security solution when I’m out of town but by the time I find great WI-FI and wait for the lag time the thieves would have cleaned me out!
title: Not a great security solution

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dwight
content: Great concept, great advertisements, but sound is terrible on my product (both directions). I have installed this device at the front door which is just off of a busy street (pedestrian and vehicle).  As such, there is plenty of background noise.  However, the sound issue seems to be unrelated to this.  When I try to speak to somebody at the door, they hear a bunch of scratchy sound (many times not being able to guess what I am trying to say (think: voice of teacher in Charlie Brown .. Wah-wah-wah-wah-wah).  Likewise, hearing what they are saying at the door is poor.  The background traffic is very clear but their voices come out scratchy.
title: Most likely will go with a lower-cost/lesser-known brand to get the same (or better) results.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Newsletter Guy
content: After all the advertising bologna I bought one for our security and installed it. It is in line of sight of my router through a window and signal strength is good. I thought as soon as someone rang your doorbell the video would be instant but not so. Usually the visitor is back down the driveway and leaving before the Ring is viewable. Very slow to activate. So after research decided it was my router speed and bought a replacement of a well known brand. Same issue, may as well get up and go answer the door regardless that I am mobile restricted which is another reason I bought it. Picture clarity is not all that great either I might add. Disappointed in Florida, Tim
title: Big disapointment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shane G.
content: I would not recommend this if you'd like to use it for anything other than upclose camera shots.  The video quality is poor if not right on top of the lens.  Motion detection is horrible- it will send an alert if a large speck of dust flys by.  I have returned this unit and purchased something else, and it's working out well.  For the price, the video quality should be much better. I will say that installation of this was quite easy.
title: An OK doorbell, but useless for motion detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Devin
content: I've had it about a week and so far so good. I live in an apartment building and use it to keep track of those both in and out of my apartment, especially for repairs or to deal with my not so friendly landlord. I also love that I can see who is ringing my bell while I am away from home. I've been looking for a video doorbell for quite a while. I purchased this one after seeing a friend's, and learned from them that it works with just a battery pack. Since don't have any hard wires available at my door, the battery pack is crucial. It came bundled with an Amazon Echo 5 for $139.99 (sweet deal!)
title: So far so good.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D.K
content: It’s very hard to install. It took me 3 hours to install. The instructions were confusing because it came with so many pieces of paper. It comes with a lot of small parts and screws. It also comes with a screwdriver which is strange. Most people own screwdrivers. I wish it came with a paper template which would have made it so much easier to install. It was very difficult to make a mark on the wall because I couldn’t find a pencil thin enough to go through the screw holes all the to way to my bumpy stucco wall.
title: Surprisingly difficult to install.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Willie Edward Redd
content: I replaced my standard doorbell with this Ring Doorbell 2. I read some of the reviews which were less than satisfactory and in some case they were entirely displeased with the product. However, I was open to not being pleased myself and was prepared to return it if my experience was not good. My initial experience was that I had no problem installing the unit. I had no issues setting up the unit. My unit connected within seconds to my internet. Also while I was installing my Ring device my neighbors had the cable company digging and installing cables services, and they were quite active near my home. I set up the detection perimeter and I got no false alerts while they were working. I got no alerts while cars were driving through my cup de sac, which is often quite busy. I left my home from the garage in an area out of view, walked into view towards my front porch with my phone in hand and I was detected immediately. When I walked out my front door the motion detector also worked instantly. I have no idea why so many people said their motion detector had such a delay. I tried mine many times and it always alerted instantly. I wired my device to work with my existing system and that also worked well too. Live video worked well too. All in all, my device works as advertised and I’m happy with it. It’s a keeper and it does exactly as I hoped it would and I love it’s ease of use. I’m very pleased with it!
title: My Ring Doorbell 2 works as designed with no issues. A wonderful addition to my home!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Aszra Wingfield
content: I have it hooked up to my original wired doorbell so that I still hear the bell throughout my house when people press the doorbell button. The video quality it pretty good. Sound is pretty good. But I find that it takes my phone FOREVER to connect once it alerts me that there is movement. I’ve had it connected for 20 days. So far I’ve had several strangers ring the doorbell (while I was home, indisposed and connected to WiFi) and I have not been able to answer it through my phone. It takes SOO LONG to connect that the people have left by the time I get to the video/talk part. I usually end up watching the video after they leave and wondering what they wanted. My husband, who was at work,  also says he can’t get on the video chat fast enough to talk to the people before they walk away. For example: if my hubby goes out the front door to take out the trash. I might have it up and ready to talk as he’s coming back in. I do find it funny that both my husband and I can chat at the same time. We had both dropped in to chat with out kids that were standing on the porch.
title: Cool, but app doesn’t upload quick enough to talk to person at door.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T@B Campin'
content: For you ladies, I installed this myself to the existing doorbell wiring!  Great instructions and videos.  All the tools you need in the box.  It took me longer to uninstall the old doorbell than it did to install the Ring!  Thank you Ring for including a side wedge as the house has a walkway and the builder installed the doorbell up against the house and not on the other side of the door where it would have been centered.  Extremely happy with this purchase!
title: Amazing home upgrade!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dot
content: We hooked this up 5 days ago and just love it.  It has motion so if someone is in your driveway it will send your smartphone a notification.  This is great when you are away you can see who pulls in.  I just purchased the Amazon Show  2 for my counter so I can just ask Alexa to let me know who is at the door and it will show up on her screen rather than fumbling with the passcode on my phone.  Love it.
title: Great camera

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Little One
content: Love this. So much more useful than timers. I can turn different lights on/off and even schedule them. I can also control them with my voice or through the app in my phone.  I bought my parents these with Echos for Christmas. Because these make lights handsfree, they're perfect for elderly that need their hands for walker stability. They also love being able to use their voices to turn on/off their lights at night. I bought Echo shows to check on my parents too. I can sleep while listening to make sure they're ok after coming home from the hospital. Paired with the Ring doorbell, they can talk and see the nurses and caregivers.
title: ELDERLY NEED THIS

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Serena Thaw
content: This thing sucks. It's triggered by cars passing by on the street, but not when actual people walk up the steps and either put down packages or come up to the door. When it is triggered by people, it's usually when they're walking away (a nice shot of their back) or after they've come in the door (a nice shot of their shoulder and the screen door closing behind them). The delay is just awful. It works great as a doorbell, but for motion alerts and recording, it just plain sucks. We've tried different angles, different settings, etc - all the same. I don't care if my neighbor drives by in her sedan. I care if there is an actual human on my porch, which this does not bother to capture. What a waste of money.
title: Does Not Capture Motion in Time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jimmy Delaney
content: Installation was easy and setting up the app on iOS was also a breeze. However, there was no sound to or from the device. Though it was defective and got an exchange from Amazon. Same issue. WiFi signal was fine. Choppy video at times and no sound. Chatted with Ring and after they walked me through the usual troubleshooting steps over a period of about an hour, it was discovered a firmware update was needed. The update had to be pushed to the doorbell by the rep and I had to uninstall and reinstall the app. I was told by the rep I would have to do this for any Ring Doorbell 2. I have audio and video now, however the audio is terrible with lots of distortion. I know it is not the WiFi signal because I did several speed tests at the doorbell location and right next to the router and the difference in speed is negligible. Moved the doorbell next to the router and had the same issue. I am going to try it for a few more weeks.  If it proves to be useless due to the audio issues, will be returning and looking for an alternative.
title: Ring Video Doorbell 2 audio issues

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: sagetek
content: One thing I noted was that when my Ring informed me of a doorbell or motion presence on the area monitored, was nowhere nearly as fast as shown in the commercials. There is a 5-10 second delay between activation and signal to your monitoring device and if you want a live view, it can be up to 15-20 seconds before you can be notified and access the live video. By that time, visitors may have left and "intruders" may have already broken in/taken items or left. This is NOT instantaneous as advertised.
title: Live internaction with "intruders/visitors" not exactly as advertised Ring II..delay noticed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: soflatechie
content: I just installed ring so I can only comment on the features I have used.  First, setup was pretty straight forward.  Keep in mind that the ring doorbell is bulky.  If the place where your existing doorbell is s door frame that is not wide enough, you won't be able to screw it in to the same place.  This is my situation.  I may get the door chime add on since I could not install it wired to my existing chime. Other than this issue setup was pretty quick.  The motion detection is pretty spot on and resolution is pretty good. I am pretty happy so far.
title: Works well

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ricquel
content: i had an instance with porch pirates. setting this up was seamless, i didnt need to wire anything.  I have had it installed for only 2 days now and love it. I feel more secure, i have it hooked up to my Alexa which alerts me if theres a motion if im not in the living room to hear it. The quality is great, i love that i can zoom in on live footage. I am debating whether or not i want to purchase the protection plan for $3 a month to get 60 days of storage. I probably will, but i will wait until my 30 day trial is over lol. I highly recommend it.  my purchase price was only $159 for the door bell 2, however it is now higher in price at $199.
title: highly recommend

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mrsbailey405
content: The reason I gave this 3 stars is the battery. I am going to look into the solar battery as another option.  Also we had read all of the directions but we had to pre drill holes in to our door and placed it right above the lock. Now it's a pain to remove for charging the battery because there is a hole at the bottom that needs to be unscrewed and due to the placement of it right above the lock. The device itself works great and I love it paired to the Echo Show. We can ask Alexa to show the front door to see who's there. If you dont pay the subscription tho you can only see real time. No recordings.
title: Alexa, Show me the front door.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: cube1
content: I like getting videos, but this thing could use some improvement.  For motion detection, I have the issue that its 30s video MISSES the first few seconds, so sometimes a bird or animal will trigger it -- but I don't get to see what actually happened.  Night vision is pretty good (it switches to monochrome.)  It complains that my WiFi signal is week (my router is in the basement) -- but actually works OK.  I had to use two of the mounting adapters to get it to fit well on my narrow door molding - that was a pain -- it would be nice if there was a narrow to wide adapter.
title: It works OK, but....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stephen Hannant
content: Product does not work as advertised, specifically around the motion detection range.  Installed the unit with a corner wedge, and set motion to 5 feet.  My house faces onto a street, and the sidewalk is about 10-12 feet from the door, so didn't want to pick up foot traffic.  Unit still detected all the foot traffic.  Ring replaced the unit as defective after attempting to fix with firmware update. Was next advised to install an angle bracket (supplied), and this did not fix the issue.
