Was next advised to install 2 angle brackets (both supplied), and have been encountering issues still with the unit. It will now still detect people 12+ feet away, but won't capture people walking up to the door.  I've videos recorded of me leaving my house, but then no video of me ever coming back in.  Not really good for a security camera if it can't capture someone at your front door. The secondary issue is that the materials used for the brackets (both angle and corner) are extremely cheap.  If you're not careful during installation, the head of the screw will eat right through the plastic.  I've had them replace 2 brackets that this happened to. I liked the video quality and ease of use of the unit when I got it, but it is just plagued with basic detection issues.  Not sure why it can't register distance, but it's not worth having a $200 unit that can only function as a video doorbell.
title: Motion detection is flawed, cheap materials used for accessories

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gary Caluducan
content: I cannot believe how much I actually am impressed with this device. I was weary at first because I have never purchased anything like this before. Also, I am terrible with all things handy so that at times stops me from taking leaps. However, honestly with installation it was a very simple task. The instruction videos are incredibly helpful and so is the customer service over the phone. I am not afraid to ask questions or for help. I was not on hold for long and everyone was easy to understand and resourceful. Quick story when I was replacing my existing doorbell and attaching the wires the screws on the back of the device are SUPER SMALL! I dropped one during the installation process and there are no extras provided so thats why I called. Customer service came to the rescue and sent me replacements immediately. Problem solved. Once installed our doorbell works great. I love the app and again just so impressed with the quality at the affordable price. I was shopping between this and nest security camera since I already am happy with my thermostat. However when price was similar it came down to wanting to be with a company fully dedicated to home security, not just trying to expand into the space. It also helps that its fully endorsed by amazon. Overall super happy with this device and I have been referring and showing everyone how cool it is. I already know we will be expanding our services with Ring in the future.
title: Impressive!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vrod-Mike
content: I've had this a few weeks now and I love it. I've seen people complain about having to pay for a service and I agree to a point. I have indoor cameras from a different manufacturer and they allow SD cards to store videos. Ring could have easily done this, but chose not to. The plans are very inexpensive though, so I don't mind. $100 for the year to cover all my devices isn't that bad. The video on this is great and the setup is super easy. You won't be disappointed
title: Love it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Seffnerman
content: I purchased this for the ability to connect with Alexa so my wife would be able to see who was at the door before answering it. As it turns out the initial connection goes to my smart phone creating a lag in time before getting to Alexa. However, the smart phone connection has worked in warning of a delivery for my wife's birthday while we were in GA for the weekend. I was able to call my neighbor to pick up the package for it's security. Overall I gave 5 stars but wish it could interface with Alexa better. I did take advantage of the cloud storage which is a great security tool also.
title: Great purchase

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ESW
content: This is an upgrade for my house as I purchased the original model last year. My first impression is the 1080 upgrade is drastically better than the older model. That alone made the change worth it. Secondly, I added two wedges for this one to point the camera down 10 degrees and my false motion alerts have stopped from the most part. The Ring Doorbell One without the wedge picked up just about every car that went down my street! Just checked my app and I have only gotten one alert today  in about 9 hours and it was a guy walking his dog past my house. I have also had the opportunity to direct deliveries to more secure locations other than my front porch via the intercom on about 4-5 occasions. Also purchased an additional Ring Doorbell 2 for the backdoor with works just as well, but does give me more notices from my large dog's activity. And I should mention that both doorbells are hardwired to my homes doorbell!
title: Works much better than the Ring Doorbell One.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eileen S
content: Got this for my husband for Christmas. He installed it and we both get a signal when there's motion at the door.  So far my favorite videos have been my husband holding up a bag full of goodies to the camera he'd just bought at our favorite local Korean market, and three nighttime videos proving that the local javelina population enjoys sashaying across the front porch and congregating in big groups in the front yard under a mesquite at night.  I do wish the night vision had more detail, but I understand the limitations, especially for the price.  I'm really glad we finally got one.
title: You'll be amazed at what goes on outside your door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sheila Reeves
content: We purchased the Ring 2 doorbell on the Black Friday sale in late Nov 2018.  It worked beautifully for about 3 months.  We did purchase the cloud subscription (which I didn’t realize was truly necessary for the device to be used effectively until after I purchased it). In early March of 2019, the device began to malfunction where it records back-to-back videos, nonstop.  It started this behavior at 4AM.  To date I have had 5 calls to tech help with each lasting a minimum of 1hr and each call with a different tech advisor -read lots of repetitive solution attempts. Some of which held no logic to me, I finally convinced them it was a defective device.  They offered to send me a replacement. I went with an upgraded model replacement that costs me $50 more.  I’m hoping it won’t be a short iced as the other. Functionality = great with subscription when the device works properly Longevity = poor Recommendation= not this model
title: Longevity is Poor

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Katreina
content: I was hesitant to get a Ring Doorbell, because of the bad reviews I've read here and there, but after speaking with a few co-workers that own it, they convinced me to get one. And I'm so happy I did, and wish I would have gotten it sooner. Delivery men no longer throw my packages over my front gate, they actually walk it up to the door. I have peace of mind actually seeing when they drop of my packages. I went out of town for a week and had a friend come by to feed my cat and water my plants, and got each and every notification of when they came through my front door. The night vision is pretty clear as well. All in all, I'm super happy about this purchase. One thing that's good to note is to move your wifi router closer if you're having connectivity issues.
title: I shouldn't have waited this long...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark L.
content: Only negative is it keeps being set off my large vehicles even tho I have set the range to 5 feet. The street is a good 30 feet from my front door. ** UPDATE as of 12/15/2018 ** As mentioned, doorbell has a distance flaw. By email I was given a code so the "community support agent " could access my doorbell video. GREAT ! Now just how does on do that ??? Rings " customer service" is among the very worst I have experienced, you cannot reach anyone that speaks English well enough to be understandable. And I am being kind, you actually cannot reach a human being on their telephone line nor their CHAT mode . You will sit there forever. Look elsewhere for a product that is actually supported , at least during the warranty period, this is not.
title: Works very well ... except when it doesn't

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: local208
content: When I set up my Ring Video Doorbell,  I had no idea what a powerful and convenient device it was, to be able to answer my front door from anywhere in the world that has access to the Internet.  It really is true that with a Ring Video Doorbell, "you're always home."  Even when I was in a foreign country, I was able to answer my mother's front door in the U.S. several times, and the people who rang the doorbell had no idea that I was actually thousands of miles away.  I did not particularly like to dismount the unit to charge it but the Ring Video Doorbell 2 solved that problem with the unit's new battery system which easily pops in and out.  I simply bought an extra/spare battery and as soon as I get the message (from RING) that the battery is running low, I charge the spare and and do the switch the next day.
title: Incredible Security, Incredible Peace of Mind!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LOU
content: UPDATED Original review: First, let me say that I have a Ring Pro and a Ring 2. In addition, I have 2 chimes. If you get a Ring, you will want the chime too. BUT there is a large caveat I'll discuss later. The Ring video seems to work well and if you did not know, you CANNOT get color any IR sensor used at night. The motion sensor and the bell work well especially through the chimes. The app (Apple) seems to work well though there is a small catch on using the setup that is included. And if I could stop here I would be giving a high rating. So what is wrong? - As someone else said, there is a time delay (yes, even if you store the image on the Ring cloud). And if you have phone in hand, the doorbell will ring long before the you check the motion. Even when you have your phone in your hand, when motion is detected at 2am, it hits you like the air raid siren going off on your first night in a battle zone, trying to get Ring to open. - you NEVER sit around with phone in hand. You are watching television or something else (Ring is NOT an app on your smart TV, Ring is not an app on your computer, Ring is not an app on your up-to-date auto, and Ring video does not pop up even on your closed iPhone.). That is why even though the Chime is great, there are many situations when it can be too late. - (picky) if you don't like the black & white Infrared, and therefore keep a light on outside, you will be awakened by a moth flying by, or a gecko staring into the lens. Even if the outdoor light is off, lighting flashes from a nearby storm may give you motion. - Setup. The app will walk you through all the steps you need to take. There are a few gotcha's. When it tells you to choose the network, does it mean your wifi network or the Ring doorbell network - no big thing. The problem is that almost every time you make some error (and I do) you have to go back to the beginning. And if you think the email address it wants is your wife's so you can share, but it turns out to be the owner's address, you are screwed. And if you become the shared user, there ain't nothing you can do. So, I worked out everything and finally got everything as I wanted it when I tried to add another Ring. That is when everything that could go wrong did go wrong. And now I am at square one. UPDATE: August 3, 2018 Thanks to Ring app updates, Ring support and Ring additions I updated my rating from 2 to 4 stars. Thanks to the app update, I no longer have to have my wife as an owner in order to allow her to see all or a few devices. I can set that up as the the owner myself and she (as a user) can see what she tells me to let her see. Ring support showed me how to make her a co-owner but now it is not necessary. Thanks. I was pleasantly surprised to find a Ring app for the PC/MAC. Works great and pops up as something happens. Wish Apple would let that happen with their iPhones. Two picky comments: can you put in the expand button that, say, youtube allows? This new app was in the app store, but it did not jump out at me (had to look around and then I lost sight of it and had to copy it from one computer to another). Can you get it so that it comes up in a "security camera" search? Um... can you get Comcast to add this app to Xfinity xi (hey, they have Facebook for instance)? Finally, the question of slowness. Ring support replied to my original review telling me I might need a WiFi upgrade. After some research (more devices on the WiFi means slower response) I am in the middle of upgrading my WiFi. THIS IS NOT EASY. On the other hand, I wonder if the number of users on the Ring cloud has any effect too. When two of us look on our phones to see what caused the alert, nothing is available. This happens on the cell also. It doesn't happen if we are both shopping on Amazon. With Amazon owning this company, will it now be on the Amazon cloud?
title: Great technology looking for smooth usefulness (update: and it is getting closer)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sara
content: Six months later...now it won’t store anything in the history. You have to subscribe to view them. It will only give you 5-7 seconds of live view after motion detection. So I go to click the links to subscribe to a plan. It then takes you to 10 different articles about subscribing with no obvious “click and subscribe” through the ring app. So I go to the ring website to find a plan to subscribe but the site seems to not be working. We also changed internet carriers since installing the ring doorbell and there is no where on the app to simply change the WiFi carrier...you have to physically take the doorbell off to change it. I had to YouTube it after searching through the ring app... In hindsight I would have shopped around more.
title: SIX MONTHS LATER

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LLB
content: I purchased three ring video doorbell 2’s 18 months ago.  When I first set them up I had issues with live view not connecting.  This occurred often on for a couple of months. After that everything was great and I could view the live view anytime I wanted. After 18 months  two of them stopped working and one of them would send a delayed motion detected alert exactly 4 times for each motion.  That is 4 app notifications and 4. chime notifications.  Customer service suggested I delete the app and reinstall. It worked. I was told it’s a good idea to do this monthly to ensure I have the latest version. All is well for now. Very good customer service.
title: Works great when it works. When it doesn’t work customer service is good.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ZackL
content: It works ok as a doorbell (as long as you have a device that it is connected to since it does not come with any indoor chime). The two way communication feature is far beyond useless. I cannot hear them at all. The motion sensor works fine in terms of distance, but the alert does not occur until the person is already at the door (and our walk way is about 25 feet long leading up to the door.). The app is glitchy at best and takes so long to get the video feed that if someone is delivering a package, they have dropped it and left before I can see video. Worse yet, half the time I try to view it in real time, I can't an by the time the video is available, it is minutes after the fact.
title: Better than nothing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tootsie
content: Very easy set up, everything in layman's terms to understand. Wonderful personalized customer service, if needed. Truly will answer any question that you might have about the product. I haven't dealt with such wonderful customer service people who are not only friendly, but truly accommodating… It's been years! Companies ought to take lessons from them. My Ring 2 worked right off the bat!  Still playing around with some distance adjusting, which is very very easy to do. Just making sure I'm not picking up traffic going by the house, but I'm having fun playing with this…Even though it's not a toy...well...it's a big kids toy!  It really is nice to just sit in the backyard and relax and know that the mail has arrived, or packages are being delivered in the front of the house; and... then I can tell solicitors to please leave!
title: Best purchase I've made in years!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DougA
content: This video doorbell was easy to install by connecting to the existing doorbell wires.  It is battery operated, but connecting the wires keeps it constantly recharged.  My busy family is always coming/going and the kids play on the front porch, so I can see the battery level go up/down.  After a string of particularly active days, the battery can get down to 50%, but it does recharge.  We haven't caught anyone doing anything nefarious on our property, and I hope I never do, but it feels good to know that I have this in place in case something were to happen.  The app is intuitive and easy to use.  Some have complained about having to have a cloud subscription to store videos but I think that is a good thing.  I can access those videos anywhere, anytime and the cost is minimal ($3 month).  This was definitely a good purchase.
title: Easy and intuitive to install and operate

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mousepotato
content: As I have arthritis pretty bad I can use the camera on this to see who is at the door without getting up. And the speaker to tell the unwanted solicitors “not interested”. Any time there is motion near this Ring” it chimes on your cell phone. As well it features any unwanted activity in your neighborhood such as theft, assault etc that others using this device post. I hooked up with my neighbor so he can “watch” my house when I’m gone. You will have to tweak the motion sensor to the sensitivity you want. I can find nothing negative to say about this product and highly recommend.
title: A must have device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Wallace N. Shaunfield
content: I had high hopes for the Ring 2 Doorbell. I had even planned to eventually go to the Ring Security system. However, I and the Ring Support could never get the doorbell to work as intended. First, the good things: The notification of someone at the door was very fast, both from the motion sensor and the push of the button, the picture was great and had a nice wide angle, the video resolution was good but not good enough to read a car license plat at 25 feet. Now the problems: first the audio is so low that it is essentially impossible to hear the visitor nor can the visitor hear the person inside. Second, when someone is detected at the door, the notification screen pops up giving you a chance to either answer the door or not. The problem is that pop up only last 4 to 5 seconds; not enough time pick up the phone and respond. Ring Support said to just load the Ring app and go into Live mode. That takes too much time. Furthermore, when you go into Live mode it only takes effect after next button press. Either this product was brought to market before it was read or the support group cannot really support the product. My recommendation is to wait until this product is ready.
title: Product does not work as intended.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SassyLassie
content: Love the Ring! Syncs with my echo dot. I can officially be more antisocial then I was before. Gone are the days where I sneak peak out a window to see if I’m ignoring whoever is trying to come over unannounced. This is a no pop ups type house. No longer to I have to fear the sweet lady Jehovah witnesses. Sweet as pie but I’m good. Or how bout those solar panel dudes or Anderson window peeps.... Ain’t interested buddy! So if you a recluse who hates people in altogether sense buy this. Never again will you have to deal with anyone who approaches your house.
title: Upping my antisocial lifestyle

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eleah
content: When first set up the signal struggled with live viewing. I bought a wifi signal booster (not the ring once yet as I wanted to try boosting it to my office shed for my PC and the ring that's set up on it as well, if possible)  I need to try live again now that the booster is set up... plan to update asap I do wish we could somehow tell it as we move around that it's just us.. so it isn't constantly activating when busy in the area. Lol
title: Great to know if someone's in our yard we can see them..

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Matt
content: After jumping through all the required hoops, the overall picture from the RING doorbell is worthless.  I have a porch roof, as most people do, over my door.  The RING doorbell automatically exposes for the daylight behind the person at the door resulting in the person at the door being a silhouette, black, no features.  HDR mode didn't not help this.  I was on the phone with customer service for over an hour resetting the RING all over again.  Apparently, they have a way to adjust exposure on THEIR end, but the image stayed exactly the same when we finished.  While I was on hold (numerous times) I went on-line to find a solution.  There were complaints to RING about this very issue THREE YEARS ago and their response was "a solution is coming soon".  I guess if you're selling enough of these doorbells, it doesn't matter if it works properly, they fly off the shelves anyway.  So RING, if you're reading this, a simple firmware update can fix this.  Give the consumer the ability to adjust the exposure themselves on the app.  A simple slider will work. Fix it!
title: NO EXPOSURE ADJUSTMENT

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Erica B
content: Like many other users have stated this is an amazing product but it is extremely misadvertised. Yes we will be breaking down and paying at least $3 a month for basic services for this product, but that is only because it is entirely useless without it. This is essentially a $200 doorbell, and that is exactly all unless you plan to spend an additional $3-$10 a month for it to be your home security service. I also got the blink indoor outdoor camera at the same time and I must say, it stores video on a cloud without any subscription and it does everything the ring out to do (aside from include a doorbell), and I got mine for $49 a piece on cyber Monday. Extremely disappointed with ring, and a firm believer that if they don’t rectify their business plan - they will ultimately fail, and fail hard.
title: Doesn’t work without subscription, as implied it should

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Thomas Jefferson
content: This is one of the finest products I've purchased in a long time.  Not only is the product well designed but the instructions and tools provided for installing this doorbell blew me away.  They thought of every contingency right down to protective packaging so that the product arrives in pristine condition.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone concerned about security at their front door.  I had to contact their customer service for help and they were incredibly helpful and friendly with a strong customer focus.
title: High quality and outstanding design.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tami Sauerman
content: I have only had this Ring 2 for about a week, so still working it out. Install was very frustrating, paperwork accompanying item was vague, I had to call support when I had unresolvable issue with motion detection, which they did fix. It does alert to motion and bell rings, but the video can be choppy not smooth and with a ring there is a slight delay so your response may be too long for someone to wait around for the answer. That said, it does alert, which is what I wanted.  I've heard there is poor quality and issue with the unit placed in the sun and since my front door faces west, we will see what happens in summer. It helps with package delivery so the packages don't sit on the porch without my knowledge and it gives me some peace of mind someone is on my porch.
title: Does what I need it to do, mostly

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Keith C
content: Upfront, my number one reason for the low rating is the microphone. It does not work (out of the box. Unfortunately I did not realize this for months since I didn't use it much. So I looked up online to see if it was something I'd done wrong in the installation. NOPE! Plenty of complaints about it online. The mic is trash which makes the whole device useless because when people ring my bell, they can't hear me talk to them. The subscription was expected so not sure why people complained about that. The response time for motion triggers? Not great but not terrible either. Picks it up just fine but if you try to view the alert on your phone as soon as it goes off, you won't see anything. Have to wait. Pretty good when it comes to adjust motion sensing area. Pretty good camera though. If you have an Alexa speaker, it will announce doorbell presses.  I would never buy this model for anyone. I don't see the Pro as having these mic issues but after having bought this, I'm skeptical of all Ring Doorbells.
title: I certainly expected more

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: UK
content: It worked very well for the first two weeks (that’s while you have the free trial of video recording). Third week in and the battery dies - this is even after reducing the range of detection. The battery charge is advertised to last up to 6 months, but that’s not the case with our doorbell. My biggest issue is that I can seem to activate ‘live viewing’ on its app. This doorbell is not working for us and I would NOT recommend it to any other buyers.
title: Not as advertised. Can’t activate ‘live viewing’.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: South LA
content: This worked out great.  It connected easily to the home doorbell system.  The only negative was that it took forever to get the battery initially charged.  Once installed, I've added RING APP to my iPhone and iPad.  Notice if someone walks up and then walks away and then returns to the front door shortly there after, it doesn't pick up the second motion.  Don't really know how much delay after one signal sent (recorded) before it will "allow" another signal to be sent (recorded).  The video/sound is only 30 Seconds in length.  With was a bit longer.
title: Works great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: king_is300
content: So idk whats wrong with my ring, but after looking through the camera the picture gets super fussy(as shown in the picture i provided). Also the motion detection sucks. I have it on the highest sensitivity and it dont pick up the motion till someomes literally infront the camera. Also my battery when charging it doesn't indicate that its charging but changing from the green light to orange, then when fully charge back to green. It says it automatically updates by itself but not sure it it has updated. Im going to call customer service and see what they say hopefully i can get this figured out, if not ill look into another brand video camera. When i first got it, it was working great just startin going down hill since.
title: My experience with the ring

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AHD
content: Bought this assuming it works as most other companies in this space do. Provide some amount of free storage [either for 24 hrs or a certain size of data]. I was wrong, looks like I need to pay for the basic plan to make this item function as intended. Else its a glorified $200 doorbell. Arlo provides 7 days of free storage and has products that are cheaper as well and well built. Looks like they are releasing a door bell as well. So going to return this doorbell and get that. Wish ring listens to its customers and provides atleast a day or 3 worth of free storage online to make this product competitive.
title: Wanted to like it but the subscription plan made it hard to justify the purchase.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Storky
content: Update on this review.  I believe it is working now.  I think the problem is my wifi.  Tried a WiFi extender after reading bad reviews on getting the Ring Chime Extender.  It didn't work at all, so I returned it.  It also won't work with my Echo Dots.  Alexa can't seem to find it after I thought she had discovered it.  Update here:  last night Alexa announced there was motion at the front door when my husband came around there weedeating.  So I am changing my review.  Alexa finally found Ring.  Or perhaps my internet provider has intermittent signals.  I will be contacting them today .  I am paying for very fast internet, and my house is small.  No reason I shouldn't be able to get adequate wifi to my front door, which is half the length of my house from the router.
title: Updated review-seems to be working now!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J
content: The RING2 doorbell was easy to mount and angle as several different positions were tried and finalized. Setup was easy. Wi-Fi connectivity is constant. I connected it to the our existing 16VAC XFMER and Multiple Tone Digital Chime Box and used the diode that was supplied and it works good as a manual door bell button. I have adjusted the settings in every possible configuration for optimal motion detection - There is none optimal. Getting used to its intermittence was difficult at first, now we just ignore it or check our phones for fun. It works like a Cat and catches only what it wants and when it wants to. It can not be depended on. Passing vehicles, depending on the Suns position, trigger the motion sensor often. But don't let a UPS or Fedex delivery drop a package on the front door step and expect to be notified, maybe and maybe not. If the doorbell button is actually pushed the RING2 will actually notify us. The only way to really know if a package was delivered is to get it from the front porch when seen in person. We have a multiple camera Security DVR system that we have rewound and watched multiple deliveries where the person is right in front of the door bell and the RING2 never detects anything. I Definitely DO NOT Recommend - Big$$ waste of money - I would return it except it looks Good and works sometimes and keeps us busy checking our phones. Because of the trouble of demounting, patching holes, reconnecting old door bell and submitting a return, packing and taking to a UPS office is why it remains. Recommendations, buy for a new toy Not a Security device.
title: Intermittent - RING2 Doorbell is the Wrong name - Should be WRONG2 Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Donn B.
content: I do like the unit. I bought it some 2 years ago and did not install until a month ago, just too busy and did not have a smart phone until 2 months ago. The setup is fairly simple, but DO READ prior to starting install  It will help a lot when you get to a point and you are not sure what option or answer to choose. (yup, I thought I was smarter and didn't "need no help!, wrong again) the only issue I have is that the sound is "scratchy" might just be the wind. Still a great tool, I work in my basement shop and lost my legs and have been rehabilitating to walk on artificial legs, there is no way if my doorbell ring and I am work I won't hear it and cannot move quickly to get to the door. This is a life saver for me. Thank you
title: read the setup guides carefully

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Me
content: The Ring Video Doorbell 2 gives me peace of mind whether I’m home or away. The installation is free with the purchase. After my first installation appointment, I realized that it wasn’t the best spot because it was facing my neighbor’s door and I didn’t want to invade their privacy. I called Amazon and had no problem having them send someone again to move it for me.  The battery life is great, I had the doorbell indoors for about a week before the installation, with constant traffic then outdoors with less traffic, two weeks later the battery was at 80%. Left outdoors, it will most likely last for three months. I bought a spare battery just so I would not stay without the doorbell for a day when it dies. It takes about 7h to charge. The image quality is perfect. I snooze motion alerts during the day so as not to be alerted of my neighbors’ moves, that way I’m only notified when someone rings the doorbell. Ring gives me the extra peace of mind needed to sleep well. It comes with a lifetime theft warranty. If your doorbell is stolen and caught on camera, which it will as long as the battery is charged, Ring will replace it for free. I’m very satisfied with the product and service.
title: The peace of mind provided by Ring is priceless.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NB
content: The good: It works and doesn't freezes up like the Ring pro did all the time. If the power goes out it and you have a UPS on your wifi device, then you can still able to see people. The bad: This thing is a lot bigger than the Ring pro. The shame on you thing: I order this because the Ring Pro kept freezing up on me even though the device show power and wifi status as being good all the time. I find it funny that Amazon is not allowing me to put a 2 star review on the ring pro but yet I am able to give a 4-star review on the Ring 2.  The message they give me when I tried to give the Ring pro a 2 star was "Sorry, we are unable to accept your review of this product. This product currently has limitations on submitting reviews. There can be a number of reasons for this, including unusual reviewing activity."
title: Works pretty good for me.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Behr
content: In this day, to receive product instructions and steps that are double checked, accurately labeled, correctly outlined and that even provide humorous tips to prevent problems, is very impressive.  These made the install process quick and trouble free.  They even included the masonry bit for installing in stone.  Device setup was easy and the associated apps installed easily on both Android and iOS devices.
title: Wow...I'm impressed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jack
content: This is the only video doorbell that's battery operated  - which you need if your current doorbell is not wired and wiring is not possible.  I returned the first, but purchased again due to no alternatives.  I've been on with technical support multiple times, and they can't get the in-house audio working (video feed works ok) - and continue to blame my home network - when all other google home products work just fine.  Since i installed it and it does server the basic purpose, i'm keeping it after a close decision.  If there were any other alternatives, i would buy in an instant and throw the Ring in the dustbin.
title: Not ready for prime time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hernan
content: Very nice camera. Night vision is pretty good. The only issue is that the WiFi is 2.5 so it might be a little slow. But I have both 5 g where I have most of my devices. It sinks well well with Alexa show and other devices that you connect to. My wife is currently out of the country and she was able to see me going out the door getting mail. I have not used it yet with food delivery or palate delivery. Will update my review when that happens.
title: Excellent camera lags slightly

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LMR
content: I've been using the Ring Bell for several months now and do not recommend.  First, the battery life is poor and requires recharging every two weeks or less.  Second, the response is very slow, so if the doorbell is rung, it can take up to a minute to view who is there.  Third, and most significantly, I have had packages placed at the door, and Ring did not record it.  Yet, it records passing cars on the street, but not when someone parks directly in front of the house.  The motion algorithm is poorly designed.  Fourth, it has no free feature for saving videos, so if you don't pay, you lose all functionality except for the doorbell function.  On the other hand, I have two Nest cams that I use indoors and out, which rarely miss events, have faster response time, send emails, have free video saving, and better detection algorithms.  Ring is definitely a poorly designed product and I will replace it.
title: Slow response, misses key events, false positives, poor battery life

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike C.
content: Great product and like that it lets us know when there is movement and/or someone at the door.  The only down side is the amount of time i takes to view the camera image.  When someone pushes the door bell it takes to long (for me) to open the app and do a live connection.  When movement is detected it takes around 45 seconds too see the video clip to see what activated it.  As strictly a door bell with two way communication it is great.  For a security camera, 45 seconds is a long time to see what was moving outside the door.  This, in my mind, does not replace a security camera.
title: Delay in seeing video

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Evan Cervantes
content: This doorbell rarely works for me. The doorbell is has been installed for 3 days, and it is yet to work the way it is advertised. I don't know if it's a faulty device, or it always works like this, but: I cannot connect to Live View (the router is less than 10' from the doorbell, my speeds are incredible (450mb down, and 40mb up), and I'm definitely connected. If you ring the Doorbell, there's a 3-5sec delay before the chime inside goes off (it's about 15' from the doorbell). The motion detection doesn't work. And yes, I have the parameters selected within the app to allow for it despite the battery usage.
title: Works rarely, and usually only after I ring it first in the morning to "warm it up"

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Steveco52
content: I had some issues after first installing this devise, which was easy, by the way. I wasn’t getting alerted on my cell phone when the door bell rang. After contacting customer service, a tech walked me through getting the issue resolved. The only negative thing is that in the app, there no way to “select all” captured videos for easy deletion. You must select each one individually in order to delete it. This takes considerable time, as there are on the average, 30 videos a day. If you forget a couple days, you’re looking at scores of motion detector videos to delete.
title: App needs work...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bill Carbin
content: We got Ring 2 doorbells for our back and front doors. We really like the ability to see who’s at our door both remotely and even when we’re in the house. We had a couple guys come and knock on the door and we could hear one of them say under his breath “Ring” we think they were casing our house and the Ring changed their minds. I think it would be a better device if you could set the length of time it records when motion is detected - or better yet an option to record until motion stops. As it is you get a 30 second snapshot and you can choose to view “Live” but it doesn’t record. Motion detection can be a bit tricky to set to your liking. All said Ring 2 Doorbell has a great picture both day and night and is a worthwhile investment for your home security.
title: Motion Detection is limited to 30 second events.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Flyers fan
content: This ring doorbell is very disappointing.  we've had it for 9 months and it's reliability leaves a lot to be desired. 1) Motion detection is awful. Many false positives from street traffic over 100 ft away and down a hill. Then it misses motion right in front of it, deliveries on the door step often don't trigger. 2) Have tried all of the configuration options to optimize detection, but nothing seems to improve it. Sometimes the configuration changes don't take.  Go back into a setting and it is back to where it was before the change. 3) Slow response trouble connecting from the app.  App response is very weak, often not able to connect. As noted by other users not on the subscription, if it does connect, it is too slow to respond to the motion or ring. Have contacted support to improve performance, but not real help. It does ring as a doorbell, but that just makes it a way over priced doorbell.
title: Very Disappointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rainbows
content: Overall great doorbell. We have it paired with Alexa, and Alexa’s speaker is hooked up to our BT sound bar, so no problems hearing the alerts/chimes with motion or when bell pushed (for our hearing impaired family members). The range for motion detection has been hit or miss. We often will get alerts in the middle of the night for insects or something being near the doorbell. Our free trial subscription just ended, so while I miss being able to look back at the day, it does work fine for live feed and answering the bell. When at work I sometimes will tap in just to see if anything’s going on. Overall good buy, especially with the Black Friday deals!!
title: Does the job!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RA
content: In my experience, the Ring 2 doorbell Is a much better constructed doorbell compared to the Ring Doorbell for $99.00. I have a hardwired application. The Ring 2 was $152.00 and worth the extra costs. It comes with several wedge brackets, two push-button cover plates and the mounting screws. The Ring doorbell has a cheesy back mounting bracket, with cheesy hanger tabs, that needs to be perfectly mounted to a very hard and to a very flat surface. If not, the Ring will not make contact with the flimsy contact tabs on the back of the Ring doorbell. I had three of the Ring doorbells before finally getting the Ring 2. The Ring 2 doorbell battery is easily removed and I purchased a extra battery, to change out, when needed.
title: Invest in the RIng 2 Doorbell, not the RIng Doorbell for $99.00

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Geek-wannabe
content: The Ring doorbell looks nice but has not worked properly since we purchased it! The doorbell randomly loses connection to our WiFi and randomly finds it. The video freezes and many times is so slow that it does not even catch the motion on camera. We know someone came to the door because a package was left and we heard the chime but the camera never caught them coming or going. We hardwired it and it worked fairly well for almost two months but then it stopped using that connection and now only recognizes and works off the battery. Very frustrating! The quality regressed again and we are back to an unreliable, inconsistent video doorbell. Our video quality could not be used to identify and/or arrest an intruder. I have to say that we have a Ring Spotlight in our backyard that works perfectly with excellent video quality and is on the same WiFi network and is hardwired as well. No complaints there. Customer assistance has yet to respond to my many complaints other than send me multiple emails saying they’re sorry. The one phone call took about 30-minutes of troubleshooting which accomplished nothing and got disconnected without resolution and no way to contact the same technician to resume. Update: Ring customer service is replacing our Ring doorbell 2 due to the number of issues. They were able to log into my account and see the distorted videos and review the previous complaints.
title: Updated: Ring Doorbell does not consistently recognize and record activity!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PRKilduff
content: Great choice for homes without prewired doorbells. App works great! Alexa ready! Mostly use this for doorbell feature but the motion detector is an added bonus. Volume at doorbell isn't that great. I can hear the person at the door but they have a hard time hearing me. Also the cost of cloud storage is rediculious. The devs should allow the user to save video on an external hard drive that is connected to WiFi network.
title: Great doorbell! Low volume sound at device.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: buyer_money
content: The product works well in a perfect world. But the product is so flimsy and the brackets provided are so inferior that the screws go right through the plastic brackets.  I spoiled couple of bracket holes that I had to change my orientation and ended up with holes all over my stucco. Btw I also tried to hookup a 16v ac transformer but the power didn’t show in this unit. So I guess I have to rely on battery all the time? That is a major no no! My other friends have hello doorbell and they Seem to be better built /durable.
title: Good tech but flimsy built

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rocky Mtn Brian
content: I was excited to try this product to add a bit of safety to our front porch. But even putting the motion sensitivity at the lowest setting many times when a car drives by it sets the thing off. After emailing with customer support, they are solution to me was for me to buy the more expensive pro model. This just seems so absurd because my house is not that close to the street. I really wish they made a better quality product instead of trying to upset you. It was also going to be challenging to hardwire into my existing doorbell, so now Ring doesn’t actually “ring” inside, I’d have to have an Echo snooping on me to ring for me. No thanks, I am returning it.
title: Motion detection too sensitive - returning it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: E_Dogg
content: I'm giving the Ring 1-star because the subscription fee feels dirty, dangling just above bait-and-switch. Yes, the basic fee is cheap but is principally wrong. I have a problem in general about paying a monthly fee to "unlock" and "maintain" a standard feature-set that is the intrinsic value and the purpose for buying in the first place. My fear is that this subscription fee model for usability is being abused and headed the wrong directly. What's next? Smart phones that go dumb without a "subscription", that is you lose almost the entire feature set after 30-days? Or a car with great fuel economy that only lasts 30-days unless you pay a monthly subscription.
title: Subscription Fee feels dirty. It blurs the line between initial value and bait-&-switch

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: anonymous_
content: I would NOT buy this new for $200. The video quality is terrible and does not scale up well. Its terrible that it does not have an SD slot for 24/7 recording. It only records once it detects motion. But the motion zone’s are very limited for customization. It misses a huge chunk of the left and right side of my front yard. It takes insanely long to start viewing the camera when I get the motion notification. It takes 15 seconds to get to live view, which is plenty of time for package theft. I bought it used for $80, so that was acceptable. I would have returned this immediately for $200. Buying this to protect against package theft is a no go.
title: Horrible

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: blessedbliss
content: Love the concept & are grateful to have this doorbell. But adjusting the motion sensor to not pick up the road, but pick up our porch has never been perfect. WiFi is also an issue...if someone rings the door or you get an alert that someone is there, when you open the app to see who it is, it’s not available yet...takes a bit. When you watch recording, the person is already upon your door or beginning to leave before the recording starts. Would also like there to be a setting for recording animals who come upon the porch if we choose.
title: Great concept

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: K Lamel
content: Preface: I have worked in the IT field for decades and have no issues with our Nest cam setups. I must have tied to get this connected to my WiFi 100x! I tried everything they listed to try from rebooting my wireless to a hard reset on the Ring.  I disabled everything else around means tried to set it up right next to the router.  Called customer service and the representative could not understand me as she barely spoke English (which was the option I had chosen).  I spelled out my email 5x and she still did not understand, it was very frustrating.  Packing it up and sending it back.
title: Could Not Get Set up/Could not Understand Technician

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jala
content: These are the times we live in.  Everyone needs extra security, and this really helps. I gave one to a friend that lives alone.  Can't imagine her going home alone without it. Also, it is very convenient.  I no longer have to face solicitors, and I can see anyone that comes to the door before I open it.  I can also see when my packages are delivered. The only problems: 1) you have to pay for monthly subscription to keep videos, and 2) we had to by the angle bracket to point the camera toward the entry (otherwise you can't see the person at the door).
title: Cant' live without it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TheEvan
content: I have tried every wireless and wired video doorbell under the sun. Always problems, especially network controlled doorbells. The ring is no exception. It comes with about 20 screws for all different types of configurations which is confusing as hell, even though they label them. What they do not tell you is that if you are hooking this doorbell up to a previous doorbell AC for consistent power YOU MUST order a resistor separately. It requires a 50 watt, 25 ohm resistor or the doorbell will not function properly.  It DOES NOT come with the resistor. You can order it through amazon for about 7 bucks but still a pain.
title: Never had good luck with these

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AReyOfSunshine
content: I originally bought this for my husband for Christmas because he loves new tech toys. I was a little indifferent about getting it installed on our house, but now that we've had it for a few months I love it. We have had quite a few packages stolen in our neighborhood and this doorbell helps me to feel somewhat better about packages that are left on my porch. We've also caught several cars going by so this also doubles as a camera. I love the other features that come with the app as well. I love getting notifications about things going on in our neighborhood and area because I feel as though all of us together help to catch the bad guys. It's really neat that our local police department also posts things and gives a direct means of helping to solve real cases. Best purchase ever, and husband also loved it too!
title: The doorbell I didn't know I needed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: bmm
content: I really like this door bell. The price is high but it does everything they claim and it does it well. It was very easy to set up. The hardest part was getting four screws into the brick wall outside my door but that just required some muscle from my son. I hope to get another one on my back door next time they are on sale.  It’s a great addition to my old but standard security system without spending a huge amount of money.
title: Does everything they say

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DesertScottAZ
content: All of the software is really buggy (both IOS and Android). Requiring a battery is silly. The batteries cost too much. The only reason I give it 3 stars is because it seems to function okay. If it were wired, it could do a trigger like 1-2 seconds /before/ motion and during and after instead of at trigger and however long after. ZERO usable or common sense integration with sonos, alexa, google home, etc. It seems like they're blocking things to sell more of their hardware. I don't need nor do I want a chime next to every echo but there's no chime function from the ring to echo devices. I also don't want tied to my mobile or tablet as I go about my life in my home to be alerted of someone at my house. Adjusted from 3 to 2 stars. The motion sensor only works sometimes. Update. It's trash for motion and security. The motion doesn't work 90% of the time. I don't recommend it to anyone. Look for something else.
title: SOOOOO frustrating.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: M.B.
content: UPDATE: THIS PRODUCT IS HORRIBLE...I'VE HAD IT FOR ABOUT 6 MONTHS.  I WISH I COULD RETURN IT.  RECENTLY, THE DEVICE BOOTS ME OUT AND I HAVE TO KEEP SIGNING BACK INTO THE APP.  The wifi signal connection and some times poor wifi connection.  I purchased the boost wifi device and see how that works and I've seen NO improvement.  I'm disappointed that the the solar power that you can buy for Ring 2 will NOT work if you have a corner kit...super design flaw.  Now I'll probably end up spending more money on another battery.  Does not seem to be HD because sometime times have horrible pixelization issues, sometimes video recording is completely white and sometimes completely black; solar charger/solar mount will not work if you have angle bracket attached to the device.  The battery at best lasts about 3 months.  Buy a spare battery.  RING PREVENTS YOU FROM POSTING ANY NEGATIVE COMMENTS ABOUT THEIR PRODUCT ON THE COMMUNITY "NEIGHBOR" CHAT!!!  VERY SNEAKY OF THEM!
title: Poor Design, Very Disappointing, Buyer Beware, Borderline Worthless, Frustrating Device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark 321
content: Let me start by saying, I probably received a defective item. It could not detect motion beyond 4 feet. Made several phone calls to Ring support (highest recommendation to Ring support! They are great!), we tried trouble shooting several options, finally Ring said item is probably defective and to return it. Ring did say this was the first he encountered this particular issue being caused by a defective device. I returned item and replaced it with a Ring Spot Light Cam. Few things worth noting about Ring. There are other products out there of equal quality and lower price that do almost everything Ring does. The one feature they don't offer is ability to record events and save them (this is a paid service offered by Ring for either $36 year for one device or $100 year for unlimited devices). This ability to record and save events is an necessary evil. I've learned it's great being able to instantly view events live as they happen, but that is not always an option. Ring, and other companies, are limited by your cell phone ability to get good reception to transmit the quantity of data necessary to view events live as they happen. If you are in a poor or dead cell reception area, you cannot view events live (true for Ring and all companies offering the same service). Hence, why the ability to record and save events for later viewing is a necessity if security is important. To the best of my knowledge, Ring is only company offering this option, or only company offering this option at an affordable price with reliable and quality platform. As for their products. They come very nicely packaged. Reality is, their quality is no different than most of the high end motion/security lights/cameras offered on the consumer market. What this means is they work good enough, but don't expect perfection. You MUST have decent wifi and the security devices need to be at closer range than many other wifi enable products due to the fact you need minimum 2 Mb speed with a good RSSI strength for the items to function as advertised. Don't believe the speeds you internet provider tells you they are providing, most of them lie. They might say you have 50 Mbs, reality is you are probably downloading at 4-5 Mbs. Internet providers use unrealistic benchmarks tested through a hardwire connection to provide their advertised speeds. Reality is, most consumers are using WiFi connection downloading data more demanding then the benchmarks. My point, if your residence has 10 Mbs speed and you are already using several devices on that wifi, check your speed first. If you do not have good wifi, these Ring devices will never work to expectations. Another thing, avoid buying battery operated devices if the device will be in an area that has lots of traffic. My kids going in and out the front door drained the battery down in one week. You cannot turn off these devices through the app, you can only change the settings to not sense motion, which is a pain. I bought some wifi smart outlets to flick the Ring devices on and off as needed. With all that being said, in my opinion Ring is the best option out there. Their customer service support is excellent, which is reason enough to choose Ring. The products as good as any other company out there. Setting up the sensitivity and zones on the devices might be a little challenging at first, as the zones are only approximate as is the sensitivity. Another little tidbit that might be of interest. The motion devices need motion to occur for a second or two. So if someone runs or walks past a motion zone, there is a possibility it might not be detected. Be aware of this when testing your motion areas, if you walk by an entrance way quickly that is supposedly being protected, it may not sense you unless you actually stand there for a second or two. It tends to be hit or miss. Overall, Ring devices (with exception of doorbell which I cannot recommend) are good at what they do. You can communicate through it, turn lights on and off through it, activate/deactivate siren at will, zoom in and limited panning (camera doesn't actually move but you can move within the viewing area). These devices do have very wide and large viewing areas, the advertised viewing areas are accurate. Again, I would recommend a wired spot light cam instead of the doorbell (it has better video quality, same communication ability, plus a light and siren option), both are same price. Overall, Ring is the best option out there and has excellent customer support backing their products. I would recommend Ring above most others.
title: Ring is best option available for certain needs, this particular item did not meet expectations

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Krista H
content: I purchased the Ring II for an added layer of security at our new house. We didn’t have any wiring to support a wired version, so this was the next logical solution. I had some issues with product support, but ring was quick to reach out and work with me to troubleshoot the problems. I wanted more advanced capabilities like my floodlight (zones, better detection, etc) and ring was happy to exchange this for a Ring Pro. Support issues aside, be careful if your door faces a busy street or has lots of foot traffic. You will need to install a wedge kit and keep tweaking the settings until the “false positives” stop. This wasn’t the doorbell for me, but Ring stands behind their product to make sure customers are satisfied.
title: Good for certain applications

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jpeters1
content: I have this installed correctly, to power.  I followed everything RING says about positioning but this this still lags on recordings.  I can park, and walk 20 feet toward the front door before it begins to record.  It's unacceptable frankly.  There are time when I can leave the house, pass the RING, and it never ever record me at all.  Doesn't this defeat the purpose?  I want something that is on the second something is in the field of view. This delay/lag issue is a know problem, just research it before buying.  BTW, my firmware is up to date also.
title: Hard-wired and it STILL has a bad delay

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: melvin a.
content: I bought this to help deter the multiple packages being stolen and boy am I disappointed. The time it takes to trigger the record, the person is gone or walking away. It’s great for people that stay still. But how many thieves really like posing for photos?  Second issue is that on a second ring doorbell I bought, it constantly drops connection for only being about 25 feet away from the router. I have the Frontier router and it seems fine for all my other devices around the house, some further. But for some reason this camera has issues with 25 feet. Past my 30 return window so I guess I’m out of luck.
title: Bad decision. You might have better luck.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bluzeman
content: Update 1/8/2019 I have upgraded this to 3 stars for the moment.  After speaking to both Michelle and Frank on Sunday, some of the issues have been resolved.  Both were very helpful and very surprised at how I was treated the previous day by support. If I can resolve all of the issues, I will raise this to 5 stars, as the device is good when it works. Audio is so horrible you can't even understand it most of the time.  I've been on the phone 3 times to tech support.  Last call I even talked to a supervisor.  Video pixelates, sometimes looks like a photographic negative, other times nothing but a black screen.  I have a tri-band router that is literally 5 steps away from the front door, yet they tell me it's my wifi causing the problem.  2 support people tell me my RSSI is very good, third says it's bad.  Even though their own app says the RSSI reading is better than most. Final straw came today.  In regards to the audio, for 3 weeks that I've had it the person on the outside has never been able to hear anything but static.  Today while I had support on the phone it was understandable for the first time since I've had the thing but the audio quality was still terrible and staticky.  The support person told me that's what it's supposed to sound like.  OK, even so, it's the first time it's even been understandable. Don't buy this garbage.  Not worth 2 dollars, much less 200.
title: 0 stars to support

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: USFBulls33
content: Pointed directly from our door to the driveway and it doesn't pick up the motion of our vehicles coming and going despite being well within the cone of "customization" for motion detection. It also does not make a doorbell sound through the echo dots or our main Gen 2 echo. Only rings through the phones. After doing research I found that it requires a echo spot or show to hear the doorbell. I had experience with the pro and it works fine through the Gen 1 and the dots so I figured this would also... I was wrong...
title: Kinda works

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: tom
content: Was a bit tough at first but support was very good. Learned I needed top quality wifi strength and speed to get the reality of what this little unit was really able to do. After working through it's and my bugs using support and my brain I am amazed. It is what it says it is and I mean that. It does a super busy job perfectly and after a week battery life looks great. I feel much better after a theft having this and that my 2 little boys are safer with it being my eyes while i'm away. I'm telling you, I needed this gadget and it is worth the cost and the hassle to give it what it needs-to date. Thank you amazon and ring, with this and my constitutional rights I feel much more confident I can keep up with the bad trying to come into my home.
title: If your a little bit savy with things like this, it's an excellent product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: chylee correia
content: I really was excited for this purchase! It cannot be installed in my house! My router cannot me moved and is in the room closest to my front door in a small 800sqft apartment. I need this for the side door. It wouldn’t connect so i bought the WiFi exntender. It still won’t connect!!!!! As soo as i shut the apartment door it drops the connection. What a waste!!!
title: Paid a lot of money for nothing!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ben1955r
content: I live in a city center with all sorts of transients passing my home day and night, so I do need to know if someone is on my porch or at my door.  This product lets me know that fact by detecting motion and announcing it over Alexa, but by the time I get my phone powered up and the app running, it is way too late.  I've re-installed my old door camera which does not record but allows me to see who is there within seconds, not several minutes.  Since I did not subscribe to the Nest Aware program, the product does not record alerts......therefore it is a very expensive doorbell.  Unless you're wanting a monthly payment and you always have your cell phone in hand and activated......don't waste your money.
title: Worthless unless you pay a monthly fee.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Missy M.
content: I love the ring video 2. I have it in the most active setting for movement which means it detects everything and it was installed over 2 weeks ago and the battery is going strong. I will prob adjust the settings because most of my alerts are drive byes. I love knowing that if anyone approaches the front door I will know-so long as I have Internet. So far it’s been pretty boring which is a good thing! But what is nice is I know exactly when a package arrives and if I’m not home I can ask a neighbor to grab it for me.
title: Feel safer

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Movie Maker (Wash, DC)
content: THE GOOD: (1) Great video. THE BAD: (1) “Live View” and “History’ video slow to develop. (2) No space to stuff wiring and wire connectors unless you use one of the wedges. Instead of the wedges, why not just have an adjustable lens. (3) Tiny little screws, hard to hold onto before they can be tightened in place. Why not provide a magnetized screwdriver to keep screws in place while they are tightened… Ring provides everything else? RECCOMENDATION: I would recommend this doorbell camera if you have the patience to install and adjust it. The installation is not as simple as some of the online videos make out.
title: Not Quite Ready for Prime Time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tom Saw
content: Overall: It works ok, it’s useful and fun to have. Pros: The night vision works very well. The battery life is phenomenal. It was easy to set up and install. Cons: Twice I’ve had large items delivered and placed on the porch in direct view of the camera (less than 8 feet from the device) and the motion sensor was not activated (neither time was the device activated within the preceding hour). Our router is only 20-22 feet horizontally from the Ring device, but it is slow to connect. I think we will need the WiFi extender (another 50 bucks).
title: It’s not bad

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CamelBack Amps
content: Installation was a breeze using wired connection. Motion detection is a pain. I set it just a tiny bit off full coverage so cars dont set it off, but in full daylight it doesn’t trigger until Postman, or anyone else is already turned away and walking away. Never to see a face. Night vision is so poor and in B&W that I guess I have to purchase and wire and additional IR light to lake camera receptive. I signed up for the free trial to save my recordings, but if this is all it does I don’t know if I can justify a yearly fee.
title: Doesn’t show people walking up, only walking away.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alan L Thompson
content: I bought this after my original one just stopped working. First, there is constant noise feedback when trying to talk on the 2-way function. Second, it is very slow to connect when someone rings it and you try and answer it, very weak signal and it's only about 25 feet straight line from my router. I usually don't end up connecting until the person is already gone. Last, and worst, the motion detection really sucks. No matter the setting I put it on it, it often doesn't detect someone until they are right at the camera or walking away. My Arlo cameras perform much more reliably and I'll try their doorbell camera next. I'm done with Ring. I'll post a video showing my Ring camera not catching the Amazon guy walking all the way to my door, only caught him after he dropped the package and was walking away. Ridiculous.
title: Too Many Problems!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: N. M. Andrews
content: The Ring 2 is fine. It has, over the last year, gotten slower detecting motion so I catch people when they're walking away from the camera instead of up the driveway.  However, I'll probably never buy another Ring product on account of their Customer Service, which seems good at first, but the agents read off a script and can't really help you. If the Ring notified me of motion when it occurred, and the Customer Service was better, I'd probably give a better rating, but when spending a bunch of money on technology, the subsequent support is as important as the product.
title: Ring 2, 3 stars. Ring Customer Service, 1 star.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Arijit Banerjee
content: Great gadget...already delivering great results, e.g. FedEx delivery made possible because of alert & ability to speak with Rep to request him to wait while I got back from nearby grocery store. Otherwise package would’ve gone back & cycle would have repeated. Only one issue so far—don’t get the notifications on my Apple Watch although setup looks alright. Can’t tell if this is an issue with Ring app or with Apple. Not a huge deal so far. Summary: All Good...exceeds expectation.
title: Great gadget.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kerra Hudson
content: I bought this and installed it yesterday - here are my initial thoughts: Setup:  There are some important steps they really gloss over.  Ok, fine, just call their support.  The first support tech spoke very poor English, and we got disconnected.  He never called me back.  Not good.  The second support tech was much better, and explained the missing steps from the manual. Installation:  Excellent review on this - comes with everything needed, and it was a breeze to install.  It took *maybe* 5 minutes outside. ....then the reality set in.  This product (and I’ve read this includes most of the ring products) has an awful WiFi antenna(s).  Standing next to my new Ring device, my iPhone has full WiFi bars (at 5Ghz), and the Ring has poor signal (at 2.4Ghz).  Hmmm, that should be the other way around.  Thanks, Ring, now I have to spend even more money to upgrade my wifi setup.  Fortunately for me, I already have a mesh system, and can simply add another device closer to the Ring. More importantly, however, *should* I have to buy more hardware to make the Ring work, when every other WiFi device I hold next to it has perfect signal to the same AP? UPDATE:  Added a 2.4Ghz mesh to my system near the Ring, and it corrected my issues:  very slow notifications, inability to pull up video, etc.  SO... this is the fix, which is fine, if they would have been up front about the product's limitations.  Now that I've done this, I'm a happy owner.  I'm leaving my original review because they should be more transparent - shame on you for that, Ring.
title: Terrible WiFi Antenna Design - Plan on Additional Expenditures

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alan Levy
content: The Ring 2 does the job.  Battery life in the east coast winter is at least 3 months in my location.  Packaging is excellent as are the  installation and set up instructions.  Works well with Alexa.  So what is not to like?  1.  No ability to save video or even photographs to local media of any type.  For this price it should be able to save to a local share.  2.  There are clearly privacy issues with the neighborhood app.  3.  As far as I can tell you can't use Alexa to make lights turn on in the house when the Ring spots movement at night.  4.  Alexa can't automatically show live view on an echo show or spot when the Ring spots movement.  If these four issues were addressed then it would be worth the list price.
title: Can't save pictures to local media - Privacy issues with Neighborhoods

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tater
content: We've had the Ring 2 for about a month now. Overall, I'm happy with it. The Wifi connection could be better, but its adequate, since my router is about 15' from the device. The motion detection works as needed. Even if notification tends to be delayed by a few seconds, I'm willing to deal with it. My big complaint is the audio from my Galaxy S9 to the doorbell. When trying to talk, the sound is echoed and sounds like I'm "in a well". Every time I've tried to speak to someone outside, they cannot hear me and just get a terrible reverberation sound. It means that answering the door remotely isn't an option for me. My wife's iPhone does not have this same issue. Overall, the Ring 2 is good for what I need it for, but I wanted it to work in entirety.
title: Good Video Doorbell. Terrible Audio Quality with Galaxy S9.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bruce
content: Well I had my concerns about this when reading some of the reviews but it was an attractive product for our application. I have to admit that the set-up went well and easily! They seem to have that down pat! The camera works well and the doorbell is good. The only issue is the motion detection! It is too good. It alarms when a car passes by the front of the house (60') and that is at its lowest setting. So I had to turn that part off! Other than that I am happy with the product and the install! We will see how it goes! For now I am impressed!
title: Impressive!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Techno Nana
content: My husband died recently.  I always felt safe before because he was a retired police officer.  Well now I am in a big house in a pretty rural area all by myself.  A friend installed a Ring Door Bell at his house and told me that is what I needed.  Now I just have to remember to have my phone handy so I can see who is at the door!  The day after it was installed somebody came over.  They were so impressed that they said they had to get one too!  It is a handy, easy crime prevention tool everybody should have!
title: Better than a barking dog!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cole Sandberg
content: I would not spend the money again. I've found several features of the ring lacking. It does work as a doorbell, and alerts you when there is motion or a person at your door, but what I've found is the app is very slow to initialize the camera so you can see or talk to them. The app is also very clunky when trying to playback. I also am disappointed in Amazon's failure to make their products work together with ease. I bought the ring and an echo show together, thinking I could use the show to see who is at the door. Well they've failed to allow the echo show to automatically display the doorbell. It can automatically announce that there is someone at the door, but there is no setting or routine you can create to make the screen pop up the ring video stream. The only solution I've found is to have a separate echo tell the show to display the doorbell. Really frustrating, especially since they are both Amazon products. My last frustration is the method of aiming the camera. Instead of a pan and tilt on the camera lens, ring supplies 2 mounting plat wedges (one for left/right, one for up/down). Problem is you are locked into the supplied angles, and if you need to use both, your ring doorbell now looks weird sticking out away from the house.
