Most of the time when I get an alert of someone at my door I end up bypassing the doorbell and going straight to my wyze security camera.
title: A lot of room for improvement, very disappointed.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Debra
content: I love the whole concept of these ring cameras. The video picture is pretty good. It serves its purpose. But I am SO SICK of fighting with them (I bought 2 cameras- 1 front door, 1 on garage) EVERY TIME I charge the batteries!!! I put the battery back in and have to go through this whole process of reconnecting to my wifi. It fails multiple times, then we try pressing the doorbell, standing on our heads, whatev. Then sometimes a few hours later, sometimes even the next day, we'll notice it's back online. It's just too much trouble and I DREAD every time the batteries need recharged.  We end up going days without.  So over it!!
title: Terrible to reconnect

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Humhead74
content: This thing misses so much motion directly in front of it. It lacks in recording, I get so many blank recordings. Can never activate the the video when it detects something it takes so long by the time it gets video to my phone, nothing is there. I have more then sufficient WiFi and band-width. I get the same results on local network as I do connecting remotely while out. Might just be my camera as I know I've installed other ring devices with much better results. Would not be my first choice when looking to purchase security.
title: Not reliable

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: John Stroud
content: After a week of using this product, i'm not impressed, in fact I'm down right disappointed. The camera feed is slow, half the time the door bell on the phone rings after the person has left. Most times when we go to check out the outside Live view, it takes a minute and most times doesn't show up. My Wifi is at 52 and i know that's a good feed, i have a wifi booster directly on the other side of the wall from it, so... on the occasion it is running strong the audio stinks..... yea i am just not happy with it.
title: Not as good as they say

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: dwmc
content: If I were going to replace this, I'd shop around.  It took a while to install for several reasons  had to modify the installation space and the unit because it is wider than the space; the leads to connect to the old doorbell wires make it really hard to get a good connection AND get the wires back into the unit; you have to pre-charge the battery and re-charging means removing most of the unit from the tight space (see above).  Also, very disturbed by the news about Ring selling/giving my Internet connection data to other.
title: Not easy to install.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael A. Young
content: First time I ever owned a ring. I'm a late comer. But I am also a believer. It has lots of great features including neighborhood watch. I really like that feature. I got the 1080p version which is great. Easy to set perimeter.  Easy install. Read all of the directions first. This way you dont mount it before setup. You have to scan code on back of device. Download app. It will tell you when to instal.
title: Down load app first. It will tell you when to install. That will save work.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Erin L. McCormack
content: Update: changing to 5 stars because Ring took the Time to contact me after this review and they are sending me the free echo dot! This is amazing customer service and the doorbell was a hit with my parents. Read the fine print if you are buy during a promotion... I purchased when they had a promotion and didn’t read the fine print so I wasn’t able to get the free echo dot offered with purchase.  Apparently you had to add the echo dot to your cart with the doorbell and then the discount would be applied- the only place that was noted was..... somewhere in the fine print that no one reads. Learned my lesson, but I’m guessing I wasn’t the only one ripped off because of this.
title: Product is fine but...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Frank diaz
content: Exelente producto se ve con mucha claridad me encanta lo recomindo para quien lo necesite
title: Tengo mi casa protegida en todo momento

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lindsey
content: Amazon product! Does exactly what we need but has had some shotty WiFi connection. We had to purchase a wiFi extender to help it. Also, be aware if you want to keep the video recordings of answered or unanswered motion you have to pay about a minimum of $10 per month after your first 30 days. So make sure that's something you have afford before purchasing. Otherwise we love it! Also love how there is a neighborhood connection feature that allows you to communicate with other people who have ring and share videos of any danger or anything thats a little "off" going on around you!
title: Great! but not so great Wifi range

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Racer X
content: You need a subscription for all previous video after the Protect trial period ends. They get you with a monthly subscription tax if you want to save any video or see any past motions. There is no USB port to save video for yourself.  Once the protect trial period ends you can't view any Ring videos. During Live motion detected the App can be slow to connect to the Ring even with a strong Wi-Fi and Chime connected. When the Ring Corp does maintenance the App becomes unavailable, and you can only view, but not record live videos.  The product is very easy to connect and use, but with no way to record without a subscription its not very useful.
title: Monthly Subscription Required for any Practical Use.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T. Lo
content: Installation on my siding was poor especially needing to using wedges due to stairs and street. Also I live on a hill. I need more zone controls, I’ve had cars constantly set the thing off and I keep adjusting the settings, but then package deliveries are often ignored. Also pairing with Echo spot was a disappointment. I can see outside but connecting via my phone is faster. The main issue is I only want echo spot alerted of activity, not every dot in the house. What if I had baby sleeping? Overall I still like it enough that I’m sticking with it, but I see room for improvement software wise. Finally the subscription part was a surprise, not even 1 hour storage if I miss activity!?! This feel gimmicky even if it is only $30/year.
title: Room for improvement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kelly Grissom
content: I paid $215 for the Ring Doorbell 2 this year.  After 10 months, the microphone stopped working and after an hour on the phone with support, they said they wouldn't honor the 1 yr warranty because my intenet speed wasnt fast enough.  I have 0% internet issue and the ring worked fine for 10 months.  Shane on ring.com for not honoring your warranty and backing your product.
title: 1 yr warranty a scam

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PrimePro
content: Having now had this camera for a little more than two months I can confidently say that I love it. It's a high quality option that comes uses a well-made and highly functional app to control the camera and any others you may have. It links well with my Amazon Echo and its easy to install, set up, and use. People have complained that they struggle to pick up a solid WIFI signal, however, I have had no such experience. Mine linked up easily with my WIFI (one floor, a layer of concrete, and tons of walls separate the door from the WIFI router). Another Issue that has been discussed is the motion detection; again, I have had not one bad experience with the motion detection system not working. It picks up everyone and anything that comes within the customized motion zone that I set up on my app. Ring's slogan is "Always Home" and its a great feeling knowing that I can always check in on my house and the activity that the Ring Doorbell 2 picks up. Its well worth the price and time required (not much) to set this thing up and get it running.
title: Love the Camera and the Peace of Mind it Provides

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Veteran's Wife
content: There's a delay getting 2 the video live when it goes off cause it doesn't automatically pop up on your alexa devices. The night vision isn't the best but considering this is the ring 2 not 1 I was expecting better. I have bought other cams that have clearer night vision & hold a sd card. We have good wifi so we've had no issues. On the whole it's average not a wow factor.  $3 a mth for 1 device is reasonable or I believe $30 for a year 2 be able 2 have it record & keep. The more ring devices the more it cost. If u have kids it good 4 them 2 see who's at the door safety especially these days.
title: Great 2 see who's at the door safely but not a wow factor on night vision

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PM
content: So bough this as my little project over the holidays. I should have ordered some Xanax too. Despite calls to Ring customer service, multiple attempts at reboot this device just would not work. Would not connect to the app for set up, router resets, changes to security, multiple different devices. It still wouldn’t work. In addition it’s the cheapest, poorest quality doorbell I’ve ever seen.  I onky took it out of the box and the shiny case was already marked and scratched. Very poor. Not worth the money
title: Very poor quality

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LPM
content: I installed it almost 6 months ago .. mine is a wired connection so it took a little time for me to figure out but once done its easy .. set up is self explanatory .... easy - picture quality is very good ... motion audio detection is very good .. on time ... however few times I observed that wifi signal is poor .. which I think tis not .. because at the same place I have Arlo and its wifi is strong .. so I guess Ring wifi signal is not that great ... even though its showig poor wifi signal so far I don't have issues ... I restarted it that time ... now all good .. records 30 seconds as soon as it detects ring/motion etc.. happy that my house is secured ... go for it
title: Working as expected - Happy with purchase

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GretchenNC
content: I'm having a hard time adjusting the motion detection so it doesn't go off with every car that drives by but still picks up someone walking up onto my front porch. The app in Microsoft Store doesn't connect about half the time, so I can't get a live view from my front porch camera on my desktop computer when I want it. The UI is clunky on the phone app--response time is too laggy to question anyone on the porch. It hasn't had a hard time connecting to WiFi and gives a very clear image though. Edit to add photo. We're getting an awful lot of this when I use the desktop app to get a live view. It's definitely making me reconsider my plan to get a floodlight camera for my back door.
title: It doesn't chime until after the person is already heading away

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scharlyce Powell
content: I hardwired two of these to two different houses. The house with long enough wires was very easy for installation. The drill bit provided worked well for the stucco walls. The second house had very short wires and it was very difficult to use the wire extender and wire nut. Had to go to home depot and buy solid wire and push in connectors. Doing it that way was way easier because the wire nuts would not stay on after any movement. If you are hardwiring, you don't need to worry about the battery life. If you are not hardwiring, make sure you have a back up battery that can be purchased at ring.com that way you have a doorbell while the battery is charging. You can also change the motion sensitivity. I am subtracting one star because they could have included easier tools for short wires.
title: Hardwire or Buy a Backup Battery

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sleep Man
content: Half the videos it makes are totally black. Our WiFi is a newer Apple Airport about 12 feet away from the front door, and so the signal is good (RSSI -55). I spent lots of time on the phone with support, which doesn't seem to have any advice other than to reboot/reset the device, which didn't help. The battery life is also not very good. Ring claims 6-12 months of operation per charge. For us, the battery was down to 40% after a month, so it would last less than 2 months on a charge. And it takes a while to charge - we tried 4 different chargers and could not find one that would charge faster than 500mA, so charging the battery takes more than 8 hours. All of these reasons mean we sent ours back, leaving some holes in our door. It has been worse overall than our old basic doorbell.
title: Black videos, not so great battery

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Valerie Stewart
content: We had a ring doorbell at our old home and loved it, so we got a new one when we moved.  Now you have to have a subscription for it to do anything.  The live view is supposed to work, but I think it's connected 5 times in the last 3 months, despite business speed internet.  I contacted support and lo and behold, we've been paying for a device that doesn't work for 2 years.  We didn't sign up for a subscription, so make sure you're checking your payments to them.  Their advice was, sorry it doesn't work.
title: Useless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: KieferC
content: Love this item.  Solicitors turn around when the see the ring.  All deliveries on my front porch are gently set down now and placed where they are not visible from the street.  I have another non visible camera on my porch prior to installing the ring so I could see the delivery folks toss my packages or place them on the very edge of my porch, just advertising free stuff to thieves.  Highly recommend.  Very easy to set up and install.
title: Keeps solicitors and porch pirates away.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: gtincol
content: My wife wanted a Ring since she's alone during the day and doesn't like to open the door without knowing who's there.  Overall, the installation was easy.  Like most Amazon products, everything needed was included and instructions were fairly straight forward.  Had to play around with motion detection range to get it set correctly.  Still picks up big trucks that pass along the street.  WiFi signal seems good but sometimes it's seems a little slow to respond when someone comes up to the door.  Overall, it's been great and one of the things you wonder why you didn't purchase earlier.  Great to know what is happening around your front door!
title: Really nice and Convenient

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Emad
content: I had the doorbell for more than 2 weeks, most of this period I was trying to have a proper connection between the device and my network. I live in an apartment, not too much distance between my door, where the device is mounted and my router. I have FIOS 200/200Mb fiber connection. but yet the door bell misses a lot of motions and few button presses. Even when motion sensor is triggered,  the camera start recording after anything between 15-60 seconds, and most of the time, voice will start to record after another 10-15 seconds, while most of the time I will get the notification delayed too. When I contacted their support their asked me to run few tests that involved removing the device, resetting it, speed tests...etc but nothing solved the problem. at the end they suggested a chime pro (their wifi extender) and left me on my own. Anyway, I'm not going to dash another $50 to help their device to connect my 10 feet away router, while I had a skybell that never had any of those problem. luckily I'm still in the return window and this what I will do.
title: Good concept, bad communication, poor customer service.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richar M.
content: I asked for this as a Gift for Christmas  and told my family to please use my Amazon account . but they went to Home depot instead. When i first hooked it up it worked great. Hard wired so power VERY GOOD  wifi connection  EXCELLENT  as it should be as Modem is less then 9 feet away.  Then it drops last week  to RSSI -73 and i get warnings . I reset it and try all the things i can think of. But nothing.  so today i come home early from work to again troubleshoot  on your ring pages and read all, and l did all, and still nothing,.  So did a text chat.  Went thru the same thing  for 2 hrs. then was asked to take it apart.  I live in  PA and we are having a snow storm and its 17 degree  No not tonight or the next few days. I was told By PAYTON to call back when i have more time.  As my wife just said. I (me) just spent more hours on this and if you convert  it to what you  (I) get paid per hr. you worked more to fix it then it cost.  I did get one for my work here on amazon and that works well. But mine  sucks and they  are making me jump through hoops?
title: UPSET

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Victor
content: Me encanta
title: Me gusta

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: 1 Factory Radio, LLC
content: We're a huge fan of the Ring product line. The app works well and allows you to monitor cameras at multiple locations with ease. The only minor annoyance is that the WiFi signal needs to be very strong and we've had a difficult time getting the Chime to work in conjunction with the doorbells and cameras. Since it's easy enough to install an access point or router near the Ring location, this isn't much of a problem. The benefit and functionality of these cameras far outweighs the WiFi issue and it deserves 5 stars.
title: Great for small businesses

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Fisher
content: This doorbell is terrible. We saw great reviews for it so we decided to purchase it. The motion sensor, no matter how much you adjust the zones or the ring itself, it won’t capture what ring calls “important events” aka when someone breaks into your car that is in your driveway and within the zone. Tech support is great (if you get connected with a knowledgeable representative). Once you’ve had your ring for over a year, customer service refuses to help you. I would recommend you spend your money on another device from another company! Save yourself the time, money & stress from dealing with a company that doesn’t have time to assist you.
title: Disappointing product & disappointing company

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: sean
content: So installing was easy enough. Video quality is good along with easy user interface with the app. However, I did not realize that it didn't have a built in DVR of some kind and if you wanted to access footage of an event you have to have one of their two subscription options. Otherwise you can only view live, so if someone does an malicious act against you, and your not around to catch it live, than your SOL on knowing who and when. Still a great product but don't like the extra revenue strategy. I also used an Adjustable Angle Mount that's not made by ring. Ring doorbell 2 does come with two wedge's to help angle but i needed more of an angle. https://www.amazon.com/dp/B078RK1131/ref=cm_sw_em_r_mt_dp_U_PuaxDbMQK659A
title: DON'T FORGET ABOUT THE SUBSCRIPTION!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TDG Fort Worth Tx
content: For the price, the RING VIDEO DOORBELL 2 has performed much better than expected in the 4 days we have had it.  We have excellent WIFI coverage but there is noticeable delay in both video and audio transmission.  In many cases, the person activating the motion detector is already out of camera view by the time an alert or video is transmitted to my iPhone Xr.  If an alert is received we usually switch to "Live View."  It is a great device to start with in establishing a home security system.  The "Neighbors Feed" has been entertaining, if not useful, in making you realize how much activity goes on around your house without you knowing it.  I'm also impressed by the alerts we get on our phones when away from the house.
title: the RING VIDEO DOORBELL 2 has performed much better than expected in the 4 days we have had ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hel
content: I got this item on sale during the amazon black Friday sale.  I knew I would be moving so I waited to put it up, which I recently did.  This item is trash.  Motion detection SUCKS.  I have been sitting in my living room watching a delivery person deliver something and it would not trigger the motion detection.  But a person could ride their bike down the sidewalk at the end of my walkway and it would trigger the motion detector.  The other day I was pushing the ring doorbell for and it would not ring and announce on my echo show.  When it finally did ring, the blue light around the button stayed lit and the echo show said waiting for ring.com for about 5 minutes.  My best friend bought the Eufy and it works flawlessly.  Add to that the fact that you have to pay a fee for the ring doorbell but not Eufy and its a no-brainer.  No wonder amazon and ring are being sued.  You don't have to take my advice.  Buy it and regret it!
title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM BUY A EUFY

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Janet Ann Thompson
content: The fact that I don’t have the option to store recordings on my own devices??? Forget it it’s a waste of money it’s just a fancy doorbell unless you pay for the subscription every single one of these cameras nowadays requires a subscription so you’re trapped. Forever! The second problem I encountered is that you can’t control the movement zone cars drive-by and for some reason I can’t exclude it I have excluded it in the app but it still records every car that drives by as a ring it didn’t do that for the first couple of weeks and then all of a sudden it did you got a wonder makes you think you need the subscription
title: No ability to store incidents on my own device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sue E
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I love the idea but it's never worked right for me. The video is slow to start so I miss what should be the beginning of the recording. Then the video freezes only two seconds in and the freeze lasts about 15 seconds or longer, so I miss whatever happened during that time. The sound continues, but after having this thing for many months, that's starting to cut out. When someone rings the doorbell, it takes forever for the Ring app to start to show me who's there. I have wireless DSL. In spited of having a DSL extension device about 5 feed from the Ring doorbell, I often get a "weak signal" message. I don't know. I just haven't had a lot of luck with this thing and it's frustrating. Video I'm submitting shows my letter carrier (mail lady) delivering my mail.
title: Video freezes for several seconds.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Javier
content: Es bueno pero hay veces que yo me paro frente del equipo y no muestra el movimiento
title: Preocupado

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Larry Delgadillo
content: I put this Doorbell at the entrance of my home. This thing is great. You cannot beat this product for what it does and how it performs. Especially at the affordable price it is at compared to other home security products. It feels great to be alerted of someone approaching my door. Especially when receiving my Amazon or other deliveries. People are more aware what this can do and the video it captures. I believe it discourages a lot of thieves from stealing your packages too. If they see the little lite up Halo I’m sure most people with think twice about coming close. The 2 way communication is good. Of course there is a small delay on the back and forth speaking but I have seen worse with other products out there. So far this product meets my expectations. What else is great is that there is a community on the app within your vicinity that are keeping a close eye on people up to no good. We can share videos to keep and eye out for them or just being aware that they are close. Also it helps with lost pets. You can post found pet wondering around. It is great that we can communicate in a wide variety of ways and have true neighborly support. RING has exceeded my expectations. All of My family now have one at their houses. Great Job RING.
title: Overall great product.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hard T. Please
content: I've had a couple of Rings and although I've found them indispensable most of the time, I also have come to realize they are a bother because they really don't work well consistently even with a solid wi-fi connection like mine. You will find that you will regularly have to set up and re-setup the device every few weeks because the iOS app will flake out, it will no longer detect motion, it will blank your PC screen if you use the desktop app etc. etc. etc. The Ring app interfaces isn't well laid out. I started with a Ring, then got another brand because the Ring was unreliable, that one was worse, went back to Ring 2 in hopes it would be better and it is but barely.
title: It has become a bother and I hope for something more reliable to come along

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: chris cowen
content: After calling and emailing the useless tech support, I finally got this to mostly work. The internet saved me, not Ring support. Typical overseas call center reading a script. The guy bricked the door bell to the point it only rang the bell. Tried to tell me that my front door was the problem... It has major documented problems connecting to the live feed. Playback video works fairly well. I have 2 other Ring cameras- one wired, one battery- that connect fairly fast and consistently. Signal was in the good range according to the app the whole time. Internet comments point at extremely aggressive battery saving software not letting the live feed to wake up the unit.
title: Unreliable

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JoniLMT
content: I wish I had known, before drilling into the brick wall, that placing the doorbell camera in the normal position (to the open side of the door) would prove to negate many of the doorway notifications. Once people are in front of the camera, then all is well and everything works to my great satisfaction. This isn't really a doorbell problem as it's more of an installation instruction problem. So if you have a recessed doorway as I do, consider putting the doorbell where it can get a better view of the full entryway.
title: Works great, even in recessed doorway.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Foulke
content: I bought this as I live in an apartments building where there are no bells. I was having issues getting deliveries and this seemed like a great solution. My WiFi however barely reaches down 3 stories where this has to be located for people to access it. I’ve tried a variety of extenders and solutions but just cannot get this thing a proper signal and if you read around you’ll see this is very common. The antennas must be very underpowered. To their credit, the company sent me a free Chime Pro, which is their version of a WiFi extender. It doesn’t work any better. It does allow you to hear inside the apt when someone rings the bell but it’s useless to access any of the video features.
title: Do you have a router next to your door? If not do not buy.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Todd Lund
content: I can see now why the Ring with Echo is the same price as the Ring. These are the first two lines of product description: 1. This bundle contains the Ring Video Doorbell 2 and the Echo Dot (3rd Generation). 2. Works with Alexa to illuminate and send announcements to Echo devices when your doorbell is pressed or motion is detected, allowing you to hear and speak to visitors with two-way talk However... The Ring does not support two-way talk with the echo dot. Which means this is somewhat deceptive advertising (despite the add-on being free). That all said, we can't even get the echo to ring when someone presses the ring door bell. As a family of Silicon Valley engineers, it is not often we are stumped by a piece of commodity technology. Camera works pretty good. We were able to get the motion detection tuned to eliminate most false reports. Pretty good battery life. Might have to buy the $29 chime to actually hear the bell in the house.
title: Misleading product description

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ReneeRox
content: I received my Ring last week and installed it ASAP.  I purchased the battery version because accessing my previous doorbell wiring would have been a PITA.  The only issue I have with it is that the motion sensor settings are very touchy.  I set it to avoid the street, but it still picks up passing vehicles.  I adjust it in more, then it didn't pick up any motion at all.  I adjust it again... more traffic.  Adjust again to hopefully pick up motion next to the truck and it doesn't pick up motion until someone is on my porch.  I'll keep playing with it, but it's frustrating that the tiniest of adjustments can make such a big difference in sensing motion.
title: So Far So Good, except...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Isa
content: I talked to so many people and read every single review before I finally purchased my ring doorbell and I could not be happier. Battery lasts about two weeks at high rang motion detection. This is at my backdoor, so no major traffic to pickup. However, I live in the country and there are a ton of animal's that keep my ring busy. I have caught several people on my property with this and let's just say that is no longer a problem. I am now getting another for my front door and looking into what outside and inside video cameras I will be getting.
title: Will buy again!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Darkpassenger
content: This Device only works with battery power! This device Need 24v Hardwire power to "Trickle Charge" the batter and now power the device. There is no way to bypass this feature. I don't even know why they offer that as a feature. Your batter will die every three days or so if you live in an even moderately trafficked area. They will try to charge you to upgrade to pro the difference of the falsely advertised device.  Don't waste your time or money with this device  Just go straight to the pro and get it hardwired power only.
title: NO HARDWIRED POWER ONLY OPTION - REQUIRES BATTERY POWER TO WORK (FALSE ADVERTISING)

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ronald Overstreet
content: IF you don't have a Ring, find someone who does, and you will buy one. I love the idea of being able to talk to someone at my front door from work. If you're concerned about not having power in your desired installation location, don't worry. The rechargeable battery lasts a long time (i was surprised how long). Since this purchase I've purchased 2 floodlight cams which also works very well. If you're considering purchasing, consider no more, purchase. Almost forgot, they are super easy to install.
title: This device is outstanding

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Valdez
content: I installed my ring video doorbell 2 yesterday and have run into issues getting it to work properly  (it mostly reports poor signal strength, choppy and freezing video, audio issues, etc.) I'm using mine off battery power, not wired. The doorbell sits only 29 feet from my router with no walls in between besides the front door and it reports poor signal strength consistently, it even shows poor signal when I moved it right next to the router. I have very reliable and fast internet at home and none of our many other wi-fi enabled devices have trouble establishing a strong connection anywhere around the house. I contacted Customer Support yesterday and the rep reported seeing interference and fluctuating speeds when she checked my device on her end. She had me run speed tests on my smartphone over wi-fi and the speeds consistently came back as 15+Mbps down/15+Mbps up, and that was using Ring's speed test site. Other speed test sites return much higher speeds so my internet speeds are obviously not a problem. She then offered to send me a Chime Pro free of charge. Hoping this fixes the issue but my gut tells me I may have a defective unit. 3 stars for the responsive customer support and free Chime Pro! I was tempted to buy a chime pro at first but opted for the regular chime considering wi-fi has never been a problem in my home.  Should everything work out okay I can now move my regular chime to the basement.  I will update this review once I receive the chime pro and have everything up and running.
title: ... issues getting it to work properly (it mostly reports poor signal strength

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: nbt
content: I have waited to write a review on the Ring 2 because I had not put the time in to adjust settings and mounting.  Today I spent 2 hours trying the different wedges and adjusting the sensitivity.  The Ring 2 will pick up every car that drives 50+ feet from my house, but will not pick up a human until they reach the doorstep.  My wifi signal is strong.  I could literally run up to the door, ring the bell and run away and not get caught by the camera.  If you need a device that serves as a video doorbell , it works great. If you want some added security on your front porch this is not the right product for you.
title: NOT for security this is ONLY a video doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Keith
content: I work very long/odd hours and I'm not home a lot.  I'm happy to finally have some kind of peace of mind that my property is secure.  However: I would really like to give this product 5 stars, but after a few weeks of tinkering, unfortunately I have to echo some of the complaints of others.  I just can't get the motion settings to work for me- I get constant "false" notifications from both this and my Spotlight cam- squirrels running around, cars passing by in the street far out of the alleged motion range I set, etc.  However, twice this week I've had packages delivered to my front door with zero notification/activation from either my Ring Doorbell 2 or the accompanying Spotlight Cam, meaning apparently there is a significant chance a package can be delivered or stolen without triggering either camera.  This is unacceptable. The blue sensitivity area in the motion settings menu is absolutely not a true representation of the real range of the unit, which is incredibly frustrating. When the camera/doorbell does sense motion, most of the time what I get is the back of the delivery driver/mailman- meaning it takes so long for the camera/doorbell to activate that if a thief were to move at a moderate to fast speed, it's likely he will be able to complete his mission without being caught on video in any significant way. The camera only records for 20-30 seconds so it's also common that you miss the beginning and end of the event. I've found that when paired/linked with a spotlight cam set at a higher motion sensitivity, the Doorbell works better because it is triggered earlier.  But why should we purchase additional products to compensate for poor software and slow reaction time? I imagine this works really well if you have a long driveway or a lot of space between the door and the street.  I don't. TL DR: the software needs a lot of work.  Either put up with constant false alarms at a higher motion sensitivity or risk missing the 1 in 1000 event you want to have on video.
title: Not great, but best when paired with other Ring cams

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AUI GUDF8
content: I like the quality of the video that's for sure. Built and overall simplicity of the design. Function is impeccable - until it is not. The latter hasn't happened yet. Battery life is more than a month now and still at almost 50% with busy motion detection and recording. With the annual subscription I have not had too much issues with "lapsing" recordings like the thousands of owners are having - not capturing the essential parts of the movement/act. But, I am not saying I didn't have this experience, just lesser. I will update in the days to come.
title: It works like it should until it doesn't.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eddie McCoy
content: The Ring doorbell is a complete waste of time. Most of the time it will record about 30 seconds of video, which is suitable for most motion situations. The biggest problem this camera has is that there is then a 2-3 minute lag time before the camera can process another video, so you most likely will not catch what you are looking for in the first place. I have been using this camera for 9 months now, and find it to be fairly useless. The video quality is acceptable, but as I have noted above, you will most likely not capture the majority of events since it will not record but every 3 minutes.
title: Waste of time. Too much lag time between videos.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Emerson Hevia
content: I bought this product on Cyber-Monday for $100.18, about half the price Amazon is charging now, and after a month of use I found it not to be worth the money even though I paid half the price. Here are some of the highlights of my experience ring Doorbell 2: 1. The installation App refused to work with my android phone, a Samsung Galaxy 8. I called customer service and they did not have a solution. They said that I should try installing it with an iPhone or just return it. I took the bother to beg a relative who has an iPhone to do the installation with her phone. To my surprise, the installation worked fine with the iPhone, but no matter how many times I tried to install it again with any of the Android phones in our house, it failed. So if you have an Android phone, chances are that you will not be able to install this product. 2. I bought this product along with the Echo Show, as Alexa had an “Skill” for Ring. Even though Alexa’s audio notifications worked ok, they were broadcasted on every Echo speaker in the house. There was no way to select which Alexa’s device(s) I wanted to hear the notifications. Moreover, I expected Echo Show to display the video from the camera once an alert was received, but it did not. As a matter of fact, the camera’s video was not shown on any of the devices were I had the App installed, neither on the Echo Show. I had to ask Echo Show to display a live video in order to see who was at the door. 3.  When the “Cloud Subscription” was in the trial period you would be able to see a recorded video of every alert. There were too many False Alerts, and there was no way to manage which videos you wanted to keep. Once the Subscription was over, there were no videos at all and the video stopped working. In order to see what an alert was about, you have to go to “Live View” which takes at least 3 minutes to display the video from the camera. This product, at this price, should offer a memory card as an alternative store the videos, rather than forcing you pay in order to get the video functionality working. 4. I would not want my videos to be stored in a “Cloud”, especially when there have been reports of hackers intruding to your ring cameras. Let along to pay for exposing you to this danger. 5. When I got the product, it took me about 16 hours to charge the battery the first time. It lasted only a couple of weeks. After recharging it, I had to adjust the device’s sensitivity in order to save power. Even though I reduced every parameter to the minimum, the battery charge lasted only 3-4 weeks. 6. After the cloud subscription ended, it became very erratic on the motion alerts … about 50% missing motions, and a lot of false alerts. 7. This product was designed to keep you paying a subscription. It may not seem that much right now. But then there is the question that if they decide to double or triple de subscription price, you will be left with the trap of either pay as much as they demand or end up with a crippled device. On the positive side, I can say that I can buy from Amazon with the confidence that they guarantee returns and refunds of their products, should they not meet your expectations.
title: My “Ring Video Doorbell 2” evaluation: not worth it and way overpriced

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Colorado Cara
content: Our Ring Doorbell brings us peace of mind—especially when expecting package deliveries. It’s handy to be able to use the speaker function to actually talk to people on your doorstep (even when you’re not home!), and we like that you can adjust the distance/sensitivity of the motion it picks up so that the notification is not going off every time a car drives by. Our doorbell is on a side wall perpendicular to our actual door, so it doesn’t face our sidewalk/driveway. We were able to use the small wedge provided with the Ring to change the angle that it faces, but it could stand to have a little more of an angle to give a better view. It’s also unfortunate that you have to pay an ongoing fee if you want to have the capability to actually record footage that you can go back and review at a later time.
title: Provides peace of mind

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: C. Coleman
content: My ring doorbell only lasted 14 months, then kaput. Only black video now. Two months past warr. The thing worked really great when it was working. I liked it a lot. When it did it's job it was worthy of 5 stars. But going kaput after 14 months and having to buy a new one, albeit with a 35% discount, is still very disappointing and only rates 3 stars. Haven't decided if I will replace it. I still get notifications of motion detection and a still shot. It just won't play video any longer. However, the video is perhaps the biggest benefit of the thing.
title: Works great until it doesn't

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ray Fer
content: The only reason I didn’t give 5 starts is because when I experience a power outage in my area the doorbell 2, chimes and spotlight battery camera go offline. Once they go offline I need to activate all of them again. The battery backup for the router didn’t help at all because the outage affected the internet outside the home. Is more annoying when traveling and no one at home to activate the ring.
title: I like the doorbell 2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scott F. Lowry
content: Hooked up my ring doorbell about a week and a half ago. Its slick, easy to connect to wifi and the app is easy to use. I tried to get it connected to my existing doorbell power, but my doorbell power no longer works. I'm just using the battery with the motion sensor turned on, but at an average distance. After 1.5 weeks, the battery is at 84%, so it looks like the battery will last a while. I've connected it to a chime. The chime is probably not loud enough for our entire house, so I might have to get a second.
title: easy to connect to wifi and the app is easy ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patricia H
content: Super easy to install.  We replaced our wired doorbell with the Ring so it always has power.  We did have to drill a hole to mount.  Overall process took about 20 minutes total from opening the box to downloading the apps to getting set up.  We find the picture doesn’t load very fast from the instant motion is detected - it says our WiFi signal is ok but not best so we will continue to tweak it.  We love the ability to see who is out front.  Not a lot of false motion detection.  Speaker is weak and you have speak slowly and clearly to be understood outside.  Overall Works great and video and photos are really clear.
title: Love the Ring Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Deck
content: It is slow, may be my wifi but by the time it comes up people are leaving. Storage is free for a month then they have you for life if you want to see what happened an hour ago or a day ago. Meh, reminds me of my timeshare  ..retch. By the time you get the pic on your phone or alexa device if someone was there they are long gone. Forget the whole answer the door thing and talking to anyone. It is a joke and a bad one. Only reason I gave it a couple of stars is it does record activity but only occasionally is the recording of any use at all.
title: Mediocre

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike H.
content: Ring really shines at their doorbells. I have 2 of the Ring Video Doorbell 2 series, a floodlight and a Spotlight Camera (which is changing to Hardwire, the Battery ones are not for me) Out of all their products I have, I especially love the doorbells the most. They make all the difference. What's sad is that during the night my Floodlight Camera by Ring sometimes doesn't pick up a person walking down our shared sidewalk with other neighbors. However, the Doorbell, if the decide to choose our path, catches them before they even get near the door. And consistently as well. I haven't had an issue where the Doorbells misses anyone, even at night. That's something that the Floodlight, while works perfectly during the day, can't say or do when up against the Doorbells. Probably the biggest thing that makes me happy is Ring's Customer Service. I had a doorbell that wasn't connecting to my router, which I found out later was my fault since I didn't allow random MAC's to connect if at a certain point. The lady on the phone still was amazing, doing everything she could to get it going, only eventually to send a replacement. Few hours later I found the problem, told them the issue, and sent the new one back to them. Morale of the story; I have not seen customer service as Ring does. They do care on their products, and they want you to be happy with it. That's something you don't see often these days. I am with Ring Protect $100/year service since I have more than 3 cameras. The story above was when I was on their Free Trial, so be as it may with your customer service. Because of the above, I bought more of their products. It does make a difference. My only gripe; if it is valid to be one is that the Battery life for these Doorbells are not even close to 6 months. I generally get at most 2 months for my one door, and 1 month on the other door that uses the shared sidewalk. While my settings are a little higher, I think even at light usage with Light frequency recordings will probably only yield 4 months of battery at most (Midwest/Great Lakes States area) However! I wouldn't gripe much on that, as 1-2 months to swap a battery is no big serious issue. When I first got these I thought max 14 days. Nice! Overall I recommend these Doorbells. They do have a longer range than it says in my opinion. It may not be suitable for someone's door at about 10 feet from a street. It might just catch everything. They do provide a mount that lowers the camera facing about 20 degrees downward to help alleviate that a little, but it still may not be perfect. I've noticed with any Ring product with anyone, your mileage and experience really varies on where your at (battery), location of your door(s) (sensitivity), and quality of video (Internet Speeds/Distance from Router to Device). I'd say; Go for it, and try them out. At least Ring backs their products from my experience.
title: Ring's Doorbells are nearly Perfect!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Alex M.
content: This is my 3rd doorbell purchase because it's a quality product. I've been using Ring doorbells for over a year now and I've never had an issue. Set up is easy and fast and the ability customize your motion settings is a real plus. Overall I'm very happy with the product, if I had to complain about anything it would be that it takes about 10 hours to fully charge the battery (not really a major issue considering the battery lasts for about 5 weeks) but if you have a hard wire set up its not a problem at all.
title: Great Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kathy Davie
content: This doorbell is essentially useless. I have good hearing and a small apartment. I barely  hear the doorbell. And it takes SOOOOO long before I can get the app open, find the right link to click, get to Live View, and then, each time, I have to turn on the video and audio. WTF? By the time I do all this, whoever was at my doorbell is gone. I thought this doorbell would be so handy because I'm disabled and it is very difficult for me to get up and get to the door. Hah! I can at least see who WAS at my door.
title: What a pain!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Deebs
content: The clarity of the video is all white as if the camera was pointed up at the sun.  My car is maybe 7ft from the camera and everything is so white that you can hardly tell it's there.  And certainly at night you can t even see that it's a car!  I live in Oregon so it's not like it's super bright and sunny here!  Also the lag time between the alert and when it shows you the motion seems long.  Any burglar or porch thief would either be in your house by the time the video came up or would have run off with your stuff by then.
title: So White I can't see much & Longish lag time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Premier Bride Magazine & Expos
content: There has to be better options out there.  I think the cost + the subscription fee + the unreliable WIFI connections just make it okay.  It’s easy to instal, the app works great and the pictures are good.  It serves most purposes except consistency.  I can’t rely on it to work all the time.  I feel there are better camera systems out there if you really want to monitor your property on a reliable basis.  They cost more and the install is much more complicated but the results would be better.  It’s just okay for what it is.  I’ll keep it but I will be upgrading to a different system.
title: Meh.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TWall19
content: Love my ring and although sometimes I feel it stalls a bit when trying to access live it does everything it should and more. I can rotate my camera range and see super far away even in the sky. Some mornings the birds will set off the ring and I bird watch in bed. When I say the clarity and depth is way better then what I thought I can’t make this up. Loved the doorbell so much I just purchased the alarm /motion set on prime day! We have had other surveillance cameras /devices and this by far beats any of them. Easy to talk through device as well which is a bonus even when your not home for deliveries or whatever.
title: Better then most surveillance out there

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chelle
content: This is the most frustrating thing ever.  From one day to the next, the motion sensitivity seems to change.  Day one, it picks up everything, so I adjust it, seems to be working ok.  However, then the next day, it begins to pick up more things in the zone that it was not picking up.  How can a car on the street not trigger it one day, but it will the next?  But it does not pick up the damn mailman.  I am constantly getting alerts, then there is nothing there.  I just walked towards the thing, within six feet of it, and nothing, no notification, but a car 25'-30' feet away will set it off??  I have tried every different motion setting to no avail, this thing is worthless!
title: I would give ZERO stars if I could.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Byron J. Guidry
content: Wife loves it!  This has given us peace of mind.  The ring 2 works like a charm.  I can even prove that the U P S guy does not ring the doorbell but the motion detector caught him.  We had tried the Ring Pro but could never solve the low amperage issue even with the recommended Elk 2440 transformer.  But the Ring 2 works great.  You get the recorded videos on your phone so you have proof who came to your front door.
title: Ring 2 works like a charm!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard Mitchell Sr.
content: Every thing needed to install this product is in the package and a bit more. and the wires are in the package to connect to your existing door bell wires. (got a lot of service out that masonry bit) I did the scan the software loaded (have your router password) I suggest setting  it up and loading the software near the router and walking it to the distance while observing it over your phone  stand in front of it wave your arms if you like that should reflect on your phone. Then install it, turn on the motion on your software, check your cell phone requirements  for ring are all turned ON. it will work with battery alone and not wired.
title: Outstanding, easy to install.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tankman
content: I just installed my Ring 2 and so far I am pleased with it.  I tried the LaView doorbell first because of the reviews I read when I was shopping for a doorbell camera.  However, the setup was very difficult and once setup it lasted a day and disconnected from my app.  Unfortunately, logging in didn’t work and I had to start the install process over.  I also received over 50 notifications in one day.  LaView doesn’t have the ability to adjust motion sensitivity with only a doorbell camera.  If you have multiple cameras and a master control box it is my understanding that you can then adjust the sensitivity for motion.  I will say that the camera quality is better than the Ring camera but for what I need it to do the ring camera works just fine. Now, for the Ring setup.  This is where they shine!  The instructions were very easy to follow, the mounting hardware was comprehensive and I didn’t need any tools but what was provided by Ring.  The sync with the app was seamless and works well.  I am also able to log in with my iPad as well as my wife’s iPhone with no issues.  I’ve seen negative reviews on the Ring which made me shy away intitially.  However, they have a satisfied customer in me.
title: The Ring 2 is a good doorbell camera and installation and setup is seamless.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hazwhomper
content: I am not one to write reviews (in fact, this is my first).  I had my Ring Video Doorbell 2 installed today, and it performs NOTHING like you would expect that it would.  Despite messing with all of the motion settings, I have only been able to get the doorbell to pick up motion one time out of more than ten tries - including several where I literally walk from the street to the front door (at which point I am standing directly in front of the doorbell).  The doorbell only registered motion in one test out of the many that I did. The wifi is equally poor, as it has an "extremely weak" signal despite being only about 12 feet from our wireless router. Clearly this product has a lot of promise once the technology actually works, but this product does not work well.  At present, the actual performance of the Ring 2 falls far short of what Ring leads you to believe it can deliver.  Very disappointed.
title: Do not buy Ring Video Doorbell 2 - Does not work well at all

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: W. Russell
content: First it has a great design. Secondly it was easy to set up. Thirdly the picture is good not great but good. Fourthly I love the ability to communicate via this device from anywhere. Lastly, it is great that it doesn’t have to be wired in.
title: Great product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Thomas U.
content: for the first couple weeks it worked ok, from day one extremely slow load time, from the time it picks up motion till the picture loads is anywhere from 30-45 seconds so when image finally loads whatever was there is no longer there, video is choppy and pixeled, the video lag is extremely slow if video loads at all,  so you cant really make out whats on the screen or load the video feed. my router is only 5 feet from front door but ring tech support keeps telling me its the location and speed, I dont have issues with my my cctv system that works over wifi just the ring, and i have gigabit internet. this was a complete waist of money.
title: waist of money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Don
content: This doorbell was easy to set up and the HD camera produces an excellent color video of any activity at the front door.  I had some initial issues with wi-fi reception but moving my router slightly seems to have made a difference.  The software for notifications is also working as described.  Being able to adjust the sensitivity to detect movement is a plus.  So far, no false notifications due to passing cars, pedestrians or dogs.  I'd easily recommend this unit to anyone looking for a little extra home security.
title: This doorbell was easy to set up and the HD camera produces an ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DC Reader
content: Waste of money.  Battery life is a JOKE. What an utter waste!  The alert that someone is at the door occurs TOO late.  The ad about having a conversation with the visitor/delivery person is crap.  This is a piece of junk, that I would have returned if it hadn’t already been installed.
title: Battery is life is an utter JOKE.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kent Gregg
content: Sometimes it's a bit slow on alerting me with current motion but I'm paying for the cloud storage thru Ring. It often misses the person's face or who it at the door. And sometimes I miss the activity if someone comes in view after the 30 seconds or whatever I have the settings at. It sounds like the Pro is suppose to capture a few seconds before someone rings the bell. I do like to have the battery option in the Doorbell 2 which the pro doesn't have. I wish it had night vision without having to leave a porch light on.
title: Consistent view and notifications

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jim121
content: I really wanted to love this thing but I just can't.  I replaced the original Ring with the Ring 2 and I'm having the same vexing issues.  It's motion detection is intermittent to say the least.  There are times when the unit will detect a person across the street walking their dog but miss a delivery person approaching less then thirty feet away heading directly toward the camera.  It's not a battery issue; my unit is wired in and it sure isn't an issue with wi-fi.  My wi-fi signal outside by the front door is off the charts.  Will eventually replace the Ring 2 but it wont be replaced by another Ring product.
title: Second Time Around And My Last

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kepa Zubeldia
content: It takes way too long for the doorbell to register on my cell phone or on the Ring Chimes installed in a couple of places in the house. It takes about 30 seconds and that is not acceptable for a doorbell application. Luckily the motion detector rings an about 25 seconds. Not much better, but a little better than the doorbell. If I had known this, I would not have bought this product. Another problem is that the video takes a few minutes to show up in the cell phone app. So, you either watch the video feed live, or you have to wait a few minutes to see who activated the video. This also means that this product is practically useless without the video subscription, because it is very difficult to catch the live video feed, given the delays built into the doorbell process.
title: Takes too long to ring the doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Meir
content: Terrible product, not ready for market. My cheap Chinese cameras work as advertised, this does not. 9/10 times I can't get a video feed at all. When it does, the delay is terrible. The audio barely works. I have done all the troubleshooting and my wifi is excellent. There customer support takes an hour at least before they get you to someone that actually knows anything. And so far even they have not helped. It does work well as a dummy camera I guess.....
title: Terrible lag, doesn't work 9/10 times.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dan
content: Installation fairly easy. The video instructions miss some details, but you can fill in the blanks. The configuration options look promising, but after playing with them for a couple of weeks, I still get flase motion alerts daily. The app is slow to start and connect on my Galaxy S9+. One time I had somebody ring the bell I could not connect timely to talk via app. The video I finally got showed nobody, it was probably from a different time. What I got  for the price is a bulky doorbell button, a camera at my front door, and a sticker warning of video surveillance. The features that made me buy this product are not viable. Very disappointed on a 2.0 version with so many rave reviews.
title: Not impressed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Andrew Soraci
content: Very easy to self install. Works well, but my biggest complaint is the short video recordings. Any motion or doorbell ring results in a 30 second clip, though you miss the first couple seconds due to the video loading and after 30 seconds, the video ends even if there is still motion outside. I would have liked to have an option with retroactive video saving and constant recording while motion is still present. Also being able to adjust the motion zones a bit better would be nice. It would be great if I could increase the range in a specific direction and also decrease it in another. The app also takes a long time to load, meaning if there is motion or a doorbell ring, by the time you get into the app, the person may be gone. Other than all of those things, I still enjoy the doorbell and will likely continue to use it, although to be honest, it's almost not worth the price without the aforementioned features.
title: Good but very limited.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Obed Patty
content: This device will record random cars passing on the street, but the two times we needed it to record illegal behavior, it failed.  We have contacted customer service twice for help, but have been unable to set up the device to record what it should, instead of random cars on the road.  It rarely is activated by someone walking up to the front door, but captures hundreds of cars simply driving by.  Again, no set up changes have mitigated the unreliable activation.  Our hope is that it at least serves as a deterrent  from simply being in view
title: Unreliable video capturing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Christina H.
content: I have two issues with this purchase, 1) operation of the doorbell, and 2) customer service. 1) I got the Ring doorbell because it often takes me a long time to get to the door to answer when someone knocks/rings, and I thought it would be convenient to be able to answer on my phone from wherever I am at the time. However, contrary to what I expected, it takes a long time for the Ring info to show up on my phone, so I'm still getting to the door before Ring notifies me anyway. At one point, tech support suggested that the problem was that my wi-fi signal wasn't strong enough, so I invested more money in a wi-fi extender, but haven't seen any change. So the whole system has been expensive without providing any benefit. I'm sorry now that I got rid of my old doorbell. 2) Customer service: I recently changed my network name and password, so the Ring isn't working at all. I haven't been able to find any clear instructions about how to reset the info on the Ring, and tech support appears to be unavailable at this time (during Covid). So now I'm even worse off than I was before I got the Ring system. I've seldom had a relatively expensive purchase that's been so completely useless.
title: Regret this purchase

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Carlos L.
content: While the picture is clear both day and night, the WIFI signal struggles and clock turns excessively while it tries to catch up. I purchased the WIFI extender and it did not significantly help even though it was plugged in 3 feet from the front door. I went through many technical support calls and it comes down to my internet each time. At times, it will hang or time out when trying to answer the door bell. When it works, its great.
title: Clear Video and night vision but low WIFI signal

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Central California Buyer
content: The system works in that you can see the view as advertised, however, when you get an alert that someone is at the door, it takes so much time for the stream to load that by the time you can see who is at the door they have left.  At present this is only good as historic monitor of what happened earlier (if you buy the additional recording services) or as a deterrent because outsiders think you may be recording them.  It is NO GOOD for interaction with someone at the door in real time!!!
title: Unimpressed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: D. Sanson
content: I absolutely love my Ring Video Doorbell. I have been able to monitor who is outside my door and property without opening the door. I feel quite secure with this wonderful addition at such a small price. I did not get the one with the cameras all over the house, but I sure have been able to avoid solicitors by not having to open my door. Thank you for such a great invention. Dee
title: Ring  Video Doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DJL
content: The concept of this product is awesome, but the execution is lacking!  To start, I got the battery-powered version, and living in the city, there's lots of action outside of my home, so even though I turned the camera so it's parallel with the street, it picks up lots of motion, and the battery is dead in one week or less.  It's a big battery and charging takes 8+ hours.  Additionally, the idea of using my phone (via the app) with this product is unrealistic.  Someone rings the doorbell, I get a notification, need to unlock my phone, load the app, and wait for the video to load.  This process takes about 15 seconds, which doesn't sound like an eternity, but I've learned it's longer than any delivery person is ever willing to wait.  Hence, the sole purpose of this product is useless for me.  Too bad, maybe a future iteration will operate more seemlessly.
title: Dead battery, slow to load video

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Watson
content: Unfortunately, zero stars is not an option.  DO NOT BUY.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. The Ring Doorbell 2 has such a slow response time to motion it is a useless piece of junk and the live view function in the iphone app often requires several tries (and sometimes minutes) to connect.  It does not work as advertised.  I have no idea how or why this is getting so many positive reviews. When the mailman delivers a package to my door, he parks his truck in front of the driveway, walks up the driveway and the walkway to the door (all of which are in the motion sensing region which is set to a hair below the max setting), delivers the package, then walks back out to his truck.  By the time I get the notification on my phone about 30 seconds later (after he’s gone!), all the recorded video captured is him getting back into his truck and driving away!  When I open the app and hit live view it often hangs and takes 2-4 tries to get it to connect.  Once it finally connects the video is nice and clear and not choppy or anything, but it takes 30-120 seconds and several tries to connect to live video in the first place!  It’s as if the doorbell goes to sleep and won’t wake up.  The performance of the Ring Doorbell 2 is absolutely terrible and so is the iphone app. Calling their tech support is a complete waste of time, the only thing they do is try to blame it on the internet connection and/or router.  I have a 160 Mbps connection and a nice high-end router which is only 20 feet from the doorbell (and I can pick up the same strong wifi signal inside my neighbor’s house about 100 feet away, and at the farthest corners of my yard).  Still, just for fun, I moved the router directly behind the front door to test it, maybe 2 or 3 ft from the doorbell, and the performance was the same. Next, it was not clear that without paying for their service, there is absolutely no video recording capability whatsoever.  None.  Not even temporarily for someone who was just at your door 2 min ago.  So without their service, all you will have is the live view option which is never able to connect on the first try and if you are lucky you might get a notification before whoever is at your door gets tired of waiting and leaves. Huge disappointment! RUN AWAY.
title: DO NOT BUY.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SAS
content: Our Ring Doorbell is slow to process the videos. By the time it processes a video the person at the door would be gone! I called the company and took their advice, and purchased a Wifi Extender. We see a little improvement in the speed but not enough to make a big difference. The quality of the video is good, and the night vision is good. Battery life seems to be lasting. Our Ring Doorbell has been installed for over a month and we haven't had to recharge the battery yet. Also, the motion detection seems to vary; sometimes it picks up motion in the street, and sometimes the motion from our cars in the close driveway isn't detected at all. CONSIDER GETTING A NEST DOORBELL INSTEAD! UPDATE 10/12/19: I added 2 photo/screenshots of what happens when I try to view a video or live shot, nearly every time!
title: Slow and Laggy - Very disappointed with this product!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Angelique Novie
content: Didnt realize doorbell wouldnt ring in our home, without buying the plug in RING speaker. Also, would be nice if it had some type of mounting variation, so it could be angled, or protrude away from wall (we can see our driveway, due to our doorframe blocking it. Also, in order to get motion on our front lawn, we have to include the street movements, which means we get a notice when cars go by.....but the pretty chime sound is not bothersome at all....so thats fine.
title: Better than nothing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: FurBabyMom
content: **Update August 2020** I am writing an updated review to express my utter disappointment in my Ring. Since purchase it worked satisfactory, not great but for the price I accepted its flaws. NOW in July 2020 about 50% of my recorded events either won't play or just have a black video. I have called customer service, sat on the phone with them for almost 2 hours, they were not able to fix it. So now they want me to call an escalated customer service to try to fix the issue. I simply do not have the time to sit on the phone with customer service for HOURS on end to try to fix this thing. When it craps out for good I will just buy a real video system. November 2018 Love!!
title: **Not so much Love!! ** DO NOT RECOMMEND

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark Andrews
content: Expected a lot more.  It does work but not the greatest. 1) Pros When it works it is good.  I can see when some people come to the door.  I did sign up for the subscription because it does not work well without it.  That is at extra cost. 2) Cons The fool you by not saying on their commercials that their live view does not work if on battery.  They do not even give you a choice.  This should be in big bold text on the amazon sight.  I would not have purchased that if I knew that. The battery charge did not last as long as they said it would. Sometime the you review the film and nothing is there because it did not turn on at time. It might be better if there was electricity to it but I do not have that.  I would ask Ring to be more up front about the live ring rather than leave unsatisfied customers.  It will hurt them in the long term.
title: A little okay - misleading with live view.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ben
content: Our landlord has some sketchy people living with her who in turn bring around even sketchier people and we needed to start somewhere in making sure our porch had cameras in case those sketchy people came knocking on our door. The rings motion detection has been awesome and it has been a peace of mind for us to know who might be around and in case someone does come up on our porch for some reason we have them on tape. The video quality could be a little bit better but this more for peace of mind than anything! Awesome product and we are planning to get a spotlight cam if the doorbell keeps performing as it should
title: Worth the price

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kenneth C. Fitzpatrick
content: Pretty disappointing considering all of the publicity and advertising.  Even with a wifi extender, it takes 30 seconds to connect and respond to a ring-- most of the time, many will have walked away by the time I connect.  I get multiple false alarms on motion detection from cars driving by on the street, even with all of the changes and adapters recommended by the Ring FAQ webpage.  Calls and emails to customer support went unanswered.  On top of all of this, you have to pay for a monthly subscriptions service to use most of the features. Considering all of the cool advertising, I effectively bought a $200 doorbell.  I like the concept, but there are many bugs that need worked out before I could recommend this to anyone.
title: Disappointing Product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JD
content: This is a product that is just OK. A good idea with poor execution. It doesn’t always show video. Keep saying is connecting. I’ve had three of these. Major software issue with sound, that as of August 2019 has not been addressed with Ring. Both iPhone and Samsung cell phones have intermittent sound issues which clearly is a software problem. Check the ring forms and it’s all over the place.
title: Major software issue involving sound on all ring video 2 doorbells

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: sweetpea30
content: There is a delay... my husband was in the house before the camera could focus on him.  Also, we have ours hard wired and we still have to charge the battery inside because we use live view from time to time.  The ring will tell You when a car passes by but you can adjust the range, so that is a plus.  Overall it works good, just a few tweaks would be great to get it more real time so you see what is happening when it is happening.
title: It serves its purpose

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kailee
content: Love this product. My only complaint is that I wish you could draw out motion zones to avoid street while still receiving wide peripheral motion detection along yard. Set up is relatively easy, I have no trouble with battery life as I have my device hard wired.
