I recommend this product to anyone, I will be purchasing a ring indoor camera to monitor my new puppy while I'm at work as well.
title: Another pleased customer review

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Betsy Horvath
content: I purchased the Ring doorbell and installed it as instructed.  It really was easy to install!  Now for the testing..........my son came over and rang the doorbell, I tried to speak to him but it sounded like a jumbled mess of alien language that nobody has ever heard. Considering the device is OUTSIDE my house and my router is INSIDE, my signals were strong but hey, who doesn't want more.  I decided to take Rings suggestion and purchase the Chime Pro.  It was delivered the next day, thank you Amazon for notifying me that the package was left because the Ring Doorbell didn't.  In the meantime on Sunday I had contacted Customer Service, 19 minute wait time and a general response via email 5 hours later!  They offer no resolution just acknowledging that they got my request for speedy customer service. Next I contacted my internet provider and increased my speed, instant results on the speed test, thank you! I get another email from Ring - 06/17/2019 @ 2:12 pm in response to my original email sent 06/16/2019 @ 3:58 pm asking me for a verification code.  I was never sent one!  They "re-send" that code.  Keep in mind that per Ring's suggestion when you contact them, you should be near your device so they can assist you.  It's now been over 24 hours that they wanted me next to the device.  Sorry, I have a job. After moving the router, moving the Ring Chime Pro and multiple other attempts, there are 3 hours of my life that I will never get back.  It repeatedly said that it would connect to the wi-fi but not the internet.  Again, I'm thinking that if I use the Chime Pro it will increase the connection and make all systems work wonderfully.  I contact Customer service through chat, I write 3 messages to them - the last one was "hello" because I was not getting a response.  (this was at 6/18/2019 at 1:39 am) they must be in a really different time zone because it was about 630 pm my time. Now I get a message from them, thanking me for the code I sent to them 12 hours earlier.  They suggest I move the Ring device next to the router or the router next to the device.  Keep in mind I can't figure out how the heck I'm suppose to move the outside of my entry way (you know that place you normally attach a doorbell to) next to the router INSIDE my house without causing some major damage.  I also am at a loss as to how I can move the router to the door without disconnecting it. I'm not a rocket scientist, I admit that.  Yet even I can figure out that 1) in order to move the device next to the router it means uninstalling the doorbell or 2) moving the router next to the device means disconnecting the router. While I'm learning the product, I will keep the doorbell with the understanding that it is merely a nice light for people to see what button to push to ring the bell.  I understand that notifications of people at my front door will be few and far between, I did get one notification today after testing it out again - 15 minutes AFTER the motion was detected - better than not at all. I think the product MIGHT be ok, who knows.  In the meantime I am waiting for Customer Service to figure out how I can move my device that is hard wired to the outside of my house closer to the router that is 15 ft away
title: I'm not sure if the product works but I know the customer service doesn't

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tazman5150
content: It picks up motion and starts recording AFTER a person is already reaching for my doorbell. So it really feels like a late start. Also even though I set the motion detection zone outside of the street, it still picks up trucks going buy even though they are outside the zone. Irritating. Plus screw Ring because they have security as bad as Facebook. And we all know how great FACEBOOK is at keeping info private. I will say, that the battery lasts for months at a time. But when it gets to about 15%...it drains FAST.
title: Great with a caveat

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Don D.
content: I bought this camera as I wanted to have video feedback for deliveries and people coming onto my front porch.  I've had this for a month now and it's been next to worthless.  I have spent a lot of time trying to adjust the sensitivity to not alert me every time a car drives by.  Depending on the time of day, the angle of the sun, clouds, etc, I will either get a notice for every movement of vehicles or nothing.  Rarely is it in the middle.  The response time for the motion tracking when people actually come on my porch is horrible.  It is about 20 feet from the street to my door with a clear view.  I have never had it alert me to someone approaching my door, only alerting me when they are already at the door or even worse when they are already leaving my porch.  I'm a frequent Amazon purchaser and I have never seen the face of the delivery people when they leave packages, only their retreating backs.  What value does it provide to tell me someone was there with no face?  After a month of the "free trial" of ring +, today that ran out and I discovered that I can't even see what triggered a motion alert or door bell ring since I didn't want to pay to store pictures of cars driving by all day.  I completely regret this purchase as it is way overhyped and doesn't even perform its basic function very well.  I could have spent $10 for a button that would have provided me with more accurate information of if someone was at my door.  There is no option to integrate this doorbell with an existing security system so it's a one off, that performs poorly, and becomes useless if you don't sign up for monthly payments to store the videos you should be able to save wherever you want rather than being locked in to an overpriced service to review unnecessary alerts.  I would not recommend this product to anyone that wants it for the security aspect.  In testing I was able to get on my porch, take a box, and leave without any notice of the activity.
title: Over hyped, poorly performing product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael D. Pechner
content: day and night images are great.  Since it detects my very active neighbors door also, I do not think the battery will last 6-12 months.  At 69% after a month. Android app will only use internal storage.  NOT GOOD.  Will not use SD card. Also,  never received a notice when the battery was very low. It just stopped recording one day. When you set sensitivity up and your door faces your neighbor's,  battery lasts less than 3 months.  I checked because I was going out of town.  I wanted to make sure the battery was still charged. Saw battery low and nothing recorded for a couple of days.
title: Works well - but android app has an issue

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rhonda Montgomery
content: I got this for my Daughter and her family as a Christmas Gift. My daughter lives in a townhouse whose door faces the street. They don't have a door bell. I only mention this because someone asked me that same question. Installation was fairly easy. After installation they would  get alerts on their cell phone when someone walks by. Less than  one week after installation my daughter sent me an video of a man at 1AM in the morning approaching their door, looking inside their mailbox, checking out the kitchen window then upon seeing the Ring flipped it off and walked away. Holy Crap !!! If that doesn't endorse this product maybe this will. They receive alerts and videos from other Ring owners located near them. I ordering one for myself.
title: Do you really want to know ??? YES!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Hinson
content: So I have looked into getting a Ring doorbell for sometime, recent crime in my area forced my hand to invest.  I am a parent with 2 small children so it was important to get something that WORKED and was able to send notifications when im out and about or not in my living room near the front door.  My Ring Doorbell experience is like this.  Extremely easy to install and set up.  Video quality is very very sub par.  I have very good wifi coverage and speed far above the recommended speed that Ring says is the minimum.  Yet my live video is slow to load, video stutters constantly and images tear.  A person can look like they transport on Star Trek in my front yard rather than walk or even run.  Its embarrassing how poorly this video works.  The motion alerts work pretty well, but since the video lags so badly and records so subpar even if the motion is set off, the person can be gone before video captures them.
title: So disappointed!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shannon branham
content: The installation was fairly simple. The picture is good except for the fish eye effect. I am able to hear people speaking clearly when they come to the door but the speaker volume is not that great. People are having to lean into the device to hear me speaking even with the volume at max. Update: absolutely hate this thing. The motion sensor goes off constantly for no reason. I've set it multiple times to take a picture every 5 minutes but it still will only do it every 15 minutes. When my subscription is up I'm getting one that records constantly and hopefully with a better night vision.
title: Speaker volume not great.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael Norris
content: Does what it's supposed to do, alert motion and ringing of door bell. Seems to "lag" a bit behind on alert but not to bad. The mounting screws for the unit's heads are to small, they pull through the frame. I used 1-1/4" drywall screws to mount this more securely. Battery level is at 63% after 6 days of use but I purchased and extra battery pack because it takes 6 hours to charge, no down time that way. Time will tell how good this truly is.
title: So far so good after 6 days

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lizistrata
content: Easy to set up - had some initial connection issues, but after moving our router around, it was fine.  The first week or so, we had it on senstivie motion and the battery (as it said) died after literally ONE WEEK.  We have since turned down the motion sensor to the middle setting and it's been fine. (Still would prefer to use the high sensor, though.) I do wish it would pick up motion farther away. It really only notifies us when someone is coming up to the camera. Our Amazon CloudCams pick up motion from far away, and it's much more useful. This is a little limited.  Overall, a good buy and would recommend.
title: So far so good - not perfect but a good product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Raymond C.
content: The unit detects most cars that go by on my very quite street, even though I've got is set on the most insensitive setting and the street is further away than the motion detection should detect. This unit also could really use an attachment that points the unit both down and to the side.  Currently the attachments allow only one or the other.  The motion recording is too slow to capture the important beginning of what one would want to see.  Worst, I constantly get idiot reports of stupid things like 'people are knocking on my door during a covid-19 scare.'  I wish I knew how to turn them off. The support people could be replaced by a bag of hammers. GET THE GOOGLE NEST.  HANDS DOWN BETTER.
title: Too sensitive

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nina
content: I returned the product. It was not working properly with all iPhone versions. I had to install it on my iphone7 and add husband with iPhone 5 as a user. He could not be an admin. For every ring- everyone’s phone in the house was going crazy- your WiFi information will be stored in cloud ( of course ) for the product to work properly. The battery can be unscrewed and taken out by anyone outside of your house, which disables the device if you don’t wanna mess with existing wiring. Audio is not really great ( it’s acceptable) . Everyone these days know that most likely the person answering the ring, is not in the house ( personal thought). I think a set of outdoor security camera with closed circuits that only records video on an internal storage will be a better choice.
title: Not working with my iPhone 5

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Andres Vergara Jr
content: I expected more from this product.  I have Frontier internet with speeds running about 250-300 Mbps My router is about 15 feet away from my ring doorbell yet it lags to connect quickly and says signal weak.  Commercial show that owners can communicate through the doorbell device yet when attempting people outside do not understand what is being said.  They need to improve the speaker quality.  When motion is detected and begins to record many times it's when the person are just feet away from the door.  Attempted to adjust the sensor but it's a catch 22. If you set it out to far the it is constantly ringing on your app and if its to close tan it's to late to react before your notified and connect.  The night vision quality is terrible.  I have a camera in my back yard that has better night vision and sensor quality. Overalll definitely not worth the money.
title: Very disappointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: greg
content: Works, but isn’t the best...not 100% signal all the time and doesn’t always load Switched to eufy wireless ...battery lasts much much much longer and wired doorbell in my opinion is better than the ring Haven’t had one loss of signal or glitch since replaced with the eufy wireless cameras and battery lasts about 15 times longer per charge
title: Decent at best

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: PCB
content: OK, it took me too long to buy one....don't wait like I did.  I am a 75 year old woman and I installed it in 15 minutes....the instructions are great.  One neat life hack is that when I am work and my husband is at home, if he misplaces his cell (we do not have a landline).....he rings the doorbell and with the chiming from the doorbell.....he finds his cell.....also, he got locked out the other day....he pressed the Ring until I answered and I could talk with him.....I hurried home from my neighbors and let him in......life hacks & Ring.....
title: I love my RIng doorbell...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Anom
content: My Ring doorbell purchase last week was my first experience with this company / it’s products. Installation was easy and well instructed, and thus far product works great. No issues although I’ve ony been using it for a week. Assuming this remains the case, I consider this an excellent value for the cost and the labor time was minimal particularly for someone with zero handyman skills (the only tool I own is an electrical drill). I’m So pleased with this product that a few days later I also purchased the Ring alarm kit and the spotlight camera. Same results as the doorbell, easy setup and works great. Very pleased with my purchase and I’m considering buying these same products for a family member as a gift (I’ll wait a few months to make sure all is still going smoothly with my home system).
title: Excellent value for overall price

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chad Navarro
content: night vision sucks on this thing all i get is very darkness i include a screen shot and when i texted cs they said it was in night vision i was seeing i told them what is this a new night vision bc my other poe camara is in black and white and i see everything.then they told me i need a light outside what the hell does that mean i have it at my front door with a light above the door it like this cam doesn't have night vision junk dont buy if you house is dark bc you will not see anything at night
title: night vision

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GeneKeating
content: 1. We love Ring.  No more going to the door to see if a package came since it notifies us.  Paired with ALexa, we know if somebody is at the door even if we can't hear the doorbell or knocking.  I've gotten so used to feeling the vibraition when I come and go that I can tell if I left the iphone. 2. Works really well, works at night. 3. However, it took me 30 seconds to view on my iphone from the time i had the phone in my hands.  you have to pull up the app and it has to load the prgram, then load the live video.  So, visitors have to wait.
title: love it, paired with Alexa and we know right away if there's a package.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Midway's Finest
content: Be warned. Horrible app and website. Makes the device nearly worthless. Wish I never bought it. App was so pathetic, started using the website. Then the website started making me have a new 5 digit code sent to my email, to then use back on the website, just to log in. EVERY SINGLE TIME! Over and over and over.  And of course, no tech help from Amazon. My 8 year old ran into the house today, after some creep approached him from a van. Camera caught nothing, even though the guy was standing 2ft in front of it! Battery was "low" when I went to check afterwards. No indication of battery issues before that. This thing is worthless. Makes me sick!
title: Do not buy

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: KTan
content: Likes: App is user-friendly, convenience of being able to communicate with visitors/see what’s occurring at home from anywhere. I’m a pretty handy woman, but I’m not an electrician by ANY means. Still, I was able to remove my existing doorbell and install the Ring doorbell all by myself in about 30 mins... and most of that time was spent drilling holes into the brick exterior of my home. Dislikes: I adjusted the ring doorbell’s motion settings several times and it would still alert me when someone drove past my home. I gave up adjusting it and the notification tapered off after a few weeks; so it resolved itself. Sometimes the connection is slow but it only happens once in a while.
title: Good buy overall.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DB
content: Purchased Ring Video Doorbell 11/21/18. Installed unit but since have been disappointed with runtime on battery having to recharge battery every 2 days. Called Ring tech support 3/01/19, spoke to Kelly and went through settings. We tried for over 1 hour to resolve issue.  She documented all test and explained that after verification of drain down, Ring would ship me a replacement unit. Kelly asked me to call back in 24-48 hours if Ring tech support didn't call. Called Ring tech support 3/04/19 at 1:00PM and spoke to Enrique. Gave him access to my Ring Doorbell 2 and verified battery was almost dead after just 2 1/2 days.  At which point he wanted to go through all settings again, totally different from what I was told on Friday. Asked to speak to a supervisor where he explained that supervisor was busy and would call me back in 15-20 minutes. No-one  called and it is now more than 6 hours later! Clearly i received a defective unit but lack of customer support makes it worthless. PLEASE don't make the same mistake I did. BUYER BEWARE Update: I was contacted by Alexis ( very bright, capable and patient individual)  from customer support who sent me a replacement. When new unit arrived, she helped me setup new unit. Replacement works perfectly and I am a very happy. Thank you Alexis.
title: Defective Ring Video Doorbell 2 - Tech Support nightmare

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JM Wheeler
content: Works well. Came with great instructions and it was very easy to install. The app is not a quick as it should be. I've missed a few rings because I was waiting for the app to load. Also, it would be nice to be able to adjust the volume of the speaker and microphone on the device. Overall, its a great device and I would highly recommend this device and other ring devices.
title: works well.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. L. Seamans
content: Got this unit to replace our broken doorbell and upgrade your smart device. Install was easy and online said it was easy as well. I am works as advertised in the battery has a pretty good life but the motion detection seems to pick up too much motion too far away and I can’t seem to get it calibrated correctly so either I turn it off or I’m notified of every car that drives by my house at 100 feet away .  That being said it is a great unit and I don’t regret purchasing it.
title: Works well but he text too much movement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Venus Thues
content: Motion detector seems to have a mind of its own. At first, it was picking up everything, then we adjusted the settings according to the instructions, now get notifications randomly. We purchased the ring wifi extender as well as an additional wifi extender from our internet carrier to boost the device's capability to sense movement AND TO NOTIFY us in relative real-time. When we do get receive notification that someone is at the door and try to speak to them, the sound is again, delayed as well as distorted. We
title: We Tried to Like It

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bob
content: Ring is my second video doorbell. The first one was descent, but I could not set up motion sensors because it was too sensitive.  The sound quality was terrible and the video quality fair. The Ring resolved all of these problems. Motion sensitivity is controlled by distance and zones. It works perfectly with no false alarms. The sound quality is excellent and the Video quality  is the icing on the cake. The Ring Doorbell 2 is the right one. Period
title: This is the Right One

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. Saavedra
content: Pros- Easy setup Good video quality* Good sound quality* Customer support has been great Cons- The video quality and sound quality up top had to be noted with an asterisk. They are great, WHEN it works. Randomly gets stuck in night mode Often can’t get into live stream mode Misses motion sensor activity It’s a great piece of hardware saddled with incredibly spotty software. I love it when it works, but I shouldn’t have to preface a $200 piece of technology with “when it works”.
title: Pros- Easy setup Good video quality* Good sound quality* Customer support ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: RonC
content: Before buying, take a real good look at where you will be placing it. In my case, my front door is recessed and up 3 steps, plus I have vinyl siding. The vinyl will cause a slight problem aiming it down. It comes with one vertical wedge (5 degree down) and one horizontal wedge. Not enough wedges and additional ones are $19 per pair (1 of each type).  My case, I need an additional 2 verticals to get it to see the landing. That’s $38 more and 2 useless side wedges. They also are needed since the street is around 15 feet so vehicles are tripping the sensor frequently. The recess causes the motion sensor to tunnel; the left and right sensors pick up the walls on either side; center is really all that will be of value. If your walkway is straight in front of your door, it might be ok. But if the walkway starts from the side you won’t get a notification until the person is standing at your door. As for the detection and the video quality - that is pretty good. You can try to modify the “cone” for the motion detection, so if you don’t have the obstacles noted above it should work fine for you. There is also the monthly or annual fee for use of the cloud storage, but that has already been noted in other comments.
title: Not for every house - evaluate your layout first

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patricia P.
content: Very happy with this overall. I bought a an Echo show, thinking it would alert me. It does not. I can ask Echo to show me the camera view, but that is after I have been alerted by some other device. Not loud enough for my hearing impaired spouse, so needed two extra chimes and really 3 for him to be able to hear it. Took Numerous times to get Ring loaded on his phone. There is a 10 - 15 second or more delay after the alert, but we are internet challenged, so others may have a more rapid response.  We did not have a door bell. I would not have been able to install this without my spouse who had the tools and know how to do  it.
title: Wish I could get an alert from Alexa Show

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scott
content: Easy to install. But sometimes " Live View " wont load. So you have to close the app and try again.  Also I have other cameras that are 1080p.  It might be 1080p if you are face to face but a few feet away and picture sucks, and yes my internet speeds are fast enough.  I do like it for the 2 way Audio but sometimes people cant understand what I am saying.  Yes again I checked my speed.  So its just okay, but it's not worth $ 200.00. plus 3 dollar monthly charge. Also customer support seems willing to ask lots of questions not answer them.
title: Not worth the money !

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: widget
content: What a bad decision this was. Purchased the Doorbell2  9 months ago (June2019). So now I have a $159 crap device that barely gives me any new information over the 18 year old doorbell it replaced. 1. Wi-fi connection is terrible. I have a pretty robust wi-fi connection with Comcast and all devices in the house have quick and consistent performance with it. Ring is SO SLOW. When someone rings the doorbell, the phone app may come up 3, 4, 5 minutes later if it comes up at all. 2. The only notification that is still working is Alexa Echo, the phone app gives me no notifications at all now. 3. When the battery needs to be replaced, I have to go thru a complete reset of the device. 4. Expensive. $159 for a doorbell/nothing else. Give me a break. 5. The settings and dashboard give you no real control over notifications or alerts. If you are considering this turn around and run away as fast as you can. On top of that it is now in the Amazon empire so good luck with that. I usually do not give ratings on ANYTHING, but I just have to get this off of my chest. What a waste of money and energy.
title: Piece of expensive junk

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michelle H.
content: Ring is having serious manufacturing quality control issues with their doorbell 2.  I am returning my second one to amazon for the same issue as the first and don't know if I am giving them a third chance. A read through of some threads on the ring community message boards reveals many others with the same problems. 1. My ring doorbell 2 has issues with two way talk.  I get an echo of myself about 1/2 second later, it is hard for someone at the door to understand me and hard for me to understand someone at the door.  This is one of the primary features of the ring, one which they tout, so it really should work.  I had no issues with an older ring classic. 2. The device makes some kind of electronic hum when it switches to night mode.  This hum is completely hardware related, you can take it off the wall. hold it in your hand and run it on battery power.  Put it next to your ear and faintly hear the hum in night mode.  This hum is picked up and amplified by the microphone and makes night recordings and communication unusable. 3.  These issues seem prevalent recently which leads me to think they have a bad part from a supplier that has affected an entire recent manufacturing run.  Contacting ring only elicits the typical cookie cutter troubleshooting response of have you reset the device, have you checked wifi blah blah blah. By the time most tech people like myself contact support we are beyond tier 1 and 2, please don't insult our intelligence.  Yes, now what?  Silence, and try to delay past the return window. Until ring gets these issues sorted, I would strongly advise against purchasing one right now.  If you are unsure, take a look at the ring community message boards.
title: Manufacturing quality control problems

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robert P. Karolak
content: I have given the Ring Video Doorbell 2 an ENTIRE YEAR to prove itself.  I have tried everything possible to make this thing work.  NO LUCK.  Initially, I had the button mounted without the wedge.  Then I tried it with the wedge tilting up, then with the wedge tilting down.  Although we are 35 feet back from the street, I have motion detection set for 5 to 15 feet.  I got the Ring Chime Pro and have it placed within 4 feet of the front door, hoping to boost the wifi signal.  I even purchased an addition wifi extender from our internet provider and placed it within 6 feet of the Ring Chime Pro.  We still don't get worthwhile service from this thing. Quite often it will pick up cars going down the street, which should be well beyond where I have motion detection set.  Yet there a many, many times where it does not pick up our U. S. Postal Carrier - and the mailbox is about a foot over from the doorbell.  And FedEx and UPS are also able to avoid detection as well.  And in the last couple of days, the video has begun to "freeze up".  Today it did catch the Postal Carrier coming up the steps.  The video froze when he hit the top step.  After the video resumes, you see him heading back down the stairs. I don't know what else I can do.  I'd love to hear from someone at Ring or Amazon (yes, I know...Amazon owns Ring) as to any options that I may have.  I have a sizable investment here and the performance is beyond terrible.
title: This is the most TERRIBLE product I have ever purchased

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patricia Phelps
content: Just another piece of technology to drive you crazy. More China crap. I've had it since Christmas and it works for a few weeks and for no reason shuts down. I even have the ring chime booster, which I didn't need, connected to it. My son re-booted it at least a dozen times and continues to do the same thing. We've been on the phone with support more times then I can believe and all my results come back as working perfectly......but there's still no video. Basically it's just a $200. door bell now. My neighbor has the same problem and so does my son. You want a security camera, get a hard wired one and be done with it.
title: Real garbage

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bob. Gould
content: The cameras work fine, but Ring's online system sucks!  I have 3 doorbell cams, two spotlight cams, and one solar powered cam that I have gotten over time, and now Ring is bugging me about Ring protect being about to end when I already set up auto pay.  The cameras work fine, but only one can connect at once, so they miss anything that moves from camera to camera, and by the time we get a notification of activity and try to respond the person has long ago left.  It's NOT as advertised!
title: Service not as advertised

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: JJAmazon Customer
content: I had high hopes for the Ring Doorbell. They were dashed. The battery life is atrocious and it constantly loses its WiFi connection, even though is installed no more than 20' from my router. Had to disable motion detection because it was detecting everything, to the point of annoyance. Great concept, horrible execution. I cannot recommend this product.
title: Very disappointing product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jon Powers
content: I upgraded from the  Blink XT motion system. The Ring doorbell 2 has many more features and is easier to control the motion. The rechargeable battery is wonderful ! No more buying expensive AA lithium batteries. The Ring system is very to set up and If you already own a amazon echo product you can interface the doorbell with it to allow you to receive alerts that someone is at the door. Because of this you don’t need to buy the indoor ringer. The cost to retain your videos from the doorbell is $30 a year but well worth the price. I’m very impressed with the features and flexibility of the Ring system.
title: High quality doorbell/motion security system  !

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: laptopcustomer
content: Great product. After the first 30-day trial, I was not able to access recordings of the day, and events were not stored on my Ring account without a $3 or $10 subscription. Nonetheless, being able to get a live view on demand, and/or being able to remotely answer the door is great. WiFi signal is excellent with the use of a mesh network. My one complaint is that motion detection is not that effective despite using the Ring app to optimize the field of view for motion detection. Oftentimes people need to stand right in front of the Ring camera before I get alerted.
title: Good with motion detection improvement needed.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brian Kuzma
content: Good camera but gave up on trying to mess with motion detection settings. The “motion wizard” and all crap to help you set the detection is useless. My camera is on my front porch, raised above walkway, 30+ feet from roadway with motion detection set close and it still picks up every vehicle driving by. Battery dies monthly but at least ring sends me a notice when that happens. Subscription seem like a con to be able to use all the features like playback which is the whole reason to buy a camera in the first place.
title: Not bad

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tom-81
content: Not sure exactly how this system is supposed to work but when used on a porch that the steps are at 90 degrees from the front door the motion detection is spotty at best.  Often get motion alerts with video showing nothing. No alerts when mail carrier  or paper delivery person have arrived or maybe they did when video shows nothing. Motion alert videos do not show for about a minute after the "chime" rings. All in all as a security device it is lacking. To get it to work even marginally have to put multiple wedges (which you have to paint ) which makes the whole rig stick way out from the door facing.  Cosmetically not wonderful.
title: Not great for 90 degree steps to front porch

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jordan
content: I had such high hopes for this device because oddly enough my front door doesn't have a peephole and I hate it, so Ring seemed like the perfect solution! That being said, this is so glitchy it's actually laughable, from the device to the app. I can't even say that it works as a regular doorbell because it pauses on the chime to load it! The video quality was awful and the notifications never worked or were so delayed it was ridiculous. I followed all of the trouble shooting tutorials and it said my connection was strong and I had all my notification settings turned on. Save your money, look elsewhere.
title: Terrible Device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Astrodonkey
content: The doorbell is ok.  It does the job.  Hooked up to my Alexa and I can see who I'm ignoring at the door. I'm not really a fan.  You have to pay a ripoff $3 "cloud" fee to store your videos.  So, you can't even look back at today's videos which makes the thing just an annoying buzzer in your pocket. Oh, and don't get me started on the "Neighbors" feature.  Welcome to NextDoor for Ring!  Basically it's a bunch of your (anonymized) neighbors posting stupid videos of people taking packages or "OMG THERE'S A BLACK GUY RINGING MY DOORBELL". All in all I wish I hadn't bought this thing.  I liked not having a doorbell better.
title: Rip off $3 montly charge, stupid "neighbors" feature constantly sending alerts

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chad
content: Although it may not be fair to rate Night Vision and WiFi signal because one camera is on the inside of a window which creates a glare at night and some of the items are configured pretty far from my WiFi access point. I rated it according to how it operates for me. You could definitely get around some the issues I've created for myself. I think this product is actually pretty awesome and have started to expand to more devices throughout my home and yard. I would definitely recommend this product.
title: I love this product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Aimster
content: I’m thrilled with the product so far.  Installation was easy & they provided everything I needed, even a drill bit!  😊 The doorbell gives me a lot less false movements than other cameras I had. The false movements it picks up is mostly shadows/reflections from trucks as I live on a busy street.  The wedge helps to keep the motion from the road being picked up.  I think my favorite feature is to announce the activity through my Alexa devices.  I would love it if they could add a TEXT option or an additional email notification so I can have it text me notices as well. I love this so much I’m looking to add on an additional outside camera.
title: Great product!  Very few false motion notifications!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Timothy Parker
content: Ring would definitely be making this a shot out of the park but the only thing that I can honestly complain about is that the motion sensor on the battery powered doorbell 2 does not pick up fast enough as frequently as it should. Also there is a 1-2-3 second distortion at the beginning of most videos when it appears that it's trying to convert up to 1080p quality even though I have gigabit internet speed with a router less than three feet away from the unit. I wish I had a wired doorbell to see if a different version made a difference but since I am in an apartment I had to make do.
title: Works as expected with room for improvement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lanielu
content: Great concept, pretty good device, terrible software. I have to wait sometimes five or ten minutes before I can see who was at my door! I need a camera that gives me a live feed with no delays, especially when activated with motion alerts! REALLY EXPENSIVE to be so worthless! It wasn’t always so terrible - I’ve had them about a year now. Used to get a better connection. I really like the community watch  aspect of the app - it’s extremely helpful and quite eye-opening, but I’m getting something else for all my other doors. I need something that works!
title: Video Delays Render It Useless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Duncan
content: This is a great addition to any home. I was using ADT security, but will be switching to go with Ring full time with their security package. Saving a lot of money with a lot more user features. No need for a service installation, and you can monitor your devices health to see when batteries need replacing. No service calls, no BS. You decide what you need and chose your options. The doorbell was definitely a gateway device only leaving me wanting more. You won't be disappointed at all if you are even slightly tech savvy.
title: A must have for anyone in a busy city!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dee Carpenter
content: If you live in below zero temperatures, beware.  The batteries will freeze and the doorbell stops working.  I bought an extra set of batteries and have to change them weekly or even every 3-4 days.  If the temp is 32 to 0, I don't know because I didn't notice at first.  But I am alert to it now and will post any updates I get. One other thing I don't like is the fact nothing can be recorded unless I pay Ring $10 a month.  That's more than some streaming services.  I think their rate is excessive and they should devise an app that we can have or even purchase that will take care of recording.
title: Batteries don't hold a charge in cold weather

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Srivats Ravichandran
content: Very convenient and must have product for every house owner. Easy to capture video and monitor who is stopping by at the house. Notifications sometimes are a few moments late but that doesn't make too much of a difference. I can talk to the person at the door from wherever I am and communicate regarding anything including packages and if there is someone to perform work at the house. The subscription is cheap as well for storing video and with my Ring Alarm product I will be installing soon, I will get full video backup without any high costs unlike other products out there like Nest.
title: One of the best investment I have made for my new home

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jeremy Fertig
content: When this camera works it is quite good.  However it uses a rechargeable battery as a primary power source even when hardwired.  If (read when) the battery charge is low you will need to pull the battery out and recharge it.  Not really difficult to be honest but should not be needed if hardwired in my opinion Rings answer to this issue is to reduce sensitivity and record less.  Sigh
title: Not recommended

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: mynameis
content: Ring is designed as a money pit with their subscription ($30/year) model. The 30 days FREE is designed to make you keep the product so that you don't realize how useless it is until after the 30 day return period. That’s why the subscription is PRE-ACTIVATED.  By time you realize you can’t see Motion, unless you answer the motion alert with 15 seconds, it’s too late to return because guess what Amazon 30 days return expired(as did the subscription). It is practically useless without the subscription because you can’t see Motion that happened unless you answer the ring RIGHT AWAY(within 15seconds)! If you answer after the 15 seconds it gives you an error or tells you need a subscription.  Really disappointed that Amazon, a customer centric company, would allow Ring, with their bait and switch tactics, allow customers to be taken like this! In 15 years as a amazon shopper I’ve never felt this way about Amazon  or  it’s new way of doing things.
title: Subscription designed to be money pit and 30 days free keeps you from returning

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Marshall G. Mintz
content: We live in a townhome complex where the buzzer for admittance dates from 1981 and the parts are no longer available.  I needed a doorbell and picked the Ring Video Doorbell 2.  Installation was a snap, as long as you have a drill to mount the device on the stucco.  I had (and to a certain extent still have) a problem with a weak wi-fi signal going out to the device. I called customer service and spoke to Max, who was incredibly helpful.  He offered to send me out their Ring Chime Pro, which has a range extender, but I had tried that unsuccessfully.  I bought a more powerful wi-fi extender and all is good.  Kudos to customer service.
title: A necessary device.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jeff Davis
content: This was super quick and very easy to install.  All of the instructions were spot on and never really had to re-read anything.  Very intuitive and works great in a spot that typically has a low wi-fi signal.  The only reason that I took it down one start is the "neighborhood" portion of the app.  I feel strongly that people need to post true safety incidents and its turning into a facebook-like platform for missing cats, and solicitors.  If they could work on that portion of it, I'd give 10 stars.
title: Great Product, Great App

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Latrice
content: Im looking over reviews and I'm not sure why so many ppl are having issues.  Mine works perfectly.  I purchased my first Ring on Black Friday.  I installed myself in 15 mins (setting up to mounting). I installed before mounting.  I love it so much I purchased another one for my back door.  Then I went back and purchased the Ring alarm system which only took me 20 mins to install.  Guess what? Fed Ex said they delivered 4 boxes today. My Ring only show 2. So its definitely the best. It connects to Alexa just fine.
title: Amazing Device & Easy set up

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J from GA
content: The Ring has so much promise, but falls a little short. The video often does not pick up until the delivery man walks off the porch/stoop. It should pick him up as he approaches the door. It is as if there is a lag. We also have the same problem if someone rings the doorbell. If someone rings, you will get an alert on your phone. By the time you get the live camera activated, half the time they are walking off. This lag makes it far less helpful. The functionality is good and the Ring app is pretty good, but for the lag.
title: Pretty good, but not great yet - motion lag

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kelly
content: But I didn't.  Finally got around to installing it.  After trying to get it to work for days and then spending half a day off and on with Ring support we determined the device was faulty.  Unfortunately there's no warranty so I'm stuck.  No more warehouse sales for me. Edit: Don't know what happened but after recharging the battery all night long (again) I inserted it in the device, let it sit all day then did the set up, it worked.  Don't know how long it will last so I only upped the star count to four.  We'll see now how good it is.
title: Should have installed it right away/ Edit - it's working now.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nicolelyn
content: We have had the Ring 2 Doorbell for 3 months now. Up until last night it had been working perfectly, detecting every motion. Last night was the first time in a long time I forgot to lock my car and was robbed. My gym bag was stolen, which had expensive sneakers, headphones, and sentimental items in it. It DID NOT detect any motion and I have no ID of the person or video evidence to show police. So the service I pay for was useless and the device did not do it’s job when I needed it to. Very odd. Also wasn’t getting notifications on my phone for some reason. Spent an hour on the phone with their customer service and am not satisfied at all. A lot of talking in circles and excuses. It seems this device has mixed reviews and now I can see why. Not sure if I will continue to use this subscription service or get something more reliable. Very unhappy right now.
title: Mixed Feelings

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R. Seshan
content: I am very happy with the ring door bell 2 I bought at black Friday deal.  It has been only 1 week, so I do not have a whole lot of experience with it.  But so far it is doing what I want.  The installation was easy using the Tools and instructions that came with it.  The only other Tool I needed was to drill holes in the Stucco to mount the backing plate.  I used the provided angle back plate and turned out nice with good coverage.  Image quality is really good.  I have to play with the coverage range setting a bit I think.  The last video it captured of the UPS guy delivering a packet was too brief.  I think if I increase the coverage range, it will capture a longer video of the person walking in from the end of the walkway towards the house.
title: Very happy with the ring door bell 2 I bought at black Friday deal

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard Sutherland
content: The TV commercials sparked my interest in this item.  We have had issues with parcels being stolen from our porch. My first complaint is that the camera does a very poor job of motion detection. We get alerts when bright shiny trucks drive by but it sometimes fails to notice a person. Second, the app is slow. Our wifi is very decent yet, the app is slow to respond. If the door bell  rings while I am not home, the caller is usually gone before I  can respond. Last, and why should this surprise me, there is a monthly fee, far more than I  would ever pay for a product that does not deliver. I opted for the minimum 3.00 a month service and if  I didn't pay that, this thing would be worthless.  I feel as though I  threw away 200.00. To add insult,  the price for this item dropped a fee days after I made my purchase.
title: Great concept, but falls short of delivering

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SoCalVal559
content: Loving it. Install was semi easy. Comes with tools and extra screws. Also comes with two different angle brackets to adjust view. I purchased an additional bracket to get an extended view since my door bell faces wall. There are lots of videos and written instructions to help with install which does make it easy enough to install... JUST KEEP ALL SCREWS AND EQUIPMENT ORGANIZED prior to install, read and watch all material first before install (battery must be charged for few hours prior) to keep installation simple. NOTE: YOU DONT HAVE TO HAVE SUBSCRIPTION. It is an option. Subscription includes SAVING video content to review up to 30 days I believe. With out subscription videos are deleted but you still get instant alerts. Subscription is $3 a month $30 for the year which is soo affordable if you were able to afford this.  It does comes with first 30 day trial of “plus” package  Basic package is free.
title: Awesome!! no subscription REQUIRED  if you read and understand correctly.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gary M Pirkle
content: I bought Swann wireless camera's for my home and have had nothing but trouble with them, Wi-Fi trouble, battery trouble, the App on my phone trouble,,,so I gave up and purchased this Ring Video Doorbell 2 to install at the front door,,,WORKS PERFECTLY,, the app works great on my iPhone, I have since purchased two wireless spotlight Ring camera's and love them just as much... they are more expensive, but well worth the money, if you want the camera's to work as you expect
title: The Best

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TSKnoxville
content: It's still early in our usage of the Ring doorbell, but so far.. so good. Our house never had a doorbell or even knocker... so people had to knock very loudly with their knuckles.  This product allows me to know when someone's coming to the door.  I also installed a Ring Camera so that I can be notified when a car pulls up the driveway.  Good for me!
title: Great product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: muffinbauer
content: I bought two Ring Doorbell 2s. I added a Ring Chime/Wifi extender. The extender didn't make any difference in the poor signal at my back door. I purchased the doorbells in November. Last week (end of March) we had a hard rain and water got inside the doorbell where the camera lens is. The next day, the device went offline and it has not come back. I've tried to let it air dry in the house and reconnect, but it does not work. Amazon will not take back my device since it's past the return period, and Ring will not take returns from items purchased on Amazon. So basically, the one year warranty for a Ring doorbell is null and void for an item purchased on Amazon. This is really sad considering Amazon pushes for use of Alexa with Ring devices. I was told through Amazon chat that I could not return the item to them. Trying to get help at Ring is nearly. impossible. The chat offers limited options and is not connected to real person. Disappointed. I liked the Ring doorbell, but I'm not going to purchase another one.
title: Not waterproof and warranty no good for items purchased on Amazon

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ed Bluestone
content: I started with the doorbell but have added the entire system. No contracts, very reasonable service cost, and East system setup. I like how all of components set up and communicate with no complications. The doorbell is very sensitive, even on lowest settings, but that is why I have it. I could here people talking from across the street on my phone from work. Amazing how well this works. Yes, the components are expensive but total cost for monitoring will recover this difference quickly.
title: Great product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: NeoPantera
content: Trying to reconnect after changing ISP. WAY TOO many Steps. WAY TOO long waits for response at each step. WAY TOO MUCH TROUBLE for this over priced doorbell. There are much cheaper ways to do what this does. If you don't have the app running full time, it's not much use. By the time you open the app, find your way to "live view", and it finally shows who's at your front door, they're probably gone. Sorry I spent that much money on something that's just not that convenient. Update: I'm even more angry that I wasted this much money than I was when I originally wrote this.
title: Too expensive - not very useful - piece of garbage!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: B-More Mom & Luvin' It
content: I'd been wanting a Ring Doorbell for some time and on Black Friday Amazon had an excellent deal that helped me decide to get it. I'd purchased the original Ring doorbell last year but sent it back because it was going to be a pain in the butt removing the battery for charging. Ring 2 is supposed to be easier removing the battery to charge. It was pretty easy to mount on our doorframe. I am really happy knowing that when someone comes within the range I set, I am notified whether they "ring" my bell or just walk up on my property. I am glad I purchased it.
title: Really nice

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bri
content: Product itself comes nicely packaged and has all of the necessary tools/supplies to make installation easy. However, it’s pretty much useless. My WiFi is strong and speed test says it’s fine but the video is laggy. It can’t stream live and the audio is choppy. Didn’t get a notification when I had my daughter test the doorbell. Searching online, I see many of the same complaints without a solution. Will likely return the doorbell. I really wanted to like it.
title: Looks nice but doesn’t work

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. H.
content: Works good so far. Easy set up. I've had it going for 7 weeks now..No problems at all staying connected to wifi. The video and sound quality is excellent. The app and notifications work very well. The battery has lasted longer than expected with 28% remaining as of now. (I'm sure it will last longer in the future because if initial set up and "playing" around with it the first few weeks. My only gripe would be the motion sensor seems inconsistent. I have it set to the lowest setting (says 5ft) but it goes off when cars drive by on the street 20 ft away. Other times we will walk by it and it will not go off at all.
title: Works good so far

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: buyer
content: I ordered my Ring 2 doorbell, it came in 2 days, (great)  Got it programmed, and installed it on my front door.  I was able to set up the motion detection (it still notifies me every time a car goes down my street. I have it set for the closest setting.  When someone is at my door, I get a notification, and when I open the app, the person at the door is gone before the app loads.  Then it takes too long to load the video ( I have a dedicated 20 MBPS DSL line)  should be plenty of band width.  Waiting for the return to complete, sent it back 9 24, it arrived at Amazon 9/27/18 at 11am according to the UPS tracking, return still shows they are waiting for the product to return before issuing a refund.
title: Not Great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jennifer H
content: So far I’m pretty happy with our doorbell. The camera catches just about everything. It is a little slow and freezes up though. I’m not sure if it’s the doorbell or our WiFi connection and that’s something I’ll have to look more into. I wish the zoom quality was a bit better. It def distorts the picture if you have to zoom! So far the night vision is pretty good, but only on a closer view as well!! But I’m happy with the purchase, it does the job!!
title: Good little camera, bad zoom quality though!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: David E. Schwartz
content: The Ring was easy to install, the app is easy to navigate. The only small complaint I had was it does not like either of our two wireless connections, but that could be because the routers are both at the absolute farthest place from the front door. A $29 WiFi booster fixed the problem nicely.
title: Easy to install and it works!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scarvare
content: Overall does it’s job very well. For the price though, I’m still a bit disappointed with the speed of it connecting to my phone when there is an alert. Most of the time by the time it connects to my phone the mailman is back in his car and driving. That kinda takes away a large piece of its usefulness... Ive tested our WiFi etc and that’s not the issue, the speed just isn’t there yet. Still recommend though
title: Works well but..

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Traci Wills
content: So, the camera is really great, the pic quality is fantastic. The app totally sucks. I sooooo wish Amazon had not tried to get into the tech field. I know they're making oodles of money on the Echo dots (another love/hate relationship) and the Ring so they're not going to stop trying (a good thing because hopefully they'll wise up and get some staff on board that actually are technically savvy) but UGH! Side note: If you haven't gone smart in your home yet and want to go with Google.
title: Love/hate relationship with Ring

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Pat M
content: There seems to be a time delay from when someone comes to the door to when we get phone notification.  Don't know if this is due to not setting the distance far enough or weak signal or something else.  We're new at this so we're still on a learning curve.  Will review questions & reviews on Amazon for help.  Easy to set up but can't figure out how to set up multiple "owners".
title: Read All Instructions First

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SS in Georgia
content: My first one after one year, stopped working.  The company was kind on the phone, tried to figure it out, but couldn't.  they showed it was fine and on line, but on my end, the app kept showing it as dead battery, no matter how many new fully charged batteries I put in.  So, I bought another.  I actually have this and two cams ....the cams are more responsive than the doorbell.. the doorbell seems to have a delay when someone comes to the door.  Otherwise I liked it enough the first time, to buy another :)
title: Second Ring doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Scrappy
content: I really want to like this product but after adjusting the motion zones so I don't detect every vehicles that drives down the street it doesn't detect people walking up to the front door on a regular basis. The doorbell is hardwired and  set for frequent motion capture (every motion). However, on two separate occasions, once for UPS and once for USPS, no motion was detected as the delivery was left on the front porch.  Deliveries is in the top 5 reasons for wanting this product.  For $200 plus monthly fees to capture and save the videos I would expect to detect every motion on the front steps and capture every video.  Expecting too much? Maybe, but I'm disappointed anyway. Not sure if I would get any more of the Ring products unless some improvement can be made to this one.
title: Disappointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: REB4
content: Disappointing performance. It's ok, but it's one of those products that is more hype than reality. The idea is fine but it is overpriced for what it does, and still doesn't perform like promised. I bought two of these, one from Costco which included the Chime and 1 year free storage of video and one from Amazon. I was going to install one in the front door and one in the backyard. The one from Costco, never really worked. The Wi-Fi connection was spotty even when the device health monitor said it was a good signal. Just very unreliable and it certainly was nowhere near the 1080P resolution. Every time it lost the wi-fi connection, I had to go outside to unscrew the front and manually reset the wi-fi button to reconnect, then have to put it back together. I had to give it back. The one from Amazon wa more reliable but still under performed. Pros: - You can see who is at your front door...eventually - If you pay the $36 a year fee, it will record  video captured in case you have a problem and need to see who was in front of your house - Most of the time you can activate the lIve stream feature on it and see through your camera proactively...eventually, but sometimes it never connects - You can communicate with someone in your front door, eventually - You can control how far out you want to detect to avoid passing cars or pedestrians on the sidewalk. It is NOT controllable by zone as it claims. - You can control how sensitive the detection is so you don't get overwhelmed at work with every single motion it detects - Night vision camera - Good deterrence, gives you some peace of mind while you are away Cons: - If you noticed that I said eventually in most of the posts, that is because there is such a time lag between the actual motion detected or the doorbell ringing that most of the time the person has already moved or left by the time you respond. I have had 9 packages delivered since i bought this and I have yet to speak to the delivery person before they left. - The speaker is horrible, most of the time the person cannot understand a word I say unless they pay close attention - Poor wi-fi antenna and spotty reception. Comments say that you need to buy the $50 extender to fix these problems but I don't agree. I have very good wi-fi in my house and have no problem watching HD movies on my laptop outside in my patio, so it shouldn't make a difference. And if that were the case, then this SHOULD be sold with the extender included, and then it becomes a $240 product and for that price there are better options. - It is NOT 1080p resolution. Even when I have it right next to my router. Absolutely not 1080P, 720p on its best day. - The $36 yearly service fee. If you really want to use this as a surveillance camera, you need it to save video you are not there to see. Without the video saving service, someone can just break in or steal your package or even steal  the ring device itself and you wouldn't know who did it. - Price...when you add up price of the device, the $50 dollar extender/chime and the $36 yearly fee, this ends up being a $275 solution. It's not worth it. I was going to by one for my back yard and decided it wasn't worth it.
title: Disappointing performance. Great idea, mediocre execution. Bought two from different vendors. Read and learn.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: LasVegasJoey
content: I am happy with the Ring Video Doorbell 2 and have already recommended it to my daughter. I bought this because I didn't have a doorbell. It was easy to install using the battery and no problem connecting to the app. but that is where my only complaint comes in. I agree with many other reviewers in most cases it does take too long to bring up the app. to see who is at the door or what the motion is about. I hope they can improve the app. but I do recommend this doorbell.
title: Easy to install using the battery

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Raymond Brevik
content: The camera is really good and picture clarity is excellent.  I can never seem to get it adjusted right and I don't know what I'm doing wrong in settings. It loves blue garbage trucks and always lets me know when I have one pass but doesn't notice white ones. I live outside city limits and people have different garbage services on different days. It doesn't pick up my car driving into the driveway but does pick me up when I get right up to the front door. I guess it's ok, but it could be better.
title: Picks up some things and a good theft deterrent

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kelsey Wheat
content: Very glad I went with the 2 instead of the original. Living in a townhome, having three zones that can be toggled on and off is a great option, especially when the neighbors to my right have kids that play out front quite often! Build is of high quality, and I love the look of the included charcoal faceplate. Installation was easy, especially with the included angled brackets. Finally, the software is user friendly, and I love the community shared alerts with video included. I highly recommend this product!!
title: High Quality, Variety of Settings, Easy Installation

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Linda L. Young
content: I bought this in January of this year. It has stopped working, first no alerts on my phone now no more video. I have done everything that needs to be done still not working. For the price I paid very upset.  I tried calling support line unfortunately it is someone out of the country and can't understand.  Then when I called back after giving them all the info they requested we were disconnected and when I called back had to start again from scratch again highly disappointed.  Basically I love the unit just displeased that it stopped working before a year old.  Now who do I go to to get a new one??
title: HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Wai-kean
content: Not worth the money at full price but if u catch it on sale go for it it's kinda choppy works when it wants Updated review So I've had these ring doorbells for a few months now I can honestly say don't buy them unless u catch them on sale the app sucks and customer service is horrible and the products suck. The reason I say this is because they hardly ever work they start recording seconds later than they should and every time I open the app to check what happened it says cant connect to the ring doorbell they tried to dau its my internet connection but I have 1gbs down 50 up and the netgear orbi satellite mesh system u can drive Down the street and still get a wifi signal from my house that's how good my internet connection is
title: Ok not great but ok

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Genetics
content: We initially received one that didn't work properly and had to return it and order a new one. Once the new one arrived, it installed and worked as it should for the most part. The video works well and motion detection is fine but the sound is super glitchy and crackly. We have a very strong wifi connection with very high speeds but somehow still need some sort of booster in order to actually be able to speak to a visitor through the ring doorbell which is annoying to have to purchase something else to make it work despite having a strong signal. That's my only complaint.
title: Poor audio

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Poco Drago
content: I am leery about messing with electricity, but the fact that all my neighbors have these encouraged me that it couldn't be that hard. I was wrong. I turned off all the breakers in my box but none of them were for the doorbell... then, I don't know what a transformer is, what it looks like, if I need one, etc etc. This is just frustrating and irritating, and not a 5 minute install. I don't have time to educate myself on electricity to properly install this thing. First world problems, I know. Waste of my time. I'll just buy the peep hole camera they just came out with.
title: I can do anything...except install this thing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: L S Burns
content: I had to call customer support after trying several times to follow the instructions for setting up Ring to my Samsung Galaxy S7.  The great tech guy I was connected to, Rodulph, suggested that I turn off bluetooth and Mobile Data on my phone before trying to connect.  Bingo!  Solved all my problems.  I had gone through set up videos, trouble shooting videos and everything in between and di not see this suggestion once.  So if it's giving you issues, please try this trick.  It just may be what is needed.
title: Connecting to wifi during setup

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Old Deadeye
content: Could not get this to function properly with any device.  The sound is nothing but static no matter what we've tried, and ring/amazon don't seem to have any fix for this widespread issue.  This was a gift for my mother and to say it was disappointing would be a massive understatement.  That's too bad because Ring had a good reputation and I bought it after hearing how good they were.  After reading all the complaints online, it was clear that the product is poor quality and support is nonexistent. Buyer beware.
title: Not a quality unit anymore, sadly.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chris
content: The idea is great, the execution leaves a significant amount to be desired.  I expected a more refined product given how long it has been on the market.  The microphone and speaker are not nearly as good as commercials would lead one to believe.  The mounting hardware is more suited for a protected environment in a computer case rather than outside exposed to the elements.  However, my biggest beef is that the audio speaker and microphone do not work at any real functional level with the newer Samsung phones, I have a S10+ and it is virtually unintelligible when trying to talk to someone at the door.  My wife's IPhone is fine although the speaker is not as loud as you would want and the microphone is not as sensitive as you would hope.  This product needs more refining and a warning about Samsung incompatibility.
title: Does not work well with newer Samsung phones

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: F.
content: Good video quality but doesn't always detect motion. When my wife went out the front door today there was a package on the front porch that hadn't activated the ap on my phone. When I checked the phone, it had detected and recorded her leaving, but not the package being delivered. And our approach is a narrow flight of steps that is completely within the video frame. So it seems it doesn't always "wake up" when someone comes to the door. Good thing we also have a separate alarm system and internet recording on our security cameras. But I would like to know when someone is there. And that was the purpose of this device. So I'll be pondering whether to keep this doorbell or return it.
title: good video but not 100% on detecting motion at the door

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: patc
content: Extremely frustrating. Can't seem to make 2 way audio work without pressing mic button a couple of dozen times. Works for 10 seconds or so, then we get a "not responding" error and get kicked out. $200 for a doorbell that doesn't do what it's supposed to do us maddening. Tech support was courteous enough, but no help whatsoever. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! Revision: discovered that it takes almost a full minute for audio to work. Also trying to buy subscription bc already spent over $200 so may as well use it. Page for subscription will not load and they won't contact me. This whole experience has been horrible.
title: Frustrating waste of money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Flyboyron
content: Takes a long time to respond via WiFi. As other people have mentioned, often someone has already left by the time you get the notification. One of ours is wired and one is not. The wireless one is very slow to come online even though it says the Wi-Fi is fine, and it tests OK. Motion detection is adjustable enough to make it usable. I just wish I could use the 2 way talk function, which I usually can't since people sometimes leave before I can answer once I get the notification.
title: Video quality is great, but slow to connect.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brock Z.
content: I am very happy with the doorbell and camera quality.  The app is very functional as well.  I also really like the mounting bracket options that come with it.  I compared to a neighbors NEST doorbell and am much happier with what I got in ring. My biggest frustration came from not being aware that you have to pay a monthly or yearly subscription to really get any value out of the product.  But, once I got over that initial shock I realized that the base price for ring is really not bad and much cheaper than a similar package from NEST.  I guess I can’t really blame them since they have to pay for the server space to store all those videos...
title: Great product, but you have to pay for a subscription.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: george s masich
content: I really would like to rate this at 5 stars.  WiFi was weak, so I added the Chime Pro Extender. That did improve my wifi signal. Being a Ring extender my wifi did not slow down. I had hoped the the audio would improve. It didn't. Audio is poor.  Cloud storage at $30.00 year is fair. Without that all you really have is a door bell. Should have been included. Price increase would be fair.  The Neighbor function really clutters. It cannot be deleted, but you can narrow the field down. All said, pretty slick product. I wish they would include storage, and improve audio. Again, improve audio.
title: Slick and it does the job, but......

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael B
content: Easy to install and use. Comes with 30 days free of saved video but afterwards you have to buy s subscription service. You always can see live video do you only need the subscription if you want to review past video events. I think everyone should be aware of the slight delay in getting live video from the device. It has to go through the router and to your phone. Then you have to answer it — so it’s not instantaneous but I guess neither is physically answering the doorbell when someone rings it.
title: Love it. Recommend getting one

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jim S
content: Would give it 5 stars but knocked it down one because to retain video you need to pay a fee. To their credit, at least it is relatively nominal. Hard to tune the motion to get just the right area, I saw a video that allowed finer tuning but believe this must be their pro/elite model.  Overall it is working well  so far.
title: Working well, one month in

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: holly karmanocky
content: When someone presses the Ring Button, if you are not holding your phone in your hand at that very moment ready to go to the Ring app, the whole system is then pointless. Notifications are equal to a mouse whispering into your ear, you will never notice them in time. Also, people walk up to the ring device, push the button, and the video i got of them was of the backs of their heads as the walk away from the door. You absolutely MUST pay the monthly or the device is completely useless. The really stick it to you with the cloud storage. Arlo gives you free could storage for your devices. I'm going with Arlo.
