title: Fails to do it's main function.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Katrina
content: I live alone and am away from home for work a lot.  It is good to know who is stopping by my house and knowing when packages are delivered. The install was super easy.  I like that it works with my mechanical bell and is able to get adequate power. Another plus is that the optional subscription to recordings is a lot cheaper than Nest.  While it would be nice to have a door bell that works with my nest and google home setup, I definitely appreciate that ring services are so much cheaper than Nest. It isn't the sexiest door bell out there, but it gets the job done!  Plus it is conspicuous enough that someone coming to my porch will notice it before they decide to grab packages sitting out there.
title: It is nice to have some extra security on my porch

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mark T.
content: Swapped for the Pro because of the lower profile and didn't want to have to charge the device. Decent though if you are renting or aren't handy with working with wiring. The motion detection could be improved. The PRO let's you set up exact zones which this only let's you set up ranges. Be aware you will be paying $30 a year for video storage as there is no SD card slot with Ring, but you also don't have to worry about someone stealing it either. Fair trade off if you ask me.
title: Good product and worth the investment

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: K. Mack
content: This was the sole reason I became a Prime member. Was the best purchase I have made. I have always wanted a video doorbell and knew the value of the peace of mind it gives a home owner. It arrived on time and was so easy to install. Battery charge very quickly (even though it is wired).  The app for your phone works great and the video and voice are very clear. The only down side of it I have found so far after having it for several months is at times there is a huge lag or it doesn't  pick up motion and alert you until someone has walked away. With that said, I still have strongly recommended it though to family and friends. We also plan to purchase a Ring cameras for our garage/drive way area as well.
title: Best Purchase I have ever made

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: kmbs
content: Videos of people coming onto my porch only show the backs of the people unless they are patiently waiting after ringing the bell. Sneak thieves of mail and packages are only recorded once they turn to go down the stairs. Not at all useful. I’ve changed the position of the ring doorbell, upgraded wifi and read all the unhelpful support articles. My neighborhood group members all have the same problem with slow wake up time. I am extremely disappointed. This was not a cheap purchase. It does not deliver
title: Useless - video takes too long to wake up and start recording

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shawn Thomas
content: There are a number of things to be impressed with on Ring Doorbell. First, the packaging.  The attention to detail is impressive.  The package comes with all the tools necessary to mount/install the doorbell (it even comes with a drill bit and screwdriver).  The instructions for installation were simple and straightforward. The only issue that I had with the installation was that the quality of the screws that were included in the packaging, seemed to be of poor quality.  In trying to screw the doorbell onto the wooden frame of my door, I sheered off the heads of at least 5 screws once the screw got about half way in (so either the wood was too dense for the screws or the screws were poor quality; I even drilled pilot holes for the screws). Once I eventually got the doorbell mounted, the device was very easy to set up using the Ring app.  You can add multiple users who are notified when the doorbell is activated.  Setting up the sensitivity of the motion detection was also very easy in the app using a slider bar.  Picture clarity is also pretty good and field of view is very good (seems like almost 180 degrees) I have only had the doorbell for a couple of days, but it seems to be working very well.
title: Impressive product; would recommend

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: thatguyoverthere
content: Sample size ~2 years. Don’t expect it to work on you busy street. Picks up too many regular sized cars 25 feet away, not people dropping off packages right in front of the camera. If you look on the neighbors app you’ll see similarly delayed start time video. Works well for answering rings and the battery is surprisingly robust and has hung in there during cold months. I have a floodlight camera and it seems the power source and larger sensors enable faster and more accurate motion detection.
title: Works well as doorbell, not advanced/consistent enough motion detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R.C.
content: I  received a Ring pro last year from my son and loved it.  This past Christmas I decided to buy the Ring Pro for my son and my daughter for Christmas. It doon turned into a big disappointment! Not only did the Ring plug-in doorbell was no longer part of this package, but also Ring also did away with videos of any activity on your Ring  and now you have to buy a membership to view any videos.  I also bought my parents one last year but a regular ring.  She told me that she had to buy a membership as well. I found this hard to believe because mine came with the video mine was working great. I regret buying all three And now we all, almost feel obligated to have to pay for a membership so we know what’s going on around our house when we’re not home And wanted what Ring used to be. I am so glad I did not buy the $300 fload lights for my home before learning about this subscription crap. Now it seems as if they have gotten greedy. Thanks for the bait and switch Ring.
title: Extremely disappointed-what happened to the original Ring Pro?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Prayleen
content: Purchased in November.  Return date ended 1/31/19.  My fault that we did not install until 2/4/19.  So first thing is I need an extender.  I bought it.  Still does not work.  Guess this product works fine if you live in 1000 sq ft or less, but if your home is a tad bit larger and your router is in another room you are in trouble.  And I have panoramic wi fi so go figure.  Instructions both written and in app direct you to a "HARD RESET BY PUSHING ORANGE BUTTON ON BACK OF UNIT"  well, my unit has no such button.  Now what?
title: DOES NOT WORK UNLESS YOUR ROUTER IS NEXT TO IT

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Monica Santos
content: The wifi is never happy when installing these devices, but it works well regardless.  LOVE the view from the front door and I can see my little dog at night after I let him out and know when he's waiting to come in.  If you find that a feature, I will mention the motion detection doesn't pick up his movement - he is 25 lbs.  I have to open the app  and look.
title: Ding Dong

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brian
content: Reliability is good and two thumbs up for battery life!  I am however very disappointed that they want to sell me a monthly service to view recordings made on my own device and connected to my own network.  I can get the same functionality for FREE with my $20 security camera sitting in the window.  Two big thumbs down for the monthly fee!! Video quality is so so, but not great, it does what I need it to.  The mounting screws that came with it were HORRIBLE, I broke 3 out of the four trying to screw them in and that was with pre drilling the holes! Had to go find other screws to attach it with.  Overall it has turned into a novelty item after they stripped one of the most functional features away from it demanding a fee
title: Excellent battery life and I appreciate the concept

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Nikos  batsos
content: Great idea but it fails to do what it’s designed to do! What’s the point of having it if it cannot auto show the live feed on your echo show? I get notifications when someone is at the door but I don’t want to ask Alexa to show me the ring footage ! It’s suppose to do it by it self like google does! Fix it...
title: No auto play live footage on amazon echo show!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Unknown Dude
content: The Ring "doorbell" is a doorbell and motion detector. You can adjust how far out the device senses motion. To my experience, it seems to pick up all that it should. The app you have to get (free with doorbell) is average. Video quality is decent. The concerns: 1) You must use a multimeter to install safely to existing doorbell wiring, since you have to measure the voltage going through that wiring. Most people don't own a multimeter, so that's either finding a friend with one, or spending another $20. 2) To view any video history, you have to subscribe to Ring after the free 30 day trial ends. That's another $30 per year (for now...). 3) Amazon just bought Ring. Usually when small companies get gobbled up, customer service and innovation suffer.
title: Good product but some big concerns

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Big KZ
content: Buyer beware the delay between activities motion or door bell is at least 60 -90 seconds. If you don’t pay a fee the video is not saved! I thought I like this product at first but I have never been able to answer a doorbell remotely due to delay person usually leaves before I can answer. There advertising is deceptive for sure. Trust me I invested into this silly product heavily before realizing all this! I have bought over $400 in addition remote ringers, and batteries. Only to now have to pay annually to use half way decently.
title: Be aware before you invest

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Turbohawk
content: Product is a great idea and good quality. PROBLEM: According to Ring troublshooting you need a MINIMUM sustained UPLOAD speed of GREATER THAN 2.0mbps. My rural internet provider cannot guarantee this upload speed, thus we could not use it reliably. Perhaps if there had been an option to reduce resolution or some sort that could make it usable for those of us that are bandwidth impaired.
title: Won't work reliably with slower internet...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: edbird32
content: A small remodeling project left us with no doorbell at our back door.  I'd been looking at options and settled on this one - the "Ring 2 Video Doorbell".  Not to be cliche, but the physical installation really was a snap!  I DID use the included wedge to angle our camera down slightly as it's slightly uphill to the door and this provided a little better coverage.  Set up was also pretty simple once I scolded our router for not playing nice.  *password issue But anyway, the doorbell has been in place just a few days so we're still learning, but so far, so good.  My only wish is that the zones were a bit more "customizable".  The side angle of view is quite generous, but it is only split into 3 zones.  I believe some ring products are split into 5?  The ability to set the distance in feet monitored from the door would be a nice benefit.  i.e. Zone 1, 0-10 feet; Zone 2, 0-30; Zone 3, 0-40 feet, etc.  up to 5 zones.  But this will be ok and it is working fine!  I'm impressed with the video quality and even the clarity after dark is quite good!  As I said, I"m still learning with this but so far I have to say I'm very happy and would consider buying more.
title: . . .still learning

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tony S.
content: I bought this on Prime day and am glad I did. It really does allow  you to see who is at the door and talk to them. That is if your network connection is good and your phone or tablet has a good signal. I find that the motion sensor triggers sometimes even though I have it adjusted not to for a zone and the signal thing really plays a part in how fast or slow you get a notification. Over all it works as advertised within limitations, but I can live with that. It was a breeze to setup and to setup with the Echo Dot we have too.
title: Works as advertised, sort of...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. Wade
content: I love my Ring video doorbells.  I have one in the front and one in the back of the house.  I can see who is at the door and can hear the bell on my phone anywhere in the house or wherever I am.  I have even been able to talk to my pet sitter  the when I'm out of the country.  I also get notifications of incidents nearby.  REally impressive!
title: Fantastic

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Richard l Kunz
content: I purchased the video camera doorbell and xtra batteries (2) for a reasonable price. I figured I was going to need it. Ring should offer a xtra battery mine get about 5 days on 1 battery so that is why I thought ahead. Other than that it seems to be a decent product. I had one incident while I was away from home someone at my door looking in and I asked what he wanted and I informed him of my German shepherd in the house because I could hear her barking. He left real fast. So I am pleased with it so far and you can find out in your area what is going on because you have a share or kind of a neighborhood watch with it. And it seems you can't please everyone who makes a purchase but I am pleased so far.
title: Good product it might not be for everyone but you will find that alot are pleased

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Gecko T
content: This is nice to have, but sometimes it doesn't start recording until after someone has walked away. It's slow to start. It could be my wifi, but my wifi router sits about ten feet from the Ring doorbell, so I'm not sure. When I want to see who is currently at the door it takes several minutes for the video to load, and that doesn't help.
title: It's good, but not great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robert
content: Great detection perfect for home security and the deal for $30 more for saving videos is worth it. Plus they give you a network so you can really monitor the crime around the neighborhood. The only bad thing is the cops just don’t care in California anymore they should be on this network all the time looking for parole’s and get the thieves or worse criminals off the street because this camera clearly captures them. All you need is this and a gun and consider your place safe.
title: Great product battery last long.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DFR
content: It was easy to install. It really works!  We were traveling. We were about 400 miles from home. Got a motion alert.  Saw that it was our pest control service. We “talked” via the doorbell. How cool is that. Added comment: I see negative comments among the reviews and am surprised.  Our Ring doorbell works great.  But I believe that may be the case because I purchased a new router.  Everything in my house on the new router works great.  My printer problems went away.  The Ring doorbell works as expected.  I used to think I needed a new printer -- but it was nothing but a router problem.  I bought the Amplifi router and my smart home became a lot smarter.
title: Love this doorbell setup

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: dee
content: Love this even more than my first one the 2nd version has more features I have two one on each door. They link together sad I use my Alexa devices for the doorbell and I can see whose at my door on my tv when I’m using my fire stick .  I have one hardwired and one I have to recharge. But it gets really cold here and so far my hardwired one has only had issues once that I had to recharge the battery which it says in the directions and on the app and then it was working fine again.
title: Great for security and seeing whose at your door and when you get packages.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Elisa L.
content: We received our Ring 2 in a timely manner and had it professionally installed, hardwired to the house  electrical system. The motion detector was amazing, and the video captured a wide range in good light. The Ring device was set up about 30 ft, from our router. All was good for a few months before the video failed, capturing only black.  I called Ring support twice and spent hours on the phone helping them perform all sorts of tests, to prove that it wasn't a wi-fi issue (one support agent said it was one of the strongest signals she's seen). Finally, the agent admitted it had to be an issue on the Ring  side, it was a known issue (!)  and I should wait a few hours for a firmware update. I gave them 5 hours and still no fix.  I called support again and the agent tried to take me through the exact same tests from square 1 but I dug my heels in and the agent read through the support history and conceded that the issue was on the Ring side. 12 hours later -- still no fix. Most companies would have sent a replacement unit by now.  Needless to say, I am disgusted with Ring and their level of service. The agents are super-nice but have to strictly follow a script for every call, which gets infuriating when you have already walked through every test. The droorbell motion detector and app continue to function well, so is a step up from a regular doorbell. But if like me video is a requirement, for you, save your money until the company works out their issues.
title: Bell works great - video failed within a few months of purchase

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cardman St Louis
content: very disappointed in the battery of this device. I purchased the Pro that wired to my existing door bell so I wouldn't have to deal with the battery being removed to be charged. Little to my surprise it turned cold and I am having to charge this battery inside every week.  Guess I should have done more homework but when you have a a description telling you the wired version charges the battery one thinks that's. They should mention cold warnings in the ad  Very misleading.
title: Battery

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dmitry Nikiforov
content: The first couple of months it’s been working fine. Then, after a lot of software updates, you can no longer view the video of an event that’s just been triggered - you get “Video is processing, please wait” for several minutes, making this video doorbell pretty much useless as a security device, since you can’t see if the skeet was legitimate threat or not until it’s possibly way too late. I definitely cannot recommend this until Ring fixes the issue so that videos can be viewed immediately without waiting for several minutes.
title: The worst "smart" (read: "dumb") doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: James Houghton
content: During our nearly empty office due to Covid, we needed a way to alert us to the fact that we had packages and visitors at our front door.  And given that the two of us who are working both have offices near the back of the building.  The Ring video doorbell along with some additional equipment provided the perfect solution.  If we are out of the office it is a breeze to communicate with visitors through the Ring doorbell and the phone app works flawlessly.
title: Love it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: M. S. Greene
content: The battery life for this product is very bad.  It doesn't last more than a few days.  I have my motion alert off so it will last more than 2-3 days, making the product worthless.  If I wanted to go away for a week and turned motion alerts to the lowest setting, the device would be dead before I got home.  Ring claims the battery will last for months.  The device alerts to everything, even on the lowest setting.  I don't want to have an alert for every car that drives by. My front door is a good distance from the street but any motion sets it off, leading to the battery being dead in two days.  There are only 3 settings for motion: low, medium and high.  Just awful.  Do not buy, unless Ring does something to fix the batter life!!!
title: Battery drains fast, device is slow

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Leslie H. Brock
content: Ring is easy to install, app works great. Would like to see one change however, a connection on the unit that would allow you to connect a charging cable directly to the unit! Right now you have to remove the security screw, remove the battery to charge it or replace it with another, this adds additional cost and is time consuming, a simple port would allow you to charge the existing battery without all the trouble or expense of buying additional charging station and or battery. Camera is great, bought a chime pro to go with it, like all of it. Like that they give you several mounting options.
title: Great camera and app that works

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lynn Gates
content: This...this is fantastic, especially if you are a single woman. Installation really is easy if you are semi-techy or mechanical. It took me about 15 mins total including hardwired to existing doorbell. Screwdriver or impact driver, two wires to marry and voila! I am a female, 56 yr old, and had no issue installing and setting up on internet and on phone, echo show and my laptop to view cameras, get alerts. Etc. I also installed a camera in my house so I can check on my pets.
title: Fantastic product, excellent for single women

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rat Daddy
content: What a nightmare. A huge waste of money and time. Spent an unmeasurable amount of time trying to get the thing to work. Only to have it say my phone or my Wi-Fi connection is the problem. So I went ahead and got the chime Pro. Thought it might solve the problem. Went outside to try to install it at the height and angle I wanted it to work at. Only have it work once.  Then it went right back to saying it cannot connect to my phone. Went through all the troubleshooting suggestions to no avail. So I had enough of this huge waste of money and time..... I'm now back to getting off my butt to answer the door! Almost a month later.... I finally got it to work intermittently. Sometimes I get a spinning icon that says activating device, with a blurry background and nothing responding . And then there's times I just get a full black screen and nothing responding. And then there's are times when it works like it's supposed to..... Bottom line if you're happy with something works a tad better than half the time. Then this device is for you. But if you fully expected it to work all the time as advertised. I would suggest finding a different product. Or wait for a new and fully improved model sometime down the line.
title: What a underwhelming product. Never again!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ms Fay
content: I had high hopes for this due to the reviews- Looks like you can buy reviews now a days. This Ring 2 does NOT sense motion. I walked up to the door bell, ran up then jumped up and down -> NOTHING on my phone as far as an alert to tell me someone is mucking around in front of my Ring 2. The door bell works and tells me someone is ringing - that is the only use i am getting from this. The live feed option DOES NOT WORK AT ALL and is infinitely on 'loading screen' trying to bring up a picture. The intercom to speak to the person is utter rubbish- i was ringing the bell and my husband had my phone- he was talking and the sound was cutting on and off like he was on the moon or something. It cut off whole words or had long gaps before another word was heard. I did not buy this to hear a sound on my phone so i know someone is at my door and see them -> A normal doorbell did this and looking out of the window would have given me get the visual! I wanted to see live feeds whenever i heard something wherever i was in my home without having to go to the front window. I also wanted to speak to the person to tell them to go away and read the 'no soliciting sign' or tell people i know i will only be a minute. I wanted to get alerts when in bed or during the day if someone was coming up to my front door to try and break in or to visit me to i knew in advance before they rang the bell!. All of which it was advertised to do. God knows how people use the intercom from work like the advert shows. What a waste!!!
title: What a waste of money!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lil Boo Boo
content: This door bell has solid video quality and great battery life. The reason I don’t give it five stars is because a few times a week it will not detect motion when someone is at the door. My ring sits right next to my mail box by my door and there are days where both the UPS guy and the USPS guy will come to the door and the door bell will not detect them. I have had one Ring Doorbell (first gen) and two different Ring Doorbell 2s and they all had the same issue. But I would say 90-95% of the time it picks up just fine.
title: Not a perfect option, but gets the job done.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Stephen L Faulkner
content: It took us months to get this to work. We called ring so so so many times. It worked at first with out wired doorbell and then didn’t ring. We changed everything. Ring couldn’t figure it out. There was no explanation. They sent us bypass chimes. Which is fine. But I bought this one bc I wanted it hardwired. It also never really connects when someone is there. There is a delay like half the time.
title: Biggest pain ever

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Donny
content: This Ring is Terrible,  the motion sensor you set is Not real. You can set it for 15ft 30ft or 45ft and wont pick up until the person is 5ft from your door, and by time you get the notification they are already gone So you can't talk to them. So I returned and You ONLY Get a Partial Refund.  NO I dont Recommend this Product.  We Switch to Eufy and that works so much better. Also it has a 2k camera and night vision compared to 1080 low vision for the Ring.
title: Junk

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Liz
content: I read a lot of reviews about how it didn't work without a Chime Pro. I chalked this up to users with bad WIFIs. However, I got it and have a Mesh wifi with a node about 3 feet from the ring. The Ring's response was inconsistent and not great. I contacted the customer support and got a Chime Pro. With the chime pro, it works perfectly. I'm giving it 5 stars because the customer support was so good, and there is no better alternative that I've found. That being said,I think it has an issue with consistency with some routers. Like I said, I have a very strong signal outside (stronger than the chime Pro in dB). It just appears that the Chime Pro is more compatible.
title: Best device... with a Chime Pro.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shane Higginbotham
content: Have had hell with this device. In the beginning, we got it to work with Hardwire mode. Then it kept slipping off of it. Now it basically never goes on hardwire mode and we have to recharge the battery every two weeks. We've tried everything. We've tried resistors, transformers, running new electrical wires, etc.. The thing is just finicky. Really kind of wish I could swap it for an August doorbell so that it could better integrate with Google Home and with our door lock. The lack of Google Home integration is annoying. Almost as much as it's constant battery draining.
title: Hardwire Mode doesn't work often

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Marlene
content: I'm extremely pleased with the Ring Doorbell 2.  I originally only purchased one for my front door, but was so pleased with it I ordered another one for my kitchen door. These devices give me peace of mind for I'm able to see and hear anybody that's on my property without opening the DOOR!!  I'll be ordering another one in the future for my cellar door...  I also have Alexa and can ask Alexa to show the cameras on my tv from the comfort of my recliner..
title: 100% SATISFIED

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Punjabi Munda
content: I have never written a review for any products ever. However I cannot help myself but to write a review for Ring.Com and its products and tech support. BUYER BEWARE. Product works well inside the house however, Door Bells are supposed to work from the Outside. I really was amazed on the tech service rep to let me know that if the Door Bell works inside the house, that means the device is working fine.  I asked them How does that help if my guests or perpetrators are already inside the house. Why would they have to ring the Ring Doorbell.  I kept wondering what was the thought pattern of the person or persons that are managing the Tech Support and what kind of conversations and training goes on in the company.  The Door Bell is supposed to work from the outside. The comment that if the Door Bell works inside, then there is nothing wrong with the device still amazes me. I am wondering on the intelligence of the people working on the FAQ's and Tech Support manual. Sorry Jeff, you spend your hard earned money on buying on a really company with stupid solutions.  Hoping that you next purchase and venture are more intelligent and more consumer friendly. Just hope I don't lose faith in you. I have been with you when you started selling books. That is how long my relationship is with you and your company.  Hope you do better due diligence in your next venture. I now understand why many in the Shark Tank did not invest in the company. In spite of Mark Cuban's objection of not seeing the value and then understanding the limitation on the product, I bought the product, because I thought you would have your best guys do their due diligence.  Mark is the person who introduced the world to Video over the internet with broadcast.com and I should have listened to his objections more carefully. I am sorry for being disappointed with Ring Products.  . The worst $179.00 i have ever spent on Amazon.com in all these years. I thought of throwing the product in the garbage. But then it occurred to me that I need to smash the product into million pieces to protect myself and my family and my house, god forbid, that somebody finds the product in the landfill and uses the information stored in the product against me.  Hope all of you Wish me Happy Smashing day!
title: Buyer Beware - Door Bell that works from the Inside of the House - Love that

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: GLPO
content: This is the second review I am writing, just as negative as the first one, but Amazon argued there were "issues" with that one and could not post it. Here is the second review: the Ring Video Doorbell 2 is useless to me. It cannot detect motion right away, and it is so slow that it usually ends up recording nothing! I have changed the settings many times, but nothing works. I would return it if I still had the box, and would give it zero stars if I could.
title: Buy something else!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Luis F. Ruiz
content: You don't need to be tech savvy or have a degree in civil engineering to understand the simplicity of installation and use. We recently purchased the Ring Doorbell 2, with the WiFi extender and additional battery pack. I do highly recommend purchasing the WiFi extender, more so if your house is older and the signal weakens, and if you don't already have any existing doorbell. We did not have a doorbell and selected this product for security and convenience. The app and installation instructions are easy-to-use, bug free. We are now considering extending range and purchasing the outdoor floodlight product, to cover our backyard. The motion sensor is really cool, since we have small kids and always worry they are free to unlock the door and run out to the front yard. Highly recommended and very happy with the product so far.
title: Why did I wait this long!?!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brian M. Edwards
content: Slow to respond to movements Missed a lot of events because they are gone by the time it’s starts recording Flimsy and easily disabled by anyone My one year subscription expired after 7 YES SEVEN months and ring ignored all my requests for help! There are much better video doorbells out there for less money and I pal. On replacing this within months. The Ring 1 was actually better than this although it was flimsy and had many of the same flaws. I DO NOT recommend this Ring doorbell... keep looking!
title: Shockingly Poor Device!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Able Devildog
content: THE SOFTWARE IS BETTER FOR THIS VERSION BUT STILL LEAVES A LOT TO BE DESIRED. FAILS TO DETECT MOTION COMING DIRECTLY TOWARD THE DOOR BELL. THE SECURITY SCREW IS BADLY PLACED BEING ON THE BOTTOM, IT IS HARD TO REACH WHEN CHANGING THE BATTERY AND I LOST IT WHEN IT FELL TO THE GROUND. RING DOESN'T PROVIDE EXTRA SCREWS. WOULD RATHER SEE A KEY LOCK OR A LOCK THAT DOES NOT HAVE TO BE REMOVED FROM THE COVER. THE SOFTWARE STINKS. SOMETIMES IT DOES NOT LOAD OR IT TAKES FOREVER TO LOAD.
title: BETTER THAN RING ONE BUT STILL LACKING

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ricky
content: Great doorbell, was easy to set up, the app works great, and decent video quality. Battery life on the doorbell is great as well and I love the removable battery pack. It’s much easier to charge than the first generation and this alone makes the second generation worth the extra cost. My only issues with it thus far is lack of dual band (5 GHz) Wi-Fi support and the Amazon Alexa skill has been a little buggy. Keep in mind recording does require the Ring Protect plan which runs around $30 per year, although I find this to be a fair price for the recording service. Overall, I recommend the Ring Video Doorbell 2.
title: Great Wi-Fi Video Doorbell for a reasonable price!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: John P.
content: I spent months doing my research on whether or not this doorbell would be worth the purchase. There are so many mixed reviews both positive and negative about it. But let me add to the positive., this product is absolutely amazing.  The doorbell is easy to set up and comes with both video and manual instructions that help ensure you don't get lost or frustrated. The video quality is amazing. I am able to see everything from my front door to the street where my car is perfectly and can make out the faces of anyone who is on my porch. The night vision is perfect as well as I can make out everything I need even without turning on my porch light. Furthermore, the motion detection is responsive and quickly notifies you of anyone approaching your door depending on where you set your motion field. The chimes it comes with are amazing with a wide variety of normal ones and a plethora of holiday ones as well. The battery lasts for weeks on end depending on your settings (if you keep the sensitivity on high it will drain the battery faster). Lastly, this device paired seamlessly with my amazon Alexa devices and ring alarm system. If you are still on the fence about this doorbell let me help push you in the right direction. Get it and you won't regret it!
title: This Product has been amazing.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael Cummins
content: The wait was over it was here and I couldn’t wait to install it. The install was easy very easy 4 screws done. Of course, the one I ordered was wireless. The battery took a while to charge but the wait was worth I, t I also ordered a backup battery knowing how long it took to charge you would want to be ready to replace when the one gets low. Checking the status on the health of the ring gives you the battery status and the connection status all good to know. They made it easy to use and set up if I can do anybody can. Next, I’m getting the flood light cam with a solar re charger and the stickup cam also with the solar charger. A friend told me and recommended it so YES I would recommend to all I know.
title: The install was easy very easy 4 screws done

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dave D.
content: I’m so disappointed in this. Upgraded to the Ring 2 for the faster Wi-Fi and night vision and it’s been nothing but headaches. We rarely can connect on the first or even the 5th attempt to live view. I’ve tried everything. It’s so bad ring has even created a stripped down app called rapid ring when the main app isn’t working. I’m truly thinking of going back to the original ring that worked or switching to something else all together. Not worth the money or headaches.
title: Disappointed.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SThomas
content: I love the fact that it lets me know when my dog is at the front door. And I can see who’s at the front door from any room in my home. It was easy to install and I love the fact that my messages from the Ring Even show up on my Apple Watch! That’s an extra perk for me because I always have on my Apple Watch so no matter where I am in my house I know it’s the doorbells ringing because it lets me know when the watch. To me that’s extra plus plus.
title: Easy to install and works with my Apple Watch!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Negel Walker
content: My fault for wanting the Ring Doorbell 2.  I should have just went with the original Ring Doorbell.  I purchased my Ring Doorbell 2 during Prime week and had it installed 8/7. It worked for 3 hours then disconnected from the Ring wi-fi and would not reconnect.  I contacted tech support and they told me that once the solid white light shows, the device is no good and to return it.  Well, I returned it and the new one did the same thing.  I contact Ring and they said the device stock from Amazon is defective.  So why is Amazon shipping defective stock?  Ring is supposed to be sending me a 2nd replacement.  If this one does not work, I'm going to purchase the original Ring and get credit.
title: Hard Wire Ring Doorbell 2 is Faulty

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Big Stew
content: Within a year the night vision degraded so bad that everything is a blurry mess. The motion detection is incredibly spotty. Some days it's triggered by everything, some days it picks up nothing. Customer Service never calls back when they say they will, so be prepared for multiple calls and long hold times. I was strung along with promises of software updates that would fix the issues. No updates, no changes, and now I'm beyond the warranty period. I could not recommend this to anyone.
title: Goes downhill FAST, terrible customer service

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: richterd
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. The installation was quick and easy. Excellent instructions, came with all needed items as well as some extra wires, caps, screws, etc. The included face plates and 2 wedge plates is great also. The connection to wifi & network / app was quick and easy as well. Adjustments to the motion sensitivity and zones is simple to adjust through the app. It attached to my existing doorbell with no problems. Notifications can be sent to family/friends also as well as to my phone.
title: Great, easy to set up and use, nice video & sound quality

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sergio Arturo Gomez
content: I like everything about it. So much I purchases a ring floodlight for my garage, which i love. Easy install and good price. It’s an excellent security camara for a a small fraction of what I would be paying if I had ADT or some other security system. I’ve had it for 4 months hardwired so I haven’t had to charge any batteries. Hardwiring is easy as long as your house has an existing doorbell. If everyone had a ring camara, I think crime around your neighborhood would drop. You can also view videos of crime that your neighbors could post via the neighbors ring app which shows other suspicious activity around your neighborhood or city. There is so much more that it offers. I already recommended this product to friends and they love it too.
title: It’ an excellent security camara.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Honkwomp
content: I bought this popular device with great anticipation.  It has been mediocre, which explains my three stars.  The app is so slow to open that I cannot see who is ringing my doorbell.  A few minutes later, I can see the event in history, but this device gets a big fat F from me for real time use
title: Slow to respond and by the time you get the app open, the person is long gone

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jarrod mcsherry
content: I give this a 2 star rating ONLY because there is a hidden fee associated with this doorbell.  in order for it to keep working the way it was intended, you need to pay a monthly fee after the first 30 days.  RING won't tell you this, but it is VERY important to know this before you make a purchase.  had I known this, I don't think I would have bought this.  that being said, if you can get past the shady added fees, this thing does work well.  but im sure there are better options out there for less money and no hidden fees.
title: RING won't tell you when you purchase, BUT there is a monthly charge to this!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Greg
content: I've been using my device for about 18 months and it's been working fantastic. It let's me know when the doorbell has been rung via the app on my phone and through the Alexa dots in my home. I also recently had my doorbell stolen by a crackhead, which was recorded on video. Ring promptly sent me a replacement once I provided them with the police report. I also recommend purchasing a second battery so you can quickly swap when the battery drains down.
title: Great device and awesome theft protection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: emerson
content: I own Yi cameras, amcrest cameras and this ring doorbell camera and none have given me issues like the ring. It'll Capture 2 seconds of video then freeze so half my videos are basically just pictures, connectivity is an issue as well I had to purchase a Xfinity mesh pods just for this ring doorbell 2 that's the closest to the wifi signal because it kept dropping off while my other cameras that are on the other side of the house have no issues with connectivity. *knocks on wood. I make purchases on Amazon all the time and never write reviews but this damn thing has given me such a headache that I just had to.
title: Meh at best

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mr. Awesome
content: this item is pretty cool the only thing I wish they had for their mounting plate they have an angled left and angled down but I really need an angle left and an angled down.  users note if you have a hardwired doorbell you don't need an extra battery it powers itself this is stupid easy to install. they give you everything you need the only thing I haven't figured out how to do is link it to Alexa.  because both Amazon and ring have passed the buck on who should know how to do this
title: The doorbell has eyes

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Adrian L.
content: No stars!! Im soo upset & dissapointed this thing has only worked In our house once we installed it outside it ceased to work. Five phone calls and five different times trying to reset it they finally are going to send me another one but I have no confidence in that I’m so upset and disappointed we had her house broken into and if we could just have this one bit of peace of mind but I’m sitting here six days later with that camera that’s mounted on my doorbell and it doesn’t even work I’m so upset right now I will never buy another product from them again
title: Contines to lose signal

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Brian H. Mckendrick
content: UPDATE: Ring keeps making it worse - introducing new features like “People only mode” which only work with a Ring protect plan.  REALLY WISH I HAD DONE MORE RESEARCH BEFORE BUYING THIS HORSESH!T PRODUCT.  Its basically like gifting yourself a monthly bill for $5.  SERIOUSLY, I HATE THE GD RING DBELL. The subscription required to store any video in the cloud is ridiculous.  I should at least be able to review videos from the past 24 - 72 hours without paying a @#$!! monthly fee.  If I had known about this limitation, i would've bought another product.  Tired of buying products nerfed without buying into premium subscriptions - seeing this model everywhere. At least offer integration with other cloud storage so I can archive videos to my own storage.
title: Another monthly fee ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Eric Bartusch
content: To preface this, I want to start by saying that I bought this really wanting to like it so I could justify expanding with more Ring cameras / lights. I travel modestly for work and although I live in a low traffic, low crime area, I wanted something simple that could just let me know if someone came to the house. Also, given that I started buying more and more through Prime, I wanted to deter any would-be porch pirates since my house is set back from the road enough that a would-be thief would have an opportunity to work out of view from the main road. That said, installation was a breeze. The included brown faceplate matched my exterior nicely and the included angle mounting hardware enabled me to set it up for an optimal view. Downloading and scanning the product was a easy and the initial set up was very intuitive. I was very impressed with the instructions, included hardware, and mounting options that were included. Alexa integration was simple too. Now all of my Alexa devices alert me when someone rings the doorbell. I turned it on and set my zones. I tried it out by walking around and seeing where it would trigger an alert. The push notification triggered immediately when I stepped into the zone. Again, I was very impressed. This is where things stopped being impressive. The first day, a UPS driver stopped at my house. I got the notification, opened the app, and saw a still shot of a driver and could hear the sound of him scanning packages. I figured it was a glitch, not aided by my meddling when it was activated. But this trend has since continued. I have since gotten still screen shots of people getting out of their car, halfway entering my house, or walking up the path. I never get a second still shot. Every visitor gets a single still shot depending on where the camera first decided to record them. I can hear the audio but the video just stalls. This has been true whether I click the notification to view the event live or if I try to recall an event that I missed. It's always a single still shot with a little audio. Sometimes, I don't even get the still shot and instead I get a zero second video. I tried to reach out to ring on the app. I initiated a chat but received no response from the person who "would be with me shortly." That was a little disappointing. I'm going to try maybe buying a wifi range extender and playing around with the zones a little more to do a little more playing. I'm hoping to update this review if I can get it to record streams of video. It's beyond returnable now so I'll mess with it and if nothing else, it'll be a talking piece for guests, but I won't count on it for any actual security. UPDATE: I bought the range extender and it works great. I'm looking into adding cameras now.
title: A neat parlor trick, but not particularly useful

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Code Vision
content: Half the videos record great....Half of them are just a black screen.  If it wasn't 200 bucks for this thing I'd have given it maybe two stars, but as it stands I just don't see the point in spending this much for something that is not reliable. There's about 6 feet between my router and the ring unit, and the health check says the signal is good. I googled issues related to the black screen and there doesn't appear to be a resolution to this problem. I might be able to work this out with tech support, but I'm more than likely just going to return this before it's too late and try another camera system.
title: Half the videos record great..

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: babs
content: The installation process was painful and involved hours of phone conversations with the delightful Ring Support staff.  It wasn't until the fourth representative joined the process that we discovered why the Doorbell 2 and the Chime unit were not communicating with the internet through our wifi router.  The answer:  We have a very good Linksys router, but it taps into the Xfinity cable modem/router which was not properly configured for "bridge" mode.  Once rep #4 asked us to contact Xfinity, we discovered the problem and fixed it.  We have to admit that the Ring Support staff never gave up on trying to solve our problem and went out of their way to compensate us for the time we spent.  Since then, the Doorbell 2 and Chime units work as advertised, with occasional hiccups, such as delayed notifications.  The video images are not as crisp as we expected, but they are usable.
title: It finally works

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patricia Bagby
content: We loved our Ring doorbell so much that we got one for the back door! We travel a lot and it’s nice to be able to get motion and ring events so we can see, hear and respond to notifications without anyone knowing we are gone! We can also keep track of deliveries and visitors without standing at our window to see what’s happening! They were both easy to install and getting them to communicate with our internet. For people having trouble with the internet part, they should make sure they have newer equipment that is capable of supporting multiple devices! We speak from experience because our first doorbell install was not as successful until we got new equipment (which we should have had anyway), and once we had the equipment up ang running, the Ring doorbell internet installation was straight forward. Also, because our back door did not have a previously wired doorbell, we got the Ring doorbell that had a rechargeable battery. Now that we’ve had it a while, we are going to get the wire and plug in transformer so we don’t have to recharge the battery and can increase the motion detection area! Our neighbors love that we can see what’s going on in their back yards!
title: Great picture and sound!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Church Griffin
content: Works well enough.  Good motion detection but takes a good while to show on your phone or tablet.  So long, delivery personal maybe gone by the time you obtain a digital view of door.  May work better with "always on" Alexa show.  Night vision is top tier quality. Sometimes will drop WiFi connectivity from time to time so plan for that. Also plan for $3.00 monthly video review charge subscription.  Which is barley noticeable but annoying.
title: Not bad but not great either

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: KP
content: I have trouble with the motion detection.  If I adjust the motion to the sidewalk/porch it's a hit and miss.  If I make it more sensitive where it is now out into the street, the motion detects everything, including the cars.  I've tried different adjustments but with no luck.  It does pick up motion about 90%+ of the time when on the sidewalk/porch.  I decided to keep it anyway.
title: Disappointing, but still going to keep it.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mr. Mark Francis
content: I went from a Ring video Doorbell to a Doorbell 2 because of the picture quality. I have been through 2 Doorbell 2s and the picture quality is still poor. I a have a Ring security cam that is farther away and the picture is great. I have a stick up cam with solar, standard definition with a better picture. I have been on tech support to try and fix it. I have been waiting on a return call because they wanted to see if it got any better overnight. Too much time on hold and with tech support. Also live view is very spotty and half the time Im not notified or the camera starts too late, on all of them, recording nothing. Also my 91 year old dad took his Ring pro doorbell down due to not ringing,very delayed ringing, or black recordings.  Now he has a standard doorbell.
title: Very iffy function of cameras.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CLM
content: Ring does not stand by it's product.  My device works great if you are coming at it from the side but if anyone walks right up in front of it, ie: up the driveway, up the stairs onto the porch and into the house....... it it does not alert or record the event, yet every time the wind blows the flag three feet to the left of it I get an alert and a video recording.  They insist it's because my internet connection is too slow, so I brought it in the house, stood it right next to my router , walked right up to it and it did not record or notify me that someone was there, only when I came in from the side.  I will NEVER by another product from this company.  THEY DO NOT STAND BY THEIR PRODUCT AND TRY TO MAKE IT YOUR FAULT THAT IT IS NOT WORKING.  I spent three hours on the phone with customer service and the end result was them insisting that it is my internet connection that causes the device to not record or alert when you are standing right in front of it, yet they cannot explain why it's right on cue when you come at it from the side.
title: Horrible Customer Support

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Carla A Antonelli
content: The problem with this producy is the location of your modem and the placement of your Ring Doorbell. I purchased 2 devices plus the ring chim as a booster. The video for one of my units is almost useless. I spoke to my cable / internet company, my modem is very stron but the distance for the signal is to far. I spoke with Ring indicating I had even purchased a chime booster, now they are telling me i should purchase an Aero Pro System which is a mesh network that will boost all the signals in my home. Should I purchase this its a free trial for 90 days, but the cost is $199.99. By the time I am done this system will have cost me over $500.00. My home is a ranch styls and only about 1800 sq feet. Do your researh on the distance of the signal puts out!
title: Signal Distance for devices to work !!!!!!!  Do your research

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: jacee
content: We use this on our house to see what goes on outside during the night with all the wildlife. Our trail cam devoured batteries so this has paid for itself it savings. The doorbell function works just fine and my grandkids love to talk to me through it. With so much activity I’m charging about every 3 weeks but thats easy to do. The range covers the entire front yard and the driveway but I really need another one for the other side of the house
title: Better than a Trail cam

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Thomas Mohr
content: I've had this product for 2 years now. The best thing about it? The batteries are easy to change. Notifications come in long after the motion has occurred. You get to see the people walk away. When you need it to work, it doesn't...so many times I've expected to use the device when someone is at the door, only to be presented with blank video. At night, it is so sensitive that mosquitoes or other things flying set it off. Useless. Do yourself a favor, buy something else.
title: Buy something else

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bald Eagle
content: From the time I opened the box until the Ring was operating took about 30 minutes including the time it took to drill the holes to install the unit.  Everything was provided, even a level that fits into the doorbell!  It's obvious that a lot of thought went into the design of the doorbell and the installation package.  It was really impressive. Our condo is 3,000 square feet so I purchased a Ring Chime Pro (to boost the Wi-Fi signal to the doorbell) and a Ring Chime to cover the other end of the condo.  Both work very well and the Wi-Fi signal to the doorbell is excellent.  The Ring App is also very well designed and works seamlessly.  I do recommend paying the $30 annual fee to have the option to store a month's worth of videos from the doorbell.  All in all, a really well designed product.
title: Very Easy to Install and Setup

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: VeeDub
content: So far we love this thing! We had a different brand and had trouble with it almost constantly. The Ring has worked flawlessly to this point (2 months). It very quickly notifies you when there's movement or when someone pushes your doorbell, which I really like because I have a shop in my back yard and cannot hear the doorbell from the house. The movement detection is also adjustable so you're not getting notifications when some walks by. It's a must for my situation. I even had the FedEx guy say "where were you? I gotta get me one"! Nuff said!
title: Quick notifications

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Heavyshield
content: This Ring 2 Doorbell security device is exactly what is expected in these modern technological times. It does everything you would have wanted a security device to do. It is so convenient. You literally know of any movement and people, animals, and insects in the vicinity of your Ring devices. The iPhone app puts all the control in your hands. You know the battery life, you can view outside anytime you feel like it. The only weak link is your wifi network. So invest in that also. We feel alot safer and in the "know" about our home. A very good investment. We are now ordering the security cam floodlight by Ring.
title: Love your home? Put a Ring on it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: nkon
content: Ring bell doorbell 2 great part of security system , clear view and sound of video. ***The only negative not with the product but with dealing with Amazon in this purchase was that I got this during Cyber Monday sale and as part of the promotion should it include echo dot for same price and it didn’t. Even though I claim it Amazon just said it needed to be selected on choices. Hello Amazon!!!!!! it was everywhere on the website as part of the catch for the sale on Cyber Monday ,  BUY THE RING VIDEO DOORBELL 2 And GET ECHO DOT GREY FOR FREE!!!!! VERY disappointed with Amazon regarding this tricky sale.
title: Like the ring but this was a deceiving Cyber Monday sale!!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Domsdad
content: Easy installation, great video and hooked right up. A bit of lag when pulling the feed up on the show, and I would love to see them add a chime feature on the echos but it's still a great product. I installed it directly on my storm door because I have a thin frame and it works perfectly, I can even see my entire drive way and front yard with the wide angle it provides. Plus now I can tell solicitors to kick rocks without actually getting up!
title: Great addition to the smart home.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Heather Brown
content: I love our Ring! We live out in the country and are able to now see people pulling in to our driveway before they get to the door without the motion triggering from street traffic. Now, if we could just keep the neighbors dog from coming over and triggering it. The setup was beyond easy and we have it hooked up to the Echo Show so we don’t have to walk around the house with our phones to know someone is coming to the door. The Echo Show announces it and I tell it to show me the camera. It’s the little things in life you didn’t realize you needed!
title: I see you!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Just Richard
content: Every time we go out it announces motion at the front door via alexa. Rarely does it get the chance to spot anyone else, mostly UPS guy. The video recording is a nice feature but its not available as far as I can tell for about 30 seconds. I dont know if live view is the mode to use.  Anyway, migrating to a complete Ring system for video monitoring etc as its much less expensive than the solution I have now, which has proved unreliable.
title: Works a little too well

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: John Hinz
content: Love this! Scored it on black friday and have been using it everday since installed. I have it installed and running off battery (not hard wired) and after 1 month since install the batter is just under half life off of just 1 charge, and this is in cold Minnesota winter temps! Love getting alerts and seeing whats going on at home while im at work and the cloud base storage is nice to review previous activity.
title: Sweet!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: drno
content: we love this new doorbell.  it works as advertised, and we don't mind the yearly sub fee - it's nominal for what you get.  i will say the adjustment of the zone for the motion sensitivity is hard to get right.  some days we get pinged when a car drives by, and some days we don't.  we tried to move it in several times closer to the house and it still is not consistent.  also the snooze feature doesn't seem to work well.  we try to snooze it when we know someone is getting ready to come home at night and it still comes over the phone/bluetooth devices loud and clear.  however it's a great device that works well for the other 90% of it's features.
title: Great item - motion adjustment is hard to get right

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Arcturus
content: I just got my Ring Doorbell 2 a week ago and have had nothing but problems. The video quality is very poor beyond about 8-9 feet. The video is completely over-exposed beyond that distance (all I can see is a sea of white). I have a digital doorbell inside, and no matter how I hooked up the included diode, it rang the inside doorbell continuously. So, I am having to run it off of batter power alone without the benefit of the indoor doorbell. I will never buy another Ring product again.
title: Disappointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Patricia
content: I replaced a intercom/doorbell with the video doorbell 2 but since the opening on the wall was bigger than the video doorbell unit, I had to make a piece of 6x4 board to cover the hole and mount the video doorbell 2. The first video doorbell 2 unit I received would not power on. I contacted tech support and I was directed to return the package to Amazon. I received a replacement unit after a couple of days. The replacement unit worked right away. Setup was easy using the app. (I already have one other Ring product). The field of vision is not too wide. Where I have it, just about 4'6" up from the floor, you can see a person's face standing in front of it, but you cannot see the ground (where delivered packages would be). The optimal height to install the doorbell is probably around 5'5" tilted down to see a person's face and the ground.
title: Great product with a few minor flaws

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Benjamin Wilson
content: Bought this doorbell during a black Friday sale, and an very happy with the purchase. Overall, setup was fairly simple; my old doorbell was wired and the 2 existing anchors in my stuck wall were correctly spaced apart from I could install the mounting plate without any additional holes. My doorbell sits Lee, so I angled the Ring doorbell with the included wedge plate and everything is focused on the image as should be. So through the app was a little difficult due to the app freezing during WiFi setup, but once I got past that glitch all was well. Overall, I'm happy and would recommend this product. I only allowed 4 starts due to the doorbell I initially purchased being DOA (no video). Amazon quickly sent a replacement and that is working well
title: Great camera/doorbell that's simple to install

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Trisha Eckoff
content: I'm home a lot alone with my 6 dogs that live inside the house, so I needed something to watch the outside of my home. When my dogs are outside it alerts me when they are at the door and ready to come in also which is nice since they don't know how to use a door bell and my home is not set up yet for a doggy door. I have one ring doorbell at each entry so I can see what is going on at all times. Easy to install and somewhat easy to set up with your wifi. There is a little bit of delay getting the alert to my phone and watch but well worth it. Good product and very happy!
title: Love it!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Miles
content: Everyone knows about the ring doorbell. It does what it advertises. Only thing I wish you could alter, maybe you can and I don’t know how, but I wish you could make it ring your actual doorbell more than one short ding. I messed around in settings and it seems you can only alter the alerts on your phone. I have missed the doorbell because I don’t have my phone on me because it is such a short ring. I have it hardwired and it hasn’t had battery issues.
title: Works like it should

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chicken Keeper
content: For the price, I’d say this product is average at best. When I first got my doorbell, I loved it but it’s so incredibly slow to connect to the internet by the time somebody rings my doorbell and I try to answer, they are already driving away. I own several ring products and when I had the need for some customer service I was disappointed to say the least. They already have my money and could care less about you afterwards. For a company now owned by Amazon I would think they would take better care of you. Maybe it’s time for Amazon to completely take over Ring because customer service is everything and without it, your company will slowly wither away and die...
title: Horrible customer service. 0 stars.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shauna Bishop
content: You have to subscribe to their cloud service in order to even view a recording. You can only do a live view without it and there is no way to save a recording. This is deceptive as it does not state that it is an absolute requirement, it simply says by subscribing you have the ability to forward your videos and save them for 30 days. It is not the $3/month that bugs me it is the absolute requirement and not being told up front.
title: Deceptive - You MUST Subscribe to use this Product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: mama llama
content: Rated 3 stars. It's a great product, but loses two stars for not being clear and honest in its description. It cannot connect to 5g. Maybe I should've looked closer. But that's something they need to say right up front. My 2G old wifi is useless and my 5G is awesome. This is not even usable for me and I'd have never wasted my time if they made this clear. Purchasing the Pro version now, which does take 5G.
title: Does not connect to 5G. Does not connect to 5G! .

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: lisa
content: Promise you will love it. Now before buying, do your research. Also if you have vinyl siding this can throw a monkey wrench into install. LOVE IT! UPDATED 2/23/18: I've had the Ring Doorbell 2 for about 2 or 3 weeks now (bought from Amazon) and the 1st night I captured footage of a man on my property. You get a 30 day trial of free data storage so you can review your footage. I recommend getting the $10 a month or $100.00 a year which will include 24/7 monitoring. Anyhow, I know when packages are dropped off, garbage is being picked up and when there is any unfamiliar motion at my door. I am eager to get the indoor security system which should be available in the spring for $199.00. Lifetime warranty might I add. I HEART THIS PRODUCT.
title: Promise you will love it. Now before buying

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Map
content: We are liking the doorbell during the day. It is very sensitive to outdoor movement.  Nighttime isn’t great.  It is really nice when you are not home to talk to people coming to the door.  You do have to subscribe for video history for a fee this year of $3 per month. It is easy to install and set up.  It runs on a battery.  We also had wired it to keep the battery charged.  We purchased a chime with it that plugs into an outlet so it chimes when someone rings it or it is motion detected. We recommend it for front door security.
title: Ring Video Doorbell 2

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chassity Stewart
content: Not that good.. I wish we would have gone with a different brand. The motion detection is not that sensitive, even on the highest sensitivity. Oh, it will pick up cars driving by, but not the person who actually walks up to my door...!? The recording time is too short, and too much time in between random recordings - SO much has been missed. For being an Amazon product, I really expected it to be A LOT better. I am super disappointed in Ring.
title: Overall disappointing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ashleigh
content: Everything was great and I was extremely happy with my product (functionality, ease of installation, etc) and then this happened. My husband was installing the door bell at the front door and 2 of the 4 heads of the screws screwed RIGHT OFF. The doorbell is still there and it’s pretty tight on the wall, it’s just frustrating how cheaply-made things are now a days. The picture is good, and the video shows pretty much a 180 degree view of my driveway. When someone approaches my door, I get notified. I can view my driveway/front door with live stream (which takes up more battery). I can call the doorbell from my phone and talk to anyone using the app. The functionality is exactly what I was looking for!!
title: Cheap Screws, but LOVE the Doorbell!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sherry Browning
content: I liked that this model didn’t require me to hardwire it to my home. Who knows what technology comes next and then we’re all wishing we never paid to wire this to our doors; so I’m glad there was an option. We’re still getting used to all the features like connecting with our neighbors but I think this will be a good choice for a while. HD and sound are great when communicating with people at your door whether you’re home or away. Overall happy for now, not sure if we need to pay for the extras available.
title: No hardwiring needed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Todd Green
content: While security is important it wasn't the main reason why we purchased it.  Our big benefit is how it works with Alexa (echo).  We have a big townhouse and never seem to hear the doorbell.  Now we get notifications through Alexa.  In addition to that, it's great to know when a package is delivered.  The motion alert will go off as someone walks up to the door.  Capturing the video is great but mostly useless for theft prevention.  Yes, you get to see who stole your package.  But unless you're sitting there at the door to catch them there isn't much you can do.  Police aren't going to spend time chasing anyone down for a package unless there are rampant thefts in the same area.
title: Works great - solves multiple problems

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Golfing Eagle
content: My original Ring doorbell bit the dust and I found this model to be much better than the old one.  Easier to install.  Better connectivity to my wifi.  Better overall quality.  I love Ring and the video recording service that it offers as an extra priced service.  Worth it for peace of mind.
title: Newer and Improved from Old Model

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: xjag33
content: I kept getting several false alarms especially late at night.  All settings were set at the minimum possible settings.  Motion detection was at minimum and WI-FI signal was weak even with range extenders.  The last straw is when I got 7 motion alarms at 11:00 pm and my CCTV cameras showed no movement of person, animal or insects.  The 'Ring' product  device or 'Ring' App was either "Hacked" or "Defective".  This 'Ring' DoorBell 2 never was all it was Hyped to be.  My advice, "Don't waste your money on this unreliable product".
title: Lot's of false alarms

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: #1MoMo
content: I usually do not write reviews , whether good or bad but after using the Ring 2 for almost 4 months, I am so disappointed that I felt compelled to write this review. This is suppose to be for safety and security. It does not pick up motion and record as it should. ( for deliveries, etc). I received a delivery today. It picked up the driver because he rang the bell. It did not pick up me retrieving the boxes??? Later I received another delivery. The Ring floodlight picked up the motion in the driveway. The Ring doorbell did not pick up the driver walking in front of the ring, and did not pick up him placing the delivery at the door. None! If you want to see clouds in the sky, sure! It will alert every 5 minutes for clouds! Trucks? No. People? Maybe, maybe not? If the driver today had been a burglar, the Ring was useless! Thankfully it wasn’t, but I still want to know someone is at my door. I have adjusted the settings. I have made it more sensitive. I have adjusted the zones to include the driveway, etc. sometimes it would say the wifi was weak, so I even bought a range extender and placed it on the inside of the front door, so I know our wifi isn’t tge issue. All around, I am extremely disappointed in the Ring 2. I have started researching wyze and other outdoor cameras. I wasted $169!
title: Extremely disappointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Zac W
content: We still own this but wouldn't purchase again.  The range is not consistent to when we get notifications.  Ring really needs to upgrade their software.  I own Wyze cameras that have better software than this expensive doorbell. The notification is nice when we come and go but that's about it.  Wish you could customize the area you want it to cover by drawing but it's all set and not user friendly.
title: Fun toy, but not worth it for us

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SCOTT MCKINNEY
content: Just received and tested this unit. Application is not updated for iPhone X support, first indication of poor software. Ring Video Doorbell 2 does not support integration with ADT Pulse, only the older first model. Ring Video Doorbell 2 does not support integration with Apple HomeKit. I would highly suggest that Ring spend more money on their IT department and less on those TV commercials..."sorry we are bathing the kids, come back later"...
