Also, an upload speed of at least 2 MBPS is needed to get all the functionality of the system. This is the second security camera that I have had to return for quality problems.  Be sure to check out a camera for several hours before installing it so you get rid of the infant mortality issues. Ring instructions and customer service were very good, however.
title: Good concept, but too many problems.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: BlackGun
content: Its an early review as I've only had it for three weeks. I like the unit so far. I bought the chime for the other side of the house and it paired up easily. I get notifications when the bell is rang and when their is movement. As most people have explained the cell phone/computer notifications are delayed by about 15 seconds but there is no way around this. I like what I've seen of it so far. It has a bunch of features to customize for your application and its simple to navigate. Only star loss is for the delay. Simple to install.
title: Ring Works for My Application

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rikki
content: Great product for home security! Works a little too well with motion detection. Often catching my trees in my yard blowing as motion, but can't be too safe! You need a working doorbell to hardwire it to for it to work the best, or else a wifi connection and can mount it outside your door. I have it this way and you do need the Ring and Alexa apps for it to work. It also helps to have it connected to an echo dot, which the doorbell will ring through if not hardwired. I'm pleased with Ring!
title: Dependable for home security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jeff O'Reilly
content: Ring app installed Phone is connected to WiFi WiFi is clocking 71Mbps down and 5.6 up The Ring app sees my router, but the doorbell doesn't connect. It lights up alright (so it's not DOA), but it doesn't connect. The Bluetooth works but the WiFi is dead. Internet seems filled with similar experiences, and the fix was to get a replacement.
title: Won't connect

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: amazonian
content: After someone rings the bell, by the time I get out my phone, wake it up, launch the app and wait for it to connect there is a delay of about 10-15 or more seconds.  Most times people will walk away before I can see who is there.  Forget about catching thieves in the act.  They will be gone before you get the live video.  The ads are soooo misleading.  Of course I didn't know this until I had gone to considerable effort to install and set up the device.  I still have it but it can't be relied on.
title: Too much latency

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Diane Golden
content: Great product to know what is going on at your home Opportunity to improve 1) ring detection sentivity - had to move my palm plant and my rose bush and the random neighborhood movement still sets it off 2) slow to load after the FREE trial ends so if someone moves thru the door quickly YOU MISS the capture Otherwise good idea and great product to protect loved ones!
title: Great concept and VERY SAFE door answering device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rob Thompson
content: I bought this for my mother as an added protection for her.  The best part is I can also see/hear what is going on at her house from my phone. Easy to install!  Quick set up!  Clear picture and sound on any of our devices, (phone, tablet, computer).
title: Makes a Great Gift

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Chip
content: The doorbell works well as a wired replacement, but as is it so much wider than a standard doorbell, be careful of the placement over your existing hole in the wall if it's in a recessed area of your doorframe.  Camera has a wide field of vision and the motion detection works well, but can be difficult to hit the 'sweet spot' between too many alerts and having someone too close before it goes off.  Tied into a system with other Ring cameras, it is very effective.
title: great field of view

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Freeradical
content: Too much delay ~15-40 s from time doorbell rings till you get a picture. If someone is running may not catch them if not placed in always on. But does the job well enough. Easy to install but you have to drill your wall if you have brick. Probably not my first choice at normal price but OK on sale. They want to charge you to store video on Ring cloud. 30 days included. Wifi transmitter is a bit weak. You need a good high end router or you may have to buy range extender.
title: A bit buggy but works

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CO_der
content: These cameras are total crap. Doesn’t connect to 5G WiFi, doesn’t even activate in time to see activity. Captures 1/10 events. Never has even captured the mailman. After setting motion on weekly basis to combat your crap, still false positives or not alerting. What worthless, spyware tech you’ve turned Ring into. Give us an app that works or I’m going to keep sending these pieces of junk back. Bezos, enough.
title: First to worst

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dave
content: Easy to install and the software is easy to install on my Android device. Here I am 30 days later and I'm getting a message that my trial period has expired and I must pay an additional $100.00 per year to be able to watch the motion at my home. This is of course after just paying over $200.00 for the door bell. I say BS!  This is nothing better than a cash grab. Shame on you Ring!
title: Easy to install....but wait

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dawn Wilkie
content: I absolutely love this Ring doorbell and the app. I've sold a lot of family and friends on the device as well. There is a feature that wasn't mentioned in the review... It's has a Neighborhood Watch blog. People that own Ring in your area can share their video and post comments about suspicious activity and the local police department has access to the information. It's fabulous and I'm a very happy consumer. I highly recommend this product, but be sure that your router is close by. It operates off your wifi. I had to move my router in order to talk to the people at my door when I wasn't home.
title: Love it!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: M. Kinnamon
content: Do not buy. I bought this for my sons home for his own security. I have waited 6 months to write this review after all the research on why it does not capture movement or live action. I own a Ring 1 which is awesome. This updated one is cheap and a waste of your money. Being that it only has a one month return I always suggest it takes about 60 days to learn the product ins and outs. What a disappointment don’t buy.
title: Terrible

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: SMC
content: This doorbell can only be used up to 1 time per day, or then the battery runs out. I am constantly having to charge the battery.
title: stay away from this doorbell because of the battery

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sarah C.
content: I have a friend that has the doorbell and he raves about it so I decided to by one and try it out and every since got it all I I have had is battery issues I will charge the battery overnight and but it in and I can’t even view it it keep telling me low battery life even tho I just charged it over night and replaced it. I can’t do live view. At first I thought it was my WiFi but it’s not this doorbell is right next to my WiFi system and I even did a speed test. All I Keep getting is low battery life. I even have this wired into the door and also it only notifies me when I am home about motion detection when I go to view it all I get is error view motion. At this point I am thinking of returning it and getting a nest doorbell instead. Update: Ring followed up with me and resolved the is for in a timely manner by replacing my faults device which was a WiFi antenna issue. Now my doorbell works great.
title: Battery life issues but resolved by Ring.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: dan38
content: I had high hopes for this and was deciding between the original and the 2.  What sold me on the 2 was the live view feature.  Unfortunately, that feature just does not work.  This unit is at my wife's spa and it does work for motion detection and when someone rings but the live view is useless.  I have tried their troubleshooting and even called their technical support with no luck.  The live view is a feature that has obviously not been perfected and shouldn't have been released.
title: Okay product, but the live view doesn't work

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robyn Waxman
content: Our battery died after about one month and because our wifi isn’t great, the video is delayed. Now my free trial period ran out and I discovered there is NO proof of time to review the video if you don’t see it live.
title: Not what I had hoped

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Hideki Kubota
content: We bought and set up this in Dec,2019.  Because of weather and accessibility the door(few time in a day). It worked 2 month,  next time in Feb,2020 it was same things 2 month. However in these days, weather goes to 80-90F day, the battery does not last 1 WEEK. It is awful, if I have to charge every week,,,  and also no one visit in these days.. mostly idle.. Without subscription we can't see a history record as well..  within a 6month this product start annoying me.
title: Battery draining so quickly!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dan Mandanici
content: What they don’t tell you.  If you don’t pay for the monthly subscription, not only can you not view your OWN videos outside of immediately, but when the power goes out, you will lose complete connectivity to the system.  Funny that this is not the case so long as you continue to bank roll these clowns. ONLY a monthly subscription will ensure you get mobile updates. ONLY a monthly subscription will ensure you’re ALWAYS HOME!  This company has a cool technology, but a horrendous business model.  They can change this very simply, but won’t. All videos go through the Ring website, with NO option to store your own damn videos locally.  This is pathetic. My advice, go elsewhere! P.S. my ring doorbell 2 is 10ft away from the Ring Hub, has excellent WiFi connectivity according to the App, but only actually connects about 30% of the time.  I can’t explain in words how frustrating this is when you’re at work and can’t figure out what’s going on at your house.  Save your money folks.  Don’t get scammed like I did.  Frauds.
title: Always Home - as long as you keep paying

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Polley
content: While the doorbell works well, you can forget about it if your house has double lap siding. The doorbell and adapter plate will extend about half way over the second lap and the bottom anchor screw will be visible.  If the doorbell could be mounted landscape, this wouldn’t be a problem, but it can’t be. Contacting their help want very helpful. Their recommendation was to contact a contractor. Spend $200 to mount a doorbell?  Please make a double lap adapter! I had to reduce my rating. It looks like Ring has decided that they want to scare their users by sending out “crime reports” that you CANNOT OPT OUT OF.  I’ve also read that they are hiring a “crime editor”. Why? Probably to make it easier to sell other security products. If I could return the doorbell, I would. It just gets worse!  There have been security breaches at Ring that they have decided to blame on their customers rather than taking responsibility. It looks like we will be getting a different brand and relegating the Ring to be a feral cat cam. 🤷🏼‍♂️
title: Doesn’t work with double lap siding and Ring has resorted to scaring their users

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: AW
content: I don’t get all the hype. I watched a lot of reviews on YouTube before I bought this. The lag time for the motion sensor is a joke. By the time I get a notification, I see the person’s back because they are leaving. OR it goes off and nothing is there. OR maybe something WAS there and because of the lag time I missed it? Hard to tell. I bought it for peace of mind and it doesn’t provide that at all.
title: Just an expensive doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: G Hendrickson
content: I received my ring 2 doorbell yesterday. After setting it up on a wired doorbell connection the only thing that would not work was the LIVE VIEW. It would try to connect but would only show activating device or a black screen. After 20 hours I checked the device health. Power source says hardwired, but power status said POOR. I decided to removed the battery and charged fully about 5 hours til light became only green. Reinstalled battery and checked under device health again. Power status now reads VERY GOOD. Went to live view and now working for the first time. I believe that the battery only slowing charges up to about 10% a day on hardwired depending on how much alerts or usage. So for me I just charged the battery fully first then I was able to finally use the LIVE VIEW feature. Hope this helps anyone else who had this problem.
title: Live view not working?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: James Reck
content: We purchased the Ring Video Doorbell 2 primarily for its motion detection. In reality, the motion detection only works if you are standing within two or three feet from the unit. We've used the app to adjust, reset and manipulate all the motion sensory settings; still no difference. We contacted the Ring support line via telephone and they only provided double-talk about detecting heat sources. Ring support took us through the same steps on the app that we had already tried; still doesn't work. The Ring Video Doorbell 2 is a wonderful doorbell. But, if you're looking for the security of motion detection, look elsewhere.
title: Very Poor Motion Detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Marc Manuszak
content: I've played around with other WIFI video surveillance devices and I will say the Ring 2 functions beautifully compared to others I've tried on my same wireless network.  I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't have to relocate or add WIFI access points.  The video quality is decent and the app is easy to use.  Installation was a snap especially with all the included hardware for various scenarios.
title: Ring 2 works great for a WIFI video device

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael A.
content: Junk! If this is the improved version,  I can only imagine how useless the first one was. It's too easy to "sneak up on it" and cover the lense without being seen. The night vision is nonexistent. I asked my neighbor to ring the bell. I could not understand him and he could not understand me. It will be a long time before I ever try buying something like this again. This thing was a huge waste of money.
title: Save your money until someone makes one that actually works.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: seattlesue
content: I bought 3 of these as gifts for Christmas, keeping one for our home.  I was happy that you didn't have to pay a monitoring fee, or so I was led to believe.  When the "trial period" ended, the doorbell quit working until I paid for a year of whatever?  Since I'm not married to my phone, I really haven't seen a big advantage over the old doorbell.  I'm hoping that when we are outside more in the summer, it will be helpful.  So far, I'm slightly less than impressed.
title: Not quite as advertised

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: kentbraun
content: My biggest complaint is that it takes way too long and too much effort to see who's at the door. It should immediately display the live image as soon as it detects motion. But instead it pops up a notice and I have to tap it and then it opens the app and I have to wait and wait and wait for it to connect to the camera which in my case only works about half the time. My second complaint is that the motion detection takes so long the visitor usually rings the bell before the motion is detected. If I set it to detect further away then it picks up the cars driving by about 40 feet from my door. But it will probably deter thieves from taking my deliveries. I'll probably buy something else unless they come out with an update before I get to it.
title: Quite Disappointing!  It does work but not very well.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Thomas B.
content: Run ! Run as far away as you can! No joke. Look, I am a systems engineer, I have top shelf wi-Fi router / bandwidth / system setup ... The latency of this is so bad I don’t even know where to begin... one star is over rating the cost / benifit of the entire ring product line. Sorry guys at ring, but less than 1/2 star is generous ...
title: RUN away as fast as you can! Awful ! Bad ! Way under cooked product!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tracy E.
content: Love my ring video doorbell. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because Unfortunately the kit did not come with the right bracket. I needed the bracket that attaches to an existing wired doorbell. I even called Ring and they sent me the frameless bracket again. So I just ordered the replacement parts. The kit should specify which bracket is on the kit and CS should get it right without me having to spend an extra $20.
title: Make sure you have the right bracket in kit!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: penname
content: My biggest complaint is the monthly charge to record. You have no choice. If you want recording you have to pay. Second is the record time. Even if you decide to pay , you cannot adjust the record settings. If the motion goes off, it does not matter if there is still motion, the record time is preset and not adjustable. You can have a fight in front of your door and only have the first minute recorded. Third is the device . Even Though I have it hard wired, I constantly have to remove the battery to recharge it.  And when you remove the battery to recharge it you cannot secure the cover back on. Poorly designed , great packaging though.
title: Not worth it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Shanna Chandler
content: I did not expect to have to drop down additional money to see videos. What a rip. The connection with WiFi is very glitchy. The quality of video is hit or miss. The audio pretty much sucks. I wish I had known that it was going to cost 30 bucks a year to see the videos that are recorded. Without the pay service, you can still use as a doorbell with live video and sucky audio. Other brand video doorbells will allow 24 hour free viewing. Hell, I could even deal with just an hour of free viewing. But you cannot see it at ALL unless it is live. OR you have to drop 30 or 100 bucks a year. Not worth it.
title: Warning, there is a yearly fee for the videos

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: xyxyzy
content: Unlike Nest, Ring cannot automatically show who is at your door onto a linked Echo Show. You jave to ask Alexa to show you. Why bundle the two if they don't work together seamlessly?
title: Ring and Echo Show do not work well together

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: E. Wardle
content: The video quality during daylight is good, the sound quality is not.  Difficult to hear person at the door and they have trouble hearing me.  That is disappointing.  Also when I get notified of motion, but the time I open the app, whatever triggered the motion sensor is gone.  Night vision is not good.  That could be because the door bell is installed next to a brick doorframe that reflects light.
title: OK, not great

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michelle Todd
content: I should have researched more before buying the Ring 2 Video Doorbell.  When someone walks up to my door, it doesn't start recording until they are walking away and sometimes they are already gone before it records anything.  It only records for 30 seconds even if there is still motion.  The video quality is great but if you are looking for something to record someone coming up to your door, look elsewhere.  Sadly I am out of my return period so I am stuck with a mediocre product.
title: Don't waste your money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tara Neuheisel
content: We loved the Rings product and it serve the purpose of monitoring unwanted thef nor people snooping around your home especially you can speak to the people through your phone while you are not home. Only downfall is, after 30 days of the Rings trial on your phone app, you will have to choose to pay or not to pay for the Rings services such as recording feature (which is a good feature and needed the most!). It was a pain to have the service reconnect after a month of the free trial... but hey, it’s all good when you pay $100 service for a year...
title: Reliable product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Xprt
content: Worthless.  If a thief comes to your door wearing a mask, all they have to do is wait 60 seconds, take it off, and then they can break into your house.  If you're running on batteries all they have to do is wait 30 seconds!! Ring product team - please allow indefinite recording while motion is detected.
title: Stops recording after 60 seconds even with continuous motion

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bill Eichhorn
content: This is a complete waste of money. I have a $3000 full mesh SOHO network, yet this junk requires a signal booster, when other devices outside work just fine. When it does connect, the motion / person detection is a joke. It barely detects a person. It technology isn’t ready do not sell the product, the general public is not your beta testers.
title: Complete waste of money

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Dustin Burris
content: News reports coming out everywhere of these being hacked. People watching you, ypur family and even vids of them taunting a 8 year old girl. I want to return mine but I am being told its past the return date. I will be following up directly with ring. My whole house has these cameras and the thought that someone can so easly hack this system and see my daughter makes me cringe!
title: These are hackable!! After seeing that girl on the news getting watched I want to return all mine!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Debora D
content: Wish I had gotten the hard wire.  The app takes a moment to connect to the doorbell.  I have yet been able to talk to a live person because they leave because the app is loading.  I have problem with this app so its not my phone or my connection.  So with that being said, I really wanted to love this doorbell because we were hoping to expand our security system around the Ring brand.  But I have hesitations now about the other Ring products.
title: Disappointed.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: crobin1
content: I already have security cameras set up around my house but the reason I purchased this is because you can be sitting in your living room watching TV and tell Alexia to show you the front door. I also got a really good price during Cyber Monday. This item works great.
title: Great Features

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Maria Gieske
content: Works great.  I like the product and the plan.  Make sure you have decent WiFi. And internet access if you expect to be able to view videos instantly from away from home. And answer the door.  If your internet access is slow. It takes longer for the video to upload to your phone and actually answering the door and seeing thins as they happen won’t work. There will be a delay.  Not the fault of ring but do to slow internet.  I have Hughes net. Satellite internet speeds are barely good enough
title: Terrific

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ProlificK
content: I actually got a replacement from Ring directly as the first unit worried exactly 6 days. Other than that image is crystal clear. Sound quality is great. I now realize how many strangers do come knocking on the door while we're not home. The theft replacement guarantee is a peace of mind. I only wish the videos were longer or at least user adjustable. I haven't signed up for the online video storage yet, but I can see that I'll need it.
title: I wish I had installed Ring Doorbell years ago

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Elle Smith
content: I like this product, but I was extremely disappointed that it had a monthly fee. I don’t want to buy a product you have to read all the fine print to find that I owe them a monthly fee to keep up what I would like to already have with my hundred plus dollars.  Not to mention the devices are you installed on her door bell.  I surely don’t think your monthly fee is worth it, but I bought this gift for my mother who is 86, so to be honest with you I think this product sucks.
title: Read the fine print or you’re going to be disappointed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ryan P.
content: I have packages left at my door and the doorbell never alerts either of us who are connected to the door bell. I get emails about deliveries and then go to the door to find packages from UPS, FedEX and USPS and the doorbell never once alerted me. Now, when a leaf blows by, we get constant notifications. Also, it has a poor connection to wifi. I have a $500 router sitting 5 feet away and it loses signal. Lastly, if your router is 5MHz and 2.4MHz in the same SSID, you will have issues. This door bell only receives 2.4 and will often lose connection. This was my issue with the EERO routers. I had to buy a Dual Band router just for the doorbell where I could turn off the 5MHz band.
title: Doesn't even alert 90% of the time

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: cavaza15
content: The Ring Door Bell 2 is not well-suited for a front door. I had mine professionally installed. The motion detection is slow to register an event, even though it is right next to the router. Night vision is grainy & pixelated, and it will get water drops behind the lens. The wifi signal goes out at least once a day. The most frustrating thing is the battery is supposed to last 6 months...ours has to be charged weekly. I'm moving the Doorbell 2 to our side entrance where there's less activity. The higher traffic areas require the Ring Doorbell Pro that's hardwired to it's own Ring Transformer. So, there goes another $500 in more Ring Doorbell equipment.
title: Great Camera in Low Traffic Area

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ortiz72
content: Terrible product. It reports a -59 RSSI on wifi but still video is blocky choppy and voice is hard to hear. Audio going to the doorbell is quiet and broken. Support sent me a chime pro. This made the wifi go from a -59 to a -72 (worse) even though the chime was mounted four feet from the doorbell. The chime saw the wifi at a -42. Last night the doorbell locked up and needed to be hard reset by pulling the battery. Finally, the video quality while good is not 720p
title: Poor product. Stay away.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Britney W.
content: Update 11/12 I bought a new cell phone S20 Ultra, it works but the lag from the doorbell to the phone is so slow that when you can finally talk to someone, they have walked away. There is no true live video, it is at best delayed video --- Original post: Do not buy if you have a Samsung S10 plus. Internet is full of complaints about audio. Wish I had known. There is no fix now since April 2019 either. Both Samsung and Ring point at each other.
title: I'll not waste money on Ring again. Had high hopes.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Laura Rose
content: This product is perfect since I am selling one of my homes and I get to see who’s coming through each time a realtor comes with potential clients to buy my home. I can also talk back-and-forth with my main realtor when I see him come to the door. It also has been beneficial when it comes to unwanted types. One guy came through with a ski mask on and I mediately sent the video on to the police.
title: Perfect

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DLM
content: It took a while to get it working properly. Had to move my WI-Fi booster, then buy a chime to boost the signal even more. Thought I was going to have to increase my Cox internet speed but the chime plugged in by the front door did it. It's working now and I love it. Even drilled in brick for the 1st time in my life. Really appreciate having all the tools I needed in the box.
title: Took a While but....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Michael Caramanica
content: After moving into a 2 story home we knew we needed a video doorbell. Nothing worse than being upstairs getting the little one down for a nap and the doorbell rings. 1. It’s loud 2. It makes the dog go crazy 3. I have to go down the stairs just to see who it is (usually ups just leaving a package) all of this and now nap is all screwed up. It was easy to install and now naps aren’t interrupted. Also love the alert about motion I know when the older kids have arrived home from school. Thanks for the awesome product
title: Naps aren’t interrupted

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: int123
content: I have had it for a little over a year and already will not turn on to connect to the network. I even purchased a new battery for $30 and that didn't start it either. I'm pretty tech savvy so I know it's not the battery, but the device, as it will not light up when the app says it should (unless the battery needs to be charged, which it is). Very disappointed because I paid a good price for it to have it for about a year.
title: Stopped working in a little over a year

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Russ Brovald
content: Took 2 hours to install, and I'm  a mechanical engineer. Nightmare.  Software on my Android is so slow, barely usable. Reminds me of software from the 1700's. Ha, Wife's Apple phone is worse.  Door bell and video and audio have HUGE delay, and my wifi at door is 4 of 5 bars. I would love to return it, but now I have 4 holes in my outside wall.  Hate this thing,  What a mistake. Wind and lights set it off, on the lowest setting, I now have 25 door bell rings a day, normal is 1.
title: Do NOT buy this thing

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: BOBBY B
content: I purchased this product because it seemed all the reviews were somewhat positive, I should of not purchased this due to the minor negative reviews, which seem to be true, I dont know what all the hype was about this product it is not that efficient, it does not always detect motion, even when someone walks next to it, I think I just wasted my money and wish this company can improve their product for future naive customers
title: Not that great, needs improvement

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Sandra M.
content: I had an attempted break-in at my home; fortunately, I arrived home before they could get in and they ran  off. I researched video doorbells and decided on the Ring 2. Within 24 hours of installing my Ring 2, I received a motion notification. I checked it out and saw three people who didn't belong, jumping over the fence of the house across the street. I called 9-1-1 and very shortly, after a brief chase, the police had the suspects in custody!! Three burglars off the street. I tell everyone they need a Ring doorbell now.
title: fortunately, I arrived home before they could get in ...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Lloyd H.
content: The view from the Ring Doorbell on my house (I have a small porch, 5ft x 5ft) is very narrow so sometimes I get a motion detection with nothing visible.
title: Narrow View Misses Object That Triggered Motion Detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Coffee Fan
content: Without the 'Ring Protect Plan' the Ring 2 is marginally useful in my opinion.  All I use it for is to check my doorstep for deliveries.  The Ring app can take forever to start up and connect to the camera, so if I don't walk over and answer the door there's a good chance they'll assume nobody's home.  And because the Ring 2 has no onboard memory, it can't record video or even take a snapshot, so I have no idea who was at my door.  I can't even get a photo of who rang my doorbell unless I pay for a subscription.  Simply unbelievable. The Achilles Heel of this device is its complete dependence on internet connectivity.  If your WiFi signal is weak where the Ring 2 will be installed or your router is too burdened by other WiFi devices or your internet connection is slow, or there's any reason you can't reach your ISP, the Ring 2 does absolutely nothing accept make a doorbell sound.
title: Ring Doorbell 2 - Plan to pay for a service subscription and make sure you have robust WiFi

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Amanda
content: Bought this because it is battery operated and that sounded a lot easier to install than hardwiring one. Also liked that it would work if we lost power. But this doesn’t record like the one in the commercials. By the time it picks up all I see is the backside of whoever’s leaving the door! After doing research, I found out this is a common complaint. I ended up returning it and getting the ring pro which I’m beyond happy with. Also, be aware you need to pay a small monthly fee to save recordings- but it’s worth it.
title: Doesn’t record nearly as well as the ring pro

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Harry C.
content: These connect to 5g WiFi, mine is set up just 12ft or less from my wifi and has a poor signal, but still functions, also you need to buy a yearly cloud service for around $30, or else all you have is a door bell, that tells you someone walked by, or a video conference utility, if some one rings your Bell. Also their estimated battery life is flooded to about one third of their claim
title: Look around

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Israel
content: Not bad. For some reason we had a hard time connecting it. When the doorbell rings, it doesn't alert my phone by a sound, only a notification, if u look at ur phone. The nice thing is I feel more confident nobody is at our front door, cause the motion detecer will send a notification. If the doorbell rings,  only if I'm on the ringer app, I can answer, cause that would be the only way I would know. Sound is okay. Update: so the battery indicator said  that it needs to be charged. It only lasted a month of charge. The battery should last from 6 months to 12 months from what I read.
title: Cool

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Crystal A.
content: Im changing my review from 4 to 1 star. I bought two doorbells and after two months one of them quitting working. I’ve spent many hours on the phone with ring and it hasn’t been resolved. All they do is put you through more trouble shooting. I was told to just take the face plate off, hit the little button twice and it will reset itself which it doesn’t. For the doorbell that does work most times there is at least a one minute lag time. By the time I’m able to view who’s at the door they are already gone.  I do not recommend this product!
title: Quit working after two months. Ring hasn’t resolved this issue as of today.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Tanusree Munshi
content: I got this for my dad for Father’s Day. He really liked it. The installation was fairly quick and we were able to just connect it to our original doorbell wiring. We also didn’t have to charge the battery all the way, the wires gradually charge it over time. I also like how it comes with 2 different color faces so you can pick the style that you like most. The app is also really cool, I like the neighborhood feature.
title: Easy installation and great overall product

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Warrior2018
content: Very disappointed in this product.  Does not capture people coming up to my door, if it does it’s them walking away before it picks it up.  I had house guest coming and going the past few days and it never detected them coming in my front door. Also the WiFi connection sucks, I have my router in the room right next to my front door and it still has poor connection problems.  I also bought the flood light ring cam and that is even worse.  Even with the WiFi extender it still doesn’t help the poor connection.  Ring customer service suggest I buy another $200 device to run my WiFi outside.  Waste of money for sure.  My $25 cameras I bought on amazon works better than Ring
title: Not worth the money.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Clue ByFour
content: The sound is pathetic.  A person has to put their face *to* the doorbell to be heard and there is a constant popping sound otherwise.  It also seems that the voice to the Ring doesn't work all that great either.  The earlier version, which I have works far better than this.  I bought this for my mom's and wish I had bought the version I had. I had thought this would be improved but it seems Ring took a step *back* with the 2.  I was fairly disappointed but since mom does not live close, we have to live with this one.
title: Lousy, lousy sound otherwise works ok.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: travis9952
content: It's incompatible with my house's doorbell chime so now the only way we hear the doorbell ring is on our Amazon Echo. The camera is fine but I don't want to pay for a subscription and it's overpriced. There are other cameras out there with an SD card slot that are cheaper and don't require a subscription. Also despite wiring this to my existing doorbell wires I still have to charge the battery periodically. I wish I had bought another, cheaper camera and left our doorbell alone.
title: Incompatible with my doorbell chime, overpriced

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Rachel Cleveland
content: As far as I was told this was a new item. When I had issues I was informed by Ring support that it was NOT new and was previously install in 2017 by someone else and from their perspective this was out of warranty. That fine if revealed but as far as I’m concerned this was improper. If it’s reconditioned SAY SO.
title: NOT NEW—RECONDITIONED

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Johnny Angell
content: The Ring 2 is very slow to bring up a video when someone approaches our door.  By the time the video starts playing the person is gone.  When at home we no longer look at the phone and just go to the door.  The only time we use the app is when we are away from the phone.  I don’t like paying for the yearly subscription either.  Since we’ve never gone back to look at videos more than a week old, I think we’ll drop it when it comes up for renewal.  I would not buy this again.
title: More Hype than Function!  Slow Video!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kimone
content: The video is clear and looks good. I'm able to connect to Live view and the view opens up quickly when I get an alert (unlike most of the other reviews here). If I ever get a black screen I just hit the back button, come back again and it's good. But the most useful feature does not work, which is detecting motion before the person gets there..or at all. This thing will detect every car that goes by but not people who come to the door. I installed at exactly 48". Played with the motion zone from one end to the other..nothing. Even went ahead and installed the wedge to angle it down 5 degrees. Still picks up cars going by but does not pick up people who walk up to the door.
title: Good for Live View but not Motion Detection

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: epopbw
content: This is easy to install and works as expected.  The only draw back is the lag between trying to access the live view after motion is detected, and the time it takes to actually see what is going on outside the door.  I installed the "chime wi-fi extender" which is suppose to help, but even this only helps a little bit and the signal strength is only "ok" according to the device, even when the Chime is installed very close to the doorbell (within 10 feet), so that is a bit frustrating.  I also have the solar panel that charges the battery but can't tell if that works well yet.
title: This is easy to install and works as expected

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kimberly
content: I have heard tale of privacy violations and hacking vulnerabilities,Strangers have access to people’s children inside their homes. There are huge problems that makes one wonder if you are inviting criminals into your home
title: Maybe Safer without the doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: aml
content: Using with an Echo Show. Setup was moderately painful but maybe that is just because of the Echo. Amazon has owned this company for a while and still hasn't worked everything out. Can't talk through the Show for example. Have to open the app on the phone or tablet. Can walk to the door quicker than that. Wi Fi sucked and had to by extender. Did not buy the Ring one. Works good and don't have any other issues.
title: Ok but could be much improved

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jen Pennella
content: So far we love it. We decided to go with Ring Doorbell 2 because our actual door bell ring is in a bad spot with a poll in front, so it’s nice because the doorbell 2 has a rechargeable battery so you can put it anywhere and it doesn’t have to hook to your actual door bell. I recommend getting a second charger though. Just an FYI It took 6 hours for the battery to charge so don’t think if you are using the battery and not hard wire that it will be set up right away. Also, make sure your WiFi and router are in good working conditions otherwise your motion detection won’t be that great. Over all  Great product highly recommend it
title: Worth the money!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Karen J
content: Ring is amazing! We are always toward the back of the house, so being able to have a front door monitor is incredible. We can see deliveries, know when the mail is here, are able to avoid opening the door for pesky salesmen and get neighborhood warnings of unsavory characters checking for open cars as far as 2 miles away.  I can see someone at my door before the dog barks!  Easy to adjust the sensitivity of the camera view, i.e. large vehicles going by the house.
title: Feeling Safer Now That We can See....

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: CB
content: I found that there is a bit of a learning curve for setting various types of devices. because the different types of devices have different characteristics. setup. Overall, I found the devices appear to be well made, well documented, including the necessary tools is helpful, the numerous mounting options are flexible, and the support staff were very helpful with completing initial setup. I started with one floodlight cam and eventually added the video doorbell 2 and a battery powered spotlight cam with a solar panel for recharging. The solar panel has not yet arrived. It has only been about 2 weeks but I would highly recommend the products I have purchased and installed.
title: It has only been about 2 weeks but I would highly recommend the products I have purchased and installed

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Snowball
content: I will say that in hindsight I should never have purchased this device. It is an interesting concept; but comes up lacking. Pros: I gave it two stars; as opposed to one, because it actually works as a video doorbell. Cons: Yes, it does work as a doorbell; however, after 30 days, if you do not pay a subscription fee… basically all you have is a video doorbell. If you do not pay a yearly subscription (30 USD) then you have a very limited time to view the recording, and I am talking a matter of seconds… not minutes, not hours… seconds. I was in the kitchen, and the doorbell rang. I walked over to my desk, picked up my iPad, and tried to punch up the video, and it said it was a past event, and then directed me to a page to sign up for a yearly subscription. Apparently, videos are deemed “past events” after about 5 or so seconds. So, unless you are Johnny-on-the-spot, what you have is simply a live video doorbell. I can purchase a wireless video camera, and stick it on my front porch, for a lot less than a Ring doorbell. Why not give non-subscribers access to the last 24 hours, or the last hour… heck even the last ten minutes would be helpful. FYI: A workaround for the five-second problem on an iOS device is to, go to settings, look under the apps for Ring, and there you can change the notification to persistent. It will not go away until it's tapped on. False Rings When I first set it up, I was getting false rings every time a car or truck passed in front of the house, so I reduced the detection zone down to around 5 feet. That stopped it alerting me every time a car passed by, but still gives me false alerts when a UPS or FED EX truck passes, and that is several times a day. Slow to the Gate For example, when the ring alerts me to the postman, by the time it begins the video they have come up on the porch, dropped the mail and are gone. Most of the time, all the video shows me is an empty porch, and mail in the mailbox. The only exception to that is when the postman stops on the porch to do something, but if they come up, drop the mail, and leave, I never see them. When UPS or FED EX drops a package, the most I have seen is the back of the driver as he/she returns to the truck. If someone were to run up on my porch, and steal a package, I would never have a video of them… so, much for security (in my opinion). FYI: There is an option that allows the Ring to start up faster, but it consumes more battery power. I tried it… it did not help. Amazon Echo Show One of the reasons that I purchased the Ring is that it will work with the new video version of the Amazon Echo Show… So, when the doorbell rings, I can say: “Alexa, show me the front door.” The problem is that you cannot talk to the people at the door, just stare at them, and decide to, or not to, open the door. In all fairness I knew that the Ring had a subscription service; however, I did not realize that you only had a matter of seconds, before you had to pay to play. And, if I had done my homework, I would have known that the Ring only shows you the live video on you Echo Show. Ring even states that on their Website. The Good News I understand that in the future, the Ring will allow two-way conversations with the Echo Show. And, I am able to download my ring videos locally, through a Script, and Home Assistant. I am also working on a script through IFTTT to store them on my Google Drive.
title: Not what I expected...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Andrew W
content: Got this Ring on cyber Monday. It's pretty easy to use, although the app can use some real work in terms of getting everything loaded faster when you get a notification. I know it depends on wifi and connection but that's how I feel. I open the app and it’ll take over a minute to load and that can be super annoying when someone is at your door. A little disappointed in this product, not gonna lie. I had high hopes. I also don't think it's a THAT big of a deal paying $30 a year for the service of recording your front door but if you don't, the doorbell is pretty useless so just plan on that. All in all I am disappointed but would be over the moon if there were some improvements with the interface and the app. Video quality can be shotty and the audio sounds awful. I wish I spent the extra 100 bucks and bought myself a real security camera system.
title: DECENT doorbell

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Stewart
content: For what it costs you should get night vision. The fisheye view is bad and it’s hard to make out objects. Misses people walking up the steps right in front of it but alarms for cars 50’ away. Plus you have to pay them $5 a month for the privilege of using the camera you paid $250 for.
title: Not good

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: S. B. Rogers
content: I liked that the Doorbell did exactly what RING said it would. I have coverage of my walkway with the Slant that I purchased to angle it from directly at the street. The motion detection works almost too well. It caught the UPS truck going by; besides my German Shepherd wanting to come back in the house.  It connects to my Apple devices and PC clearly via wifi connection. I highly recommend the RING.
title: RING works like it says it will

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TriciaL
content: I bought this 5 months ago, expecting to be notified when someone is at the door, in case I need to talk to them (e.g., a delivery person). However, even with our 200Mbps Comcast Internet, their service is so SLOW, that by the time the notification gets to my phone and I select live view and it finally connects can take a minute or more and the person is gone. Their service is so terrible that if your don't pay a monthly service fee, you can't even look back 5 minutes to see who was there. The motion detection doesn't work either. I have it set for a 10 foot detection zone, but it still picks up cars passing by on the street 40 feet away. This was a total waste of money for us. Do not buy this piece of junk.
title: It's garbage, don't waste your money on it

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Frank Mesa
content: Purchased this about a year ago , and really it’s no good for nothing unless u subscribe to there service ! I hard wire it in , but if u use the live feature too much it will drain the battery, which takes about a week to recharge! They really need to do some upgrades to these because unless u pay extra for the subscription every month , they are worthless!
title: Have to pay xtra for a subscription! Or these are worthless !!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Retired
content: The Ring doorbell-2 seems yo be a good product but I have been waiting for my question to be answered relative for the need to install a 25 Ohm resistor when using any of the many modular power transformers being sold on Amazon that claim to power a Ring doorbell-2 without the need of this resistor. I called them on the phone twice and sent two messages via the Ring web site with no luck.
title: Poor product support.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Candice
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I purchased the Ring Doorbell 2 about a month ago and could not be happier with my purchase! The video is very clear and works well for all my deliveries. I have an older home so running wires is a pain so the battery operated works well. I also purchased the wireless chime for in the house and love it all! Will be purchasing more from Ring in the near future!
title: Not just great for deliveries & security...

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: sara
content: Bought this during the Black Friday promo, and the set up is so easy. Ring includes everything you will need from the drill bit to put into brick (which we did, but it took 2 days to drill through the brick since our drill is only a 9.6V and we had to charge overnight after getting 3 holes done), all face plates to get proper angles, and a step by step guide in the app to ensure everything goes smoothly. Image quality is great and the night vision is high quality as well.
title: Practically Perfect in Every Way

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mavrico55
content: My son installed my Ring Video Doorbell 2 on my front door. The  installation and set up were easy. Adjusting the alert zones takes a few days especially if you have a lot of vehicle traffic passing the front of your home. Installation of the enclosed wedge made the adjustment easy. Now, I get alerts when someone comes to my front door for deliveries or visits. I've tracked two UPS deliveries, and I'm finding the neighbor alerts are interesting....I recommend for improved security and peace of mind.
title: Improves My Home Security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Celia
content: I have had other door bell rings that had built in rechargeable, this was not worth the money or effort to take battery in and out to recharge then have the battery not keep charge.. I will not pay for a replacement. covid-19 shelter in place kept me from returning in time by 5/31/2020 and it is now 6/18/2020. did not even get to sign up for annual service thank God. :(
title: Rechargable Battery Dont Keep Charge

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: J. Connors
content: Bought this because the Zmodo I had for a while started acting up.  Not getting notifications, and other little problems.  So far while it has only been a month it has been working so much better.  Notifcations get pushed to all the devices, including the Echo devices.  Got the package with the Echo 5 which allows the wife to view who is at the door before opening which she loves.
title: Better then ZModo

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mo
content: It was ez to install but i think they should have included longer screws because i need to double mount it.  they give you the mounts but not the long screws and told me to go to hardware store to get them. I like the convenience of the App but i didnt know i now have to pay to subscribe monthly if i want to save the videos and access other functions. Otherwise, I would have given It 5 stars. The picture quality is excellent and motion detection can be adjusted so that it doesnt pick up every wind that blows.
title: Buy it on sale because I dont think it is worth full retail price.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Amy Plank
content: I’ve been wanting a video doorbell for awhile now, and as any smart person, I did My research first. Through written reviews and video reviews, I decided On the Ring 2. I also Bought an extra rechargeable battery pack and the ring chime for inside. I havent Had any problems with it connecting to the live view from home or away. It does seem to be about a few second delay when notifying me there is motion. I have Messed around with the sensitivity to see if it would alert me sooner, but honestly I think it’s the angle (we used the wedge) of the camera. I have Been very pleased with it so far. There has been a lot of package stealing in my town the past 6 months and I’m sure it’s going to get worse around the holidays. So this gives me a peace of mind.
title: After much research, I decided On the Ring 2 Doorbell!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ryan Dikdan
content: What a piece of junk. It constantly goes off due to cars, and nothing, the image quality is terrible, and it DOESNT EVEN have good integration with Amazon! It took forever to setup and still is awkward and slow to use. All it is useful for is waking me up in the middle of the night. The battery doesn't last long enough either. Avoid this, don't buy it for the name.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: TJ
content: I like the video/interaction feature of the doorbell.  I dislike the motion sensor false alarms.  I've tried all different settings (steps, no steps, distance, etc.), but can't get it set properly for my front door.  Also annoying that no matter how close to the router this is, it will tell you your signal is weak so that you have to buy their 40.00 extender, but, you can get a cheaper extender for almost half the price from other vendors and it will work with the video doorbell.
title: OK, but a lot of false motion alarms

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Spender
content: I got the ring after installing two of them for friends and I was really impressed at how well they performed. I like having this as additional security for the front door, and being able to see and talk to anyone at my door just makes me feel that much better. I love the neighborhood linking for suspicious activity. I like the company and hear great things about the customer service. I have not had the unit installed to long now but I am confident I will have no regrets. Seamlessly works with my iPhone X.
title: Great front door security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ingicat
content: This thing is a piece of crap.  I used the Ring version 1 successfully for several years until it just stopped working.  So I invested in the newer version at twice the price and it barely works!  It supposedly installs right into the plate from your first device but it’s really loose and someone could quite easily rip it right off.  Half the time the doorbell doesn’t chime and it NEVER records quickly enough to see who was at the door.  I even have all the ancillary devices to help with WiFi signal but nope, it sucks.  To add insult to injury, they lowered the price significantly two weeks after I bought it so don’t bother buying until Black Friday...although they’ve lost my business now.
title: It sucks!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Vick
content: Basically I replaced my existing wireless door bell, to have more control on learning who is there at the door before running down to opening the door from my bedroom. I am so happy I did go with RING door bell. The live video shown on my iPhone and iPad are very clear and detailed. The motion detector is extremely good and very sensitive. First couple of days I had problem whenever a vehicle passed by or some one passed by on the road which is 20 to 30 feet away from my door. I had to adjust the sensitivity to almost zero to send a message when a vehicle passes by. Also it was draining the battery fast. It would be nice if they can improve the battery a little more efficient. I highly recommend this product and would advice to join the local law enforcement authority to share the video in case required to resolve any local crime/issues.
title: Loyal watch dog /

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Suuseq
content: I'm sure there must be a way to set the devise to NOT alert me to every car that drives by, but I've yet to figure that out. Otherwise its a great product and this is my 2nd one because I loved it so much wanted the newer technology.
title: Just wish it didn't alert me to every car that drives by!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Danielle Dutmers
content: Love it.  Gives that added security to the home. Battery life is great, we’ve only had to charge once in 3 months.  We also hooked ours up with our echo dot and Alexa announces when someone rings the bell...great feature. Only downfall, sometimes the motion sensor activates the camera a few seconds too late and you aren’t able to actually see what set it off.
title: Added security

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: ken V
content: I like this is a big way. It’s real security at an affordable price.  I liken it to the seat belt. Everyone should have one of these at there door.  They talk to you and show you possible problems while sharing amongst other Ring units in your neighborhood.  Simple to set up and install.  Alexa intergration is awesome. You also can have multiple people with multiple emails receiving the door bell alerts. This is one of the greatest products invented during the low voltage, WiFi enabled, smartphone relying era.
title: Why don’t you have one of these already? Don’t you love your family?

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: R. Eichelberg
content: Worked initially, but now it will not notify motion on anything but a scattered basis. Done everything to bring it back into a working condition to no avail. The live view function works with no problem, just the motion detection. Manual activation also works. Both of these are useless in the motion detection mode. Unless someone presses the doorbell button, I have no idea that anyone is there or what they are doing.
title: Door bell now useless

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Davis
content: I purchased a Ring 2 and experienced a problem with the audio emitted from the unit when talking to a visitor.  The audio level or volume is lower then a cell phone in speaker phone configuration.  If a delivery person leaves a truck idling in the background, it is unlikely that they will hear or understand you unless they place their ear next to the unit.  Unfortunately, by the time you are notified and respond to the APP, they have already returned to their vehicle.  As mentioned, I have a problem with an audio artifact, delayed feedback, that interferes with receiving people at the unit.  Customer service was very responsive, but failed to understand the problem until I provided a sound bite.  They had me conduct and repeat tests over and over again until, upon my insistence, they escalated my complaint to a higher level.  They finally acknowledged the problem but failed to offer a solution and gave up.  At that point, I had passed the 30 day return period at Amazon and am stuck with the unit and problem.  Try it at your own risk.  If you have a problem, send it back immediately.
title: Suggest reading before ordering

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Doc J
content: Pros:  Easy installation with existing doorbell wiring.  Pleasant doorbell sounds, and the chime pro allows for notifications even in the bowels of the house.  The camera image is excellent in the daytime, just a little fuzzy in the nite vision mode. Never miss a person at the front door.  Inexpensive subscription to save videos. Cons:  Never miss a person at the front door...my iWatch and iPhone alert me probably 15 times a day for things like my wife going in and out.  Even tho they are silent, you know you can't ignore them and look away!
title: Ring doorbell always with you!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Abraham
content: Great product.  Nice camera with a clear view.  There is a bit of a delay of signal. only a second or two. (Not a big concern.)  The only issue I have is that it's very sensitive to motion.  I tried to set it for a distance of less than 10ft but it picks up large trucks out on the street.  Again...Not a big concern except when I'm asleep.  I highly recommend this camera to anyone interested in home security.  I've even bragged about it to my friends, and I intend to notify my local police department that I have a camera just in case they need video if something happens in the neighborhood.
title: Great product. Nice camera with a clear view

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: wally
content: This device delays notification so the thief is gone before you ever get a notification.  I am constantly having to reset the device to get notifications.  The cheap plastic it is made of has stripped out all the holes for the screws and the drill bit included would not drill into my brick to allow mounting.  Had to use mounting tape.  I would not recommend this for outside maybe for a condo!
title: I would not purchase this again

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Paul Austin
content: The Doorbell 2 is easy to install. Integration with my WiFi went smoothly and physical installation was just as easy. The only snag was the low voltage of my existing doorbell. I installed the Doorbell 2 in "self-powered" mode until I can replace the low voltage transformer in my house. The included wedge allowed me to aim the Doorbell 2 precisely to get the camera coverage I wanted. Integration with the household cellphones (2), tablets (3) and desktops (2) all went smoothly. Now, I expect to be able to "answer the doorbell" from any room, with or without my cell phone.
title: Easy to install, effective to use

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kelljo
content: I purchased the Ring doorbell after having some packages stolen off my porch.  This doorbell has given me some peace of mind because I know when packages are delivered so I can get them off the porch quickly.  The motion detection seems to range from super sensitive to hardly sensitive without adjusting the settings.  I have had to reinstall the app a couple times and this issue seems to resolve.  Overall, an awesome addition to my home
title: Peace of mind

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jay Dee
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Overall I'm happy with the product, but when I tried to screw it onto the outside wall, there is something wrong with the mounting plate. Please watch the video I made. Even though the holes in the device line up with the holes on the mounting plate, they won't screw in tight and attach. Very frustrating.
title: Works fine, but mounting plate is defective

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ponderer
content: This ring doorbell has been flawless.  Very good camera.  Excellent color images.  Night time excellent.  Motion detection is excellent and goes out 30 plus feet.  I have been using this for 2 years and never have had one problem.  Really nice product and I have purchase the pro model for the rear of house.  The motion detection and field of view is so good nothing will be missed.  Highly recommend this Ring doorbell.
title: Excellent Camera

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mrs A
content: I absolutely love this doorbell! Very, very easy to set up. I was more in love with it when someone rang the doorbell and my husband answered the door. Guess where my husband was...OVERSEAS in AFRICA! That sealed the deal for me. One small problem though. I think my wifi speed is slow. I have problems answering the door from inside the house. I called customer service and they has me change it to cellular data, which does not make sense. However, reading the FAQ's it might be my internet speed.
title: Excellent, Clear Video

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Catty B
content: Love that I can see who’s at door wherever I am. Even if they don’t ring the bell, I get motion at door alerts. Sometimes my live view is slow to open. Wifi is 15’ away, Xfinity’s fastest. Battery is slow to recharge - full overnight or all day. If I had reason to be operational 24/7, I’d get another battery backup. But it still looks like I’ve got a Ring doorbell to deter someone even with battery pulled. I like the Neighbors feature when someone posts suspicious videos in my area.
title: Great peace of mind since I live alone

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Jean Coyle
content: i think i have most of the ring doorbell, security (inside and out) that ring sells.  i paid ADT $40 a month and ring is $10.  i know what is going on in my yard (three ring doorbells, front , back, side) and security over the garage doors that take care of my front driveway--siren, talk, etc. and even what is going on in the neighborhood.  better than the police
title: makes me feel safe

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: M. Stitt
content: These seem to be the best units out there, but come one Ring, put some money into your products rather than into so many commercials.  The units have poor WiFi reception, even though we are a commercial building with Cisco equipment, and we see full strength at the bell with our test equipment.  The Chime booster unit sort of helps the WiFi, but not reliably The doorbell does not hangup for sometimes 10 seconds.  These are all common complaints that you see over and over again in the reviews. Maybe Ring 3, when and if it comes out, will  get this sorted out.  This ain't no Apple or Nest product, for sure.
title: These seem to be the best units out there

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Cameron Plunkett
content: I returned this item. I was highly dissatisfied with the night vision. I could only see maybe a few feet out but nothing more than that. I also have a house where the front door is set back and the driveway and garage is more forward of the house so the view was very limited. I have to say the product for the money just was not worth it. I Purchased the blink home security system by Amazon and I am very happy.  The blink home security system came with two cameras for way less than just one ring doorbell.
title: Meh.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Kent Allen
content: I started with the original Ring Doorbell - battery operated - because it would have required doing more work at the location of our existing doorbell.  No problem at all!  It rescued us from having to drive to FEDEX when we were able to let them know to take a package next door to our parents for signature when we were out of the area.  More recently, with my Ring Video Doorbell 2 (removable battery), I was able to communicate with a construction worker doing some renovation out front without being at home.  Wouldn’t live without one anymore!
title: Will make your home safer and add the convenience of talking to anyone at your door from anywhere.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: DynamikR
content: After 1 month free subscription with the device now every time it rings and I try to answer it says can not establish connection server error and it reminds me to subscribe to 10$ a month wtf. Calling them Tom very annoying
title: Only worked for 30 days

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Obadiah
content: In the information they do tell you that you need to have a subscription minimum $3 a month to "SAVE" your videos. What they DO NOT tell you is that if you DON"T allow them to pick your pockets for $3 a month $36 a year, you CAN"T EVEN VIEW your videos even though they are on you device. So living in an apartment I have opted NOT to allow them to pick my pockets. It went back to amazon. That being said. It seems to be a good device, works well. But for me not worth the extra money.
title: BUYER BEWRE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: T Hood
content: Awesome. Wired to existing electrical door bell. Get a distinctive chime from house chime. Get 2way video notice on IPhone wherever I am in or away from the house. Angle mounting brackets allow you to customize what the ring will see (distance and direction). In addition, neighbor app provides reports of suspicious activity from other houses in the general neighborhood. You should get the ring 2. We got ours on sale and got an amazon puck included for no extra cost.
title: Secure your home

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: christy j
content: Love love love my ring doorbell products!  Video is clear, alerts are timely, sound and customization are perfect.  Super simple to install & operate. A competitive/costly wireless security system salesman activated my ring - when I responded to the motion alert and spoke with him, he chuckled as he walked away.....guess he took the hint that I had that security need covered!
title: Ring doorbell has rung my bell!

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Mike Mathis
content: Most security alarms or door cams only record and alert you when some breaks in. I like the fact I can see and have a recording of what happens at my doors. I also like the ability I can access my camera when away. Though the access times vary according to the traffic on the server, never the less I can usually see what's happening in seconds rather way after the fact. Ring provides a really inexpensive means of monitoring your home - Thanks Ring!!
title: Love being able to see who came to my door while away

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Bornjose59
content: I’ve had this installed for about 8 months and it is either too sensitive or not sensitive enough when detecting motion, no matter how I mess with the settings. I live on a semi busy road and it goes off constantly unless I really restrict the range rendering it useless. There is such a delay before a recording starts that someone could easily run up to the door and cover the camera before it would even show them. Not to mention that there is a buffer time after motion is detected and that recording stops where it will not record again for some time. My router is also directly next to the door it is installed on and I have intermittent issues with pulling up a live view. Supposedly the pro (which requires wiring) addresses these issues. Seems like this version doesn’t work as advertised. Fine when it works, but doesn’t work often.
title: Motion detection too delayed to be useful

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: G. Elson
content: This thing is amazing, and I think everyone should have one. We leave near a park so traffic is heavy on our street. There have been a lot of car theft and jacking going on in the area. I’ve been wanting one so bought the Ring 2 because it’s a little more budget friendly. No problems, works great and I can check the front door when I’m not around.
title: Mind at ease

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Robert A Wessner
content: Easy to set-up. Took some tweeking to get the motion zone set to avoid pedestrians/dog walkers. Works great so far battery looks like it will last two weeks.. if I would quit playing with it.  😉 Ordered s second battery for a quick swap until I can set up an AC connection. Oh, crime fighting at night, good luck. Realistically, you will have footage to support your insurance claim, but not much detail for the police.
title: As good as I hoped.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
author: Ericka
content: It doesn't detect all the time, sometimes it only detects when the person is already living, it doesn't record the whole time, it stop and looks like the video has been modify.
